The Subject Expert Committee reviewed the interim Phase 1 data and found the vaccine to be safe, tolerable, and immunogenic in over 80 people who participated in the study.

Over 100 transgender persons were vaccinated against COVID-19 at Mumbai's first dedicated vaccination centre for the LGBT community, which was opened by the BMC on Tuesday. The centre was opened at St Joseph School at Vikhroli West. Those without an identity card can also reach this centre and get vaccinated, BMC officials said.

Union Health Minister Mansukh Mandaviya on Wednesday said that state governments have been asked to vaccinate all school teachers on priority before Teachers' Day on September 5. He added that over two crore additional COVID-19 vaccine doses are being made available to states this month. According to the Health Ministry, India's COVID-19 vaccination coverage has crossed 59 crore.

India has reported 37,593 new COVID-19 cases and 648 deaths in the last 24 hours. This comes a day after the country reported 25,467 cases and 354 deaths. Kerala accounted for over 64% of the new cases as the state reported 24,296 cases on Tuesday. The total number of cases in India reached 3,25,12,366, while death toll surged to 4,35,758.

Health Minister Mansukh Mandaviya shared a graph depicting increasing pace of COVID-19 vaccination. India took 85 days to administer 10 crore doses, another 45 to cross 20-crore mark and 29 more days to reach 30-crore mark. It took 24 more days to reach 40 crore, 20 days to cross 50 crore vaccinations and 19 more to go past 60-crore mark.

Chehre' director Rumy Jafry has tested positive for coronavirus. Speaking to ETimes, he said, "I was in Hyderabad for my daughter's wedding, and all my friends including Neetu Kapoor, Randhir Kapoor...attended the wedding which was held in...first week of August." "I thank God...I contracted...[COVID-19] only on August 15. All those who came to the wedding went home safe," Rumy added.

Ahead of the release of a US intelligence community report on COVID-19, China criticised the US "politicisation" of efforts to trace the origin of the virus. "Scapegoating China cannot whitewash the US," China said. China, which has denied a theory that coronavirus escaped from a lab in Wuhan, has suggested that COVID-19 slipped out of a lab in US' Maryland.

Kerala on Wednesday recorded a single-day rise of 31,445 COVID-19 cases, taking the total infection count to 38,83,429. The last time the state crossed the 30,000-mark was on May 20 when it logged 30,491 cases. It further reported 215 COVID-19 deaths in the last 24 hours. Kerala now has over 1.7 lakh active coronavirus cases.

BJP on Wednesday said the COVID-19 situation in Kerala was alarming and alleged that the state was doing little to mitigate the health crisis. BJP spokesperson Tom Vadakkan said the state government is busy covering it up. "Especially the newsreader turned Health Minister is busy reading the wrong script and spreading disinformation that everything is hunky-dory in Kerala," he added.

Over 100 transgender persons were vaccinated against COVID-19 at Mumbai's first dedicated vaccination centre for the LGBT community, which was opened by the BMC on Tuesday. The centre was opened at St Joseph School at Vikhroli West. Those without an identity card can also reach this centre and get vaccinated, BMC officials said.

Goldman Sachs Group has made it mandatory for its employees to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 for entering its offices in the US, a company spokeswoman said. People who are not fully vaccinated by September 7 will be expected to work from home, she added. Fully vaccinated employees will receive weekly COVID-19 tests starting from September 7.

Ahead of the release of a US intelligence community report on COVID-19, China criticised the US "politicisation" of efforts to trace the origin of the virus. "Scapegoating China cannot whitewash the US," China said. China, which has denied a theory that coronavirus escaped from a lab in Wuhan, has suggested that COVID-19 slipped out of a lab in US' Maryland.

The Haryana government has decided to reopen government and private schools for Classes 4 and 5 in the state from September 1. State Education Minister Kanwar Pal said that the offline classes will be organised for these students while strictly following the COVID-19 SOPs. The students will be allowed to attend the school only with prior permission from their parents.

Around 4,700 COVID-19 cases in the UK are being linked to the Boardmasters music and surfing festival that was held in England's Cornwall between August 11 and 15. However, local officials say they have "no regrets" letting the festival proceed due to the mental health benefits it brought. They added that the cases won't translate into a serious life-threatening illness.

The Greater Chennai Corporation (GCC) has announced a COVID-19 vaccination drive on August 26 with 400 camps across the city limits. According to GCC officials, per day vaccination numbers had dropped from 36,000 to around 30,000 over the last seven days. "We want to increase our scale of vaccination by introducing more camps," a GCC official added.

Kerala on Wednesday recorded a single-day rise of 31,445 COVID-19 cases, taking the total infection count to 38,83,429. The last time the state crossed the 30,000-mark was on May 20 when it logged 30,491 cases. It further reported 215 COVID-19 deaths in the last 24 hours. Kerala now has over 1.7 lakh active coronavirus cases.

A 53-year-old Indian-origin woman in South Africa was killed for allegedly providing critical information about an over $20 million PPE fraud during COVID-19 lockdown in the country last year. Babita Deokaran died of her injuries after being shot multiple times through her car's door. She was working as a senior official at the Gauteng provincial Department of Health.

Greece has said that it would end free coronavirus testing for unvaccinated people to boost inoculation rates in the country. The new measure will come into effect on September 13. "Free testing for vaccinated people would continue," Health Minister Vassilis Kikilias said. According to the Johns Hopkins University tracker, nearly 53% of Greece's population is fully vaccinated against coronavirus.

Delhi's Health Minister Satyendar Jain has said that the Delhi government is making full preparations to tackle the third wave of COVID-19 if it arises. "We are arranging 37,000 beds, preparing 12,000 oxygen beds...Separate preparations are also being made for children," Jain said. Notably, with 17 cases, Delhi on Monday recorded its lowest number of fresh COVID-19 infections this year.

Delhi reported zero COVID-19 fatality and 39 new cases of infection on Tuesday, while the positivity rate stood at 0.06%, according to data shared by the health department. The total number of COVID-19 recoveries in Delhi has risen to 14,11,995 after 114 recoveries were reported in the last 24 hours. Moreover, 1,43,264 beneficiaries were vaccinated in the last 24 hours.

Zydus Cadila has said that it expects monthly sales of ?200-250 crore from its COVID-19 vaccine ZyCoV-D from the October quarter. This can be scaled up to ?500 crore per month, it added. Zydus, which aims to produce one crore vaccine doses per month from October, said it's still in discussions with the government on the pricing and volumes.

Congress leader Sachin Pilot on Tuesday said the BJP's Jan Ashirwad Yatra across the country was being undertaken to misguide people. "What blessings are they seeking when the prices of petrol and diesel have crossed ?100 and gas cylinder ?850?" Pilot asked. He also criticised the Centre over "poor" COVID-19 management.

Papua New Guinea has banned flights from India after accusing Indian diplomats of "deliberate deception" by letting unauthorised travellers, some of whom were COVID-19 positive, enter the country. "As a consequence of deliberate...disrespect against people and Government of Papua New Guinea, there's now indefinite ban on...repatriation flights from India," said Police Commissioner David Manning.

Pune's Principal District Judge SA Deshmukh has announced that an employment fair will be organised in the district to help unskilled labourers who lost their jobs during the COVID-19 pandemic. The registration forms will be available at the District Legal Services Authority office till September 9. It's being done as per the Bombay High Court directions, the judge said.

New Zealand batsman Finn Allen has tested positive for coronavirus after arriving in Bangladesh for their five-match T20I series. Allen tested positive despite being fully vaccinated and having cleared his pre-departure tests in England where he played for Birmingham Phoenix in The Hundred. The rest of the New Zealand squad is set to undergo a three-day isolation period.

Pakistan has announced that it'll require all teachers, professors, school staff and students above 17 years of age to get vaccinated against coronavirus. Unvaccinated people will be barred from entering educational institutions starting from October 15. The government also said it would require citizens to show COVID-19 vaccination proof to purchase train and bus tickets from mid-October.

PM Narendra Modi on Tuesday tweeted that he had a "detailed and useful exchange of views" on the recent developments in Afghanistan with his friend and Russian President Vladimir Putin. The conversation happened days after the Taliban's takeover of the Afghan capital Kabul. "We also discussed issues on the bilateral agenda, including India-Russia cooperation against COVID-19," PM Modi wrote.

Pune-based startup, Genrich Membranes, provided 10 oxygen enrichment units to Pune Municipal Corporation-run Naidu Hospital which will be used towards treating COVID-19 patients. Using a grant supported by the Cipla Foundation, the startup has delivered 10 units each of 10 litre/minute capacity to the hospital. It will provide an additional 10 units of 25 litre/minute capacity soon.

Genomic surveillance by the Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation identified 128 cases of COVID-19 caused by the Delta variant in Mumbai. The figures emerged from the tests conducted on the first batch of 188 samples at BMC's Kasturba Hospital. Of the 188 samples, 128 are Delta variants, two are Alpha variants and 24 are Kappa variants, the remaining 34 are non-significant/local variants.

Pakistan has announced that it'll require all teachers, professors, school staff and students above 17 years of age to get vaccinated against coronavirus. Unvaccinated people will be barred from entering educational institutions starting from October 15. The government also said it would require citizens to show COVID-19 vaccination proof to purchase train and bus tickets from mid-October.

New Zealand on Tuesday reported 41 new COVID-19 cases, its highest one-day jump in cases since April 2020. However, the authorities said the numbers were not rising exponentially. New Zealand's virus-free run since February ended last week following an outbreak of Delta COVID-19 variant in the country's largest city Auckland. New Zealand on Monday extended nationwide lockdown until August 27.

Madhya Pradesh CM Shivraj Singh Chouhan on Monday met Union Health Minister Mansukh Mandaviya in Delhi and urged for 11 lakh additional COVID-19 vaccine doses for the mega vaccination drive in the state on August 25-26. "Under the campaign, a target has been set to vaccinate a total of 35 lakh citizens in two days," a state government release read.

Greece has said that it would end free coronavirus testing for unvaccinated people to boost inoculation rates in the country. The new measure will come into effect on September 13. "Free testing for vaccinated people would continue," Health Minister Vassilis Kikilias said. According to the Johns Hopkins University tracker, nearly 53% of Greece's population is fully vaccinated against coronavirus.

Health Minister Mansukh Mandaviya on Tuesday said that COVID-19 vaccine slots can now be booked on the phone "within minutes" through WhatsApp. This can be done by sending the WhatsApp message 'Book Slot' to MyGovIndia Corona Helpdesk's number +91-9013151515 and verifying the OTP received, he wrote on Twitter. Mandaviya referred to it as a "new era of citizen convenience".

Vice President M Venkaiah Naidu launched 'Vaccinate India Programme' at Raj Bhavan in Bengaluru on Tuesday. The programme has been organised by GiveIndia and Sustainable Development Coordination Centre in association with the Planning Department of the Karnataka government. Naidu appealed to people to follow COVID-19 norms, urged them to not consume junk food and consume traditional Indian food.

Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) has spent ?182 crore on COVID-19 related arrangements at Seven Hills Hospital at Marol in the last year. Notably, the hospital has treated more than 25,000 COVID-19 patients so far, officials said. BMC had started its first COVID-19 quarantine centre at Seven Hills Hospital after the outbreak of the coronavirus pandemic in 2020.

Kerala on Tuesday reported 24,296 COVID-19 cases and 173 deaths, pushing the total infection count to 38,51,984 and fatalities to 19,757 till date. The Test Positivity Rate (TPR) jumped to 18.04% from 15.63% on Monday. As many as 19,349 people have been cured of the infection since Monday, taking the total recoveries to 36,72,357.

Delhi's stock of COVID-19 vaccines will only last a day, the vaccination bulletin of the Delhi government revealed on Tuesday. Delhi had administered 1,43,264 vaccine doses on Tuesday, of which 1,00,159 were first doses while 43,105 were second doses. Till now, 1,24,60,536 doses have been administered in Delhi. Currently, 915 centres in Delhi are administering COVID-19 vaccine doses.

Coal India arm Northern Coalfields (NCL) said that it has become the first PSU in the country to vaccinate its employees and their family members against COVID-19. "During...COVID-19, coal warriors...ensured uninterrupted coal supply to the nation...We left no stone unturned to get them vaccinated," NCL CMD Prabhat Kumar Sinha said. NCL has a strength of around 50,000 people.

With an aim to make Hyderabad fully vaccinated in a fortnight, a special mop-up vaccination drive against COVID-19 started in Hyderabad on Monday, to vaccinate those who have been left out of the process so far. The mobilisation team comprising two persons will go door-to-door and identify unvaccinated people in advance, as per the plan.

Dr NK Arora, head of the government's vaccine advisory group, has said that children above the age of 12 with comorbidities will be prioritised for COVID-19 vaccination. This comes after the Drugs Controller General of India granted emergency approval to ZyCoV-D, making it the first vaccine in India that can be administered to adults as well as children above 12.

The Health Ministry said on Tuesday that those who are being evacuated from Afghanistan will have to undergo a 14-day mandatory quarantine at ITBP's facility in Delhi's Chhawla area amid COVID-19. As per Union Minister Hardeep Singh Puri, 626 people have been evacuated till now. Meanwhile, two people who returned from Afghanistan tested positive for COVID-19 at Delhi's LNJP Hospital.

New Zealand batsman Finn Allen has tested positive for coronavirus after arriving in Bangladesh for their five-match T20I series. Allen tested positive despite being fully vaccinated and having cleared his pre-departure tests in England where he played for Birmingham Phoenix in The Hundred. The rest of the New Zealand squad is set to undergo a three-day isolation period.

Pakistan has announced that it'll require all teachers, professors, school staff and students above 17 years of age to get vaccinated against coronavirus. Unvaccinated people will be barred from entering educational institutions starting from October 15. The government also said it would require citizens to show COVID-19 vaccination proof to purchase train and bus tickets from mid-October.

Zydus Cadila has said that it expects monthly sales of ?200-250 crore from its COVID-19 vaccine ZyCoV-D from the October quarter. This can be scaled up to ?500 crore per month, it added. Zydus, which aims to produce one crore vaccine doses per month from October, said it's still in discussions with the government on the pricing and volumes.

The Kerala High Court on Tuesday asked the Centre whether the 84-day gap between two Covishield doses was based on the efficacy of the vaccine or its availability in the country. Justice PB Suresh Kumar said if efficacy was the reason, he was "worried" as he received the second dose within four-six weeks of the first dose.

Madhya Pradesh CM Shivraj Singh Chouhan on Monday met Union Health Minister Mansukh Mandaviya in Delhi and urged for 11 lakh additional COVID-19 vaccine doses for the mega vaccination drive in the state on August 25-26. "Under the campaign, a target has been set to vaccinate a total of 35 lakh citizens in two days," a state government release read.

Telangana's per capita income has almost doubled in six years, state Finance Minister Harish Rao on Monday said. "During...COVID-19, while India experienced negative growth of GDP...Telangana was still positive with 2.4%," he added. "Telangana tops the country in the state-owned tax revenues as it had increased state-owned tax revenues by 90% in the last six years," Rao stated.

Dr NK Arora, head of the government's vaccine advisory group, has said that children above the age of 12 with comorbidities will be prioritised for COVID-19 vaccination. This comes after the Drugs Controller General of India granted emergency approval to ZyCoV-D, making it the first vaccine in India that can be administered to adults as well as children above 12.

Health Minister Mansukh Mandaviya on Tuesday said that COVID-19 vaccine slots can now be booked on the phone "within minutes" through WhatsApp. This can be done by sending the WhatsApp message 'Book Slot' to MyGovIndia Corona Helpdesk's number +91-9013151515 and verifying the OTP received, he wrote on Twitter. Mandaviya referred to it as a "new era of citizen convenience".

Chief Scientist of the World Health Organisation Dr Soumya Swaminathan has said that India may have entered "some sort of stage of endemicity" of COVID-19. "Because of size of India and heterogeneity of population and immunity status...it's very feasible that the situation may continue like this with ups and downs in different parts of the country," she added.

Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) has spent ?182 crore on COVID-19 related arrangements at Seven Hills Hospital at Marol in the last year. Notably, the hospital has treated more than 25,000 COVID-19 patients so far, officials said. BMC had started its first COVID-19 quarantine centre at Seven Hills Hospital after the outbreak of the coronavirus pandemic in 2020.

The BMC will open its first dedicated COVID-19 vaccination centre for the transgender community at St Joseph's High School in Mumbai's Vikhroli West on Tuesday. "Our Additional Commissioner Suresh Kakani had asked us to start a centre for transgender people...We've tied up with an NGO in Vikhroli, who will bring them and drop them [home] in vehicles," an official said.

India has reported 25,467 COVID-19 cases and 354 deaths in the last 24 hours. The country's active caseload stands at 3,19,551, which is the lowest in 156 days. Active cases in India account for less than 1% of total cases, currently at 0.98%, which is the lowest since March 2020. Total cases reached 3,24,74,773 and death toll surged to 4,35,110.

Delhi's stock of COVID-19 vaccines will only last a day, the vaccination bulletin of the Delhi government revealed on Tuesday. Delhi had administered 1,43,264 vaccine doses on Tuesday, of which 1,00,159 were first doses while 43,105 were second doses. Till now, 1,24,60,536 doses have been administered in Delhi. Currently, 915 centres in Delhi are administering COVID-19 vaccine doses.

All government and private educational institutions including Anganwadi centres in Telangana will be allowed to reopen from September 1, the state government said. CM K Chandrashekar Rao has ordered ministers and officials of Municipal and Panchayat Raj departments to clean and sanitise all educational institutions and hostels by August 30, which were shut due to COVID-19.

The clinical trial participants of Covishield and Covaxin COVID-19 vaccines will now be issued vaccination certificates via CoWIN, Health Minister Mansukh Mandaviya said. "The nation thanks them (the participants) for their incredible commitment and contribution to COVID-19 vaccine research and treatment," he said. Certificates can be downloaded via Aarogya Setu, Digilocker and UMANG app too.

Taiwan's President Tsai Ing-wen received her first dose of the island's domestically developed coronavirus vaccine on Monday, as the country began the rollout to the public. "It doesn't hurt, I'm in good spirits, and I'm going to continue working for the day," she said. The vaccine developed by Medigen Vaccine Biologics Corp was given emergency approval by regulators in July.

India has reported 25,072 new COVID-19 cases in the last 24 hours, which is lowest rise in the daily cases in 160 days. The country reported 389 deaths in the last 24 hours. India's active caseload stands at 3,33,924, which is the lowest in 155 days. The country's total COVID-19 cases reached 3,24,49,306 and the death toll surged to 4,34,756.

Delhi recorded zero COVID-19 deaths for the fourth consecutive day on Monday, according to the latest bulletin issued by the health department. The national capital saw 17 new coronavirus cases during this period, pushing the tally of COVID-19 cases to over 14.37 lakh, while the death toll mounted to 25,079. The positivity rate in the city on Monday was 0.04%.

Over one crore COVID-19 vaccines have been administered in the Pune circle to date, which includes the districts of Pune, Satara and Solapur. Pune has inoculated 72,61,612 people, Solapur 11,90,324 and Satara 15,97,624, the district health authorities said. One million doses were administered in a single day on Saturday across the state, authorities said.

Mumbai Mayor Kishori Pednekar has said that BJP's 'Jan Ashirwad Yatra' is nothing but a "yatra of deceit". "People are witnessing what they are doing. They will give their 'ashirwad' (blessings) in due time," she added. "If they really want to work, they should provide COVID-19 vaccines for the people," the Mayor further said.

Former US President Donald Trump was booed by some of his supporters at a rally after he suggested that they get vaccinated against COVID-19. "I believe totally in your freedoms, I do, you've got to do what you've got to do. But I recommend (that you) take the vaccines. I did it, it's good," said Trump.

Cadila Healthcare's shares rose by nearly 4% to reach ?555.25 on the NSE as of 2:40 pm after it received Emergency Use Authorization (EUA) from DCGI for its COVID-19 vaccine ZyCoV-D. It's the world's first and India's indigenously-developed DNA-based COVID-19 vaccine for children aged 12 and above. It's the sixth COVID-19 vaccine to be approved in India.

Taiwan's President Tsai Ing-wen received her first dose of the island's domestically developed coronavirus vaccine on Monday, as the country began the rollout to the public. "It doesn't hurt, I'm in good spirits, and I'm going to continue working for the day," she said. The vaccine developed by Medigen Vaccine Biologics Corp was given emergency approval by regulators in July.

The US Food and Drug Administration (FDA) on Monday granted full approval to the Pfizer-BioNTech COVID-19 vaccine, making it the first to secure such validation from the American drug regulator. This "may now instil additional confidence to get vaccinated", FDA's acting Commissioner Janet Woodcock said. The vaccine was approved for emergency use for people aged 12 and older in May.

The clinical trial participants of Covishield and Covaxin COVID-19 vaccines will now be issued vaccination certificates via CoWIN, Health Minister Mansukh Mandaviya said. "The nation thanks them (the participants) for their incredible commitment and contribution to COVID-19 vaccine research and treatment," he said. Certificates can be downloaded via Aarogya Setu, Digilocker and UMANG app too.

WHO chief Tedros Adhanom Ghebreyesus on Monday called for a two-month pause on administering booster shots of COVID-19 vaccines as a means of reducing global vaccine inequality. Of the 4.8 billion vaccine doses delivered to date globally, 75% have gone to only 10 countries, Tedros added. Several countries are already offering or planning to offer their populations COVID-19 booster shots.

Over one crore COVID-19 vaccines have been administered in the Pune circle to date, which includes the districts of Pune, Satara and Solapur. Pune has inoculated 72,61,612 people, Solapur 11,90,324 and Satara 15,97,624, the district health authorities said. One million doses were administered in a single day on Saturday across the state, authorities said.

New Zealand PM Jacinda Ardern on Monday announced that the coronavirus lockdown in the country has been extended by three days till August 27 as the number of active cases in the outbreak reached 107. She added that the current outbreak of Delta variant hasn't peaked yet. Restrictions in Auckland, the outbreak's epicentre, will be in force till August 31.

As many as 10,206 vaccinated people have been re-infected with COVID-19 in the Pune district. Of the total breakthrough infections, 7,124 cases were reported among the citizens who had received one dose of the vaccine, while 3,082 infections were detected among those who are fully vaccinated, as per the data available with the administration.

Uttarakhand government on Monday extended the ongoing COVID-19 induced curfew in the state till August 31. As per the order, the curfew that was to end on August 24, will remain in force till 6 am on August 31. A maximum of 50 people are allowed to attend a marriage function with a COVID-19 negative test report.

The vaccine developed by Medigen Vaccine Biologics Corp was given emergency approval by regulators in July.

Schools in West Bengal will reopen after Durga Puja vacations if the COVID-19 situation does not change for worse, Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee said on Monday. "If the third wave does not turn out to be dangerous, we will sanitise the school buildings and reopen them," the CM added. She added that the government is keen on restarting schools.

The current rate of COVID-19 vaccination in India is 3.2% and if it doesn't improve, India may see 6 lakh cases per day in the third COVID-19 wave, a report by MHA's NIDM has said. "The emergence of a third wave could be significantly challenged by expanding vaccination but only around 7.6% (10.4 crore) are fully vaccinated," said the report.

West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee on Monday said the Election Commission should immediately announce dates for the pending Assembly bypolls as the COVID-19 situation in the state is completely under control. "We must not curtail the democratic rights of the people," she added. By-elections are due in seven Assembly seats of West Bengal.

Two days after the COVID-19 test positivity rate in Kerala touched 17%, state Health Minister Veena George on Monday said people need to remain vigilant in the next four weeks. "Highly transmissible Delta variant is a threat in many places. There's also third wave's threat," George added. She said the government has prepared a total of 744 beds for children.

Two people evacuated from Afghanistan were found COVID-19 positive on their arrival in Delhi on Monday, an official said. Both of them have been sent to the Lok Nayak Jai Prakash Narayan (LNJP) Hospital in the city. They are among the 146 Indian nationals who landed in Delhi from Doha in Qatar.

New Zealand PM Jacinda Ardern on Monday announced that the coronavirus lockdown in the country has been extended by three days till August 27 as the number of active cases in the outbreak reached 107. She added that the current outbreak of Delta variant hasn't peaked yet. Restrictions in Auckland, the outbreak's epicentre, will be in force till August 31.

A special coronavirus vaccination drive to achieve 100% coronavirus vaccination in Hyderabad in the coming weeks will begin tomorrow. The drive will take place in around 5,200 localities under the Greater Hyderabad Municipal Corporation and Secunderabad Cantonment Board limits. A total of 35,64,813 vaccine doses have been given to people in the city so far, according to CoWIN data.

Union Health Minister Mansukh Mandaviya announced on Sunday that the government has decided to vaccinate people returning to India from Afghanistan for free against polio. This has been done as a precautionary measure against Wild Polio Virus, he added. The minister also shared a picture of the drive at Delhi International Airport in which the returnees were seen getting vaccines.

Over 720 children in child care institutions (CCIs) in 11 states and UTs have contracted COVID-19 and no fatalities have been reported, according to RTI data from the National Commission for Protection of Child Rights (NCPCR). Last year, Uttar Pradesh was the only state out of the 11 states and UTs to report coronavirus cases among children in CCIs.

Madhya Pradesh CM Shivraj Singh Chouhan on Sunday said COVID-19 infections are in control in the state and announced a mega vaccination drive on August 25-26. He also urged people to maintain COVID-appropriate behaviour. Chouhan also informed that around 60% of people in the state have been administered the first COVID-19 vaccine dose.

Delhi reported 24 new COVID-19 cases and zero deaths in the past 24 hours, the health department informed on Sunday. The city has reported zero deaths for the third consecutive day, while the positivity rate stood at 0.04%. The death toll stands at 25,079 with a case fatality rate of 1.74%, the Delhi Health Department said.

Madhya Pradesh CM Shivraj Singh Chouhan on Sunday said COVID-19 infections are in control in the state and announced a mega vaccination drive on August 25-26. He also urged people to maintain COVID-appropriate behaviour. Chouhan also informed that around 60% of people in the state have been administered the first COVID-19 vaccine dose.

Mumbai Mayor Kishori Pednekar on Sunday tied rakhis to COVID-19 frontline workers including doctors, nurses and police personnel on the occasion of Rakshabandhan. "[Honouring] corona warriors! Feelings of belonging, security and responsible protection," she tweeted. Pednekar also tied rakhis to the Mumbai Police force officers and shared photos of the same on Twitter.

Haryana government on Sunday extended the COVID-19 restrictions till 5 am on September 6, without any additional relaxations in the curbs. Restaurants and bars, gyms and spas are allowed to open at 50% capacity and with regular sanitisation. Indoor gatherings of a maximum of 100 people or 50% of hall capacity are allowed.

In order to prevent the UN General Assembly from becoming a "super-spreader event" for COVID-19, the US has urged world leaders to deliver their statements by video instead of travelling to New York. The US also requested delegations attending UNGA in person to bring minimum number of travellers necessary. This comes amid a surge in cases due to Delta variant.

Schitt's Creek: The Farewell Tour' anticipated events have been cancelled due to the surge in Covid-19 cases across North America. Eugene Levy shared the statement on Twitter and tweeted, "We've made the difficult decision to cancel all tour dates that were scheduled pre-pandemic...We're so sorry to be missing you. We'll...try to find a way to see you in the future."

Over 720 children in child care institutions (CCIs) in 11 states and UTs have contracted COVID-19 and no fatalities have been reported, according to RTI data from the National Commission for Protection of Child Rights (NCPCR). Last year, Uttar Pradesh was the only state out of the 11 states and UTs to report coronavirus cases among children in CCIs.

Authorities in Hohhot, the capital of Inner Mongolia Autonomous Region, have said that unvaccinated residents will not be allowed to enter public places, including hospitals, malls and subways, amid the COVID-19 pandemic. Residents have to show proof of vaccination to enter public areas. Local workers in Hohhot have been asked to submit names of unvaccinated residents to government offices daily.

Minister of State for Railways Raosaheb Danve has said that Indian Railways suffered losses to the tune of ?36,000 crore during the COVID-19 pandemic. "Passenger train segment always runs into losses. Since increasing the ticket fares affects the passengers, we cannot do so," he added. Danve also said that a bullet train project would be executed along the Mumbai-Nagpur Expressway.

Facebook shelved a report about what content was most viewed in the US in the first quarter of 2021 over fears that it would cause a public relations problem, The New York Times reported. The publication said, the most-viewed link in that report was a news article with a headline suggesting COVID-19 vaccine caused the death of a Florida doctor.

A special coronavirus vaccination drive to achieve 100% coronavirus vaccination in Hyderabad in the coming weeks will begin tomorrow. The drive will take place in around 5,200 localities under the Greater Hyderabad Municipal Corporation and Secunderabad Cantonment Board limits. A total of 35,64,813 vaccine doses have been given to people in the city so far, according to CoWIN data.

India has reported 30,948 new COVID-19 cases and 403 deaths in the last 24 hours. The country's recovery rate stood at 97.57%, which is the highest since March 2020. India's active caseload stood at 3,53,398, the lowest in 152 days. Active cases in the country account for 1.09% of total cases, which is the lowest since March 2020.

Mumbai Police registered 7 new FIRs against BJP leaders and workers for allegedly violating COVID-19 protocols during the Jan Ashirwad Yatra of Union Minister Narayan Rane in different parts of the city. On Saturday, police had filed 17 FIRs against BJP's rally for flouting COVID-19 norms. Maharashtra's COVID-19 recovery rate currently stands at 96.99%.

A special coronavirus vaccination drive to achieve 100% coronavirus vaccination in Hyderabad in the coming weeks will begin tomorrow. The drive will take place in around 5,200 localities under the Greater Hyderabad Municipal Corporation and Secunderabad Cantonment Board limits. A total of 35,64,813 vaccine doses have been given to people in the city so far, according to CoWIN data.

Hollywood actress Hilary Duff on Saturday shared on Instagram that she has tested positive for COVID-19. The 33-year-old actress shared a picture of herself lying in bed and wrote in the Instagram story, "That Delta [COVID-19 variant], she's a little b****. Symptoms: Bad headache, no taste or smell, sinus pressure, brain fog. Happy to be vaccinated."

As many as 36 FIRs have been registered by Mumbai Police against BJP workers and volunteers for allegedly conducting 'Jan Ashirwad Yatra' in violation of COVID-19 protocols. "I don't care about the FIRs. We've seen that many rallies have been conducted during the pandemic. But no action was taken against them," BJP's Narayan Rane, who participated in the yatra, said.

The Tamil Nadu government on Saturday extended lockdown till September 6 with additional relaxations in curbs. Schools for classes 9-12 and all colleges will reopen from September 1 on a rotational basis. All college teaching and non-teaching staff must be vaccinated against COVID-19. Theatres can reopen at 50% capacity and shops can open till 10 pm from Monday (August 23).

The Kerala government has set aside ?3.2 crore to be distributed among 87 children in the state who have lost both their parents to COVID-19. The government has announced ?3 lakh compensation to each child. Kerala Health Minister Veena George said that children to receive the funds were identified via a door-to-door survey by Integrated Child Development Services (ICDS) volunteers.

Zydus Cadila will decide pricing of its COVID-19 vaccine in the next one-two weeks and start supplying in mid-September, MD Sharvil Patel said on Saturday. Zydus aims to produce 1 crore doses per month from October and 5 crore doses totally by January 2022, he added. ZyCoV-D is world's first DNA-based COVID-19 vaccine to get emergency use approval in India.

As many as 34,457 new COVID-19 cases have been reported in India in the last 24 hours. Active COVID-19 cases in India stand at 3,61,340, the lowest in 151 days. Further, the total number of COVID-19 recoveries has risen to 3,15,97,982 after 36,347 recoveries were reported in the last 24 hours. India has reported 375 new COVID-19 deaths.

British High Commissioner to India, Alex Ellis, has appreciated the efforts of the Uttar Pradesh government in the handling of the COVID-19 pandemic, according to a statement issued by the state government. "UK and Uttar Pradesh have a lot to do together," Ellis said, after meeting Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath at his official residence in Lucknow.

Tesla CEO Elon Musk on Friday posted a picture of Taliban militants with the caption 'not one f***ing mask Jesus Christ' in his first tweet on Taliban since it seized power in Afghanistan. "Do they even know about the Delta [COVID-19] variant?" he asked in another tweet. "Their 'mask' shouldn't be your biggest concern about them," a Twitter user responded.

While acknowledging the usefulness of COVID-19 vaccines' booster doses, Maharashtra Deputy CM Ajit Pawar said the Pune district administration will consider making those available only after the eligible population is fully vaccinated. "The state government and I...agree that a booster dose should be given," he added. "As of now...we've decided to prioritise delivering second doses," Pawar said.

Zydus Cadila will decide pricing of its COVID-19 vaccine in the next one-two weeks and start supplying in mid-September, MD Sharvil Patel said on Saturday. Zydus aims to produce 1 crore doses per month from October and 5 crore doses totally by January 2022, he added. ZyCoV-D is world's first DNA-based COVID-19 vaccine to get emergency use approval in India.

Tokyo Paralympics organising committee on Saturday confirmed the first two cases of COVID-19 inside the Olympic Village. No athlete has reported positive so far as the two cases from the Village are among the staff. The organising committee revealed a total of 15 new cases in the last 24 hours. Paralympics will begin on Tuesday.

Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal on Saturday said that time curbs imposed on markets will be removed from Monday (August 23), amid declining COVID-19 cases. Delhi shops, markets and malls can now open for longer and follow their regular timings instead of closing at 8 pm. A traders' body had demanded that Delhi markets be allowed to open till 10 pm.

While acknowledging the usefulness of COVID-19 vaccines' booster doses, Maharashtra Deputy CM Ajit Pawar said the Pune district administration will consider making those available only after the eligible population is fully vaccinated. "The state government and I...agree that a booster dose should be given," he added. "As of now...we've decided to prioritise delivering second doses," Pawar said.

Delhi's Deputy CM Manish Sisodia on Friday claimed L-G Anil Baijal once again denied the government's request to set up an expert committee to investigate deaths caused due to lack of medical oxygen during the second COVID-19 wave. "While Centre is collecting data...on deaths because of oxygen shortage, they are not letting states investigate such deaths," he said.

The CDSCO's Subject Expert Committee (SEC) on COVID-19 has recommended granting emergency use authorisation to Zydus Cadila's three-dose COVID-19 vaccine ZyCoV-D, reports said on Friday. If approved, the 'needle-free' vaccine will become the sixth COVID-19 vaccine cleared for use in India. The vaccine was found to be 66.6% effective in a late-stage trial conducted on more than 27,000 volunteers.

Union Information and Broadcasting Minister Anurag Thakur said on Friday the Centre is fully ready to tackle a possible third wave of COVID-19. He said that a provision of ?23,123 crore has been made to deal with it. Special emphasis is being given to strengthening paediatric care as experts fear that the third wave may affect children more, he added.

US Customs and Border Protection agents in Alaska seized over 3,000 counterfeit COVID-19 vaccination cards sent from China, the agency said on Thursday. The cards were of "low-quality printing" but closely resembled authentic US Centers for Disease Control and Prevention certificates provided to vaccine recipients, it added. The cards were headed for destinations around the US other than Alaska.

Schools in Himachal Pradesh will continue to stay closed till August 28, as per an order from the Revenue Department of the state's Disaster Management Cell issued on Friday. Only teaching and non-teaching staff will be allowed to attend the school, it stated. Residential schools, however, will continue to function while following COVID-19 guidelines issued by the state education department.

Zydus Cadila's ZyCoV-D is the first COVID-19 vaccine in India to receive DCGI's approval for emergency use in children aged 12 and above. The world's first and India's indigenously developed DNA-based COVID-19 vaccine showed 66.6% efficacy in Phase-III trial. "This three-dose vaccine which when injected produces the spike protein of the SARS-CoV-2 virus and elicits an immune response," Centre said

Zydus Cadila has received approval for Emergency Use Authorisation (EUA) from DCGI for its three-dose COVID-19 vaccine ZyCoV-D. It's shown to be 66.6% effective in phase 3 trials and has become sixth COVID-19 vaccine to be approved in India. It's the world's first and India's indigenously-developed DNA-based vaccine for COVID-19 to be administered in those aged 12 years and above.

Sri Lanka's President Gotabaya Rajapaksa has ordered a 10-day nationwide lockdown in the country starting on Friday night in an effort to curb the spread of coronavirus. This will be the first time since mid-June that the country will be re-imposing a lockdown. Sri Lanka has reported over 3.8 lakh coronavirus cases and 6,790 COVID-19 deaths, according to official data.

Sri Lanka's President Gotabaya Rajapaksa has ordered a 10-day nationwide lockdown in the country starting on Friday night in an effort to curb the spread of coronavirus. This will be the first time since mid-June that the country will be re-imposing a lockdown. Sri Lanka has reported over 3.8 lakh coronavirus cases and 6,790 COVID-19 deaths, according to official data.

Delhi on Friday reported zero coronavirus-linked deaths, making it the eleventh time since the onset of the second wave that no one died due to the disease in 24 hours, officials said. As per data, 57 people tested positive for COVID-19 in 24 hours, taking the cumulative tally to 14,37,274. So far, 25,079 people have died of COVID-19 in Delhi.

The night curfew from 11 pm to 6 am imposed amid COVID-19 in Andhra Pradesh has been extended till September 4, the state Medical and Health Department said on Friday. The restrictions were extended on the day when Andhra Pradesh's cumulative COVID-19 tally passed two million. As per Union Health Ministry data, Andhra Pradesh has 15,738 active COVID-19 cases.

Apple is delaying its employees' return to corporate offices in the US from October until January at the earliest because of surging COVID-19 cases and new variants, Bloomberg reported. In a memo Apple reportedly said it would confirm the reopening timeline one month before employees are required to return. It also encouraged staff to get vaccinated.

US Customs and Border Protection agents in Alaska seized over 3,000 counterfeit COVID-19 vaccination cards sent from China, the agency said on Thursday. The cards were of "low-quality printing" but closely resembled authentic US Centers for Disease Control and Prevention certificates provided to vaccine recipients, it added. The cards were headed for destinations around the US other than Alaska.

The Uttar Pradesh government has decided to end Sunday curfew in view of declining COVID-19 cases. As per the order, signed by Additional Chief Secretary Awanish K Awasthi, markets and other activities will be allowed from 6 am to 10 pm on all seven days. However, the night curfew will remain imposed from 10 pm to 6 am.

The CDSCO's Subject Expert Committee (SEC) on COVID-19 has recommended granting emergency use authorisation to Zydus Cadila's three-dose COVID-19 vaccine ZyCoV-D, reports said on Friday. If approved, the 'needle-free' vaccine will become the sixth COVID-19 vaccine cleared for use in India. The vaccine was found to be 66.6% effective in a late-stage trial conducted on more than 27,000 volunteers.

Israeli PM Naftali Bennett received a third shot of the Pfizer-BioNTech COVID-19 vaccine on Friday, after Israel extended its booster dose campaign for people over 40 to try to curb the spread of Delta variant. The country has reported a surge in COVID-19 cases since the variant's emergence. Israel had started administering booster shots to people above 60 in July.

Johnson & Johnson (J&J) has sent an application to the Central Drugs Standard Control Organisation (CDSCO) in India seeking permission to conduct a study of its single-dose COVID-19 vaccine in adolescents aged 12-17 years. Earlier this month, the vaccine became India's fifth shot to get approval for emergency use. The vaccine showed 85% efficacy against severe COVID-19 in global trials.

Zydus Cadila has received approval for Emergency Use Authorisation (EUA) from DCGI for its three-dose COVID-19 vaccine ZyCoV-D. It's shown to be 66.6% effective in phase 3 trials and has become sixth COVID-19 vaccine to be approved in India. It's the world's first and India's indigenously-developed DNA-based vaccine for COVID-19 to be administered in those aged 12 years and above.

Savitribai Phule Pune University (SPPU) administration issued a circular on Thursday to over 700 affiliated colleges to reduce their fees for the current academic year. The university has also asked colleges to waive 100% fees for students who have lost one parent or both due to coronavirus. Colleges should also give poor students instalment options to pay fees, it said.

As many as 36,571 new COVID-19 cases have been reported in India in last 24 hours, taking the total number of cases to 3,23,58,829. Active COVID-19 cases in the country stand at 3,63,605, the lowest in 150 days. The death toll due to coronavirus has risen to 4,33,589 after 540 new deaths were reported in the last 24 hours.

After 'Pakistan Zindabad' slogans were raised in Ujjain, Madhya Pradesh CM Shivraj Singh Chouhan said he won't tolerate "Taliban mentality". He said four accused have been arrested in relation to the incident. The incident occurred during a religious procession on Thursday. When police stopped the procession, saying they weren't allowed amid COVID-19, the mob started raising pro-Pakistan slogans.

Johnson & Johnson (J&J) has sent an application to the Central Drugs Standard Control Organisation (CDSCO) in India seeking permission to conduct a study of its single-dose COVID-19 vaccine in adolescents aged 12-17 years. Earlier this month, the vaccine became India's fifth shot to get approval for emergency use. The vaccine showed 85% efficacy against severe COVID-19 in global trials.

As many as 36,571 new COVID-19 cases have been reported in India in last 24 hours, taking the total number of cases to 3,23,58,829. Active COVID-19 cases in the country stand at 3,63,605, the lowest in 150 days. The death toll due to coronavirus has risen to 4,33,589 after 540 new deaths were reported in the last 24 hours.

The Telangana government has announced that it's making all efforts to achieve 100% COVID-19 vaccination in Hyderabad in the next 10-15 days. Chief Secretary Somesh Kumar instructed medical and municipal staff to conduct household survey and map up eligible people aged above 18 to be vaccinated. Kumar said there was a good response to mobile vaccination programme in GHMC limits.

Mumbai Police has filed 19 FIRs against BJP workers and organisers of Union Minister Narayan Rane's Jan Ashirwad Yatra for allegedly violating COVID-19 norms. BJP leader Devendra Fadnavis and Pravin Darekar also participated in the yatra in Mumbai on Thursday. The yatra sought to inform people about the BJP-led central government's achievements in internal, external, economic and other sectors.

Israeli PM Naftali Bennett received a third shot of the Pfizer-BioNTech COVID-19 vaccine on Friday, after Israel extended its booster dose campaign for people over 40 to try to curb the spread of Delta variant. The country has reported a surge in COVID-19 cases since the variant's emergence. Israel had started administering booster shots to people above 60 in July.

BJP leader Ramratan Payal in response to a reporter's question on inflation in India said, "Go to Taliban-ruled Afghanistan. Petrol is ?50 per litre there...but there's no one to use it." "At least there is safety in India. The third wave of COVID-19 is about to hit us...and being a reporter, you are talking about petrol prices," he added.

Actress Vaani Kapoor, while sharing her experience of shooting 'Bell Bottom' amid the COVID-19 pandemic, said, "Everything went so well, the protocols, safety measures that were being taken." "It was all well planned, and for that one has to credit...producers and Akshay Kumar that one sails through without getting sick and we all came back in good health," she added.

South Africa will open up COVID-19 vaccinations to those aged between 18 and 35 years old from Friday, as part of increasing the vaccination roll-out programme, the government said. The country has so far fully vaccinated less than 8% of its population of 60 million. South Africa has reportedly recorded the most coronavirus infections and deaths on the African continent.

Dabur India Vice Chairman Mohit Burman has said that the challenges from the COVID-19 pandemic are far from over but the company is better prepared to deal with any eventuality. Talks of another wave likely in future means Dabur might have to cope with the related challenges, he added. "We're...applying learnings from last year on streamlining...supply chain," Burman said.

According to Telangana Public Health and Family Welfare Director Dr G Srinivasa Rao, COVID-19's second wave has come to an end in the state and this is the time to reopen educational institutions. Only vaccinated teachers and staff will be allowed, he said. Rao added that 56% people have received the first COVID-19 vaccine dose in Telangana.

The WHO warned that on top of the COVID-19 pandemic, West Africa is facing new outbreaks of viral hemorrhagic fevers Marburg and Ebola. Matshidiso Moeti, WHO Regional Director for Africa, said, "Fighting multiple outbreaks is a complex challenge." The country on Saturday declared its first case of Ebola after an 18-year-old girl was found to be infected with the disease.

The COVID-19 vaccination drive will remain suspended on August 19 and 20 at all government and civic body-run centres in Mumbai due to a shortage of doses, the BMC has announced. "The vaccination drive will resume on August 21, as a fresh stock of vaccines is expected to arrive on Thursday night and will be distributed...the next day," it added.

Kerala on Thursday reported 21,116 new COVID-19 cases pushing the state's total infection count to 37,66,573. The number of people succumbing to the disease climbed to 19,246 with 197 additional deaths in the last 24 hours. As many as 19,296 people have been cured of the infection since Wednesday, taking the total recoveries to 35,67,492, a state government release said.

India has achieved the milestone of conducting a cumulative 50 crore COVID-19 tests across the country, the Indian Council of Medical Research (ICMR) informed on Thursday. "India recorded a daily testing average of more than 17 lakh in the month of August...The country has achieved the milestone of the last 10 crore tests in only 55 days," it added.

Kerala Health Minister Veena George said that the state is prepared to start the COVID-19 vaccination for the children when the country decides to go forward with the same. Earlier, the Director of Indian Council of Medical Research's National Institute of Virology had said that children in the age group of 2-18 may get COVID-19 vaccines by September 2021.

Bengaluru Police Commissioner Kamal Pant has announced that prohibitory orders issued under Section 144 (1) of Code of Criminal Procedure have been extended till August 30 amid a gradual increase in COVID-19 cases. This restricts the assembly of four or more people and puts curbs on certain activities. Night curfew has also been extended till August 30.

National Institute of Virology Director Dr Priya Abraham has said that recommendations for booster dose of COVID-19 vaccines will definitely come in future. "Studies on booster dose have been going on overseas and at least seven different vaccines have been tried out for booster dose," Abraham stated. This comes as WHO said there's no need for booster doses for now.

Online registration has been made mandatory for people visiting Himachal Pradesh, as per state Chief Secretary Ram Subhag Singh's new order. Earlier in an order issued on August 10, the state government had made it mandatory for people to carry negative COVID-19 reports or full vaccination certificates if they planned to visit the state from August 13.

Kerala Health Minister Veena George said that the state is prepared to start the COVID-19 vaccination for the children when the country decides to go forward with the same. Earlier, the Director of Indian Council of Medical Research's National Institute of Virology had said that children in the age group of 2-18 may get COVID-19 vaccines by September 2021.

Oil prices fell for the sixth straight day in its longest losing streak since February 2020 as rising COVID-19 cases around the world prompted fears of lower fuel demand. Brent crude fell to $67.1 a barrel, or its lowest level since late May. Slower demand growth in China and an unexpected increase in US gasoline inventories dragged the market.

The COVID-19 vaccination drive will remain suspended on August 19 and 20 at all government and civic body-run centres in Mumbai due to a shortage of doses, the BMC has announced. "The vaccination drive will resume on August 21, as a fresh stock of vaccines is expected to arrive on Thursday night and will be distributed...the next day," it added.

South Africa will open up COVID-19 vaccinations to those aged between 18 and 35 years old from Friday, as part of increasing the vaccination roll-out programme, the government said. The country has so far fully vaccinated less than 8% of its population of 60 million. South Africa has reportedly recorded the most coronavirus infections and deaths on the African continent.

According to Telangana Public Health and Family Welfare Director Dr G Srinivasa Rao, COVID-19's second wave has come to an end in the state and this is the time to reopen educational institutions. Only vaccinated teachers and staff will be allowed, he said. Rao added that 56% people have received the first COVID-19 vaccine dose in Telangana.

National Institute of Virology Director Dr Priya Abraham has said that recommendations for booster dose of COVID-19 vaccines will definitely come in future. "Studies on booster dose have been going on overseas and at least seven different vaccines have been tried out for booster dose," Abraham stated. This comes as WHO said there's no need for booster doses for now.

The average pay of top executives at Indian companies increased by 13% from ?9.22 crore in FY20 to ?10.41 crore in FY21 despite COVID-19, according to an ET report. The double-digit increase is partly due to low-base effect in FY20 when top executives only got a 3% pay hike. The companies mentioned in the report include Infosys and Tata Steel.

India has reported 36,401 new COVID-19 cases and 530 deaths in the last 24 hours. This comes a day after the country reported 35,178 cases and 440 deaths. Kerala accounted for over 58% of the new cases as the state reported 21,427 cases on Wednesday. India's active caseload stood at 3,64,129, the lowest in 149 days.

Maharashtra recorded 5,132 new COVID-19 cases and 8,196 recoveries in the last 24 hours. The state also recorded 158 more deaths on Wednesday taking the toll to 1,35,413. Currently, there are 58,069 active COVID-19 cases in the state and the recovery rate has reached 96.93%, the state's Public Health Department stated.

Several rakhi shops in Hyderabad are providing a 50% discount on their items to customers who are fully vaccinated against COVID-19. A shop owner told his business was affected last year due to coronavirus-linked lockdown, adding that customers would get a discount after their vaccination certificates are verified. A customer said shops are giving discounts as a "token of gratitude".

Circulation of the Delta variant in areas of low vaccination is driving transmission of COVID-19 around the world, World Health Organization officials said on Wednesday. WHO epidemiologist Maria Van Kerkhove said, "[The Delta] variant...is really circulating in areas of low level of vaccine coverage and in the context of very limited and inconsistent use of public health and social measures."

Uttar Pradesh government has decided to reopen schools for students of Classes 6 to 8 from August 23 and Classes 1 to 5 from September 1. This comes days after the schools reopened for students of Classes 9 to 12 on Monday with 50% attendance and "strict COVID-19 protocol in place" in the state.

Pope Francis on Wednesday urged people to get the COVID-19 vaccination and joined a campaign to boost vaccinations globally. In a video message, the Pope said, "Thanks to God and to...work of many, we...have vaccines to protect us from COVID-19." "Being vaccinated...is an act of love...And contributing to ensure...majority of people are vaccinated is an act of love," he added.

Aditya Birla Group Chairman Kumar Mangalam Birla said the Indian economy is rapidly normalising towards pre-pandemic activity levels, even as uncertainty about COVID-19 mutations and repeated infections exists. Vaccination is picking up pace, which would improve resilience against a potential third wave, he added. There are strong signals of a pick-up in the private sector capex cycle, Birla said.

Rapper Drake revealed he experienced hair loss after getting COVID-19. An Instagram user trolled his hairline in a post, writing "that heart is stressed", referring to a heart that Drake has shaved into his head, which looked faded. "I had COVID-19 that sh*t grew in weird I had to start again," Drake replied.

US government said it plans to make COVID-19 vaccine booster shots available from September 20. It said it's prepared to offer a third booster shot to Americans who took the second dose at least eight months ago, subject to FDA approval and CDC vaccine advisory committee's recommendation. Data shows COVID-19 vaccine protection begins to decrease over time, the statement said.

The United States reported over 1,000 COVID-19 deaths on Tuesday, according to a Reuters tally. The tally on Tuesday showed 1,017 deaths, taking the death toll from the pandemic to under 6,23,000 people, the highest number of deaths officially reported by any country globally. The COVID-related hospitalisations have increased by about 70% in the past two weeks in the US.

Moderna's Co-founder Noubar Afeyan spoke to Bloomberg TV about COVID-19 vaccine booster doses and said, "My guess is that given enough time, we may well end up in a situation where we have, let's say at a minimum, yearly vaccinations, just like the flu." Moderna is currently testing a half-dose booster that "seems to be extremely effective," Afeyan added.

Actor Arjun Kapoor spoke about working with actor Saif Ali Khan in film 'Bhoot Police'. He said, "I was...excited to work with him because I'm a huge fan and I was an assistant on...sets of 'Kal Ho Naa Ho', too." Speaking about how COVID-19 affected the film's shoot, Arjun said, "Saif was...apprehensive but Ramesh Taurani and the team made us...comfortable."

India has reported 35,178 new COVID-19 cases and 440 deaths in the last 24 hours. This comes a day after the country reported 25,166 cases and 437 deaths. Kerala accounted for over 61% of the new cases as the state reported 21,613 cases on Tuesday. The total number of cases in India reached 3,22,85,857, while death toll surged to 4,32,519.

Covishield COVID-19 vaccine maker Serum Institute of India's (SII) Founder Cyrus S Poonawalla was quoted by PTI as saying, "After six months, the antibodies go down and that's why I've taken the third dose." The billionaire added, "We've given the third dose to 7,000-8,000 SII employees." He further urged the people to take a third booster dose after six months.

Maharashtra CM Uddhav Thackeray on Tuesday virtually inaugurated the renovated tourist resort at Sinhagad Fort. The resort is operated by the Maharashtra Tourism Development Corporation (MTDC). MTDC Regional Manager Deepak Harne said that it also has a museum and an open amphitheatre for martial art (Mardani Khel). He added that COVID-19 preventive measures are in place at the resort.

India is likely to get an indigenous COVID-19 vaccine for children by September or "just after it", Prof Priya Abraham, Director of ICMR-National Institute of Virology said. Her statement came amid ongoing phase two and three trials of Bharat Biotech's Covaxin for the 2-18 age group. "The results (of the trials) are going to be available very soon," she added.

The extent of food items' price rise remained relatively modest during the second COVID-19 wave, as compared to the first wave, RBI said in an article. This was due to better supply chain management and localised lockdowns, it added. The article tracked retail and wholesale prices of 22 food items and showed that mark-ups rose more sharply during first wave.

Retail sales recovered to 72% of pre-COVID-19 levels in July and Indian retailers are now eyeing the festive season, a survey by the Retailers Association of India (RAI) found. The rate of recovery stood at 50% of pre-pandemic levels in June 2021. The survey found businesses in the South reported a sharp comeback with sales at 82% of pre-COVID-19 levels.

Several rakhi shops in Hyderabad are providing a 50% discount on their items to customers who are fully vaccinated against COVID-19. A shop owner told his business was affected last year due to coronavirus-linked lockdown, adding that customers would get a discount after their vaccination certificates are verified. A customer said shops are giving discounts as a "token of gratitude".

Current data does not indicate that COVID-19 vaccines' booster shots are needed, the World Health Organization (WHO) said on Wednesday. WHO chief scientist Soumya Swaminathan said, "We believe clearly that the data today does not indicate that boosters are needed." The remarks came just before the US said it planned to make the booster shots available to all Americans.

Kerala on Wednesday reported 21,427 new COVID-19 cases, according to the state government's data, taking the infection count to 37,45,457. The death toll also mounted to 19,049 with 179 new fatalities, according to the state government bulletin. Of the 14 districts in Kerala, Malappuram reported over 3,000 new cases on Wednesday, while three other districts reported over 2,000 new cases.

US government said it plans to make COVID-19 vaccine booster shots available from September 20. It said it's prepared to offer a third booster shot to Americans who took the second dose at least eight months ago, subject to FDA approval and CDC vaccine advisory committee's recommendation. Data shows COVID-19 vaccine protection begins to decrease over time, the statement said.

India is likely to get an indigenous COVID-19 vaccine for children by September or "just after it", Prof Priya Abraham, Director of ICMR-National Institute of Virology said. Her statement came amid ongoing phase two and three trials of Bharat Biotech's Covaxin for the 2-18 age group. "The results (of the trials) are going to be available very soon," she added.

WHO epidemiologist Maria Van Kerkhove said, "[The Delta] variant...is really circulating in areas of low level of vaccine coverage and in the context of very limited and inconsistent use of public health and social measures."

Moderna is currently testing a half-dose booster that "seems to be extremely effective," Afeyan added.

Pope Francis on Wednesday urged people to get the COVID-19 vaccination and joined a campaign to boost vaccinations globally. In a video message, the Pope said, "Thanks to God and to...work of many, we...have vaccines to protect us from COVID-19." "Being vaccinated...is an act of love...And contributing to ensure...majority of people are vaccinated is an act of love," he added.

The WHO has issued an alert saying that falsified Covishield COVID-19 vaccine has been reported at the patient level in Uganda and India. The genuine manufacturer of Covishield (Serum Institute of India) has confirmed that the products listed in the alert are falsified. "SII does not produce Covishield in 2ml," WHO said while sharing a picture of vials from India.

Around 35 lakh passengers travelled on the Mumbai suburban trains on the first full working day, on Tuesday, after people who have been fully vaccinated against COVID-19 were allowed to board the local trains, officials said. On Sunday, over 18 lakh commuters boarded the trains. Government and private offices in the city reopened after an extended weekend.

Current data does not indicate that COVID-19 vaccines' booster shots are needed, the World Health Organization (WHO) said on Wednesday. WHO chief scientist Soumya Swaminathan said, "We believe clearly that the data today does not indicate that boosters are needed." The remarks came just before the US said it planned to make the booster shots available to all Americans.

The WHO has issued an alert saying that falsified Covishield COVID-19 vaccine has been reported at the patient level in Uganda and India. The genuine manufacturer of Covishield (Serum Institute of India) has confirmed that the products listed in the alert are falsified. "SII does not produce Covishield in 2ml," WHO said while sharing a picture of vials from India.

Covishield COVID-19 vaccine maker Serum Institute of India's (SII) Founder Cyrus S Poonawalla was quoted by PTI as saying, "After six months, the antibodies go down and that's why I've taken the third dose." The billionaire added, "We've given the third dose to 7,000-8,000 SII employees." He further urged the people to take a third booster dose after six months.

Bombay High Court on Tuesday granted permission to hold Muharram procession in the state but subject to certain conditions amid COVID-19. It allowed a procession of only fully vaccinated persons to travel on seven trucks, with 15 persons onboard each vehicle. The court also restricted entry into the cemetery to only 25 out of 105 persons when the procession ends.

AAP MLA Kuldeep Kumar, among others, has been booked for carrying out a 'Tiranga Yatra' on Independence Day in Delhi without taking necessary permissions, police said. Police alleged the group didn't follow COVID-19 norms and most of them weren't wearing a mask. "Why is Delhi Police not registering an FIR against the 'Ashirwad Yatra' taken out by BJP?" Kumar asked.

India has reported 25,166 COVID-19 cases in the last 24 hours, which is the lowest daily cases reported in the last five months. The country recorded 437 deaths in the last 24 hours. India's active caseload stood at 3,69,846, which is the lowest in 146 days. With this, the country's total cases reached 3,22,50,679 and death toll surged to 4,32,079.

The US Centers for Disease Control and Prevention has eased its travel advisory category for India to 'Level 2', citing moderate level of COVID-19 in the country. The US State Department also eased it to 'Level 2' and asked citizens to 'exercise increased caution'. Last month, India was in 'Level 3' category, under which citizens are urged to reconsider travel.

Virologist Gagandeep Kang has said that there is no data, at present, which shows that anyone who has received two COVID-19 vaccine doses needs a booster dose. "There's no cut-off level of antibodies which reliably predicts protection at the individual level," she added. Kang further said that the third dose isn't currently recommended in many countries, but should be considered.

The government has put the export of COVID-19 Rapid Antigen testing kits under 'restricted category' with immediate effect, the Directorate General of Foreign Trade (DGFT) said in a notification. This means that exporters have to seek a licence or permission from DGFT for shipping these items. The notification comes as several experts have warned of a possible third COVID-19 wave.

Uttar Pradesh on Tuesday became the only Indian state to administer over six crore doses of coronavirus vaccine since the vaccination drive started in mid-January this year, the government said. So far, over five crore people have received the first dose while over 94 lakh people have received both their doses. The government claimed UP has 419 active COVID-19 cases.

Gaurav Gupta, Chief Commissioner of Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike (BBMP), said that the civic body has received a contribution of 30,000 juice packets for COVID-19 warriors from ITC Limited. Sharing pictures on Twitter, he wrote, "This will be distributed amongst the health workers who are working towards prevention and containment of COVID-19 pandemic."

The Assam government on Tuesday issued a revised SOP, announcing relaxations in COVID-19 restrictions for both rural and urban areas from August 18. As per the new order, the night curfew will be in force from 7 pm to 5 am. Inter-district movement of private vehicles has been allowed across the state, except to and from Kamrup Metropolitan District.

New Zealand announced a strict lockdown on Tuesday after the country's first coronavirus case in six months was reported in the largest city of Auckland. All of New Zealand will be in the toughest, level-four lockdown for at least three days from Wednesday. Auckland and Coromandel, where the infected person spent time, will be in lockdown for seven days.

Covishield COVID-19 vaccine maker Serum Institute of India (SII) has bought a 50% stake in Schott Kaisha, the largest maker of vials in India. Schott Kaisha is a 50:50 joint venture partnership between German specialty glass producer Schott and India's Kaisha Manufacturers. SII's CEO Adar Poonawalla said the deal will ensure an uninterrupted supply of essential pharma packaging products.

BJP chief JP Nadda on Tuesday criticised Kerala government's handling of the coronavirus pandemic, calling it "gross mismanagement". "There are nearly 20,000 cases in Kerala on average," he said, adding that the government conducted maximum tests through rapid antigen kits and not the more reliable RT-PCR method. He revealed Union Health Minister gave a ?267 crore package to strengthen healthcare.

Uttar Pradesh on Tuesday became the only Indian state to administer over six crore doses of coronavirus vaccine since the vaccination drive started in mid-January this year, the government said. So far, over five crore people have received the first dose while over 94 lakh people have received both their doses. The government claimed UP has 419 active COVID-19 cases.

As many as 20% of the estimated 85 lakh eligible beneficiaries have been vaccinated against COVID-19 till date in the Pune district, according to a new district health department report. Of the total 17.06 lakh persons who have been fully vaccinated in the district, 0.15% were infected with the virus after receiving both doses, according to the report.

India has achieved its highest single-day COVID-19 vaccination record after administering more than 88.13 lakh vaccine doses in the last 24 hours, said the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. India's vaccination coverage crossed 55-crore milestone yesterday. Cumulatively, 55,47,30,609 vaccine doses have been administered through 62,12,108 sessions, as per the provisional report till 7 am today.

India has administered over 56 crore doses of COVID-19 vaccines till Tuesday, a government release revealed, adding that nearly 50 lakh doses were administered in 24 hours. On Monday, India administered the most number of doses, nearly 88.13 lakh, since the vaccination drive began in mid-January. Meanwhile, UP became the only state to administer over six crore doses so far.

India has achieved its highest single-day COVID-19 vaccination record after administering more than 88.13 lakh vaccine doses in the last 24 hours, said the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. India's vaccination coverage crossed 55-crore milestone yesterday. Cumulatively, 55,47,30,609 vaccine doses have been administered through 62,12,108 sessions, as per the provisional report till 7 am today.

"There are nearly 20,000 cases in Kerala on average," he said, adding that the government conducted maximum tests through rapid antigen kits and not the more reliable RT-PCR method. He revealed Union Health Minister gave a ?267 crore package to strengthen healthcare.

Delhi reported 38 new coronavirus cases and four fatalities in the last 24 hours, while the positivity rate stood at 0.07%, according to a Health Department bulletin issued on Tuesday. With four more deaths, the toll has now reached 25,073, the bulletin stated. There are 471 active COVID-19 cases in Delhi, up from 467 the previous day.

Uttar Pradesh on Tuesday became the only Indian state to administer over six crore doses of coronavirus vaccine since the vaccination drive started in mid-January this year, the government said. So far, over five crore people have received the first dose while over 94 lakh people have received both their doses. The government claimed UP has 419 active COVID-19 cases.

Centre stated in Kerala High Court that those who've received two doses of coronavirus vaccine can't be re-vaccinated. Taking the vaccine's overdose can lead to health problems, it added. The court was hearing a man's petition, who'd received Covaxin's two doses, however, he wanted to be re-vaccinated with Covishield as Covaxin wasn't approved in Saudi Arabia, where he'd his job.

The Karnataka government on Tuesday launched a special drive to test those who have recovered from COVID-19 and their families for tuberculosis. State Health Minister K Sudhakar said the testing drive will ensure early detection of TB among people who've recovered from COVID-19. "There are more than 28 lakh people in the state who have recovered from COVID-19," he informed.

India has administered over 56 crore doses of COVID-19 vaccines till Tuesday, a government release revealed, adding that nearly 50 lakh doses were administered in 24 hours. On Monday, India administered the most number of doses, nearly 88.13 lakh, since the vaccination drive began in mid-January. Meanwhile, UP became the only state to administer over six crore doses so far.

The Centre will provide a financial package of ?1,300 crore to the Northeastern states to fight the COVID-19 pandemic, Union Health Minister Mansukh Mandaviya announced on Tuesday. He said, "The fund will...be utilised to speed up...vaccination drive by the states in the region." "In...last two weeks, [COVID-19] cases have started declining in...Northeast and this is a good sign," he added.

Maharashtra on Tuesday recorded 4,408 new COVID-19 cases, taking the number of active cases in the state to 61,306. Besides, 116 more COVID-19 deaths were reported in the day, taking the number of total fatalities to 1,35,255. The recovery rate in the state rose to 96.87% and the case fatality rate in the state is 2.11%.

Kerala on Tuesday logged 21,613 new COVID-19 cases pushing the infection count to 37,24,030, as the number of people succumbing to the disease rose to 18,870 with 127 additional deaths. As many as 18,556 people have been cured of the infection since Monday, taking the total recoveries to 35,29,465. There are currently 1,75,167 active COVID-19 cases in the state.

While interacting with the Indian contingent headed for the upcoming Tokyo Paralympics, PM Narendra Modi on Tuesday said, "New India will never pressurise its athletes to win medals, rather everyone should...focus on giving their 100%." He said, "[India] is going to script history at...Paralympics as well." "COVID-19 may have increased your hardships, but you...have never given up," PM Modi added.

"There's no cut-off level of antibodies which reliably predicts protection at the individual level," she added. Kang further said that the third dose isn't currently recommended in many countries, but should be considered.
