The court was hearing a man's petition, who'd received Covaxin's two doses, however, he wanted to be re-vaccinated with Covishield as Covaxin wasn't approved in Saudi Arabia, where he'd his job.

Union Health Minister Mansukh Mandaviya will visit Assam on Tuesday to review the COVID-19 situation there. The minister will also take stock of the ongoing construction of the All India Institute of Medical Sciences (AIIMS) in Changsari. Earlier, on Monday, Mandaviya visited Kerala to assess the COVID-19 situation and assured the complete help from the Centre.

Indian vaccine makers are looking at supply opportunity of $10-11 billion in the next three years, Care Ratings said in a report. However, they're unlikely to get the premium pricing being enjoyed by US-based MNCs, which is between $15 and $25 per dose, it added. Indian vaccine makers' average realisation could remain between $3.25 and $3.50 per dose, it said.

Delhi reported 38 new coronavirus cases and four fatalities in the last 24 hours, while the positivity rate stood at 0.07%, according to a Health Department bulletin issued on Tuesday. With four more deaths, the toll has now reached 25,073, the bulletin stated. There are 471 active COVID-19 cases in Delhi, up from 467 the previous day.

Covishield COVID-19 vaccine maker Serum Institute of India (SII) has bought a 50% stake in Schott Kaisha, the largest maker of vials in India. Schott Kaisha is a 50:50 joint venture partnership between German specialty glass producer Schott and India's Kaisha Manufacturers. SII's CEO Adar Poonawalla said the deal will ensure an uninterrupted supply of essential pharma packaging products.

New Zealand announced a strict lockdown on Tuesday after the country's first coronavirus case in six months was reported in the largest city of Auckland. All of New Zealand will be in the toughest, level-four lockdown for at least three days from Wednesday. Auckland and Coromandel, where the infected person spent time, will be in lockdown for seven days.

Wayanad became the first Kerala district to administer its adult population with the first COVID-19 vaccine dose, state Health Minister Veena George said. More than 6.16 lakh people out of the targeted 6.51 lakh persons have received the first dose in the district. The Kerala Health Department said that they were able to vaccinate 636 bedridden patients by visiting houses.

The Thane Municipal Corporation has found 40 COVID-19 vaccine doses, which allegedly went missing from a vaccination centre in Mumbra on Saturday, in a hair transplant clinic. The civic body has sealed the clinic for illegally storing vaccine doses and is inquiring if the incidents are connected, officials said. This comes amid a shortage of vaccine doses in the city.

Fully vaccinated people coming to Pune from outside Maharashtra do not need an RT-PCR test report, the Pune Municipal Corporation (PMC) said in a revised order. Those who haven't received both doses of the COVID-19 vaccine will have to carry an RT-PCR report not older than 72 hours. PMC directed all commercial establishments to administer both doses to their staff.

Union Health Minister Mansukh Mandaviya will be visiting Kerala on Monday to assess the COVID-19 ground situation in the state. Mandaviya's visit comes at a time when Kerala continues to report high number of coronavirus cases. The Union Health Minister will meet CM Pinarayi Vijayan and state Health Minister Veena George, as per the Union Health Ministry's visit plan.

Wayanad became the first Kerala district to administer its adult population with the first COVID-19 vaccine dose, state Health Minister Veena George said. More than 6.16 lakh people out of the targeted 6.51 lakh persons have received the first dose in the district. The Kerala Health Department said that they were able to vaccinate 636 bedridden patients by visiting houses.

The Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) has allowed the opening of grounds, gardens, beaches, and seafronts in Mumbai from 6 am to 10 pm on all days. However, COVID-19 regulations like social distancing and use of masks will be compulsory. The BMC in its notification warned that action will be taken if COVID-19 protocols are not followed.

Union Health Minister Mansukh Mandaviya will be visiting Kerala on Monday to assess the COVID-19 ground situation in the state. Mandaviya's visit comes at a time when Kerala continues to report high number of coronavirus cases. The Union Health Minister will meet CM Pinarayi Vijayan and state Health Minister Veena George, as per the Union Health Ministry's visit plan.

India has reported 32,937 new COVID-19 cases and 417 deaths in the last 24 hours, as per the Health Ministry. This comes a day after the country witnessed 36,083 COVID-19 cases and 493 deaths. With this, India's active cases dropped to 3,81,947, and the death toll surged to 4,31,642. The country's total COVID-19 cases reached 3,22,25,513.

The Thane Municipal Corporation has found 40 COVID-19 vaccine doses, which allegedly went missing from a vaccination centre in Mumbra on Saturday, in a hair transplant clinic. The civic body has sealed the clinic for illegally storing vaccine doses and is inquiring if the incidents are connected, officials said. This comes amid a shortage of vaccine doses in the city.

Jagannath Temple in Odisha's Puri will reopen for local devotees from Monday in adherence to COVID-19 guidelines, according to Shree Jagannatha Temple Administration. People from outside Puri will be allowed to enter the temple from August 23, an official said. As per guidelines, devotees from outside Puri will have to produce COVID-19 vaccination certificate or a negative COVID-19 RT-PCR report.

The Indian Institute of Technology Bombay has allowed Afghan students, who registered during the current semester, to return to the campus. "Indian Council for Cultural Relations (ICCR) Mumbai office is working closely with the Indian Embassy in Kabul to issue visas to the students," said IIT Bombay Dean (International Relations). The students are attending classes online due to COVID-19.

Cuban Public Health Minister Jose Angel Portal said on Sunday that its main oxygen plant had failed and efforts are underway to restart it amid a surge in coronavirus cases. This comes as the country reported 98 daily deaths on Saturday, equal to its record high. Cuba's fatalities are at nearly 1%, which is higher compared to 0.67% last year.

India's business activity crossed the pre-COVID-19 level for the first time, Nomura said. Nomura India Business Resumption Index (NIBRI), which measures the activity on a weekly basis, rose to 101.2 for the week ended August 15, rising above 100 for the first time since March 2020. However, Nomura warned that the economy is not out of the pandemic woods yet.

Fully vaccinated people coming to Pune from outside Maharashtra do not need an RT-PCR test report, the Pune Municipal Corporation (PMC) said in a revised order. Those who haven't received both doses of the COVID-19 vaccine will have to carry an RT-PCR report not older than 72 hours. PMC directed all commercial establishments to administer both doses to their staff.

Delhi reported 27 COVID-19 cases in the last 24 hours, the lowest number of cases since April 15 last year. No COVID-19 related deaths were reported from the national capital in the last 24 hours. While 73 people were discharged from hospitals in the same time span, the total recoveries stood at 14,11,582.

More than 160 COVID-19 cases have been confirmed among people who attended an outdoor music festival in US' Washington state from July 30 to August 1, an official said. "The outbreak is the first one traced to an outdoor...event since the lifting of...COVID-19 prevention measures," the official added. Over 25,000 fans had attended the festival, the Seattle Times reported.

Cuban Public Health Minister Jose Angel Portal said on Sunday that its main oxygen plant had failed and efforts are underway to restart it amid a surge in coronavirus cases. This comes as the country reported 98 daily deaths on Saturday, equal to its record high. Cuba's fatalities are at nearly 1%, which is higher compared to 0.67% last year.

Ten new cases of Delta Plus COVID-19 variant have been found in Maharashtra, the state Health Department said on Monday. While six of these cases have been found in Kolhapur, three are in Ratnagiri and one in Sindhudurg in the Konkan region of the state. With this, the total number of cases in the state has increased to 76.

The Uttarakhand government on Monday extended the COVID-19 curfew in the state from 6 am on August 17 to 6 am on August 24. The government order states that the vaccination drive against COVID-19 will continue in the state despite curbs. As per the state's guidelines, a maximum of 50 people are allowed to attend weddings and funerals.

Goa CM Pramod Sawant on Sunday announced that the COVID-19 curfew in the state has been extended till August 23. The curfew was supposed to end on August 16, as per earlier orders. Sawant has said that Goa is the first state in India to administer at least one dose of the COVID-19 vaccine to 90% of its eligible population.

Gujarat government on Sunday extended the night curfew (from 11 pm to 6 am) till August 28 in eight cities amid COVID-19. The night curfew has been extended in Ahmedabad, Surat, Vadodara, Rajkot, Bhavnagar, Jamnagar, Gandhinagar and Junagadh. The curfew timings were reduced by an hour last month.

Thai Police used water cannons and teargas during a clash with anti-government protesters near the residence of Thai PM Prayut Chan-o-cha on Sunday. The protesters had hurled projectiles towards the police. A separate "car mob" convoy of thousands of cars and motorcycles urging Prayut to resign over his handling of the COVID-19 pandemic earlier passed through Bangkok peacefully.

Delhi reported zero deaths due to COVID-19 and 53 fresh cases in the last 24 hours, according to a health bulletin issued on Sunday. With this, the COVID-19 tally has reached 14,37,091 and the death toll has risen to 25,069. As many 14.11 lakh patients have recovered so far, while the COVID-19 positivity rate in the city stood at 0.08%.

India has reported 36,083 new COVID-19 cases and 493 deaths in the last 24 hours, as per the Health Ministry. This comes a day after the country witnessed 38,667 COVID-19 cases and 478 deaths. With this, India's active cases dropped to 3,85,336, and the death toll surged to 4,31,225. The country's total COVID-19 cases reached 3,21,92,576.

Prime Minister Narendra Modi, in his address to the nation on 75th Independence Day, said thousands of startups have emerged during COVID-19. "Yesterday's startups are becoming unicorns today. Their market value is touching thousands of crores. They are the new kind of wealth creators in the country," he said. So far, 23 Indian startups have achieved unicorn status this year.

Karnataka CM Basavaraj Bommai said on Saturday that the coronavirus test positivity rate in Bengaluru is currently 0.66% and if this rises to 2%, then stricter rules will be imposed here. He added that if oxygen beds are occupied up to 40%, then too stricter rules will be imposed in the city. These will be tracked daily, he further said.

Local train services in Mumbai resumed after a gap of four months on Sunday. The Maharashtra government for now has allowed only those people who are fully vaccinated against COVID-19 to avail train services. To facilitate the process, BMC introduced a universal travel pass system with QR code for passengers that are available through both offline and online systems.

The Women and Child Development department has warned of strict action against its officials after some of them cited COVID-19 restrictions as the reason for being late to work. However, the WCD department said that the justification was "not satisfactory". On July 13, the department had issued show-cause notices to 49 of its employees for reporting late.

Kerala on Sunday reported 18,582 new COVID-19 cases, pushing the total infection count to 36.69 lakh, and the death toll rose to 18,601 with 102 additional deaths. As many as 20,829 people have been cured since Saturday, taking the total recoveries to 34,92,367. There are 1,78,630 active cases in the state currently, a state government release said.

SLC secretary Mohan de Silva has praised Rahul Dravid, who was India's coach for Sri Lanka tour, for ensuring that the series continued despite Krunal Pandya testing positive for coronavirus. "If Dravid wanted, he could've easily taken the team back to India," De Silva said. India made seven changes in playing XI for second T20I due to the COVID-19 outbreak.

Mumbai local train services for fully-vaccinated general commuters resumed on Sunday, after a gap of four months. No incident of crowding was reported inside local trains and on suburban railway stations on both Central and Western railways, officials said. Nearly 1,20,000 monthly passes have been issued so far to people who've completed 14 days since receiving the second vaccine dose.

The Pune rural administration has diverted its entire stock of 50,000 Covishield doses and 3,000 Covaxin doses for the second dose beneficiaries amid a shortage of the vaccine. "As of August 8, Pune rural has 2,07,164 people awaiting their second dose of Covishield and 14,498 people awaiting their second dose of Covaxin," Dr Sachin Edake, district immunisation officer said.

Goa CM Pramod Sawant on Sunday announced that the COVID-19 curfew in the state has been extended till August 23. The curfew was supposed to end on August 16, as per earlier orders. Sawant has said that Goa is the first state in India to administer at least one dose of the COVID-19 vaccine to 90% of its eligible population.

Addressing the nation on Independence Day, PM Narendra Modi said it's a result of strength of our industrialists and scientists that today India doesn't need to depend on any other nation for COVID-19 vaccines. He added, "We can proudly say that the largest vaccination program is being run in India. Over 54 crore people have received vaccine doses so far."

Addressing the nation on Independence Day, PM Narendra Modi said it's a result of strength of our industrialists and scientists that today India doesn't need to depend on any other nation for COVID-19 vaccines. He added, "We can proudly say that the largest vaccination program is being run in India. Over 54 crore people have received vaccine doses so far."

Mumbai is free of active COVID-19 containment zones, BMC announced. Municipal Commissioner IS Chahal said, "This is the happiest day of my life. All along we've been working hard towards having zero containment zones in the city and today (Saturday) we've achieved it." "Delta Plus variant cases are on a rise and we need to abide by...COVID-19-appropriate behaviour," he added.

Panta Petrovic, a 70-year-old man who has been living in a cave in Serbia for around 20 years, got vaccinated against COVID-19 recently and urged everyone to do the same. Petrovic learnt about the pandemic in one of his visits to town last year. "It (the virus) does not pick. It will come here, to my cave, too," Petrovic said.

US President Joe Biden extended wishes to India on the occasion of its 75th Independence Day, saying that the country's commitment to democracy "continues to inspire the world". "This past year, our nations have come together in new ways as we tackle the COVID-19 pandemic," he added. In this moment, US-India partnership is "more important than ever", he further said.

AIIMS Director Dr Randeep Guleria has said the possible third wave of COVID-19 might not be as severe as the second wave. Referring to apprehensions that the third wave could infect children more, Guleria stated that children would be "more susceptible" because they weren't being vaccinated. He added that vaccines are still effective as far as severe disease is concerned.

Panta Petrovic, a 70-year-old man who has been living in a cave in Serbia for around 20 years, got vaccinated against COVID-19 recently and urged everyone to do the same. Petrovic learnt about the pandemic in one of his visits to town last year. "It (the virus) does not pick. It will come here, to my cave, too," Petrovic said.

AIIMS Director Dr Randeep Guleria has said the possible third wave of COVID-19 might not be as severe as the second wave. Referring to apprehensions that the third wave could infect children more, Guleria stated that children would be "more susceptible" because they weren't being vaccinated. He added that vaccines are still effective as far as severe disease is concerned.

Iran will impose a six-day-long "general lockdown" in cities across the country from Monday amid a fifth wave of coronavirus pandemic, state media reported on Saturday.  All non-essential government offices and businesses will remain shut during this period. The country's coronavirus taskforce has issued a travel ban between all Iranian cities from Sunday to Friday.

A picture showing US President Joe Biden holding a sign alongside social media influencer 'Dude with Sign' to promote COVID-19 vaccines has gone viral. "Lets look out for each other and get vaccinated," Seth Phillips' sign reads, while Biden held a sign reading, "This dude gets it, folks." The picture was shared by Phillips and has over 19 lakh likes.

India's exports surged nearly 50% year-on-year to a record high of $35.43 billion in July due to low base effect and healthy growth in petroleum, engineering, and gems and jewellery segments, Commerce Ministry data showed. Exports rose 35% compared to pre-COVID-19 levels of July 2019. Imports in July 2021 stood at $46.4 billion, taking India's trade deficit to $10.97 billion.

US Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) said it has administered over 35 crore COVID-19 vaccine doses as of Friday and distributed over 41 crore doses. The doses distributed and administered include Moderna, Pfizer-BioNTech and Johnson & Johnson vaccines. US, which is the worst coronavirus-hit country, is witnessing a COVID-19 surge due to Delta variant, first found in India.

Actress Richa Chadha has said she was "just hungry" to get back on set after the COVID-19 lockdown because it creates employment and she was sick of sitting at home. She added that an actor's motivation to sign a project can be different "depending on the state they are in their personal lives, headspace and careers".

Expressing condolences towards families of those who died of COVID-19, President Ram Nath Kovind in his Independence Day eve speech said the intensity of the pandemic has reduced but the disease is still here. "We suffered from a terrible second wave," he said, adding that vaccines are the best protection provided by science. He urged people to get vaccinated.

President Ram Nath Kovind on Saturday hosted the Indian contingent that participated at the Tokyo Olympics over a High Tea at Rashtrapati Bhavan Cultural Centre and said the athletes gave the country a reason to celebrate during the COVID-19 pandemic. "This team has won the highest number of medals for India in Olympics. The entire country is proud," Kovind stated.

Iran will impose a six-day "general lockdown" in cities across the country from Monday to Saturday amid a surge in coronavirus cases. The national coronavirus taskforce, which issued the decision, also ordered a travel ban between all Iranian cities from Sunday to Friday. Markets, public offices, theatres, gyms and restaurants will remain shut during the lockdown.

Karnataka CM Basavaraj Bommai on Saturday said schools in districts having less than 2% COVID-19 test positivity rate (TPR) will be reopened for Classes 9-12 from August 23. "It's mandatory for all parents and school staff to be vaccinated for entry into school premises," he said. However, if the positivity rate crosses 2%, schools will be shut for a week.

Union Health Minister Mansukh Mandaviya will be visiting Kerala on August 16 to review the COVID-19 situation in the state. According to the revised plan shared by the Union Health Ministry, Mandaviya will meet Kerala CM Pinarayi Vijayan and state Health Minister Veena George. Kerala government will also implement new guidelines from Wednesday and enforce "special intensified stringent" lockdown.

Punjab Chief Minister Captain Amarinder Singh has said that full COVID-19 vaccination or negative RT-PCR report will be mandatory for all those entering the state from Monday. "Strict monitoring particularly of those coming from Himachal Pradesh and Jammu, which are showing increased positivity," the state government said. Punjab has over 500 active cases of COVID-19.

The cricket boards of Australia and England have confirmed the availability of their players for the second leg of the IPL 2021, which was suspended in May this year due to the COVID-19 outbreak inside its bio-bubble. The season will resume on September 19 in UAE with the final taking place on October 15.

SpiceJet's consolidated net loss increased to ?729 crore in the April-June quarter, as against ?593 crore in the year-ago period. Managing Director Ajay Singh said the first quarter was severely impacted by the second wave of COVID-19 when passenger traffic reduced. SpiceJet added that it continues to incur costs related to the grounding of Boeing 737 Max jets in India.

India recorded 38,667 new COVID-19 cases and 478 deaths in the last 24 hours, Ministry of Health and Family Welfare said. COVID-19 recovery rate stands at 97.45%, it added. It further said that active cases (3,87,673) in the country constitute 1.21% of total cases. India's total cases reached 3,21,56,493 and the death toll surged to 4,30,732.

US Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) said it has administered over 35 crore COVID-19 vaccine doses as of Friday and distributed over 41 crore doses. The doses distributed and administered include Moderna, Pfizer-BioNTech and Johnson & Johnson vaccines. US, which is the worst coronavirus-hit country, is witnessing a COVID-19 surge due to Delta variant, first found in India.

US Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) said it has administered over 35 crore COVID-19 vaccine doses as of Friday and distributed over 41 crore doses. The doses distributed and administered include Moderna, Pfizer-BioNTech and Johnson & Johnson vaccines. US, which is the worst coronavirus-hit country, is witnessing a COVID-19 surge due to Delta variant, first found in India.

Karnataka Revenue Minister R Ashoka said on Friday that the state government has no proposals to impose a lockdown in Bengaluru. This comes after media reports speculated a possible lockdown in the city due to a rise in coronavirus cases. He added that there will be discussions for more stringent coronavirus restrictions in the state after August 15.

Iran will impose a six-day-long "general lockdown" in cities across the country from Monday amid a fifth wave of coronavirus pandemic, state media reported on Saturday.  All non-essential government offices and businesses will remain shut during this period. The country's coronavirus taskforce has issued a travel ban between all Iranian cities from Sunday to Friday.

Iran will impose a six-day "general lockdown" in cities across the country from Monday to Saturday amid a surge in coronavirus cases. The national coronavirus taskforce, which issued the decision, also ordered a travel ban between all Iranian cities from Sunday to Friday. Markets, public offices, theatres, gyms and restaurants will remain shut during the lockdown.

World's largest vaccine maker Serum Institute of India's (SII) Chairman Cyrus Poonawalla on Friday termed the government's ban on COVID-19 vaccine exports a "very bad move". "My son (Adar) asked me not to open my mouth. But it's my view that exports ought to be opened," Poonawalla said. Over 150 countries are blaming SII for stopping supply, he added.

A picture showing US President Joe Biden holding a sign alongside social media influencer 'Dude with Sign' to promote COVID-19 vaccines has gone viral. "Lets look out for each other and get vaccinated," Seth Phillips' sign reads, while Biden held a sign reading, "This dude gets it, folks." The picture was shared by Phillips and has over 19 lakh likes.

Resident Welfare Associations (RWAs) in Bengaluru have been told that residents returning from inter-state travel must mandatorily carry negative RT-PCR tests not older than 72 hours by the Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike (BBMP) amid the COVID-19 pandemic. RWAs have also been directed to limit deliveries to the main gate. They were also told to discourage congregations in common areas.

Robin Hood Army, a volunteer-based organization has joined hands with WhatsApp, Uber and Google to help vaccinate 1.5 lakh Indians and serve 5 million meals by this Independence Day. The #mission28states initiative is a national effort across 28 states in which RHA volunteers shall bring together civic society to address key challenges of hunger and vaccine hesitancy.

Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike (BBMP) will be honouring 100 COVID-19 warriors during the 75th Independence Day celebrations at Field Marshal Manekshaw Parade Ground in the city on August 15. The COVID-19 warriors, including healthcare professionals, frontline workers and 25 persons who've recovered from the virus, will participate as special invitees, BBMP Chief Commissioner Gaurav Gupta said.

World's largest vaccine maker Serum Institute of India's (SII) Chairman Cyrus Poonawalla on Friday termed the government's ban on COVID-19 vaccine exports a "very bad move". "My son (Adar) asked me not to open my mouth. But it's my view that exports ought to be opened," Poonawalla said. Over 150 countries are blaming SII for stopping supply, he added.

Global pharma firm Wockhardt Limited on Friday announced its partnership with the Russian Direct Investment Fund (RDIF) to produce and supply COVID-19 Sputnik V and Sputnik Light vaccines. The agreement was reached under the aegis of Enso Healthcare DMCC that is RDIF's coordination partner for sourcing Sputnik vaccines in India. Wockhardt will manufacture and supply 62 crore doses to Enso.

Global pharma firm Wockhardt Limited on Friday announced its partnership with the Russian Direct Investment Fund (RDIF) to produce and supply COVID-19 Sputnik V and Sputnik Light vaccines. The agreement was reached under the aegis of Enso Healthcare DMCC that is RDIF's coordination partner for sourcing Sputnik vaccines in India. Wockhardt will manufacture and supply 62 crore doses to Enso.

Intensifying the COVID-19 vaccination drive in Hyderabad, the Health Department and Greater Hyderabad Municipal Corporation (GHMC) have launched 75 additional mobile vans to vaccinate people aged above 18 years, free of cost. Residents can contact GHMC's helpline number ? 040 21111111 to track the vans in their respective localities. GHMC had launched the initiative with 100 such vans in June.

After a gap of two days, vaccination is likely to resume at over 300 government-run centres on Saturday. BMC had earlier announced that the COVID-19 vaccination drive had been suspended for Thursday and Friday, owing to vaccine shortage. BMC was set to receive 1,59,000 vaccine doses on Thursday, which will be distributed to vaccination centres on Friday.

North Korea aired the Tokyo Olympics for the first time on Tuesday days after the closing ceremony was held. Korean Central Television (KCTV) aired 70 minutes of a women's football group stage match between United Kingdom and Chile without sound and in low resolution. North Korea did not participate in the Tokyo Olympics citing concerns over the coronavirus pandemic.

West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee said on Thursday in an apparent reference to PM Narendra Modi that he should "allow his photo on death certificates" as he has made it "mandatory that his photo should be there on COVID-19 vaccine certificates". "I may not like you. But even then, I would have to carry this," she added.

Mumbai recorded its first death due to Delta Plus variant of COVID-19, BMC said. The deceased is a 63-year-old woman who had taken both the vaccine doses and died in July. Her death was found to have been caused by Delta Plus variant on August 11. "We conducted tracing of her contacts...two were detected with Delta Plus variant," BMC stated.

Facebook has removed over 300 misinformation accounts from Facebook and Instagram that claimed COVID-19 vaccines from AstraZeneca and Pfizer would turn humans into chimpanzees. Facebook said that the accounts were from Russia that they linked to Fazze, a subsidiary of a UK-registered marketing firm. "This operation targeted audiences primarily in India, Latin America," Facebook added.

After a gap of two days, vaccination is likely to resume at over 300 government-run centres on Saturday. BMC had earlier announced that the COVID-19 vaccination drive had been suspended for Thursday and Friday, owing to vaccine shortage. BMC was set to receive 1,59,000 vaccine doses on Thursday, which will be distributed to vaccination centres on Friday.

Serum Institute of India's Chairman & MD Cyrus Poonawalla on Friday said his company can't launch Novavax's COVID-19 vaccine, Covovax, unless it gets a licence. "The parent American company has some issues with the US Food and Drug Administration (FDA), those should be cleared by the end of October. Once they...get a license then we'll get a license," he added.

Pune Municipal Corporation has banned processions for Muharram in the city on August 19 amid the COVID-19 pandemic. Pune Municipal Commissioner Vikram Kumar said there is a ban on social and religious functions, so the Muharram processions can't be taken out. The Muslim community should have their functions in their home by strictly following the COVID-19 appropriate behaviour, he added.

Serum Institute of India Chairman and MD Cyrus Poonawalla on Friday said that it's "very wrong to mix" COVID-19 vaccines. If anything misfires, "Serum will say that the other vaccine isn't good and they (other company) will blame us," he added. Earlier, India's drug regulator granted approval for a study on mixing of Serum Institute's Covishield and Bharat Biotech's Covaxin.

US Food and Drug Administration (FDA) amended the emergency use authorisations for both Pfizer-BioNTech and Moderna COVID-19 vaccines to allow for the use of an additional dose in certain immunocompromised individuals. The dose will be given to "solid organ transplant recipients or those who are diagnosed with conditions that are considered to have equivalent level of immunocompromise", FDA said.

Prime Minister Narendra Modi has appreciated the women self-help groups (SHGs) for producing masks and sanitisers and creating awareness during the ongoing COVID-19 pandemic. He also released ?1,625 crore as capitalisation support fund for over four lakh such groups. The loan limit for SHGs has been raised from ?10 lakh to ?20 lakh, PM Modi said.

A cruise ship with 4,400 people on board reported 27 COVID-19 cases just before it made a stop in Belize City this week, according to Belize Tourism Board. The positive cases were among 26 crew members and one passenger, who are all currently in isolation, on Carnival Vista, it added. All 27 were vaccinated against COVID-19, it further said.

China halted operations at Meishan terminal in the world's third-busiest cargo port on Wednesday after a fully-vaccinated worker contracted COVID-19. Nearly 2,000 frontline workers have been placed under "closed management" and cannot leave the port. The closed terminal at the Ningbo-Zhoushan port accounts for around 25% of container cargo through the port and handled 1.2 billion tonnes in 2020.

Sony Pictures has pushed the release of 'Venom: Let There Be Carnage', starring Tom Hardy, amid the surge in the COVID-19 cases in the US. The Andy Serkis directorial, which was scheduled to release on September 24 in the US, will now premiere on October 15. The upcoming film is a sequel to the 2018 film 'Venom'.

US Food and Drug Administration (FDA) amended the emergency use authorisations for both Pfizer-BioNTech and Moderna COVID-19 vaccines to allow for the use of an additional dose in certain immunocompromised individuals. The dose will be given to "solid organ transplant recipients or those who are diagnosed with conditions that are considered to have equivalent level of immunocompromise", FDA said.

Mumbai recorded its first death due to Delta Plus variant of COVID-19, BMC said. The deceased is a 63-year-old woman who had taken both the vaccine doses and died in July. Her death was found to have been caused by Delta Plus variant on August 11. "We conducted tracing of her contacts...two were detected with Delta Plus variant," BMC stated.

India has achieved the highest ever COVID-19 recovery rate of 97.46%, the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare tweeted on Friday. The country saw 40,120 new COVID-19 cases and 42,295 recoveries in the last 24 hours, the ministry said. Total COVID-19 deaths have reached 4,30,254 as 585 new deaths were recorded.

The Taliban has banned the COVID-19 vaccine in eastern Afghanistan's Paktia province, a report by a local news media organisation Shamshad News has said. The region was captured by the terror group last week when it allegedly removed Nishan Sahib from a gurdwara in the province. Half of Afghanistan's 34 provinces are now controlled by the Taliban.

Actress Zareen Khan opened up about her mother falling sick amid the COVID-19 pandemic and said, "If anything goes wrong with my mom, I can't function." She added, "I couldn't concentrate on anything else and was disconnected from my work. I didn't pay attention to any of it, anything that was happening work-wise at that time."

West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee said on Thursday in an apparent reference to PM Narendra Modi that he should "allow his photo on death certificates" as he has made it "mandatory that his photo should be there on COVID-19 vaccine certificates". "I may not like you. But even then, I would have to carry this," she added.

Facebook has postponed workers' return to the office until January next year due to concerns over a surge in the Delta variant of COVID-19. The company said this will apply to its US employees and those working in some other countries. "Data, not dates, is what drives our approach for returning to the office," Facebook added in a statement.

Airlines can now operate a maximum of 72.5% of their pre-COVID-19 domestic flights until further orders, the Ministry of Civil Aviation stated on Thursday. The capping has been increased from 65% capacity on which airlines were operating since July 5, according to the Ministry's order. The government had cut the limit to 50% in June amid the second COVID-19 wave.

India's first nasal COVID-19 vaccine, developed by Bharat Biotech, has been given the regulatory approval for conducting phase 2/3 clinical trials, the government said on Friday. "This is the first-of-its-kind COVID-19 jab to undergo human clinical trials in India," said a government release. Phase 1 clinical trial has been completed in the 18-60 years age group, it added.

Serum Institute of India's Chairman & MD Cyrus Poonawalla on Friday said his company can't launch Novavax's COVID-19 vaccine, Covovax, unless it gets a licence. "The parent American company has some issues with the US Food and Drug Administration (FDA), those should be cleared by the end of October. Once they...get a license then we'll get a license," he added.

A WHO team's official who investigated COVID-19 origins in China's Wuhan said he was 'concerned' about safety standards of a laboratory near the seafood market where the first cases were detected. In a documentary, Ben Embarek said the Chinese Center for Disease Control and Prevention was handling coronaviruses "without potentially having same level of expertise or safety or who knows".

Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike officials have said there is no steep rise in fresh coronavirus cases among children in Bengaluru. They said that most of the children who tested positive for the infection are primary contacts of COVID-positive adults. It comes after over 300 children below 19 years of age tested coronavirus positive in the past six days in Bengaluru.

China has rejected WHO's call for a renewed probe into the origin of COVID-19, saying it supported "scientific" over "political" efforts to find out how the virus started. This is the second time that China has rejected WHO's call for further probe into COVID-19 origin. In July, China said WHO's plan showed "disrespect for common sense and arrogance toward science".

Airbnb Inc on Thursday said its current-quarter bookings could be hit by the Delta variant and a slump in COVID-19 vaccination pace in the US. As a result, shares of the holiday home rental app fell by nearly 4.5% on the Nasdaq. Airbnb's Chief Financial Officer (CFO) Dave Stephenson said, "We have a combination of fewer bookings for the fall."

Hollywood actor Arnold Schwarzenegger recently criticised those who are not wearing a mask amid the ongoing COVID-19 pandemic. During an interview with CNN, Arnold said, "[Don't]...think about, 'Well my freedom is being...disturbed here.' No, screw your freedom...You're a schmuck for not wearing a mask. Because you are supposed to protect your fellow Americans around you."

Facebook has removed over 300 misinformation accounts from Facebook and Instagram that claimed COVID-19 vaccines from AstraZeneca and Pfizer would turn humans into chimpanzees. Facebook said that the accounts were from Russia that they linked to Fazze, a subsidiary of a UK-registered marketing firm. "This operation targeted audiences primarily in India, Latin America," Facebook added.

Serum Institute of India Chairman and MD Cyrus Poonawalla on Friday said that it's "very wrong to mix" COVID-19 vaccines. If anything misfires, "Serum will say that the other vaccine isn't good and they (other company) will blame us," he added. Earlier, India's drug regulator granted approval for a study on mixing of Serum Institute's Covishield and Bharat Biotech's Covaxin.

WHO expert Peter Ben Embarek who led a joint probe into origin of COVID-19 pandemic has said in a documentary that Chinese officials pressured COVID-19 origin investigators to drop Wuhan lab leak theory. He added that Chinese officials eventually agreed to discuss the theory in the report "on the condition we didn't recommend any specific studies to further that hypothesis".

Ex-General Than Shwe, who led Myanmar for nearly two decades as the head of a junta, has been hospitalised after testing positive for COVID-19. The 88-year-old was admitted to a military-owned medical facility in the capital Nay Pyi Taw as a precaution. He is being treated in a VIP section of the hospital under tight security, an employee said.

Speaking about working amid the ongoing COVID-19 pandemic, actor Akshay Kumar said, "I can't comment about others but I'm going about doing my business as usual." He added, "This has always been the way I've worked, doing an average of four films in a year." He also said, "I pick...subjects which I find entertaining and what excites me."

The Taliban has banned the COVID-19 vaccine in eastern Afghanistan's Paktia province, a report by a local news media organisation Shamshad News has said. The region was captured by the terror group last week when it allegedly removed Nishan Sahib from a gurdwara in the province. Half of Afghanistan's 34 provinces are now controlled by the Taliban.

The Chennai Super Kings (CSK) on Friday departed for UAE to play the remaining matches of the IPL 2021, which was suspended in May this year due to the COVID-19 outbreak inside the bio-bubble. The season will resume on September 19 with CSK playing against MI. CSK had won five of their seven games before the season was suspended.

Canada's Chief Public Health Officer Theresa Tam said, "The latest national surveillance data indicate that a fourth wave is underway in Canada and that cases are plotting along a strong resurgence trajectory." There are currently over 13,000 active coronavirus cases in Canada, more than double the number from late July. "Fortunately, the number of deaths remains low," Tam added.

Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike officials have said there is no steep rise in fresh coronavirus cases among children in Bengaluru. They said that most of the children who tested positive for the infection are primary contacts of COVID-positive adults. It comes after over 300 children below 19 years of age tested coronavirus positive in the past six days in Bengaluru.

Wrestler Vinesh Phogat, who has been temporarily suspended by Wrestling Federation of India over misbehaviour at Tokyo Olympics, said, "Everyone outside is treating me like I'm a dead thing." "They didn't even let me regret my loss...Everyone is ready with their knives," she added. She further said she didn't stay with Indian team as she feared infecting them with coronavirus.

A WHO team's official who investigated COVID-19 origins in China's Wuhan said he was 'concerned' about safety standards of a laboratory near the seafood market where the first cases were detected. In a documentary, Ben Embarek said the Chinese Center for Disease Control and Prevention was handling coronaviruses "without potentially having same level of expertise or safety or who knows".

India's first nasal COVID-19 vaccine, developed by Bharat Biotech, has been given the regulatory approval for conducting phase 2/3 clinical trials, the government said on Friday. "This is the first-of-its-kind COVID-19 jab to undergo human clinical trials in India," said a government release. Phase 1 clinical trial has been completed in the 18-60 years age group, it added.

The Bengaluru Urban district administration has banned the entry of public to temples on weekends and public holidays to contain the spread of COVID-19.  The rule will be applicable till September 7, the end of 'Shravan', J Manjunath, district Deputy Commissioner, Bengaluru Urban, said. Devotees will be allowed to enter temples on other days following COVID-19 guidelines by the government.

The Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike (BBMP) has collected a total of ?12.58 crore as fine from people for violating the COVID-19 guidelines between May 2020 and August 7, 2021. About ?11.86 crore fine was collected from over 4.93 lakh people for not wearing masks, while ?71.35 lakh fine was collected from those who did not maintain physical distancing.

More than 300 children below 19 years of age have tested positive for coronavirus in the past six days in Bengaluru. According to data by Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike (BBMP), 127 children below the age of 10 and about 174 children aged between 10 and 19 years were tested positive for the virus between August 5 and 10.

Japanese athlete Miu Goto will have her medal replaced with a fresh one after the mayor of her hometown was seen biting it amid COVID-19, Tokyo 2020 organisers said. Mayor Takashi Kawamura was criticised on social media for disregarding coronavirus etiquette. He had earlier apologised, saying, "I forgot my position as Nagoya mayor and acted in an extremely inappropriate way."

The Bombay High Court on Thursday said BMC was moving in the right direction as it has vaccinated one-fourth of the total registered bedridden persons against COVID-19. The court asked other civic bodies to follow BMC's model. On Tuesday, BMC said it has vaccinated 1,317 of the total 4,889 bedridden and immobile persons registered for home vaccination till August 9.

More than 300 children below 19 years of age have tested positive for coronavirus in the past six days in Bengaluru. According to data by Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike (BBMP), 127 children below the age of 10 and about 174 children aged between 10 and 19 years were tested positive for the virus between August 5 and 10.

India's daily COVID-19 cases crossed the 40,000-mark for the first time in six days as 41,195 people tested positive in the last 24 hours, according to Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. It further said that active cases (3,87,987) in the country constitute 1.21% of total cases. India's total cases reached 3,20,77,706 and the death toll surged to 4,29,669.

West Bengal on Thursday extended restrictions in view of the COVID-19 situation in the state till August 30. However, the night curfew time has been relaxed from 9 pm-5 am to 11 pm-5 am. "If we are able to vaccinate 50% of the population then we can resume the local train services," CM Mamata Banerjee stated.

The COVID-19 vaccination drive will remain suspended at all the civic and state-run centres in Mumbai on August 12 and August 13 due to a shortage of doses, the BMC said. The drive will resume on Saturday. The vaccine stock is expected to arrive by late Thursday, officials said. The drive has been suspended for the second time this month.

Neha Dhupia, while speaking about battling COVID-19 during her second pregnancy, said it was a "very scary" and "tough" time. The actress, who announced her second pregnancy last month, added she was away from her husband Angad Bedi. "I'd my mask on...whole day and...I would sleep on...ground in a certain position staying away from Mehr because I'm pregnant," said Neha.

California has become the first US state to require teachers and other school staff to be vaccinated or get regularly tested for COVID-19. "We think this is the right thing to do and...is a sustainable way to keeping our schools open and to address...number one anxiety that parents like myself have for young children," state's Governor Gavin Newsom said.

Rajasthan government has allowed re-opening of schools for classes 9-12 with 50% capacity from September 1. Teaching and non-teaching staff need to take at least one COVID-19 vaccine dose 14 days prior to this. Students can come to schools only after parents' written consent. Online classes would continue for those students whose parents don't wish to send them to schools.

The Bombay High Court on Thursday said it was encouraging to see that no adverse reaction was observed in bed-ridden beneficiaries, who received the COVID-19 vaccine under BMC's home vaccination programme. It added that other state civic bodies and district councils should follow the initiative. As many as 1,317 people have been vaccinated in door-to-door vaccination, BMC told Bombay HC.

California has become the first US state to require teachers and other school staff to be vaccinated or get regularly tested for COVID-19. "We think this is the right thing to do and...is a sustainable way to keeping our schools open and to address...number one anxiety that parents like myself have for young children," state's Governor Gavin Newsom said.

The COVID-19 vaccination drive will remain suspended at all the civic and state-run centres in Mumbai on August 12 and August 13 due to a shortage of doses, the BMC said. The drive will resume on Saturday. The vaccine stock is expected to arrive by late Thursday, officials said. The drive has been suspended for the second time this month.

Rajasthan government has allowed re-opening of schools for classes 9-12 with 50% capacity from September 1. Teaching and non-teaching staff need to take at least one COVID-19 vaccine dose 14 days prior to this. Students can come to schools only after parents' written consent. Online classes would continue for those students whose parents don't wish to send them to schools.

As many as 46 shops and street vendors at Sarojini Nagar market in Delhi have been asked to remain closed for two days for violating COVID-19 guidelines. The concerned market association president and the general secretary were sent a show-cause notice. The enforcement officers in Vasant Vihar found these shops violating the protocols on August 10, an official order said.

As part of preparations for the third wave, Karnataka CM Basavaraj Bommai announced that 50% of beds in the ICUs across the state hospitals will be converted into paediatric ICU beds. The state government is also implementing "Vatsalya" programme aimed to ensure the well-being of children during the time of COVID-19. Currently, there are 22,877 active COVID-19 cases in Karnataka.

Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman on Thursday said that public spending during the pandemic ensured that the core sector grew at 8.9%. Speaking at Confederation of Indian Industry's (CII) annual session, she further said that consumption has been given all the boost that is required. She added that foreign direct investment (FDI) has been flowing into the country nonstop.

The re-carpeting work on the runway at Pune International Airport is expected to continue beyond its October deadline. The airport isn't operating flights between 8 pm and 8 am due to this and the curbs are likely to continue. "Our effort is to complete it in a time-bound banner, but situations do arise because of COVID-19 pandemic," an official said.

Japanese athlete Miu Goto will have her medal replaced with a fresh one after the mayor of her hometown was seen biting it amid COVID-19, Tokyo 2020 organisers said. Mayor Takashi Kawamura was criticised on social media for disregarding coronavirus etiquette. He had earlier apologised, saying, "I forgot my position as Nagoya mayor and acted in an extremely inappropriate way."

The Bombay High Court on Thursday said it was encouraging to see that no adverse reaction was observed in bed-ridden beneficiaries, who received the COVID-19 vaccine under BMC's home vaccination programme. It added that other state civic bodies and district councils should follow the initiative. As many as 1,317 people have been vaccinated in door-to-door vaccination, BMC told Bombay HC.

The World Health Organization (WHO) said the US, India, Iran, Brazil and Indonesia reported the most number of COVID-19 cases last week. While India, Brazil and Indonesia witnessed a decline in infections from the previous week, the US recorded a 35% increase in new infections. The Delta variant was reported from seven additional countries last week, the WHO report said.

Mexico's Foreign Affairs Secretary, Marcelo Ebrard, said that US Vice President Kamala Harris has informed Mexican President Andr?s Manuel Lpez Obrador that America will send 85 lakh coronavirus vaccine doses to the country. Mexico is witnessing a third coronavirus wave as Delta variant continues to spread. The US will send AstraZeneca and Moderna coronavirus vaccines, Ebrard added.

The Kerala State Beverages Corporation (BEVCO) has mandated that people coming to purchase liquor should either be vaccinated partially or fully or carry a negative RT-PCR test certificate. This comes after Kerala High Court pulled up the state government on Tuesday over overcrowding in front of liquor outlets. Many liquor outlets on Wednesday pasted a four-point direction stating the order.

As many as 1,317 of the total 4,889 bedridden and immobile persons registered for home vaccination have been vaccinated against COVID-19 from July 30 to August 9, the Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) informed the Bombay High Court. It added that with this, more than one-fourth of the total registered bedridden persons have received their first dose of the COVID-19 vaccine.

A police investigation has found that a Red Cross nurse may have injected around 8,600 people with a saline solution instead of COVID-19 vaccine in Germany's Friesland. "I am totally shocked by this episode," Sven Ambrosy, a local councillor, said on Facebook as local authorities asked the residents, who may have been affected, to get another shot of COVID-19 vaccine.

Pune district authorities on Tuesday said that more than 300 vaccination centres have been shut down due to severe shortage of the Covishield coronavirus vaccine. The civic-run sites were mostly affected by the shortage, but the private hospitals still have enough doses of the vaccine, according to officials. Authorities expect a fresh batch of doses to arrive by Wednesday evening.

The Drugs Controller General of India (DCGI) has given approval for a study which will determine whether vaccine doses of Covishield and Covaxin can be mixed. The study will be done by Christian Medical College in Tamil Nadu's Vellore. Earlier, an Indian Council of Medical Research (ICMR) study conducted on 18 people said mixing the vaccines elicited better safety results.

Shares of Pfizer hit a record high on Tuesday for the first time in more than 20 years amid strong sales of its COVID-19 vaccine. Its shares surged as much as 6% to $48.57 on Tuesday, surpassing its previous intraday high of $47.44, reached in April 1999. Pfizer's vaccine garnered $7.8 billion in sales in the second quarter of 2021.

The Kerala State Beverages Corporation (BEVCO) has mandated that people coming to purchase liquor should either be vaccinated partially or fully or carry a negative RT-PCR test certificate. This comes after Kerala High Court pulled up the state government on Tuesday over overcrowding in front of liquor outlets. Many liquor outlets on Wednesday pasted a four-point direction stating the order.

People queued up outside Radha Soami Satsang Beas in Gurugram to get the COVID-19 vaccine. More than 50 people queued up on the road before 20 hours for the vaccination drive. "I have been coming here for some days. We are not being allowed at our jobs without vaccination. I'll have to wait here all night," a local said.

Under revised COVID-19 guidelines in Maharashtra, restaurants and shops can remain open till 10 pm everyday. Gyms and parlours can operate with 50% capacity till 10 pm. For weddings at indoor venues, 50% capacity or 100 guests (whichever is lesser) are allowed, while at outdoor venues, 50% capacity or 200 guests are permitted. Theatres and religious places will remain closed.

NITI Aayog (Health) member Dr VK Paul said that the government is looking deeply into the issue of giving COVID-19 vaccine booster dose. "We're watching the science for the need for such booster dose. WHO has called for a moratorium," he added. "Booster dose...whether there is a need for it...who will need it is a very relevant issue," Paul stated.

The Punjab government on Wednesday ordered to conduct at least 10,000 RT-PCR tests at state schools daily, after 26 students tested positive for coronavirus in the past two days. The schools reopened for all classes in the state from August 2. The government also asked deputy commissioners to ensure that only fully vaccinated staff is allowed to attend the schools.

Russia's COVID-19 vaccine, Sputnik V is around 83% effective against the Delta variant, Health Minister Mikhail Murashko said on Wednesday. Murashko reportedly added that the vaccine's efficacy against a severe course of the novel coronavirus infection surpasses 95%. However, the vaccine's developers in June had said that Sputnik V was around 90% effective against the Delta variant of COVID-19.

The cumulative COVID-19 vaccine coverage in the country has exceeded 51.90 crore, the Union Health Ministry said on Wednesday. The countrywide vaccination drive was rolled out on January 16 with healthcare workers getting inoculated and vaccination for frontline workers started from February 2. Currently, there are 3,86,351 active COVID-19 cases in the country.

Punjab CM Captain Amarinder Singh on Wednesday said, "Six deaths had occurred at a private hospital in Amritsar right in the beginning when there was an oxygen shortage." "Now, we produce 400 tonnes of oxygen. There's no problem now," he added. Earlier, the Centre said only one state reported a "suspected" death due to oxygen shortage during second COVID-19 wave.

Health Minister Mansukh Mandaviya said Delhi was asked to share data on deaths due to oxygen shortage amid COVID-19, however, it hadn't done so. "Here's the copy of...mail sent by my Ministry," he tweeted. This comes after Delhi Deputy CM Manish Sisodia alleged that Delhi government hadn't received any letter from Centre inquiring about deaths due to oxygen shortage.

Aamir Khan, during an event in Mumbai, said, "Some films are releasing on OTT platforms, and as a film person I am very concerned." "I hope in the near future things will improve," he added. Aamir also requested people to get vaccinated against COVID-19. "As more and more people get vaccinated things will get better," he further said.

The Uttar Pradesh government on Wednesday said the COVID-19 curfew will continue on Sunday in the state while adding that people can travel from 6 am-10 pm from Monday-Saturday starting August 14. The government also allowed coaching centres, which are outside containment zones, to resume services. However, these centres will remain closed on days when the curfew is imposed.

Uttar Pradesh CM Yogi Adityanath on Wednesday asked officials to consider partial relaxations in the closure of shops and markets on weekends. At a meeting to assess the COVID-19 situation in UP, Adityanath said the COVID-19 guidelines should be followed everywhere. There should be no unnecessary gathering of people anywhere, the Chief Minister directed officials.

Delhi recorded zero COVID-19 fatality and 37 new cases of infection on Wednesday, with the positivity rate declining to 0.06%, according to data shared by the health department. Forty-seven patients recovered in the last 24 hours, taking the total number of recoveries to 14,11,327 in the national capital. As many as 1,40,849 beneficiaries were vaccinated in the last 24 hours.

The Tamil Nadu Police on Wednesday booked 10 AIADMK legislators and three ex-MLAs for flouting COVID-19 norms and assembling in front of the residence of former minister SP Velumani. The AIADMK leaders had gathered to protest a raid against Velumani by the Directorate of Vigilance and Anti-Corruption (DAVC) on Tuesday. They were booked in three separate cases.

Actress Supriya Pilgaonkar has said shooting amid the COVID-19 pandemic is difficult because many agencies and people are involved in it. "We can take all the precautions but can't say what happens next. I've left it (on God) now," she added. Supriya also revealed that she contracted the virus despite adhering to all safety measures.

Maharashtra Health Minister Rajesh Tope today said a lockdown will be reimposed in the state if the daily need for medical oxygen surpasses 700 MT. He added that Maharashtra might require 3,800 MT of oxygen during third COVID-19 wave's peak. "As other states may also need oxygen...it's not clear if we can get what we need from Centre," he added.

ITC has said that the COVID-19 crisis was far from over but the Indian economy holds promise. "During the second wave, the local lockdowns and restrictions once again posed challenges," ITC's Chairman and MD Sanjiv Puri said. "The recovery over the last couple of months is encouraging, though the possibility of subsequent waves creates near-term uncertainties," he added.

As many as 99.88% of people in the Pune district administered with COVID-19 vaccine, did not contract the virus after vaccination, according to a report by the district administration. Out of total 63 lakh people who were vaccinated, 7,636 contracted COVID-19, which is 0.12%. Out of 16.4 lakh people who received both doses, 2,170 were infected.

Maharashtra government has allowed operations of hotels and restaurants till 10 pm from August 15. The restaurants can function at 50% capacity, while only people who have been vaccinated with both doses of a COVID-19 vaccine will be allowed inside shopping malls. Fully vaccinated passengers can travel in local trains 14 days after their second dose.

India is in talks to acquire 5 crore doses of Pfizer's COVID-19 vaccine, The Wall Street Journal reported on Wednesday. The country is also expecting to receive about 70 lakh doses of a vaccine made by Moderna from the US through COVAX, it added. Authorities are also in an advanced stage of negotiations with J&J, the WSJ said.

The Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) said it will set up 358 help desks at 53 railway stations in Mumbai to facilitate offline verification of vaccination certificates. The facility will be available from Wednesday. This comes as the Maharashtra government has allowed fully vaccinated people against COVID-19 to travel in the local trains from August 15.

Mexico's Foreign Affairs Secretary, Marcelo Ebrard, said that US Vice President Kamala Harris has informed Mexican President Andr?s Manuel Lpez Obrador that America will send 85 lakh coronavirus vaccine doses to the country. Mexico is witnessing a third coronavirus wave as Delta variant continues to spread. The US will send AstraZeneca and Moderna coronavirus vaccines, Ebrard added.

NITI Aayog (Health) member Dr VK Paul said that the government is looking deeply into the issue of giving COVID-19 vaccine booster dose. "We're watching the science for the need for such booster dose. WHO has called for a moratorium," he added. "Booster dose...whether there is a need for it...who will need it is a very relevant issue," Paul stated.

NGOs in the country received over ?49,000 crore in foreign funds in the last three years, Minister of State for Home Affairs Nityanand Rai informed the Rajya Sabha. The foreign contributions were received by over 18,000 NGOs. "In view of COVID-19...the Foreign Contribution Regulation Act (FCRA) NGOs were allowed to receive [foreign contributions] in their old FCRA accounts," he added.

As many as 1,317 of the total 4,889 bedridden and immobile persons registered for home vaccination have been vaccinated against COVID-19 from July 30 to August 9, the Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) informed the Bombay High Court. It added that with this, more than one-fourth of the total registered bedridden persons have received their first dose of the COVID-19 vaccine.

Thailand police fired tear gas, rubber bullets and water cannons to disperse protesters who took to the streets of Bangkok on Tuesday to demonstrate against the government's failure to handle the COVID-19 pandemic.  At least six police officers were injured during the clashes. This is the second time in four days that police and anti-government protesters have clashed.

Malaysian singer Siti Sarah Raisuddin passed away aged 36 due to COVID-19 just days after giving birth to a baby boy in induced coma. Siti, her husband and three children tested positive for COVID-19 in late July. Her family tested negative after a 14-day quarantine, but she was rushed to the hospital last Wednesday due to her low oxygen levels.

Shares of Pfizer hit a record high on Tuesday for the first time in more than 20 years amid strong sales of its COVID-19 vaccine. Its shares surged as much as 6% to $48.57 on Tuesday, surpassing its previous intraday high of $47.44, reached in April 1999. Pfizer's vaccine garnered $7.8 billion in sales in the second quarter of 2021.

Kerala may witness around 4.6 lakh COVID-19 cases from August 1-20, the central team that visited eight districts of Kerala said. The unlocking of activities, the Onam festival and reopening of the tourism sector in Kerala pose challenges, the team added. Kerala accounted for more than half of the COVID-19 cases in India in the seven days, the Centre said.

A police investigation has found that a Red Cross nurse may have injected around 8,600 people with a saline solution instead of COVID-19 vaccine in Germany's Friesland. "I am totally shocked by this episode," Sven Ambrosy, a local councillor, said on Facebook as local authorities asked the residents, who may have been affected, to get another shot of COVID-19 vaccine.

Listed Indian banks recast loans worth over ?1 lakh crore under the first round of the RBI's one-time debt restructuring scheme announced in August 2020. Restructured corporate loans stood at ?68,897 crore, or more than twice the retail loans recast. Experts said the total restructured amount was lower than estimated since measures like loan moratorium "helped borrowers regularise their loans".

The Bangalore Metropolitan Transport Corporation (BMTC) will receive 90 mini electric buses by December this year. The transport body will get its first mini electric bus in September. JBM Auto Limited, an automobile manufacturing company based in Haryana, was supposed to deliver the e-buses by June this year, but manufacturing and supply were disrupted due to the COVID-19 pandemic.

Australia's second-largest city Melbourne on Wednesday extended a COVID-19 lockdown for another seven days. The lockdown was extended after Victoria state reported 20 new COVID-19 cases on Wednesday, including several "mystery" cases. "There are too many cases, the origins of which are not clear to us...for us to safely come out of lockdown," Victoria state Premier Daniel Andrews said.

Robin Hood Army, a volunteer-based organisation has joined hands with WhatsApp, Uber and Google to help vaccinate 1.5 lakh Indians and serve 5 million meals by this Independence Day. The #mission28states initiative is a national effort across 28 states in which RHA volunteers shall bring together civic society to address key challenges of hunger and vaccine hesitancy.

As many as 99.88% of people in the Pune district administered with COVID-19 vaccine, did not contract the virus after vaccination, according to a report by the district administration. Out of total 63 lakh people who were vaccinated, 7,636 contracted COVID-19, which is 0.12%. Out of 16.4 lakh people who received both doses, 2,170 were infected.

Delhi BJP President Adesh Gupta has asked all the mayors to withdraw the commercial tax raised by the corporations earlier this year. He said the decision was taken as people and traders were facing hardships due to COVID-19. Gupta also advised the mayors to withdraw the increase in sanitation charges along with factory license, trade license and commercial property tax.

The Himachal Pradesh government has announced the closure of all schools except residential schools across the state till August 22 amid a surge in the number of COVID-19 cases. However, teaching and non-teaching staff will continue to attend the school. The state will also allow inter-state, inter-district and intra-district movement of public transport buses with 50% capacity from August 13.

India has reported 38,353 new COVID-19 cases and 497 deaths in the last 24 hours. This comes a day after the country reported 28,204 cases and 373 deaths. Kerala accounted for 55% of the new cases as the state reported 21,119 cases on Tuesday. The total number of cases in India reached 3,20,36,511, while death toll surged to 4,29,179.

Mexico's Foreign Affairs Secretary, Marcelo Ebrard, said that US Vice President Kamala Harris has informed Mexican President Andr?s Manuel Lpez Obrador that America will send 85 lakh coronavirus vaccine doses to the country. Mexico is witnessing a third coronavirus wave as Delta variant continues to spread. The US will send AstraZeneca and Moderna coronavirus vaccines, Ebrard added.

Russia's COVID-19 vaccine, Sputnik V is around 83% effective against the Delta variant, Health Minister Mikhail Murashko said on Wednesday. Murashko reportedly added that the vaccine's efficacy against a severe course of the novel coronavirus infection surpasses 95%. However, the vaccine's developers in June had said that Sputnik V was around 90% effective against the Delta variant of COVID-19.

The Punjab government on Wednesday ordered to conduct at least 10,000 RT-PCR tests at state schools daily, after 26 students tested positive for coronavirus in the past two days. The schools reopened for all classes in the state from August 2. The government also asked deputy commissioners to ensure that only fully vaccinated staff is allowed to attend the schools.

Pune district authorities on Tuesday said that more than 300 vaccination centres have been shut down due to severe shortage of the Covishield coronavirus vaccine. The civic-run sites were mostly affected by the shortage, but the private hospitals still have enough doses of the vaccine, according to officials. Authorities expect a fresh batch of doses to arrive by Wednesday evening.

The cumulative COVID-19 vaccine coverage in the country has exceeded 51.90 crore, the Union Health Ministry said on Wednesday. The countrywide vaccination drive was rolled out on January 16 with healthcare workers getting inoculated and vaccination for frontline workers started from February 2. Currently, there are 3,86,351 active COVID-19 cases in the country.

Murashko reportedly added that the vaccine's efficacy against a severe course of the novel coronavirus infection surpasses 95%. However, the vaccine's developers in June had said that Sputnik V was around 90% effective against the Delta variant of COVID-19.

India is in talks to acquire 5 crore doses of Pfizer's COVID-19 vaccine, The Wall Street Journal reported on Wednesday. The country is also expecting to receive about 70 lakh doses of a vaccine made by Moderna from the US through COVAX, it added. Authorities are also in an advanced stage of negotiations with J&J, the WSJ said.

The Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) on Wednesday began issuing the monthly local train passes to the fully vaccinated people against COVID-19, at 53 stations. The civic body has started an offline verification process for fully vaccinated people. This comes as Mumbai is set to resume local train services for the people who have received both doses, from August 15.

People queued up outside Radha Soami Satsang Beas in Gurugram to get the COVID-19 vaccine. More than 50 people queued up on the road before 20 hours for the vaccination drive. "I have been coming here for some days. We are not being allowed at our jobs without vaccination. I'll have to wait here all night," a local said.

Maharashtra government has allowed operations of hotels and restaurants till 10 pm from August 15. The restaurants can function at 50% capacity, while only people who have been vaccinated with both doses of a COVID-19 vaccine will be allowed inside shopping malls. Fully vaccinated passengers can travel in local trains 14 days after their second dose.

The government on Tuesday shared a snapshot of state-wise active COVID-19 cases in India and listed the nine states that have above 10,000 active cases. Kerala is the only state with over one lakh active cases (1,77,091 cases). Other states with over 10,000 active cases are Maharashtra, Karnataka, Tamil Nadu, Andhra Pradesh, Mizoram, Assam, West Bengal and Odisha.

Google employees based in the same office before the COVID-19 pandemic could see different pays if they switch to permanent work from home, Reuters reported, citing the company's pay calculator. Reuters said that interviews with Google employees indicate pay cuts as high as 25% in the US. "Our compensation packages have always been determined by location," a Google spokesperson said.

Delhi reported 52 fresh COVID-19 cases and one new fatality in the last 24 hours. As per the data shared by the health department, 45 patients recovered in the last 24 hours, taking the total number of recoveries to 14,11,280. On Monday, Delhi?s active cases dropped below the 500-mark for the first time since April last year.

Delhi government on Tuesday said the central government has not yet asked them for data regarding oxygen shortage related deaths in the city during the COVID-19 second wave. Delhi Deputy CM Manish Sisodia accused the Centre of not showing seriousness towards the oxygen crisis. Sisodia added that they have decided to share all the details with the central government.

Government has named 37 districts reporting an increasing trend in daily new COVID-19 cases during the last 2 weeks. While the highest number is from Kerala with 11 districts that are seeing an increasing trend, Tamil Nadu comes second with 7 districts. Districts from Himachal Pradesh, Karnataka, Andhra Pradesh, Maharashtra, West Bengal, Meghalaya and Mizoram are also in the list.

Dr Shi Zhengli, China's Wuhan Institute of Virology's scientist who's also known as 'bat woman', has said new variants of coronavirus would continue to occur as an increasing number of infections provide more opportunities for the virus to mutate. "We shouldn't panic, but we need to prepare to co-exist with the virus in the long term," she added.

The government has shared a map showing 44 districts in India reporting high positivity rate of over 10%. Out of the 44 districts, 10 each are from Kerala and Manipur, six are from Mizoram and five are from Arunachal Pradesh. Himachal Pradesh's Lahaul And Spiti, West Bengal's Kalimpong and Rajasthan's Churu and Sirohi are also included on the list.

Anti-vaccine protestors attempting to target BBC's news operation, holding it responsible for promoting COVID-19 vaccines, stormed a wrong building in UK's London. The broadcaster had moved out of the building almost a decade ago. Videos and pictures showed protestors trying to enter the building and clashing with police in the process.

The US State Department and Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) have advised Americans to avoid all travel to France amid rising coronavirus cases in the country. "If you must travel to France, make sure you are fully vaccinated before travel," the CDC said. The US' health protection agency also warned against travel to Israel, Thailand and Iceland.

Bangladesh began vaccinating over 65,000 Rohingya refugees above the age of 55 in the first phase of an effort to inoculate the nearly 9,00,000 refugees. About 500 Bangladesh Red Crescent Society staff and volunteers joined health workers for the campaign in collaboration with the UN refugee agency. Around 20,000 cases and 200 deaths have been recorded among refugees so far.

The Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike (BBMP) will launch a programme on August 16 which will involve doctors visiting every house in the city to screen for coronavirus, Karnataka Revenue Minister R Ashoka said on Monday. An app has been developed for this wherein the patients would be screened for symptoms and co-morbidities. Bengaluru recorded 296 daily cases on Monday.

The Central government has not taken any decision to prepare the National Register of Indian Citizens (NRIC) at the national level, MoS Home Affairs Nityanand Rai said. He added, "The Citizenship (Amendment) Act, 2019 has been notified on December 12, 2019...However, due to the outbreak of COVID-19, the updation of NPR and other related field activities have been postponed."

Anti-vaccine protestors attempting to target BBC's news operation, holding it responsible for promoting COVID-19 vaccines, stormed a wrong building in UK's London. The broadcaster had moved out of the building almost a decade ago. Videos and pictures showed protestors trying to enter the building and clashing with police in the process.

The Kerala High Court on Tuesday questioned the state government for not including liquor shops or bars under the new COVID-19 norms which require at least one dose of vaccination or a negative RT-PCR test to visit shops. "It's baffling, surprising, incongruous...If getting vaccinated is a requirement for buying alcohol...more people would opt for it," the court observed.

PM Narendra Modi's picture and statement are printed on COVID-19 vaccine certificates for "creating awareness", the government said on Tuesday. PM's picture and remark are for making people aware of the "importance of following COVID-19 appropriate behaviour even after vaccination, in the larger public interest", Union Minister of State for Health Bharati Pravin Pawar has said.

The district administration in Pune has urged private hospitals to lend it COVID-19 vaccines to speed up the vaccination drive. "We will return a fresh stock of vaccines as per their requirements from September 1," Pune Zilla Parishad CEO Ayush Prasad said. He added that Pune has been a great example of partnership between local administration, government and private hospitals.

Actress Aahana Kumra, who's shooting for a film in London, spoke about working amid the coronavirus pandemic and said she's "excited and very anxious" because the cases are rising everywhere. She added that people are not wearing masks in London. "But I will make sure that I do wear it all the time," Aahana further said.

Haryana CM Manohar Lal Khattar on Tuesday announced that women and children up to 15 years of age can travel for free in state-run buses on Raksha Bandhan. "Due to COVID-19 situation, buses will operate at 50% capacity," a statement from his office read. Those travelling in buses will have to wear face masks and follow COVID-appropriate behaviour.

The Delhi government on Monday issued an order saying that pregnant and breastfeeding women can be vaccinated against COVID-19 at the health facilities where they report for regular check-ups. "The medical officer and the vaccinator are already present in the health facility along with the vaccines, as these centres also serve as cold chain points," the order said.

PM Narendra Modi's picture and statement are printed on COVID-19 vaccine certificates for "creating awareness", the government said on Tuesday. PM's picture and remark are for making people aware of the "importance of following COVID-19 appropriate behaviour even after vaccination, in the larger public interest", Union Minister of State for Health Bharati Pravin Pawar has said.

Twitter has temporarily suspended US Representative for Georgia Marjorie Taylor Greene's account after she said that COVID-19 vaccines are "failing" and that they "do not reduce the spread of the virus". Greene's tweet remains up on her Twitter feed paired with a misinformation warning. Her account has been frozen due to "repeated violations" of Twitter's platform rules, the platform said.

The government has approved a vaccine manufacturing facility for the production of Bharat Biotech's Covaxin in Ankleshwar, Gujarat, Union Health Minister Mansukh Mandaviya said on Tuesday. "Following PM Narendra Modiji's vision of #SabkoVaccineMuftVaccine (free vaccine for all), this will increase vaccine availability and accelerate the world?s largest vaccine drive," Mandaviya tweeted.

The district administration in Pune has urged private hospitals to lend it COVID-19 vaccines to speed up the vaccination drive. "We will return a fresh stock of vaccines as per their requirements from September 1," Pune Zilla Parishad CEO Ayush Prasad said. He added that Pune has been a great example of partnership between local administration, government and private hospitals.

A health supervisor posted at a Primary Health Centre (PHC) in Uttar Pradesh's Varanasi was arrested for allegedly giving fake COVID-19 vaccine injections to people. The accused would charge up to ?50 for it, police said. Dexona (anti-allergic injection) and Aciloc (an injection for gastric trouble) injections were found in the accused's possession, PHC Superintendent Harish Chandra Maurya said.

The Pentagon on Monday said it'd seek to make COVID-19 vaccines mandatory for all military members by mid-September. The deadline could be pushed up if the vaccines get full approval from the US Food and Drug Administration before or infection rates continue to rise, Defense Secretary Lloyd Austin said. US President Joe Biden said he "strongly" supported the Pentagon's decision.

The Pune Municipal Corporation is conducting an at-home COVID-19 vaccination campaign for bedridden people who are likely to remain in the same condition for the next six months.
