Eligible persons will be informed about the date and time of vaccination after verification of all documents. "Through this campaign, patients will be given a dose of Covaxin," Mayor Murlidhar Mohol said.

The Pune Municipal Corporation is conducting an at-home COVID-19 vaccination campaign for bedridden people who are likely to remain in the same condition for the next six months. Eligible persons will be informed about the date and time of vaccination after verification of all documents. "Through this campaign, patients will be given a dose of Covaxin," Mayor Murlidhar Mohol said.

Canada on Monday opened its border to fully vaccinated American tourists for the first time in 16 months, causing long queues at border checkpoints. The country had barred all leisure travel from the US in March 2020 due to the COVID-19 pandemic. The reopening of the borders comes as new COVID-19 cases and hospitalisations in US hit a six-month high.

The government on Tuesday listed five states in India where the COVID-19 reproduction number (Rt) is currently above one. Of these, Rt of Punjab and Himachal Pradesh is highest at 1.3 while Gujarat, Madhya Pradesh and Uttar Pradesh's Rt stands at 1.1. The COVID-19 reproduction number indicates the average number of new infections an infected person can generate.

India has reported 28,204 new COVID-19 cases and 373 deaths in the last 24 hours, according to the government. This is the lowest rise in the number of daily cases in the last 147 days. India's active caseload stands at 3,88,508, the lowest in 139 days. The total number of cases reached 3,19,98,158, while the death toll surged to 4,28,682.

The Pentagon on Monday said it'd seek to make COVID-19 vaccines mandatory for all military members by mid-September. The deadline could be pushed up if the vaccines get full approval from the US Food and Drug Administration before or infection rates continue to rise, Defense Secretary Lloyd Austin said. US President Joe Biden said he "strongly" supported the Pentagon's decision.

Arrangements will be made at 65 railway stations in Mumbai, where QR code-based passes will be issued to people who are fully vaccinated against COVID-19, city Mayor Kishori Pednekar said on Tuesday. "Citizens should not indulge in altercations, as long queues are likely at ticket counters," she added. "People should cooperate and follow the COVID-19 norms," Pednekar further said.

Actress Aahana Kumra, who's shooting for a film in London, spoke about working amid the coronavirus pandemic and said she's "excited and very anxious" because the cases are rising everywhere. She added that people are not wearing masks in London. "But I will make sure that I do wear it all the time," Aahana further said.

Only one state has reported a "suspected" death due to oxygen shortage during second COVID-19 wave, the Centre said. "States were asked about deaths related to oxygen shortage. One state informed us about a suspected case. States that sent us reports...haven't told us that they've specifically reported a death due to oxygen (shortage)," said Health Ministry Joint Secretary Lav Agarwal.

Canada has extended its ban on all direct passenger flights from India until September 21 based on the advice from its public health agency amid risks posed by COVID-19 pandemic. "Passengers who depart India to Canada via an indirect route will continue to be required to obtain a valid COVID-19 pre-departure test from a third country," the Canadian government said.

Goa government has extended the state-level curfew for another week with the same conditions and relaxations to contain the spread of COVID-19. Chief Minister Pramod Sawant said the curfew will remain in place as long as the positivity rate does not fall. In its last order, the government allowed bars and restaurants to operate at 50% capacity till 11 pm.

During the surveillance of travellers coming to Gautam Buddha Nagar, the administration found two persons, one from Assam and the other from Odisha, who tested positive for COVID-19. They've been put in isolation and their contacts are being traced and tested, officials said. As many as 26 of the 28 travellers traced since August 1 have tested negative, they added.

The Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike (BBMP) will launch a programme on August 16 which will involve doctors visiting every house in the city to screen for coronavirus, Karnataka Revenue Minister R Ashoka said on Monday. An app has been developed for this wherein the patients would be screened for symptoms and co-morbidities. Bengaluru recorded 296 daily cases on Monday.

The Delhi government has waived custody charges on vehicles impounded by Transport Department and Traffic Police, which couldn't be bailed out by their owners. The relaxation has been given till September 30, in view of the COVID-19 situation. Vehicles impounded for violating Motor Vehicles Act are slapped with custody charges if their owners don't get them released within 48 hours.

The Delhi government on Monday issued an order saying that pregnant and breastfeeding women can be vaccinated against COVID-19 at the health facilities where they report for regular check-ups. "The medical officer and the vaccinator are already present in the health facility along with the vaccines, as these centres also serve as cold chain points," the order said.

China on Tuesday reported 108 new domestic coronavirus cases in the past 24 hours, the highest single-day jump in cases since the current outbreak began in July, the National Health Commission said. China also reported 35 imported cases and 38 asymptomatic infections during the same period, it added. China's latest outbreak is mainly driven by the Delta variant, officials said.

The Centre on Tuesday said Kerala reported over half of the total COVID-19 cases recorded in India in the past seven days. An official said 37 districts across nine states, including Kerala (11) and Tamil Nadu (seven), were showing a rising trend in daily new COVID-19 cases over the last two weeks. Kerala on Tuesday reported 21,119 new COVID-19 cases.

Twitter has temporarily suspended US Representative for Georgia Marjorie Taylor Greene's account after she said that COVID-19 vaccines are "failing" and that they "do not reduce the spread of the virus". Greene's tweet remains up on her Twitter feed paired with a misinformation warning. Her account has been frozen due to "repeated violations" of Twitter's platform rules, the platform said.

Spectators attending Premier League matches are set to face random spot checks of their COVID-19 status at some stadiums in the opening weeks of the 2021-2022 season. Ticket holders should be prepared to provide proof of full vaccination or a negative lateral flow test result within 48 hours before the match via the NHS COVID Pass, the Premier League said.

A health supervisor posted at a Primary Health Centre (PHC) in Uttar Pradesh's Varanasi was arrested for allegedly giving fake COVID-19 vaccine injections to people. The accused would charge up to ?50 for it, police said. Dexona (anti-allergic injection) and Aciloc (an injection for gastric trouble) injections were found in the accused's possession, PHC Superintendent Harish Chandra Maurya said.

The US State Department and Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) have advised Americans to avoid all travel to France amid rising coronavirus cases in the country. "If you must travel to France, make sure you are fully vaccinated before travel," the CDC said. The US' health protection agency also warned against travel to Israel, Thailand and Iceland.

Union Minister Rajeev Chandrasekhar while addressing a webinar said Bengaluru and its citizens coped well with the challenges posed by COVID-19. Organised on the theme of COVID-19 third wave, Chandrasekhar urged people to "move to the new normal". He said that the second wave was "ferocious and took everyone by surprise", citizens must be careful to prevent a third wave.

The number of active coronavirus containment zones in Bengaluru increased by about 47% in the 10 days till August 8, according to data released by the city's civic body. On July 30, the number of active containment zones was 108, which rose to 159 on August 8. Mahadevpura has the maximum number of active containment zones at 42.

China has fired or given other punishments to more than 30 officials over accusations that they failed to effectively respond to the latest surge of coronavirus infections. Among those fired were a vice mayor, heads of city districts and health commissions, staff in hospital management, airport and tourism departments. The Delta COVID-19 variant is behind the latest rise in cases.

Emcure Pharmaceuticals Founder and CEO Satish Mehta has said that the firm is on track to deliver six crore doses of country's first mRNA COVID-19 vaccine by the end of 2021. "Right now we are in Phase 1. We are very satisfied with the primary outcome of safety," he added. The vaccine is being developed by Emcure's subsidiary Gennova.

Malayalam actress Saranya Sasi, who was fighting brain tumour for 10 years, passed away aged 35 on Monday in Thiruvananthapuram. The actress was reportedly diagnosed with cancer in 2012 and had undergone 11 major surgeries. She had reportedly recovered from COVID-19 and was recently rushed to the hospital due to low sodium levels in the blood and pneumonia.

The Indira Gandhi International Airport in Delhi has set up a rapid PCR testing booth for passengers who need to carry COVID-19 reports to their destinations, especially to the United Arab Emirates. The testing facility will have about 50 rapid PCR machines. The cost per test will be ?5,000 and the reports will be available within 45 to 60 minutes.

Haryana on Monday lifted the night curfew imposed in the state "with immediate effect" till 5 am on August 23. The night curfew was earlier imposed from 11 pm till 5 am amid COVID-19. The state government has also issued orders to cap gatherings at district/ sub-divisional level Independence Day celebrations to 1,000 people with COVID-19 protocols.

Police have registered an FIR against Samajwadi Party MLA Abu Asim Azmi and 17 others for allegedly violating COVID-19 guidelines while celebrating the legislator's birthday in Mumbai's Shivaji Nagar area. "No social distancing was maintained and many of them were found not wearing mask," an officer said. Police have also seized a sword from one of the party workers.

A survey conducted in Tamil Nadu by the Directorate of Public Health and Preventive Medicine showed that vaccine hesitancy was highest among those aged over 60 at 27.6% of the population. Among the reasons for hesitancy, lack of information on where to get vaccinated ranked first at 59.9%. Fear of complications after vaccination ranked second at 57.6%, the survey revealed.

China has fired or given other punishments to more than 30 officials over accusations that they failed to effectively respond to the latest surge of coronavirus infections. Among those fired were a vice mayor, heads of city districts and health commissions, staff in hospital management, airport and tourism departments. The Delta COVID-19 variant is behind the latest rise in cases.

PM Narendra Modi on Monday condemned the "ghastly attack" on St Vincent and the Grenadines PM Ralph Gonsalves and said that he will be missed at the United Nations Security Council (UNSC) Open Debate on Maritime Security. Gonsalves was injured during an anti-vaccine mandate protest after he was reportedly hit on the head with a stone last week.

Saudi Arabia's Ministry of Hajj and Umrah has announced that it will begin receiving requests for Umrah pilgrimage from various countries for people who have been vaccinated against coronavirus from today, the state news agency reported. People from countries that Saudi Arabia includes on its entry-ban list will require to undergo institutional quarantine, the ministry said.

Emcure Pharmaceuticals Founder and CEO Satish Mehta has said that the firm is on track to deliver six crore doses of country's first mRNA COVID-19 vaccine by the end of 2021. "Right now we are in Phase 1. We are very satisfied with the primary outcome of safety," he added. The vaccine is being developed by Emcure's subsidiary Gennova.

The government on Monday said it has decided to allow foreign nationals residing in India to get registered on CoWIN to get the COVID-19 vaccine. "They can use their passport as identity document for the purpose of registration on the CoWIN portal. Once they are registered on this portal, they will get a slot for vaccination," said the Health Ministry.

As the COVID-19 restrictions have been relaxed in Pune, Maharashtra Deputy CM Ajit Pawar said the curbs will be reimposed if COVID-19 cases increase. "The day the positivity rate goes beyond 7%, all the restriction rules will come into force again," said Pawar. He added, the number of patients increased in the second wave when restrictions were lifted.

The Supreme Court on Monday issued a notice to the Centre on a PIL seeking disclosure of clinical trial data of COVID-19 vaccines approved in India. The court, however, said it didn't want to send a signal it didn't trust the vaccines' efficacy amid vaccine hesitancy. The plea was filed by a former member of an expert government advisory committee.

The government on Monday said it has decided to allow foreign nationals residing in India to get registered on CoWIN to get the COVID-19 vaccine. "They can use their passport as identity document for the purpose of registration on the CoWIN portal. Once they are registered on this portal, they will get a slot for vaccination," said the Health Ministry.

Tokyo Olympics organisers on Monday reported 28 new Games-related COVID-19 cases, none of them were athletes. The new cases included 13 contractors, six Games-concerned personnels, six volunteers, two Tokyo employees and one from media. Since the Games-related testing began on July 1, a total of 458 people have been infected by the virus, including 29 athletes.

Kerala General Education Minister V Sivankutty on Monday said the state will consider reopening of schools in a phased manner after complete COVID-19 vaccination of children and taking approval from the Centre. He added that digital and online classes weren't a permanent solution. Sivankutty said there're various protocols of the Centre and state government to be followed in this matter.

Actors including Ajay Devgn, Farhan Akhtar, Saif Ali Khan, Sara Ali Khan and Shilpa Shetty will come together for a global fundraiser on Facebook on this Independence Day, that is expected to unlock philanthropic donations upwards of ?25 crores for Covid-19 relief work. They will support livelihoods in India after the devastation caused by the second wave of the pandemic.

Communal slogans were allegedly raised at an event organised under the 'Bharat Jodo Movement' by BJP leader Ashwini Upadhyay at Delhi's Jantar Mantar on Sunday. Delhi Police said there was no permission for the event which saw thousands of people in violation of COVID-19 norms. Police on Monday filed an FIR in connection with inflammatory slogans raised during the event.

India has reported 35,499 new COVID-19 cases and 447 deaths in the last 24 hours. Kerala reported over 52% of the total new cases in the country as the state recorded 18,607 COVID-19 cases on Sunday. With this, India's total COVID-19 cases reached 3,19,69,954, while the death toll surged to 4,28,309. The country's active caseload currently stands at 4,02,188.

After police registered an FIR against Samajwadi Party (SP) MLA Abu Asim Azmi for allegedly violating COVID-19 guidelines, he said, "Following PM...who doesn't take precautions himself...I requested everyone to follow COVID-19 norms." The FIR was registered against 17 others along with Azmi for violating the norms while celebrating the legislator's birthday in Mumbai's Shivaji Nagar area.

A group of students from Bengaluru raised ?3.3 lakh to buy medical equipment for Primary Healthcare Centres (PHCs) in rural areas amid pandemic. Under the project, started by welfare organisation Bellandur Jothege, Class 11 students from Indus International School gave COVID-19 medical kits in Anekal taluk. Oxygen concentrators, oximeters and N95 masks, among others, were donated with the money.

The Supreme Court on Monday issued a notice to the Centre on a PIL seeking disclosure of clinical trial data of COVID-19 vaccines approved in India. The court, however, said it didn't want to send a signal it didn't trust the vaccines' efficacy amid vaccine hesitancy. The plea was filed by a former member of an expert government advisory committee.

Tesla has told its Nevada battery factory workers that they will be required to wear a mask indoors starting August 9 amid rising COVID-19 cases, regardless of vaccination status, The Wall Street Journal reported. The plant's workers had previously been required to wear a mask if they were not vaccinated. Amazon has also made masks mandatory for US employees.

BJP National General Secretary Tarun Chugh on Sunday tweeted, "How can Corona harm Madhya Pradesh where state president is Vishnu and Chief Minister is Shiv." Shivraj Singh Chouhan is Madhya Pradesh's CM and Vishnu Dutt is the state BJP chief. Reacting to his statement, state Congress spokesperson Bhupendra Gupta said "Were the two leaders sleeping when COVID-19 was wreaking havoc?"

Delhi reported 39 new COVID-19 cases and one death in the last 24 hours. As per the data shared by the health department, with 498 active cases, this is the first time since April last year that active cases have dropped below 500 in the national capital. The overall infection tally stands at 14,36,800 in Delhi.

New Zealand plans to reopen its borders due to a shortage of workers amid fears over a rise in inflation. The situation emerged after New Zealand restricted entry from abroad in 2020 as part of a strategy to curb the spread of COVID-19. The dairy, horticulture, housing, services, health and broader public sector have all reported acute staff shortages.

Japan PM Yoshihide Suga on Monday said the country has fulfilled its "responsibility" as host nation of the Tokyo Olympics. "I would like to express my sincere appreciation to the Japanese people for their understanding and cooperation," he added. This year the Games were held with COVID-19 induced restrictions and almost all sports were played without spectators.

Karnataka reported 1,598 new COVID-19 cases and 20 more deaths in the last 24 hours, according to a bulletin issued by the state health department on Sunday. The state's daily COVID-19 positivity rate stood at 1.09% and the number of active cases was 23,930. The state had reported 1,610 COVID-19 cases and 32 deaths on Saturday.

Kerala on Sunday reported 18,607 new cases of COVID-19 and 93 deaths, pushing the total till date to 35,52,525 and 17,747 respectively. Since Saturday, over 20,000 people have been cured of the infection. The total number of those who have recovered till date were 33,57,687 and the number of active cases were 1,76,572, an official press release said.

Mumbai local train services will start from August 15 for people who have taken both doses of COVID-19 vaccine, Maharashtra Chief Minister Uddhav Thackeray said on Sunday. People can travel on the trains 14 days after taking their second vaccine shot, he said. Monthly local train passes will be available to people via a mobile application, he added.

China's capital Beijing on Sunday restricted the entry of travellers from Chinese provinces with high COVID-19 transmission rates. This comes amid a surge in coronavirus cases across the country due to the Delta variant. Separately, authorities in Wuhan, where COVID-19 first emerged, said that they had finished testing its entire population of over 1.10 crore in response to rising cases.

A Parliamentary panel has asked the Labour Ministry to use and reconcile data and studies conducted by credible agencies to depict the real picture of job loss. It observed net EPFO payroll addition for 2020-21 was 77.08 lakh, almost at par with 2019-20 despite COVID-19. There's net payroll addition in FY21's every month, except for April and May, it noted.

Delhi on Sunday implemented the colour-coded Graded Response Action Plan (GRAP) with immediate effect to control COVID-19 rise. Accordingly, there will be four levels of alerts, namely yellow, amber, orange and red, based on three parameters- positivity rate, new COVID-19 cases and average occupancy of oxygen beds. The levels will decide curbs/ relaxations in Delhi.

Twelve TMC leaders and workers, including those injured in an alleged attack by BJP workers on the previous day, were arrested in Tripura's Khowai on Sunday for "violating COVID-19 norms", police said. TMC National General Secretary Abhishek Banerjee left for Khowai to meet the arrested party workers. They were arrested for travelling during night curfew at 7 pm, police said.

As UK government moved India from red to amber list for coronavirus travel restrictions to enter England today, Pakistan I&B Minister Fawad Chaudhry launched a petition to move Pakistan out of the red list also. Thousands of people are "stuck" in Pakistan, petition said. Travellers from amber list countries don't need to compulsorily quarantine in a hotel for 10 days.

Health Minister Mansukh Mandaviya has said that the COVID-19 vaccine certificate can now be downloaded on a beneficiary's phone "in seconds" through WhatsApp via the MyGov Corona Helpdesk. This can be done by sending WhatsApp message 'covid certificate' to the number +91-9013151515 and entering the OTP received, Mandaviya said. So far, India has administered over 50 crore vaccine doses.

Iran on Sunday reported its highest one-day jump in coronavirus cases and deaths so far amid a COVID-19 surge in the country. Iran reported over 39,600 new cases and 542 deaths from COVID-19, according to Iranian health authorities. Iran is one of the worst coronavirus-hit countries in the Middle East with more than 41 lakh cases and over 94,000 deaths.

At the current rate of vaccine supply by Centre, Delhi will be able to fully inoculate its adult population of 15 million only by July or August next year, the Delhi government has informed Delhi Disaster Management Authority (DDMA). "To complete two doses of all eligible beneficiaries by December, 2021, around 45 lakh doses are required every month," it added.

US President Joe Biden has been trolled after he said that 350 million Americans were vaccinated for COVID-19 when the country has a population of around 333 million (as per US Census Bureau). "Are we vaccinating in utero (before birth) now?" said a Twitter user. The White House later clarified that Biden meant 350 million vaccine doses have been administered.

Goa is aiming to administer COVID-19 vaccines to all the eligible people by October 31, state BJP chief Sadanand Shet Tanavade said on Sunday. "Goa is the first state to complete administering the first dose to 90% beneficiaries," he added. Tanavade said this at an event of the BJP's women's wing in Panaji.

Haryana on Sunday extended lockdown till August 23 with a few more relaxations in restrictions. Time restrictions for the opening of restaurants, bars, gyms and spas have been removed and all these places can open at 50% capacity with COVID-19 protocols. All malls and shops and even swimming pools can open with COVID-19 protocols, said the new order.

Pune city has vaccinated about 58% of its eligible beneficiaries against COVID-19, as of now, and 21% are fully vaccinated, Dr Suryakant Deokar, PMC immunisation officer said. "The city?s population (estimated) is close to five million, of which 3.2 million beneficiaries are aged above 18 and eligible for the vaccine," Dr Deokar added.

Amazon has ordered all US employees to wear a mask at work regardless of their vaccination status amid the rise in COVID-19 cases. "We are monitoring the situation closely and will continue to follow local government guidance," the company said. Amazon has also extended work from home for corporate employees in US and some other countries to January 3, 2022.

India has reported 39,070 new COVID-19 cases and 491 deaths in the last 24 hours. Kerala accounted for over 52% of the new cases in India as the state reported 20,367 cases on Saturday. With this, India's total COVID-19 cases reached 3,19,34,455, while the death toll surged to 4,27,862. The country's active caseload currently stands at 4,06,822.

When asked how his wife Sonali Bendre's cancer battle changed his life, filmmaker Goldie Behl said, "My life hasn't changed. I have always dedicated my life to her and I still do." Speaking about working amid the COVID-19 pandemic, he told Rediff.com, "The sense of being cautious was always there. That's why we shot smoothly through the pandemic."

As many as 15 officials were punished on Saturday in China for failing to contain the Nanjing Lukou International Airport COVID-19 outbreak, reported state-media Global Times. Of the total, disciplinary actions were taken against six senior officials after an epidemic prevention and control probe at the airport. The airport is considered to be the source of latest outbreaks in China.

BJP National President JP Nadda, while accusing Opposition parties of "isolating" themselves during the second wave of COVID-19, praised his party workers for risking their lives at that time. "BJP was the only party whose hardworking workers dedicated themselves to help the humanity without being concerned about their lives...The Opposition spread a lot of rumours on oxygen [shortage]," he added.

Global benchmark Brent lost more than 6% in its biggest weekly decline in four months and West Texas Intermediate (WTI) tumbled nearly 7%, its largest week of losses in nine months. Brent crude oil futures settled down 59 cents at $70.7, while WTI crude futures settled at $68.28 a barrel. This comes amid concerns over Delta variant of COVID-19.

PNB Housing Finance expects to manage its bad loans better from this month onwards, the company's Managing Director and CEO Hardayal Prasad said. "We've pulled back about ?80 crore of NPA in July...restrictions led to a little bit of problems in recovery," he added. The company's COVID-19-related restructured loans stood at ?1,733 crore as of June 30.

House Leader of Pune Municipal Corporation (PMC), Ganesh Bidkar, said that the civic body should take necessary care to prevent encroachments on important roads in the city. Bidkar had called a meeting of officials on Friday to discuss the issue of encroachments. He also said it's the PMC's  responsibility to ensure incidence of COVID-19 doesn't increase.

Due to the blockade of National Highway 306 from the Assam side, Mizoram is facing a shortage of essential COVID-19 testing kits, reagents and life-saving drugs, state Rural Development Minister Lalruatkima said on Saturday. "Sample testing in Mizoram is getting capped based on the available stock," he added. The highway was blocked after violence along the interstate border last month.

The US on Saturday urged the American citizens to leave Afghanistan immediately amid a territorial advance by the Taliban. The US has maintained a Level 4 travel advisory for Afghanistan that mandates Americans to not travel to the country due to crime, terrorism, civil unrest, kidnapping, armed conflict and COVID-19. This comes amid a US troop withdrawal from Afghanistan.

In July, 13.45 crore doses of COVID-19 vaccines were administered across India, Union Health Minister Mansukh Mandaviya said on Saturday. "July saw a remarkable daily average of 43.41 lakh doses," he tweeted. Notably, India's cumulative vaccination coverage crossed the 50 crore mark on Friday, after which PM Narendra Modi said the country's fight against COVID-19 got "strong impetus".

Indian-American Congressman Raja Krishnamoorthi said that the US had allocated only 75 lakh doses of COVID-19 vaccines to India so far and urged President Joe Biden-led administration to do more by expanding its vaccine aid programme. "As we approach Indian Independence Day, we need to declare our independence from COVID-19," he added. He called for global cooperation against the pandemic.

China's Wuhan city has tested over 1.12 crore residents for COVID-19 so far amid a surge in cases, authorities said on Saturday. The city had launched an all-inclusive testing drive for the residents on August 4. Wuhan had not reported locally transmitted cases for over a year until seven people tested positive for COVID-19 on August 2, state media reported.

Bhandara district on Friday became the first district in Maharashtra to be coronavirus free after the only patient under treatment was discharged from the hospital, the local administration said. Meanwhile, 578 persons were tested for coronavirus in the last 24 hours and all of them returned a negative result. The district had reported its first coronavirus patient in April 2020.

All weekly markets in Delhi will reopen from Monday (August 9), Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal said on Saturday. "These are poor people. Government is quite concerned about their livelihoods," said Kejriwal on the decision to open the markets that were shut amid COVID-19. "I urge everyone to follow COVID-19 appropriate behaviour after these markets are opened," he added.

The Kerala High Court allowed a man working abroad to appear via video conferencing to enable registration of his marriage, as he could not come in person due to COVID-19 travel restrictions. The court's order came on his 28-year-old bride's plea, who said that her husband left for Canada right after their marriage in July 2019.

Anti-government protesters in Thailand clashed with police as they demonstrated against the government's failure to handle COVID-19 outbreaks and its impact on the economy. Police fired tear gas and rubber bullets at protesters as they marched towards PM Prayut Chan-o-cha's office demanding his resignation. Thailand on Saturday reported 21,838 new COVID-19 cases, its biggest one-day jump so far.

India recorded 38,628 new COVID-19 cases and 617 deaths in the last 24 hours, Ministry of Health and Family Welfare said. COVID-19 recovery rate stands at 97.37%, it added. It further said that active cases (4,12,153) in the country constitute 1.29% of total cases. India's total cases reached 3,18,95,385 and the death toll surged to 4,27,371.

The European Union's drugs regulator said, "It's currently too early to confirm if and when a booster dose for COVID-19 vaccines will be needed." "There isn't yet enough data from vaccination campaigns and ongoing studies to understand how long protection from the vaccines will last," it added. Notably, EU members Germany and France are planning to give a booster dose.

UK PM Boris Johnson will not self-isolate after an aide tested COVID-19 positive during a recent trip to Scotland, Downing Street said. The PM won't isolate because he hasn't come into "close contact" with a positive case, it added. According to reports, the person and Johnson travelled in the same plane on Wednesday and were "side-by-side" at points during visits.

Actors Amitabh Bachchan, Sonakshi Sinha, Shraddha Kapoor and Tara Sutaria have reportedly joined hands with singers Sonu Nigam, Lata Mangeshkar, Kailash Kher and others for a patriotic project. "The project [will]...be an inspiring piece on the struggles of the country during the coronavirus pandemic and other recent woes, and how we're rising above it as one," Bollywood Life reported.

Health Minister Mansukh Mandaviya on Saturday tweeted that Johnson & Johnson's single-dose COVID-19 vaccine has been approved for emergency use in India. "India expands its vaccine basket! Now India has 5 EUA vaccines. This will further boost our nation's collective fight against COVID-19," he wrote in his tweet.

Pune Mayor Murlidhar Mohol on Friday wrote to Maharashtra Health Minister Rajesh Tope asking him to relax coronavirus restrictions in the city for shops by allowing them to function till at least 8 pm. Currently, shops in Pune are allowed to function till 4 pm. Earlier this week, traders had staged a protest to extend shop timings in the city.

Half of the US population is now fully vaccinated against coronavirus, White House Data Director Cyrus Shahpar said. "Seven-day average of newly vaccinated is up 11% from last week and 44% over past two weeks," Shahpar added. Daily new COVID-19 cases, deaths and hospitalisations in US have risen sharply in recent weeks due to Delta variant, first found in India.

Bangalore Metro Rail Corporation Limited (BMRCL) has announced that the last train from terminal stations will leave at 8 pm instead of 9 pm due to the night curfew to contain the spread of coronavirus. The new schedule will be in effect from today till August 16. The city recorded 441 daily coronavirus cases on Friday.

COVID-19 vaccine production has been ramped up to 40 lakh doses per day, Minister of State for Health and Family Welfare Bharati Pravin Pawar said. "Initially, around 2.5 lakh vaccines were produced per day," she added. "I think with this rise in the production capacity, we will be able to vaccinate people in an even better manner," Pawar stated.

Actress Jennifer Aniston, who recently told InStyle magazine that she decided to cut ties with unvaccinated people, defended her decision and said, "If you have the variant, you are still able to give it to me." She added, "I can give it to someone...who doesn't have the vaccine...That's why I worry. We've to care about more than just ourselves."

India gave first priority to the poor in its strategy to combat the COVID-19 crisis, PM Narendra Modi said on Saturday. "Be it PM Garib Kalyan Anna Yojana or...Garib Kalyan Rojgar Yojana, we thought about food and employment of the poor from first day itself," he added. He said over 80 crore Indians received free ration during the ongoing pandemic.

Thirty people across Maharashtra's Nashik have been infected with the Delta variant of COVID-19, the district hospital informed. "People must sanitise, wear masks and maintain social distancing. Delta variant spreads through overcrowding and close contact," surgeon Dr Kishore Shrinivas said. While 28 patients are from rural areas, two patients are from Gangapur and Sadique Nagar, he added.

In July, 13.45 crore doses of COVID-19 vaccines were administered across India, Union Health Minister Mansukh Mandaviya said on Saturday. "July saw a remarkable daily average of 43.41 lakh doses," he tweeted. Notably, India's cumulative vaccination coverage crossed the 50 crore mark on Friday, after which PM Narendra Modi said the country's fight against COVID-19 got "strong impetus".

A cloth merchant in Punjab's Phagwara was booked for flouting coronavirus norms after a discount sale at his shop brought hundreds of women there. The police said that the shopkeeper was a habitual offender and had earlier announced a sale during lockdown. Shopkeeper had closed the shop when crowd kept increasing, but this caused the women to sit on dharna.

St Vincent and the Grenadines PM Ralph Gonsalves has been hospitalised after being injured at a protest against a proposed vaccine mandate. Gonsalves was walking through a crowd outside Parliament when he was hit in the head, his office said. Protestors on Thursday were demonstrating against the government's plan to require most frontline healthcare workers to be vaccinated against COVID-19.

The RBI's Monetary Policy Committee (MPC) on Friday decided to keep the repo rate unchanged at a record low of 4% and reverse repo rate at 3.35% amid fears of an impending third COVID-19 wave. The rates were also left unchanged during the last MPC meeting in June 2021. This is the seventh time that repo rate has been unchanged.

India's domestic air passenger traffic rose 57% to 49 lakh in July, as against 31.1 lakh in June this year as per credit rating agency ICRA. Airlines' capacity deployment nearly doubled on a yearly basis in July 2021 amid a decline in COVID-19 infections. There were a total of 47,200 departures in July, versus 24,770 departures in the year-ago period.

Lockdown will be imposed in Delhi when the COVID-19 positivity rate reaches 5%, Delhi Health Minister Satyendar Jain said on Thursday. Notably, the national capital on Thursday recorded a COVID-19 positivity rate of 0.08%. "Over 37,000 dedicated beds for COVID-19 patients are being set up presently and the Delhi government is preparing for the worst-case scenario," Jain added.

Johnson & Johnson (J&J) has applied for Emergency Use Authorisation (EUA) of its single-dose COVID-19 vaccine in India. Earlier, India's Central Drugs Standard Control Organisation announced that J&J had pulled its proposal seeking an accelerated approval for local trials. J&J has claimed that its vaccine generates a strong response activity against Delta and other strains of COVID-19.

PVR Limited Managing Director Ajay Bijli said the multiplex chain operator expects business to return to pre-COVID-19 levels by the end of FY22 if good films release and there is no third wave. Bijli shared that PVR would add 19 more screens by September but remains "slightly cautious" on further expansion. PVR recently launched its first Director's Cut in Haryana.

The DMRC while addressing the issue of long queues outside metro stations, said that it will not be able to open more gates as it could lead to violation of COVID-19 norms. It added that since standing travel is not permitted in the trains as of now, the carrying capacity is reduced and hence the need to regulate the crowd.

Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike (BBMP) has launched a serosurvey in the city to understand coronavirus infection and its severity. Blood samples of 1,000 vaccinated and 1,000 non-vaccinated individuals will be collected to determine the number of antibodies present in the survey. Out of them, 30% will be aged under 18, 50% aged above 18 and the rest aged above 45.

As many as 51,16,46,830 COVID-19 vaccine doses have been provided to states and Union Territories so far, the Central government said on Friday. "We are committed to accelerating the pace and expanding the scope of COVID-19 vaccination throughout the country," the government added. "The new phase of universalisation of COVID-19 vaccination commenced from June 21, 2021," it stated.

Maharashtra minister Aaditya Thackeray has said the main aim of the state government is to prevent spread of COVID-19 in the state. "We...tried to increase hospitals...but it should be our first responsibility that people don't get infected," he said. On BJP protesting to resume Mumbai's local train service, he said, "Rather than playing politics, we should focus on saving...people's lives."

Johnson & Johnson (J&J) has applied for Emergency Use Authorisation (EUA) of its single-dose COVID-19 vaccine in India. Earlier, India's Central Drugs Standard Control Organisation announced that J&J had pulled its proposal seeking an accelerated approval for local trials. J&J has claimed that its vaccine generates a strong response activity against Delta and other strains of COVID-19.

Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Friday said India's fight against COVID-19 got a "strong impetus" as over 50 crore vaccine doses were administered till 7 pm. "We hope to build on these numbers and ensure our citizens are vaccinated under 'Sabko Vaccine Muft Vaccine' movement," he tweeted. Over 43.29 lakh doses were administered today. The vaccination drive started in January.

Thousands of people jammed coronavirus vaccination centres in Philippines' capital Manila after false news spread that unvaccinated people would be deprived of cash aid or barred from leaving home during a two-week lockdown. The lockdown, which began on Friday, was announced to combat Delta variant spread. Earlier, President Rodrigo Duterte had threatened to arrest people who don't get a vaccine.

Amid a surge in COVID-19 infections in Myanmar, the UN World Food Programme (WFP) on Friday said that it needs $86 million (?637 crore) to help fight hunger in the country. "We've seen hunger spreading further and deeper in Myanmar," it added. The WFP estimates 63 lakh people in Myanmar could face food insecurity in the next six months.

India's COVID-19 recovery rate stands at 97.36%, the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare said on Friday as the country recorded 44,643 new cases. According to the latest data, 3,10,15,844 people have recovered so far. India's active cases stand at 4,14,159 and the death toll has surged to 4,26,754.

Serum Institute of India CEO Adar Poonawalla on Friday said that he's hopeful that Covovax, another COVID-19 vaccine being manufactured by his company, will be launched in October for adults. "Covovax vaccine for kids will be launched in the first quarter of the next year most likely in January-February," he added. Poonawalla also met Home Minister Amit Shah in Parliament.

Section 144 of the Code of Criminal Procedure has been imposed in Bengaluru till 6 am on August 16, according to an order by the city's police amid a gradual rise in COVID-19 cases. Night curfew from 10 pm to 5 am has also been imposed till the same date. Section 144 prevents the gathering of four or more people.

Tokyo Olympics organisers on Friday reported 29 new Games-related COVID-19 cases. No athletes were among the latest positive cases. The 29 new infections have taken the total of Games-related infections to 382. Japan proposed on Thursday expanding emergency restrictions to eight more prefectures to fight a surge in COVID-19 cases, a cabinet minister said. Games-related testing began on July 1.

As many as 51,16,46,830 COVID-19 vaccine doses have been provided to states and Union Territories so far, the Central government said on Friday. "We are committed to accelerating the pace and expanding the scope of COVID-19 vaccination throughout the country," the government added. "The new phase of universalisation of COVID-19 vaccination commenced from June 21, 2021," it stated.

Nobel laureate Abhijit Banerjee on Thursday apprehended that a third COVID-19 wave might adversely impact India's GDP growth, pulling it down to 7% in 2021-22. "Earlier, the IMF...said GDP growth would be 12.5%. Now it is saying it would be 9.5%. I apprehend it might go down to 7%," Banerjee said. "Another wave will decrease it further," he added.

The Ministry of Women and Child Development has received no complaints of violence against Anganwadi workers during the COVID-19 pandemic, Minister Smriti Irani said on Friday, in response to a question of Congress leader Rahul Gandhi. She also added states are responsible for their safety. Further, she revealed that the Centre increased their honorarium from ?3,000 to ?4,500 monthly.

Tamil Nadu government has extended the COVID-19 restrictions in the state till August 23. The state has decided that places of worship will remain shut for devotees on Fridays, Saturdays and Sundays. The state is also planning to reopen schools for Class 9 to 12 at 50% capacity from September 1 and medical and nursing colleges from August 16.

Bharat Biotech on Thursday said that every batch of its COVID-19 vaccine Covaxin is subjected to over 200 quality control tests followed by the submission of samples to the Central Drugs Laboratory. The company's statement came after NTAGI's NK Arora told ANI that the test batches of Covaxin produced at the new plant in Bengaluru weren't satisfactory and got rejected.

Apple has delayed its plans to launch its first physical store in India due to the COVID-19 pandemic, the company confirmed. CEO Tim Cook last year announced that the first physical Apple Store would open in the country starting 2021. The iPhone-maker had launched an online store in India last year in September.

Union Health Minister Mansukh Mandaviya on Friday met Serum Institute of India (SII) CEO Adar Poonawalla to discuss ways in which the manufacturing of the Covishield vaccine could be ramped up. "More than 17 countries in Europe have already approved Covishield and many are in line to give approval. This will be good news for all the travellers," Poonawalla said.

Kerala Health Minister Veena George on Friday justified the government's decision to make vaccine certificate or negative RT-PCR test report mandatory for people visiting shops, banks and other establishments. She added that the decision has been taken after detailed consultation with experts to provide protection to the people. Opposition leaders have criticised the government over the order.

US news media company CNN has fired three of its employees for coming to the office unvaccinated against COVID-19 last week. In a memo sent to staff, President Jeff Zucker told employees that the company has zero tolerance policy on such instances. Showing proof of vaccination may now become a formal part of the process to enter office, CNN said.

The RBI Governor Shaktikanta Das on Friday said that the central bank remains in "whatever it takes" mode to revive growth and mitigate the impact of COVID-19. The central bank is ready to "deploy all its policy levers - monetary, prudential or regulatory", he added. His comments came as the RBI Monetary Policy Committee kept repo rate unchanged at 4%.

Delhi reported 44 fresh COVID-19 cases and five deaths in the last 24 hours, as per the data shared by the health department. While the positivity rate slipped to 0.06%, the death toll in the national capital now stands at 25,065. On Wednesday, Delhi reported 67 new COVID-19 cases and no deaths.

BJP MLA Suvendu Adhikari claimed on Thursday that the TMC-led government in West Bengal was "depriving" BJP workers and supporters who voted for the party of coronavirus vaccines. "We have to take these people to alternative places for vaccination," he also claimed. He said that he's requested the Centre to directly send vaccines to Central government-run hospitals in the state.

Bharat Biotech on Thursday said that every batch of its COVID-19 vaccine Covaxin is subjected to over 200 quality control tests followed by the submission of samples to the Central Drugs Laboratory. The company's statement came after NTAGI's NK Arora told ANI that the test batches of Covaxin produced at the new plant in Bengaluru weren't satisfactory and got rejected.

Australian Foreign Minister Marise Payne said that Australia will not accept China's demands to change policy in order to restart bilateral talks. The bilateral relations deteriorated further after Australia called for an independent investigation into the origins of coronavirus, that first emerged in China. China had responded by imposing tariffs and import limits on Australian commodities.

Former U`S President Barack Obama has scaled back plans to celebrate his 60th birthday this weekend "due to the...spread of...Delta variant over the past week", his spokeswoman said. Only close friends and family will now attend the event, Hannah Hankins added. ?About 700 people were expected to attend the event, planned in line with public health guidelines and COVID-19 safeguards.

The Self-Test features a minimally invasive nasal swab and delivers results in 15 minutes without instrumentation. "Self-testing is a proven tool that provides an added layer of defense along with public health protocols and the vaccine roll out." said Sanjeev Johar, divisional vice president of Abbott's rapid diagnostics business in Asia Pacific.

The total cases of coronavirus globally crossed the 20 crore-mark, according to the Johns Hopkins University tracker, as more infectious Delta variant continues to spread. Over 40 lakh new coronavirus cases were reported globally in the last week, the WHO said. US is the worst coronavirus-hit country with over 3.5 crore cases, followed by India at over 3.1 crore cases.

The COVID-19 vaccination drive, which was suspended for a day due to a shortage of vaccines, will resume across Mumbai at all the 314 civic and government-run centres on Thursday. According to the civic body - Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC), Mumbai received 57,000 doses of Covishield and 48,000 of Covaxin on Tuesday night, which were distributed across centres throughout Wednesday.

Kerala on Thursday added 22,040 fresh coronavirus cases and 117 deaths to its tally, which took the caseload to 34.93 lakh and total deaths to 17,328 respectively. In 24 hours, 20,046 recovered from COVID-19, pushing the total number of recoveries to 32,97,834. The positivity rate stands at 13.49%, government data revealed. Notably, Malappuram and Thrissur are among the worst-hit places.

US top infectious disease expert Dr Anthony Fauci has said that COVID-19 cases may double as variant worse than Delta could be coming. He said, "If America's current COVID-19 surge continues unabated...[US] will likely face an even more deadly strain of [COVID-19] that could evade...current coronavirus vaccines." Notably, the US is the worst coronavirus-hit country with over 3.5 crore cases.

Bangladesh announced that it plans to vaccinate at least one crore people against COVID-19 in a week amid rising virus cases in the country. The COVID-19 vaccination drive will be led by tens of thousands of healthcare workers at 14,000 centres from August 7, senior minister A.K.M Mozammel Haque said. "Elderly people, workers and shopkeepers will be given...priority," he added.

Nobel laureate Abhijit Banerjee has said that the Centre is "not capable" of generating supply of COVID-19 vaccines for the country. "If there were enough vaccines, these claims wouldn't have arisen. We have not received the promised level of supply for the entire nation," he added. He was attending Global Advisory Board meeting held by West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee.

Chinese President Xi Jinping on Thursday said that China will strive to provide 2 billion doses of COVID-19 vaccines to other countries in 2021, state broadcaster CCTV reported. In his written message to an international COVID-19 vaccine cooperation forum, Xi also said the country would donate $100 million to the COVAX global vaccine distribution scheme, according to the CCTV report.

Pune BJP has urged t1he district administration to comply with the request of traders to extend the market closure deadline to 8 pm. "Since the COVID-19 spread is reducing, the timing for shops to remain open in the city should be extended," said city BJP chief Jagdish Mulik. "The administration should also relax the restrictions on weekends," Mulik added.

As many as 4,715 bedridden and immobile people have been registered for home vaccination against COVID-19 in Mumbai and the Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) has vaccinated 602 of them so far, the BMC told the Bombay High Court on Thursday. The civic body informed the court that a two-member team visits the beneficiaries along with an ambulance to inoculate them.

China has imposed new travel and movement restrictions as a delta variant-driven COVID-19 outbreak grew to over 500 symptomatic cases scattered across nearly half of China, affecting 15 provinces and municipalities. China has put restrictions on public transport and taxi services in 144 of the worst-hit areas. Officials on Thursday informed that 94 new local infections were detected on Wednesday.

Serum Institute of India's CEO Adar Poonawalla on Thursday in a tweet said that he has set aside ?10 crore for quarantine costs of Indian students travelling abroad amid COVID-19. "Dear students travelling abroad, as a few countries are yet to approve Covishield as an acceptable vaccine for travel without quarantine, you may have to incur some costs," he tweeted.

Gold imports by India jumped to the highest in three months in July as economic activity picked up after the second wave of COVID-19 abated, and prices softened. Inbound shipments surged 71% from a year earlier to 43.6 tonnes last month, Bloomberg Quint reported. This comes after virus-related curbs were eased in several states.

A total of 3.3 lakh COVID-19 claims worth ?10,603 crore are outstanding with insurers, the Economic Times reported. Of the total, 95,569 claims are from financial year 2020-21. In the first four months of FY22 up to July-end, 12.3 lakh claims worth ?13,804 crore were filed with general and health insurers. Of this, 49,452 claims worth ?389 crore were rejected.

The Delhi government on Thursday told the High Court that it won't take any action against people, organisations and religious institutions who have been providing free medical oxygen to COVID-19 patients. The government added that it intended to withdraw the prosecution filed against such people. The court had last month said that good samaritans can't be prosecuted for procuring oxygen.

All 16 and 17-year-olds in UK will be offered their first Pfizer-BioNTech COVID-19 vaccine dose in coming weeks following a new recommendation by Joint Committee on Vaccination and Immunisation (JCVI). Last month, JCVI advised the vaccine to be offered to only medically vulnerable children, saying it was taking a precautionary approach. Teens won't need parental consent to get the vaccine.

The temporary delay in delivery of Sputnik V COVID-19 vaccine due to production scale-up will be fully resolved in August, the vaccine's team said in a statement. "Sputnik V...will additionally double its capacity in September," it added. Team Sputnik V also refuted media reports and said that not a single country has cancelled a contract for the delivery.

The COVID-19 vaccination drive, which was suspended for a day due to a shortage of vaccines, will resume across Mumbai at all the 314 civic and government-run centres on Thursday. According to the civic body - Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC), Mumbai received 57,000 doses of Covishield and 48,000 of Covaxin on Tuesday night, which were distributed across centres throughout Wednesday.

Delhi High Court on Wednesday said the target set to vaccinate the entire adult population against COVID-19 by December 31 was unlikely to be met. The court said, "It was in press that we need to vaccinate 90 lakh people a day...We don't have that kind of vaccination. So obviously we are not going to meet it. Let's face it."

India has reported 42,982 new COVID-19 cases and 533 deaths in the last 24 hours. Kerala accounted for over 52% of the new cases in India as the state reported 22,414 cases on Wednesday. With this, India's total COVID-19 cases reached 3,18,12,114, while the death toll surged to 4,26,290. The country's active caseload currently stands at 4,11,076.

All healthcare and frontline workers will be given COVID-19 vaccines by August 15 in Gurugram, district civil surgeon Dr Virender Yadav said. "For inoculating frontline workers, a team will be constituted...which will cover two departments every day," he added. Of the 50,185 healthcare workers in Gurugram, 43,539 have received their first dose and 39,567 have got their second.

Indian pharmaceutical firm Panacea Biotec has agreed to produce up to 2.5 crore doses of Sputnik V COVID-19 vaccine, the company said in a regulatory filing. The firm added that it will use the drug substance made by Russia's Generium to produce the vaccine. Panacea will supply the doses to drugmaker Dr Reddy's Laboratories for distribution in India.

Russia has administered COVID-19 vaccines to 38.9 million people, about 27% of its population, Health Minister Mikhail Murashko said on Thursday. Russia had made 53 million vaccine doses available to the public and the COVID-19 situation in the country was stabilising, he said. Last month, the government said 33.6 million people had received at least one dose of the vaccine.

Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee on Thursday wrote another letter to PM Narendra Modi, saying the COVID-19 situation in the state might turn grim if the vaccine supply isn't increased. She alleged Bengal was getting a much lower number of vaccines despite having a very high population density. Bengal would need around 14 crore doses to cover eligible people, she added.

Kerala on Thursday added 22,040 fresh coronavirus cases and 117 deaths to its tally, which took the caseload to 34.93 lakh and total deaths to 17,328 respectively. In 24 hours, 20,046 recovered from COVID-19, pushing the total number of recoveries to 32,97,834. The positivity rate stands at 13.49%, government data revealed. Notably, Malappuram and Thrissur are among the worst-hit places.

PM Narendra Modi on Thursday met Australia's Special Trade Envoy and former PM Tony Abbott. The leaders discussed ways to strengthen bilateral trade, investment and economic cooperation. "They emphasised that enhanced economic cooperation...would help both countries better address the economic challenges emerging out of the COVID-19 pandemic," the Ministry of External Affairs said in a statement.

US-based Moderna on Thursday said its COVID-19 vaccine was about 93% effective four-six months after the second dose, just short of the shot's initial efficacy of around 94%. "This strong duration will benefit...hundreds of millions of people," CEO St?phane Bancel said. Last week, Pfizer said its vaccine's efficacy dropped to about 84% four-six months after the second dose.

Indian pharmaceutical firm Panacea Biotec has agreed to produce up to 2.5 crore doses of Sputnik V COVID-19 vaccine, the company said in a regulatory filing. The firm added that it will use the drug substance made by Russia's Generium to produce the vaccine. Panacea will supply the doses to drugmaker Dr Reddy's Laboratories for distribution in India.

The government has granted Adani Group a three-month extension to take over airports at Jaipur, Guwahati and Thiruvananthapuram, Civil Aviation Minister Jyotiraditya Scindia told the Lok Sabha. The Adani Group had sought six months additional time, till December 2021, from the Airports Authority of India (AAI) to take over the airports. It had cited force majeure events due to COVID-19.

Covaxin has submitted documents for emergency use authorisation in Canada. Reports said that if Covaxin gets approval in Canada, thousands of Indian citizens, students, temporary workers and new residents who have been inoculated by Covaxin will no longer face entry restrictions in Canada. Currently, among the vaccines available in India, only Covishield is approved in Canada.

Australia's second-largest city Melbourne and the rest of Victoria state entered their sixth lockdown on Thursday. The seven-day lockdown was announced after Victoria reported eight new COVID-19 cases. If lockdown isn't imposed now, there is every chance that "this gets away from us and we're potentially locked down until we all get vaccinated", Victoria state Premier Daniel Andrews said.

Indian airlines and airports incurred financial losses worth ?22,400 crore in financial year 2020-21, Minister of State for Civil Aviation VK Singh said. Domestic air passenger traffic fell by 61.7% in 2021 due to the COVID-19 pandemic. As of July 30, there was a 80-85% drop in number of flights operating to and from India as compared to pre-COVID-19 levels.

Russia has administered COVID-19 vaccines to 38.9 million people, about 27% of its population, Health Minister Mikhail Murashko said on Thursday. Russia had made 53 million vaccine doses available to the public and the COVID-19 situation in the country was stabilising, he said. Last month, the government said 33.6 million people had received at least one dose of the vaccine.

Karnataka reported 1,785 new COVID-19 cases and 25 deaths in the last 24 hours, the state health department said on Thursday. With these new cases, the total number of active COVID-19 cases in the state has reached 24,414 and the death toll reached 36,705. As many as 28,52,368 recoveries have been reported in Karnataka so far.

Nobel laureate Abhijit Banerjee has said that the Centre is "not capable" of generating supply of COVID-19 vaccines for the country. "If there were enough vaccines, these claims wouldn't have arisen. We have not received the promised level of supply for the entire nation," he added. He was attending Global Advisory Board meeting held by West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee.

New York City will require COVID-19 vaccination proof for indoor dining, gyms and indoor concerts from September 13, becoming the first major city in US to do so. "It's time for people to see vaccination as...necessary to living a good...and healthy life," Mayor Bill de Blasio said. The mandate will require customers/staff to show proof of at least one dose.

Activity in India?s services industry shrank for the third consecutive month in July as COVID-19 related curbs continued to impact demand, Services Purchasing Managers? Index, compiled by IHS Markit showed. The index rose to 45.4 in July from 41.2 in June but stayed below the 50-level separating growth from contraction.

India has reported 42,625 COVID-19 cases and 562 deaths in the last 24 hours, according to the Union Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. This comes a day after the country reported 30,549 cases and 422 deaths. With this, the country's total COVID-19 cases reached 3,17,69,132, while the death toll surged to 4,25,757. India's active caseload stands at 4,10,353.

People coming to Himachal Pradesh will be required to show negative RT-PCR reports in view of the increasing COVID-19 cases, CM Jairam Thakur said. Besides this, those who have been vaccinated with one or both doses will be allowed in the state. "It has been issued as an advisory now, it will be made mandatory later," he added.

Kerala Health Minister Veena George said the severity of the pandemic was decreasing even as Kerala reported 22,414 new COVID-19 cases and 108 deaths on Wednesday. The number of patients seeking treatment at hospitals and those needing ICU support has dwindled, she added. On Tuesday, the Centre said Kerala has the maximum districts reporting over 10% weekly COVID-19 positivity rate.

The BBMP said it will try to fully vaccinate 50% of the city's population in two months. So far, about 18% of the population has received both COVID-19 vaccine doses, while 62% has received one dose, BBMP Chief Commissioner Gaurav Gupta said. According to Gupta, Bengaluru will need "between one lakh to 1.5 lakh doses" daily to fulfil the goal.

Kerala has extended the existing COVID-19 guidelines with effect from August 5. While strict lockdown restrictions would be imposed in areas recording over 10 COVID-19 cases per 1,000 people, shops in other areas can operate from Monday to Saturday. There will a complete lockdown on August 8 in the state, the government announced.

After Pune didn't get relief from restrictions amid COVID-19, Mayor Murlidhar Mohol said that the state government should rethink its decision. "Since a month, the positivity rate in Pune city has been below 5%. State government had said that if the positivity rate remains below 5%, then curbs can be eased," he explained. Mohol added citizens and traders want relaxations.

France's health officials on Tuesday activated an emergency plan on the Mediterranean island of Corsica as the fourth wave of COVID-19 spread across the country. Meanwhile, more of France's coastal areas have reintroduced the compulsory wearing of masks. It comes after Guadalupe became the third of France's overseas territory to announce a partial lockdown amid a "catastrophic" surge in cases.

After temporarily suspending the e-catering facility in view of COVID-19, the Indian Railways has resumed the facility to let passengers order food on their seats. The IRCTC in a tweet said that the service will now be available at more than 200 railway stations. Passengers will be able to order food via a dedicated website or the 'IRCTC eCatering' app.

China reported 71 new domestically transmitted coronavirus cases for August 3, the highest daily tally since January 30. The number of cases in China has increased for five consecutive days since July 30. The country has been witnessing a COVID-19 surge due to the Delta variant. Many Chinese cities with COVID-19 cases have closed tourist sites and entertainment venues.

All Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) and government-run vaccination centres will remain closed on Wednesday due to vaccine shortage, the civic body said in a tweet earlier. "We apologise for the inconvenience," the tweet read. Notably, between July 1 and July 22, BMC had suspended the vaccination drive five times. Meanwhile, 288 people tested positive for COVID-19 on Tuesday in Mumbai.

Urban Maharashtra was the worst-hit by COVID-19 in terms of unemployment in the April-June and July-September quarters last year when the rate of unemployment was 35.6% and 22.6% respectively. The national averages stood at 20.9% and 13.3% respectively. The Periodic Labour Force Survey found that urban Jharkhand had the second-highest unemployment rate in the two quarters at 32% and 19.8%.

The United States is helping India and other countries to be able to produce COVID-19 vaccines by themselves, President Joe Biden said during a press conference at White House on Tuesday. "By the way, it's free. We're not charging anybody anything," he said. The US has committed to provide over half a billion vaccine doses around the world, he added.

Sixteen-year-old Vanisha Pathak from Bhopal, who lost her parents to COVID-19 in May this year, has scored 99.8% in CBSE Class 10. "I want to become an IITian because it was the dream of my parents and it's my responsibility to fulfil their dreams," she stated. Vanisha, along with her brother, is now living with her maternal uncle and aunt.

Andhra Pradesh has reported as many as 2,442 new COVID-19 cases in the last 24 hours. Moreover, the state also reported 2,412 recoveries and 16 coronavirus-related deaths. As per the state health department, the total recoveries have reached 19,40,368 and the total number of active COVID-19 cases has reached 20,184.

Amid rising coronavirus cases, the number of micro-containment zones in Bengaluru has risen to 141. There were less than 100 micro-containment zones until last week. The highest number of containment zones are located in Mahadevapura (42), while Dasarahalli has only two containment zones. Bengaluru on Tuesday logged 477 new COVID-19 cases, taking the total number of cases to 12,28,515.

Bihar CM Nitish Kumar on Wednesday announced that in view of the reduction in coronavirus infections, schools will reopen for Classes 9-10 from August 7 and Classes 1-8 from August 16. Coachings will function at 50% capacity (barring a day), he added, while all shops will reopen from August 7-25 with weekly off. Malls and cinemas will reopen with restrictions.

Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal on Wednesday said the meeting convened by L-G Anil Baijal to review the COVID-19 situation was "against the Constitution". "We are a democracy. People have elected a Council of Ministers. If you have any questions, please ask your ministers. Avoid holding direct meetings with officers," Kejriwal tweeted while quoting the tweet posted by Baijal.

The WHO has called for a moratorium on booster doses of COVID-19 vaccines until September-end. WHO chief Tedros Adhanom Ghebreyesus said, "[It's] to enable at least 10% of...population of every country to be vaccinated." "We can't accept countries that have already used most of...global supply of vaccines using even more of it, while..world's most vulnerable people remain unprotected," he added.

The BBMP said it will try to fully vaccinate 50% of the city's population in two months. So far, about 18% of the population has received both COVID-19 vaccine doses, while 62% has received one dose, BBMP Chief Commissioner Gaurav Gupta said. According to Gupta, Bengaluru will need "between one lakh to 1.5 lakh doses" daily to fulfil the goal.

All Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) and government-run vaccination centres will remain closed on Wednesday due to vaccine shortage, the civic body said in a tweet earlier. "We apologise for the inconvenience," the tweet read. Notably, between July 1 and July 22, BMC had suspended the vaccination drive five times. Meanwhile, 288 people tested positive for COVID-19 on Tuesday in Mumbai.

The Indian Medical Association (IMA) state unit said the Kerala government has to change the current COVID-19 strategy, appealing to the government to ensure more vaccines at affordable costs are made available for the private clinics on priority. The alternative day lockdown and weekend lockdown have led to overcrowding, increasing the chances of spreading the virus, said an IMA member.

Germany will begin administering COVID-19 vaccine booster shots to elderly and at-risk citizens from September 1, the Health Ministers of the country's 16 states said. The citizens will be inoculated with Pfizer-BioNTech and Moderna COVID-19 vaccines irrespective of the jabs they'd originally received.  The Health Ministers have also agreed to make vaccination available to all children aged 12-17.

Actor-television host Maniesh Paul, who recently shot for various projects, spoke about working amid the coronavirus pandemic and said that the energy on the set "has definitely gone down". "Earlier, we'd have people chit-chatting, spot dada, light men, someone talking outside while shooting was going on inside," Maniesh said, adding that it has become "quieter" now.

Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike (BBMP) has made institutional quarantine mandatory for people arriving in Bengaluru from outside of Karnataka to contain spread of coronavirus. Travellers must bring a negative RT-PCR test and test will be conducted if they don't get it, BBMP Chief Commissioner Gaurav Gupta said. People will have to wait for test result in institutional quarantine, he added.

CBSE took to Twitter to reveal that CBSE Class 10 result will be announced at 12 pm today. Students can access their results on https://cbseresults.nic.in or https://cbse.gov.in or DigiLocker. CBSE had declared the Class 12 result on July 30. Both Class 10 and Class 12 exams were cancelled due to the coronavirus pandemic.

Describing people who refuse coronavirus vaccines as "walking spreaders", Philippine President Rodrigo Duterte has said, "For those who do not want it (vaccine), well, for all I care, you can die anytime." "If you go out of your house, I will tell the police to return you to your home," he further said.

The US said it'd provide an additional $30 million in "life-saving COVID-19 assistance to Indonesia to...enhance vaccine rollout and provide medical supplies to treat COVID-19 patients and save lives". US has provided over $65 million in aid to Indonesia since pandemic began, US Agency for International Development (USAID) said. Indonesia is currently facing a COVID-19 surge due to Delta variant.

The deaths of 21 COVID-19 patients of Jaipur Golden Hospital in April wasn't caused by lack of oxygen, Delhi Police told a court on Tuesday. However, the hospital contradicted this, saying there's a link between inadequate oxygen supply and the deaths since oxygen wasn't supplied for nearly 30 hours. The hospital said it was forced to switch to oxygen cylinders.

Kerala reported 23,676 fresh COVID-19 cases on Tuesday, taking the total number of cases in the state to 34.49 lakh. The state recorded 148 more deaths and the test positivity rate (TPR) stood at 11.87%. The Union Health Ministry said Kerala reported 49.85% of the total cases recorded in the country last week.

The government has shared a snapshot of state-wise active COVID-19 cases in India with Kerala being the only state with over one lakh active cases. Kerala's overall contribution to India's active cases stands at 40.95% and last week 49.85% of the total cases were from the southern state. Eight states have active cases between 10,000 and one lakh.

Health Minister Mansukh Mandaviya on Tuesday said four more Indian companies are expected to begin producing COVID-19 vaccines by October-November. Biological E and Novartis vaccines will be available in the coming days, while Zydus Cadila will soon get an emergency-use nod from an expert committee, he said. Currently, Bharat Biotech and Serum Institute are supplying vaccines to the government.

The Centre on Tuesday said that the total number of COVID-19 vaccine doses administered in July is more than double of that in May. So far, over 48 crore vaccine doses have been administered. It added that the second wave of COVID-19 is not over in India as yet as the R-Value is high in eight states.

Uttar Pradesh on Tuesday became the first Indian state to administer over 22 lakh COVID-19 vaccine doses in one day, the Centre said. CM Yogi Adityanath in a tweet congratulated citizens and said the drive became successful under PM Narendra Modi's guidance. Meanwhile, till 7 pm today, over 51.51 lakh doses were administered across India, a government release said.

Pune, Ahmednagar, Satara, Solapur and Sangli continue to account for high number of COVID-19 cases and deaths, as per the state health department data. The positivity rate in Pune is around 3.5%, a PMC official said. "Extensive testing during this peak has increased the positivity rate," Dr Sanjay Pujari, an expert member with the national COVID-19 task force said.

The monthly production capacity of the COVID-19 vaccine, Covishield, is expected to be increased to over 120 million doses by December, Health Minister Mansukh Mandaviya informed the Rajya Sabha on Tuesday. Similarly, the monthly production capacity of Covaxin is projected to be increased from 25 million doses per month to nearly 58 million doses per month, he added.

Actor-television host Maniesh Paul, who recently shot for various projects, spoke about working amid the coronavirus pandemic and said that the energy on the set "has definitely gone down". "Earlier, we'd have people chit-chatting, spot dada, light men, someone talking outside while shooting was going on inside," Maniesh said, adding that it has become "quieter" now.

India has reported 30,549 new cases and 422 deaths in the last 24 hours, according to the Union Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. Before this, India reported over 40,000 COVID-19 cases every day for the last six days. The country's total COVID-19 cases reached 3,17,26,507, while the death toll surged to 4,25,195.

The Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) has issued new guidelines easing COVID-19 restrictions in Mumbai. As per the new orders, all essential and non-essential shops can remain open till 10 pm on all days. All hotels and restaurants have been permitted to remain open for dine-in on all days till 4 pm. Medical shops will be allowed to remain open 24x7.

Nigeria has received 40 lakh doses of Moderna's coronavirus vaccines from US, the country's Health Minister Osagie Ehanire said. The donation from US comes as the West African country battles the third wave of infections. The vaccines are undergoing validation by the country's drug regulator and will be distributed to local states once they're certified fit for use, Ehanire added.

Saath Nibhana Saathiya' actress Vandana Vithlani opened up about facing financial issues and selling rakhis last year amid the coronavirus lockdown. "Last year I went through a bad phase but...I've overcome that...It's not like that pandemic was there so I started making Rakhi for my survival and now when I have other work...I should stop...I'm taking it ahead," she shared.

No recommendation has been made yet to mix first and second doses of COVID-19 vaccines by the National Technical Advisory Group on Immunisation or National Expert Group on Vaccine Administration for COVID-19, the government informed Parliament. "The vaccines have been developed recently. Therefore, scientific evidence about mix and match studies of different vaccines is still evolving," it said.

US-based pharmaceutical firm Johnson & Johnson said that it is still in talks with the Indian government over its COVID-19 vaccine. This comes after India's drug regulator Central Drugs Standard Control Organisation announced that J&J had withdrawn its proposal seeking accelerated approval for local trials. "We remain committed to bringing our single-dose COVID-19 vaccine to India," the firm said.

The second wave of COVID-19 is still not over in India, Joint Secretary (Health) Lav Agarwal said during the government's press briefing on COVID-19. This came as India recorded 30,549 new cases and 422 related deaths. Agarwal further said that a high number of daily COVID-19 cases are being reported globally, indicating that the pandemic is "far from over".

During a recent interview, actor Sunil Grover said, "I am looking forward to the new film project, which is exciting. Producers want to start shooting but the pandemic has upset many plans." He added, "Everyone is scared and can't decide when to start. Standing costs have increased, so everyone is wary...things will take time to get into full swing."

Greece have withdrawn from Tokyo Olympics artistic swimming competitions after four of their athletes tested positive for COVID-19, the Hellenic Olympic Committee, governing Olympic body of Greece, said on Tuesday. One athlete tested positive on Monday while another three returned positive tests on Tuesday. Tokyo Olympics organisers reported 18 new Games-related COVID-19 cases on Tuesday.

A Russian court has sentenced Lyubov Sobol, ally of President Vladimir Putin's critic Alexey Navalny, to 18 months of parole-like restrictions after finding her guilty of inciting people to break COVID-19 regulations. Sobol was charged following an unsanctioned street protest in Navalny's support earlier this year. She has been ordered to stay home between 10 pm-6 am, her lawyer said.

The district administration in Tamil Nadu's Madurai has announced the closure of 22 major temples, including the Sri Meenakshi-Sundareswarar Temple, till August 8. The District Collector has also asked textile shops, supermarkets and other commercial establishments to follow guidelines in view of the rising COVID-19 cases. He added that crowding should be avoided in the markets.

Till August 2, 2021, the Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) has collected over ?62 crore in fines from people for not wearing face masks in public places amid the COVID-19 pandemic. The amount is inclusive of the fines collected by the Mumbai Police and Railways. Meanwhile, Mumbai reported 259 new COVID-19 cases on August 2, taking the total tally to 7,35,371.

Facebook will be requiring all of its employees in the US offices to wear masks, regardless of their COVID-19 vaccination status. "Given the rising numbers of COVID-19 cases, the newest data on COVID-19 variants, and an increasing number of local requirements, we are reinstating our mask requirement," Facebook said. It recently mandated COVID-19 vaccination for employees returning to US offices.

The government on Tuesday said that 44 districts are reporting over 10% weekly COVID-19 positivity rate. Of these, the maximum number of districts (10) are located in Kerala. Nine districts are in Manipur, six in Mizoram, four each in Nagaland, Arunachal Pradesh and Meghalaya, two in Sikkim and one each in Puducherry, Rajasthan, Himachal Pradesh, Assam and Andhra Pradesh.

Seventy percent of all US adults have received at least one dose of the COVID-19 vaccine, according to the US Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC). US President Joe Biden had originally aimed to administer at least one COVID-19 vaccine to 70% of adults by July 4. So far, the country has fully vaccinated 50.24% of its population.
