The Centre on Tuesday said that the total number of COVID-19 vaccine doses administered in July is more than double of that in May. So far, over 48 crore vaccine doses have been administered. It added that the second wave of COVID-19 is not over in India as yet as the R-Value is high in eight states.

The Chhattisgarh government on Tuesday announced that it is mandatory for air travellers visiting the state to carry a negative RT-PCR report from August 8. It added that even fully vaccinated passengers will also need to produce a negative test report not older than 96 hours. Chhattisgarh logged 236 fresh COVID-19 cases and three fatalities on Monday.

Daily COVID-19 cases in India rose slightly as 1,32,788 people tested positive in the last 24 hours. India had reported 1,27,510 cases on Tuesday. COVID-19 deaths have again crossed the 3,000 mark as 3,207 deaths were recorded in the last 24 hours. Active cases in India now stand at 17,93,645, while the number of people discharged is 2,61,79,085.

The Pune Municipal Corporation (PMC) is in process of turning a civic building in Baner into dedicated COVID-19 hospital. The two "parking floors" of building will be converted into ICU facility for treatment of critical patients. "First and second floor parking will have a total of 62 ICU beds, 31 ICU beds on each floor," said Municipal Commissioner Vikram Kumar.

Germany downgraded its COVID-19 risk level to "high" from "very high" for the first time in 2021 after a decline in new cases. "Situation is getting better, we are getting noticeably better," Germany's Health Minister Jens Spahn said. The minister also said that "around 80 to 90% of the adult population would be offered a vaccine by mid-July".

Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation's (BMC) global expression of interest for procurement of 10 million doses of COVID-19 vaccines has received nine responses. ?On Tuesday, we got fresh responses from two Indian firms. Scrutiny of all nine proposals will be completed in two to three days," said P Velrasu, Additional Municipal Commissioner who is heading BMC's vaccine procurement.

The Bombay High Court said Maharashtra government must assure Serum Institute of India's (SII) CEO, Adar Poonawalla of requisite security in the wake of alleged threats to him over supply of Covishield vaccine. The bench said state's top officials must personally speak to Poonawalla, who recently went to London, and assure him of his safety upon his return to India.

Punjab recorded 2,184 new COVID-19 cases and 94 deaths on Tuesday. This is the first time in over a month that the state has recorded less than 100 COVID-19 deaths. According to government of Punjab's medical bulletin, the active cases in the state stand at 33,444, while 14,649 people have died of COVID-19 so far.

The Indian Medical Association (IMA), in an open letter, stated that Baba Ramdev has "irreparably" damaged the government's efforts to contain the COVID-19 pandemic. "Ramdev thought it fit to launch his tirade against national COVID-19 treatment," IMA added. "The IMA has demanded to deem it as sedition and prosecute Ramdev under the Disaster Management Act," IMA wrote.

As many as 24 people have been arrested in connection with attacking a doctor in Assam's Hojai district, said CM Himanta Biswa Sarma. "I am personally monitoring this investigation and I promise that justice will be served," he tweeted. The doctor was thrashed at a COVID-19 facility in Assam by relatives of a patient who died.

Ratings agency ICRA said that COVID-19 restrictions on movement in various states will likely impact field collections of non-banking financial companies (NBFCs) and housing finance companies (HFCs). As a result, non-banks' reported non-performing assets (NPAs) could increase to about 4.5-5% by March 2022, compared to 4% in December 2020. NBFCs are more likely to be adversely impacted than HFCs.

Bengaluru has shown a decline in the number of COVID-19 cases. The city reported 3,418 fresh COVID-19 cases on Tuesday, down from 3,992 cases on Monday. "For the last one week, cases have been dropping. It is now showing a declining trend," said Dr Manjunath CN, a member of the state COVID-19 Technical Advisory Committee (TAC).

The Supreme Court has sought complete data on the Centre's purchase history of the three COVID-19 vaccines till date. "The data should clarify: (a) the dates of all procurement orders placed by the central government for all three vaccines; (b) the quantity of vaccines ordered as on each date; and (c) the projected date of supply," the order stated.

Germany downgraded its COVID-19 risk level to "high" from "very high" for the first time in 2021 after a decline in new cases. "Situation is getting better, we are getting noticeably better," Germany's Health Minister Jens Spahn said. The minister also said that "around 80 to 90% of the adult population would be offered a vaccine by mid-July".

The WHO, in its weekly epidemiological report, said B.1.617.2 (Delta) is the only strain of COVID-19 first detected in India that remains a variant of concern (VOC). It added that B.1.617.1 (Kappa) has been reclassified as variant of interest (VOI) and will continue to be "monitored regularly". Further, B.1.617.3 is no longer classified as either a VOI or VOC.

Union Minister Piyush Goyal said the Indian economy is witnessing a "robust recovery" and is on track to surpass pre-COVID-19 levels. "The FDI during COVID-19 period has been the highest ever as we have FDI of USD 81.72 billion in Financial Year 2020-21, more than 10% than Financial Year 2019-20. Our economy will bounce back soon post-COVID successfully," said Goyal.

Biological E has entered into a licensing agreement with Providence Therapeutics Holdings to manufacture the Canadian company's mRNA COVID-19 vaccine in India. Biological E said it'll run a clinical trial and seek emergency use approval for it. Providence will sell up to 3 crore doses of its vaccine, PTX-COVID19-B, to the Hyderabad-based firm and will also transfer necessary technology.

Pakistan on Tuesday launched its locally-made coronavirus vaccine 'PakVac' with the help of its ally China. 'PakVac', the localised version of Chinese CanSino vaccine, will be produced at the state-run National Institute of Health. Pakistan's Planning and Development Minister Asad Umar thanked China for helping Pakistan with vaccine development and said it was an "important day" for the country.

Israel's Health Ministry said there's a probable link between receiving Pfizer COVID-19 vaccine's second dose and small number of myocarditis or heart inflammation cases, among men aged 16-30. Such a link was observed more among men aged 16-19 and 95% of cases were classified as mild, according to a study. Pfizer has said no causal link has been established.

The Delhi High Court has issued notice to CBSE, Centre and Delhi government on a plea seeking modification in evaluation criteria for Class 10 Board exams. The Class 10 Board exams were cancelled in April due to rising COVID-19 cases. The Centre had said that the results will be prepared based on an objective criterion to be developed by CBSE.

Turkey has imposed 14-day mandatory institutional quarantine for travellers arriving from India and seven other nations to combat COVID-19 spread. The other countries are Pakistan, Sri Lanka, Afghanistan, Bangladesh, Brazil, South Africa and Nepal. Travellers who've visited these nations in the past 14 days will have to submit a negative PCR test conducted within 72 hours before entering Turkey.

Canada, US, Italy, UAE, Philippines, Chile and Japan have approved extending the use of the Pfizer-BioNTech vaccine against coronavirus to those aged above 12. Germany and Poland also said they will start vaccinating children above 12 from June 7. Israel had expanded its vaccination drive to those aged 16 and above earlier this year.

Uttarakhand Chief Minister Tirath Singh Rawat virtually inaugurated a 500-bed COVID-19 care centre in Haldwani. The facility, named after late former Army Chief General Bipin Chandra Joshi, was built by the DRDO in 21 days. The centre has 375 oxygen beds and 125 ICU beds with ventilators and it will become operational from June 3, the DRDO said.

After the government said that everybody in India will be vaccinated by December this year, Congress leader Shashi Tharoor said, "While seeing the availability, or the lack thereof, of the vaccines, I wonder how the government will get there." "My message from my [COVID-19] sickbed," he wrote along with his video on Twitter.

The Kerala government on Wednesday claimed in the High Court that the Centre's vaccination policy was encouraging black marketing. "Rates must be fixed based on the cost of production," the state government added. Accusing private hospitals of procuring vaccines from the black market, the state government said that it isn't able to get the vaccines.

DCGI waived the requirement for foreign companies to conduct post-approval bridging clinical trials for COVID-19 vaccines that have received restricted use approval by US FDA, EMA, among others or are in WHO Emergency Use Listing. The requirement of testing vaccine batches by the Central Drugs Laboratory can be exempted if they've been released by country of origin's national control laboratory.

Odisha CM Naveen Patnaik has written to all the Chief Ministers seeking consensus on centralised procurement of COVID-19 vaccines due to challenges faced by the states. "No state is safe unless all the states adopt vaccination as the top most priority...But this cannot be a battle among the states to compete against each other to procure vaccines," he wrote.

The Supreme Court has sought complete data on the Centre's purchase history of the three COVID-19 vaccines till date. "The data should clarify: (a) the dates of all procurement orders placed by the central government for all three vaccines; (b) the quantity of vaccines ordered as on each date; and (c) the projected date of supply," the order stated.

ICMR Director General Dr Balram Bhargava has suggested a three-point plan to unlock districts to prevent a third coronavirus wave. He stated that districts should have less than 5% test positivity rate for a week. There should be 70% vaccination rate for those aged above 60 and over 45 with co-morbidities. The third point is community ownership for Covid-appropriate behaviour.

Canada, US, Italy, UAE, Philippines, Chile and Japan have approved extending the use of the Pfizer-BioNTech vaccine against coronavirus to those aged above 12. Germany and Poland also said they will start vaccinating children above 12 from June 7. Israel had expanded its vaccination drive to those aged 16 and above earlier this year.

Haryana Education Minister Kanwar Pal on Tuesday said that the state government has decided to cancel the Class 12 exams conducted by the state education board amid the COVID-19 pandemic. The state education board will take steps to compile the results of Class 12 students and modalities for this will be worked out soon, Pal further said.

Nykaa plans to go public later this fiscal year at a valuation of $4.5 billion, according to people directly aware of internal discussions. Earlier reports said Nykaa would go public at a valuation of over $3 billion. The increase in valuation is reportedly due to a rise in company revenue and profit as customers continue to shop online during COVID-19.

Bajaj Finserv's Chairman and Managing Director Sanjiv Bajaj said that the impact of second wave of COVID-19 will be less due to localised lockdowns. "India needs at least 70 lakh vaccinations per day so that we can vaccinate the adult population by end of the year," he added. He also said that rural India was more impacted this time.

The Pune rural police collected over ?2.5 lakh from over 500 COVID-19 norm violators in past three days from Lonavla city police station jurisdiction. ?This action will continue for days to come and citizens roaming for no reason should take note of that,? said Senior Police Inspector Dilip Pawar of Lonavla city police station.

Only five devotees have been allowed to offer prayers at a time in the makeshift Ram Temple in Ayodhya as Uttar Pradesh announced relaxations in curfew in some districts from Tuesday. Temple's head priest said all COVID-19 protocols will be followed. The construction of Ram Temple is going in full swing, Shri Ram Janmabhoomi Teerth Kshetra General Secretary earlier said.

The Delhi High Court has asked the Delhi government why did it start COVID-19 vaccination if it couldn't provide the second dose of Covaxin within the stipulated time. "You should have stopped. Maharashtra stopped when it found it can't provide second dose," the court said. It added, "You opened so many vaccination centres everywhere with so much pomp and splendour."

Maruti Suzuki India reported a 71% decline in total sales from 1,59,691 units in April to 46,555 units in May. The automobile manufacturer halted production from May 1-16 to divert oxygen from industrial use for medical purposes amid the second wave of COVID-19. Sale volumes of its mini cars fell sharply by 81% in May compared to April.

Maharashtra Government has announced a 'Covid-free village' contest in order to boost the local administration in villages to initiate steps to curb the spread of coronavirus. Maharashtra Rural Development Minister Hasan Mushrif said the first prize will be ?50 lakh, second ?25 lakh and third ?15 lakh. The participating villages will be judged on 22 criteria, he added.

Pune Municipal Corporation (PMC) collected a record property tax of ?736.12 crore in the first two months of the financial year 2021-2022, despite COVID-19 restrictions. According to PMC, the amount has been collected from 5,07,755 properties for the current financial year till May 31. "The property tax collection in the first two months...is very high," a civic official said.

European Union agreed to add Japan to their list of countries from which they will allow non-essential travel. Ambassadors from the EU's 27 countries approved the addition of Japan on Wednesday, with the change to take effect in the coming days. However, Britain was left off the list amid increasing COVID-19 cases arising from a variant first identified in India.

A case has been registered against actor Tiger Shroff for allegedly violating COVID-19 rules, a Mumbai Police official said. He was found roaming near the Bandra Bandstand in the evening, hours after the deadline on restrictions on the movement of people without a valid reason. "He couldn't give a satisfactory reply about why he was roaming outside," the official stated.

The Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) on Wednesday announced that due to the lack of adequate vaccine stock, vaccination will be stopped on Thursday at all government centres in Mumbai. Earlier today, the Union Health Ministry said that over 1.64 crore vaccine doses are still available with the states and UTs. There are currently 2,33,498 active COVID-19 cases in the state.

Javed Akhtar, while speaking about India's second COVID-19 wave, said, "The news these days is so disturbing." "It's sad...if you're safe, you feel guilty," he added. Javed further said the second wave of COVID-19 has been "unbelievably bad" for the industry. "I'm relieved...we've people like Salman Khan, and other bodies, who're coming forward to help daily wage workers," he added.

A petition was filed on Wednesday in Supreme Court challenging Delhi High Court's May 31 verdict, which dismissed a plea seeking to halt the Central Vista project. Advocate Pradeep Kumar Yadav, who didn't participate in high court proceedings, argued that the court wasn't justified in dubbing the plea "motivated". He added that allowing construction amid COVID-19 poses a health risk.

Delhi has recorded 576 new cases of coronavirus in the last 24 hours, taking the total number of COVID-19 cases in the national capital to 14,27,439. As many as 103 COVID-19 deaths and 1,287 recoveries were reported in the last 24 hours, with test positivity rate dipping to 0.78%. Delhi now has 9,364 active cases.

Uttarakhand has cancelled the UBSE Class 12 board examinations amid spike in COVID-19 cases in the state, state's Education Minister Arvind Pandey said. He said that the students will be promoted as per CBSE and CISCE regulations. CBSE had said that it would take steps to compile results of Class 12 students as per well-defined objective criteria.

The government on Wednesday released the list of states/UTs with highest number of confirmed coronavirus cases in India. Maharashtra with 57,61,015 cases has the highest number of total coronavirus cases, followed by Karnataka, Kerala, Tamil Nadu, Andhra Pradesh, Uttar Pradesh and Delhi. The other states include West Bengal, Chhattisgarh, Rajasthan, Gujarat and Madhya Pradesh.

The Delhi High Court has asked the Delhi government why did it start COVID-19 vaccination if it couldn't provide the second dose of Covaxin within the stipulated time. "You should have stopped. Maharashtra stopped when it found it can't provide second dose," the court said. It added, "You opened so many vaccination centres everywhere with so much pomp and splendour."

Amid the ongoing COVID-19 pandemic, Inti Bhojanam, Hyderabad's home-based kitchen and Street Byte, a social media channel, have started feeding delivery executives for free. "We have given 40 packs on day one to the delivery boys," wrote Street Byte on its Facebook page. They have also posted pictures of providing food packets to delivery executives.

Lockdown reading has helped the Harry Potter publisher Bloomsbury to its third profit upgrade of the year after a 22% surge in annual pre-tax profits, The Guardian reported. The company said people had ?rediscovered the joy of reading? during the COVID-19 pandemic, pushing its sales 14% higher to ?185 million in the 12 months to the end of February.

Tesla CEO Elon Musk on Wednesday said that the ongoing chip shortage is like the toilet paper shortage during the early outbreak of COVID-19 in the United States. "Our biggest challenge is supply chain, especially microcontroller chips. Never seen anything like it," he tweeted. "Fear of running out is causing every company to over-order," he added.

The Supreme Court on Wednesday said that the Centre's policy of free COVID-19 vaccination for the 45-plus age group and having a paid system for the 18-44 age group is "prima facie arbitrary and irrational". The court said that people in the 18-44 age group aren't only getting infected by COVID-19 but are also suffering severe complications and deaths.

Komal Karpe, the 21-year-old sarpanch of Antroli village in Maharashtra's Solapur, said that she was working and became "shocked" when people began congratulating her for being praised by Maharashtra CM Uddhav Thackeray. Karpe was praised for her efforts to make Antroli free from coronavirus. Karpe, who pursued B.Sc Botany, spearheaded the vaccination and COVID-19 awareness drive in her village.

The Indian Motion Picture Producers' Association (IMPPA) on Wednesday announced that the producers' body will organise a free COVID-19 vaccination drive for 500 of its members on June 15 and 16 on a "first-come-first-served" basis. The association will also facilitate vaccination for members' spouses on payment of ?1000. The producers' body has around 6,000 registered members.

Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation's (BMC) global expression of interest for procurement of 10 million doses of COVID-19 vaccines has received nine responses. ?On Tuesday, we got fresh responses from two Indian firms. Scrutiny of all nine proposals will be completed in two to three days," said P Velrasu, Additional Municipal Commissioner who is heading BMC's vaccine procurement.

Delhi has recorded 576 new cases of coronavirus in the last 24 hours, taking the total number of COVID-19 cases in the national capital to 14,27,439. As many as 103 COVID-19 deaths and 1,287 recoveries were reported in the last 24 hours, with test positivity rate dipping to 0.78%. Delhi now has 9,364 active cases.

Karnataka Chief Minister BS Yediyurappa on Wednesday said lifting the lockdown completely isn't possible as COVID-19 cases in the state haven't come under complete control. "I'll have a discussion with everyone to make a decision on measures that need to be taken regarding lockdown," he said. Yediyurappa added that he has decided to give permission to those involved in exports.

Maharashtra recorded 15,169 new COVID-19 cases and 285 deaths and 29,270 recoveries in the last 24 hours, figures released on Wednesday showed. In comparison, Maharashtra had reported 14,123 new COVID-19 cases and 477 fatalities on Tuesday, including previously unreported deaths. Mumbai reported 925 COVID-19 positive cases, 31 deaths, and 1,632 recoveries in the last 24 hours.

The Gujarat Secondary and Higher Secondary Education Board (GSHSEB) on Wednesday cancelled the Class 12 examinations. This comes a day after the board released the revised date sheet for the exams. The CBSE and ISC Class 12 exams have also been cancelled amid the coronavirus situation in the country.

Uttar Pradesh on Wednesday crossed a milestone of testing five crore samples for COVID-19. In a release, the state government said that Uttar Pradesh is the first state to cross the milestone. The state government added that 3,31,511 samples were tested in the last 24 hours, out of which nearly 1,500 tested positive for coronavirus.

Actor Salman Khan, while talking about the COVID-19 crisis, said, "We all need to stay positive and hold the fort until these bad times pass." He added that one needs to have faith and help others with whatever one can during these critical times. "This is a phase and it shall pass," Salman stated.

Former Chief Secretary of erstwhile Andhra Pradesh, SV Prasad succumbed to coronavirus at a private hospital in Hyderabad on Tuesday. Prasad was appointed as the Chief Secretary in 2010 when K Rosaiah was the Chief Minister of Andhra Pradesh. CJI NV Ramana, CM Jagan Mohan Reddy and his Telangana counterpart K Chandrashekar Rao condoled the death.

The Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) on Wednesday announced that due to the lack of adequate vaccine stock, vaccination will be stopped on Thursday at all government centres in Mumbai. Earlier today, the Union Health Ministry said that over 1.64 crore vaccine doses are still available with the states and UTs. There are currently 2,33,498 active COVID-19 cases in the state.

An Indian-American non-profit organisation American Telangana Society (ATS), along with Telangana Information Technology Association (TITA), has launched a COVID-19 Dawakhana to provide healthcare services in rural Telangana. At this Dawakhana, which is functional at the Zilla Parishad High School in Maganoor, infected villagers would be able to seek online consultation with doctors for free.

Mahindra Group Chairman Anand Mahindra said that Cipla's possible deal with Moderna for COVID-19 booster vaccine is "excellent news". "I pray that the government swiftly grants...the exemptions required. A copious supply of a variety of vaccines...will be our...true defence against a third and all future waves," he added. Cipla is reportedly close to committing $1 billion as advance to Moderna.

The Philippines has extended a ban on inbound travel from India, Pakistan, Sri Lanka, Bangladesh, Nepal, Oman and the UAE until June 15 to prevent transmission of the B.1.617.2 COVID-19 variant. Travellers who've visited these countries in the past 14 days will also be denied entry. The country has reported 13 cases of the B.1.617.2 variant, first detected in India.

Union Education Minister Dr Ramesh Pokhriyal Nishank was admitted to AIIMS in Delhi due to post-COVID-19 complications on Tuesday, ANI reported quoting AIIMS officials. The minister had tested positive for coronavirus on April 21. According to reports, he was likely to announce the government's final decision on conducting CBSE Class 12 board exams today.

IIT Ropar and ScratchNest have developed an IoT device that records real-time temperature during the transportation of perishable products, vaccines, body organs and blood. The "AmbiTAG" is capable of recording temperature of its immediate surroundings from -40 to +80 degrees for 90 days on single charge. It will be made available to Indian companies involved in COVID-19 vaccine transportation.

Jharkhand CM Hemant Soren on Tuesday said the procurement of COVID-19 vaccines by state governments on their own during the ongoing COVID-19 pandemic "stands against the principle of cooperative federalism". "This is probably...the first instance in the history of independent India that the states have been mandated to procure vaccines on their own," Soren wrote to PM Narendra Modi.

After Centre decided to ask state governments to procure COVID-19 vaccines, Madhya Pradesh CM Shivraj Singh Chouhan said that the government had a "perfect vaccination policy", which had to be changed following various states' demands. Chouhan also appealed to Chief Ministers of all states to "come together and urge the Prime Minister to form a centralised policy for COVID-19 vaccination".

Maharashtra Congress Vice President Mohan Joshi claimed that Centre is not giving permission to Pune Municipal Corporation (PMC) to purchase Covishield doses directly from city-based vaccine manufacturer Serum Institute of India (SII). Meanwhile, Mayor Murlidhar Mohol said PMC has already written to the Union Health Ministry, seeking permission for SII to sell vaccine doses directly to the PMC.

Pune Municipal Corporation will conduct special two-day vaccination drive, for students going abroad for studies, on Tuesday and Wednesday between 10 am and 5 pm at Kamla Nehru Hospital. Till date, 338 applications have been received via email for drive, said Additional Municipal Commissioner Rubal Agarwal. PMC aims to vaccinate 200 students on the first day, said a PMC official.

Jharkhand CM Hemant Soren in a letter to PM Narendra Modi has said that the state government was unable to incur nearly ?1,100 crore for the vaccination of people in the age group of 18-44 years. Soren asked PM Modi to allocate free vaccines for the 1.57 crore eligible beneficiaries between the ages of 18 and 44, citing limited resources.

Union Health Minister Harsh Vardhan has urged Rajasthan Health Minister Raghu Sharma to probe reports of alleged wastage of COVID-19 vaccines in state on priority. A media report has highlighted that over 500 vials of vaccines were found dumped in waste bins of 35 vaccination centres in state which is "not acceptable" and must be investigated, Vardhan told Raghu Sharma.

Union Health Ministry termed some media reports stating, even successful booking on CoWIN platform for vaccination slot does not assure one of COVID-19 shot, as "baseless and incorrect". Availability of slots on CoWIN Portal is based on vaccination schedule published by District Immunisation Officer (DIO) or Session site in-charge which in turn depends upon availability of vaccines, said Centre.

About 4,20,750 doses of Covishield for those above the age of 45 were sent by the Union government to Tamil Nadu on Tuesday, the Tamil Nadu Health Department said. This happened hours after the state government announced that the vaccination drive has been suspended from June 2-5. The vaccines will be stocked at the DMS campus before being distributed.

India's COVID-19 vaccination drive slowed in May compared to the previous month even as the central government opened up vaccinations for all its adult population, a report said. The COVID-19 vaccination rate dropped by 28.7% to 5.53 crore vaccine shots in May, compared to 7.75 crore doses during the month of April, Bloomberg Quint reported citing official figures.

The Centre on Tuesday said that only five states have reported more than 10,000 single-day rise in COVID-19 cases. Tamil Nadu with 27,936 coronavirus cases has the highest number. This is followed by 16,604 cases in Karnataka, 15,077 cases in Maharashtra and 12,300 in Kerala. West Bengal reported single-day rise of 10,137 COVID-19 cases.

US drugmaker Eli Lilly and Company on Tuesday said its antibody drug combination has received an emergency use approval in India for the treatment of mild to moderate COVID-19 cases. A combination of the company's monoclonal antibodies bamlanivimab and etesevimab has received approval for restricted use in emergency situations in hospital settings in adults, the company's India unit said.

Power consumption in India grew 8.2% year-on-year to 110.47 billion units (BU) in May 2021 as per power ministry data, signalling a gradual recovery in industrial and commercial demand. Experts believe the slow recovery is due to local lockdowns imposed to contain the spread of COVID-19 and power outages due to cyclones Tauktae and Yaas that hit India in May.

Mumbai's Dharavi locality reported two new COVID-19 cases on Monday, which is the lowest single-day count of cases reported since February 11, according to information provided by the state Health Department. Three new COVID-19 cases were reported from the area on May 26. According to BMC, Dharavi has reported 6,822 cases since last year's COVID-19 outbreak.

After Union Jal Shakti Minister Gajendra Singh Shekhawat alleged that Rajasthan wasted more than 11.5 lakh COVID-19 vaccine doses, the state government on Monday denied the claim. Rajasthan government also claimed that the wastage of COVID-19 vaccine doses in the state is less than 2%, which is below the national average of 6%.

The world needs the cooperation of China to trace origins of COVID-19 and prevent future pandemic threats, a US disease expert said in an interview with NBC. Peter Hotez, co-director of the Texas Children's Hospital Center for Vaccine Development, added, "There's going to be COVID-26 and COVID-32 unless we fully understand the origins of COVID-19."

A University of Southampton and Central University of Jharkhand study claims the first COVID-19 lockdown in India led to a 40% reduction in nitrogen dioxide levels in New Delhi. Researchers concentrated on six major cities and compared data from the 2020 March to May lockdown with pre-pandemic years. An average drop of 12% in NO2 levels was seen throughout India.

The IIM Bangalore Alumni Association has launched an initiative, 'Donate a vaccine', to vaccinate one lakh underprivileged individuals against COVID-19. The initiative was launched virtually in presence of Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman. "This initiative comes at the right time...such an effort...is emulatable; something that every institution in India can learn from," Finance Minister said.

Uttar Pradesh reported 1,317 new coronavirus cases and 179 deaths in the last 24 hours, according to Tuesday's government bulletin. The total number of cases and active cases stand at 16,92,822 and 32,465 respectively. While Gautam Buddh Nagar district (that includes Noida and Greater Noida) logged 68 new cases, Lucknow and Ghaziabad recorded 54 and 35 fresh cases respectively.

KGF' actor Yash on Tuesday announced that he'll be donating ?1.5 crore from his earnings to 3000 members of the Kannada film fraternity amid the COVID-19 pandemic. He said he'll be depositing ?5000 each in the personal accounts of the members. "While I'm...aware that this may not serve as...solution to...pains caused by the situation...it's a ray of hope," he said.

The month of May saw the highest number of funerals conducted as per COVID-19 protocol in Delhi ever since the pandemic began, with MCDs putting the number at 9,324. According to the data by MCDs, this figure in April was 9,156. The data also shows that such funerals have been decreasing since last week, with 50 funerals on May 31.

Chinese Foreign Minister Wang Yi on Tuesday said that China stands with India and will support it as it fights the second wave of COVID-19. "As long as it is needed by India, all BRICS partners, including China, will provide further support and assistance at any time," he added. The BRICS meeting was chaired by External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar.

In a new feature to update COVID-19 vaccination status on Aarogya Setu, people will have to take a self-assessment on the app. People vaccinated with first dose will get "Partially Vaccinated (Unverified)" status and those vaccinated with both the shots will get "Vaccinated (unverified)" status. After clicking on the status button, the 'unverified' status is removed after an OTP-based check.

Pune on Monday got its first drive-in vaccination centre inaugurated at an auditorium in Hadapsar. The centre is the first-of-its-kind in the city and it prioritises senior citizens and disabled persons for vaccination. At least 64 people were vaccinated on the first day. Meanwhile, Mumbai's first drive-in vaccination centre was inaugurated on May 5.

Drugmaker Cipla said that it is working to import COVID-19 vaccines to India and is in the process of seeking clarity and guidance from the Centre for a possible roadmap for it. The statement comes amid the reports that Cipla is close to committing over $1 billion as advance to Moderna for bringing its booster vaccine in India.

The third and largest consignment of Russian COVID-19 vaccine Sputnik V arrived in Hyderabad before dawn today and was cleared in 90 minutes by Hyderabad Customs. The consignment comprising nearly three million doses arrived on a specially chartered freighter RU-9450. Sputnik V was cleared for emergency use in India on April 12.

Karnataka's Technical Advisory Committee (TAC) on coronavirus urged CM BS Yediyurappa's government to continue lockdown after June 7, if the test positivity rate remains over 5%. The restrictions should be eased only if daily infections slide below 5,000 and case fatality rate below 1%. The restrictions were first imposed on April 27 and extended frequently to curtail the virus's spread.

The Centre on Tuesday informed that the states and Union Territories have 1,57,74,331 coronavirus vaccine doses with them. So far, the union government has given over 23 crore vaccines doses, both through the free of cost and direct state procurement categories. States and UTs have utilised 21,51,48,659 doses, including wastage, the government disclosed.

Vistara CEO Leslie Thng has said that the aviation industry is going through one of the toughest times due to the coronavirus pandemic. "Vaccines will play a significant role in the full recovery of air travel demand across the world," he said. "Despite the current situation, we remain focused on protecting all jobs at Vistara," Thng added.

Lebanon's economic and financial crisis is likely to rank as one of the worst the world has witnessed in over 150 years, the World Bank said. "It's likely to rank in the top 10, possibly top 3," it added. Since late 2019, Lebanon has been facing challenges including its largest peace-time economic and financial crisis, coronavirus and Beirut blast.

As many as 623 new coronavirus cases and 62 deaths due to the virus were reported in Delhi in the last 24 hours. The coronavirus positivity rate in the national capital has now dipped to 0.88% from 0.99% reported yesterday. Delhi currently has 10,178 active coronavirus cases. A total of 24,299 people have died of coronavirus in Delhi.

Mahindra Group's Chairman Anand Mahindra tweeted "we may never get to know the truth" regarding the origin of coronavirus. "Just like Nuclear Non-Proliferation Treaty, the world now probably needs a Biological Weapons & Hazardous Research Non-Proliferation Treaty," he added. His tweet came after a report said British intelligence officials believe Wuhan's COVID-19 lab leak theory is 'feasible'.

Peru has more than doubled its coronavirus death toll following a review, making it the country with the world's highest death rate per capita. The government raised the death toll from 69,342 to 1,80,764. Previously, Hungary had the worst coronavirus-related death rate per capita at around 300 per 1,00,000 people. Now, Peru stands at over 500 deaths per 1,00,000 people.

Uttar Pradesh CM Yogi Adityanath has directed to conduct a "sero survey" in state, in a bid to understand prevalence of COVID-19 in urban and remote areas of UP. The serological survey will be launched on June 4 to help find the volume of immunity against coronavirus being developed in the state's people, said an official spokesperson.

Union Education Minister Dr Ramesh Pokhriyal Nishank was admitted to AIIMS in Delhi due to post-COVID-19 complications on Tuesday, ANI reported quoting AIIMS officials. The minister had tested positive for coronavirus on April 21. According to reports, he was likely to announce the government's final decision on conducting CBSE Class 12 board exams today.

Delhi BJP chief Adesh Gupta claimed on Monday that coronavirus deaths in Delhi per million population was "five times higher than the national average". Citing a report from statistics website Worldometers, he said that deaths per million population in India was 234 and 1,207 in Delhi. He added that Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal led-government was "alone responsible for this".

The South American Football Confederation (CONMEBOL) on Monday confirmed that Copa America 2021 will be played in Brazil. The announcement comes less than 24 hours after Argentina was ruled out due to rising COVID-19 cases in the country. Meanwhile, Brazil is still fighting its own battle with coronavirus. The tournament will begin as planned on June 13.

A coronavirus vaccination campaign for parents of children aged below 12 will begin in Noida and Greater Noida from today, officials said. Parents or guardians have to book their slots through CoWIN portal, district immunisation officer Neeraj Tyagi said. They'll need to produce an identification document along with proof of having a child or children aged below 12, he added.

The Tamil Nadu government on Tuesday announced that all students from Classes 1 to 8 in state board schools will be considered pass, based on the Right To Education Act amid the second wave of the coronavirus in the country. Earlier in February, the Tamil Nadu government had announced that students of classes 9 to 11 were declared "all pass".

The UK recorded no new deaths within 28 days of a positive COVID-19 test for the first time since the pandemic began more than a year ago, figures released on Tuesday showed. The last time Britain recorded no deaths was in March 2020, before the country had entered its first lockdown. The data also showed 3,165 new cases of coronavirus.

The Deutch government on Tuesday has lifted the ban on passenger flights arriving from India. The travellers from these areas are now allowed to enter the Netherlands again, provided they test negative for the coronavirus prior to their departure and follow the quarantine rules upon their arrival. The Netherlands had on April 26 decided to suspend flights from India.

Twinkle Khanna and her actor husband Akshay Kumar have raised ?1 crore to "get oxygen concentrators [for] Indian hospitals" amid the coronavirus pandemic. She took to Twitter to share the news and also thanked her fans and followers as her fundraiser campaign reached its goal. "I will keep posting updates. A big shout out to all of you," she wrote.

Uttar Pradesh reported 1,317 new coronavirus cases and 179 deaths in the last 24 hours, according to Tuesday's government bulletin. The total number of cases and active cases stand at 16,92,822 and 32,465 respectively. While Gautam Buddh Nagar district (that includes Noida and Greater Noida) logged 68 new cases, Lucknow and Ghaziabad recorded 54 and 35 fresh cases respectively.

The WHO has approved a Covid-19 vaccine made by Sinovac Biotech for emergency use listing, the second Chinese-produced shot to get its approval. It has recommended its use for people aged 18 and older in a two-dose schedule with a gap of two to four weeks between shots. Sinopharm vaccine was the first Chinese Covid-19 vaccine to get WHO approval.

Bengaluru-based delivery startup Dunzo is set to test the delivery of medicines through drones in Telangana. Dunzo would conduct experimental drone delivery flights for the 'Medicine from the Sky Project' launched by the Telangana government and the World Economic Forum. The test will also help support the delivery of essentials and COVID-19 vaccines later, Dunzo CEO Kabeer Biswas said.

Senior Congress leader Siddaramaiah was admitted to a private hospital in Bengaluru on Tuesday after he was diagnosed with a high fever. The 72-year-old leader has, however, tested negative for COVID-19, hospital authorities confirmed. Siddaramaiah had, on April 29, received the second dose of the COVID-19 vaccine at Victoria Hospital in Bengaluru.

EU countries should take account of global shortages of COVID-19 vaccines before rolling out shots for adolescents, the European Centre for Disease Prevention and Control said. Vaccinating adolescents should be a priority only when they're at high risk of developing serious COVID-19 symptoms, it added. Earlier, the WHO called for a delay in inoculations of young adults in rich nations.

The government on Tuesday released state-wise percentage of the population that received at least one dose of vaccine against COVID-19 in the country. While 41.3% of the population in Ladakh has received at least one dose of COVID-19 vaccine, 6.47% population has received the vaccine in Uttar Pradesh. Around 20.5% population has received COVID-19 vaccine in Delhi, 14.53% in Maharashtra.

On the first day of a special vaccination drive for students going abroad for studies, 987 received their first jabs in Mumbai on Monday. Amid reports of vaccine shortage, Mayor Kishori Pednekar visited the hospitals and assured that every student would be inoculated. "On learning about the shortage...we arranged to replenish...stocks immediately," BMC Additional Commissioner Suresh Kakani said.

The Indian Council of Medical Research (ICMR) on Tuesday said there is no shortage of vaccine and they are confident of vaccinating the whole population by December. "By mid-July or August, we will have enough doses to vaccinate one crore people daily," ICMR Director General Balram Bhargava said. Over 21 crore vaccine doses have been administered in India so far.

Odisha government's COVID-19 WhatsApp helpline is getting support for vaccination information. The service will help guide citizens through the vaccination process right from registration to slot bookings to vaccination certificate procurement. Users will also be able to get answers to queries regarding safety concerns such as misinformation and rumours about vaccines.

The Bengaluru Police issued a notice to activist HM Venkatesh for releasing a 'vaccine trade' audio clip in which BJP MLA Ravi Subramanya was accused of taking a commission for procuring vaccines. Deputy Commissioner of Police (South Division), Harish Pandey said that Venkatesh was summoned by the Girinagar Police after the AV Hospital lodged a complaint against him.

Shiv Sena MP Priyanka Chaturvedi has urged the Union Health Secretary to reduce the gap between two doses of COVID-19 vaccines for students travelling abroad. "Maharashtra has initiated the vaccination for students travelling overseas for further studies," she tweeted. "However, the 12-15 week mandated gap by ICMR has led to apprehension about receiving the second dose on time," Chaturvedi added.

There's no change in the schedule of Covishield doses and both doses will have to be administered with a gap of 12 weeks, the Centre has said. NITI Aayog's Dr VK Paul also said that mixing two different vaccine doses isn't protocol yet. This came after reports said the Centre will test a single-shot Covishield regimen and mixing vaccine doses.

WHO labelled COVID-19's four variants of concern (VOC) and six variants of interest (VOI) using Greek alphabets. For VOC, WHO named the variant first identified in UK as 'Alpha', variant first identified in South Africa as 'Beta', variant identified in Brazil as 'Gamma' and variant first identified in India as 'Delta'. Epsilon, Zeta, Eta, Theta, Iota and Kappa are VOI.

Coronavirus cases in the world rose to over 17 crore, while coronavirus-related deaths crossed 35 lakh, according to Johns Hopkins University tracker. The US is the worst coronavirus-hit country, with the highest number of cases and deaths. In terms of cases, India comes second with over 2.8 crore cases, while Brazil comes second in terms of deaths with 4,62,791 fatalities.

More than 66.1 crore doses of COVID-19 vaccines have been administered in China as of May 31, according to the National Health Commission data on Tuesday. About 2.23 crore doses of COVID-19 vaccines were administered in the country on Monday, the data showed. COVID-19 has infected over 1.11 lakh people in China, according to the World Health Organization (WHO).

Senior BJP leader and former Madhya Pradesh Education Minister Laxmikant Sharma succumbed to COVID-19 at the age of 60 on Monday. After testing positive for the disease on May 11, Sharma was admitted to a private hospital in Bhopal where he died due to bilateral COVID-19 pneumonia, doctors said. He is survived by his wife and three daughters.

Drugmaker Cipla said that it is working to import COVID-19 vaccines to India and is in the process of seeking clarity and guidance from the Centre for a possible roadmap for it. The statement comes amid the reports that Cipla is close to committing over $1 billion as advance to Moderna for bringing its booster vaccine in India.

Film producer Sajid Nadiadwala organised a COVID-19 vaccination drive for over 500 employees and their family members, his spokesperson said on Tuesday. The crew members who got vaccinated are part of his upcoming films like 'Bachchan Pandey', 'Kabhi Eid Kabhi Diwali', 'Tadap' and 'Heropanti 2'. Sajid will be organising another vaccination drive this week.

Congress leader P Chidambaram said that 2020-21 has been the "darkest year of the economy in four decades". Chidambaram added that the current state of the economy was largely due to the impact of the COVID-19 pandemic. "But it has been compounded by the ineptitude and incompetent economic management of the BJP-led NDA government," he further said.

India has reported 1,27,510 new COVID-19 cases and 2,795 more deaths in the last 24 hours. The country reported less than 3,000 COVID-19 deaths after a period of 35 days and also this is the lowest rise in daily COVID-19 cases in 54 days. With this, the total number of cases reached 2,81,75,044, while the death toll surged to 3,31,895.

The government on Tuesday cancelled the CBSE Class 12 Board exams "in view of uncertain conditions due to COVID-19". CBSE will take steps to compile results of Class 12 students as per well-defined objective criteria in a time-bound manner, ANI reported. In case some students desire to take the exams, such an option would be provided to them, it added.

After the cancellation of the CBSE class 12 Board exams, the Council For The Indian School Certificate Examinations (CISCE) on Tuesday cancelled the class 12 (ISC) Board exams this year, amid the COVID-19 pandemic. CISCE Chief Executive Gerry Arathoon has said that class 12 students will be evaluated through an alternative scheme, the details for which will be available soon.

The sarpanch of Ambapuram in rural Andhra Pradesh purchased an ambulance worth ?4 lakh with his own money to help people in his village and surrounding areas during the ongoing COVID-19 pandemic. Gandikota Sitaiah, who recently got elected as a sarpanch, said the ambulance service will be provided free to those who cannot afford its services.

Actress Jacqueline Fernandez shared that her parents want her to live with them in Bahrain because of the COVID-19 situation in India. "My parents...panic when they see the situation in India. My parents desperately want me to live with them in Bahrain...However, I'm pretty intent on staying...here and continuing the work I'm doing," she told The Times of India.

Actor Abhishek Bachchan, who was hospitalised with his father Amitabh Bachchan after they contracted COVID-19 last year, said, "He's [a] good company to have...it was wonderful to wake up and go see my father." He added on Anand Chulani's podcast, "Last year [he] was 78-years-old...with severe comorbidities, but [he was] positive and [had] that fighting spirit to get through this."

Asserting that the state cannot keep extending lockdown, Tamil Nadu Chief Minister MK Stalin on Tuesday urged people to follow restrictions to put a "full stop to COVID-19". "People should duly follow the lockdown restrictions. It is only because of the failure to put a full stop to the first wave, we are facing the second wave," said Stalin.

During the 74th World Health Assembly, WHO chief Tedros Adhanom Ghebreyesus said, "One day the COVID-19 pandemic will be behind us." "But the psychological scars will remain for those who have lost loved ones, who have been stretched beyond breaking point and the millions of people of all ages confronted with months of loneliness and isolation," he further said.

The UK recorded no new deaths within 28 days of a positive COVID-19 test for the first time since the pandemic began more than a year ago, figures released on Tuesday showed. The last time Britain recorded no deaths was in March 2020, before the country had entered its first lockdown. The data also showed 3,165 new cases of coronavirus.

In the week beginning on April 27 and ending on May 3, India's COVID-19 positivity rate was 21.29% and in the week ending on May 10, the positivity rate was 21.38%. There has been a steady decline in weekly positivity rate since last three weeks, shows official data. It has been declining even when testing has increased multifold, said government.

The BMC has said that all domestic air passengers "originating from airports located within Maharashtra to Mumbai" are exempted from RT-PCR test requirement upon landing in Mumbai. However, air passengers arriving into Mumbai from outside Maharashtra have to compulsorily present a negative RT-PCR test report at the time of boarding the flight, the Mumbai airport authorities have said.

Veteran art director Marutirao Kale, who worked in films like 'Saudagar' and 'Disco Dancer', has passed away due to COVID-19 complications in Mumbai. Kale, who was 92 years old, breathed his last on May 26, his daughter Meena Kapadia said. He had tested positive for COVID-19 on May 7 and was undergoing treatment at a hospital in Bandra, Meena added.

As many as 230 resident doctors of Indira Gandhi Government Medical College and Hospital in Nagpur went on an indefinite mass leave on Tuesday. They demanded that they be relieved from COVID-19 duties as the cases were declining and they had to focus on their post-graduation. The Maharashtra Association of Resident Doctors said authorities were completely neglecting the doctors' academics.

The government on Tuesday released state-wise percentage of the population that received at least one dose of vaccine against COVID-19 in the country. While 41.3% of the population in Ladakh has received at least one dose of COVID-19 vaccine, 6.47% population has received the vaccine in Uttar Pradesh. Around 20.5% population has received COVID-19 vaccine in Delhi, 14.53% in Maharashtra.

WHO chose Greek alphabets as COVID-19 variants' names after months of deliberations on possibilities such as names of Greek Gods and pseudo-classical names, bacteriologist Mark Pallen said. Idea to refer variants of concern as VOC1, VOC2 was scrapped after he pointed out it resembled English swear words. WHO stated the variants have been named to simplify pronunciation and avoid stigma.

Union Minister Dharmendra Pradhan on Tuesday inaugurated a 270-bed COVID-19 care centre at Jindal Steel and Power plant in Odisha's Angul district. He said that the corporate will also assist for socio-economic development and health in the state. "There will be no shortage of health infrastructure...Corporate institutions are continuing their efforts to combat the epidemic," Pradhan said.

A study's samples suggesting COVID-19 was circulating outside China by October 2019 were re-tested at WHO's request, scientists who led the Italian research said. COVID-19 was first identified in China's Wuhan in December 2019, while Italy's first patient was detected in February 2020. However, a study suggested antibodies to either COVID-19 or a variant were detected in Italy in 2019.

EU countries should take account of global shortages of COVID-19 vaccines before rolling out shots for adolescents, the European Centre for Disease Prevention and Control said. Vaccinating adolescents should be a priority only when they're at high risk of developing serious COVID-19 symptoms, it added. Earlier, the WHO called for a delay in inoculations of young adults in rich nations.

Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal on Tuesday said he was glad that the central government cancelled the CBSE Class 12 Board exams amid the COVID-19 pandemic. In a tweet, he said, "All of us were very worried about the health of our children. A big relief." The government cancelled the exams "in view of uncertain conditions due to COVID-19".

Senior Congress leader Siddaramaiah was admitted to a private hospital in Bengaluru on Tuesday after he was diagnosed with a high fever. The 72-year-old leader has, however, tested negative for COVID-19, hospital authorities confirmed. Siddaramaiah had, on April 29, received the second dose of the COVID-19 vaccine at Victoria Hospital in Bengaluru.

The Jammu and Kashmir government on Monday capped the cost of RT-PCR tests at ?400 for all private laboratories. The rate will be inclusive of GST/Taxes if any, the cost involved in pickup, packing and transportation of samples, documentation and reporting in the Jammu and Kashmir, the notification said. Currently, there are 35,095 active COVID-19 cases in J&K.

Kerala government has modified the guidelines for the ongoing lockdown till June 9. The government said that all central and state government departments may function with up to 50% staff from June 7 onwards on rotation basis. The government permitted morning walks from 5 am to 7 am and evening walks from 7 pm to 9 pm observing COVID-19 protocols.

India's COVID-19 vaccination drive slowed in May compared to the previous month even as the central government opened up vaccinations for all its adult population, a report said. The COVID-19 vaccination rate dropped by 28.7% to 5.53 crore vaccine shots in May, compared to 7.75 crore doses during the month of April, Bloomberg Quint reported citing official figures.

BJP MLA Mahesh Landge and over 60 others have been booked for violating COVID-19 rules after a video of them celebrating at his daughter's pre-wedding function in Pune went viral online. "Various social distancing norms, mask rules and also the laid down limit of 25 persons in attendance were not followed during the function," the police said.

Stating that vaccines are required in villages and small towns, the Delhi HC on Monday observed that the central government officers are not moving out of their offices. "In every field...your people do not know what they are doing. A little more humility on the end of your officers will go a long way," Delhi HC told the Centre.

IndiGo has decided to implement compulsory leave without pay for its senior employees for up to four days per month till September as passenger traffic has declined due to the second COVID-19 wave. All pilots will have to undertake three days of leave without pay for next three months, the airline said. IndiGo had implemented a similar policy in 2020.

Maharashtra's State Election Commission (SEC) has directed the BMC to start preliminary preparation for the civic polls scheduled in February 2022. "The preparation will also include arrangements of polling booths as per COVID-19 protocol," SEC Secretary Kiran Kurundkar said. "We will have to consider 2011 census for the upcoming polls," Assistant Municipal Commissioner Sangeeta Hasnale said.

Uttar Pradesh CM Yogi Adityanath has directed to conduct a "sero survey" in state, in a bid to understand prevalence of COVID-19 in urban and remote areas of UP. The serological survey will be launched on June 4 to help find the volume of immunity against coronavirus being developed in the state's people, said an official spokesperson.

Coronavirus cases in the world rose to over 17 crore, while coronavirus-related deaths crossed 35 lakh, according to Johns Hopkins University tracker. The US is the worst coronavirus-hit country, with the highest number of cases and deaths. In terms of cases, India comes second with over 2.8 crore cases, while Brazil comes second in terms of deaths with 4,62,791 fatalities.

While over one crore Indians lost their jobs during the second wave of COVID-19, nearly 97% of the households witnessed a decline in incomes since the virus outbreak last year, Centre for Monitoring Indian Economy (CMIE) chief Mahesh Vyas said. "As the economy opens up, part of the problem will be solved but not entirely," Vyas added.

Union Health Ministry termed some media reports stating, even successful booking on CoWIN platform for vaccination slot does not assure one of COVID-19 shot, as "baseless and incorrect". Availability of slots on CoWIN Portal is based on vaccination schedule published by District Immunisation Officer (DIO) or Session site in-charge which in turn depends upon availability of vaccines, said Centre.

India's urban unemployment rate rose to a one-year-high of 17.88% in the week ended May 30, amid COVID-19-induced lockdowns and restrictions. This is three percentage points higher than a fortnight ago, as per Centre for Monitoring Indian Economy (CMIE) data. Labour Force Participation Rate (LFPR) in urban India fell to 35.69% from 37% between May 16 and May 30.

The GD Goenka Public School in Delhi's Vasant Kunj has turned its classrooms into a COVID-19 care centre for frontline workers and their families, said its MD Nipun Goenka. The school took the initiative in association with NGO Sewa Bharti. "The facility is equipped with oxygen concentrators for each bed and a 24X7 ambulance service with oxygen support," Goenka added.

Actress Kamya Panjabi, who is currently in Agra for a shoot, said that it's not easy to live away from her family and kids. She added, "Both my kids miss me, but they are living with family...so I am relaxed." "My husband Shalabh (Dang) keeps visiting me, which is a blessing and gives me a lot of strength," Kamya said.

After Union Jal Shakti Minister Gajendra Singh Shekhawat alleged that Rajasthan wasted more than 11.5 lakh COVID-19 vaccine doses, the state government on Monday denied the claim. Rajasthan government also claimed that the wastage of COVID-19 vaccine doses in the state is less than 2%, which is below the national average of 6%.

India pacer Bhuvneshwar Kumar and his wife Nupur Nagar are reportedly quarantining at their residence in Meerut as a precautionary measure after exhibiting symptoms of COVID-19. According to reports, Bhuvneshwar's mother had tested positive for the virus a few days back and was admitted to a hospital. The 31-year-old is expected to play against Sri Lanka in July.

A Thailand court has approved bail for three anti-government protest leaders who were jailed on charges of insulting King Maha Vajiralongkorn, their lawyer said. Arnon Nampa, Panupong Jadnok and Chukiat Saengwong were granted bail on condition that they will refrain from defaming the monarchy and inciting unrest. The leaders are  currently being treated in hospital after testing COVID-19 positive.

Union Minister Nitin Gadkari on Monday said that the society as well as individuals have a responsibility towards the children orphaned due to COVID-19. "The service to Dalit [community], the exploited, orphans, physically challenged and medically ill, in fact, is service to God," he added. Gadkari was speaking at the inauguration of a COVID-19 care centre in Uttar Pradesh's Mathura.

Delhi BJP chief Adesh Gupta claimed on Monday that coronavirus deaths in Delhi per million population was "five times higher than the national average". Citing a report from statistics website Worldometers, he said that deaths per million population in India was 234 and 1,207 in Delhi. He added that Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal led-government was "alone responsible for this".

Indian benchmark indices opened higher on Tuesday amid positive global cues and a decline in COVID-19 cases in the country. Sensex jumped 130 points to open at 52,067 while the broader Nifty 50 jumped 47 points to hit a fresh record high above 15,600. Bajaj Auto was the top Sensex gainer, followed by HDFC, Bajaj Finance, IndusInd Bank and SBI.

The Supreme Court Tuesday stayed a Delhi High Court order holding as "unconstitutional" the imposition of Integrated Goods and Services Tax (IGST) by the Centre on import of oxygen concentrators by individuals for personal use. Attorney General KK Venugopal said the GST council will meet on June 8 and deliberate on granting exemption to essential items related to COVID-19.

As many as 623 new coronavirus cases and 62 deaths due to the virus were reported in Delhi in the last 24 hours. The coronavirus positivity rate in the national capital has now dipped to 0.88% from 0.99% reported yesterday. Delhi currently has 10,178 active coronavirus cases. A total of 24,299 people have died of coronavirus in Delhi.

The South American Football Confederation (CONMEBOL) on Monday confirmed that Copa America 2021 will be played in Brazil. The announcement comes less than 24 hours after Argentina was ruled out due to rising COVID-19 cases in the country. Meanwhile, Brazil is still fighting its own battle with coronavirus. The tournament will begin as planned on June 13.

A Bengaluru BJP MLA S Raghu on Monday allegedly organised a COVID-19 vaccination drive while cancelling it at a nearby government centre. The vaccination was conducted at a premises run by the MLA and a banner outside it claimed it was free of cost, courtesy the MLA. However, locals  alleged that only his party cadres and friends got the doses.

Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal on Tuesday appealed to the Centre to cancel Class 12 board exams amid COVID-19 and suggested that the students be evaluated on the basis of their past performance. "Students and parents are really worried about Class 12 board exams. They don?t want the exams to be conducted without vaccination," Kejriwal tweeted in Hindi.

Joint Secretary of Health Ministry Lav Agarwal on Tuesday said that recovered cases of COVID-19 in the country have exceeded the daily new cases of infection. Agarwal stated that recovery rates have increased to 92% and that India is now conducting 20 lakh tests per week on average. India reported 1,27,510 new COVID-19 cases in the last 24 hours.

Union Health Minister Harsh Vardhan has urged Rajasthan Health Minister Raghu Sharma to probe reports of alleged wastage of COVID-19 vaccines in state on priority. A media report has highlighted that over 500 vials of vaccines were found dumped in waste bins of 35 vaccination centres in state which is "not acceptable" and must be investigated, Vardhan told Raghu Sharma.

Mumbai Mayor Kishori Pednekar on Tuesday said the elections to the Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) will be held in January-February in 2022 if the COVID-19 situation is under control. The polls will be postponed if the cases don't decline, she added. On Monday, Maharashtra reported 15,077 new COVID-19 cases, which is the lowest in the last three months.

Odisha government's COVID-19 WhatsApp helpline is getting support for vaccination information. The service will help guide citizens through the vaccination process right from registration to slot bookings to vaccination certificate procurement. Users will also be able to get answers to queries regarding safety concerns such as misinformation and rumours about vaccines.

The Supreme Court (SC) on Monday adjourned the hearing of a plea seeking the cancellation of Class 12 exams for CBSE and ICSE students till June 3 after the Centre asked for time. The apex court has asked the Centre to give a "good and tangible reason" if it decides to not cancel the examinations amid coronavirus like last year.

Vietnam plans to test all 90 lakh people in Ho Chi Minh City, the country's largest city, for coronavirus and imposed several curbs to prevent the spread of COVID-19. "The city will prioritise testing high-risk people first including workers in industrial parks," a state-run newspaper said. Authorities will conduct 1 lakh COVID-19 tests a day, it added.

Chief Economic Adviser Krishnamurthy Subramanian said the overall impact of the second wave of COVID-19 on the economy is not likely to be large. He said it would be "difficult to predict exact growth number that the country may achieve as the path for pandemic still remains uncertain". Fiscal and monetary support will be important going forward, he added.

The Pacific nation of Palau has recorded its first case of coronavirus. However, authorities said that the infection was "historical" and posed no transmission risk. The case was detected in a traveller who had arrived in the country on May 9 and tested positive for COVID-19 on day 21 of quarantine after testing negative three times.

The Supreme Court on Monday questioned the Centre over its COVID-19 vaccine procurement policy. With several states floating global tenders to source vaccines, the top court asked Centre, "Are you asking the states to pick up and compete with each other?" It further said there should be central allocation of vaccines and states shouldn't be "left in lurch".

The Supreme Court has told the Centre that there needs to be one price for COVID-19 vaccines across the nation, adding that the pandemic has evolved in the last two months. It said, "Centre says it gets a low price since it buys in bulk. If this is the rationale, then why do states have to pay a higher price?"

The COVID-19 vaccine stock in Tamil Nadu will last only until Tuesday, after which the state government is expected to receive its consignment by June 6, state Health Secretary J Radhakrishnan said on Monday. Tamil Nadu currently has around 4.93 lakh doses of vaccines. So far, 11.97 lakh people in the 18-44 age group have been vaccinated in the state.

BHU researchers have claimed that people who've recovered from COVID-19 may require only a single vaccine dose for immunity. Zoology Professor Gyaneshwer Chaubey said that a study on the effect of vaccine on COVID-19 recovered and non-infected people showed antibodies developed in the former in one week. Only 90% of non-infected persons showed antibodies after three-four weeks, he added.

Maharashtra on Monday reported 15,077 new COVID-19 cases in the lowest single-day increase in fresh cases the state has seen in three months. The state also witnessed 184 COVID-19 deaths and 33,000 discharges in the last 24 hours. Mumbai recorded 676 new COVID-19 cases, 5,570 recoveries, and 29 deaths during the 24-hour period.

British spies believe that the theory coronavirus escaped from a Chinese lab is feasible, reported The Sunday Times. To probe the matter, British spy agencies are recruiting human intelligence sources in China through the dark web, where Chinese employees can share secrets anonymously, reports added. Wuhan lab is a short distance from where the first COVID-19 cases were recorded.

The Union Health Ministry on Monday said that the CoWIN platform doesn't collect any information about the COVID-19 infection history of any person. "CoWIN has been built as a platform to manage vaccination in the country," it said. CoWIN enforces only those rules (relating to gaps between two shots) as announced by the Centre from time to time, it added.

Actor Angad Bedi recalled the time when he had to stay away from his daughter Mehr and wife Neha Dhupia after testing positive for COVID-19. "Mehr is just two-and-a-half, and she doesn't understand why her father cannot...see her. These are emotions that just break you," he said. Angad added that it was difficult to stay away from his family.

Kerala CM Pinarayi Vijayan has written to 11 chief ministers of non-BJP states seeking a united effort to urge Centre to procure COVID-19 vaccines and ensure "free universal vaccination". Taking to Twitter, Vijayan wrote that it is "quite unfortunate" that Centre absolved itself of its duty to source vaccines. United effort is the need of the hour, he added.

Dr Reddy's Laboratories is in talks with the central government to bring Russia's single-dose Sputnik Light COVID-19 vaccine into India, a company spokesperson told Reuters. Sputnik Light demonstrated 79.4% efficacy in comparison to 91.6% for the two-shot Sputnik V, the vaccine's website said. Sputnik Light has proven effective against all new strains of coronavirus, Russia had said.

Investors' wealth has jumped by ?3.93 lakh crore during four consecutive sessions of gains in the equity markets amid a declining trend in COVID-19 cases. The 30-share BSE Sensex has climbed 1,299.91 points in the last four sessions. Sensex on Monday closed 514 points higher at 51,937 and Nifty gained 147 points to end at a record high of 15,583.

World Health Organization (WHO) chief Tedros Adhanom Ghebreyesus has called for launching negotiations this year on an international treaty to boost pandemic preparedness and response. "This is an idea whose time has come," he added. Tedros further said that the WHO faced a "serious challenge" to maintain its COVID-19 response at the current level and required sustainable and flexible funding.

The World Health Organization (WHO) has announced new labels for COVID-19 Variants of Concern (VOCs) and has labelled the variant first identified in India (B.1.617.2) as 'Delta'. Another variant that was earlier found in India (B.1.617.1) has been labelled as 'Kappa'. The B.1.617 variant of COVID-19 has been officially recorded in 53 territories, WHO had earlier said.

Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal on Monday reacted to the Centre's action to recall West Bengal Chief Secretary Alapan Bandyopadhyay, saying that "this wasn't the time to fight with state governments". He added that this is instead the time to "fight the coronavirus together" and help the state governments. "Whole life is left for fights and politics," he further said.

Former SRH skipper David Warner, member of the Australian contingent, who took part in now suspended IPL 2021, on Monday completed his 14-day hotel quarantine in Sydney. "It's great to be home," wrote Warner on Instagram. Forty members of the Australian contingent stranded in Maldives landed in Sydney on May 17 and were quarantined as per the COVID-19 protocols.

Singapore's PM Lee Hsien Loong on Monday said that the country will start vaccinating children over 12 years old against COVID-19. Earlier, Singapore had approved the use of the Pfizer-BioNTech COVID-19 vaccine for those aged 12-15 years. The city-state had recently re-imposed restrictions on social gatherings to combat a surge in local coronavirus cases.

Renault-Nissan's Tamil Nadu car plant will be inspected for coronavirus-related safety protocols. Earlier, a union representing plant's workers had said the workers will be going on a strike from May 26 over plant's COVID-19 measures and policies. A two-judge bench has ordered a senior government official to visit the plant for an inspection and asked workers to resume their duties.

Jammu and Kashmir administration has reopened markets after a month-long lockdown due to a surge in COVID-19 cases, officials said. According to new guidelines imposed by authorities on Sunday, shops have been allowed to open on alternate days. The ease-out process was launched amid the positivity rate falling to 6.2% from 13%.

Delhi reported 648 new COVID-19 cases in the last 24 hours, the lowest rise in new cases the national capital has seen since March 18. Delhi also recorded 86 deaths and 1,622 recoveries in the last 24 hours, data released on Monday showed. The positivity rate in Delhi dropped below 1% to 0.99%.

Vietnam has asked Samsung Electronics and other foreign companies to find COVID-19 vaccines for their workers, the government's website reported. Authorities in Bac Ninh Province have also ordered factories to set up on-site sleeping arrangements for workers. Recently, the European Chamber of Commerce in Vietnam urged the government to allow firms to procure vaccines and inoculate staff.

The Employees' Provident Fund Organisation (EPFO) has allowed its over five crore subscribers to avail the second COVID-19 advance. "EPFO is committed to settle these claims within three days of their receipt," the Labour Ministry said. "As on date, EPFO has settled more than 76.31 lakh COVID-19 advance claims thereby disbursing a total of ?18,698.15 crore," it added.

Expressing concern over the heavy traffic on Mumbai roads, Maharashtra CM Uddhav Thackeray said the lockdown-like curbs will be made stricter if such a situation continues. "I myself cross-checked my speech made last night. I did not say that COVID-19 restrictions have been lifted," Thackeray said. The Maharashtra government has extended the lockdown-like restrictions in the state till June 15.

Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal on Monday replied to Haryana CM Manohar Lal Khattar's criticism about him "doing politics" over  COVID-19 vaccines, saying that his "aim isn't to save vaccines, but to save lives". "Khattar sahib, only vaccines will save lives," Kejriwal added. Khattar had also claimed that Delhi received more vaccines than other states on basis of per million population.

Patanjali founder Baba Ramdev, who was criticised recently for his remarks against allopathy, has said that he "didn't feel the need to get vaccinated" against COVID-19 as he had been practising Yoga and Ayurveda "for decades". "Over 100 crore people of India as well as in foreign countries have access to these ancient therapies," he added.

An ANM (auxiliary nurse midwife) of primary health centre in Aligarh was booked for allegedly disposing of 29 syringes filled with COVID-19 vaccines without administrating them to beneficiaries. The incident has been reported from Jamalpur Primary Health Centre. On complaint of CMO office, police lodged FIR against ANM Neha Khan and Medical Officer-in-charge of primary health centre Afreen Zehra.

A man in UP's Lucknow has filed a police complaint against SII CEO Adar Poonawalla alleging that he didn't develop COVID-19 antibodies despite taking a Covishield dose. He also claimed that he became more prone to the virus after vaccination as his platelet count reduced by half. Union Health Ministry Joint Secretary Lav Agarwal was also named in the complaint.

BHU researchers have claimed that people who've recovered from COVID-19 may require only a single vaccine dose for immunity. Zoology Professor Gyaneshwer Chaubey said that a study on the effect of vaccine on COVID-19 recovered and non-infected people showed antibodies developed in the former in one week. Only 90% of non-infected persons showed antibodies after three-four weeks, he added.

India may soon start testing feasibility of a regimen that mixes doses of two different COVID-19 vaccines to see if it boosts immune response to the virus, an official of an advisory committee of the Centre said. India will have at least 20-25 crore vaccine doses per month by August, Dr NK Arora, Chairman of NTAGI's COVID-19 working group said.

Vietnam has asked Samsung Electronics and other foreign companies to find COVID-19 vaccines for their workers, the government's website reported. Authorities in Bac Ninh Province have also ordered factories to set up on-site sleeping arrangements for workers. Recently, the European Chamber of Commerce in Vietnam urged the government to allow firms to procure vaccines and inoculate staff.

Delhi Deputy CM Manish Sisodia on Monday said BJP leaders criticise and abuse CM Arvind Kejriwal to cover up their failure in vaccine management. Sisodia added, "No matter how much they abuse, Kejriwal will continue to demand vaccines for people of Delhi." He added that when BJP stopped Delhi's medical oxygen supply, it was Kejriwal who fought for its resumption.

The COVID-19 vaccine stock in Tamil Nadu will last only until Tuesday, after which the state government is expected to receive its consignment by June 6, state Health Secretary J Radhakrishnan said on Monday. Tamil Nadu currently has around 4.93 lakh doses of vaccines. So far, 11.97 lakh people in the 18-44 age group have been vaccinated in the state.

Bharat Biotech is going to increase the production of Covaxin to 10-12 crore doses per month by July-end, informed National Technical Advisory Group on Immunisation (NTAGI) Chairman Dr NK Arora. He added that nearly 25 crore made-in-India vaccine doses are expected to be available by August. SII will also manufacture 10-12 crore doses by June-end, Arora added.

The United Arab Emirates (UAE) has extended the suspension of passenger flights from India till June 30 in an effort to curb the spread of COVID-19. The ban was initially imposed in April. Foreign travellers who've been to India in the last 14 days will not be allowed to enter the UAE, Emirates, the flag carrier of the country, said.

Haryana CM Manohar Lal Khattar criticised Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal for "doing politics over COVID-19 vaccine supply". He further claimed that the national capital received more vaccines than other states on basis of per million population. "Kejriwal always speaks in tone of criticism. The Centre has to supply vaccine doses to all the states and not just Delhi," said Khattar.

Drugmaker Cipla said that it is close to committing over $1 billion as advance to Moderna for bringing its booster vaccine in India, according to reports. Cipla has reportedly requested the government for indemnification, exemptions from price capping, bridging trials and basic customs duty. Cipla has shown interest to procure 50 million doses from Moderna for 2022, reports said.

Avani Singh, CEO of SpiceHealth and daughter of SpiceJet Ltd Chairman Ajay Singh, has called upon Centre to open up manufacture and procurement of COVID-19 vaccines to private sector. She said it's the only way to ensure nation's vast population receives adequate protection from pandemic. "Government needs to become more lenient in opening up vaccination to private sector," she stated.

Actress Malaika Arora, who tested positive for COVID-19 last year, opened up about her journey to recovery and wrote on Instagram, "I...tested negative on the 26th of September...But the weakness stayed." She added, "I was afraid that I'd never gain back my strength...My first workout was brutal. I couldn't do anything well. I felt broken."

Holding Central Vista Project to be of national importance, the Delhi High Court on Monday dismissed a petition which sought a stay on the construction taking place at Central Vista Avenue in view of the second wave of the COVID-19 pandemic. The court also imposed ?1 lakh fine on petitioners, saying, "This is motivated petition and not a genuine PIL."

The government took to Twitter to share a map highlighting states which are still reporting over 10,000 daily COVID-19 cases. As many as six states reported over 10,000 COVID-19 cases in the last 24 hours. Tamil Nadu and Karnataka reported more than 20,000 cases in the last 24 hours, while Kerala and Maharashtra recorded over 18,500 cases.
