"As of today, more cases have been reported so far this year than in the whole of 2020," he added. Tedros also condemned the "scandalous inequity" of the global vaccine rollout, which is "perpetuating the pandemic".

The WHO has said that more information is required from Bharat Biotech, which is seeking emergency use listing for its COVID-19 vaccine Covaxin, according to its latest status report. The company had submitted an expression of interest on April 19, WHO's report showed. Bharat Biotech has reportedly conveyed to government that it submitted 90% documents to WHO for the listing.

Vietnam's PM Pham Minh Chinh has ordered government officials to create mechanisms to solicit donations from individuals, companies and organisations to the country's COVID-19 vaccine fund, according to a post on the government's website. The government had said that it will need around $1.1 billion to acquire vaccines for 75 million people, out of Vietnam's population of 98 million.

Hyderabad-headquartered Bharat Biotech's Co-founder and Joint Managing Director Suchitra Ella on Tuesday said that the company's COVID-19 vaccine Covaxin reached 30 cities within 30 days. She tweeted, "All our employees are committed, working 24x7 through lockdowns for the country's immunisation." She added, "Please send your prayers to their families, some are still quarantined & off work."

BJP MLA representing Coimbatore South Vanathi Srinivasan on Tuesday requested Union Health Minister Harsh Vardhan to constitute a high-level team to assist the Tamil Nadu government in handling the COVID-19 pandemic. In a letter, Srinivasan said Coimbatore is facing an acute shortage of vaccines and the people in the age group of 45 plus are unable to get vaccinated.

The Union Health Ministry on Tuesday informed that more than 1.7 crore COVID-19 vaccine doses are still available with the states and Union Territories (UTs). The ministry added that over 21.89 crore doses have been provided by the government to the states and UTs so far. Seven lakh doses will be given within the next three days, it stated.

Haryana government on Tuesday informed that it has improved vaccine wastage data from six percent, as per data recently released by the central government, to two-three percent. "Vaccine wastage percentage was relatively higher in the data released by the Centre as there was data mismatch and the districts have rectified it," the state Health Department stated.

Bharat Biotech on Tuesday said it expects approval for its COVID-19 vaccine Covaxin from the WHO for Emergency Use Authorisation during July-September 2021. The company said regulatory approvals for Covaxin are in process in over 60 countries including the USA, Brazil and Hungary among others. "Emergency Use Authorisation has been obtained in 13 countries with more to follow," it added.

The Karnataka Pradesh Congress Committee (KPCC) on Tuesday launched 'Let Congress Vaccinate', an online campaign to create awareness about the importance of COVID-19 vaccination. This comes days after KPCC prepared a ?100 crore plan to procure COVID-19 vaccines directly from manufacturers. According to Congress, more than 20,000 people lent their support to the campaign on the launch day.

Apollo Hospitals Joint MD Sangita Reddy said that the group is ramping up to provide one lakh COVID-19 vaccine doses per day at its centres. "I'm...optimistic the country will reach a level of vaccinating 50 lakh Indians a day in...30-45 days," she said. We must aspire to vaccinate at least 60% of population with one dose by November, Reddy added.

The Himachal Pradesh government has announced that the coronavirus curfew in the state has been extended till 6 am on May 31. Himachal Pradesh CM Jairam Thakur said that the state has reported a decline in COVID-19 cases and the extension in curfew will help in breaking the infection cycle. The ongoing curfew was to end on May 26.

A case has been registered against three Congress MLAs and 12 other Congress workers for staging a protest amid coronavirus curfew in Madhya Pradesh's Indore on Monday. The party workers were protesting against an FIR lodged against former MP CM Kamal Nath and allegedly burned an effigy of MP CM Shivraj Singh Chouhan. The workers had protested sporting black bands.

National Technical Advisory Group on Immunisation (NTAGI) Chairman Dr NK Arora said that India's vaccine-related decisions are based on scientific evidence. "We are not just trying to have the best efficacy but also trying to see that the country is protected from various variants and waves of coronavirus going forward," Dr Arora added.

A video has surfaced showing Karnataka BJP MLA Abhay Patil leading an 'Agnihotra homa' (fire ritual) procession on streets of Belagavi, claiming it would eradicate COVID-19. The video shows Patil, along with a group, burning cow dung cakes, camphor, neem leaves and other herbs in a cart. "I follow Ayurveda...By performing the homa, I hope we can contain...COVID-19," said Patil.

Congress leader Rahul Gandhi will organise a sanitation campaign in Amethi, his former constituency, a party official said on Tuesday. District Congress President Pradeep Singhal said 10,000 litres of sanitisers will soon be arriving in Amethi and teams have been formed to carry out the drive amid the second wave of COVID-19.

Quetta Gladiators' pacer Naseem Shah has been ruled out of the rescheduled PSL for breaching the COVID-19 protocols. According to reports, players assembling at hotels were required to bring COVID-19 negative reports of RT-PCR tests taken not more than 48 hours prior to their arrival at the hotel. However, Naseem produced the report of a test conducted on May 18.

United Nations Secretary-General Antonio Guterres said the world is "at war" with COVID-19, adding that the virus "cannot be beaten one country at a time". "We need the logic and urgency of a war economy to boost the capacity of our weapons," Guterres said. "The most vulnerable are suffering most and I fear this is far from over," he added.

Nearly 400 train passengers who arrived at a railway station in Assam on Monday escaped the station premises to avoid being tested for COVID-19. Assam has made COVID-19 testing mandatory on arrival for all train passengers. According to a report, police has booked many passengers under relevant sections of the IPC and Disaster Management Act for violation of COVID-19 norms.

Barclays on Tuesday cut India's GDP growth forecast to 9.2% for 2021-22 from its previous estimate of 10%. It said that the economic impact of the second wave of COVID-19 has been deeper than initially expected. "The slow vaccination drive may pose medium-term risks to growth, especially if the country experiences a third wave of COVID-19 cases," Barclays added.

Bahujan Samaj Party chief Mayawati on Tuesday extended her support to Samyukta Kisan Morcha's call for protest on May 26 to mark six months of farmers' protests against the farm laws. "Farmers...are continuously agitating even in the extreme calamity of COVID-19...Centre also needs to adopt a sympathetic attitude," she said. Earlier, 12 opposition parties extended support to May 26 protest.

Samajwadi Party chief Akhilesh Yadav demanded that students should be vaccinated against COVID-19 before board exams are conducted. "Pehle tika, fir pariksha (First vaccination, then examination). No examination without vaccination," Akhilesh Yadav tweeted. In April, the CBSE cancelled the Class 10 board exams and postponed the Class 12 board exams amid the COVID-19 surge.

Senior Congress leader Anand Sharma on Tuesday called for unity between the Centre and states in fighting the COVID-19 pandemic, saying it is time Prime Minister Narendra Modi walk the talk on cooperative federalism. "In a democracy differences in ideology will remain but these should not become personal. We must all stand united in this time of crisis," said Sharma.

IPL franchise Punjab Kings have joined forces with Round Table India (RTI) to help provide oxygen concentrators to COVID-19 patients in need of oxygen support. PBKS will finance and RTI will handle the distribution part. After its return, the concentrator will be sanitized before giving it to another patient. PBKS tweeted a picture, "Project Saah! Let's help India breathe again."

Mumbai on Tuesday reported 1,037 fresh COVID-19 cases, taking the city's caseload to 6,99,904, according to official data. The death toll rose to 14,708 after the city reported 37 more deaths due to the disease in the last 24 hours. As many as 1,427 people were discharged, while the number of active COVID-19 cases stands at 27,649.

Pfizer-BioNtech has asked the US Food and Drug Administration to expand emergency use authorisation for their COVID-19 vaccine to children aged 12-15. The request comes a week after Pfizer said that the vaccine was 100% effective in phase 3 trials on 12-15 years old. "We plan to request similar rulings by other regulatory authorities worldwide in coming days," it added.

A night curfew will be imposed in Uttar Pradesh's Muzaffarnagar from April 10 to 18, authorities announced on Friday. However, essential services will be exempted from the curfew that'll be in force from 9 pm to 5 am. Muzaffarnagar has reported 161 COVID-19 cases and two deaths in the last 24 hours, taking the total number of cases to 9,824.

Chandigarh's Postgraduate Institute of Medical Education and Research has decided to suspend physical examination of patients at the Outpatient Departments (OPDs) of the institute from Monday. PGIMER Director Professor Jagat Ram said, "The emergency services at PGIMER will function as usual." PGI campus has seen a rise in COVID-19 cases, with eight cases being reported on the campus on Friday.

Veteran actor Satish Kaul, who had 300 Punjabi and Hindi films to his credit and played the role of Lord Indra in the TV show 'Mahabharat', passed away due to coronavirus-related complications on Saturday in Ludhiana. Kaul's sister Satya Devi told Indian Express, "He had fever for the last five-six days and wasn't keeping well."

Congress leader Rahul Gandhi on Saturday expressed concern over the COVID-19 situation and said the "virus attacks the poorest and disadvantaged the hardest". He urged the government to look at new mutations of COVID-19 and demanded basic income support from the Centre. He made the remarks during a virtual meeting of CMs of Congress-ruled states to review the COVID-19 situation.

India's goods exports increased by 297% year-on-year in the first week of April to $6.79 billion while imports rose by 244.2% to $9.66 billion, as per government data. Exports in the first week of April in 2020 stood at $1.71 billion due to the COVID-19-induced lockdown. India's total exports fell an estimated 7.4% to $289.92 billion in 2020-21.

Around 7,000 petrol pumps remained closed in Rajasthan on Saturday as the state's Petroleum Dealers' Association called for a one-day strike to demand a rollback of VAT on fuel in the state. The association's President Suneet Bagai said the fuel prices in Rajasthan are ?5-10 costlier than neighbouring states as the government increased VAT during the COVID-19 pandemic.

Due to the rising COVID-19 cases, Aligarh Muslim University (AMU) has cancelled the entrance examinations for the 2021-2022 session. The university's Public Relation Officer, Omar Saleem Peerzada, informed about the development. However, a fresh entrance schedule will be uploaded soon by the university authorities on AMU's official website, he added.

More than 110 people have been fined for dining at a restaurant in Paris on Friday in violation of the restrictions imposed due to COVID-19, the police said. Restrictions on restaurants, bars and cafes have been imposed amid the third national lockdown in France. Earlier, an undercover report showed secret dinners in Paris where guests were seen defying COVID-19 norms.

India needs to grow at a much faster pace to make up for the unprecedented contraction of 8% last year owing to the COVID-19 pandemic, IMF's Petya Koeva Brooks said. Brooks added that targeted support for households and for firms that have been most affected is the most efficient way to provide support.

The Sports Authority of India (SAI) on Friday announced a three-week 'summer vacation' across all its National Centres of Excellence due to rising COVID-19 cases in the country. However, Olympic-bound athletes would continue to train at the ongoing camps. All athletes and staff staying back will undergo a weekly RT-PCR test, as per SAI SOPs.

Authorities in Delhi will conduct the sixth sero-survey from Monday to determine the extent of the spread of COVID-19, Health Department officials said. The survey's sample size will be 28,000. While Delhi?s fifth sero-survey had revealed that 56.1% of the population had been exposed to the COVID-19 infection, the fourth sero-survey showed that 25.5% of the population had developed antibodies.

Gujarat Chief Minister Vijay Rupani on Saturday said the state government is not in favour of imposing a lockdown considering its impact on poor. However, he welcomed voluntary imposition of lockdowns at a local level by villages or market associations in cities. With 4,541 fresh COVID-19 cases, the tally of cases in Gujarat reached 3,37,015 on Friday.

As many as 794 coronavirus deaths were reported in India in the last 24 hours, out of which 10 states accounted for 86.78%. Maharashtra saw the maximum casualties (301), followed by Chhattisgarh (91). Punjab recorded 56 deaths, Karnataka 46, while Gujarat and Uttar Pradesh reported 42 and 36 deaths each. Further, Rajasthan saw 32 casualties.

Japan reported on Friday it will raise the coronavirus alert level in Tokyo to allow tougher measures to control the spread of a more contagious variant ahead of the Tokyo Olympics. The governor of Tokyo will impose shorter opening hours for bars and restaurants along with punishments for violators and compensation for those who comply. The measures begin from Monday.

Congress leader Rahul Gandhi on Saturday hit out at central government saying that its "failed policies" had led to the "terrible second wave of coronavirus in the country and forced migrants to flee again". "But, the egoistic government is allergic to good suggestions!" he added. It's "necessary to put money in migrants' hands" along with increasing vaccinations, he further said.

Madhya Pradesh Tourism Minister Usha Thakur was on Friday spotted conducting a puja at Indore airport to prevent coronavirus. She performed the puja before the statue of Devi Ahilya Bai Holkar on the premises and was joined by the Airport Director, and other staff members. In a video that went viral, she can be seen clapping, singing and showering flowers.

AR Rahman, while speaking about the theatrical release of his maiden production '99 Songs' amid the coronavirus pandemic, said, "There is pressure. This is not a formulaic film." "Come with low expectations and high hopes but come to theatres with all safety precautions," he added. "People need to see it on...big screen. It is a cinematic experience," Rahman further said.

As many as 94,828 samples, collected randomly from incoming passengers to Delhi at the airport, railway stations and bus terminals, have been tested for COVID-19. Out of the total, 1,221 tested positive for COVID-19 which translates to a positivity rate of 1.28%. At 532, railway stations in Delhi and Kashmere Gate ISBT accounted for maximum positive cases among incoming passengers.

Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation has said all private COVID-19 vaccination centres in Mumbai will remain shut till April 12 as no vaccination stock is available. "Vaccination to take place only at government & municipal hospitals on April 10 (12pm-6pm) and April 11 (9am-5pm)," it added. Citizens eligible for vaccination can travel to vaccination centres during curfew on medical grounds.

The Navi Mumbai Municipal Corporation has fined five housing societies ?10,000 each for violating COVID-19 norms. The housing societies have been warned that the civic body would impose ?25,000 fines if they're found violating the micro containment zone rules for the second time. NMMC also fined one society for carrying out construction works without conducting a COVID-19 test of manpower.

The National Human Rights Commission has sought an Action Taken Report (ATR) from the Chief Election Commissioner and the Union Home Secretary over alleged COVID-19 guidelines' violations in poll-bound states. NHRC sought a report from both the authorities within four weeks. The NHRC has sought the report on the petition filed by human rights lawyer and SC advocate, Radhakanta Tripathy.

Olympic-bound Indian archers Atanu Das, Deepika Kumari and Tarundeep Rai received their final shot of the coronavirus vaccine at the Army Sports Institute in Pune on Wednesday. "2nd and final dose of vaccine is done. Thank you so much Army Sports Institute for making everything smooth and convenient," tweeted Das. Deepika and Tarundeep informed about their second dose on Instagram.

Chhattisgarh CM Bhupesh Baghel on Friday took his first dose of COVID-19 vaccine at Pt Jawahar Lal Nehru Memorial Medical College, Raipur. Baghel had earlier urged the Centre to provide the required stock of COVID-19 vaccines for a week in advance. He had also sought a reduction in the GST rate on medicines and devices used in the COVID-19 treatment.

Indian Army Chief General MM Naravane on Thursday gifted 1 lakh COVID-19 vaccine doses to his Bangladeshi counterpart General Aziz Ahmed. Ahmed thanked India for helping Bangladesh tackle the coronavirus pandemic, as per reports. During the meeting, they reportedly discussed issues related to the existing good relations between the two countries' armed forces and mutual cooperation in the future.

Union Health Minister Harsh Vardhan said on Friday that over 9.4 crore coronavirus vaccine doses have been administered so far, with over 36 lakh given in the past 24 hours. "Last week we even gave 43 lakh doses one day, probably...highest given anywhere in the whole world," he added. India recorded its highest one-day spike with 1,31,968 cases on Friday.

In an apparent dig at PM Narendra Modi's call to observe 'Tika Utsav' (vaccination festival) from April 11 to 14, Congress leader Rahul Gandhi on Friday said that vaccine shortage in the country is a serious issue and not a festival. Blaming India's vaccine export for the shortage, Rahul added that the Centre should support all states without any bias.

HSBC and the Asian Development Bank (ADB) said they will together provide $300 million in financing to boost Asia's manufacturing capacity for COVID-19 vaccines. "Right now demand for vaccines far outstrips supply and one of the challenges is that supply and distribution networks have to be formed, which requires a lot of liquidity," an HSBC executive stated.

The Finance Ministry has requested the Home Ministry and Health Ministry to enable COVID-19 vaccination of bankers and National Payments Corporation of India (NPCI) employees on a "priority basis" regardless of age. "This will go a long way in assuring them about the safety of themselves...and will boost their morale in continuing to provide their best services," the Ministry wrote.

Johnson & Johnson, the only manufacturer with a single-dose COVID-19 vaccine, will soon conduct clinical trials in India, The Indian Express reported citing government sources. The US healthcare giant has reportedly sent a letter to India's Central Drugs Standard Control Organisation, saying it would "very shortly apply" for permission for trials. Currently, India has two approved vaccines in use.

The Serum Institute of India has fully refunded South Africa for the 5 lakh doses of the COVID-19 vaccine, which were not delivered to the country. This comes after South Africa decided not to use the vaccine because it was not effective against a new variant of the virus. South Africa has sold delivered doses to other African Union countries.

The European Union's (EU) vaccine chief, Thierry Breton, has said that the EU is on track for herd immunity by mid-July. He added that the EU was "working extremely hard" to make this happen and that it was possible. Breton's comments came as the EU faces criticism for their slow pace of delivery of COVID-19 vaccines across the 27-nation bloc.

The Serum Institute of India (SII) is legally bound to ship COVID-19 vaccines to the global vaccine-sharing facility COVAX, its co-lead Gavi told Reuters. This comes after SII delayed global shipments to meet India's needs amid rising COVID-19 cases. COVAX had expected over 100 million doses from SII between February and May but has so far received only 18.2 million.

Three women, aged 72, 70 and 60, were allegedly administered anti-rabies injections instead of the coronavirus vaccine at a government hospital in Uttar Pradesh's Shamli district, their families claimed. The women were allegedly handed anti-rabies vaccine slips as well. Brijendra Singh, in-charge of the health centre has said that an inquiry would be conducted into the incident.

Adar Poonawalla-led vaccine maker Serum Institute of India (SII) has bought a minority stake in insurance aggregator Policybazaar. True North sold a part of its stake in Policybazaar to five different firms, including SII, Ashoka India Equity Investment Trust and Triumph Global Holdings. 
In February, SII's subsidiary Poonawalla Finance bought majority stake in NBFC Magma Fincorp for ?3,450 crore.

Hong Kong said it has asked Oxford-AstraZeneca to suspend its shipments of COVID-19 vaccine amid severe side effect fears and concerns over its efficacy against new variants. The city preferred "to avoid any waste as vaccines are in short supply globally", health chief Sophia Chan said. About 5,29,000 people have received their first dose of COVID-19 vaccine in Hong Kong.

Westlife Development, which operates McDonald's franchise in West and South India, has said that select stores in Mumbai will operate 24/7 for contactless delivery amid COVID-19-led restrictions in the city. This comes after the Maharashtra government allowed 24/7 food delivery in Mumbai. Earlier this month, the company announced that it will cover cost of vaccines for 10,000 McDonald's employees.

Refuting the reports of vaccine shortage, Union Home Minister Amit Shah on Friday said that all states are being provided with an adequate number of doses. This comes after Maharashtra, Odisha, Chhattisgarh and a few other states complained of facing a vaccine shortage. Notably, Health Minister Harsh Vardhan also said that over 4 crore vaccine doses are still in stock.

Russia's Sputnik V vaccine is less effective against the South African COVID-19 variant but still does better than other vaccines, Alexander Gintsburg, the lead scientist behind it, said. Gintsburg claimed that the Russian vaccine also provides better protection against the British variant. The vaccine was tested against the variants and the original strain by laboratories in the US, he added.

After Congress leader Rahul Gandhi wrote to PM Narendra Modi over vaccine shortage, Union Minister Ravi Shankar Prasad responded to him. ?India isn't facing vaccine starvation but Shri Gandhi is facing attention starvation. Why hasn't he taken the vaccine?? tweeted Prasad. He further asked if Rahul had taken the vaccine in a foreign country but "doesn't want to disclose it."

Rajasthan CM Ashok Gehlot has written to PM Narendra Modi urging him to provide the state with at least 30 lakh COVID-19 vaccine doses as their current stock ?will finish in next two days?. Gehlot also said that the state plans to vaccinate 5 lakh people every day. Rajasthan has administered 86,89,770 doses from January 16 to April 7.

Amid rising coronavirus cases, Congress leader Rahul Gandhi wrote a letter to PM Narendra Modi asking him to halt the export of vaccine to other nations and to open "vaccination for everyone who needs it". Presenting his seven-point demands, Gandhi also asked if the vaccine export was an "oversight", referring to the Centre's recent order on small savings.

Facebook will convert part of its headquarters in California into a vaccination clinic for under-served communities. It plans to offer transportation for residents seeking shots to get to and from its campus. However, Facebook employees will not be eligible for the vaccination programme, under which the Ravenswood Family Health Center will administer the Covid-19 vaccines.

The European Medicines Agency (EMA) said that it's reviewing reports of rare blood clots in four people who received Johnson & Johnson's COVID-19 vaccine. Of the four cases, three have been reported in the US during the vaccine's rollout, EMA added. In response, the company said that it's working with regulators to assess the data and provide relevant information.

The Centre has released the names of 12 states/UTs which have more than 3.3 lakh confirmed coronavirus cases in the country. Maharashtra has the highest number with 32,29,547 COVID-19 cases. This is followed by Kerala, Karnataka, Andhra Pradesh, Tamil Nadu, Delhi, Uttar Pradesh, West Bengal, Chhattisgarh, Rajasthan, Odisha and Gujarat.

Taking preventive measures to check on the spread of coronavirus, the Uttar Pradesh government on Friday imposed a night curfew in the Moradabad district from 10 pm to 6 am. The Moradabad district administration said the night curfew will begin on Friday night and will continue till April 16. However, essential services will continue functioning normally during the curfew period.

Bihar government on Friday extended the closure of schools till April 18 and announced fresh coronavirus restrictions in the state. All shops in the state will have to close after 7 pm, while hotels, dhabas and restaurants can function at 25% capacity. Additionally, seating capacities of cinema halls and public transportation have been capped at 50%.

After Maharashtra government imposed restrictions on dine-in services amid COVID-19 surge, hotel associations across the state such as FHRAI, HRAWI, NRAI and AHAR, among others, held silent protests on Thursday. Under the campaign #MissionRoziRoti, lakhs of restaurant owners and staffers stood outside their establishments holding placards to highlight the hospitality industry's bid for survival.

Farmer leaders protesting against Centre's farm laws at the borders of Delhi on Friday asserted that nothing, not even the fear of coronavirus, can disrupt their protest. "We have been making announcements about the necessity of wearing masks and washing hands frequently. We are also encouraging the protestors to get vaccinated," said Vice President (Punjab) of All India Kisan Sabha.

A 'morphed' picture has surfaced that is claiming that the Indian government has decided to impose coronavirus lockdown from April 9 to 19, PIB's Fact Check Twitter page said. "This claim is fake. No such announcement has been made by the Indian government regarding lockdown. Please do not share such misleading pictures or messages in the wrong context," said PIB.

Actor Amit Sadh, speaking about his decision to not post on social media, told Bombay Times, "I feel at a time as challenging as this, the privileged lot can be...sensitive." "Is Brad Pitt showing you...he's on an exotic island while the rest are battling [coronavirus]? No, right?" he added. Amit further said he doesn't use social media to stay relevant.

All educational institutions in Himachal Pradesh have been ordered to stay shut till April 21 in view of the surge in coronavirus cases, an official spokesman said on Friday. The decision was taken in the state Cabinet meeting chaired by Chief Minister Jai Ram Thakur. The state's government had earlier decided to close educational institutions till April 15.

After PM Narendra Modi chaired a virtual meeting with Chief Ministers of all states and Union Territories to discuss coronavirus situation in the country, videos and pictures of Arvind Kejriwal laughing and yawning during the meeting have gone viral. Several people made memes, with one Twitter user saying, "Arvind Kejriwal is basically all of us in a Zoom meeting."

Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal on Friday said that amid rising cases of coronavirus in the national capital, all schools (both government and private) have been closed for classes till further orders. This came a day after Delhi recorded over 7,400 new COVID-19 cases on Thursday, marking the biggest daily case surge of 2021 in the city.

As many as 780 coronavirus deaths were reported in India in the last 24 hours, out of which 10 states accounted for 92.82%. Maharashtra saw the maximum casualties (376), followed by Chhattisgarh (94). Punjab recorded 56 deaths, Uttar Pradesh 39, while Karnataka and Gujarat reported 36 and 35 each. Further, Madhya Pradesh saw 27 casualties.

American singer Britney Spears took to Instagram to announce that she has been vaccinated for COVID-19 and said, "The people on the internet said it was really bad, [as] a bullet through your arm...I felt nothing." Standing alongside her boyfriend Sam Asghari, Britney added, "I'm fine and I hope I continue to stay fine."

The All India Institute of Medical Sciences (AIIMS) Delhi on Thursday said only urgent procedures or surgeries will be taken up in its operation theatres from April 10 in view of the rising cases of coronavirus. Earlier, AIIMS said it has decided to temporarily stop walk-in registrations for out-patients from Thursday (April 8).

India reported 1,31,968 coronavirus cases on Friday, which is the highest single-day rise in cases in India since the pandemic began. Maharashtra reported the most number of cases in the last 24 hours at 56,286. Chhattisgarh followed Maharashtra with 10,652 cases. Uttar Pradesh and Delhi reported 8,474 and 7,437 coronavirus cases respectively. Meanwhile, Karnataka reported 6,570 cases.

Police have filed a case against at least 50 traders for violating coronavirus rules during their protest in Pune on Thursday. The traders were protesting against the night curfew and weekend lockdown imposed by the Maharashtra government amid a surge in coronavirus cases. The traders have threatened to defy state government orders unless their shops are allowed to open.

While holding a meeting with Chief Ministers on the COVID-19 situation, PM Narendra Modi said, "There was a sort of competition between states when the number of coronavirus cases started rising." "I told you that you shouldn't worry a bit if the number of cases is high. Don't be under any kind of pressure...You just focus on testing," he added.

Sahara Group Chairman Subrata Roy has said that he has tested positive for coronavirus. Releasing a statement, Roy has appealed to everyone to "stay safe and take care of people around us". On Friday, India reported a record single-day spike of 1,31,968 new COVID-19 cases, pushing its infection tally to 1,30,60,542.

As many as 1,31,968 coronavirus cases were confirmed in India in the last 24 hours, marking the biggest one-day jump so far and taking the total number of cases to 1,30,60,542. Meanwhile, 780 deaths have been recorded in the last 24 hours, taking the death toll to 1,67,642. Out of the total cases, 9,79,608 cases are active.

Amid rising COVID-19 cases, Rajiv Gandhi Super Speciality Hospital in Delhi has suspended all the non-COVID-19 services with immediate effect till further orders. The hospital has been declared as a COVID-19 dedicated hospital, where only coronavirus patients will be treated. The hospital had already reserved 500 beds for COVID-19 patients.

Amid rising coronavirus cases, the Indian Railways on Friday said that it doesn?t plan to curtail train services in the country. Railway Board Chairman Suneet Sharma also said that there is no shortage of trains for those who want to travel. Sharma added if there is a surge in demand, they'll increase the operation of trains.

COVID-19 positivity rate in Delhi over the last 10 days increased from 2.7% to 8.1% from March 30 to April 8. Out of the 91,770 COVID-19 tests conducted in Delhi on April 8, a total of 7,437 tested positive. On March 30, Delhi conducted 36,757 tests out of which 992 tested positive. Active COVID-19 cases in Delhi stand at 23,181.

The net direct tax collections for 2020-21 have risen by nearly 5% to ?9.45 lakh crore, exceeding the revised estimates, according to the Finance Ministry. The collections have shown an upswing, despite the impact of COVID-19 pandemic, it said. The Ministry added that refunds amounting to ?2.61 lakh crore were issued in 2020-21, a rise of nearly 42.1% from 2019-20.

The 2021 edition of the Indian Premier League (IPL) may see its out-of-home revenue decline significantly owing to fresh curbs put in place amid rising COVID-19 cases in the country. The Economic Times citing inputs from industry executives reported that several brands are pulling out of co-promotions and off the stadium marketing deals with clubs, bars and restaurants.

Reports in a section of the media about migrant workers heading home due to COVID-19 are "not correct", Deepak Kumar, CPRO Northern Railway said, adding, "I request media...to show the truth." Central Railway General Manager Sanjeev Mittal said that videos showing crowds at some stations were old, adding, "Some news reports falsely mention that there's a mass movement of people."

Amid a steep rise in COVID-19 cases in Maharashtra, Railway Board Chairman Suneet Sharma has said the state has not yet asked the Railway administration to stop or curb the movement of trains. Sharma also said that there is no shortage of trains for those who want to travel and that trains will continue to run across the country.

The Jawaharlal Nehru University's administration on Friday said it's authorised the security department to take photographs of those not seen wearing face masks inside the campus and take disciplinary action against them. It said the shopkeepers who sold to customers not wearing masks could face closure for two days. The university reportedly has 27 active COVID-19 cases, including 24 students.

Delhi recorded 8,521 new COVID-19 cases in the last 24 hours, marking its biggest daily case surge of 2021. This is the highest number of cases recorded in Delhi in a day since November 11, 2020. As many as 39 people have died of COVID-19 in Delhi in the last 24 hours, taking the city's death toll to 11,196.

Health Minister Harsh Vardhan on Friday said that 149 districts have seen no new COVID-19 cases in the last week. He further said that eight districts have not registered any new infection in a fortnight, three districts since 21 days and 63 districts since the last 28 days. This comes as India recorded single-day rise of over 1.3 lakh cases.

In view of rising COVID-19 cases, Central Railway has stopped platform tickets' sale at six long-distance train stations in Mumbai with immediate effect. The tickets' sale has been stopped at Mumbai CSMT, Lokmanya Tilak Terminus, Kalyan, Thane, Dadar and Panvel stations. He said the decision has been taken to avoid an unnecessary rush at these stations.

An FIR was registered against the popular 'My Bar Headquarters' restaurant-cum-pub in Delhi's Connaught Place for allegedly not maintaining social distancing and violating COVID-19 guidelines, police said on Friday. Police said a large number of customers were seen without face masks inside the restaurant on Sunday, April 4. Most customers were "standing very close to each other", police added.

Stating that the Centre has made a "mess" of the vaccination programme, Congress leader P Chidambaram said Maharashtra is being wrongly targeted over the spread of COVID-19. "Maharashtra has vaccinated 80% of healthcare workers. Nearly 20 states are behind it. Maharashtra has vaccinated 73% of frontline workers. Only five states have done better," the former Finance Minister said.

Congress leader Priyanka Gandhi Vadra said that the added pressure of having to appear for examinations during the ongoing COVID-19 pandemic will affect the mental health of children. "It is downright irresponsible of boards like the CBSE to force students to sit for exams under the prevailing circumstances. Board exams should either be cancelled [or] rescheduled," Gandhi added.

An Uttar Pradesh-bound train was seen packed with migrant labourers at Lokmanya Tilak Terminus in Mumbai yesterday. "This train will go to Gorakhpur. We're leaving the city because COVID-19 cases are rising here," a passenger said. "Many of them fear that a lockdown will be imposed...However, our state government has no such plans," Congress leader Sanjay Nirupam said.

The three municipal corporations of Delhi (MCDs) have appealed to the Delhi government to make transport arrangements for those choosing to get vaccinated during night curfew timings. "Not everyone is able to get an e-pass permitting them to move around during the curfew hours...How will they...get a public transport after 10pm?" North Delhi Municipal Corporation Mayor Jai Prakash said.

Brazil's Supreme Court has ordered the senate to investigate President Jair Bolsonaro's government's response to COVID-19 pandemic. The order came as Brazil reported 4,249 COVID-19 deaths on Thursday, the highest increase in its daily virus deaths so far. Brazil, in recent weeks, has become the global epicenter of the pandemic, accounting for over a quarter of the world's death toll.

The resurgence of COVID-19 cases in India has raised concerns that the economic recovery could be derailed, Oxford Economics' latest report has said. However, it added, "We do not expect to see a massive decline like in 2020, as targeted lockdowns remain the preferred containment strategy." India registered a record single-day spike of 1,31,968 new COVID-19 cases on Friday.

The Gurugram Traffic Police tweeted that entry of all private vehicle in Haryana?s Gurugram from the Delhi border will not be allowed after 10 pm till April 30. Those violating the curfew shall be dealt with strictly, it further added. To tackle rising COVID-19 cases, the AAP government on Tuesday announced a curfew from 10 pm-5 am till April 30.

Facebook has suspended 16,000 accounts for selling or buying fake reviews of products and services on its platforms after an intervention by UK's competition watchdog CMA. It also made changes to detect, remove and prevent paid content that could mislead users. The CMA said that fake and misleading reviews are damaging as more people are buying online amid COVID-19.

The Tripura government on Friday announced closure of schools for classes 1 and 2 amid rising COVID-19 cases. The decision came within 48 hours of Chief Minister Biplab Kumar Deb testing positive for COVID-19. While schools will remain open for class 5 onwards, offline classes for grades 3 and 4 will be held alternatively for three days every week.

Talking about life in COVID-19 times, Mumbai Indians captain Rohit Sharma said, "A lot of people are going through hard times; a lot of people are not able to work. Not able to do what they like to." He added, "At least we're lucky that we're getting to do what we like...I'm happy playing cricket, which is what I love."

Actress Sara Ali Khan was spotted by the paparazzi on Friday as she arrived at a gym in Mumbai's Santacruz area. The pictures show her signalling the photographers to stay away from her amid rising COVID-19 cases in the city. However, Sara is seen getting down from her car without wearing a mask.

Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Thursday received his second dose of coronavirus vaccine at Delhi's AIIMS. "Vaccination is among the few ways we have, to defeat the virus," PM Modi tweeted with a picture of him receiving the shot. "If you are eligible for the vaccine, get your shot soon. Register on http://CoWin.gov.in," he added.

AstraZeneca has sent a legal notice to Serum Institute of India, which is manufacturing its COVID-19 vaccine, over supply delays, CEO Adar Poonawalla said. "We are examining all avenues to...resolve legal disputes over contractual obligations that Serum Institute isn't able to fulfil due to its prioritisation of Indian supplies," he added. Serum Institute has so far exported 60 million doses.

After Maharashtra's Health Minister Rajesh Tope claimed the state's COVID-19 vaccine doses will get over in three days, Union Health Minister Harsh Vardhan said it's an attempt to divert attention from Maharashtra's failures to control the spread of pandemic. He said, "The inability of Maharashtra government to act responsibly is beyond comprehension," adding, Tope's claims are "utterly baseless".

Maharashtra Chief Minister Uddhav Thackeray on Friday received his second dose of the COVID-19 vaccine. The CM's office also shared a picture on Twitter. Thackeray had received his first shot of the vaccine on March 11. India, which began its vaccination drive against COVID-19 on January 16, has administered more than nine crore of vaccine doses so far.

Hrithik Roshan's parents, Rakesh Roshan and Pinkie Roshan, have received the second dose of coronavirus vaccine. Taking to Instagram on Thursday, Rakesh shared a picture from a vaccination centre and wrote, "Roshan family, 2nd dose taken. Thank you and grateful Dr Bhujang Pai." The couple had taken the first dose of the vaccine on March 4.

As many as 9,01,98,673 COVID-19 vaccine doses have been administered till now, the Ministry of Health said on Thursday. A total of 29,79,292 people were vaccinated against the coronavirus infection in the last 24 hours and 7,87,63,027 have been given the first dose. Maharashtra has administered the maximum number of COVID-19 vaccines at 89,49,560, followed by Rajasthan at 82,87,840.

Pantry stocking is seeing a surge due to local lockdowns and work-from-home norms amid rising COVID-19 cases in India, The Economic Times reported. Online grocery store Grofers reported an 80% increase in demand in the ready-to-eat and ready-to-cook segments and a 500% rise in the frozen foods category. Sales of packaged milk products also saw an increase of 150%.

Odisha Health Minister Naba Kisore Das has written to Union Health Minister Harsh Vardhan, saying that the state had to close nearly 700 vaccination centres due to a shortage of COVID-19 vaccines. Das wrote that Odisha will run out of Covishield vaccine by April 9. He requested Centre to provide 25 lakh doses of Covishield vaccine to the state immediately.

Around 109 vaccination centres remained shut in Maharashtra's Pune on Wednesday due to a shortage of COVID-19 vaccines, said Lok Sabha MP and NCP leader Supriya Sule. She also alleged that several people had to return home without getting vaccinated. "Requesting Honourable Dr Harsh Vardhan ji (Union Health Minister) to kindly help us with the COVID-19 vaccines," Sule tweeted.

Delhi Health Minister Satyendar Jain said that the COVID-19 vaccination drive is going well in Delhi. "We have stock for 4-5 days. We have demanded more and we will get it," he added. "Centre alleging that there was less vaccination of healthcare workers in Delhi. We can also say that there was less vaccination at Centre's hospitals," Jain further said.

The government has asked all the seven manufacturers of remdesivir to ramp up production to full capacity by next week amid reports of shortages. Remdesivir is an antiviral drug used to treat severe COVID-19 patients. The manufacturers, including Zydus Cadila, Dr Reddy's and Sun Pharma, have a total monthly production capacity of 31.60 lakh vials, Union Minister Mansukh Mandaviya said.

The Centre is cooperating with Maharashtra government in this tough time of the pandemic, said NCP chief Sharad Pawar. "We all have to come together and fight this menace," he added. Pawar's statement comes a day after Maharashtra Health Minister Rajesh Tope said that the state has 14 lakh COVID-19 vaccine doses which will get over in three days.

Actress Anjali, who'll be seen in the Telugu film 'Vakeel Saab', has refuted reports that said she has tested positive for coronavirus. Taking to Twitter, she shared a statement informing her fans and followers that she's "safe and healthy and doing absolutely well". The reports stated that Anjali tested positive after her co-star Nivetha Thomas contracted the virus.

Delhi on Thursday recorded over 7,437 new coronavirus cases in the last 24 hours, making it the National Capital's biggest single-day COVID-19 surge this year. This takes Delhi's active COVID-19 caseload to 23,181 and total number of cases to 6,98,005. As many as 24 people died due to coronavirus in Delhi in the last 24 hours.

Actor Govinda, who had contracted coronavirus, on Thursday shared that he has tested negative for the virus. Taking to Instagram, the 57-year-old actor shared a Boomerang video in which he can be seen walking into a room. "Apun aa gayela hain! #testednegative," he wrote alongside the video. Govinda was under home quarantine and had mild symptoms.

Kerala Chief Minister Pinarayi Vijayan has tested positive for COVID-19 on Thursday. Notably, the CM was administered the first dose of the COVID-19 vaccine on March 3. "[I] request those who have been in contact with me recently to go into self-observation," CM Vijayan tweeted. As per a report, the CM is currently asymptomatic.

Over 80 students of the Indian Institute of Technology Roorkee in Uttarakhand have tested positive for COVID-19, an institute official said on Thursday. Sonika Srivastava, a spokesperson of the institute, said all the infected students have been quarantined in the Ganga hostel and it has been converted into a COVID-care centre. Moreover, five hostels at the institute have been sealed.

Former Maharashtra CM Devendra Fadnavis criticised the state government for not curbing the black marketing of coronavirus drug Remdesivir and said the government should procure the drug from states where the COVID-19 situation is under control. He added that Maharashtra government should stop doing politics over vaccines. Uttar Pradesh received fewer vaccines as compared to Maharashtra, he said.

India's non-bank financial institutions (NBFIs) face fresh asset quality and liquidity risks amid the second wave of coronavirus infections, Fitch Ratings said. The rating agency added these challenges are likely to increase if recent restrictions to contain the pandemic are prolonged, leading to greater economic and operational disruption.

Tamil Nadu government has issued new COVID-19 guidelines which would come into effect from April 10. Religious gatherings and festivals are banned. Shops are allowed to function till 11 pm. Only 50% occupancy is allowed in restaurants, recreational clubs, amusement parks, multiplexes and theatres. The government has allowed up to 100 people for weddings and up to 50 for funerals.

Maharashtra Minister Rajesh Tope on Thursday said that due to vaccine shortage, coronavirus vaccination has been stopped in districts like Satara, Sangli and Panvel. "We have two more days of stock," he added. "The Centre increased [Maharashtra's] COVID-19 vaccine doses from 7 lakh to 17 lakh. Even this is less because we need 40 lakh doses a week," Tope stated.

Filmmaker Hansal Mehta replied to a Twitter user who accused him of prioritising 'politics' over his 25-year-old son Pallava who has Down Syndrome. Hansal earlier questioned the rollout of COVID-19 vaccine 'not to those who want it, but to those who need it'. "Down Syndrome is not a disease...Understand...context of my question first before providing...parroted answers," Hansal told the user.

Karnataka CM BS Yediyurappa on Thursday announced that 'corona curfew' (night curfew) will be imposed in seven cities from 10pm to 5am from April 10 to 20 amid rising coronavirus cases. Bengaluru, Mysuru, Mangaluru, Kalaburagi, Bidar, Tumkur and Udupi (Manipal) are the cities where the corona curfew would be imposed. Essential services will be exempted from the curfew, Yediyurappa added.

New Zealand on Thursday temporarily suspended entry of all travellers from India, including its own citizens, following a high number of coronavirus cases arriving from the country. The suspension will start from April 11 and will be in place until April 28. During this time the government will look at risk management measures to resume travel.

Karnataka Health Minister K Sudhakar on Wednesday said public and private sector offices across the state can start vaccinating employees above 45 years of age from April 11 at their premises. This comes after Union Health Ministry allowed states to permit vaccination at workplaces in private and public sectors, where minimum 100 employees are ready to take the vaccine.

Nineteen people including students and staff members at IIM Jammu have tested positive for COVID-19. A total of 180 samples were sent for testing on Wednesday, of which 19 samples came out positive. This comes ahead of Vice-President M Venkaiah Naidu's visit to the institution for addressing the convocation on April 9.

The Centre on Thursday named 10 states/UT which have accounted for 87.59% of the new coronavirus deaths reported in the last 24 hours. Maharashtra has the highest number with 322 COVID-19 deaths. This is followed by Punjab, Chhattisgarh, Uttar Pradesh, Karnataka, Gujarat, Delhi, Tamil Nadu, Kerala and Madhya Pradesh. India reported 1,26,789 new COVID-19 cases in the last 24 hours.

Tesla CEO Elon Musk said, "I do support vaccines in general and COVID-19 vaccines specifically. The science is unequivocal." In an interview last year, Musk had said that he wouldn't take the vaccine as he and his family were not at risk from coronavirus. Musk, who previously called coronavirus panic "dumb", had "a moderate case of COVID-19" in November 2020.

After the new weekend lockdown was introduced by the Maharashtra government, actor Salman Khan said that the team may have to postpone film, 'Radhe: Your Most Wanted Bhai' to next Eid if the lockdown continues. "Everyone should take [the pandemic] seriously and see that we kill coronavirus...before it kills us all," Salman said.

In its latest report to World Health Organization, North Korea claimed it still has no cases of coronavirus. In an email to The Associated Press on Wednesday, the WHO said North Korea has reported that it tested 23,121 people for coronavirus as of April 1 and that all results were negative. North Korea has limited cross-border traffic and banned tourists.

Brazilian President Jair Bolsonaro has said that there would be "no national lockdown" amid rising COVID-19 cases and deaths in the country. "We're not going to accept this politics of stay home and shut everything down," Bolsonaro added.  Brazil had reported 4,195 deaths on Tuesday, which is the biggest one-day rise in coronavirus-related deaths since the pandemic began.

Pope Francis has told the International Monetary Fund and World Bank that poor countries hit by the economic impact of the COVID-19 need to have their debt burden reduced. He called for a "global plan" that "means giving poorer and less developed nations an effective share in decision-making". "[Can't] allow...law of...marketplace to take precedence over...law of love and...health," he added.

While interacting with the Chief Ministers on Thursday, PM Narendra Modi said that states should emphasise on COVID-19 testing. "Today, the problem is that we have forgotten about COVID-19 testing and have moved to vaccination," he added. "Once again we need to raise awareness about the importance of wearing a mask and following COVID-19 safety protocols," the PM said.

PM Narendra Modi on Thursday held a meeting with Chief Ministers on the current COVID-19 situation and said tracing and tracking is the way to curb COVID-19 spread. "We must concentrate on micro-containment zones," he added. "We have resources, experience now; test, track, treat, COVID-appropriate behaviour will help bring down infection peak," the PM told CMs.

After the Maharashtra government imposed a partial lockdown in the state, former Bigg Boss contestant Abhinav Shukla said, "It's like history repeating itself within a year since the first lockdown." He added, "Lockdown isn't a cure...for COVID-19, it's a way to slow the spread. But along with it, lockdown slows the economy too, generates unemployment, creates disparity."

Actress Sonakshi Sinha talked about whether all the actors should be given COVID-19 vaccination as they work without masks and said, "I don't want to say 'just give actors vaccination' because it would be unfair to others." She added, "I don't want to sound like someone's life is more important than others. They (government) have a plan about vaccination."

Amid reports of the COVID-19 vaccine shortage in Maharashtra, Shiv Sena MP Rahul Ramesh Shewale has submitted a letter to Union Health Minister Dr Harsh Vardhan, requesting him to increase vaccine doses. Earlier, Union Minister Prakash Javadekar rejected claims of shortage in COVID-19 vaccine supply and accused the Maharashtra government of wasting five lakh vaccine doses.

Amid surge in the number of COVID-19 cases, Congress MP Shaktisinh Gohil asked Gujarat CM Vijay Rupani to set up a state COVID-19 helpline desk that people can approach. Gohil said that he had been receiving calls from patients seeking information regarding the availability of ventilators, ICU beds and medicines for COVID-19 treatment in Gujarat.

The African Union has dropped plans to secure COVID-19 vaccine doses from the Serum Institute of India (SII), John Nkengasong, Director of Africa Centres for Disease Control and Prevention said. He further said that they will seek supplies from Johnson & Johnson. He added the decision has no links with reports of AstraZeneca's vaccine causing rare blood clot events.

Net leasing of office space dipped 36% to 5.5 million sq ft across seven major cities during January-March this year amid COVID-19 pandemic, according to a report by JLL India. The report said that net leasing of office space stood at 8.6 million sq ft across the cities in the same period last year. Office rents remained stable, it added.

US Treasury Secretary Janet Yellen on Thursday urged major economies to infuse significant new fiscal support to secure a robust recovery. Yellen said that major economies should continue supporting developing countries as they grapple with the COVID-19, climate change and high debt burdens. "The job is not yet done, given high uncertainty and the risk of permanent scarring," she added.

An entire class was put in quarantine for 10 days after three students in Switzerland's Basel falsified positive coronavirus test results to skip school. However, after the hoax was discovered, the perpetrators are now facing disciplinary measures and criminal charges. "It's not just a childish prank, this is a serious incident," Simon Thiriet, a spokesman for Basel's education department said.

Actor Saqib Saleem, while speaking about his upcoming film '83', said, "It's been the best film I've ever shot in my life." Calling it a "special film", he added, "Can't wait for things to normalise because I...want people to see '83'." Saqib further said he was disappointed when the film's release was postponed last year due to the coronavirus pandemic.

Filmmaker Ashish R Shukla, who's working on his new web series, shared his experience of shooting amid the coronavirus pandemic. He said that some of his editors and assistants have tested positive for COVID-19, adding, "So, work is getting affected and halted." "Some people disclose it, some don't but I think every film set is getting infected," he further said.

Addressing the Chief Ministers over COVID-19 situation, PM Narendra Modi on Thursday said, "We need to prioritise (COVID-19 vaccine distribution) with what we have. We won't get the result by keeping vaccines in one state." He added that the governments would have to manage by thinking about the country. This comes after partisanship claims by some states.

While raising concerns on inequality in terms of COVID-19 vaccinations and median income, World Bank President David Malpass said, "There's the good news that there's faster global growth driven primarily by the US, China and India, having strong rebound." Malpass stated that there is also inequality in terms of the bankruptcy process, which is not available to sovereign countries.

Assam Health Minister Himanta Biswa Sarma said that "there is no possibility of lockdown or night curfew" in the state. "I request everyone to get themselves tested if they have symptoms," he added. The government aims to conduct at least 1 lakh COVID-19 tests in the next seven days so that people can celebrate the Bihu festival, Sarma further said.

NCP chief Sharad Pawar said the state government decided to impose restrictions, following the resurgence in COVID-19 cases, on the advice of the health experts as there were no other options left. "The central government too has urged the state government to take some strict decisions," Pawar added while urging people to cooperate with the state administration.

Amid rising COVID-19 cases, Uttarakhand Health Secretary Amit Negi on Thursday said the state government can take strict decisions if needed, after assessing the situation and on the collector's report. He further said that the cabinet will take a decision in this regard. Uttarakhand reported 1,109 new COVID-19 positive cases on Wednesday, taking the cumulative count to 1,04,711.

Amid the surge of COVID-19 cases in Andhra Pradesh, the Tirumala Tirupati Devasthanams announced the suspension of free Sarvadarshanam tokens at the Sri Venkateswara Temple in Tirupati from April 12. The tokens will be issued only until the evening of April 11, until further orders. On Wednesday, Andhra's Chittoor district reported 296 new COVID-19 cases.

Singer Kanika Kapoor spoke about the time when she was trolled for testing COVID-19 positive and recalled it as a "mentally disturbing" experience. She added, "It was so heavy on me that I...forgot that I have the virus and I'm sick." "I couldn't cope...It took me a year to get out of it...I had to take counselling," Kanika said.

HSBC Holdings has told more than 1,200 staff at its British call centres that they can permanently work from home (WFH) following the COVID-19 pandemic. Reuters reported that about 70% of 1,800 eligible staff have volunteered not to return to the office. HSBC and other British banks have started to cut office space partly, the report added.

Assam Chief Minister Sarbananda Sonowal took his first shot of the COVID-19 vaccine at Gauhati Medical College and Hospital on Thursday. After taking the first vaccine shot, Sonowal said, "Vaccines are safe and will help us defeat this pandemic." He urged all eligible persons of Assam to get vaccinated and continue following safety precautions.

Maharashtra Congress chief Nana Patole on Thursday said, "Today, our country is providing free vaccines to Pakistan but for Maharashtra, they are doing politics over it. BJP's state and central leaders are targeting Maharashtra and they surely will face the consequences." Earlier in the day, COVID-19 vaccination drive was affected at several hospitals in Mumbai due to vaccine shortage.

A central team of experts visited Mumbai's Bandra Kurla Complex COVID-19 vaccination centre to assess the pandemic situation in the city. The Centre has deployed 50 high-level multi-disciplinary public health teams to 50 districts across Maharashtra, Chhattisgarh and Punjab in view of the rising COVID-19 cases in these states. The Centre has also appointed nodal officers for the three states.

While holding a meeting with Chief Ministers on the COVID-19 situation, PM Narendra Modi said that April 11-14 can be observed as 'Tika (vaccination) Utsav'. He called for the 'vaccine festival' to give jabs to maximum eligible people. "India's criteria for vaccination is no different from those applied by most prosperous countries, we will have to prioritise," PM Modi stated.

India has reported 1,26,789 new COVID-19 cases in the last 24 hours, the highest number of daily cases ever since the pandemic began. The country witnessed 685 more deaths due to COVID-19 in the last 24 hours, pushing the death toll to 1,66,862. The total number of cases has reached 1,29,28,574, while the active cases surged to 9,10,319.

The Centre wrote to Maharashtra, Punjab and Delhi governments asking them to improve COVID-19 vaccination numbers. "Upon analysis of vaccination till April 7... the performance was seen to be below the national average," Additional Health Secretary Manohar Agnani wrote. As compared to the national average of 51.49% of the second dose coverage among healthcare workers, Punjab stood at 27.36%.

India's debt-to-GDP ratio increased from 74% to 90% during the COVID-19 pandemic, the International Monetary Fund (IMF) has said. "That's a very large increase, but it is something that other emerging markets and advanced economies have experienced as well," an IMF executive said. "We expect that the debt ratio will gradually come down as the economy recovers," he added.

After Maharashtra alleged they had been allotted fewer COVID-19 vaccine doses as compared to states like Gujarat, Health Minister Harsh Vardhan said, "Maharashtra and Rajasthan are 2 of the top 3 states based on allocation of vaccine doses." "Hue & cry by certain States about partisanship by Union Govt is...a farce, an attempt to hide their own incompetence," he tweeted.

Jharkhand Health Minister Banna Gupta on Thursday said their current COVID-19 vaccine stock won't last for more than two days but he expects Centre to replenish the stock by tomorrow. "Spoken to Union Health Minister...requested him to immediately provide around 10 lakh vaccines for first dose," Gupta added. He said around 83 lakh people still need two doses of vaccine.

India's largest two-wheeler maker Hero MotoCorp has announced that it is initiating a COVID-19 vaccination drive and will cover the cost of vaccines for its entire workforce. It will also facilitate a similar vaccination drive across group companies, dealer network and supply chain partners to cover a total of over 80,000 employees. On Wednesday, the government allowed vaccination at workplaces.

Union Health Minister Harsh Vardhan will on Friday chair a meeting of the high-level Group of Ministers on COVID-19 to discuss the pandemic situation in the country and strategies to be adopted for the availability and distribution of vaccines. Several states, including Maharashtra, Chhattisgarh and Odisha, have complained about a shortage of the COVID-19 vaccine in the last few days.

Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal has written to the Centre urging to open vaccination for all amid rising COVID-19 cases in the country, state's Health Minister Satyendar Jain said. "We've made two more requests that vaccination should be allowed at least for all adults. Secondly, it should be allowed even at camp settings and not only at healthcare facilities," he added.

Actor Amit Sadh took to Instagram to share he will not be posting anything on social media amid rising COVID-19 cases in the country. "I believe my posts and reels of the gym sessions, the silly things that I do will not heal or entertain anyone," he wrote. He added that his fans can reach out to him through DMs.

Actor Milind Soman, who recently tested negative for COVID-19, took to Instagram to share a video. Alongside it, he wrote, "Ran a comfortable, easy pace five km in around 40 minutes and it felt amazing!" Speaking about experiencing COVID-19, Milind said, "I know...that COVID-19 is a thing now, I've not had any flu-like symptoms for more than 25 years now."

Congress West Bengal in-charge Jitin Prasada has tested positive for COVID-19. "Anyone who may have come in contact with me over the last few days, please get yourselves tested," he tweeted. "I am presently in quarantine as advised by my doctors," he wrote. Prasada is a former Union Minister of State for Steel, Petroleum and Natural Gas.

Congress leader Priyanka Gandhi on Thursday cited media reports and alleged that UP CM Yogi Adityanath is attending rallies even after coming in contact with a COVID-positive person. "His office is giving incorrect COVID-19 death figures," she added. "In times of crisis, leaders should set an example of truth and right conduct so that people can trust them," Priyanka tweeted.

Hyderabad's Begum Bazar will remain closed after 5 pm from April 9 due to the surge in COVID-19 cases. The Hyderabad Kirana Merchants Association has instructed the shops in the market to operate from 9 am to 5 pm. The association has also ordered the shopkeepers to ensure physical distancing and to encourage the use of mask and sanitiser.

In order to ensure travel guidelines are being followed, Delhi Metro's Flying Squads penalised 672 commuters on Wednesday for not wearing a face mask properly and not following social distancing, said Delhi Metro Rail Corporation (DMRC). "Let us all follow the protocols and politely counsel others to do the same," DMRC tweeted on Thursday.

India doesn't have enough data on the new COVID-19 variants to explain the steep, nine-fold jump in infections from around 11,000 daily new cases in early February, Bhramar Mukherjee, a professor at the School of Public Health at the University of Michigan has said. "The more you let the infection spread, the more chances of the virus mutating," she added.

Kalyan Jewellers said the company reported nearly 60% growth in revenue in Q4 of FY21 in its India operations on the back of robust increase in consumer demand. The company further said that growth was driven by store sales, adding its outlets were closed for a large part of the financial year ended March 31, 2021 due to COVID-19 restrictions.

As a preventive measure against COVID-19, the District Collector of Gujarat's Porbandar has issued a notification, closing public parks and beaches in the district till April 21. However, these public places will remain open for morning walks from 5 am to 8 am. These restrictions would also apply to the sea coast in Odadar village, Kuchhadi village and Madhavpur beach.

After the government allowed COVID-19 vaccination at workplaces, Mahindra Group Chairman Anand Mahindra said, "This'll be brilliant. Especially if combined with wider eligibility given the number of young people in the workforce." "We've been...awaiting an opportunity to...join what we hope will be a final battle with COVID," he added. Workplace vaccination centres will be launched from April 11.

Consumer confidence in India fell in March 2021 "on the back of deteriorating sentiments on general economic situation, income and prices," as per the latest Reserve Bank of India (RBI) survey. The consumer confidence index dipped to 53.1 in March from 55.5 in January, while future expectations fell from 117.1 to 108.8 for the same period amid rising COVID-19 cases.

Delhi High Court declined a plea that sought directions to the city government to take measures amid rising COVID-19 cases and said, "The state is doing everything to control the pandemic." The court said the government is taking steps like vaccination and conducting awareness campaigns regarding use of masks. "What else do you expect the state to do?" it added.

COVID-19 cases continue to surge throughout the Americas, with over 1.3 million new cases and 37,000 deaths reported in the region in the last week, Pan American Health Organization Director said. Carissa Etienne said, "[Over]...half of...global deaths [in]...last week were...in...Americas." The US, Brazil and Argentina were among the 10 nations globally reporting the highest number of new cases.

Uttarakhand government on Thursday declared Dehradun's Doon School a restricted zone after 12 people tested COVID-19 positive on the campus. Entry and exit to and from the school has been restricted and all essential goods will be supplied at the campus, said Dehradun District Magistrate. A group of five students and seven teachers at the school tested positive on Wednesday.

Reserve Bank of India (RBI) Governor Shaktikanta Das has said that localised and regional lockdowns across the country could dampen the recent improvement in demand conditions and delay the return of normalcy. RBI said that consumer confidence has fallen due to the surge in COVID-19 cases. The RBI has projected real GDP growth at 26.2% in the April-June quarter.

Discussing the COVID-19 situation with Chief Ministers, PM Narendra Modi on Thursday asked the states to endorse 'night curfew' as  'corona curfew'. He further said that it would be better to impose the 'corona curfew' from 9 pm or 10 pm till 5 am to 6 am. He also said that the practice of night curfew has been accepted worldwide.

A 104-year-old Colombian woman has beaten COVID-19 infection for the second time in nine months. Carmen Hernandez was tested COVID-19 positive for the first time in June 2020 and then again in March 2021, after being vaccinated. Hernandez received a standing ovation from hospital staff while being discharged after 21 days in the hospital fighting COVID-19 for the second time.

Schools and other educational institutions in Uttarakhand's Haridwar will remain closed from April 9 to 15 in view of a huge rush of devotees to the Kumbh Mela and the rising COVID-19 cases. District Magistrate C Ravishankar issued an order in this regard. Many pilgrims are likely to visit Haridwar for 'shahi snan' on April 12 and 14.

The district administration in Mysuru on Thursday issued a travel advisory to people travelling from Bengaluru to carry an RT-PCR negative report, which is not older than 72 hours, from April 10 to 20 due to the surge in COVID-19 cases. The negative report has been made mandatory for people to visit tourist places, theatres, party halls and resorts.

Canadian PM Justin Trudeau said the country is facing "a very serious third wave" of the COVID-19 pandemic which is pushing up hospitalisations and rapidly filling up intensive care beds. Canada has averaged nearly 5,200 new coronavirus cases daily over the last week, Reuters reported. The country has reported over 10 lakh COVID-19 cases and 23,083 coronavirus-related deaths so far.

RCB opener Devdutt Padikkal, who had tested COVID-19 positive two weeks back, on Wednesday joined the rest of the squad after returning negative in fresh round of testing. "I am feeling completely fine now. Just can't wait to get out there," Padikkal said. He was the third IPL player to have contracted the virus after Nitish Rana and Axar Patel.

RBI Governor Shaktikanta Das said that the recent surge in COVID-19 infections has created uncertainty over economic growth recovery. The governor's remarks came after India reported over one lakh COVID-19 cases on April 5, the highest single-day rise in infections since the pandemic began last year. RBI will continue to do "whatever it takes" to preserve financial stability, he added.

Jharkhand government has issued new COVID-19 guidelines which will be applicable from April 8 to 30. Schools, except for classes 10 and 12, will be closed during this period. Shops, restaurants and clubs shall not remain open after 8 pm. All congregations are prohibited except marriages with up to 200 people and last rite functions with up to 50 people.

Reliance Group Chairman Anil Ambani's son Anmol criticised the COVID-19-related restrictions imposed on businesses in Maharashtra and said, "What does essential even mean? Each individual's work is essential to them." "Professional 'actors' can continue shooting...'cricketers' can play their sport...'politicians' can continue their rallies...But your business or work is not essential," he tweeted.

The routine walk-in OPD registrations, including special clinics, at Delhi's All India Institute of Medical Sciences, will remain temporarily shut from April 8. This comes amid increasing COVID-19 cases in Delhi to "minimise the possibility of community spread". OPDs and speciality clinics will continue to provide requisite services only to those patients having prior appointments, AIIMS stated.

International Monetary Fund's (IMF) Chief Economist Gita Gopinath has said that there is evidence of normalisation of economic activities in India. This comes as the IMF on Tuesday predicted a 12.5% growth rate for India in 2021, stronger than that of China, the only major economy to have a positive growth rate last year during the COVID-19 pandemic.

Maharashtra Health Minister Rajesh Tope on Wednesday said the state's COVID-19 vaccine wastage rate is 3%, which is half the national average. He further said the price of the COVID-19 drug Remdesivir will be capped between ?1,100 and ?1,400 per dose. "We need a high number of Remdesivir doses as 50,000 doses are consumed daily," Tope added.

Mexico's health regulator Cofepris has approved Bharat Biotech's Covaxin, India's indigenous COVID-19 vaccine, for emergency use, Foreign Minister Marcelo Ebrard said. He added that the country has now approved six coronavirus vaccines, naming Oxford-AstraZeneca, Pfizer-BioNTech, Covaxin, China's CanSino, Sinovac and Russia's Sputnik V.  Mexico has administered over 9.6 million shots so far.

With the rise in COVID-19 cases in the city, Bengaluru City Police Commissioner Kamal Pant has prohibited rallies, demonstrations, public gatherings, functions and group prayers till April 20 to tackle the pandemic. He warned that anyone violating norms will be booked under Disaster Management Act and Karnataka Epidemic Diseases Ordinance, 2020. Bengaluru reported 4,266 COVID-19 cases on Tuesday.

The pace of expansion of services activity in India slowed in March as authorities imposed fresh restrictions due to a surge in COVID-19 cases, a private monthly survey revealed on Wednesday. The IHS Markit Services Purchasing Managers' Index fell to 54.6 in March from 55.3 in February but stayed above the 50-mark threshold which separates growth from contraction.

The cumulative number of COVID-19 vaccine doses administered in India has crossed 8.70 crore on Wednesday, said the Union Health Ministry. As many as 8,70,77,474 vaccine doses have been given through 13,32,130 sessions. India has surpassed the US to become the fastest vaccinating country in the world with an average daily rate of 30,93,861 vaccine doses.

The Goa government has sought special permission from the Centre to vaccinate all workers in the state's tourism sector against COVID-19, even if they are below 45 years of age, citing the sector's importance, said Goa CM Pramod Sawant. The tourism industry provides employment to nearly 35% of Goa's population that is dependent on the sector, according to official estimates.

Three COVID-19 cases were detected among Bengaluru FC players and staff at their training camp in Goa ahead of their AFC Qualifiers match on April 14. "Bengaluru FC continues to take all the necessary precautions at the highest levels to stay safe, secure and healthy," the club said. They will be playing either Nepal Army Club or Sri Lanka Police.

For the first time since the start of the coronavirus pandemic, Brazil has recorded more than 4,000 coronavirus deaths in a single day. At least 4,195 people died due to COVID-19 on Tuesday, taking Brazil's total death toll to nearly 3,37,000, second only to the United States. "It's...nuclear reactor that...is out of control. It's...biological Fukushima," said Brazilian doctor Miguel Nicolelis.

Union Health Minister Harsh Vardhan said there is no shortage of COVID-19 vaccine in the country and that the Centre will continually replenish vaccine stock. He also asked the states to continue administering vaccine doses to prioritised groups. "I urge you not to have any doubts about the availability of the COVID-19 vaccine," said Vardhan.

In its guidelines for COVID-19 vaccination at workplaces, government stated that one type of vaccine will be provided. Beneficiaries who've already received one dose of a vaccine different from the one being administered at the workplace shall not be vaccinated at the workplace. All vaccination must be recorded in real time through the Co-WIN Vaccinator Module on the same day.

Sonu Sood and Anubhav Sinha on Wednesday shared that they've received the first dose of coronavirus vaccine. Taking to Twitter, Sonu shared a picture of himself and wrote, "Got my vaccine today and now it's time to get whole of my country vaccinated." "Started the biggest vaccination drive 'Sanjeevani' which will bring awareness and get our people vaccinated," he added.

The International Monetary Fund has predicted that China will drive global economic growth in the coming years as world recovers from COVID-19 pandemic. China will contribute over one-fifth of the total increase in the world's GDP in five years through 2026, as per Bloomberg calculations based on IMF's forecast. The US and India will be the second and third-biggest contributors.

The Madhya Pradesh government on Wednesday suspended bus operations with Chhattisgarh till April 15 in the wake of a rise in COVID-19 cases in the neighbouring state. Chhattisgarh on Tuesday saw its highest single-day spike in COVID-19 cases with 9,921 fresh cases, taking the state's caseload to 3,86,269, as per official figures. Madhya Pradesh reported 3,722 new cases on Tuesday.

Five students and seven teachers tested COVID-19 positive at The Doon School in Uttarakhand's Dehradun, confirmed Dehradun District Magistrate Ashish Srivastava. "Those who tested positive have been quarantined and are adhering to the government guidelines," he added. The District Magistrate also said that all staff members and students will be undergoing a mandatory RT-PCR test.

Mumbai Mayor Kishori Pednekar has said that "[COVID-19] vaccine stock in Mumbai is about to get over". "We only have a little over 1 lakh Covishield doses left. There is a bit of a shortage," she added. "The Centre needs to give us more stocks as soon as possible or it'll be difficult to administer second doses," she further said.

Karnataka Health and Medical Education Minister Dr K Sudhakar has requested the central government to provide the state with more COVID-19 vaccines. He further explained the measures taken in the state to control the second wave, including speeding up testing. He has also explained to the Centre the need to increase the availability of oxygen for the patients in Karnataka.

Pakistani pop singer Jawad Ahmad, who tested positive for COVID-19 in November 2020, has contracted the virus again. "I contracted COVID again. Don't know if I'll survive or not...I've enough money for its treatment if it gets worse, but truth is...it is no more fun to just keep living in this world full of poverty, helplessness & deprivation," he tweeted.

Kangana Ranaut took to Twitter on Wednesday to share that her parents have received the second dose of the COVID-19 vaccine. "No fever no weakness no other symptoms they are feeling quite good and happy," she wrote while sharing a picture of them from a vaccination centre in Himachal Pradesh. "Waiting for my turn now," Kangana further wrote.

NCP chief Sharad Pawar took the second dose of the COVID-19 vaccine on Wednesday. He thanked the medical team who vaccinated him. "Coincidentally, today is World Health Day. On this occasion, I urge all citizens to take an active part in the fight against this virus by completing the COVID-19 vaccination process as soon as possible," Pawar tweeted.

Former Jammu and Kashmir Chief Minister and National Conference Vice President, Omar Abdullah, received the first dose of the COVID-19 vaccine on Wednesday at Sher-I-Kashmir Institute of Medical Sciences (SKIMS) in Srinagar.
