"It was a smooth & painless affair," he said while sharing a picture of himself receiving the vaccine on Twitter. Abdullah also thanked the staff of the hospital.

The International Monetary Fund (IMF) raised its 2021 global growth forecast from 5.5% to 6%, the fastest rate since 1976, amid the COVID-19 pandemic. It expects the US economy, which is the world's biggest, to grow by 6.4% in 2021, the fastest since 1984. The US forecast was raised by 1.3 percentage points from the IMF's earlier projection of 5.1%.

A UK trial of AstraZeneca COVID-19 vaccine on children has been paused, while regulators assess its possible link to blood clots, Oxford University said. "There are no safety concerns in...trial...we await additional information from...MHRA," it said. UK's Medicines and Healthcare products Regulatory Agency had said there were 30 blood clotting cases, seven fatal, after the AstraZeneca jab's use.

Amid rising COVID-19 cases, Mumbai's civic body Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) on Tuesday updated its guidelines and announced a fresh set of restrictions. Under the fresh guidelines, BMC noted that all beaches in the city will remain shut till April 30. According to the SOP, every housing society having more than five cases will be declared a micro-containment zone.

Filmmaker Hansal Mehta shared a picture of his son Pallava. "[He] is 25...He has [Down] Syndrome. He...suffered from a near-fatal respiratory failure...few years ago. Does he want the vaccine or does he need it?" Hansal wrote. Government recently said "the aim is not to administer COVID-19 vaccine to those who want it but to those who need it."

India has surpassed the US to become the fastest COVID-19 vaccinating country in the world with an average daily rate of 30,93,861 vaccine doses, the Health Ministry said on Wednesday. According to a provisional report till 7 am, over 8.70 crore doses have been administered through 13,32,130 sessions. So far, 1,43,58,637 healthcare workers and 1,40,49,455 frontline workers have been vaccinated.

During an interview, Serum Institute of India's CEO Adar Poonawalla said, "Do we have enough vaccines to cover everybody? Absolutely not. Nobody in the world has it. No country has it." He stated that his company has a capacity of 60-70 million doses currently that he hopes to ramp up in the coming months with government's proposal and bank borrowings.

US President Joe Biden said America is still in a "life-and-death race" against coronavirus as his government administered 150 million doses in 75 days. He also announced that all adults would become eligible for a vaccine by April 19. Biden added that "the pandemic remains dangerous" and encouraged people to continue to wash their hands, socially distance and wear masks.

Punjab government on Wednesday announced that night curfew from 9 pm to 5 am will be imposed in the state till April 30 amid rising cases of coronavirus. The government also announced that political gatherings have been banned in the state. This comes after the Centre said that 80% of COVID-19 cases in Punjab have UK variant of the virus.

India has reported 1,15,736 new COVID-19 cases in the last 24 hours, the highest number of daily cases ever since the pandemic began. The country witnessed 630 more deaths due to COVID-19 in the last 24 hours, pushing the death toll to 1,66,177. The total number of cases has reached 1,28,01,785, while the active cases surged to 8,43,473.

Maharashtra Health Minister Rajesh Tope has said the state has 14 lakh COVID-19 vaccine doses which will get over in three days. He said, "We don't have enough doses at various centres, and people have to be sent back due to shortage". Tope added, "I'm not saying Centre is not giving us vaccines but the speed of delivery is slow."

AAP MLA Saurabh Bharadwaj on Wednesday said that COVID-19 vaccines should be available at the local doctors' clinic adding that country's youth has the right to get it. "People between 18-45 age, who have to get out of their homes...have the right to get the vaccine before Pakistan, Afghanistan. They run the economy...so they deserve it," he said.

Britain began using Moderna's COVID-19 vaccine on Wednesday in Wales amid a shortfall of doses due to a supply crunch caused by manufacturing problems at AstraZeneca. It's the third approved vaccine to be offered in Britain, alongside AstraZeneca and one from Pfizer-BioNTech. UK PM Boris Johnson informed 17 million doses of Moderna's vaccine were ordered, urging Britons to get vaccinated.

The European Medicines Agency (EMA) found a possible link between the Oxford-AstraZeneca COVID-19 vaccine and rare blood clotting issues. "Unusual blood clots with low blood platelets should be listed as very rare side effects of the vaccine," the EMA said. It carried out an in-depth review of 86 cases of clotting amongst 2.5 crore people who had received the vaccine.

Under-30s should be offered an alternative vaccine instead of AstraZeneca jab if there's one available in their area and they're healthy and not at high COVID-19 risk, said UK's drug regulator. This comes after University of Oxford paused trial on children amid concerns over blood clotting among adults. By March-end, 79 people in UK suffered rare blood clots after vaccination.

The use of swimming pools, gyms and party halls in apartment/residential complexes in limits of Bengaluru City has been banned amid rising coronavirus cases. Earlier, the police had also said that rallies and demonstrations for any purpose by any group are prohibited across Bengaluru till April 20. Karnataka on Tuesday reported over 6,000 new COVID-19 cases.

The Andhra Pradesh government has announced its decision to waive off the electricity charges for all the theatres including multiplexes for the months of April, May and June 2020. The government has also given an option for deferred payments from July to December. The relief measures have been announced to help recover from the losses incurred due to COVID-19 pandemic.

At Sports Authority of India (SAI) centre in Bhopal, 18 people tested positive, including eight athletes, during a routine COVID-19 testing. However, no Olympic-bound athlete returned positive. The COVID-19 positive athletes have been shifted to the hospital. On March 31, National Institute of Sports in Patiala and the SAI centre in Bengaluru also reported 26 and four positive cases, respectively.

Telangana High Court on Tuesday pulled up the state government for poor RT-PCR testing and vaccination numbers. The High Court observed that measures to contain the spread of the coronavirus infection were not being followed in the state. The court instructed the state to file a fresh status report within 48 hours on the steps taken to tackle the spread.

Bhim Army chief Chandrashekhar Azad and his 149 supporters have been booked for taking out a roadshow in Uttar Pradesh's Muzaffarnagar in violation of the prohibitory orders issued to control the spread of COVID-19, police said. Azad took out the roadshow on Tuesday in support of his party candidates in the UP Panchayat elections, the police added.

Union Health Secretary Rajesh Bhushan has written to states, announcing that COVID-19 vaccinations will be allowed in workplaces as "substantial population aged 45 years and above are in the organised sector of the economy". The sessions will be held at workplaces with 100 willing beneficiaries. The states have been asked to prepare for Work Place Vaccination launch by April 11.

Indian judokas weren't allowed to participate in the ongoing Asia-Oceania Judo Championships 2021 in Kyrgyzstan after two Indian participants tested COVID-19 positive during tests conducted there. The 19-member Indian contingent had tested negative for COVID-19 before departure. Currently, the two COVID-19 positive Indian athletes have been shifted to hospital, while others have been quarantined.

Actress-politician Nagma took to Twitter on Wednesday to share that she has tested positive for coronavirus. She added that she had taken the first dose of the vaccine "a few days ago". Nagma further said she has quarantined herself at home, adding, "Please take care and take all necessary precautions even after taking...first dose of vaccine do not get complacent."

The International Monetary Fund (IMF) said that controlling COVID-19 pandemic worldwide through vaccination could generate over $1 trillion in additional tax revenue in advanced economies by 2025. Countries have announced $16 trillion in fiscal actions in the past year, IMF added. Recently, the fund had raised its 2021 global growth forecast from 5.5% to 6%.

As many as 630 coronavirus deaths were reported in India in the last 24 hours, out of which eight states accounted for 84.44%. Maharashtra saw the maximum casualties (297), followed by Punjab (61). Chhattisgarh recorded 53 coronavirus deaths in the last 24 hours, while  Karnataka and Uttar Pradesh reported 39 and 30 each. Further, Madhya Pradesh saw 18 casualties.

Maharashtra recorded the highest daily count of 59,907 new coronavirus cases in the last 24 hours, figures released on Wednesday showed. The state's case tally now stands at 31,73,261 and with 322 deaths, the state's death toll has climbed to 56,652. The state's active cases stand at 5,01,559 and total recoveries at 26,13,627.

Mumbai has reported 10,428 new COVID-19 cases and 23 deaths in the last 24 hours, taking the total number of cases to 4,82,760, the Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) said. The death toll in the city has increased to 11,851, the civic body added. Over 51,000 tests were done in the last 24 hours in Mumbai, the BMC further said.

Maharashtra Education Minister Varsha Gaikwad on Wednesday announced that all state board students of Class 9 and 11 will be promoted to the next class without any examinations. She said the decision was taken in the wake of the current COVID-19 situation. Earlier, it was announced that students from Class 1-8 will be passed without examinations.

Amid the rising number of COVID-19 cases in Pakistan, PM Imran Khan has said his government would approach the International Monetary Fund for another relief package to mitigate the impact of the pandemic. He said, "[We'll]...speak to IMF because we see disruptions ahead." Pakistan last month received the third tranche of $500 million (over ?3,000 crore) loan from the IMF.

Gurugram on Wednesday reported 611 fresh COVID-19 cases, making it the city's biggest single-day spike this year. The city's COVID-19 tally has reached 66,763 and the death toll stands at 368. The number of active COVID-19 cases in Gurugram is 3,904, according to the state health department.

Chandigarh DM on Wednesday announced that movement of individuals for all non-essential activities between 10:30 pm and 5 am in the Union Territory has been prohibited amid rising coronavirus cases. However, hospitals, chemist shops and ATMs can remain open 24x7 and there are no curbs on inter-state and intra-state movement of goods, the DM stated.

Bihar CM Nitish Kumar on Tuesday held a review meeting over the COVID-19 situation via video conferencing. CM Nitish said, "Amid the rising COVID-19 cases in other states, there is a possibility that people hailing from Bihar might return here. We must prepare quarantine centres for them." He also reaffirmed the need for raising the testing rate in the state.

As many as 52,740 beneficiaries were vaccinated against COVID-19 in the last 24 hours in Mumbai, as per data. "We realise there is vaccine hesitancy among Mumbaikars following which we will be creating awareness regarding the vaccine...More eligible beneficiaries will be added in the next phase of vaccination," BMC Additional Municipal Commissioner Suresh Kakani said.

The Delhi government on Tuesday said that night curfew will be imposed in the national capital from 10 pm to 5 am with immediate effect till April 30 in the wake of COVID-19 situation. Delhi has reported more than 3,500 coronavirus cases daily for four days in a row. Delhi currently has 14,589 active coronavirus cases.

US airlines are recalling and bringing in more pilots while preparing for a rise in travel demand as more people receive coronavirus vaccinations. Delta Air Lines said that it recalled 1,713 idled pilots on April 1 and about 400 will be trained to start flying this summer. Southwest Airlines also said that 209 pilots will return from voluntary leave.

Nepal's Health Minister Hridayesh Tripathi has warned that the country may witness the peak of the second wave of COVID-19 in June if people do not follow precautionary measures. The country has again witnessed a surge in coronavirus cases from mid-January which had begun to decline from October last year. Nepal has reported 2.7 lakh COVID-19 cases so far.

The shooting of 'Mr Lele' has been put on hold after actors Vicky Kaushal and Bhumi Pednekar tested positive for coronavirus. Confirming the news, FWICE (Federation of Western India Cine Employees) General Secretary Ashok Dubey said, "Several junior artists were also tested for Covid-19 but they have tested negative for the virus." The film is being directed by Shashank Khaitan.

Union Health Secretary on Monday said on-site registration for healthcare and frontline workers will now happen only at government COVID-19 vaccination centres. The workers will need to produce original photo identity cards and employment certificates. This move comes after Centre stopped fresh registration for health, frontline workers as they found ineligible beneficiaries availing the facility.

An enquiry has been ordered after a video showing a garbage truck carrying 34 ventilators in Gujarat went viral. Gujarat government had ordered to transport the ventilators from Valsad to Surat amid shortage at hospitals. Meanwhile, state government directed oxygen manufacturers to divert 60% of their produce for medical purposes as Gujarat recorded a new high of 3,160 COVID-19 cases.

Actor Milind Soman, who tested positive for the coronavirus in March, has recovered from the virus. Taking to Instagram, Milind shared a picture with his wife Ankita Konwar along with a thank you note. He wrote, "Thank you to Ankita, who travelled all the way back from Guwahati as soon as she heard...and took care of me like an angel."

Several states have imposed night curfews in their districts amid rising cases of coronavirus in the country. While Maharashtra and Rajasthan have imposed state-wide night curfews, Odisha and Punjab have imposed night curfews in 10 and 11 worst-hit districts, respectively. Gujarat has imposed night curfews in four cities, while the Union Territory of Delhi imposed a night curfew from today.

Actor Suniel Shetty talked about the Maharashtra government's decision to shut theatres again amid the surge in COVID-19 cases and said that the government needs to offer subsidies and tax rebates to the single-screen theatres and multiplexes for their revival. "Theatres need our [industry's] support with good content, and also need the government and the audience?s support," he added.

Mumbai Indians' scout and wicketkeeping consultant Kiran More has tested positive for coronavirus. "He is currently asymptomatic and has been isolated. The MI medical team will continue to monitor his health and abide by the BCCI protocols," Mumbai Indians said in a statement. "We'd like to remind our fans...to follow COVID-19 appropriate behaviours in these difficult times," it added.

Centre wrote to the Delhi government asking it to issue show-cause notices to COVID-19 vaccination centres (CVCs) over irregularities in identifying beneficiaries below the age of 45. One such centre has been identified as Vidyasagar Institute of Mental Health, Neuro and Allied Sciences at Nehru Nagar. "Flouting vaccine compliances will harm...countrywide vaccination exercise," Centre said.

Actor Kartik Aaryan has bought a Lamborghini Urus for ?4.5 crore after testing negative for coronavirus. He reportedly paid an extra ?50 lakh to have the car airlifted from Italy to Mumbai to avoid the three months waiting period. Sharing a video on Instagram, the actor jokingly wrote, "Bought it...But I'm probably not made for expensive things."

Ahead of their first leg of the Champions League quarter-final against Liverpool, Real Madrid defender Raphael Varane has tested positive for coronavirus. Madrid captain Sergio Ramos has already been ruled out of the match due to an injury. Varane is also expected to miss Saturday night's Clasico against Barcelona and the return leg against Liverpool at Anfield next week.

Filmmaker-actress Seema Pahwa took to social media on Monday to inform that she has tested positive for coronavirus. She shared a selfie and wrote, "Positive hun har baat ko le kar. Dekhlo report bhi POSITIVE hi aa gai. (I'm positive about everything and now my report is also positive). I am COVID positive. 14 days home [quarantine] take care."

Stand-up comedian Kunal Kamra and his family have tested positive for COVID-19. Taking to social media, he urged his followers to take the second wave of coronavirus "very seriously". Kunal wrote, "My parents are COVID-19 positive and they're in...hospital...I'm...quarantined at home. I've spoken to everyone who I was in contact with. Me and my family will be fine soon."

Pakistan's Minister for Planning and Development Asad Umar said the country would administer coronavirus vaccines to citizens aged 80 years and above at their homes. The decision was taken keeping in mind the onset of summer and the difficulty elderly would face in reaching vaccination centres and waiting in queues, Umar added. Pakistan has vaccinated 10 lakh people so far.

The Confederation of All India Traders (CAIT) has suggested Maharashtra Chief Minister Uddhav Thackeray to reduce shop timings from 11 am to 5 pm instead of imposing full lockdown. CAIT said that the economic impact of such lockdown should not be overlooked. Other states who are suffering from the surge in coronavirus cases may follow Maharashtra, the traders' body added.

ECI has reportedly extended polling time by one hour across four states and UT to allow COVID-19 patients to vote. In Tamil Nadu, COVID-19 patients or those in isolation can go to polling booths from 6-7pm to cast their votes. "Body temperature of all voters will be taken...Those with fever will be asked to come...[from] 6-7pm," state Health Secretary said.

The Badminton Association of India (BAI) has postponed the All-India ranking tournaments amid the surge in COVID-19 cases across the country. As a result, the upcoming tournament in Bengaluru from April 18 to 25 and junior and sub-junior competitions in Hyderabad to be held in May have been delayed. India saw highest 24-hour spike on Sunday since the pandemic began.

The global death toll from coronavirus crossed the 30 lakh-mark on Tuesday, according to a Reuters tally. It took over a year for the COVID-19 death toll to reach 20 lakh but the next 10 lakh deaths were added in about three months, Reuters reported. Brazil accounts for one in every four COVID-19 deaths worldwide each day, it added.

The WHO doesn't back the requirement of vaccination passports for travel, for now, a WHO spokeswoman said. "[We] would not like to see the vaccination passport as...requirement for entry or exit because we're not certain...the vaccine prevents transmission," Margaret Harris said. The WHO now expects to review China's COVID-19 vaccines Sinopharm and Sinovac for possible emergency use, she added.

The Prime Ministers of Trinidad and Tobago and Georgia, Keith Rowley and Irakli Garibashvili, have tested positive for coronavirus. "I feel good, I'm self-isolating and continuing to work remotely," Garibashvili announced in a post on Facebook. Rowley, who was tested after experiencing flu-like symptoms, is isolated and under medical supervision, officials said.

Delhi on Tuesday recorded over 5,000 new coronavirus cases in the last 24 hours, marking the national capital's biggest daily COVID-19 surge this year. As many as 5,100 new COVID-19 cases were recorded in Delhi on Tuesday while 17 more died of the virus there in the last 24 hours. Delhi's cumulative caseload has now increased to 6,85,062.

As many as 10,030 people tested positive for coronavirus in Mumbai in the last 24 hours, the BMC informed on Tuesday. With this, the total caseload in the city has increased to 4,72,332, while the total number of fatalities has risen to 11,828 with 31 more deaths. Nearly 48,000 COVID-19 tests were conducted in Mumbai in the last 24 hours.

Delhi's COVID-19 positivity rate crossed the 5% mark on Monday after 124 days. Following 3,548 new COVID-19 cases on Monday after 64,003 tests, the positivity rate stood at 5.54%. The positivity rate on Sunday was 4.64% with 4,033 new COVID-19 cases after 86,899 tests. Delhi's death toll stood at 11,096 on Monday with the case fatality rate at 1.63%.

People going for coronavirus vaccination will be exempted from 10 pm to 5 am curfew in Delhi but with an e-pass. Shops, dealing with foods, groceries, fruits and vegetables, dairy, meat and fish and medicines can stay open. Petrol pumps can also stay open. There will be no restriction on inter-state and intra-state movement of essential and non-essential goods.

India recorded 96,982 fresh COVID-19 cases and 446 deaths in the last 24 hours, according to the Union Health Ministry. With this recent spike, the total number of COVID-19 cases in the country surged to 1,26,86,049 while the death toll increased to 1,65,547. Meanwhile, India's active caseload stands at 7,88,223.

Serum Institute of India's CEO Adar Poonawalla told India Today that Oxford-AstraZeneca's Covishield vaccine's efficacy rises to 90% if the doses are given 2.5-3 months apart. A Lancet study had earlier said that the vaccine had 70% efficacy with a month's gap between doses. "A group was administered doses with higher gap...and they found the efficacy was 90%," Poonawalla said.

Actor Ajaz Khan, who was recently arrested by the Narcotics Control Bureau (NCB) in connection with a drugs case, has tested positive for the coronavirus. The former Bigg Boss contestant is being shifted to a hospital, an official said. The officer involved in the probe will also undergo a COVID-19 test, he added.

Actors Ashutosh Rana, Renuka Shahane and Shefali Shah have received the first dose of the coronavirus vaccine. Taking to Twitter on Tuesday, Renuka shared a picture of herself with Ashutosh and thanked the doctors and nurses for their services. Meanwhile, Shefali shared a "side effects song" penned by make-up artist Pallavi Symons and urged everyone to get vaccinated.

Speaking about receiving COVID-19 vaccination, veteran actor Dharmendra Deol said, "I took my first dose last month. There were no side effects at all. Not even a slight fever. I'm now going to take the second dose." He added, "I want everyone to know that the vaccine is absolutely safe. So get over your apprehensions and take the jab."

US President Joe Biden's administration named Gayle Smith, who helped lead the Obama administration's Ebola response, to serve as the US coordinator for Global COVID-19 Response and Health Security. Following her appointment, Smith said that her top priorities were to shorten the lifespan of the pandemic all over the world and work to detect and prevent future global health threats.

As many as 297 new COVID-19 deaths were reported in Maharashtra on Tuesday, which is the highest single-day rise in the state this year. Moreover, 55,469 new cases were recorded in the state in the last 24 hours. Maharashtra on Sunday had recorded 57,074 coronavirus cases, which was the highest in the state since the onset of the pandemic.

Delhi Health Minister Satyendar Jain on Tuesday said over 12 lakh people have been vaccinated against COVID-19 in the national capital so far. He added that 87,673 people were vaccinated on Monday. Jain said the Delhi government is hopeful that the Centre will take note of CM Arvind Kejriwal's proposal to roll out the vaccine to all.

The Jammu and Kashmir administration has ordered the suspension of indoor sports activities till further orders in view of the rising COVID-19 cases in the Union Territory. However, other sports activities can be conducted following standard operating procedures (SOPs) issued by the Centre, according to an official order.

A month-long national lockdown to stop the surge in coronavirus cases can dent India's GDP by up to 2%, Bank of America Securities warned on Tuesday. The lockdown will also aggravate fiscal risks, it said. "Given the high economic cost, we expect the Centre and state governments to try to contain the spread with tightening of COVID-19 regulations," it added.

The Ministry of Information and Broadcasting has urged private TV news channels to circulate messages for COVID-appropriate behaviour and vaccination to create awareness. It asked them to emphasise on "Dawai Bhi, Kadai Bhi" (medicines as well as strict preventive measures) message. India is the country with the third-highest coronavirus caseload in the world after the United States and Brazil.

Speaking about following social distancing rules during the ongoing COVID-19 pandemic, singer Lata Mangeshkar said, "Only my family members are allowed in my room." She added, "I miss meeting people who matter to me. But safety is more important right now than anything else. I urge the people of this country to...get the vaccination sooner rather than later."

Amid rising number of COVID-19 cases in the country, the Indian Medical Association (IMA) has written to PM Narendra Modi suggesting that vaccination should be open to everyone above the age of 18 years. According to IMA, the vaccination certificate should be made mandatory for entering into public places and receiving products under the public distribution system.

The World Health Organization (WHO) on Tuesday issued a clarification after a video claimed that the global body issued a warning about 50,000 COVID-19 deaths in the country by April 15, saying it is "fake news". The World Health Organization Regional Office for South-East Asia (SEARO) said in a tweet that it did not issue any such warning.

New Zealand PM Jacinda Ardern on Tuesday said that the country would begin a quarantine-free "travel bubble" with Australia from April 19. However, she warned that the travel arrangements could change "if there is a [COVID-19] outbreak". Most Australian states have allowed quarantine-free visits from New Zealanders since October but New Zealand had required mandatory quarantine from its neighbour.

A bar's indoor opening event in a rural Illinois county in February 2021 caused 46 COVID-19 cases and a school's closure affecting 650 kids. It also led to hospitalisation of a resident at a long-term care facility. An attendee had tested COVID-19 positive the day before the event while four others had symptoms on the day of the event.

Gujarat government on Tuesday announced night curfew in 20 cities of the state between 8 pm and 6 am from tomorrow, amid a surge in coronavirus cases. Gujarat CM Vijay Rupani said that 8 Municipal Corporations and the cities of Anand, Nadiad, Mahesana, Morbi, Patan, Godhra, Dahod, Bhuj, Gandhidham, Bharuch, Surendranagar and Amreli will have night curfew till April 30.

The total COVID-19 cases in India have surged to 1,26,86,049. Manipur (29,428), Chandigarh (28,479) and Nagaland (12,365) are among states/UTs with 1-30,000 confirmed cases. States with 30,001-3,00,000 cases include Madhya Pradesh (3,10,249), Bihar (2,69,312) and Punjab (2,54,152). Maharashtra (30,57,885), Karnataka (10,20,434) and West Bengal (5,95,576) are among states with 3,00,000+ cases.

In view of rising cases of COVID-19, the Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) has restricted the entry of people at its headquarters and other offices in Mumbai. According to a circular issued by BMC on Monday, apart from public representatives and citizens who have urgent work or meetings scheduled, no other visitor will be allowed to enter the civic body offices.

Hindustan Aeronautics Limited (HAL) donated a 32 Slice Computed Tomography scan machine costing around ?1.76 crore to Shri Atal Bihari Vajpayee Medical College and Research Institute in Bengaluru. According to R Madhavan, Chairman and MD of HAL, "Such a medical aid is the need of the hour and will be useful in diagnosing the patients including those suffering from COVID-19."

Amid rising COVID-19 cases in Rajasthan, a night curfew has been imposed in Jodhpur between 8:00 pm and 6:00 am from April 6 to April 19. This comes after Rajasthan government said district magistrates and police commissioners have the authority to impose night curfew in their jurisdiction if there is a spike in the number of cases in their districts.

MNS chief Raj Thackeray on Tuesday said migrant workers from other states were responsible for the rapid spread of coronavirus in Maharashtra. "Maharashtra is the most industrialised state in India which attracts a large number of workers from other states. The places from where these workers come lacked enough testing facilities," he said.

Active COVID-19 caseload in India has reached 7,88,223, with Maharashtra, Chhattisgarh, Karnataka, Kerala and Punjab accounting for 75% of total active cases. Government has named the five most affected districts in the three states with maximum active cases, which are Maharashtra, Chhattisgarh and Karnataka. Pune, Mumbai, Thane, Nagpur and Nashik are Maharashtra's most affected districts.

India's fight against COVID-19 over the next four weeks will be "very, very critical" as it faces a faster second surge in infections, NITI Aayog member VK Paul said on Tuesday. "Warnings were given that the situation should not be taken for granted," he added. India's daily infections passed the 100,000 mark for the first time on Monday,

Odisha?s Puri district administration has made it mandatory for travellers from five states to produce a negative COVID-19 test report on arrival at the railway station and bus stands. The restriction is imposed on visitors from Maharashtra, Madhya Pradesh, Chhattisgarh, Punjab and Kerala. It added that producing a certificate of two vaccine doses will also be acceptable.

As India crossed 1-lakh mark in daily COVID-19 cases for the first time, the export of ?Made in India? vaccines could take a hit to meet the local demands, the head of the Global Alliance for Vaccines and Immunisation (GAVI) said. "India is, by volume, the largest supplier of vaccines for the developing world," said Seth Berkley, GAVI CEO.

Over 43 lakh COVID-19 vaccine doses were administered in a span of 24 hours, the highest single-day coverage in India so far, Union Health Ministry said on Tuesday. A total of 43,00,966 vaccine doses have been administered, out of which 39,00,505 beneficiaries received the first dose while 4,00,461 have taken the second dose, according to data updated today.

The Central Government on Tuesday directed its employees of the age 45 years or above to get vaccinated to ensure that the spread of COVID-19 is contained. The decision was taken based on the strategy undertaken for prioritising the groups for vaccination, the government said. All Central Government employees have been asked to follow COVID-appropriate behaviour even after vaccination.

Union Health Secretary Rajesh Bhushan on Tuesday said that Maharashtra has 58% of the total active COVID-19 cases in India and accounts for 34% of the total COVID-19 deaths reported so far. He added that the percentage of RT-PCR tests has been reducing in Maharashtra, adding, "Only 60% of total tests were done through RT-PCR method in Maharashtra last week."

Actress Shweta Tripathi Sharma, who had tested positive for COVID-19 a month ago, commented on recovering from the virus and said, "Though it's been so long, my sense of taste and smell isn't the same." She added, "Physically, I'm okay but I don't have enough energy to workout...My muscles don't have the strength that they used to [have]."

Union Health Secretary Rajesh Bhushan on Tuesday explained why the Centre has not opened the coronavirus vaccination drive for everyone in India and said, "There are two aims of such drives- to prevent deaths and protect the healthcare system." He added, "The aim is not to administer the vaccine to those who want it but to those who need it."

Thailand's capital Bangkok will close 196 entertainment venues in three districts from Tuesday until April 19 to combat COVID-19 spread, city's governor Aswin Kwanmuang said. The closure of these establishments in Klong Toey, Wattana and Bang Khae comes after new clusters of infections were detected in some of these night-entertainment venues. The country has reported over 29,300 COVID-19 cases.

Amid rising COVID-19 cases, the Gurugram Deputy Commissioner Yash Garg has asked the police to conduct surprise checks at marriage venues and events to ensure adherence to COVID-19 appropriate behaviour. Garg added that the "Gurugram Police should issue at least 1000 challans per day to those violating protocols". Gurugram reported 581 cases on Monday, taking its active caseload to 3,168.

Actress Bhumi Pednekar, who recently tested positive for COVID-19 took to Instagram stories and urged everyone to follow the COVID-19 safety protocols. She wrote, "I've spent yesterday sleeping and recovering. Just want to say, stay home and step out only if it's really necessary. Follow protocol. Trust me this is a lot harder than you can imagine."

World's largest vaccine maker Serum Institute of India's CEO Adar Poonawalla in an interview with the Associated Press said that he's "scared" of what will happen if India's surge in COVID-19 infections doesn't subside. "We are going to have to keep supplying vaccines to India, and not anywhere else," he said. He expects India could resume vaccine exports by June.

Serum Institute of India (SII) CEO Adar Poonawalla said the company would require around ?3,000 crore to ramp up COVID-19 vaccine production capacity. "We've delivered over 100 million doses to India...and exported around 60 million doses to other countries," he said. SII hopes to increase its vaccine capacity to 110 million doses per month from June onwards, he added.

Responding to Union Health Secretary Rajesh Bhushan's explanation on COVID-19 vaccine for all age groups, Congress MP Manish Tewari termed it "most obtuse gibberish". Tewari tweeted, "Does virus have an age distinguishing vector...don't young deserve protection when you're exporting it to everybody." Earlier, Bhushan said that the vaccine isn't for "those who want it but for those who need it".

Shares of Panacea Biotec surged the most in 10 months on Tuesday after the company entered a pact to produce 100 million doses of Russia's Sputnik V vaccine in India per year. The shares were locked in upper circuit after jumping by 20% to ?220.85. Earlier, other firms like Gland Pharma and Stelis Biopharma agreed to produce the COVID-19 vaccine.

Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike Chief Commissioner Gaurav Gupta has asked zonal health officers to double the COVID-19 vaccination rate in the wake of the second wave of the pandemic in the country. Gupta said 35,000 people are being vaccinated in the city on a daily basis. He added that two lakh doses of vaccines will arrive in Karnataka on Wednesday.

To boost the vaccination drive across Bengaluru, the city's civic body Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike (BBMP) plans to set up COVID-19 vaccination sites at apartment complexes with the help of the Resident Welfare Association (RWA). The BBMP awaits approval from the Centre on this. Till April 5, BBMP has vaccinated 8,46,062 people since the vaccination drive began on January 16.

The Gujarat High Court on Tuesday said the COVID-19 situation in the state was going from bad to worse and asked the state government to consider a lockdown or curfew for three to four days. The court said such a lockdown or curfew is needed to break the chain of the transmission. Gujarat reported 3,160 COVID-19 cases on Monday.

External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar held talks with his Russian counterpart, Sergei Lavrov, in Delhi on Tuesday. Jaishankar said the bilateral and political dialogue between the two nations is at its "sustainable highest" despite COVID-19 restrictions. "This year marks the 22nd year of our strategic partnership and the 12th year of our special and privileged strategic partnership," he added.

Katrina Kaif on Tuesday shared that she has tested COVID-19 positive. "Have immediately isolated myself and will be under home quarantine. I'm following all safety protocols under the advice of my doctors. Requesting everyone who came in contact with me to get tested immediately too," she wrote. This comes after rumoured boyfriend Vicky Kaushal tested positive for the virus.

According to the fresh advisory issued by the Gurugram Health Department, the gathering in open spaces is allowed only up to 500 persons with social distancing and mask-wearing. In indoor places, 50% of capacity is allowed with a maximum of 200 persons. The department has encouraged "work from home" practice wherever possible and suggested "work staggering" in industries.

Over 100 students of Arya Kanya Gurukul in Delhi's New Rajinder Nagar are being sent back home after nine students reportedly tested positive for COVID-19. "A sadhvi...tested positive...following which 16 students who had symptoms like fever...were tested. Nine of them tested positive," an 'acharya' of the gurukul said. Students had been sent home at the start of the lockdown.

Eight teachers of four schools that fall under the Municipal Corporation of Delhi (MCD), have tested positive for COVID-19, Mayor of North Delhi Municipal Corporation (NDMC) said on Monday. This comes after the Delhi government last week announced that students of any class should not be called to schools physically in the new academic session till further orders.

Delhi government is not considering a lockdown to control the rising COVID-19 cases, said Cabinet Minister Gopal Rai. He added that while the government is exploring its options, "Night curfew has a role in it...but the government isn't completely dependent on it." A night curfew from 10 pm to 5 am till April 30 has been ordered in Delhi.

Due to the surge in COVID-19, all classes of Ranchi University are going to be online from tomorrow, Dr Kamini Kumar, V-C (Acting) said on Tuesday. Research scholars, teachers and employees will come to university as usual and perform their duties following COVID-19 guidelines, Kumar added. Currently, there are 5,882 active COVID-19 cases in Jharkhand.

Commenting on the Serum Institute of India (SII), World Bank President David Malpass said that India is blessed to have a major manufacturer of global vaccines and he is encouraged by the country's ramping up of its domestic vaccination programme. "I've had substantial contact with the Serum Institute of India," he further said. SII is manufacturing the Covishield vaccine.

In a COVID-19 review meeting with Health Ministers of 11 states, Union Health Minister Dr Harsh Vardhan said that the country's COVID-19 recovery rate is currently at 92.38%. "Despite the increasing cases, the fatality rate is at 1.30% of the country," he added. "The worst affected state is Chhattisgarh with a positivity rate of 20%," the Health Minister further said.

DMK Lok Sabha MP Kanimozhi who tested positive for COVID-19 earlier cast her vote while wearing Personal Protective Equipment (PPE) on Tuesday. The leader cast her vote at a polling station in Tamil Nadu's Mylapore in Chennai district. The Election Commission had designated one hour between 6 pm and 7 pm to allow COVID-19 infected persons to cast their votes.

US Special Presidential Envoy for Climate John Kerry said India's global leadership has been critical across a range of issues, including delivering COVID-19 jabs to the world. He said, "India is getting the job done on climate. You're indisputably a world leader...in...deployment of renewable energy." He also appreciated PM Narendra Modi-led government's target of 450 GW of renewables by 2030.

Former Maharashtra CM and BJP leader Devendra Fadnavis has written to CM Uddhav Thackeray requesting him to reconsider restrictions imposed to prevent COVID-19 spread. Fadnavis has requested the CM to discuss these things with all strata of society again and impose restrictions so that the lives of commoners are not affected. Restrictions were imposed in the state on Sunday.

Singapore will accept visitors with IATA mobile travel pass containing digital certificates for COVID-19 tests and vaccines, starting next month. It will accept the pass for pre-departure checks, where travellers can get clearance to fly to and enter Singapore by showing a smartphone app containing their data from accredited laboratories. The pass was successfully tested by Singapore Airlines.

India's largest diamond exchange Bharat Diamond Bourse (BDB) has decided to stop operations "until further notice" amid the surge in coronavirus cases. The bourse has requested the Maharashtra government to allow it to function with 20% staff strength for completion of export orders, BDB President Anoop Mehta said. The bourse handles around 98% of the country's diamond exports.

Vietnam's National Assembly on Monday elected Pham Minh Chinh as the country's next Prime Minister and outgoing PM Nguyen Xuan Phuc as the new President. Chinh most recently was a member of the ruling Communist party's Central Committee for Personnel and Organisation. Under Phuc, Vietnam's economy boomed and his government was praised for its response to the COVID-19 pandemic.

BCCI President Sourav Ganguly on Sunday assured that everything will go on as per schedule in the upcoming IPL despite the resurgence of COVID-19 in the country. Sourav's confirmation comes after Maharashtra government announced a weekend lockdown to curb the pandemic. Earlier, BCCI Vice President Rajeev Shukla had also said that IPL 2021 would go ahead "without any problem".

Uttar Pradesh CM Yogi Adityanath on Monday received his first shot of the COVID-19 vaccine at Lucknow's Civil Hospital. "I thank PM Narendra Modi and Union Health Ministry for making the vaccine available free of cost. I also thank the scientists of the country. The vaccine is completely safe. We all should take it when our turn comes," Adityanath said.

Maharashtra reported 47,288 new COVID-19 cases, 26,252 discharges and 155 deaths in the last 24 hours, official figures released on Monday showed. The state's total cases now stand at 30,57,885, total discharges at 25,49,075, active cases at 4,51,375 and death toll at 56,033. Maharashtra's capital Mumbai reported 9,857 new COVID-19 cases and 21 deaths during the same period.

Actor Kartik Aaryan, who recently tested positive for coronavirus, took to social media on Monday and announced that he has tested negative. "Negative. 14 din ka vanvaas over. Back to work," the 'Bhool Bhulaiyaa 2' actor tweeted along with his picture. On Sunday, Kartik had shared a post where he revealed that he was waiting for his test results.

Actress Alia Bhatt, who recently tested positive for COVID-19, took to Instagram to share her first picture post-diagnosis. Sharing a selfie where she is seen resting on her bed in a white outfit, Alia wrote, "One day at a time." Alia's best friend Akansha Ranjan Kapoor also commented on the post and wrote, "One call at a time".

Actor Govinda's wife Sunita, who on Sunday confirmed that the actor has tested positive for COVID-19, has now revealed that she was the one who had tested positive before him. She said, "I think I got infected in Kolkata." Sunita also gave an update on Govinda's health and added that he only has body ache and cold.

AAP MLA Raghav Chadha on Monday alleged that Prime Minister Narendra Modi took the decision to export COVID-19 vaccines to other countries because he wanted to improve his global image. He said, "Central government exported more vaccine doses than it administered to the citizens." Chadha added that the government is more concerned about its image than saving people's lives.

Uttarakhand Director General of Police (DGP) Ashok Kumar on Monday appealed to the people to wear masks and maintain social distancing to avoid another lockdown. "Lockdowns are bad in every way. They hit children's studies and harm the economy. I urge people to make a habit of wearing masks," Kumar added. Uttarakhand reported 550 COVID-19 cases on Sunday.

Actress Rupali Ganguly, who recently tested positive for COVID-19, is celebrating her quarantined birthday today. Rupali said that it's going to be heartbreaking to celebrate her birthday away from her family. She added, "This year we had a nice bungalow booked in Alibaug. We were all gonna go there...now I've to cut my...cake on...zoom call with my husband and son."

Shopkeepers in Pune are confused over the timings of shop closure after the Maharashtra government announced new COVID-19 restrictions, said a traders' body. Earlier, the PMC said all shops were allowed to remain open following social distancing norms between 6 am to 6 pm, however, the new guidelines for containment areas mandate all shops to remain shut barring essential services.

Pune has inoculated 8% of its population in the district as over a million doses have been given. As of Tuesday, the district has seen 10.75 lakh vaccinations of which 9.88 lakh have got only the first dose and of those who got the first jab, over 87,000 have got the second dose. The district has over 523 vaccination sites.

Around 65-70 people including students, teachers and staff at Rajasthan's IIT Jodhpur have tested positive for COVID-19 so far and about 55-60 of them are currently infected with the coronavirus, the authorities said on Sunday. "Block G3 on campus declared a micro-containment zone. Most of the positive students came from their houses in Chandigarh, Gujarat and Jaipur," said an official.

The makers of 'Sooryavanshi' on Monday announced that the film's release has been indefinitely postponed due to the surge in COVID-19 cases in Maharashtra and across the country. It was also informed that Chief Minister Uddhav Thackeray appreciated director Rohit Shetty's decision to postpone the film. 'Sooryavanshi' stars Akshay Kumar and Katrina Kaif in the lead roles.

Paris Saint Germain defender Alessandro Florenzi has tested positive for COVID-19 and will miss their Champions League quarter-final first leg at Bayern Munich, the French club said on Monday. Florenzi's teammate and fellow Italy international Marco Verratti is out of Wednesday's game in Munich as well after he tested positive on Friday. PSG tweeted that Florenzi had been self-isolating.

Investors' wealth tumbled over ?2.16 lakh crore on Monday as markets crashed amid a sharp spike in coronavirus cases in the country. The BSE Sensex plummeted 1,449.03 points during intra-day trade and finally closed 870.51 points lower at 49,159.32. Despite stable global cues, the Indian indices ended with losses as the country recorded the biggest spike with 1,03,558 new cases.

Veteran Bengali actor Soumitra Chatterjee's wife Deepa Chatterjee passed away on Sunday due to kidney failure in a Kolkata hospital, her family informed. Deepa was 83 and was hospitalised since March 31. The news of Deepa's death comes months after Soumitra's passing away, who died in November last year following a long battle with various ailments after testing COVID-19 positive.

Indian Economy is better poised to deal with the second wave of COVID-19 pandemic, a Finance Ministry report has said. "It is well-equipped with adequate testing and health infrastructure and economic activity has adapted to the pandemic," the report further said. Agricultural sector remained a bright spot with foodgrains production touching 303.3 million tonnes in 2020-21, it added.

PM Narendra Modi will on Thursday hold a virtual meeting with Chief Ministers of all states and Union Territories to discuss the COVID-19 situation and issues related to vaccination in the country, the Prime Minister's Office said. During a COVID-19 review meeting on Sunday, PM Modi directed central teams of experts to be sent to Maharashtra, Punjab and Chhattisgarh.

Several students in Bihar's Sasaram district pelted stones and vandalised vehicles to protest against the state government's decision to defer the reopening of schools, colleges and coaching institutes by a week in view of rising COVID-19 cases. Police fired bullets to bring the situation under control. Vehicular movement was suspended in the area.

Maharashtra Chief Minister Uddhav Thackeray on Monday wrote to PM Narendra Modi requesting him to allow the COVID-19 vaccination of all above the age of 25 years. Thackeray said that vaccinating a large number of young people would help reduce the number of patients. Over 76 lakh people have been vaccinated till April 4, the CM added.

The Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike (BBMP) has proposed to set up COVID-19 vaccination sites at big corporate offices and apartment complexes in collaboration with private hospitals. BBMP Administrator Rakesh Singh said that the civic body has approached the Centre to seek its approval. ?The talks are on...We haven't received any order to start the process as of yet," he added.

The Russian Direct Investment Fund (RDIF) on Monday announced that Panacea Biotec has agreed to produce 10 crore doses of Sputnik V COVID-19 vaccine in India annually. The vaccine is registered in 59 countries globally and has 91.6% efficacy, a joint statement said. Earlier, Indian pharmaceutical firms Virchow Biotech, Stelis Biopharma and Hetero struck similar deals to supply the vaccine.

Mumbai reported 9,857 new COVID-19 cases, 3,357 discharges and 21 deaths in the last 24 hours, figures released on Monday evening showed. Mumbai's total cases now stand at 4,62,302, total recoveries at 3,74,985, active cases at 74,522 and deaths at 11,797. The surge in cases forced Maharashtra CM on Sunday to impose a statewide night curfew and weekend lockdown.

Pharmaceutical company Zydus Cadila on Monday said that it has sought Drugs Controller General of India's (DCGI) approval for using its hepatitis drug for treating COVID-19 as its Phase-III clinical trials showed promising results. "The treatment regimen would be less cumbersome and more affordable for patients as Pegylated Interferon Alpha 2b [PegIFN] is a single-dose regimen," Zydus Cadila said.

The Delhi government on Monday said one-third of COVID-19 vaccination centres in government hospitals will be open for 24 hours of the day from tomorrow. All vaccination centres in Delhi were earlier asked to operate for 12 hours from 9 am to 9 pm. A third of these centres will now also be open from 9 pm to 9 am.

French prosecutors have launched a probe into claims that ministers and other wealthy guests attended secret dinners and parties that violated COVID-19 restrictions. A local channel aired hidden camera footage allegedly shot at a high-end restaurant where neither the staff nor the diners were wearing masks. The allegations surfaced after France entered a third national lockdown on Saturday.

Mexico's President Andr?s Manuel Lpez Obrador said that he won't get vaccinated against COVID-19 because his doctors told him he still has a high level of antibodies from when he was infected in January. The 67-year-old leader had previously said that he would wait his turn in line to get vaccinated and didn't want it to become a "spectacle".

India has recorded more than one lakh COVID-19 cases in a span of 24 hours with 1,03,558 new cases, the highest single-day rise in infections since the pandemic began last year. The country reported 478 deaths, taking the COVID-19 death toll to 1,65,101. The total COVID-19 cases in the country stand at 1,25,89,067, while the active cases stand at 7,41,830.

Maharashtra Governor Bhagat Singh Koshyari received the second dose of the COVID-19 vaccine at Sir JJ Group of Hospitals in Mumbai on Monday. He had taken the first dose of the vaccine on March 5. Director of Medical Education and Research Dr TP Lahane and Sir JJ Group of Hospitals Dean Dr Ranjit Mankeshwar were present during Koshyari's vaccination.

The total number of COVID-19 vaccinations in the country has crossed 7.9 crore on Monday. As many as 16,38,464 COVID-19 vaccine doses were administered on Sunday across the country, said the Union Health Ministry. Eight states account for 60% of the cumulative COVID-19 vaccine doses given so far. Meanwhile, India's daily new COVID-19 cases continue to rise.

Rowing Federation of India (RFI) president Rajlaxmi Singh Deo on Sunday said that 34 rowers and four coaches have received the second dose of the coronavirus vaccine. ?Both the shots have been given to around 34 rowers with four coaches. About all belong to the Army I am sure. The women team in Bhopal has also been vaccinated,? said Rajlaxmi.

While speaking about the ongoing coronavirus pandemic, singer Lata Mangeshkar expressed concerns about the young people contracting the virus. "It's become much worse, and we are to blame for it...Udit Narayanji's son Aditya has COVID-19. Even children are getting it. There's no certainty about how not to get the virus. Isolation is the only solution," Lata said.

A day after Akshay Kumar tested positive for the coronavirus, it has been confirmed that 45 crew members on 'Ram Setu' sets have also tested positive for COVID-19. As a result, the shoot of the film has been halted. Further, Akshay today confirmed that he has been hospitalised as a precautionary measure under medical advice.

Actors Vicky Kaushal and Bhumi Pednekar took to their respective social media accounts to share that they have tested positive for coronavirus. "Inspite of all care and precautions, unfortunately, I have tested positive for COVID-19. Following all essential protocols, I am under home quarantine," wrote Kaushal. Meanwhile, Bhumi said that she has mild symptoms but "is feeling ok".

Delhi Health Minister Satyendar Jain on Monday said that according to doctors, in the current wave of coronavirus, the "virus spreads rapidly but is less severe". He added that the state government will soon launch micro-containment zones in areas with two or three coronavirus patients. Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal had earlier said that there were no plans for a lockdown.

BCCI vice-president Rajeev Shukla has said that the board will get in touch with the Health Ministry soon to request for vaccination of players against coronavirus. ?I think the only solution is to get vaccinated,? he added. The rising number of coronavirus cases has forced BCCI to think of players? vaccination ahead of the Indian Premier League (IPL).

Goa CM Pramod Sawant on Monday said, "There is no immediate plan to impose lockdown or curfew in Goa. We are monitoring the situation in Maharashtra and Karnataka where COVID-19 cases are rising alarmingly." Sawant added that testing in Goa has been increased. "We advise social distancing...People should take care of themselves and get themselves tested," Sawant said.

Amid rising COVID-19 cases, the Bengaluru civic body has decided to deploy 2,000 more home guards to ensure citizens follow COVID-19 protocols. These home guards will be in addition to the police personnel and marshals who are already deployed for the purpose. The civic body is also aiming to increase vaccinations from 35,000 per day to at least 70,000.

Arunachal Pradesh didn't report any fresh COVID-19 case in the last two days, a health department official said on Monday. The COVID-19 caseload in Arunachal remained at 16,849, State Surveillance Officer (SSO) Dr Lobsang Jampa said. The state currently has eight active COVID-19 cases, while 56 people have died due to the virus so far, the SSO added.

India's manufacturing sector activity grew at its weakest pace in seven months in March due to low domestic demand and output amid surge in COVID-19 cases, according to a private survey. The IHS Markit India Manufacturing Purchasing Managers' Index (PMI) fell to 55.4 in March from 57.5 in February. However, new exports and work orders increased during the period.

Pictures have surfaced online which show hundreds of people violating the social distancing norms at Mumbai's Dadar vegetable market on Monday morning. Many people were seen without a proper mask at the market, reported ANI. This comes a day after both Mumbai and Maharashtra recorded their highest single-day spike in COVID-19 cases at 11,163 and 57,074 cases respectively.

Indian benchmark indices on Monday fell amid rising COVID-19 cases and new restrictions imposed in various states. Sensex fell 870 points or 1.74% to end at 49,159.32 while the broader Nifty 50 ended 229.55 points or 1.54% lower to close at 14,637.80. Bajaj Finance, SBI, Eicher Motors and Mahindra & Mahindra were the top losers.

The Bihar Public Service Commission (BPSC) postponed the Bihar Judicial Services (BJS) examination 2021 after aspirants requested postponement or cancellation of the examination due to surge in COVID-19 cases in Patna. The examination was scheduled to be held from April 8 to 13. "The new dates for the exam will be announced in the due course of time," said BPSC.

Maharashtra Cabinet Minister Nawab Malik on Monday confirmed that the state has given its nod for IPL 2021 matches to be held in Mumbai despite the COVID-19 surge. However, he said the permission was given with restrictions in place, including no spectators, no overcrowding and presence of bio-bubbles. The confirmation comes after weekend lockdown was announced in Maharashtra on Sunday.

Pune District Collector Rajesh Deshmukh has urged Dakshin Maharashtra and Goa Sub Area General Officer in Commanding to provide additional beds for COVID-19 positive civilians at Army Institute of Cardio-Thoracic Sciences (AICTS). Deshmukh said the district has over 70,000 active cases. More than 322 civilian patients requiring critical care have been admitted to AICTS since September last year.

England's Football Association has said they're hoping that Wembley Stadium will be at full capacity for European Championship final in July. Several pilot events will be taking place to assess procedures for testing on spectators and visitors ahead of the relaxation of coronavirus restrictions in England in May. The pilot events include three matches with spectators increasing in each match.

Rajasthan government on Sunday ordered the closure of cinema halls, theatres and multiplexes to control the spread of coronavirus in the state. The CM Ashok Gehlot-led government has made RT-PCR tests mandatory for everyone entering the state. It has also capped the number of guests at weddings at 100 and allowed District Magistrates to impose night curfews.

Tokyo Olympics-bound archers and rowers have received COVID-19 vaccine as their national camps are being held at Army facilities in Pune. Archers Atanu Das, Tarundeep Rai, Pravin Jadhav and Deepika Kumari got their first shot. The five male members of the rowing team completed their vaccination course on Saturday.

As many as 7,59,79,651 COVID-19 vaccine doses have been administered in the country, the Union Health Ministry said on Sunday. The cumulative vaccination figure includes over 6.5 crore first doses, while the second dose numbers have crossed the 1 crore mark. More than eight lakh beneficiaries above the age of 45 have received the second dose so far.

Vice President M Venkaiah Naidu received the second dose of the COVID-19 vaccine at AIIMS in Delhi on Sunday. "I appeal to all the eligible people to get themselves vaccinated immediately and everyone to continue to follow all precautions in view of the surge in cases in some parts of the country," the Vice President Secretariat tweeted quoting Naidu.

A Surat-based textile company started a free one-week-long COVID-19 vaccination drive for its 6,000 employees on Saturday. "They (employees) either have to take the vaccine or get tested after every three days or else they won't be allowed to work. Hopefully, it would encourage all to get vaccinated," said Sanjay Saravagi, the director of the company.

A coronavirus vaccination camp in Gujarat's Rajkot is giving freebies including a gold nose pin for women and a hand blender for men who get vaccinated. The goldsmith community in the area are giving out freebies to encourage people to receive vaccine. The number of people who've received the first dose of vaccine in Gujarat is 61,27,830 as on Sunday.

Mumbai recorded 11,163 new coronavirus cases in the last 24 hours, marking the city's biggest daily COVID-19 case surge since the beginning of the pandemic. As many as 25 more died of the virus in Mumbai in the last 24 hours, taking the city's COVID-19 death toll to 11,776. The city's cumulative caseload now stands at 4,52,445.

Uttar Pradesh CM Yogi Adityanath-led government has directed to launch focussed vaccination drive from April 8, amid a spike in COVID-19 cases. The Additional Chief Secretary Information Navneet Sehgal said COVID-19 vaccines would be administered to those high-risk groups above the age of 45 years who move around often in the public and are vulnerable to catch and spread coronavirus.

Delhi on Sunday recorded 4,033 new coronavirus cases in the last 24 hours, marking the biggest daily case surge in the national capital this year. As many as 21 more have died of the virus in the last 24 hours in Delhi, taking the COVID-19 death toll there to 11,081. Delhi's cumulative COVID-19 caseload now stands at 6,76,414.

Karnataka government on Sunday relaxed coronavirus restrictions and allowed gyms to open at 50% capacity. Gym operators have, however, been warned of closure if they fail to sanitise their equipment after every use. In an earlier order issued on April 2, the state government had ordered gyms to stay closed amid a COVID-19 surge.

Maharashtra on Sunday reported 57,074 new COVID-19 cases, the highest single-day spike in cases the state has seen so far. The total cases recorded in the state now stand at 30,10,597 and active cases at 4,30,503. With another 222  deaths in the last 24 hours, Maharashtra's coronavirus death toll has now reached 55,878.

French Sports Minister Roxana Maracineanu said on Saturday that it was possible the French Open could be postponed for the second year amid the COVID-19 crisis. France entered a third nationwide lockdown on Saturday to contain the coronavirus spread, although professional sports have been largely spared. The 2021 French Open is due to start this year from May 23.

The US government has stopped a Baltimore manufacturing plant that ruined 1.5 crore doses of Johnson & Johnson's COVID-19 vaccine from making the vaccine developed by Oxford-AstraZeneca, the New York Times reported. J&J said it was "assuming full responsibility" of the Emergent BioSolutions facility, reiterating that it will deliver 100 million doses to the government by the end of May.

Madhya Pradesh CM Shivraj Singh Chouhan said that his government will restrict the movement of people from Chhattisgarh to contain the spread of COVID-19. "Those who need to come for necessary and unavoidable work will be allowed on humanitarian grounds and transportation of goods will continue," he said. A lockdown will be enforced in isolated areas whenever needed, Chouhan added.

Actor Govinda has tested positive for COVID-19, confirmed the actor's wife Sunita on Sunday. She said, "His symptoms are absolutely mild. There's nothing to worry about." The 57-year-old actor is currently quarantining at home and taking precautions, Sunita added. Earlier in the day, actor Akshay Kumar had also informed that he has tested positive.

Royal Challengers Bangalore (RCB) today revealed that Devdutt Padikkal tested positive for coronavirus on March 22. They added that he will be fit to join the RCB bio-bubble once his RT-PCR tests are negative. "He is doing well and is expected to join the squad for the upcoming IPL season," they further said.

Akshay Kumar took to Twitter to share that he has tested positive for coronavirus. He wrote, "Following all the protocols, I've immediately isolated myself. I am under home quarantine and have sought necessary medical care." He added, "I would sincerely request all those that have come in contact with me to get themselves tested and take care...Back in action soon!"

Actor Vikrant Massey's fiancee, Sheetal Thakur wished the actor on his 34th birthday. Taking to Instagram, Sheetal shared a candid picture of Vikrant and captioned it, "Thank god you were born. Happy birthday!" Meanwhile, Vikrant is currently under home quarantine after testing positive for the coronavirus. "Step out of your homes, only if necessary," Vikrant wrote in a post.

Assam government has made a negative RT-PCR report must for air travellers coming from Mumbai and Bengaluru from April 9 due to the COVID-19 surge. The test should be conducted within 72 hours prior to undertaking the journey. Meanwhile, passengers arriving in trains originating from/transiting through Maharashtra and Karnataka will undergo screening for symptoms at railway stations in Assam.

Maharashtra will be put under night curfew from 8 pm to 7 am due to the rising number of COVID-19 cases from Monday, Maharashtra Minister Aslam Shaikh said on Sunday. Malls, theatres, bars will be shut and restaurants and hotels will be allowed to offer only takeaway services. A complete weekend lockdown will also be imposed in Maharashtra.

The Pimpri Chinchwad Municipal Corporation (PCMC) has set up COVID-19 vaccination centres in housing societies that have at least 400 residents above the age of 45, PCMC Additional Health and Medical Officer Pavan Salve said. The vaccination programme will continue at other places as earlier, he added. The move aims at speeding up the vaccination process.

Hyderabad Cricket Association (HCA) president Mohammed Azharuddin on Sunday said that the association will offer its services to BCCI to ensure that IPL 2021 is conducted in 'safe and secure' venues amid rising coronavirus cases. "In these difficult times there are all the more reasons for us to stand by each other," Azharuddin wrote on Twitter.

Speaking about singer Bappi Lahiri, who recently tested positive for COVID-19, his son Bappa said, "Dad tested positive...after I landed in Mumbai [from the United States]." He added, "I had checked into a hotel...to protect my parents from [the] risk of contracting any infection...As soon as I entered the hotel, I got to know about dad."

Around 70% of coronavirus patients tested at a hospital in Japan's Tokyo last month carried a mutation known for reducing vaccine protection, Japanese public broadcaster NHK said on Sunday. The E484K mutation, nicknamed "Eek" by some scientists, was found in 10 of the 14 cases at Tokyo Medical and Dental University Medical Hospital in March.

Singer Udit Narayan spoke about his son, singer Aditya Narayan and daughter-in-law, Shweta Agarwal, who recently tested positive for COVID-19. Udit said that Aditya has been hospitalised, while Shweta is under home quarantine. He added, "I...received a text from Aditya saying, 'Papa, don't worry about me...Just pray for me.'" "Stay safe...This too shall pass," Aditya earlier wrote in a post.

Bhool Bhulaiyaa 2' director Anees Bazmee provided a health update about Kartik Aaryan, who recently tested positive for coronavirus, and said, "Kartik...didn't have many symptoms...when he tested positive...he's doing fine and is recovering well." Anees further added, "He had always been taking a lot of precautions. I'm in touch with him to check on his health."

Speaking about her daughter, actress Alia Bhatt, who recently tested positive for COVID-19, Soni Razdan said, "In the last few days, I've called her in the morning to check on her. I don't want to burden her with constant calls...it'll stress her out." She added, "I sent her messages suggesting what she should eat, which is simple and light food."

The Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj International Airport (CSMIA) has announced a fine of ?1,000 against people found violating the COVID-19 norms. This includes a refusal to wear a mask or not following physical distancing. "In the event of non-compliance of COVID rules, the violator will be handed over to the authorities for further action," the CSMIA said in a statement.

The number of active sealed buildings in Mumbai has increased by 350% in last one month, according to BMC data. While on March 2, there were 145 buildings that were sealed entirely as more than five people had tested positive for COVID-19 in these buildings, 657 buildings were sealed entirely as of April 2, the data added.

Television actress Rupali Ganguly, who is currently playing the lead role in television series 'Anupama', said that her family has tested COVID-19 negative. "Jai...Mahakaal...family and...staff...have tested negative...Thank you...for the prayers." Rupali had earlier informed that she has tested positive for COVID-19. "Have quarantined myself away from my family," Rupali wrote in a post.

French Finance Minister Bruno Le Maire has cut the country's 2021 GDP growth forecast to 5% from 6%, following an 8.1% contraction last year. This comes after a four-week nationwide lockdown was imposed in France to stop the surge in coronavirus cases. Government's assistance to businesses impacted by the lockdown would cost around $12.9 billion in April, Le Maire said.

India on Friday added the most number of COVID-19 cases than any other country. It surpassed, on average, the number of new infections in the United States. In the seven days till Friday, India recorded 68,969 new cases a day on average, while the US recorded 65,753 and Brazil recorded 72,151 new cases a day over the week's period.

Actress Sheetal Thakur shared a health update about her fianc?, actor Vikrant Massey, who recently tested positive for COVID-19, and said, "Vikrant is still in quarantine." She added, "He was shooting in Bhopal when he tested positive...he immediately quarantined himself there. He doesn't have any heavy symptoms...I'm in touch with him and there's nothing major to worry about."

Maharashtra is witnessing a rise in COVID-19 cases as testing is being conducted on a large scale across the state, said Shiv Sena MP Sanjay Raut. He further stated that large scale testing is not being done in other states. Maharashtra has reported the highest daily new COVID-19 cases in India at 49,447, according to the Union Health Ministry.

Real Sociedad defeated Athletic Bilbao 1-0 in the delayed 2019-20 Copa del Rey final on Saturday. The final was delayed from last season at the behest of both clubs to ensure fans could attend the event but continued COVID-19 restrictions in Spain meant fans still couldn't attend. Meanwhile, Bilbao will face Barcelona in this season's final on April 17.

India has reported 93,249 new COVID-19 cases in the last 24 hours which is the highest number of cases reported in a day in 2021. The country reported 513 deaths in the last 24 hours, taking the COVID-19 death toll to 1,64,623. The total COVID-19 cases in the country stand at 1,24,85,509, while the active cases stand at 6,91,597.

BCCI Vice-President Rajeev Shukla is confident that despite the surge in COVID-19 cases in the country the upcoming edition of IPL will go ahead "without any problem". "That's why only six venues have been kept and bio-bubble has been created...Those who are in bio-bubble, they're getting tested," Shukla said. He also added that Lucknow is the first back-up venue.

Jammu and Kashmir administration has announced to close all schools up to class 9 from April 5 to 18 due to rising COVID-19 cases. Schools will be closed for classes 10 to 12 from April 5 to 11. Further, social gatherings and customary functions will be restricted to 200 people only and after following due COVID-19 SOPs, the administration said.

Assam Health Minister Himanta Biswa Sarma on Saturday said there was no need for face masks in Assam as 'COVID-19 was no longer present' there. He responded to those criticising and "making fun of him" for the remarks and said, "Come to Assam, see how we've contained COVID-19." As per Union Health Ministry data, Assam has 1,945 active COVID-19 cases.

Pinterest has held talks to buy Visual Supply, maker of the VSCO photo-editing app, The New York Times reported. VSCO, which was last valued at $550 million, had laid off around 30% of staff, or 45 of its employees amid COVID-19. Founded in 2011, VSCO has raised around $90 million to date, according to Crunchbase.

Pakistan Peoples Party Chairman Bilawal Bhutto Zardari said the country is not ready to combat the ongoing third wave of COVID-19 due to the government's "stubbornness" and "refusal" to purchase vaccines for every citizen. Pakistan is trailing behind India, Bangladesh, Sri Lanka and Afghanistan in the vaccination drive and tackling COVID-19, despite Afghanistan being a war-torn country, he added.

Dravida Munnetra Kazhagam (DMK) MP, Kanimozhi, has tested positive for COVID-19. She is currently in home isolation and has cancelled all her events ahead of the upcoming Assembly elections in Tamil Nadu. Kanimozhi, who represents Thoothukudi in the Lok Sabha, had been involved in campaigning for DMK for the upcoming Tamil Nadu Assembly polls.

As many as thirteen hostellers and two officials of Delhi University's St Stephen's College tested positive for COVID-19. This comes after 40 students were taken on a trip to Dalhousie. "The inner perimeter of college...out of bounds for all, unless specific clearance is given...outer perimeter may be accessed by those with relevant work after due process," the principal said.

There are a total of 6,58,909 active coronavirus cases in India. The government today released a list of 10 districts and cities accounting for 50% of the total active COVID-19 cases. They include: Pune, Mumbai, Nagpur, Thane, Nashik, Bengaluru Urban, Aurangabad, Delhi, Ahmednagar and Nanded. Pune accounts for 10.75% of the total active caseload of the country.

Delhi Deputy CM Manish Sisodia and his wife Seema received their first dose of coronavirus vaccine at Lok Nayak Hospital, which is attached to Maulana Azad Medical College, on Saturday. "Thankful to our brilliant scientists, medical teams and everyone who worked tirelessly for making vaccines for us," he tweeted sharing the pictures. Delhi recorded 3,594 daily cases on Friday.

While stating that India hasn't imposed export ban on coronavirus vaccines, External Affairs Ministry said the country has taken the lead in sending vaccines abroad with over 640 lakh doses supplied to over 80 countries till now. It added that 'Vaccine Maitree' initiative to supply vaccines has been "very successful and very well liked" by our partners across the world.

A healthcare worker in Uttar Pradesh's Kanpur allegedly administered double dose of coronavirus vaccine to a woman, which led to an uproar at the centre and the in-charge informed higher officials about the case. The healthcare worker was allegedly busy over the phone while vaccinating the woman. The woman's relatives have reportedly filed a formal complaint with Chief Medical Officer.

The US employers added 9.16 lakh jobs in the month of March as the COVID-19 vaccine rollout and fewer business restrictions supported recovery, according to the Labour Department. The surge in hiring was the highest since August last year. The unemployment rate fell to the lowest since the start of the pandemic at 6% as against 6.2% in February.

Television actress Kanchi Singh, who's known for playing Gayatri in the TV series 'Yeh Rishta Kya Kehlata Hai', took to her Instagram and announced that she has tested positive for coronavirus. "Unfortunately, I have tested positive for COVID-19. I've isolated myself...I'm following all the safety protocols...take care, stay safe and...don't step out if you don't have to," she wrote.

Director Prem Soni, known for films like 'Ishkq in Paris' and 'Main Aurr Mrs Khanna', has tested positive for coronavirus and is under home quarantine. He said, "Taking all precautions as required and being as responsible as I can to avoid spreading it." Soni was diagnosed with cancer of the gallbladder in 2012 but recovered after a year-long battle.

Mumbai on Saturday recorded over 9,000 new coronavirus cases in the last 24 hours, marking the biggest daily COVID-19 case surge in the city since the beginning of the pandemic. As many as 9,090 new COVID-19 cases were reported there today and 27 more have died of the virus in the last 24 hours. Mumbai now has 62,187 active cases.

Union Health Ministry has shared a video of Dr NK Arora, who is part of ICMR's COVID-19 response team, to address "rumours" about coronavirus vaccine shortage. Dr Arora said, "There's neither been a vaccine shortage in India till now nor is there any possibility of shortage...CoWin portal...is used to manage vaccine supply requirements and ensure vaccine stock doesn't run out."

The revenue collection of the Pimpri-Chinchwad Municipal Corporation (PCMC) has dipped by over ?300 crore for the year 2021, civic officials said. Officials said in 2019-2020, the total revenue collected was ?3,153 crore. However, as COVID-19 raged on in 2020-21, the revenue collection dipped to ?2,846 crore, ?307 crore less than the previous year.

All Maharashtra state board students of classes 1 to 8 will be promoted to the next class without any exam in view of the COVID-19 situation, state School Education Minister Varsha Gaikwad said on Saturday. "A decision regarding students of classes 9 and 11 will soon be taken," said Gaikwad. Maharashtra had recorded nearly 48,000 COVID-19 cases on Friday.

With 87,505 testings, we are testing five times higher than other states, Delhi Health Minister Satyendar Jain said. "Delhi's positivity rate stands at 4.11%," he added. "The number of beds in private hospitals have been escalated from 15% to 25%. Two-third beds in Delhi hospitals are vacant," Jain further said. Delhi reported 3,594 new COVID-19 cases on Friday.

Bangladesh on Saturday said that the country will enter a week-long nationwide lockdown from April 5 to curb the new wave of coronavirus. "Every office and court will be closed during this lockdown but industries and mills will continue their operation on rotation," State Minister for Public Administration Farhad Hossain said. Bangladesh has reported over 6.24 lakh COVID-19 cases.

Music composer Vishal Dadlani on Friday revealed that he has received the first dose of coronavirus vaccine at a hospital in Mumbai. "Barely any 'after-effects', just a slightly sore shoulder from the needle. Science WILL beat this damned virus," he wrote on Twitter. Music composer Salim Merchant also recently shared a video wherein he was seen getting vaccinated.

The chairman of the selection committee of Indian men's cricket team Chetan Sharma said that he received the first dose of coronavirus vaccine on Friday. The former India fast bowler also urged people who are eligible to take the COVID-19 vaccine to get themselves vaccinated. Ex-cricketers Kapil Dev and Madan Lal received their first dose of coronavirus vaccine last month.

Seven people who suffered blood clots after receiving the Oxford-AstraZeneca vaccine against coronavirus have died in the UK, the nation's medicines regulator has said. In total, 30 people out of 1.8 crore vaccinated in the UK by March 24 had these clots, it added. This comes amid decision by several European countries to pause the use of the AstraZeneca vaccine.
