Amid rising cases of coronavirus in Maharashtra, the BCCI has reportedly placed Hyderabad and Indore as a backup venue option if they are forced to cancel the matches in Mumbai. At least 10 groundsmen at Mumbai's Wankhede Stadium have tested positive for coronavirus so far. Currently, Chennai, Mumbai, Ahmedabad, Delhi, Bengaluru and Kolkata are set to host IPL.

Ten ground staff of Mumbai's Wankhede Stadium have tested positive for coronavirus ahead of the Indian Premier League (IPL) 2021. A Mumbai Cricket Association (MCA) official has said that the infected staffers have been placed in isolation and the matches will be held "as per schedule". Hyderabad and Indore are on stand-by in case the situation worsens, he added.

Tennis players who have completed COVID-19 vaccination would no longer be considered as close contacts of anyone testing positive for the virus, according to new protocols by men's governing body ATP. The ATP and the women's WTA said it suggested players to take the vaccine shots when available. Some players at the 2021 Miami Open expressed reluctance to get vaccinated.

Netherlands Health Ministry said it's temporarily suspending Oxford-AstraZeneca COVID-19 vaccine use for people under 60 following the death of a woman who had received it. Dutch medicine monitoring agency Lareb said it has received five reports of extensive blood clots with low platelet counts after vaccinations with Oxford's vaccine. The events had occurred 7-10 days after vaccination, it added.

Union Minister of Minority Affairs Mukhtar Abbas Naqvi on Saturday received his second dose of the COVID-19 vaccine at the Parliament House Annexe. "'Made in India'...vaccines are absolutely safe. All those [who're]...eligible, should get vaccinated and contribute in making India Corona free," Naqvi tweeted after taking the vaccine. He'd received his first shot of the COVID-19 vaccine on March 2.

Argentina's President Alberto Fernndez on Saturday took to Twitter to announce that he has tested positive for COVID-19 and waiting for the results of a PCR test to confirm the diagnosis. "I am physically well and...I am also in good spirits.," he said. Fernndez had received Russia's Sputnik V coronavirus vaccine early this year.

Johnson & Johnson has said that it's expanding a clinical trial for its coronavirus vaccine to include adolescents aged 12-17. The trial had previously included "healthy adults aged 18 to 55" and  "adults aged 65 years and older". The vaccine will  be initially tested in teenagers aged 16-17 and then expanded to minors as young as 12 years old.

Odisha government has imposed a night curfew between 10 pm and 5 am in 10 districts of the state from Monday, April 5, in view of the coronavirus case surge. The districts where night curfew will be imposed are Sundargarh, Jharsuguda, Sambalpur, Bargarh, Bolangir, Nuapada, Kalahandi, Nabarangpur, Koraput and Malkangiri. Essential services can stay operational after 10 pm.

Pune Municipal Corporation (PMC) will shut swimming pools, spas, gyms, sports complexes and clubs for a week from today as it recorded 4,766 daily cases on Friday. Gatherings of five or more persons during the day will be fined ?1,000 each. This is in addition to restrictions in place in the district to contain the spread of coronavirus.

The gross GST revenue collections in Jammu and Kashmir in FY21 increased by 2.94% to ?4,890.35 crore from ?4,750.60 crore in the previous fiscal. The growth in the GST collections despite constraints during the initial months of the fiscal due to the COVID-19 lockdown indicates a revival of business and economic activities in the Union Territory, an official stated.

Shortly after recovering from COVID-19, actor Ranbir Kapoor was reportedly seen heading to a dubbing studio, on Thursday, for his upcoming film 'Brahmastra' along with Alia Bhatt, who will share screen space with him in the movie. On the same evening, Alia took to her Instagram Stories to share that she had tested positive for the virus.

As many as 89,129 people tested positive for coronavirus in the last 24 hours in India, marking the biggest one-day jump in the number of coronavirus cases in the country this year. Meanwhile, 714 deaths have been recorded in the last 24 hours, taking the death toll to 1,64,110. Out of the total cases, 6,58,909 are active.

Calling journalists in Uttarakhand 'frontline workers', the state government has announced vaccination for them without any age restrictions. It said that journalists have supported the fight against the coronavirus pandemic "as frontline workers for communication, spreading awareness and giving out the correct information". State Information Directorate staff will also be vaccinated.

Chhattisgarh Health Minister TS Singh Deo wrote to Union Health Minister Harsh Vardhan on Friday urging him to include journalists in coronavirus vaccination drive as "frontline corona warriors". They've contributed to the coronavirus fight by spreading information about testing and vaccination, he said. In current circumstances, protecting journalists and their families is important, he added.

The Central Board of Secondary Education (CBSE) will not reduce the syllabus for classes 9 to 12 in the new academic session of 2021-22 that is scheduled to begin from April. The board had reduced 30% of the syllabus in the last academic year due to the COVID-19 pandemic situation. The new syllabus was released on Saturday.

Out of 50,811 samples collected from people randomly at Delhi airport, railway stations, bus terminals and a border point over the last week, 532 tested positive for COVID-19, as per government records. Notably, out of 1,615 people tested at IGI Airport, no one has tested COVID-19 positive so far. Out of 12,032 samples collected at railway stations, 143 tested positive.

Italy has entered a three-day national lockdown until Monday to deter travel and try to prevent a surge in COVID-19 cases over Easter. Non-essential shops have been closed and the police set up road checks to ensure people were staying close to home. Extra patrols have been ordered to break up large gatherings in squares and parks.

Singer Aditya Narayan took to Instagram on Saturday and announced that he and his wife Shweta Agarwal have tested positive for COVID-19. "Unfortunately [we]...have tested positive for COVID-19 and are in quarantine. Please stay safe, continue to follow protocol and do keep us in your prayers. This too shall pass," he wrote alongside their picture.

Federation of Indian Chambers of Commerce & Industry (FICCI) has written a letter, urging the government to ramp up COVID-19 testing and open up vaccination for those aged between 18 and 45 years. "There is capacity of performing much more tests with 2,440 labs...operational for COVID-19 testing, including more than 1,200 from the private sector," FICCI President Uday Shankar said.

The Election Commission has banned 'Kottikalasam', the final campaign celebration in the state, due to COVID-19 regulations. The decision was taken after the recommendation by Kerala's Chief Electoral Officer Teeka Ram Meena. The public campaign for the 2021 Kerala Assembly polls will end on April 4 at 7 pm.

Eight states account for 81.42% of the active COVID-19 cases reported in the country in the last 24 hours, said the Union Health Ministry. These eight states are Maharashtra, Karnataka, Chhattisgarh, Delhi, Tamil Nadu, Uttar Pradesh, Punjab and Madhya Pradesh. India on Saturday reported 89,129 new cases- its highest daily rise in six months, taking the active caseload to 6,58,909.

Railway Minister Piyush Goyal wrote a letter to around 13 lakh rail employees, thanking them for their "dedication and stupendous efforts" during COVID-19 pandemic. "While the world came to a standstill, Railwaymen never took a day off, and worked even harder at a great...risk," Goyal said. He added that Railways "spearheaded the economic recovery" with record freight loading in 2020-21.

As many as 12 states/UTs are displaying an upward trajectory in daily new COVID-19 cases. They are: Maharashtra, Chhattisgarh, Punjab, Karnataka, Delhi, Tamil Nadu, Madhya Pradesh, Gujarat, Haryana, Rajasthan, Uttar Pradesh and Kerala. Five states, namely Maharashtra, Karnataka, Chhattisgarh, Kerala and Punjab cumulatively account for 77.3% of total active cases (6,58,909) in the country.

Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike (BBMP) Chief Commissioner Gaurav Gupta urged people to follow coronavirus guidelines issued by the Karnataka government amid a surge in cases in the city.  It's advisable to avoid attending close door and open door meetings, he added. Bengaluru Urban recorded 72% of Karnataka's total active cases at 24,600, according to official data published on Friday.

Delhi Capitals all-rounder Axar Patel has tested positive for COVID-19 on Saturday, six days before the start of the IPL 2021. Axar has been taken into a medical care facility, Delhi Capitals said in a statement. A member of Chennai Super Kings' content team too has tested positive and subsequently put under isolation, confirmed the franchise's CEO Kasi Viswanathan.

Nearly 69% of Karnataka's daily coronavirus cases have been recorded in Bengaluru Urban at 2,906, according to the state's Department of Health and Family Welfare figures published on Thursday. The total number of active cases in the city is now 21,789 and 719 people have been discharged. Bidar recorded the second-highest number of daily cases at 218.

Actress Fatima Sana Shaikh, who recently tested positive for coronavirus, took to her Instagram Stories and shared a health update. Sharing a picture of herself lying on a bed, the actress wrote, "COVID-19 sucks. Lost smell and taste and a horrible body ache." Last week, Fatima confirmed that she has tested positive for coronavirus.

Mumbai has recorded over 8,800 new coronavirus cases in the last 24 hours, marking the city's biggest daily COVID-19 case surge since the start of the pandemic. The city recorded 8,832 new COVID-19 cases on Friday and 20 more have died of the virus there in the last 24 hours. The city now has total 58,455 active COVID-19 cases.

The US may not need the Oxford-AstraZeneca coronavirus vaccine, even if it wins US regulatory approval, White House Chief Medical Advisor Anthony Fauci said. The US has enough contracts with other vaccine makers to vaccinate its entire population, he added. The comments come as some countries report cases of rare blood clots possibly linked to the vaccine.

Rupali Ganguly, who tested positive for coronavirus, said, "I don't know where I got it from...But it doesn't matter...I'll fight this like I've fought all...battles in life." Speaking about her health, she said, "As of now I feel no symptoms. But...doctors have given me so many medicines...I'm not feeling ill with COVID...But I think...I'm going to fall ill because of...medicines."

Congress' Sanjay Nirupam said on Friday that instead of coming up with a solid plan to defeat the second wave of COVID-19, Maharashtra CM Uddhav Thackeray has issued "another threat to impose lockdown". His reaction came after CM Thackeray said that possibility of a lockdown can't be ruled out if the surge in coronavirus cases continues.

Actress Alia Bhatt took to her Instagram Stories to share that she has tested positive for coronavirus. The 28-year-old actress wrote, "I have immediately isolated myself and will be under home quarantine. I am following all safety protocols under the advice of my doctors." Last week, Alia's boyfriend and actor Ranbir Kapoor had recovered from the virus.

England limited-overs captain Eoin Morgan, who was named KKR captain during the last IPL season, has said that there are a lot of Indian cricketers who are interested in being part of the ECB's The Hundred. The new 100-ball tournament was set to be played last year but was postponed due to the coronavirus pandemic.

Over 36.7 lakh COVID-19 vaccine doses were administered in the last 24 hours, the highest single-day coverage till now, the Union Health Ministry said on Friday. Of these, 33,65,597 beneficiaries were given the first vaccine dose and 3,05,645 beneficiaries received the second vaccine dose, it added. A total of over 6.87 crore vaccine doses have been administered till now.

The health official who had given the COVID-19 vaccine to Karnataka minister BC Patil and his wife at their residence has been suspended for violating the vaccination norms. The Centre had sought a report from the state after Patil was administered the vaccine shot at his residence on March 2. He had shared a photo of him receiving the shot.

Economic Affairs and Revenue Secretary Tarun Bajaj has said India is better prepared to face the COVID-19 pandemic this year and the government won't address the challenge through lockdowns. "We'll fight it out with vaccines and other measures," he added. Gross revenue will be lower by only 2-3% compared to last year, which is a "good comeback", he further said.

WHO Director-General Tedros Adhanom Ghebreyesus said experts examining the COVID-19 origins, first identified in China, will conduct "follow-up assessments" on an initial report released this week. The report said COVID-19 probably transmitted from bats to humans through another animal. Earlier, Tedros claimed that China had withheld data from the WHO-led team investigating the COVID-19 origins.

Data by staffing firm Xpheno showed that the growth of active white collar job postings in India's top five metros fell from 11% in February to just over 1% in March. The rise in COVID-19 cases played "spoilsport", said Xpheno Co-founder. Bengaluru, Hyderabad, Delhi, Mumbai and Chennai accounted for 40% of all white collar job postings over the last year.

As many as 81,466 people tested positive for coronavirus in the last 24 hours in India, marking the biggest single-day rise in the number of coronavirus cases in the country in 2021. Further, India also reported the biggest single-day rise in the number of deaths due to coronavirus at 469. The death toll due to coronavirus in India is 1,63,396.

A PIL in the Bombay High Court has sought directions to the Centre, state government and BMC to provide door-to-door COVID-19 vaccination facility for senior citizens above the age of 75 and those who are physically challenged, bedridden or specially abled. The petition stated they would need the vaccine dose at the earliest.

The Centre on Friday released a list of states/UTs that have more than 3 lakh confirmed coronavirus cases. Maharashtra has the highest number with 28,56,163 confirmed COVID-19 cases so far. This is followed by Kerala, Karnataka, Andhra Pradesh, Tamil Nadu, Delhi, Uttar Pradesh, West Bengal, Chhattisgarh, Odisha, Rajasthan, Gujarat and Telangana.

UK's Medicines and Healthcare products Regulatory Agency on Thursday said it has identified 30 cases of rare blood clot events after the use of the AstraZeneca COVID-19 vaccine. The agency added that it still believes the benefits of the vaccine in the prevention of COVID-19 far outweigh any possible risk of blood clots.

Pope Francis on Friday made a surprise visit to homeless and poor people from Rome getting coronavirus vaccinations for free in the Vatican. The pictures released by the Vatican showed the 84-year-old interacting with doctors, nurses, charity workers and vaccine recipients. Around 800 homeless or needy people have so far received the free COVID-19 vaccines, the Vatican said.

Karnataka government on Friday issued new guidelines for restrictions in the state amid rising coronavirus cases. The government has suspended schools for Classes 6 to 9. It has ordered gyms and swimming pools in the state to remain shut and prohibited rallies and dharnas and gatherings at places of worship. Moreover, cinema halls can operate at 50% seating capacity.

A senior police officer in UP has tested positive for COVID-19 after taking his second vaccine dose against coronavirus last month. Inspector General of Police, Bareilly, Rajesh Pandey, along with his wife and a personal security guard have tested COVID-19 positive. While his wife is yet to take the second jab, Pandey is currently undergoing treatment at a medical college.

Actress Malaika Arora, who tested positive for coronavirus last year, took to Instagram on Friday to share a photo in which she can be seen taking the first dose of the COVID-19 vaccine. "Let's go warriors, let's win this war against [the] virus...a special mention to our...frontline workers...and yes I'm eligible to take the vaccine," the 47-year-old actress wrote.

The company that operates the McDonald's franchise in West and South India has announced that it will cover the cost of vaccinating 10,000 employees, including part-time staff and delivery riders, against COVID-19. Westlife Development also said it will facilitate the administration of the vaccine across cities, adding that it "will continue to do whatever it takes to support" its employees.

Bigg Boss 14 contestant Nikki Tamboli, who contracted coronavirus last month, has tested negative for the virus. Talking about her recovery, Nikki said, "Fortunately, I've made a full recovery...and I'm super relieved." "I can't wait to go back and work...but this time I'm going to take extra care with everything, especially for myself and the people around me," she added.

Former Pakistan captain Wasim Akram has wished Sachin Tendulkar a speedy recovery after the ex-India cricketer was shifted to a hospital, six days after testing positive for coronavirus. "Even when you were 16, you battled the world's best bowlers with guts and aplomb...so I'm sure you'll hit COVID-19 with a six! Recover soon master!" he tweeted.

Authorities In Japan?s Osaka will discuss plans with Tokyo Olympic organisers on Friday to cancel the western region?s leg of the Olympic torch relay, said governor Hirofumi Yoshimura. The move aims to avert confrontation with measures to control sudden outbreak of new coronavirus infections. Osaka saw a two-month high of more than 600 new cases reported on Thursday.

All government and private schools in Uttar Pradesh have been ordered to stay closed for students of classes 1 to 8 till April 11, amid coronavirus spread. Classes may go on for other students with adherence to COVID-19 norms. Earlier, schools in the state were ordered to stay closed for students of classes 1-8 till April 4.

Amitabh Bachchan, in his recent blog post, shared that he has received the first dose of coronavirus vaccine. The 78-year-old actor added that his entire family, except Abhishek Bachchan, has received the vaccine. "He (Abhishek) be on location and shall do it on return soon in a few days," he wrote. Amitabh also shared a picture of himself getting vaccinated.

Congress leader Priyanka Gandhi Vadra on Friday said that she has been exposed to the coronavirus and will self-isolate after her husband, Robert Vadra, tested positive for COVID-19. In a video message released on her Twitter, Priyanka informed that she had tested negative for COVID-19 and apologised for cancelling her scheduled election programmes in Assam, Tamil Nadu and Kerala.

World Health Organization (WHO) epidemiologist Maria van Kerkhove has said that Brazil is facing "a very serious situation" with "a number of states in critical condition" due to COVID-19 pandemic. She added that many hospital intensive care units are over 90% full in the country. Brazil is the second-worst coronavirus-hit country in the world with over 1.28 crore COVID-19 cases.

Former India cricketer Sachin Tendulkar, who had tested positive for coronavirus on March 27, took to Twitter to share that he has been hospitalised. "As a matter of abundant precaution under medical advice, I have been hospitalised. I hope to be back home in a few days. Take care and stay safe everyone," he wrote.

The Railways have decided to suspend Ahmedabad-Mumbai Central-Ahmedabad Tejas Express from April 2 amid a rise in daily COVID-19 cases in both Gujarat and Maharashtra. The decision is in the larger public interest, IRCTC said in a statement on Thursday. The service will remain suspended for a period of one month, it further said.

Himachal Pradesh government has directed all educational institutions to remain closed till April 15, amid a rise in coronavirus cases. "The government will review its decision to reopen schools after April 15," said Chief Minister Jai Ram Thakur. Earlier, the said institutes had been told to remain closed till April 4.

Maharashtra CM Uddhav Thackeray on Friday said that he could not rule out imposing a lockdown if the current situation of COVID-19 continued to prevail. Saying that stricter restrictions will be announced in the next few days, Thackeray added, "If the number of cases keeps increasing, there could be a shortage of healthcare infrastructure in the next 15-20 days."

Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal appreciated the Centre's decision to start COVID-19 vaccination on all days in April for people aged above 45 years. However, he urged to start the vaccination drive at a mass-scale for all age groups. He appealed to allow the vaccination drive to be conducted in schools and community centres so that more people can be vaccinated.

Reversing three months of decline, the urban unemployment rate in the country jumped to 7.24% in March, 25 basis points higher than the previous month. Data from the Centre for Monitoring Indian Economy (CMIE) further showed that amid a resurgence of COVID-19, the female joblessness rate in urban areas climbed almost two percentage points to 19.07%.

This year's Rio Open tennis tournament was cancelled on Thursday due to rise in COVID-19 cases in Brazil, organisers said. The ATP 500 event had already been postponed from its original February dates. The continued uncertainty around the pandemic meant it would not be rescheduled, organisers added. The coronavirus has killed more than 3,20,000 people in the South American nation.

The Indian Olympic Association (IOA) has asked the authorities to speedily vaccinate the Olympic-bound athletes at the All India Institute of Medical Science (AIIMS), New Delhi. The IOA is concerned about the rising number of athletes contracting COVID-19 at top training centres in the country. The positive results do not include any Tokyo Olympic-bound athletes till now.

India's merchandise exports jumped by 58% to $34 billion in March despite the COVID-19, as compared to $21.5 billion in March 2020, according to preliminary data released by the Commerce Ministry. This is the highest ever monthly export recorded by India. Meanwhile, imports surged 53% to $48 billion in March, taking the country's trade deficit to $14.1 billion.

Singer Arijit Singh has said he doesn't miss the live shows at all. "Every time, it's a task to be on stage, so much responsibility," he added. Arijit further said the COVID-19 lockdown gave him a "natural break", adding, "I enjoyed it. I know I have to be on stage very soon anyway, so I enjoyed the vacation."

A Chinese city on the border with Myanmar has said it would vaccinate its entire population of 3,00,000 people in five days, beginning on Friday, after a COVID-19 outbreak. The city of Ruili has confirmed 16 COVID-19 cases since Tuesday. Of those who tested positive, 12 of them were Chinese citizens, while the remaining four were Myanmar nationals.

Television actress Rupali Ganguly, who is currently playing the lead role in the television series 'Anupamaa', announced that she has tested positive for COVID-19. "Ma Corona Devi...This is the kind of positive I didn't want to be...Have quarantined myself away from my family...The family has been tested and awaiting results...please send out...love...for my family," she posted on Instagram.

The US could be in the early stages of the fourth wave of COVID-19 pandemic, with cases increasing in 25 states, according to reports. On average, the country has tallied 63,000 new cases daily over the past week, a 17% rise from the week prior, news website Axios reported. The third wave reportedly saw 2,50,000 testing positive in US daily.

The BJP on Friday opposed the Pune administration's decision to shut down malls, restaurants and eateries for seven days and making PMPML bus service available only for essential workers. The restrictions have been imposed after a surge in COVID-19 cases. BJP MP Girish Bapat said, "We don't want the normal life of citizens to get affected due to the restrictions."

The UK has added Pakistan, Bangladesh, Kenya and the Philippines to its travel ban list amid concerns over new variants of COVID-19. The latest restrictions will take effect from April 9, an official release said. International visitors who've departed from or travelled through the listed countries in the preceding 10 days will be refused entry into the UK.

Amid surge in COVID-19 cases, Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal said there's no plan for lockdown. "If the need arises in future, then we will consult the people before taking such a decision," he added. "This is the fourth wave in Delhi. Cases are increasing exponentially but it's less severe as number of deaths and ICU cases are less," stated Kejriwal.

Amid rising COVID-19 cases, a nine-day-long lockdown has been announced in Chhattisgarh's Durg from April 6 to April 14. Durg district collector Sarveshwar Bhure said the vaccination drive will continue during the lockdown and essential services will be allowed in the district. Raipur with 66,999 cumulative cases and Durg with 40,068 cumulative cases are the state's two worst-affected districts.

Brazil's Sao Paulo city on Thursday accelerated its efforts to empty old graves to make room for an increasing number of COVID-19 victims. Gravediggers in hazmat suits opened tombs of people buried years ago and bagged their remains for burial at a different location. Brazil's Health Ministry had reported 3,769 COVID-19 deaths on Thursday.

Base effect due to COVID-19 disruptions, low interest rates and a preference for personal mobility due to the pandemic has led to automobile companies posting significant growth in year-on-year wholesale numbers. While Maruti Suzuki recorded a 99% increase in its overall sales in March 2021, overall sales including exports for Hyundai Motor doubled over the 12-month period.

The Central Board of Secondary Education (CBSE) will conduct practical exams for classes 10 and 12 students who test positive for COVID-19 as well as for those affected by COVID-19, before June 11. Practical exams of such candidates will be conducted "at an appropriate time in consultation with the concerned regional officer", CBSE said in a notification on Thursday.

Around 25% of the total COVID-19 cases reported in Pune since the outbreak have been in March this year. The city also registered 447 coronavirus deaths in the last month. A civic officer said, "[Increase in cases] has put pressure on the health infrastructure as all the predictions of the civic administration of a possible second wave have fallen flat."

Delhi recorded 2,790 fresh COVID-19 cases over the last 24 hours, taking the cumulative case tally to 6,65,220 infections. This makes it the highest single-day spike the country's capital has seen this year in COVID-19 cases. Nine new fatalities were also recorded over the last 24 hours, pushing the overall COVID-19 death toll in Delhi to 11,036.

Railway Minister Piyush Goyal took the first dose of the COVID-19 vaccine at AIIMS in New Delhi on Thursday. "I appeal to all citizens who are eligible to take the vaccine and request everyone to encourage people around you to get vaccinated," he tweeted after receiving the vaccine. The country began its phase 3 of the COVID-19 vaccination drive today.

UEFA Executive Committee on Wednesday decided to allow up to five substitutions at upcoming Euro 2020. UEFA said the rule remains valid against the background of national and international football calendars affected by COVID-19. The committee also decided to lift the 30% capacity limit on stadiums, saying that the decision should be taken by relevant local or national authorities.

As many as 1.5 crore doses of Johnson & Johnson (J&J) COVID-19 vaccine were destroyed after workers at a factory in US' Baltimore mixed ingredients from the coronavirus vaccines of J&J and AstraZeneca. Federal officials attributed the mistake to human error. Shipments of J&J's vaccine have been delayed pending an investigation by the FDA.

Amid a spike in COVID-19 cases in India, Director and Medical Superintendent of Dr RML Hospital Dr (Prof) Rana Anil Kumar Singh said that the cases are increasing due to laxity in the observance of COVID-19 appropriate behaviour by people. He further stated that after vaccination no death has been reported and the severity of COVID-19 is also reduced.

European Medicines Agency (EMA) Director Emer Cooke said, "There is no evidence that would support restricting the use of this [Oxford-AstraZeneca] vaccine in any population". The agency's assessment was based on 62 cases worldwide of unusual blood clots, including 14 deaths, reported to EMA by March 22, Cooke added. Her comments came after Canada and Germany restricted the vaccine's use.

Every Indian aged 45 or above will now be eligible for the COVID-19 vaccine as the third phase of the vaccination drive begins from today. The government made this decision last month to tackle the recent spike in COVID-19 cases across India. Vaccination appointments can be booked through Co-WIN website or at the nearest vaccination centre after 3 pm.

Andhra Pradesh Chief Minister YS Jagan Mohan Reddy on Thursday took the COVID-19 vaccine along with his wife YS Bharathi. The 48-year-old Chief Minister became eligible for the vaccine after the central government opened the vaccination drive for all Indians above the age of 45. Reddy took the vaccine at the 140th Ward Secretariat in Guntur's Bharatpet.

India has reported 72,330 new COVID-19 cases in the last 24 hours, which is the maximum number of new cases reported in a day in nearly six months. The country also reported 459 deaths, which is the highest death count in nearly four months. The total number of cases stood at 1,22,21,665, while the death toll jumped to 1,62,927.

Google has cancelled its annual April Fools' Day prank due to the COVID-19 pandemic for the second year. "With much of the world still grappling with serious challenges, we will again pause the jokes for April Fools' Day in 2021," Google said. In 2020, Google had decided to pause its longstanding tradition out of respect for those fighting the pandemic.

The Italian government has said that coronavirus vaccination is mandatory for all health workers, including pharmacists, in the country. Those who refuse the vaccine could be suspended without pay for rest of the year. The measure aims to protect "both medical and paramedical staff and those who're in environments that may be more exposed to risk of infection", it added.

Mumbai on Thursday reported 8,646 fresh COVID-19 cases, making it the city's biggest single-day spike since the beginning of the pandemic. The city reported 18 more deaths in the last 24 hours, taking the death toll to 11,704, Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) data showed. Mumbai's COVID-19 tally has reached 4,23,360 and the number of active cases stands at 55,005.

Amid a spike in COVID-19 cases in India, AIIMS Director Dr Randeep Guleria has said, "We need to develop a strategy where we can reach out to people and give them the vaccination." However, he added that the vaccination should be done in such a way that any adverse effects can be taken care of.

Germany's President Frank-Walter Steinmeier on Thursday received the first dose of AstraZeneca's COVID-19 vaccine, his office announced. "I trust the vaccines authorised in Germany. Vaccinating is...decisive step on the path out of the pandemic!" the 65-year-old Steinmeier said. This comes after Germany restricted the use of the AstraZeneca jab in people under 60 over concerns of blood clotting.

India has responded to a WHO report on origins of coronavirus by calling for "comprehensive and expert-led mechanism" to expedite the probe. "We'll continue to work with...WHO to strengthen capacity...so that the present report and further studies will provide valuable inputs," the statement said. India welcomes WHO chief's readiness to deploy additional missions, a spokesperson stated.

Delhi Education Department on Thursday said that students of any class should not be called physically in school for the Academic session 2021-22 till further orders. "However, teaching-learning activities may be commenced from April 1," the department added. The announcement comes amid rising cases of coronavirus in the National Capital.

Hong Kong will resume administering the coronavirus vaccine developed by Pfizer-BioNTech on April 5 following a suspension over packaging defects, officials said. Hong Kong had suspended the vaccine's use last month after one of its batches had defective bottle lids. An investigation by BioNTech found no safety issues in the batch with packaging defects, the officials added.

Singer Bappi Lahiri, who's undergoing coronavirus treatment at Breach Candy Hospital in Mumbai, is in the ICU and stable now, son Bappa Lahiri said. He added that Bappi was detected with a mild COVID-19 infection on Wednesday. "But the reason for concern is, he...has a pulmonary condition. He's in Breach Candy Hospital...We're relieved...he's getting the best care possible," said Bappa.

The Centre said that six states accounted for 83% of the new COVID-19 deaths reported in the country on Thursday. Maharashtra has the highest number with 227 coronavirus deaths, which is followed by Punjab (55), Chhattisgarh (39), Karnataka (26), Tamil Nadu (19) and Kerala (15). India reported 459 deaths on Thursday, highest single-day rise in nearly four months.

Amid rising coronavirus cases in the country, AIIMS Director Dr Randeep Guleria said, "It is likely that there is a variant which is causing the virus to be more infectious." He added that there's a need to reach out to the people with coronavirus vaccines. India on Thursday reported 72,330 new COVID-19 cases, highest single-day rise in nearly six months.

India's annual electricity usage fell for the first time in at least 35 years in 2020-21, according to Reuters' analysis of government data, mainly due to coronavirus-induced lockdowns. Total power generation in the fiscal year fell by 0.2% from 2019-20. This is because lockdowns resulted in a decline in electricity production for six months in a row ending in August.

Veteran singer and music director Bappi Lahiri has been admitted to Breach Candy hospital in Mumbai after testing positive for coronavirus. "Bappi dada?s family requests all those who came in contact with him in the recent past should get themselves tested as a precautionary measure," his spokesperson said. "He seeks blessings and wishes of his fans," the spokesperson added.

The World Health Organization's European head Hans Kluge criticised Europe's COVID-19 vaccine rollout, saying it's "unacceptably slow" and is "prolonging the pandemic". "Only 10% of the region's population has received one vaccine dose and 4% has completed a full vaccine series," he added. The situation in Europe is more "worrying" than it has been for several months, the WHO said.

A journalist in Brazil has said "the situation is completely out of control", as the country reported 3,869 deaths due to COVID-19 in the last 24 hours. Patricia Campos Mello said, "People are dying because of lack of oxygen. [They're]...suffocating." Globally, Brazil has reported the second-highest number of cases and deaths with over 1.2 crore cases and about 3,21,515 fatalities.

The COVID-19 vaccinations will be conducted throughout the month of April, including on gazetted holidays, at all public and private sector centres, the Centre informed on Thursday. The government has written to all states and Union Territories to make necessary arrangements for this to exponentially expand the countrywide vaccination drive, the Health Ministry said.

Himachal Pradesh's Una district has ordered all private doctors, chemists and other private practitioners to report patients with COVID-19 symptoms to the concerned health authorities. All chemists have also been instructed to sell COVID-19 medicines on a prescription basis only. Una has recorded 871 cases in a fortnight and is among the three worst-hit districts in the second wave.

Hide the Pain Harold' meme became the face of a Swedish COVID-19 vaccination website for a few hours before the concerned health authority realised 'Harold' was actually one of the Internet's most-recognised figures. 'Harold' or Andras Arato's stock photo was used on a website where Stockholm city residents can book their COVID-19 vaccines. The photograph has since been taken down.

India's largest carmaker Maruti Suzuki India on Thursday reported total sales of 1.67 lakh units last month compared to 83,792 units in March last year amid nationwide lockdown due to the COVID-19 pandemic. Meanwhile, the company's domestic sales stood at 1.49 lakh units last month compared to 76,976 units in March 2020.

After several cases of COVID-19 were reported from Mumbai's Maker Tower in Cuffe Parade, BMC sealed the B wing of the building. Mumbai on Wednesday recorded 5,394 new COVID-19 cases. According to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare, there are currently 3,57,604 active COVID-19 cases in Maharashtra and 54,649 people have died of COVID-19 so far.

Madhya Pradesh government has decided to extend the suspension of inter-state bus services with Maharashtra till April 30 due to rise in COVID-19 cases. Earlier, passenger bus services with Maharashtra were suspended from March 21 to 31. The state also ordered the closure of all schools and colleges in Bhopal, Indore, Jabalpur, Betul, Chhindwara, Khargone and Ratlam till April 15.

Gurugram's health department has allowed private companies to establish a tie-up with city-based private hospitals to provide COVID-19 vaccine to its staff on their office premises. The officials believe that this will accelerate the vaccination drive in the city. On Wednesday, Gurugram's government hospitals vaccinated 12,382 beneficiaries while private hospitals inoculated 1,906 beneficiaries.

Filmmaker Rohit Shetty was on Thursday administered the first dose of COVID-19 vaccine at Nanavati Hospital in Mumbai. "Action and stunts are for movies don't try to be a khatron ke khiladi in real life, get vaccinated," he wrote while referring to his adventure reality show 'Khatron Ke Khiladi'. Rohit also thanked the staff of the hospital.

The Bangalore Metro Rail Corporation Ltd (BMRCL) has decided to soon start levying a ?250 fine on all those who'll be seen flouting COVID-19 norms during their metro ride. BMRCL Managing Director Ajay Seth said, "Since last week, we have increased announcements...advising the public to follow COVID-19 protocols." He stated that the penalty will be imposed as a last resort.

French President Emmanuel Macron has announced that a 'limited lockdown' will be imposed across the nation and schools would be closed for three weeks. From Saturday night and for the next four weeks, travel restrictions will be imposed across the country and non-essential shops will close in line with measures already implemented in COVID-19 hotspots such as Paris, he said.

Twenty-two doctors from Rohtak's Post Graduate Institute of Medical Sciences (PGIMS) have tested positive for COVID-19, hospital authorities said. Twelve of the total infected doctors had received their first dose of vaccine and two more had got their two complete doses, hospital added. All 22 infected doctors are from the Obstetrics and Gynaecology department, informed the authorities.

IBM expects 80% of its employees to work in a hybrid work model after the COVID-19 pandemic. The majority of workers "will spend at least three days a week, maybe not all 8-10 hours, but at least some fraction of those days, in office," IBM's CEO Arvind Krishna said. "When people are remote I worry about...their career trajectory," he added.

Pune district health authorities said that they're planning to double the number of coronavirus vaccination centres ahead of third phase of the vaccination drive. We?re planning to setup 282 COVID-19 vaccination centres in the next three to four days, Dr Sanjay Deshmukh, Deputy Director, Health, Pune circle, said. Pune district has vaccinated eight lakh beneficiaries so far.

Credit card spending in India is returning to pre-COVID-19 levels, according to new data. Total spends stood at ?64,737 crore in January this year, just ?1,836 crore less than in January 2020. The data also showed that spending in January 2021 was higher than both February and March last year when COVID-19 cases in the country began to increase.

Online grocery company Grofers announced that it will pay for the COVID-19 vaccine for its employees, their families and contractual staff in a drive covering 25,000 people across 38 cities. In addition to providing extra sick leave to employees to manage any post-vaccination side effects, Grofers will also reimburse the vaccine cost for those who get it personally.

The states and Union Territories have cumulatively borrowed ?7.98 lakh crore from markets in 2020-21, around 3% less than the indicated debt for the fiscal. The states had told the RBI that they would borrow ?8.24 lakh crore in 2020-21 to meet the revenue gap due to COVID-19-induced lockdowns. In 2019-20, 28 states and two UTs borrowed ?6.35 lakh crore.

The Centre stated that eight states alone accounted for 84.73% of the new coronavirus cases reported in the country on Wednesday. Maharashtra reported the highest number with 27,918 cases. This was followed by Chhattisgarh (3,108), Karnataka (2,975), Kerala (2,389), Tamil Nadu (2,342), Gujarat (2,220), Punjab (2,188) and Madhya Pradesh (2,173).

COVID-19 was the third-leading cause of death in the US last year, the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention said. COVID-19 was the underlying or contributing cause of 3,77,883 deaths in US in 2020, CDC said. American Indians, Hispanics and Blacks had the highest COVID-19 death rates by ethnicity, while most deaths were reported in people aged 65 or above.

Hollywood actors Ryan Reynolds and Amber Heard have received the first shot of COVID-19 vaccine. Taking to Instagram on Wednesday, Ryan shared a picture wherein he can be seen getting vaccinated. Amber also shared a picture from a vaccination centre and wrote, "Did someone say 'vaccine queen?'" Celebrities like Arnold Schwarzenegger and Judi Dench have also received the vaccine.

Chinese state media said some local authorities in China have resorted to "simple and crude" measures to push people into getting COVID-19 vaccines. Shanghai, Hubei and Heilongjiang have reportedly stressed they'll treat vaccination as an important "political task". Some Beijing districts have given shopping coupons and certificates to firms where vaccination rates among staffers top 80%.

Industrial associations in Pune and Pimpri-Chinchwad have demanded setting up of vaccination infrastructure in their areas for inoculation of their workers. The industrial bodies said that such facilities would help in shouldering the load of the health system in vaccinating as many people as possible in a short time. Pune district has been reporting more than 5,000 COVID-19 cases daily.

A BJP delegation met Pune Municipal Corporation (PMC) commissioner Vikram Kumar, and demanded an increase in testing and vaccination in the city. Pune chief of BJP Jagdish Mulik said, "The state government should provide ?500 crore to Pune city to control COVID-19. PMC is doing good work, but unfortunately, the state government is deliberately ignoring its efforts."

The Union Health Ministry has asked the states and Union Territories to keep COVID-19 vaccine wastage below 1% and advised them to avoid over-stocking or under-stocking of vaccines. Assuring that there is no shortage of vaccines, Health Secretary Rajesh Bhushan asked the states to identify the areas where vaccine coverage has been low so far and take "corrective actions" there.

Mumbai reported 5,394 fresh COVID-19 cases and 15 more deaths on Wednesday, according to data issued by the Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation. The city's COVID-19 tally has reached 4,14,714, while the death toll has risen to 11,686. The number of active COVID-19 cases in the city stands at 51,411 and 3,50,660 people have recovered from the disease so far.

Amid rising COVID-19 cases in Maharashtra, testing, tracking and tracing have been increased in the state, said Maharashtra Health Minister Rajesh Tope. "We are also going to increase the number of vaccination centres. Today, there is no shortage of beds, medicines, doctors. If the number of cases keeps rising then we'll have to take a decision," he added.

Actor Anil Kapoor sent home-cooked food for actress Fatima Sana Shaikh, who recently contracted coronavirus and is under home quarantine. She took to Instagram Stories to share a picture of the food and thanked the actor for sending her "ghar ka khaana". Fatima wrote, "Anil Kapoor, you are the best!!! Thank you for sending this amazing ghar ka khaana."

Singer Rashmeet Kaur, known for the song 'Nadiyon Paar' from the film 'Roohi', has tested positive for coronavirus. The singer shared the news on Instagram. "It's day 4 and home-quarantine is going on, 10 more days left," she said in a video. "Please stay safe everyone. Jaan hai toh jahaan hai," Rashmeet wrote alongside the video.

Union Health Minister Harsh Vardhan said that 61 million doses of the COVID-19 vaccine have been administered in India and 64 million doses have been provided to 84 countries. "These are either gifted or...given through the COVAX facility...created to help all countries internationally by WHO," he added. Among Indian states, Maharashtra has done maximum vaccinations at 59,93,126.

A Chinese city on the border with Myanmar reported nine coronavirus cases on Wednesday, the country's first outbreak since mid-February. Five people who tested positive were reportedly Chinese citizens, while others were Myanmar nationals. The city of Ruili said the entire population of around 2,10,000 people would be tested for COVID-19 and would have to home quarantine for one week.

As many as 14 countries, including the US and the UK, have criticised the World Health Organization (WHO) report into the beginnings of coronavirus pandemic in Wuhan, accusing China of "withholding access to complete, original data and samples". Earlier, WHO chief Tedros Adhanom Ghebreyesus claimed China didn't share "proper data" with WHO to look into the origins of the pandemic.

Hans Timmer, World Bank's Chief Economist for the South Asia Region, praised India's economic recovery amid COVID-19 and said, "It's amazing how far India has come compared to a year ago." He added, "India is bouncing back, opened up many activities, started vaccination and leading in the production of vaccination." He, however, cautioned that the situation is still incredibly challenging.

Germany has suspended the use of the Oxford-AstraZeneca COVID-19 vaccine for people under the age of 60 over concerns of blood clotting, health officials said. Germany's medical regulator said a total of 31 people in the country had experienced blood clots after getting their shots. Earlier, Canada had suspended the use of the AstraZeneca vaccine in people under 55.

Bihar Health Minister Mangal Pandey said that Bihar does not have so many COVID-19 cases that the administration can consider imposing a lockdown. He said, "Number of COVID tests have been increased from 25,000 to 70,000 per day. All necessary steps are being taken. We are in alert mode. We don't have so many cases that we consider imposing lockdown."

American pharma company Pfizer on Wednesday said that its COVID-19 vaccine was 100% effective in a Phase 3 trial in adolescents aged 12 to 15 years. The trial enrolled 2,260 participants in the United States. Pfizer also said the vaccine elicited a "robust" antibody response in children, exceeding those in an earlier trial of those aged 16-25 years.

Russia has registered the world's first vaccine for animals against COVID-19, its agricultural regulator said, after tests showed it generated antibodies against the virus in dogs, cats, foxes and mink. Mass production of the vaccine, called Carnivac-Cov, can start in April, regulator Rosselkhoznadzor said. The regulator said it'd be able to protect vulnerable species and thwart viral mutations.

In a bid to curb the spread of COVID-19, Nashik administration is issuing a ?5 ticket per person to enter the market area for an hour. Commissioner of Police Deepak Pandey said it's an attempt to save the city from entering lockdown. According to police officials, any customer found inside the market for over an hour will be fined ?500.

The State Bank of India (SBI) said that it has raised an additional $1 billion loan from Japan Bank for International Cooperation (JBIC). The loan was taken to provide support to manufacturers, suppliers and dealers of Japanese automobiles in India, who were affected by COVID-19, the bank said. It will also assist in 'Make in India' initiative, it added.

Around 900 people in the Manipal Institute of Technology campus in Karnataka's Udupi have been infected by COVID-19, state Health Minister K Sudhakar said on Tuesday. "More people in a single campus spread the infection as many didn't follow guidelines and violated COVID-19 appropriate behaviour," he added. Authorities sealed the campus and termed it a containment zone on March 17.

Brazilian health regulator ANVISA has said that the COVID-19 vaccine Covaxin, developed by India's Bharat Biotech, doesn't meet its manufacturing standards. Last month, Brazil signed a contract to buy 2 crore doses of Covaxin and Bharat Biotech applied for the vaccine's emergency use on March 8. Bharat Biotech said it would present evidence that it is complying with all requirements.

The spike in COVID-19 cases in Delhi is mainly among the young people with relatively milder symptoms, AIIMS director Dr Randeep Guleria said. "But this will spread to the elderly, as....seen in Maharashtra, where it started with milder cases and then we found...hospital resources getting strained," he added. "Having a state lockdown is going to be difficult," Guleria further said.

All government and private schools for classes 1 to 8 in Uttar Pradesh will remain shut till April 4 in the view of COVID-19 pandemic. Further, Uttar Pradesh Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath said that full compliance of COVID-19 protocol should be ensured in other schools and educational institutions. Uttar Pradesh currently has over 8,500 active coronavirus cases.

The lockdown in Maharashtra's Aurangabad, which was scheduled to come into effect from Tuesday midnight, has now been cancelled, Collector Sunil Chavan announced. According to Chavan, the decision was taken after discussion with NGOs, other organisations, political associations as well as the government. Due to rising COVID-19 cases, a lockdown was planned in Aurangabad from March 31 to April 9.

Gujarat government has announced that the night curfew in Ahmedabad, Vadodara, Surat and Rajkot, which is currently in force from 9 pm to 6 am, will continue till April 15. Considering the prevalence of coronavirus spread, the state government has decided to keep the COVID-19 Transition Control Guidelines of the central government unchanged till April 30, said a government official.

Actor-filmmaker Satish Kaushik, who was recently hospitalised due to COVID-19, is back home. He also confirmed that his daughter, Vanshika Kaushik, is in hospital but is "feeling better". Taking to Instagram, Satish shared a picture with Vanshika in which both are looking outside a hospital window, dressed in patient's attire, and wrote, "Father-Daughter hoping for COVID-19 free world."

World Economic Forum has estimated that it will take an extra 36 years to close the gender gap worldwide due to impact of COVID-19 pandemic. According to the report, it'll take 135.6 years to attain gender parity, instead of the 99.5 years estimated earlier. The group estimated that the gender gap in economic participation will take 268 years to close.

The Delhi government on Wednesday decided to increase testing to over 80,000 tests per day to cope with the surge in COVID-19 cases in the national capital. However, despite the spike state Health Minister Satyendra Jain said there is only 25% occupancy in private & government hospitals in Delhi. In the last 24 hours, Delhi recorded 992 new COVID-19 cases.

Amid a continuous spike in COVID-19 cases in Delhi, the safety norms were flouted at the vegetable and fruit market in Ghazipur on Wednesday morning. People crowded the market and were not maintaining social distancing norms, reports said. Some people were also seen without masks in the market. Meanwhile, Delhi on Tuesday reported 992 new COVID-19 cases and four deaths.

The third wave of coronavirus infections is emerging in Russia, TASS news agency quoted Deputy Health Minister Tatyana Semenova as saying. Russia is among the worst coronavirus-hit countries with nearly 45 lakh cases and over 97,000 deaths. However, President Vladimir Putin said last week that he expected to lift pandemic-related restrictions by the end of the summer.

The World Bank has raised its projection for India's economic growth in 2021-22 to 10.1% from its January estimate of 5.4%, as it expects the country's vaccination drive to spur activity in contact-intensive sectors. Given the uncertainty over the COVID-19 pandemic, the World Bank in its report also provided a range of 7.5% to 12.5% for its 2021-22 prediction.

As the shooting of 'Bhool Bhulaiyaa 2' was suspended after actor Kartik Aaryan tested positive for COVID-19, director Anees Bazmee said that he isn't worried about the film. He added, "Kartik is a...fast worker. He picks up his lines in minutes." "We'll be back on track as soon as he rejoins us. We're all waiting for him," Anees said.

The Centre has urged states to achieve 100% vaccination coverage of those above the age of 45 years in COVID-19 surge districts within the next two weeks. The states were also asked to focus on mortality reduction, identifying localities and hospitals where deaths are high and analysing deaths to understand whether they were due to late detection or referral delay.

Comedian Vir Das took to Twitter to take a dig at India exporting vaccines to other countries, while vaccination for all above 45 in India will start from tomorrow. He wrote, "Can someone share...list of countries where the Indian vaccine is freely available? Might be quicker." After the tweet, some users got confused between 'free vaccine' and 'freely available vaccine'.

Andhra Pradesh is estimated to have suffered a minimum loss of ?21,500 crore because of the COVID-19 pandemic so far, according to a statement released by the YSRCP government. The pandemic has led to an over-reliance on debt, it said. The state government also declared that its total debt as on March 31, 2021, was ?3,48,998.11 crore.

In order to contain the rising cases, Tamil Nadu government on Wednesday extended existing COVID-19 restrictions till April 30 and stressed on effective enforcement of Test-Track-Treat protocol. All international air travel of passengers, except for purposes permitted by the MHA, remains prohibited, it stated. Safety measures including mask usage and social distancing will be strictly enforced.

Amid rising COVID-19 cases in the state, Maharashtra Health Minister Rajesh Tope on Wednesday said the state government is planning to impose more restrictions in places that are prone to crowding. He added that saving the lives of people is the government's priority. Tope said that imposing a lockdown is the last option for the state government.

The Indira Gandhi International Airport in Delhi has issued a passenger advisory saying, "Delhi Disaster Management Authority shall conduct random COVID-19 testing of passengers coming from the states where the cases are increasing." After the collection of samples, the travellers would be allowed to exit, however, those who are found positive shall be mandatorily quarantined as per the protocol.

India has reported 53,480 new COVID-19 cases and 354 deaths in the last 24 hours, as per the Union Health Ministry. This is the biggest rise in the daily death toll this year. With this, the total number of COVID-19 cases has reached 1,21,49,335, while the death toll jumped to 1,62,468. There are 5,52,566 active COVID-19 cases in the country.

The shooting of Bosco Martis' directorial debut 'Rocket Gang' has been put on hold after a few crew members tested positive for coronavirus. Bosco confirmed the news to ETimes and said, "It's really tough to have a perspective on this because...scientists still cracking on the virus."  Reportedly, the shooting of the horror-comedy has been stopped for the next 10 days.

UEFA said it intended to use VAR in the World Cup qualifiers but later dropped the plan due to COVID-19. According to UEFA, the operational and logistical restrictions due to the pandemic forced them to postpone the implementation. This comes after Ronaldo was denied a goal against Serbia in the World Cup qualifiers due to the absence of VAR.

A barbershop in Wisconsin, US is hosting a COVID-19 vaccination clinic for its customers every Saturday till April 17, it announced on Facebook. The post noted that "some people may be concerned about getting vaccinated" and that the shop has teamed up with a local pharmacy to make the vaccine available to those who might want to take it.

The benchmark Sensex on Tuesday jumped over 800 points to trade over 49,800 while the broader Nifty jumped above 14,750. This came despite the rising COVID-19 cases in the country, particularly in economically crucial Maharashtra. Meanwhile, global shares remained mixed following the collapse of the hedge fund Archegos Capital and reports that the ship blocking the Suez Canal was refloated.

A court in Vietnam sentenced a flight attendant to two years in prison for breaching COVID-19 quarantine rules and spreading the virus. Duong Hau reportedly breached Vietnam's 14-day quarantine regulations and met 46 people after his flight from Japan in November. His violation resulted in quarantine and testing of around 2,000 people at $194,192 (over ?1.4 crore), the indictment said.

Actor Amitabh Bachchan posted a blog about how he spent Holi amid the ongoing pandemic and mentioned, "The streets are silent, the drums and the singing of the celebrations remain muted, nothing moves...This is not the festival we all grew up in." He added, "I miss it all and sit in silence by myself...it is sad."

The Council of Scientific and Industrial Research (CSIR) and Bharat Biotech are collaborating to set up a messenger RNA (mRNA)-based vaccine platform in India, given the initial success of mRNA vaccines against COVID-19. CSIR Director General Dr Mande said the organisation is working with Dr Krishna Ella's Bharat Biotech to "bring" this platform to India in the "coming few months".

As many as 43% of active COVID-19 cases in Delhi have been reported from south, south-east and south-west districts, which also have over 700 active cases each. Notably, five districts have less than 350 cases each. "We are mainly getting more cases from upscale residential areas such as Safdarjung Enclave, Sainik Farms...Malviya Nagar and Pushp Vihar," an official said.

Apple is encouraging its employees to get vaccinated and is offering them paid time off for appointments and paid sick leave for those experiencing side effects, Bloomberg reported. The company does not have access to vaccines itself and will not be providing shots to its employees. Apple has been offering on-site COVID-19 testing for employees returning to offices.

India Women T20I captain Harmanpreet Kaur has tested positive for COVID-19. Kaur, who did not play in the T20I series against South Africa in Lucknow after injuring herself in the fifth ODI on March 17, got herself tested on Monday after developing mild fever. She tweeted that she has quarantined herself and urged people to wear masks.

Former India all-rounder Irfan Pathan has become the fourth cricketer who represented India Legends in the Road Safety World Series T20 tournament to test positive for coronavirus. Irfan tweeted that he is self-isolating at home. Earlier, Irfan's brother Yusuf Pathan, Sachin Tendulkar and Subramaniam Badrinath had revealed that they had contracted the virus.

Paraguay has received 1,00,000 doses of coronavirus vaccine COVAXIN from India under grant assistance. "Never too far for friendship. Made in India vaccines arrive in Paraguay," External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar tweeted on Tuesday. Paraguay Health Ministry thanked India for the vaccines and said that another 1,00,000 made-in-India COVID-19 vaccines would arrive in the next few days.

Himachal Pradesh CM Jai Ram Thakur on Tuesday said new COVID-19 strains are more lethal and urged people to stay alert and follow the safety guidelines. Chairing a review meeting, he instructed the state health department to encourage people to take the COVID-19 vaccine. "The safety protocol should be followed so that economic activities are not hampered again," Thakur added.

A day after Maharashtra CM Uddhav Thackeray asked officials to prepare for lockdown as people continue to violate COVID-19 protocols, state BJP chief Chandrakant Patil said that imposing lockdown is not a solution. "We will protest against lockdown. If lockdown is imposed then the government should announce a package to the people affected by it," said Patil.

Punjab government on Tuesday ordered to extend existing COVID-19 restrictions till April 10 to contain the spread of the coronavirus. The state government recently issued COVID-19 guidelines wherein it extending the night curfew (9 pm to 5 am) in 11 districts and also banned social gatherings there. The order said cinema halls can operate at 50% capacity, among other things.

In the wake of increasing COVID-19 cases, the Chandigarh administration has declared 25 areas in the Union Territory as containment zones. As many as three areas are part of Sector 22. Chandigarh has reported a total of 23,184 coronavirus cases so far, out of which 2,633 are active. Further, there have been 377 deaths due to coronavirus in the UT.

Canada on Monday suspended the use of the Oxford-AstraZeneca coronavirus vaccine for people under age 55 following concerns it might be linked to rare blood clots. "There is substantial uncertainty about the benefit of providing AstraZeneca COVID-19 vaccines to adults under 55 given the potential risks," said Dr Shelley Deeks, vice-chair of the National Advisory Committee on Immunization.

Congress MP from Punjab's Ludhiana Ravneet Singh Bittu on Tuesday said that he has tested positive for COVID-19. "As it is being shown in the media, it is true that I have tested positive for coronavirus with mild symptoms. Many of our colleagues in the Parliament have tested positive including the Speaker," Bittu said in a tweet.

Italy football team coach Roberto Mancini said he'd support the introduction of larger squad limits for the rescheduled European Championships due to the risk of COVID-19. ?Expanding the squad to 25 or 26 players could be a good thing,? said Mancini. The tournament is scheduled to take place from June 11 to July 11 across 12 different host cities.

Saudi Arabia announced on Monday it would allow people who have been vaccinated against COVID-19 to attend sporting events at stadiums as the Kingdom pushes for its immunisation campaign. The stadiums will function at 40 percent capacity starting May 17. Vaccinated fans will be allowed to attend Asia World Cup qualifiers match between Saudi and Palestinian teams.

Players at the Miami Open on Monday expressed their concern for COVID-19 vaccines, with many saying they want more details before getting the shot. Seventh seed Aryna Sabalenka said, "So far I don't really trust it." Fifth seed Elina Svitolina said, "I would probably wait for now." "I'm planning on getting one," said second seed Osaka.

There are only a few rare cases wherein people contracted COVID-19 after taking vaccines, said Union Health Minister Harsh Vardhan, who received the second dose of COVID-19 vaccine on Tuesday along with his wife. "Even if someone tests positive after taking vaccines, it minimalises the chances of their hospitalisation or admission to ICU wards," said the minister.

The Centre has listed 10 districts that have the most number of active coronavirus cases in the country. Pune is at the top with 59,475 active cases. This is followed by Mumbai, Nagpur, Thane, Nashik, Aurangabad, Bengaluru Urban, Nanded, Delhi and Ahmednagar. Eight of these ten districts are from Maharashtra.

Pfizer-BioNTech and Moderna's coronavirus vaccines are "highly effective" and reduced the risk of infection by 80% in two weeks after the first shot, a study by US Centers for Disease Control and Prevention revealed. The infection risk fell 90% by two weeks after the second shot, it added. The study evaluated vaccines' ability to protect against infection, including asymptomatic cases.

India's 2021 economic output is expected to remain below the 2019 level despite COVID-19 vaccine's roll-out, according to a UN report. The country is estimated to record an economic growth of 7% in 2021-22, over a contraction of 7.7% witnessed in the previous fiscal, it said. Asia-Pacific economies are expected to grow by 5.9% in 2021, it added.

Stating that compliance of COVID-19 protocols at some airports is not satisfactory, DGCA asked the airports to explore levying spot fines to people who are not wearing their face masks properly or violating other protocols. It requested the airport operators to ensure that people cover their nose and mouth with the face masks and maintain social distancing.

India recorded 56,211 new COVID-19 cases and 271 deaths in the last 24 hours, according to Union Health Ministry. With this latest spike, the total number of COVID-19 cases in India inched towards the 1.21-crore mark. Meanwhile, the death toll due to COVID-19 climbed to 1,62,114. The active caseload in India stands at 5,40,720 amid the recent COVID-19 surge.

Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) has directed all private hospitals in Mumbai to keep 80% of the total number of beds reserved for COVID-19 patients. BMC also asked private hospitals to charge COVID-19 patients as per government guidelines. On Monday, Mumbai recorded 5,888 new COVID-19 cases and 12 deaths due to the virus, pushing the total death toll to 11,661.

Recalling the time when she tested COVID-19 positive, singer Kanika Kapoor said that it was a tough phase for her. She added, "It was really sad to see that people wanted to be so mean, despite knowing someone is so unwell." Kanika said, "It was more shocking...to see people just say anything without knowing the reality of the situation."

US President Joe Biden has said that 90% of US adults would be eligible for COVID-19 vaccination by April 19 and final 10% by May 1. Nearly all adults will be able to get a shot within 5 miles of their homes, Biden added. Biden aims to administer 20 crore doses by his 100th day in office on April 30.

Mahindra Group's Chairman Anand Mahindra on Tuesday shared a video on Twitter that showed some people at Mumbai's Marine Drive performing 'murga walk' as a punishment by policemen for not wearing masks amid COVID-19. "A common punishment in the boarding school I attended," wrote Mahindra. "Comical, but physically taxing. I certainly won't forget my mask," he added.

Tamil Nadu logged 2,342 new COVD-19 cases on Tuesday, including two from the UAE, taking the caseload to 8.84 lakh. Moreover, with 16 more COVID-19 related deaths, the state's toll has gone up to 12,700. Total recoveries in the state have touched 8,56,548 with 1,463 patients being discharged, leaving 14,846 active cases.

Amid rising COVID-19 cases in the national capital, the Delhi government has decided to increase the number of normal and intensive care unit (ICU) beds for COVID-19 patients in a few hospitals. "This will improve bed availability. We are keeping close watch and will take all steps necessary," CM Arvind Kejriwal tweeted. Delhi on Tuesday reported 992 coronavirus cases.

Forty-three women prisoners and a child in the New Nabha jail in Punjab's Patiala have tested positive for COVID-19. All the positive patients have been transferred to a different location, an official said. The health department stated that vaccination will begin for inmates who have tested negative. The jail employees and the officials are also being vaccinated, the official added.

Apple will host its annual Worldwide Developers Conference from June 7 to 11 in an online-only format for the second year in a row. The conference, which is usually held in San Jose, California, was moved completely online for the first time last year due to the COVID-19 pandemic. The event will be streamed for free on Apple's developer app.

As many as 18 crew members of the dance reality show 'Dance Deewane 3' have tested positive for coronavirus. Confirming the news, FWICE (Federation of Western India Cine Employees) General Secretary Ashok Dubey told ETimes, "We pray that each person who has been infected gets fine." The reality show is judged by Madhuri Dixit, Dharmesh Yelande and Tushar Kalia.

Actor Milind Soman, who recently tested positive for coronavirus, shared pictures from his Holi celebrations on Instagram and revealed that his wife Ankita Konwar visited him dressed in a PPE suit. "We put some colour on ourselves and ate puranpolis...I ate six mangoes and they were delicious...Don't know whether my taste buds are impaired. Definitely can't smell anything," he wrote.

Union Health Minister Harsh Vardhan along with his wife Nutan Goel on Tuesday received a second dose of COVID-19 vaccine at Delhi Heart and Lung Institute. On March 2, the health minister and his wife received the first dose of the vaccine. "Do not worry if you experience minor side-effects, but do let your doctors know," Harsh Vardhan had said.

The UN is seeking $10 billion in aid to help Syrians fleeing civil war as humanitarian crisis worsens amid COVID-19 pandemic. It includes $4.2 billion for humanitarian response inside Syria and $5.8 billion for refugees and their hosts in the Middle East. The appeal came ahead of Tuesday's Brussels Conference on Syria, an annual event co-hosted by UN and EU.

Despite rising number of cases in Delhi, several people were seen violating COVID-19 protocols at Ghazipur vegetable market today morning. People, including both customers and vegetable sellers, were seen without face masks and not maintaining social distancing. This comes after Delhi recorded over 1,900 new COVID-19 cases on Monday for the first time since December 2020.

Airline carrier Vistara has decided to roll back the pay cut that was implemented last year due to COVID-19 for select staff categories, it said in a company-wide email. However, management-level executives, including Vistara's CEO, will continue to take reduced salaries for the time being. Vistara had announced the pay cut for nearly 40% of its employees in June 2020.

Dakshina Kannada District Deputy Commissioner Dr Rajendra KV has imposed Section 144 of the CrPC in view of rising COVID-19 positive cases in the Karnataka district, ANI reported on Tuesday. All religious gatherings have been banned at public places, public grounds, gardens, markets and religious places. Reports said that fairs and processions have also been banned with immediate effect.

Filmmaker Amit Sharma, who recently recovered from coronavirus, said, "It's fortunate that my wife and son are out of town...So, I was in quarantine in my home without the fear of infecting [them]." "Though it was tough on me to manage with Covid on my own, I think it was plain good fortune that my family was spared," he added.

Lokesh Kanagaraj, who directed Vijay-starrer action-thriller film 'Master', has tested positive for coronavirus. The filmmaker shared the news on Monday and added that he has been admitted to a private hospital. "Will be back soon and stronger," Lokesh further wrote. "Take care bro and wish you a speedy recovery," a fan wrote while reacting to his tweet.

Visitors will now be required to produce a negative COVID-19 test report before they can enter Uttarakhand, CM Tirath Singh Rawat said on Tuesday. The restriction would apply to visitors coming from Maharashtra, Kerala, Punjab, Karnataka, Chhattisgarh, MP, Tamil Nadu, Gujarat, Haryana, UP, Delhi and Rajasthan by road, air and trains. The decision will come into force from April 1.

The release date of the film 'Chehre' has been indefinitely postponed from April 9 due to the surge in COVID-19 cases. The makers of the film announced the same in a statement that read, "Due to the rising cases of COVID-19 and new guidelines for cinemas, we are unable to release our movie 'Chehre'...until further notice."

After her COVID-19 result controversy, actress Gauahar Khan reacted to a post by filmmaker Rahul Dholakia, who suggested Indian cricketer Irfan Pathan to get his test again. This came after Irfan posted that he's tested positive for COVID-19 with no symptoms. Gauahar tweeted, "One still has to [be quarantined]...I've experienced the same. And [I] won't let anyone...suffer because of...confusion."

The UK government will not share surplus COVID-19 vaccines with other countries until its adult population is vaccinated, PM Boris Johnson's spokesperson said. UK currently has the fastest vaccine rollout in Europe, with over 30 million having received the first dose.  Many European countries have alleged that Britain has been getting more than its fair share of the vaccine supplies.

Union Health Secretary Rajesh Bhushan on Tuesday said that Punjab is neither conducting adequate number of tests nor being able to promptly isolate COVID-19 positive people. "The weekly national average positivity rate is 5.65%. Maharashtra's weekly average is 23%, Punjab stands at 8.82% and Delhi at 2.04%," Bhushan added during the press conference.

An 81-year-old COVID-19 patient allegedly died by suicide at a government hospital in Maharashtra's Nagpur. The Medical Superintendent (In-charge), GMC Nagpur said the man hung himself using an oxygen pipe inside a bathroom. This comes amid rising cases of coronavirus in Maharashtra, with Nagpur reporting 3,177 new infections on Monday.

The English Premier League confirmed one new coronavirus case after its latest rounds of testing on Monday. The Premier League said that across two rounds of testing, 2,210 players and club staff were tested for coronavirus between March 22- 28. "No specific details as to clubs or individuals will be provided by the League," it added.

Delhi on Tuesday reported 992 COVID-19 positive cases during the last 24 hours, official numbers showed. With four more deaths, the total COVID-19 related deaths in the national capital jumped to 11,016. The health bulletin showed that 1,591 recovered and 36,757 tests were conducted in the last 24 hours. Out of the total 5,784 hospital beds, 4,200 were vacant.

Union Health Minister Harsh Vardhan on Tuesday said both Indian vaccines, Covishield and Covaxin, are safe and effective and urged people not to believe what is being circulated in 'WhatsApp university'. Vardhan added that there were only a few rare cases wherein people contracted COVID-19 after taking vaccines. "A lot of people still have doubts regarding vaccines," he said.

Easy Trip Planners' Director Prashant Pitti said that it is unfortunate for the company that coronavirus cases have surged since the company's initial public offering (IPO) earlier this month. Pitti added that the company didn't foresee the surge but it is hopeful of growing due to its policies. The company's IPO raised ?510 crore and was subscribed 160 times.

Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) Commissioner Iqbal Singh Chahal took COVID-19 vaccine shot today at BKC Jumbo COVID Centre. Following the inoculation, Chahal urged all eligible citizens of Mumbai to get themselves vaccinated at the earliest. He also requested them to not drop their guards and continue following COVID-19 protocols to help the city beat the virus.

Ten states/UTs are displaying an upward trajectory in daily new COVID-19 cases. These are- Maharashtra, Gujarat, Punjab, Madhya Pradesh, Delhi, Tamil Nadu, Chhattisgarh, Karnataka, Haryana and Rajasthan. India's total active caseload reached 5,40,720 on Tuesday, with 78.56% of the new cases being reported from Maharashtra, Punjab, Karnataka, Madhya Pradesh, Tamil Nadu and Gujarat.

Slovakia's PM Igor Matovic resigned on Tuesday amid a political crisis triggered by a decision to buy Russia's Sputnik V coronavirus vaccine without informing his coalition partners in early March. President Zuzana ?aputov accepted Matovic's resignation and asked Eduard Heger to form a new government. Heger had served as the finance minister and deputy PM in the outgoing government.

The Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike (BBMP) identified three more COVID-19 containment zones in Bengaluru on Tuesday. A total of nine, 15 and six cases of COVID-19 were reported in Dasarahalli, RR Nagar and Yelahanka zones, respectively. With this, the total number of active containment zones has risen to 31 in the city.

Actor Mandar Chandwadkar, who plays Bhide in 'Taarak Mehta Ka Ooltah Chashmah', has tested negative for COVID-19 after announcing he had tested positive around a week back. "I am still at home, did my tests three days back and tested negative as expected," said Chandwadkar. He informed that he will resume shoot from Friday or Saturday.

Six states cumulatively contributed to 78.56% of new COVID-19 cases in the last 24 hours from across India, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare on Tuesday. These states are Maharashtra, Punjab, Karnataka, Madhya Pradesh, Tamil Nadu and Gujarat which continued to report a surge in daily cases. India recorded 56,211 new cases in the last 24 hours.

Tokyo Olympics organisers said on Monday that international athletes could be invited to participate in test events before the Games this summer. The organisers are planning 18 test events before the Games begin on July 23. The events will be a dress rehearsal in how to prevent the spread of COVID-19.

Authorities in Berlin, Munich and the eastern state of Brandenburg have temporarily suspended the use of the Oxford-AstraZeneca coronavirus vaccine for people under 60. The suspension was announced after Germany's vaccine regulator said that it had recorded 31 cases of a rare blood clot in the brain, nine of which resulted in deaths, after people received the vaccine.

The total tally of COVID-19 cases at the Indian Institute of Management, Ahmedabad has increased to 70 from 40, Dr Mehul Acharya, Deputy Health Officer, Ahmedabad Municipal Corporation said. Students who have tested positive are not being allowed to sit for the exams. The institute has been conducting RT-PCR tests for the students and community members for free, Acharya added.

The Parliamentary Standing Committee on Home Affairs on Management of COVID-19 Pandemic recognised bankers as 'COVID warriors' and hailed the efforts of the banking sector during the pandemic.
