In its 229th report, the committee said it "notes and appreciates the efforts and pain taken by the banking sector for providing uninterrupted and seamless banking facilities" during the COVID-19 outbreak.

Actress Genelia Deshmukh took to Instagram and shared a video celebrating Holi with her husband, actor Riteish Deshmukh. In the video, the couple is smeared with colours. Alongside the post, Genelia wrote, "Find your...way to make festivals special [by] following all COVID-19 restrictions, even if it's small and intimate." Riteish also shared a video with his family on Instagram.

Chinese electric vehicle (EV) maker BYD reported a net profit of 4.23 billion yuan in 2020, up from 1.61 billion yuan in 2019, marking a 162% growth. BYD sold 4,26,972 vehicles in 2020, 7.5% lower from a year earlier. The company, which has been backed by Berkshire Hathaway CEO Warren Buffett, also became a major mask maker amid COVID-19 pandemic.

The central government said on Monday that 84% of the total new cases of the COVID-19 reported in the last 24 hours came from eight states. According to the government, Maharashtra has contributed most to the daily spike with 40,414 fresh cases, followed by Karnataka with 3,082 cases. Punjab has reported 2,870 cases and Madhya Pradesh reported 2,276 cases.

Karnataka CM BS Yediyurappa denied suggestions of a lockdown after chairing a COVID-19 review meeting in Bengaluru on Monday. "COVID-19 cases in apartments are increasing, so no parties or celebrations are allowed from today," the Karnataka government said. "For 15 days from today no protests, rallies will be allowed in Karnataka...We're not going to close schools and colleges," it added.

Holi celebrations were witnessed across the country on Monday despite many states restricting gatherings to try to contain a coronavirus resurgence. The latest surge is centered in Maharashtra where authorities have tightened travel restrictions and imposed night curfews. On Monday, the Health Ministry reported 68,020 new coronavirus cases, the sharpest daily rise since October last year.

Actor Akshay Kumar took to Twitter to urge his fans to stay at home and celebrate Holi inside their houses amid the surge in COVID-19 cases in the country. He wrote, "Do me a favour let's not play Holi." Akshay also posted a picture of himself with daughter Nitara from their at-home Holi celebration.

Actress Suchitra Krishnamoorthi on Monday expressed concern over the surge in COVID-19 cases in the country and said the government needs to speed up the vaccination process. She tweeted, "Why can't vaccination centres be set up like we have polling booths in every area during elections?" Recently, she had spoken about Mumbaikars flouting COVID-19 protocols and roaming around without masks.

America's Johnson & Johnson said that it will deliver up to 400 million doses of COVID-19 vaccine to the African Union. "We need to immunise at least 60% of our population...to get rid of the virus from our continent," John Nkengasong, Director of Africa Centres for Disease Control and Prevention said. Almost 121,000 people across Africa have died from COVID-19.

Pune has reported the highest number of new COVID-19 positive cases, at 8,292, taking the total tally to 5,14,639, a health official said on Sunday. He added that the death toll reached 9,842, with 42 more patients succumbing to the COVID-19 infection. A total of 2,107 patients were discharged from hospitals, he further said.

Active COVID-19 cases in India crossed the five-lakh mark as the country recorded its biggest one-day jump this year. India recorded 68,020 new cases in the last 24 hours, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. Meanwhile, 291 deaths have been recorded in the last 24 hours, taking the death toll to 1,61,843. Total cases stand at 1,20,39,644.

Indian Institute of Technology (IIT) Bhubaneswar has postponed the arrival of the next batch of students scheduled for April 4 after 10 students tested positive for COVID-19. "All 10 students are now in the isolation centre of the institute and are being taken care of," the institute said in a statement.

The Elisabeth Pharmacon lab in Czech Republic has discovered a new strain of coronavirus. The company's founder, Czech biologist Omar Sery, confirmed the same on Twitter. Omar explained that the new mutation does not appear to be more contagious, and added that COVID-19 vaccines should be effective against it. Czech Republic has confirmed over 1.5 million coronavirus cases so far.

The Confederation of All India Traders (CAIT) has estimated losses of around ?25,000 crore due to restrictions on Holi celebrations across the country amid rising COVID-19 cases. This is the second year that COVID-19 has impacted traders on Holi who cumulatively lost ?20,000 crore in 2020. CAIT secretary general Praveen Khandelwal said that 40,000 Holi gatherings take place every year.

Nepal Army on Sunday received one lakh doses of COVID-19 vaccines from the Indian Army, the Nepal Army said. Nine packages of Covishield vaccines, manufactured by the Serum Institute of India (SII) arrived in Kathmandu late on Sunday evening via an Air India flight. Earlier in March, Nepal received 3,48,000 doses of made-in-India COVID-19 vaccines under the COVAX initiative.

Cricket West Indies President Ricky Skerritt has revealed that the board had to borrow money to pay wages during the COVID-19 pandemic. "We were literally having to borrow to just pay players and staff," Skerritt said. Last year due to the financial loss caused by COVID-19, the board had announced a temporary 50% pay cut across their entire cricketing system.

Mexico's coronavirus death toll is at least 60% higher than the confirmed number, according to government data. By the end of the sixth week of this year, 294,287 fatalities "associated with COVID-19" had been registered on death certificates, data showed. That was 61.4% higher than the confirmed death toll of 182,301 given as a comparison in same table.

Mumbai faced a shortage of beds in private hospitals over the weekend, as it recorded over 13,000 COVID-19 cases on Saturday and Sunday. In a meeting, the BMC decided to add 63 small nursing homes as COVID-19 hospitals. Currently, there are 243 ventilators and 2,279 oxygen beds available in Mumbai, but the bulk of vacant beds are in government centres.

In her latest Instagram post, television actress Dalljiet Kaur opened up about contracting COVID-19 and revealed that she was admitted to Lilavati Hospital in Mumbai. "I was...fortunate to have detected the virus on the third day itself...Maybe being paranoid saved my life. Being an asthma patient, it's been scary to be living in today's situation...while working," she wrote on Instagram.

Pakistan President Arif Alvi and Defence Minister Pervez Khattak have tested positive for COVID-19. "Had first dose of vaccine, but antibodies start developing after second dose that was due in a week," Alvi tweeted on Monday. This comes a little over a week after PM Imran Khan and first lady Bushra Bibi tested positive for coronavirus.

United Nations Secretary-General Antonio Guterres has said that the world faces intense problems of debt sustainability because of the COVID-19 crisis that have not been properly understood or addressed. "The response to COVID-19 and to the financial aspects [of the crisis] has been fragmented," he further said. "It has been too limited in scope and too late," he added.

Delhi has recorded 1,904 new coronavirus cases in the last 24 hours. This is the first time Delhi's daily cases have crossed the 1900-mark since December 2020. As many as six more have died of the virus there in the last 24 hours, taking the Union Territory's total death toll to 11,012. The national capital's cumulative COVID-19 caseload is 6,59,619.

Actress Fatima Sana Shaikh took to her Instagram Stories and shared that she has tested positive for coronavirus. "[I'm] following all the precautions and protocols and have been home quarantining myself. Thank you for?your wishes and concerns," she posted. Other celebrities like Milind Soman, R Madhavan, Kartik Aaryan, Vikrant Massey, Rohit Saraf are also in quarantine after testing positive.

Team India captain Virat Kohli has criticised scheduling amid the coronavirus pandemic, with players having to stay in bio-bubbles for longer periods. "Scheduling needs to be looked at in future, because playing in 'bubbles' for so long, two to three months, is going to be very, very difficult going forward," he said. He added that players get cooked.

Dr Reddy's Laboratories is expecting Sputnik V COVID-19 vaccine to get approval from the Indian regulator in the next few weeks, Deepak Sapra, CEO for API and Services, said. "It is a two dose vaccine. You take the first dose on day zero and the second one on day 21," he added. The efficacy of Sputnik V is 91.6%.

Subramaniam Badrinath took to Twitter to reveal that he has tested positive for coronavirus. He added that he has mild symptoms and will be isolating himself at home. Earlier, Sachin Tendulkar and Yusuf Pathan had tested positive for the virus. Notably, the trio were part of India Legends, who recently won the Road Safety World Series T20 tournament in Raipur.

A hostel block at the Andhra University College of Engineering in Visakhapatnam on Sunday was turned into an isolation ward after 102 students and staff members tested positive for coronavirus, The News Minute reported. "The district authorities are taking all the necessary measures to treat those who have been infected with the virus," state minister MS Srinivasa Rao said.

Actor Sanjay Dutt took to Instagram and urged people to celebrate Holi while keeping the coronavirus social distancing norms in mind. Sanjay, who celebrated the festival with his wife Maanayata Dutt and children, shared a family picture and wrote, "Keep the celebrations at home this year for the safety of your loved ones. Wishing you all a very Happy Holi!"

A new report by FICCI and EY projected that India's media and entertainment (M&E) industry will grow by 25% to reach ?1.73 lakh crore by 2021 and ?2.23 lakh crore by 2023. FICCI Secretary General Dilip Chenoy said that while the industry had been impacted by COVID-19, online gaming grew by 18% and digital subscription by 49% last year.

Venezuela has accused Facebook of "digital totalitarianism" after the firm froze President Nicolas Maduro's page for 30 days for promoting a remedy he claims can cure COVID-19. The government said Facebook was going after "content geared toward combating the pandemic". It also accused firms like Facebook of wanting to impose their law on nations.

Hotel Taj in Uttarakhand's Rishikesh has been closed for three days by the district administration after 76 people were found to be COVID-19 positive there, ANI reported on Monday. "The hotel was sanitised and has been closed as a precautionary measure," Tehri Garhwal SSP Tripti Bhatt said.

BJP leader and former Rajya Sabha MP Amar Sable on Monday alleged Chief Minister Uddhav Thackeray-led Maha Vikas Aghadi (MVA) government failed to control the second wave of COVID-19 in Maharashtra. He said, "COVID-19 cases are continuously increasing in the state. In such a situation, the Maharashtra government needs to improve health facilities but it doesn't appear to be happening."

Actor Manish Raisinghan said that he had major plans for Holi this year, considering it is his first after his marriage with actress Sangeita Chauhaan but COVID-19 played "spoilsport". Speaking about his plans to celebrate Holi, Manish said, "We have a new addition in our family. We all will try to make it as special as we can for Sangeita."

Actor-filmmaker Satish Kaushik, who was recently hospitalised due to COVID-19, is back home and informed that his eight-year-old daughter Vanshika is still in the hospital. He said, "Her [Vanshika's] COVID-19 report has come negative but still her temperature is not becoming normal and stable. Please pray for her." Satish added that he's recovering and quarantined at home.

Pune Municipal Corporation (PMC) has decided to go for a third-party audit of private labs testing COVID-19 samples, after a private lab which conducts RT-PCR testing for COVID-19 reported 78 out of 80 samples positive for coronavirus on a single day. PMC officials discussed the matter at the COVID-19 review meeting chaired by Maharashtra Deputy CM Ajit Pawar on Friday.

Amid a rise in coronavirus cases in Madhya Pradesh, the Bhopal district administration on Saturday declared 20 areas and houses as containment zones. The administration said that residents of these areas will remain in home quarantine. Earlier, the Madhya Pradesh government imposed Sunday lockdown in several cities, including Bhopal, Indore and Jabalpur.

Maharashtra recorded 40,414 new COVID-19 cases in the last 24 hours, the biggest jump in daily coronavirus cases the state has seen so far. The state's total cases now stand at 27,13,875 and active cases at 3,25,901. With 108 more coronavirus-related deaths in the last 24 hours, the state's coronavirus death toll now stands at 54,181.

The Uttarakhand government has increased COVID-19 testing at borders to check travellers, especially from Kerala, Maharashtra and other high-load states. State Health Director Dr Tripti Bahuguna said, "The COVID-19 situation in the state is under control. The thermal screening of people has started at various borders." The state reported 177 COVID-19 cases in the last 24 hours.

Beginning April 1, a negative RT-PCR test report not older than 72 hours will be mandatory for those travelling to Gujarat from other states, the state government said on Saturday. The announcement comes as the state recorded 2,276 new COVID-19 cases, its highest single-day rise in infections since the beginning of the pandemic last year.

Australia's PM Scott Morrison on Sunday greeted the Hindu Australian community and his "good friend" PM Narendra Modi on the occasion of Holi. "Holi ki shubhkamnaye," Morrison said in a tweet. In a video message, Morrison praised India's "tremendous job" in manufacturing COVID-19 vaccines and exporting them, "which is helping the broader world" in the fight against the pandemic.

A huge crowd was seen at Mumbai's Dadar vegetable market on Sunday despite rising COVID-19 cases in the state of Maharashtra. On Saturday, Mumbai logged the highest single-day spike of 6,130 fresh cases of the coronavirus disease taking the total tally to 3,91,791. Maharashtra is contributing the most to the rising cases across the country.

Amid rising daily COVID-19 cases in Telangana, the Greater Hyderabad Municipal Corporation (GHMC) has decided to issue partial curbs within its premises after more than 10 of its employees tested positive for coronavirus. GHMC has imposed restrictions on visitors, barring them from meeting officials at the head office, saying all complaints would go through the My-GHMC app.

Karnataka on Sunday recorded over 3,000 new coronavirus cases in the biggest daily case surge in the state this year. While Karnataka recorded 3,082 new coronavirus cases in the last 24 hours, as many as 12 more people died of the virus in the state. The total number of active COVID-19 cases in the state has gone above 23,000.

KFC India Managing Director Samir Menon said that the company will continue to expand its restaurant network in India despite the structural changes brought by the coronavirus pandemic. "We believe very strongly in the India story and...India is...going to be a growth market for KFC in the coming years," he added. KFC India has over 480 restaurants across India.

Japan will issue digital certificates to citizens who have been vaccinated against COVID-19, the Nikkei reported. People will be able to manage the certificate using an app that will allow them to carry vaccination proof when boarding a plane or checking in to a hotel. The app will also focus on foreigners staying in Japan and returning to their homes.

About 63% of the total daily coronavirus cases recorded in Karnataka are in Bengaluru at 1,820 on Saturday, according to official data. There are now 29 active containment zones in the Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike (BBMP) area, with the most identified in Dasarahalli at nine and Yelahanka at eight. The number of active cases in the city is 14,671.

Russian President Vladimir Putin on Sunday said that he had experienced minor side effects after taking the first shot of the coronavirus vaccine. "I woke up the next morning after the vaccination and it seemed to me I felt slight pain in muscles," he added. Putin also said that he had an uncomfortable feeling on the site of the injection.

Maharashtra's capital Mumbai reported 6,923 new COVID-19 cases in the last 24 hours, the biggest one-day spike in cases the city has seen since the coronavirus pandemic began. Mumbai's total cases now stand at 3,98,674 and active cases at 45,140. With eight more coronavirus-related deaths, Mumbai's coronavirus death toll rose to 11,649.

Delhi on Sunday recorded 1,881 new coronavirus cases, marking this year's biggest daily case surge in the national capital. As many as nine more people died of the virus in the last 24 hours in Delhi, taking the UT's COVID-19 death toll to 11,006. Delhi's total COVID-19 caseload now stands at 6,57,715, of which 7,545 cases are active.

BMC, Mumbai police and volunteers at railway stations collected ?46.87 crore in fine from 23.25 lakh people till March 26 for not wearing masks in public spaces. Furthermore, a total fine of ?38.52 lakh was collected from 19,262 violators on a single day on March 26. Notably, Mumbai reported 6,123 fresh COVID-19 cases on Saturday.

At least 6,02,69,782 COVID-19 vaccine doses have been administered in the country through 9,85,018 sessions, the Union Health Ministry said on Sunday. Karnataka, West Bengal, Maharashtra, Kerala, Gujarat, Uttar Pradesh, Rajasthan and Madhya Pradesh account for 60% of the total vaccine doses given so far. As many as 21,54,170 vaccine doses were given in the country on March 27.

At least 32 out of 86 employees of Telangana's Yadadri Temple, located 60km away from Hyderabad, tested COVID-19 positive after tests were conducted by authorities. Those found positive include both staff members and priests, reported News18. The temple attracts 25,000-30,000 devotees on weekdays and more than 40,000 on weekends. However, temple authorities have now cancelled special rituals.

India has reported over 62,000 new COVID-19 cases for second day in a row. The country recorded 62,714 new COVID-19 cases in the last 24 hours, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. Meanwhile, 312 deaths have been recorded in the last 24 hours, taking the death toll to 1,61,552. Out of the total cases, 4,86,310 are active.

Actor Siddhant Chaturvedi took to social media and announced that he has tested negative for COVID-19, two weeks after contracting the virus. The 'Gully Boy' actor posted a picture of himself on Instagram and wrote, "COVID-19 negative but still, keep your distance." The 27-year-old actor announced his diagnosis on March 14 and shared that he was under home quarantine.

Indore district administration has given a partial relaxation allowing a maximum of 20 people to gather at one place for the celebration of Holika Dahan while adhering to COVID-19 norms. This comes after there were protests over the ban on public celebration of Holika Dahan. The administration has ordered a lockdown on March 28 and 29 amid COVID-19 surge.

A picture of the ever-busy Marine Drive in Mumbai laying empty without any people surfaced on Sunday as Maharashtra's night curfew came into effect. Maharashtra government imposed a night curfew between 8 pm and 7 am in view of rising cases of COVID-19. Gathering of five or more people will not be allowed from 8 pm to 7 am.

Maharashtra CM Uddhav Thackeray at a meeting with senior health officials and COVID-19 task force on Sunday instructed them to prepare for restrictions similar to lockdown if people continue to violate COVID-related rules. He said that the COVID-19 cases are rising because people are not following guidelines seriously. He stressed that strict steps like lockdown are needed to be considered.

Actor Vikrant Massey on Sunday took to Instagram to inform that he has tested positive for COVID-19. He wrote, "Despite necessary precautions on shoot, I have tested COVID-19 positive. In self-quarantine." He stated that he's currently doing fine and urged all those who have recently come in contact with him to get themselves tested. Several actors wished him speedy recovery.

The active COVID-19 cases in Pimpri Chinchwad Municipal Corporation (PCMC) have seen a four-fold increase in a month since February 26, said PCMC Additional Health chief Dr Pavan Salve. The area had 3,331 active cases as of February 26, while the figure reached 15,415 by March 27. "Every day we are registering more than 1,800 cases," Salve added.

Maharashtra CM Uddhav Thackeray said that people of the state "need to understand" that COVID-19 threat "is not over but has grown bigger". "Lockdown should be imposed in individual districts, if needed, but such a step should not be taken suddenly," he added. Notably, night curfew has been imposed in Maharashtra and it'll come into effect from tonight onwards.

Actress Kangana Ranaut replied to a tweet by filmmaker Vivek Agnihotri, in which he had praised Kangana for her relentless energy of working during COVID-19. Kangana said, "I was an unwanted girl child, today I work with best and passionate filmmakers, artists and technicians." Kangana added that she loves her work and doesn't work for fame or money.

Kevin Pietersen has been criticised for his tweet reading, "Can someone...tell me...why you need to announce...to the world, that you have COVID-19?" Pietersen posted this the same day Sachin Tendulkar announced he had COVID-19. A fan tweeted, "Are you taking shots at the great man?" Another wrote, "We wonder why you had to announce about your workout sessions, golf sessions."

Only 50 persons will be allowed to attend the annual Tukaram Beej ceremony at Sant Tukaram Maharaj Devasthan in Dehu near Pune, Pimpri Chinchwad Police said. Amid rising COVID-19 cases, a curfew has been imposed in Dehu from Sunday morning till midnight of March 30. A Warkari sect leader had asked devotees to come to Dehu in large numbers.

A COVID-19 vaccination centre has been set up inside Tihar Jail to vaccinate eligible inmates, Delhi Prisons Department officials said on Sunday. The centre, which was set up on Tuesday, is in the central jail hospital at jail number 3. According to jail officials, around 70 to 80 inmates of Tihar, Rohini and Mandoli jails have been vaccinated so far.

New COVID-19 cases in Pune declined marginally from Friday's peak, with the city recording 6,563 cases on Saturday. On Friday, 7,147 cases were recorded, registering a new high. Pune has so far seen over 5.08 lakh confirmed cases, the second-highest for any city in India after Delhi, which has recorded over 6.55 lakh cases so far.

Over 470 children below the age of 10 years have been infected with COVID-19 since March 1 in Bengaluru, according to official data. As many as 244 boys and 228 girls have been infected from March 1 to 26, the data showed. "There is more and more exposure of children because of the opening of schools," a PHFI official said.

The 2021 edition of Kingfisher Ultra Indian Derby scheduled for Sunday at the Royal Western India Turf Club will be held behind closed doors due to the COVID-19 pandemic. Around 200 people will be allowed in each of the first enclosure and the members? box. The Mahalaxmi race course was turned into a COVID-19 centre by BMC last July.

Television actors Amar Upadhyay and Priyal Mahajan, who star in the TV series 'Molkki', have tested positive for COVID-19. "I'm asymptomatic and don't have any cough, cold or fever...I don't know how I got the virus," Amar told The Times of India. "I've isolated myself at home under the advice of doctors and authorities," Priyal shared on her Instagram Stories.

Forty people including students and professors at the Indian Institute of Management, Ahmedabad have tested positive for COVID-19, Mehul Acharya, Deputy Health Officer, Ahmedabad Municipal Corporation said. Meanwhile, 25 students of Indian Institute of Technology, Gandhinagar have tested positive for the virus, according to IIT officials. Gujarat has 10,871 active COVID-19 cases.

India football captain Sunil Chhetri, who had tested positive for COVID-19, on Sunday took to Twitter to announce he has recovered from it. "Got an all-clear from the tests and couldn't be happier to get back on the pitch (I missed it bad!)," Chhetri tweeted. "I'd want everyone to stay safe and mask up at all times," he added.

BJP MLA Ram Kadam on Sunday criticised Chief Minister Uddhav Thackeray-led Maharashtra government over restrictions on 'holika dahan' due to COVID-19 and termed the state government as "anti-Hindu". He tweeted, "Other religions are allowed to celebrate their festivals. Is COVID-19 a special relative of them?" Kadam alleged that the state government has continuously been against Hindus.

As Punjab continues to witness a sharp rise in COVID-19 cases, Ludhiana administration has started its special doorstep vaccination drive four days ahead of schedule with vaccination camps in mohallas. The drive began on March 26 with a mobile vaccination camp in Partap Nagar. On Friday, at the camp, 106 persons were administered their first dose.

Mumbai Mayor Kishori Pednekar has announced that residential societies with five or more COVID-19 cases will be sealed by BMC. "We're seeing a higher positivity rate in high-rises than slums," said Pednekar. Night curfew in Mumbai may begin from 10 or 11 pm on March 28 and all pubs and hotels will remain shut during the curfew period, she said.

As many as 59 students of Andhra University College of Engineering in Andhra Pradesh tested positive for COVID-19. "After a student tested positive, health officials collected samples of 850 students, of which 450 results came out by the evening. Of them, 59 tested positive," DMHO PS Suryanarayana said. All COVID-19 positive students are asymptomatic and have been kept in isolation.

Mumbai recorded 6,123 new COVID-19 cases in the last 24 hours, the highest single-day rise in cases Maharashtra's capital has seen since the coronavirus pandemic began. Mumbai's total cases now stand at 3,91,751 while active cases stand at 41,609. With another 12 coronavirus-related deaths in the last 24 hours, Mumbai's coronavirus death toll now stands at 11,641.

Amazon has received US FDA's authorisation for a COVID-19 test made by its subsidiary STS Lab Holdco. The test is done via a nasal swab that individuals administer themselves, either under the supervision of health-care professionals or at home. Amazon plans to use the test among its workforce as part of its COVID-19 preparedness and response programme, the filing said.

Hours after Sachin Tendulkar revealed that he tested positive for coronavirus, former India all-rounder Yusuf Pathan tweeted he has also tested positive for the virus with mild symptoms. Yusuf said that he has quarantined himself at home. Notably, Sachin and Yusuf were part of India Legends, who recently played in Raipur and won the Road Safety World Series T20 tournament.

France Foreign Minister Jean-Yves Le Drian has accused UK of "blackmail" over COVID-19 vaccine supplies. "One cannot play like that, a kind of blackmail, where you wanted to vaccinate with all your might with the first dose...then you find yourself handicapped with the second doses," he said. "It's not for Europe to bear the cost of this policy," he added.

Maharashtra government on Saturday extended the restrictions related to coronavirus till April 15, amid a rise in cases in the state. The state government had earlier capped the capacity of cinema halls, hotels, restaurants at 50% and had warned that establishments that flout COVID-19 guidelines will be shut down. The curbs were earlier to be in effect till March 31.

Voting for the first phase in the Assam and West Bengal Assembly elections has begun. Polling will be held in 47 out of the 126 constituencies in Assam and 30 out of the 294 constituencies in West Bengal today. The voting will conclude at 6 pm, as the timing has been extended by an hour in view of COVID-19 pandemic.

Actor R Madhavan, who tested positive for coronavirus this week, said, "The only problem is, I've to be confined to my home for fifteen days. Otherwise, there is no problem at all." He added that he's enjoying this "enforced" resting period. "I normally won't dream of being without work. But this time I've actually welcomed the time off," said Madhavan.

The Centre on Saturday released a list of states and a Union Territory that have more than 2.8 lakh confirmed coronavirus cases. Maharashtra has the highest number with 26,37,735 confirmed cases so far. This is followed by Kerala, Karnataka, Andhra Pradesh, Tamil Nadu, Delhi, Uttar Pradesh, West Bengal, Odisha, Chhattisgarh, Rajasthan and Telangana.

Former India batsman Sachin Tendulkar has tested positive for coronavirus. The 47-year-old, who captained India Legends to victory in recently-concluded Road Safety World Series T20 tournament in Raipur, said that he tested coronavirus positive after showing mild symptoms and added that he has quarantined himself at home. He further said that his family members have tested negative for the virus.

A total of 62,258 new cases of coronavirus were detected in India in the last 24 hours, out of which 36,902, or 60%, came from Maharashtra. Meanwhile, 291 deaths have been recorded in the last 24 hours, taking the death toll to 1,61,240. Out of the total 1,19,08,910 cases, 4,52,647 cases are active.

World Health Organization (WHO) Director-General Tedros Adhanom Ghebreyesus has said that India's decision to make domestic COVID-19 vaccinations a priority is "understandable" amid rising cases. "It is not an export ban from India as far as we know," he added. The WHO is in talks with India so it continues providing doses to other countries, he further said.

WHO Director-General Tedros Adhanom Ghebreyesus has warned against fake COVID-19 vaccines being sold on internet, especially on the dark web. Many health ministries, national regulatory authorities and public procurement organisations across the world have received suspicious offers to supply vaccines, he said. Tedros urged people to not buy vaccines outside government-run vaccination programmes.

Camps will be set up at corporate firms in Gurugram to provide coronavirus vaccines to employees above the age of 45 from April 1. The decision was made at a meeting held under the chairmanship of Gurugram Deputy Commissioner Yash Garg on Friday. "This will be the first experiment of its kind in the country," Gurugram CMO Virender Yadav said.

As COVID-19 cases continue to rise in the national capital, Delhi Health Minister Satyendar Jain on Saturday said, "There is no possibility of lockdown. There has already been a lockdown and there was a logic behind it." "At that time, no one knew how the virus spreads," he added. We are conducting 85,000-90,000 tests every day, he further said.

WHO Director-General Tedros Adhanom Ghebreyesus has urged countries to "immediately" donate one  crore doses of coronavirus vaccines to ensure every country starts immunising within the first 100 days of 2021. So far, COVAX has delivered vaccines to 61 countries but 36 nations still await vaccines, Tedros said. The COVAX scheme aims to distribute vaccines for free to poor countries.

Karnataka's Leader of Opposition Siddaramaiah tweeted on Saturday that the state's BJP government's "inefficiency, corruption and lies" are reason for surge in COVID-19 cases. He claimed that it'd "lied" about COVID-19 deaths, medicines, masks and other supplies. The state government should release "white paper about COVID-19 infection, deaths, treatment details and compensation paid", he said.

India has supplied more COVID-19 vaccines globally than vaccinated its own people, India's Deputy Permanent Representative to the UN Ambassador K Nagaraj Naidu said to the UN General Assembly. "Lack of global cooperation...disparity in the accessibility of COVID-19 vaccines will affect the poorest nations the most," Naidu added. India has gifted 200,000 COVID-19 vaccine doses to UN peacekeepers.

Foreign Portfolio Investment (FPI), one of the chief drivers of the Indian stock market, fell to a six-month low in March, data from the exchanges showed. Amid a fresh spike in COVID-19 cases, net inflow into equities slipped to ?10,557 crore this month. In contrast, FPI inflow into equities between October 2020 and February 2021 amounted to ?37,435 crore.

Pimpri-Chinchwad Municipal Corporation (PCMC) officials said there is no shortage of beds for COVID-19 patients in the city as of now. "Every day, around 100-125 patients are being hospitalised. Therefore, we don't think there's possibility to run out of beds immediately," PCMC Health Department Medical Officer Dr K Anil Roy said. Pimpri-Chinchwad recorded 1,782 new COVID-19 cases on Friday.

Serum Institute of India (SII) has announced that the trial for Covovax, the second COVID-19 vaccine being manufactured by it, has begun in India. The vaccine has been developed by US-based Novavax. "It has been tested against African and UK variants of COVID-19 and has an overall efficacy of 89%. Hope to launch by September 2021!" CEO Adar Poonawalla tweeted.

Facebook plans to reopen its Menlo Park, California, headquarters at 10% capacity on May 10, if the COVID-19 situation begins to improve. The firm said its offices in Fremont and Sunnyvale are also scheduled to reopen at 10% capacity on May 17 and May 24 respectively. It expects that its largest offices will not reach 50% capacity until early September.

Facebook has frozen Venezuelan President Nicolas Maduro's page for 30 days for violating policies against spreading misinformation about COVID-19, a company spokesman told Reuters. He's violating policies by promoting a remedy he claims, without evidence, can cure COVID-19, the spokesman said. "We follow guidance from the WHO that says there is currently no medication to cure the virus," he added.

India's online smartphone market reached its highest ever share at 45% in 2020 amid the COVID-19 pandemic, according to Counterpoint Research. It registered a growth of 7% year-on-year. Flipkart had the highest market share of 48% among online platforms, followed by Amazon at 44% share. Among brands, Xiaomi led with 40% market share, followed by Samsung at 19%.

Actor Ranbir Kapoor has recovered from COVID-19 and is doing well, his paternal uncle, actor Randhir Kapoor, confirmed on Thursday. "Ranbir is absolutely fine now. He is alright. I've met him," he said. On the same day, Riddhima Kapoor Sahni shared a photo with Ranbir sitting by her side while they performed a puja for their late father Rishi Kapoor.

Japan may reportedly halve the number of official travellers to the Tokyo Olympics to around 30,000 amid the COVID-19 pandemic, said reports on Friday. The government aims to cut the number of visitors who are not directly related to the competitions, reports added. Around 90,000 people are expected from overseas, including about 30,000 athletes, coaches and team members.

The Delhi Metro Rail Corporation (DMRC) has said that services on all Metro lines in the national capital will be unavailable till 2.30 pm on the occasion of Holi on March 29. This also applies to Rapid Metro/ Airport Express Line, DMRC said. Public celebrations and gatherings were earlier banned in Delhi amid a rise in COVID-19 cases.

Six states- Maharashtra, Punjab, Chhattisgarh, Karnataka, Gujarat and Madhya Pradesh have accounted for nearly 80% of the new COVID-19 cases reported in the last 24 hours. As per the Health Ministry, 62,258 new cases have been reported in the last 24 hours taking the active caseload to 4,52,647. The total vaccination coverage in the country has crossed 5.8 crore.

Union Health Ministry in its daily vaccination update on Friday said the cumulative number of COVID-19 vaccine doses administered in the country has crossed the 5.5 crore-mark with 23,58,731 inoculations in the last 24 hours. "A total of 5,55,04,440 vaccine doses have been given, as per the provisional report till 7 am today," the Health Ministry said on Friday.

Nepal has removed quarantine requirements for foreign tourists who have received both doses of coronavirus vaccine. However, they'll have to submit a negative COVID-19 test within 72 hours of travel, along with documents proving administration of both doses of vaccine, it said. Visitors will also have to take a COVID-19 test at their own cost after they arrive in Nepal.

Canada has said that US drugmaker Moderna has delayed the shipment of 5,90,400 doses of its COVID-19 vaccine due to arrive this weekend. The company informed Canadian officials that the delay was due to a "backlog in its quality assurance process", Public Services and Procurement Minister Anita Anand said. The doses will be shipped by Thursday next week, she added.

Mexico has become the third country after the US and Brazil to report over two lakh deaths from coronavirus, according to the Mexican Health Ministry's data. The total COVID-19 deaths in Mexico stood at 2,00,211. The country's capital Mexico City is among the hardest coronavirus-hit cities in the world with over 38,000 COVID-19 deaths.

Bangladesh Foreign Minister AK Abdul Momen said that focus of PM Narendra Modi's visit to the country is "celebration". "Bangladesh PM Sheikh Hasina and PM Modi reached such height of diplomatic maturity that we've been resolving our critical issues through dialogue and discussion," he added. "Happy my first foreign visit after COVID-19 onset will be to...Bangladesh," PM Modi had said.

The German Health Ministry said that the people flying into the country will be required to test negative for COVID-19 within 48 hours of departure. Earlier, Germany had required negative COVID-19 tests from travellers coming from regions it deemed as high-risk areas in the pandemic. The new measure will come into effect from Sunday and will last until May 12.

Actor Paresh Rawal has tested positive for coronavirus, days after he received the first dose of the vaccine. The 65-year-old actor shared the news on Friday and tweeted, "All those that have come in contact with me in the last 10 days are requested to please get themselves tested." Several people wished Paresh a speedy recovery from the virus.

After Krispy Kreme announced free doughnuts for everyone who has received the COVID-19 vaccine, the co-owner of a local gym in New Jersey tweeted offering free membership to those that decide not to get it. He said, "We believe in health - the real way - exercise, good diet, plenty of Vitamin D, Zinc, and an environment to destress."

Bangladesh Foreign Minister AK Abdul Momen on Friday praised PM Narendra Modi over the timely delivery of the coronavirus vaccine to Bangladesh. He said, "PM Modi assured...if India develops a vaccine, Bangladesh will get it...He kept his word and...won...hearts and minds of people." PM Modi is gifting 1.2 million vaccines to Bangladesh as a gesture of goodwill, Momen added.

BJP leader Devendra Fadnavis said that the corrupt practices in BMC could have led to the fire incident at the Mumbai hospital. "Why no fire audit was performed before the COVID-19 care centre was set up there?" Fadnavis questioned. The death toll in the fire at Sunrise Hospital in Dreams Mall in Mumbai's Bhandup West has risen to nine.

External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar said that 200,000 doses of COVID-19 vaccines, announced as a gift by India, will be sent to the UN peacekeepers on March 27. Jaishankar had offered 200,000 vaccine doses while speaking at the United Nations Security Council (UNSC) meeting. UN Secretary-General Antonio Guterres had said that he is "extremely grateful" to India.

About 45% of CEOs do not expect business to return to 'normal' till 2022, while 31% believe it will happen later this year, as per a KPMG report that surveyed 500 global executives. More than half said they are concerned about employees' access to a COVID-19 vaccine, while 94% of Indian CEOs will ask employees to return to work post-vaccination.

Pakistan is planning to purchase 70 lakh doses of coronavirus vaccines from China by April-end, Planning Minister Asad Umar said. Umar added that the country had already purchased 10 lakh doses from Sinopharm and 60,000 doses of CanSino vaccines from China. Earlier, Pakistan had said it wouldn't buy vaccines and aims to tackle COVID-19 through herd immunity and donated vaccines.

Actor Dharmendra recently underwent COVID-19 test after three people from his household staff tested positive for the virus. The 85-year-old actor, while talking to ETimes, confirmed that he has tested negative. "God has been kind to me...I really don't know what's happening with this second COVID wave which is...crazy. The situation has to quickly come under control," he added.

The government has extended the validity of motor vehicle documents like driving licence and registration certificate till June 30, in view of COVID-19. An advisory to states from the Ministry of Road Transport and Highways said that the validity of all documents, which had expired since February 1, 2020, or would expire by March 31, 2021, has been extended.

Milind Soman shared a health update after testing COVID-19 positive. "Quarantine. Day 4. Difficult to say how I got infected...I had a negative report on...18th March, was working from home...and only went out to run every day, but started feeling...low energy on 23rd," he wrote. "Today when I woke up, pulse was 61, O2 was 99 and...temperature 97.6," Milind added.

The Black Swan' author Nassim Nicholas Taleb while talking about COVID-19 induced lockdowns in the world said that India did what a wise government would do. In absence of information, you don't take risk and that's what India did, Taleb remarked. The economist also predicted that the changes in consumer habits during the ongoing pandemic are going to be permanent.

Delhi recorded 4,758 COVID-19 cases in the last four days which is notably more than the number of cases in the entire month of February. The total number of coronavirus cases reported in Delhi in February stood at 4,193. Delhi on Thursday reported 1,515 new COVID-19 cases which is the highest one-day increase in the past three months.

Maharashtra on Friday recorded 36,902 new coronavirus cases, making it the biggest daily surge in cases so far. Meanwhile, Mumbai also crossed its earlier daily COVID-19 case peak with 5,513 new cases in the last 24 hours. As many as 112 more COVID-19 deaths were recorded in Maharashtra and the case fatality rate in the state stood at 2.04%.

Talking about dealing with coronavirus, Manoj Bajpayee said, "It's something I wouldn't want anyone to go through." He added that "it's not only painful, but also annoying and bothersome". "Worst thing is its unpredictability...You never know what kind of pain awaits you next while you're infected...It's better to be cautious...than to go through what I'm going through," said Manoj.

Thailand plans to allow tourists who've been vaccinated against COVID-19 to visit Phuket island without quarantining on arrival. The government's Center for Economic Situation Administration, chaired by PM Prayut Chan-o-cha, has already approved the plan, which is set to begin on July 1. However, it still needs the approval of Phuket's Governor and the Center for COVID-19 Situation Administration.

The US said that it'll give nearly ?109 crore to Palestinian communities in the West Bank and Gaza Strip to help fight the COVID-19 pandemic. "This urgent...aid is one piece of our renewed commitment to...Palestinian people," US Ambassador to the UN Linda Thomas-Greenfield said. "This aid...will help...bring more stability and security to both Israelis and Palestinians alike," she added.

Brazil has reported a record 1,00,158 coronavirus cases in the past 24 hours on Thursday, its Health Ministry said. The country's total number of coronavirus cases rose to over 1.23 crore, the second-highest total globally. This comes as Brazil's President Jair Bolsonaro continues to face growing criticism from critics and senior lawmakers for his handling of the pandemic, Reuters reported.

Colombian President Ivn Duque said the US should help countries in the Western Hemisphere that haven't received coronavirus vaccines yet to acquire them. America is a leader in vaccine production and helping with supplies could provide it with an important diplomatic tool, he added. Some countries have bought up to six times of vaccines than what's needed, he further said.

Suchismita Routray, a Bollywood camera assistant, has said she has been out of work since last year's coronavirus lockdown. She's currently earning a livelihood by selling momos in her hometown in Odisha's Cuttack. "I didn't have...money to return home. Thankfully Amitabh Bachchan and Salman Khan funded our entire crew to return to their respective hometowns," the 22-year-old told India Today.

Fashion designer Vikram Phadnis has tested positive for coronavirus. He took to Instagram Stories on Friday to share the news. He also informed that he has isolated himself at home and is "taking every precaution". "I would request those who came in contact with me to get themselves tested at the earliest," Vikram further said.

Chhattisgarh government on Thursday announced the fine for not wearing masks at public places has been increased from ?100 to ?500 in the state. The state health and family welfare department issued the order to contain the spread of coronavirus in the state. Chhattisgarh on Thursday recorded 2,419 new coronavirus cases, its highest single-day spike in the past four months.

Maharashtra Deputy CM Ajit Pawar on Thursday said that he will hold a meeting with representatives and officials in Pune on Friday to review the city's COVID-19 situation, and decide on additional lockdown-like restrictions. "We all know that cases are continuously rising in Pune. However, there's difference of opinion among public representatives on complete lockdown," he further said.

Travel time for passengers may rise as Delhi Metro Rail Corporation (DMRC) on Thursday announced that it'll intensify its drive to ensure COVID-19 appropriate behaviour. "Passengers are advised to...allow for additional time of 20-30 minutes for their commute," DMRC's Anuj Dayal said. Earlier, the Delhi government declared cinema halls, metros, malls and religious places as 'super spreader' areas.

International Monetary Fund (IMF) has said that the Indian economy is on the path of gradual recovery from the COVID-19 related economic stress. However, IMF?s spokesperson Gerry Rice said that the recent emergence of the variants and localised lockdowns could pose risks to a sustained recovery. RBI governor Shaktikanta Das has also expressed concern over the resurgence of COVID infections.

Maharashtra government on Friday announced a night curfew from Sunday, March 28 onwards, in view of rise in cases of coronavirus there. Malls in the state have been ordered to stay closed between 8 pm and 7 am. This came after CM Uddhav Thackeray held a meeting with District Collectors, Divisional Commissioners and other officials today.

India recorded 59,118 new COVID-19 cases in the last 24 hours, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. This is India's biggest one-day spike in COVID-19 cases since mid-October. Meanwhile, 257 deaths have been recorded in the last 24 hours, taking the death toll to 1,60,949. Out of the total cases, 4,21,066 cases are active.

Tamil Nadu Health Minister C Vijayabaskar on Friday said that a second lockdown is not on the cards. Vijayabaskar, who is AIADMK's candidate from the Viralimalai constituency for the upcoming Assembly elections said that the government hopes for better public cooperation. On Thursday, the state recorded 1,779 new COVID-19 cases including 664 cases from Chennai.

Ahead of embarking on a two-day Bangladesh visit today, PM Narendra Modi on Thursday tweeted that India is committed to "further deepen and diversify" its partnership with Bangladesh. In his departure statement, he said, "I'm happy that my first foreign visit after COVID-19 onset will be to our friendly...country, with which India shares deep cultural, linguistic and people-to-people ties."

Referring to people who are not obeying COVID-19 safety norms during air travel, Union Civil Aviation Minister Hardeep Singh Puri said "there are few people who are being careless". Puri said that authorities have started putting such people on the no-fly list. Puri added that "air travel is much safer than surface route travels."

Speaking about the COVID-19 pandemic, Microsoft Co-founder Bill Gates in an interview with Gazeta Wyborcza and TVN24 said, "By the end of 2022 we should be basically completely back to normal." The pandemic is an "incredible tragedy", Gates added. The Bill and Melinda Gates Foundation has contributed at least $1.75 billion to the global response to the COVID-19 pandemic.

Brazil on Thursday became the second country after the US to report over three lakh COVID-19 deaths. The country reported 2,009 fatalities on Wednesday, bringing the total COVID-19 death toll in Brazil to 3,00,685, the Health Ministry said. Brazil reportedly added 1 lakh coronavirus-deaths to its tally in only 75 days. US is the worst COVID-19-hit country with 5,45,237 fatalities.

India has reported more than 50,000 new coronavirus cases in a day for the first time in 2021. The country reported 53,476 new COVID-19 cases and 251 deaths in the last 24 hours, taking the total number of cases to 1,17,87,534 and the death toll to 1,60,692. The active COVID-19 cases in the country stand at 3,95,192.

Karnataka has received four lakh doses of COVID-19 vaccine on Wednesday, said state Health Minister K Sudhakar. "The state government has taken measures to ensure there is no shortage of doses. Another tranche of 12 lakh doses is expected to arrive by this week," he added. According to the Health Ministry, 30,29,544 doses have been administered so far in Karnataka.

India is likely to delay the deliveries of AstraZeneca COVID-19 vaccine doses to the GAVI/WHO-backed COVAX facility for March and April, said the programme's procurement and distributing partner UNICEF. COVAX participant countries have also been told about lower-than-expected supplies of AstraZeneca doses made in South Korea for March, said UNICEF.

French President Emmanuel Macron said the COVID-19 vaccine rollout in EU is lagging because the European leaders didn't expect the vaccines to be developed so soon and "were wrong to lack ambition". "We didn't shoot for the stars. That should be a lesson for all of us. We were wrong...to lack the madness...to say...It's possible, let's do it," he added.

Data from property consultants ANAROCK showed that housing sales in the top seven Indian cities increased from 45,200 units in the first quarter of 2020 to 58,290 homes for the same period this year, effectively surpassing pre-COVID-19 sales. Pune and Mumbai Metropolitan Region accounted for over half the sales while Bengaluru didn't show any major yearly change in total sales.

Uttar Pradesh Governor Anandiben Patel on Thursday tweeted that she has received the first dose of COVID-19 vaccine. "The vaccine is completely safe. I appeal to the people of the country and the state to get vaccinated," the 79-year-old said. India began inoculating those above 60 years of age from March 1 under the second phase of its vaccination drive.

Out of the 19.17 lakh doses of COVID-19 vaccines supplied to Punjab, only 40.71% have been used so far. A total of 3.50 lakh doses were supplied to armed forces, and of the remaining 15.67 lakh doses, 6.38 lakh doses have been given to beneficiaries. "We still have more than 9 lakh doses...which is sufficient enough," Punjab nodal officer said.

Maharashtra has registered the highest number of COVID-19 vaccine doses administered in the country, crossing the five million-mark, said Dr Pradeep Vyas, Principal Secretary, Health, Maharashtra. The state has also administered the second dose of vaccine to 6,72,128 people, thereby reaching the cumulative vaccination figure of 50,14,774.

The US has has become the first country to report over three crore coronavirus cases, according to Johns Hopkins University tracker. The number of coronavirus-related deaths in US now stands at over 5.45 lakh. According to reports, nearly one-fourth of Americans have received at least one dose of the COVID-19 vaccine, while about 13% of the population is fully vaccinated.

Zydus Cadila has reduced the price of its generic version of Remdesivir by nearly 70% from ?2,800 to ?899 for a 100 mg vial. The drug, sold under the brand name Remdac, is used to treat severe COVID-19 patients. Zydus launched Remdesivir's cheapest generic version in August 2020 after it got a licence from Gilead to manufacture it in India.

Canada's health department continued to back Oxford/AstraZeneca's COVID-19 vaccine even as it updated its label to provide information on very rare reports of blood clots associated with low levels of blood platelets following an immunisation shot. Canada is using Covishield vaccine received from India. Health Canada said it has not received any reports of these blood clots to date.

Karnataka Health Minister Dr K Sudhakar today announced that from April 1, all passengers travelling to Bengaluru will need to show a negative COVID-19 test report before they can enter the city. Earlier, the state government had made it compulsory for passengers from Punjab, Chandigarh, Maharashtra and Kerala to carry a negative report before they could enter Karnataka.

BJP chief JP Nadda on Thursday visited the All India Institute of Medical Sciences (AIIMS) in Delhi and interacted with senior citizens who received the first dose of the COVID-19 vaccine. He said India has proved to be the leader in COVID-19 management under PM Narendra Modi's leadership. "The world's largest vaccination programme is underway in India," Nadda added.

Hundreds of students of Osmania University in Hyderabad and Kakatiya University in Warangal staged a protest against the Telangana government's decision to temporarily close educational institutions due to rising COVID-19 cases in the state. The police detained the students from all the sites and released them later. The students said that the decision will affect their studies and careers.

A report by SBI has stated that India's second coronavirus wave might reach the peak in the second half of April. The wave may last up to 100 days, when counted from February 15, it said. It also claimed that localised lockdowns or restrictions have been ineffective and that mass vaccination is the "only hope" to win against the pandemic.

Loss of income and livelihood are among the top concerns for rural communities during the ongoing COVID-19 pandemic, as per a new study conducted across 10 states including Bihar and Uttar Pradesh. The study conducted by the Indian School of Development Management (ISDM) showed that only 17% could retain their job or primary source of income during the lockdown.

After a huge spike in COVID-19 cases in Mumbai, BMC tweeted, "We can't go backwards Mumbai, we can't drop our guards now." Mumbai reported 5,185 COVID-19 cases on Wednesday, the highest-ever daily spike the city has seen so far. "January saw the least number of new cases in the city since the pandemic- 236. March witnessed the highest," BMC added.

Amid rise in coronavirus cases, Delhi government has initiated random COVID-19 testing across airports, railways and bus stations. Pictures of healthcare workers in PPE kit, collecting swab samples for COVID-19 testing have also surfaced online. Meanwhile, Gautam Buddha Nagar administration in Uttar Pradesh is also conducting random testing at different points of the Delhi-Noida borders.

RBI Governor Shaktikanta Das on Thursday said despite the renewed surge in COVID-19 cases in the country, the chances of there being a lockdown similar to the one that happened last year are unlikely. "We have additional insurances this time to tackle the afflictions," he stated at the India Economic Conclave (IEC) 2021 at Delhi.

Delhi Metro's flying squads issued challans to 318 commuters on Wednesday for not wearing face masks properly and not following social distancing norms, according to the Delhi Metro Rail Corporation (DMRC). "Let us all follow the protocols and politely counsel others to do the same," DMRC tweeted. Delhi reported 1,254 COVID-19 cases on Wednesday, the biggest single-day spike this year.

AstraZeneca has revised down the efficacy figure for its two-dose COVID-19 vaccine following a clinical trial held across the US, Peru and Chile. The company said its vaccine is 76% effective rather than 79% effective at preventing any kind of symptomatic COVID-19. This comes after US health officials expressed concern that AstraZeneca "may've included outdated information" in the efficacy data.

The release date of Saif Ali Khan and Rani Mukerji's 'Bunty Aur Babli 2' has been pushed due to a rise in the number of coronavirus cases across the country, film trade analyst Taran Adarsh tweeted. Yash Raj Films will announce the new release date later, he added. Earlier, the film was scheduled to release in theatres on April 23.

Actor Ranbir Kapoor, who had tested COVID-19 positive few weeks back, has seemingly recovered and was on Thursday seen performing rituals at his late father Rishi Kapoor's 11-month prayer meet. Riddhima Kapoor Sahni took to Instagram to share a picture of her with brother Ranbir from the prayer meet. She captioned it as, "Always watching over us!"

America's 657 billionaires got $1.3 trillion richer during the coronavirus pandemic, a study by Americans for Tax Fairness (ATF) and the Institute for Policy Studies (IPS) showed. From March 2020 to February 2021, eight crore people in the US lost their jobs, it added. Google Co-founders Larry Page and Sergey Brin saw the biggest increase in wealth among American billionaires.

Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) will increase COVID-19 testing to more than 60,000 tests per day in the coming weeks, a statement issued by the civic body read. BMC has also decided to increase beds in Dedicated COVID Health Centres to 21,000 from the present 13,773. As per the statement, the number of daily vaccinations has been increased to one lakh.

Mumbai recorded 5,504 new COVID-19 cases in the last 24 hours, the highest single-day rise in cases Maharashtra's capital has seen since the coronavirus pandemic began. Mumbai's total cases now stand at 3,80,115, while active cases stand at 33,961. With another 14 coronavirus-related deaths in the last 24 hours, Mumbai's coronavirus death toll now stands at 11,620.

Delhi on Thursday reported 1,515 fresh coronavirus cases, making it the highest single-day rise this year. In the last 24 hours, the national capital has recorded 903 recoveries and five deaths, taking the death toll to 10,978, according to the health department data. Delhi has an active caseload of 5,497 and a total of 6,52,742 COVID-19 cases.

R Madhavan has tested positive for coronavirus. The actor took to Twitter on Thursday to share a picture of himself with  '3 Idiots' co-star Aamir Khan, who also contracted coronavirus this week. Madhavan wrote, "Farhan HAS to follow Rancho...BUT - ALL IS WELL...this is one place we don't want Raju in. Thank you for all the love I'm recuperating well."

Pimpri Chinchwad Municipal Corporation (PCMC) will provide financial assistance of ?25 lakh each to the families of its 23 frontline workers who died during COVID-19 pandemic, said Additional Municipal Commissioner Ulhas Jagtap. In addition to this, one member from each bereaved family will be offered jobs in civic services, he added. A decision to provide compensation was taken in July.

Actor Milind Soman, on Thursday, shared that he has tested positive for coronavirus. "Tested positive. #Quarantine," the 55-year-old actor tweeted. "Wishing quickest recovery Milind," a fan wrote while reacting to his tweet. Recently, several Bollywood celebrities, including Aamir Khan, Rohit Suresh Saraf, Kartik Aaryan and R Madhavan, tested positive for the virus.

Ludhiana Commissioner of Police Rakesh Agrawal on Thursday said the coronavirus infection is at its peak in the city and asked people to follow government guidelines and night curfew to avoid tougher measures. "The situation is very dangerous," he added. Agrawal said that due to economic reasons, the government has allowed all businesses to open.

Goldman Sachs has told all but the critical employees at its operation in Bengaluru to return to working from home. "This hasn't come as a surprise given how coronavirus cases have been rising...specifically in the area where the office is located," Reuters quoted an employee as saying. Goldman's Bengaluru office has around 7,000 employees, a majority of its Indian workforce.

The Sri Lankan government has said that it'll purchase 70 lakh doses of Russia's Sputnik V coronavirus vaccine at a cost of $69.65 million. Sri Lanka's drug regulatory body had approved the Sputnik V vaccine for emergency use earlier this month. The country began COVID-19 vaccination in January after receiving 5,00,000 doses of Covishield vaccine as a gift from India.

Reserve Bank of India Governor Shaktikanta Das on Thursday said the revival of economic activity should continue unabated despite the surge in coronavirus cases. Das stated that the central bank's preliminary findings show that predictions made on growth rates would not require a downward revision. The RBI expects India to grow at 10.5% for the fiscal year 2021-22.

German Chancellor Angela Merkel has reversed plans for a coronavirus lockdown over Easter, calling it a "mistake" and asking citizens for "forgiveness". The plans had called for placing the country in a strict lockdown over the Easter holiday,  which would've seen all shops and churches close from April 1-5. The lockdown plans were widely criticised by business leaders and experts.

Actress Shabana Azmi, while talking about her hectic work schedule during the pandemic, said, "We are tested five times a week. It is therapeutic to work...as long as one adheres to the COVID-19 protocols." She stated that she had resumed work in Mumbai in September 2020 and has since then travelled to Budapest and London for shoots.

The Rajasthan government has banned gatherings at public places, markets and religious places for Holi and Shab-e-Barat on March 28 and March 29. The order for restricting gatherings was issued by the Rajasthan Home Department amid a surge in coronavirus cases in the state. Rajasthan reported 669 more coronavirus cases on Wednesday, while another person succumbed to the disease.

After government announced that anyone above 45 irrespective of co-morbidities will be eligible for COVID-19 vaccination from April 1, actress Alia Bhatt's mother Soni Razdan reacted. "When it's really the 16 to 40 age group that's 'socialising' going out to work, bars, nightclubs...(the last 2 without masks mostly) just can't understand why they aren't getting the vaccine first," she tweeted.

The government is working to provide optical fibre connections to 6.5 lakh villages, Minister of Communications and Information Technology Ravi Shankar Prasad said. The Union Minister further said the government liberalised work from home which has become "work from anywhere". He further added that most schools continued because digital education was being encouraged during the COVID-19 lockdown.

BJP leader Devendra Fadnavis has said that the Maharashtra government is not "bothered about the COVID-19 situation in the state". "The way in which cases are increasing here, it has become the epicentre. I don't understand what has this government done to control it? It is time to act and not give lectures," the former Maharashtra CM added.

Swiggy has announced that it will cover COVID-19 vaccination costs for its entire fleet of over 2 lakh delivery partners. "We will also cover the loss of pay when they take the time off to get vaccinated," Swiggy COO Vivek Sundar said. The online food delivery startup said it is also requesting authorities to prioritise vaccination for the delivery partners.

In the wake of rising COVID-19 cases in the capital, the Delhi government has declared cinema halls, metros, malls, and religious places as 'super spreader' areas. Delhi government has asked all district magistrates concerned to increase surveillance in these areas of concern, reported ANI. Delhi recorded 1,101 cases on Tuesday, which was the biggest daily case surge this year.

Maharashtra's capital Mumbai recorded 5,185 new COVID-19 cases in the last 24 hours, the highest-ever daily spike in coronavirus cases the city has seen so far. Mumbai's total case tally now stands at 3,74,611, while the active cases stand at 30,760. The city saw six coronavirus deaths in the last 24 hours, taking the city's COVID-19 death toll to 11,606.

Pune's Serum Institute of India has sought the Centre's nod to supply 50 lakh Covishield COVID-19 vaccines to the UK. "Under the agreement, Serum Institute of India will supply AstraZeneca vaccine to any country where AstraZeneca has commitments," SII wrote to the Centre. SII has assured that India's vaccination programme will not be affected.

Delhi Police on Tuesday caught 730 people violating the COVID-19 pandemic rule to wear a mask in public spaces and fined them ?2,000 each. Another 11 were fined for not adhering to social distancing measures. Delhi Police has increased its enforcement of COVID-19 appropriate behaviour amid rising cases. Delhi on Tuesday reported 1,101 new COVID-19 cases, the highest in 2021.

Investors' wealth fell by over ?3.27 lakh crore on Wednesday after the Sensex plunged 871 points or 1.74% to close at 49,180 amid concerns over the rising COVID-19 cases in the country. The broader Nifty 50 plunged 265.35 or 1.79% to end at 14,549. Mahindra & Mahindra, which declined by 3.97%, lost the most from the BSE benchmark 30-share pack.

Ramesh Taurani, who has produced films like 'Race 3' and 'The Legend of Bhagat Singh', has tested positive for coronavirus. The producer shared the news on Wednesday and wrote, "I've taken my first vaccine dose and hope to recover from this soon." "If you have interacted with me in the past two weeks please do get tested," Ramesh further wrote.

A cargo container ship that's among the largest in the world has turned sideways and blocked all traffic in Egypt's Suez Canal, officials said on Wednesday. The MV Ever Given, a Panama-flagged container ship that carries trade between Asia and Europe, became grounded on Tuesday. The incident threatens to disrupt a global shipping system already strained by the coronavirus pandemic.

Kiara Advani, who was shooting for 'Bhool Bhulaiyaa 2' with Kartik Aaryan, has confirmed to ETimes that she and director Anees Bazmee have tested negative for coronavirus. The shooting of the horror-comedy film came to a halt after Kartik tested positive this week. Reportedly, Tabu was also shooting for the film with Kartik and her reports have not arrived yet.

Amid the surge in COVID-19 cases in Gujarat, the state government said that the festival can be celebrated "traditionally with limited rituals". "Organisers need to be vigilant about strict adherence," it added. "Public celebrations and mass events will not be allowed on Dhuleti day," the state government further said. There are currently over 8,300 active COVID-19 cases in Gujarat.

The Uttarakhand High Court on Wednesday made negative RT-PCR test report compulsory for devotees attending the upcoming Kumbh Mela in Haridwar. This comes after CM Tirath Singh Rawat had announced that no COVID-19 test report will be required from devotees. In the last 24 hours, India has recorded 47,262 fresh coronavirus cases, the highest single-day rise so far this year.

Infosys Co-founder Nandan Nilekani lauded India's efforts to ensure smooth rollout of COVID-19 vaccination, including the development of digital platform CoWIN, which he said was "amazing". He highlighted that his friend in US' Seattle got his vaccination certificate "scribbled" on a piece of paper, while in India, Nilekani got a digitally signed and QR-coded certificate on his phone.

Pfizer on Tuesday said it has started early-stage US trial of an oral coronavirus antiviral therapy that could be prescribed to patients at the first sign of infection. It said the drug, PF-07321332, "has demonstrated potent in vitro antiviral activity" against the virus that causes coronavirus. The drug is a protease inhibitor that prevents the virus from replicating in cells.

Actor Salman Khan on Wednesday received the first dose of COVID-19 vaccine at a Mumbai hospital. The actor informed about it in a tweet and wrote, "Took my first dose of vaccine today." Earlier in the day, Salman was photographed entering Lilavati Hospital in Bandra. Meanwhile, actor Sanjay Dutt took the first dose at BKC vaccine centre on Tuesday.

Union Health Secretary Rajesh Bhushan has said the decision to give COVID-19 vaccine to people aged above 45 from April 1 was taken as 88% deaths due to coronavirus in the country were reported in the age group of 45 years and above. "Therefore, this group is the most vulnerable population group and needs to be protected first," he added.

Shoppers in Beijing are getting discount coupons if they've received COVID-19 vaccinations, as China tries to accelerate its COVID-19 vaccination rate. Beijing's Daxing started giving the coupons worth from 8 to 30 (around ?89-?334) each on Wednesday to people who've got jab's two doses. Over 200 million (around ?220 crore) worth of discounts will reportedly be distributed through the coupons.

As many as 163 students of a private college in Rajahmundry of East Godavari district in Andhra Pradesh were found infected with the coronavirus on Tuesday, authorities said. All infected persons were intermediate students and have been immediately placed under quarantine within the college, an official stated. There were about 400 students in all in the college.

The spike in coronavirus cases in Maharashtra and Punjab is of grave concern, the Health Ministry said. "Maharashtra reported more than 28,000 cases in the last 24 hours and Punjab is reporting a huge number of cases in proportion to its population," Union Health Secretary Rajesh Bhushan said. "Besides them, Gujarat & Madhya Pradesh are of concern too," he added.

As many as 47,262 new coronavirus cases were reported in India in last 24 hours, the biggest one-day spike in 2021. Out of these, 82% cases are from six states- Maharashtra, Punjab, Karnataka, Kerala, Chhattisgarh and Gujarat. Further, 275 deaths were reported in the last 24 hours, also the highest single-day rise in deaths reported due to COVID-19 this year.

Sanjay Dutt was on Tuesday administered the first dose of COVID-19 vaccine in Mumbai. The 61-year-old actor, who recovered from lung cancer last year, shared a picture wherein he can be seen getting vaccinated. "I want to congratulate Dr Dhere and his entire team for doing such a wonderful job! I've so much love & respect for them," he wrote.

Telangana Cinematography Minister Talasani Srinivas Yadav on Wednesday said that the state government is not planning to close theatres in the state. Earlier, the state government announced a temporary closure of schools and colleges to contain COVID-19 cases.  Talasani added that theatres will continue to function as per the Union government's COVID-19 guidelines.

Maharashtra government on Wednesday announced a lockdown in the Beed district from March 26 till April 4 in the wake of rising COVID-19 cases. During the lockdown, all marriage halls, hotels and restaurants will remain shut in the district. Similarly, all schools and colleges will also remain closed during this period. Shops selling grocery, milk and medicines will remain open.

The Pune Municipal Corporation (PMC) said it would keep five COVID-19 vaccination centres open 24 hours for inoculating frontline workers. "Crowding at the vaccination centres...is causing delay for frontline workers to take their jabs," a civic health officer said. As of March 23, 33,310 frontline workers in Pune have received their first dose of the vaccine.

Indian benchmark indices fell most in a month on Wednesday amid concerns over rising COVID-19 cases in the country. The Sensex fell 871 points or 1.74% to close at 49,180 while the broader Nifty 50 plunged 265.35 or 1.79% to end at 14,549. Reliance Industries, ICICI Bank, HDFC Bank, HDFC, and Infosys were among the top losers on Sensex.

Ludo' actor Rohit Suresh Saraf took to Instagram on Wednesday to share that he has tested positive for coronavirus. He informed that he has been in isolation for the last four days with "all the possible symptoms". Rohit also requested his fans and followers to not take the virus lightly and wrote, "Please stay put unless urgent."

A video shows director Farah Khan pulling her mask down to smell mangoes at a roadside stall. She's seen smelling at least three fruits from the cart. Criticising her action amid rising COVID-19 cases, an Instagram user commented, "Smelling mangoes in this...situation. So many must have touched those mangoes." "What's the point of wearing that mask?" another comment read.

Sachin Tendulkar superfan Sudhir Kumar Gautam cheered for India during the first ODI against England from the hills nearby the Maharashtra Cricket Association Stadium in Pune. His oversized India flag could be seen fluttering from the stadium. This comes as spectators are not allowed to watch the match from the stadium amid the coronavirus pandemic.

Congress MP and Telangana Pradesh Congress Committee working president Revanth Reddy has tested positive for COVID-19. "I have isolated myself on doctor's advice," he tweeted. "Whoever has been in contact from the past few days, please take necessary precautions," Reddy wrote. Among politicians, Tirath Singh Rawat, Om Birla, Aaditya Thackeray, among others recently tested positive for COVID-19.

Haryana government on Wednesday announced that public celebration of the Holi festival will not be permitted in the state amid rising coronavirus cases. This comes after the Union Additional Health Secretary wrote to states, saying that it's "strongly advised" that the states impose local restrictions in view of upcoming festivals such as Holi, Shab-e-Barat, Bihu, Easter and Eid-ul-Fitr.

As many as 275 new COVID-19 deaths were reported in India in the last 24 hours, which is the highest one-day jump in 2021. Out of these, 83.27% deaths were recorded in six states, which are Maharashtra, Punjab, Chhattisgarh, Kerala, Tamil Nadu and Karnataka. Maharashtra saw maximum casualties at 132.

WHO Director-General Tedros Adhanom Ghebreyesus said the recent increase in coronavirus cases and deaths represent "truly worrying trends". These trends could put the world back at "square one", he added. "As long as the virus continues to circulate...people will continue to die, trade and travel will continue to be disrupted and the economic recovery will be further delayed," Tedros said.

Parbhani district in Maharashtra's Marathwada region will be placed under lockdown from 7 pm on Wednesday to March 31 in view of the surge in COVID-19 cases. District Collector Deepak Muglikar said that the earlier measures such as night curfew didn't prove effective as the infection graph of new cases continued to show an upward trend.

A six-week decline in global COVID-19 deaths has stalled, with cases continuing to rise for the fourth consecutive week, the WHO reported on Tuesday. WHO data showed nearly 3.3 million new coronavirus cases globally and 60,000 additional deaths in the week leading up to March 21. Brazil, the US, India, and France reportedly had the highest number of new cases.

NITI Aayog CEO Amitabh Kant said that industrial activities in India are expected to gain momentum from increase in government capital expenditure, accelerated COVID-19 vaccination drive. "Fiscal, financial...reforms were adopted which promoted a rapid V-shaped recovery," he further said. India is the only country to adopt structural reforms to expand supply in medium and long term, he added.

Punjab on Wednesday reported 39 more fatalities due to COVID-19 and 2,634 fresh cases, bringing the toll to 6,474 and the infection count to 2,20,276, according to a medical bulletin. The number of active cases increased from 19,403 on Tuesday to 20,522 on Wednesday. A total of 1,455 coronavirus patients were discharged after recovering from the infection, the bulletin stated.

Delhi reported 1,254 fresh COVID-19 cases in the last 24 hours, the biggest single-day spike this year, according to the health department data. The city's COVID-19 caseload has risen to 6,51,227, of which 4,890 cases are active. Six more people succumbed to the disease in the last 24 hours, taking the death toll to 10,973.

Actor Aamir Khan has tested positive for coronavirus. "He is at home in self quarantine, following all the protocols and he's doing fine. All those who came in contact with him in the recent past should get themselves tested as a precautionary measure," the actor's spokesperson said. Aamir had recently quit social media.

Hong Kong has temporarily suspended the use of Pfizer-BioNTech's COVID-19 vaccine after its Chinese distributor informed the city that one batch had defective bottle lids. The suspension is immediate and is being investigated by distributor Fosun Pharma and BioNTech, the Hong Kong government said. BioNTech and Fosun Pharma haven't found any reason to believe the product is unsafe, it added.

On Wednesday, BSE Sensex was down by over 300 points and trading at below 49,800 while Nifty was around 14,700. Asian Paints, Dr. Reddy's and Sun Pharma were trading in green while ONGC and State Bank of India were the top drags. The stock market volatility index was above 21 levels amidst a resurgence of COVID-19 cases in the country.

Madhya Pradesh government has imposed Sunday lockdown in Khargone, Betul, Chhindwara and Ratlam after a surge in coronavirus cases, Medical Education Minister Vishvas Kailash Sarang said on Wednesday. Earlier this month, the government had imposed Sunday lockdown in Bhopal, Indore and Jabalpur. Schools and colleges will remain closed in these seven cities till March 31, Sarang added.

India has reported 47,262 new COVID-19 cases and 275 deaths in the last 24 hours, as per the Union Health Ministry. This is the most number of cases and deaths reported due to COVID-19 in a day this year. The total active COVID-19 cases in the country stand at 3,68,457, while the death toll has gone up to 1,60,441.

The WHO said the weekly global coronavirus-related deaths are rising again after about six weeks of decline, adding it's a "worrying sign".  The rise is followed by an increase in the active cases for the fifth straight week, Maria Kerkhove, technical lead on COVID-19 at UN health agency said. "In the last week, cases have increased by 8%," she added.
