As the Union Cabinet allowed vaccination for everyone above the age of 45 years starting from April 1, Maharashtra cabinet minister Aaditya Thackeray said CM Uddhav Thackeray had made this request at the March 17 PM-CM meeting. He tweeted, "Such coordination is welcome and indeed healthy for the nation." Aaditya Thackeray on Saturday said he has tested positive for COVID-19.

Facebook has announced that it will be hosting its annual developer conference 'F8' as a one-day event, virtually. The event is being called 'F8 Refresh' this year and will be live-streamed on the 'Facebook for Developers' page. Last year, the event was cancelled over coronavirus concerns. However, Facebook CEO Mark Zuckerberg will not be speaking at the event this year.

The Mexican government on Tuesday thanked India for providing 8,70,000 COVID-19 vaccines. "I would like to thank the Government of India. And why do I say this? India has 1,300 million inhabitants and requires vaccines. However, the government gave its consent for 8,70,000 to be sent to Mexico...and we'll never forget that," Marcelo Ebrard Casaubon, Mexico's Foreign Secretary said.

With nearly 4.85 crore people vaccinated against COVID-19 in the country, Union Health Minister Harsh Vardhan on Tuesday announced that India is conducting vaccinations at the fastest rate. Addressing the Lok Sabha, he said, ?Vaccine doses administered in India in a single day amount to 30-40% of the doses given across the world during the same time period.?

German Chancellor Angela Merkel has said that the country will enter a strict shutdown for five days over Easter amid rising cases. "We are in a new pandemic due to the spread of coronavirus variants," Merkel added as she warned that Germany needed to "break the exponential growth of the third wave".

The US' Data and Safety Monitoring Board said that results from a US trial of AstraZeneca's COVID-19 vaccine may have used "outdated information". It stated that it was concerned that AstraZeneca may have provided an incomplete view of the efficacy data. AstraZeneca reported that its vaccine provided strong protection among adults of all ages in its study in US.

Union Health Minister Harsh Vardhan on Tuesday said 4.85 crore people in the country have received COVID-19 vaccines so far. While speaking in the Rajya Sabha, he added that 32,53,095 people were vaccinated in the last 24 hours. "We have a national expert group on vaccine administration which guides us on vaccination," Vardhan told the House.

Karnataka Health Minister K Sudhakar said there is no shortage of COVID-19 vaccines in the state. Karnataka will receive 12.5 lakh doses of vaccine from the Centre by next week, he said, adding that additional 4 lakh doses will be dispatched through flight before that. "The Centre has assured us there'll be no shortage of supply of vaccine," Sudhakar added.

The government has said that coronavirus vaccination centres and people should make sure that the first dose vaccination was done with the same vaccine as is being offered at the time of second dose. It asked to ensure the first dose was administered over 28 days ago. Beneficiaries are advised to carry the vaccine certificate issued after the first dose.

Russia has said that it'll "deliberately" not reveal the name of the vaccine that President Vladimir Putin is due to take later on Tuesday. All three Russian-made vaccines approved in the country "are absolutely reliable and effective," spokesman Dmitry Peskov added. He further said that Putin will not get vaccinated on camera as "he's never been a fan of that".

Punjab CM Captain Amarinder Singh has urged the Centre to widen its COVID-19 vaccination drive to include people younger than 60 years of age. He stated that 81% of the latest 401 samples sent by Punjab for genome sequencing were positive for the new UK COVID-19 variant. The variant has been found to infect younger population more, Singh pointed out.

China's Sinovac has said that its coronavirus vaccine is safe for children aged 3-17, based on preliminary data. Early and mid-stage clinical trials with over 550 participants showed the vaccine would induce an immune response, Gang Zeng, the Medical Director at Sinovac, said. More than 7 crore shots of Sinovac's vaccine have been reportedly administered worldwide, including in China.

The Delhi Disaster Management Authority (DDMA) has banned public celebrations for upcoming festivals such as Holi and Navratri, as well as gatherings in general, amid a spike in COVID-19 cases in the UT. Visitors to Delhi coming from states where COVID-19 cases are increasing will be subjected to random RT-PCR tests at railways stations, airport, inter-state bus terminals etc.

BJP Lok Sabha MP Girish Bapat and other party MLAs from Pune wrote to PM Narendra Modi, seeking his intervention in increasing the COVID-19 vaccine quota for Pune district. The letter also put forth a proposition to open up the vaccination process for people above the age of 30 to help contain the spread of the infection in the city.

Delhi has recorded 1,101 coronavirus cases in the last 24 hours, making it the biggest daily case surge of the Union Territory this year. The city's cumulative COVID-19 caseload has now increased to 6,49,973. As many as four more COVID-19 deaths were recorded in Delhi in the last 24 hours, taking the city's total death toll to 10,967.

South Korea's President Moon Jae-in received his first dose of Oxford-AstraZeneca vaccine ahead of his visit to Britain for a G7 summit in June. Moon's wife, Kim Jung-sook, and nine aides who'll accompany him on the trip were also vaccinated, his office said. UK PM Boris Johnson has invited South Korea, India and Australia to attend the summit as guests.

Coronavirus is surging "dangerously" across Brazil and Brazilians need to take measures to prevent its spread, Carissa Etienne, the WHO's regional director for the Americas, said. "Unfortunately, the dire situation in Brazil is also affecting neighbouring countries," she added. Regions of Venezuela, Peru and Bolivia bordering Brazil have reported a spike in COVID-19 cases, she further said.

Actor Manoj Bajpayee, who is currently recovering from COVID-19, said that it's frustrating to see people being "careless, reckless and casual" about the pandemic. He added that the actors are the most vulnerable to the virus as they can't wear a mask and everyone around them should behave responsibly. Manoj stated that he's still feeling very weak physically.

Eros International, the production house of Rana Daggubati's 'Haathi Mere Saathi', on Tuesday announced that the film's release in Hindi markets has been pushed due to the rise in coronavirus cases. However, its Telugu and Tamil versions, titled 'Aranya' and 'Kaadan', will release in South markets on March 26. The film also stars Pulkit Samrat, Shriya Pilgaonkar and Zoya Hussain.

Israelis on Tuesday began voting in the fourth parliamentary election in the past two years, including COVID-19 patients who cast their votes from hospitals. "It would be better if we didn't have to vote...four times in two years...It's a little bit tiring," a voter said. A coalition government led by PM Benjamin Netanyahu and his rival had collapsed in December.

The doubling time of COVID-19 cases in India has decreased from 504.4 days on March 1 to 202.3 days on March 23, the Union Health Ministry has said. India's active COVID-19 caseload is rising after touching its lowest mark in mid-February, it said, adding that it stands at 3.45 lakh cases as of today.

There are a total of 795 cases of the UK, South Africa and Brazil variants of coronavirus in India, the Union Health Ministry said on Tuesday. Last week (March 18), the government had put the total number of these foreign mutant coronavirus cases at 400. The country has recorded 40,715 new COVID-19 cases in the last 24 hours.

Filmmaker Anees Bazmee, who was working with Kartik Aaryan on 'Bhool Bhulaiyaa 2', has said he's shocked that Kartik tested positive for coronavirus "as he would always take so many precautions". He added that everyone on the sets was working very carefully and following all the guidelines. "We'll start filming for Bhool Bhulaiyaa 2 once Kartik completely recovers," said Anees.

Government has issued guidelines for effective control of COVID-19 which will be effective from April 1, 2021, and remain in force up to April 30, 2021. The guidelines mandate State/ UT governments to strictly enforce the Test-Track-Treat protocol in all parts of the country. "There shall be no restriction on inter-State and intra-State movement of persons and goods," said government.

Nearly 400 illegal migrants tested COVID-19 positive and are being transferred to a field hospital in Bangkok, Thailand, on Tuesday. Immigration Bureau Commissioner Police Lieutenant General Sompong Chingduong said 393 migrants had contracted COVID-19 in the bureau's Bang Khen detention facility. A police's Welfare Division stadium is converted into a field hospital to treat the COVID-19 patients.

Goa CM Pramod Sawant said the state government will not make it mandatory for visitors to carry COVID-19 negative reports on their arrival at the airport. "For now there is no decision to be taken (regarding testing on arrival)," Sawant added. Goa Health Minister Vishwajit Rane had earlier said that the state will make COVID-19 negative certificates mandatory for visitors.

States and Union Territories in the country can impose local restrictions at district or sub-district levels based on their assessment of the COVID-19 situation, the Centre said in its new guidelines on Tuesday. However, there should be no restrictions on inter-state or intra-state movement of persons or goods, the Centre added. The guidelines will come into effect from April 1.

All educational institutions, including schools and colleges, in Telangana have been ordered to shut down until further orders amid a spike in COVID-19 cases. The order comes into effect from March 24 onward and classes can be held online till restrictions are lifted. Medical colleges will, however, remain open in the state.

The Governor of Brazil's Sao Paulo state, Joao Doria, called the country's President Jair Bolsonaro a "psychopathic leader" who mishandled the coronavirus pandemic. Much of the deaths from COVID-19 in Brazil could have been avoided if Bolsonaro "acted with the responsibility that his position gives him", he added. Brazil has reported second-highest number of coronavirus deaths at over 2.9 lakh.

Around 40 employees have tested positive for coronavirus at an information technology company in Chennai. Officials said that initially four cases were identified and 36 more were found positive after testing 364 samples. Tamil Nadu Health Secretary J Radhakrishnan called the spread a chain of clusters as the employees in the building had moved to other branches of the company.

Filmmaker Sanjay Leela Bhansali, who reportedly contracted coronavirus earlier this month, has tested negative for COVID-19 following treatment, Bollywood Hungama reported. Bhansali will reportedly start shooting for his upcoming Alia Bhatt-starrer film 'Gangubai Kathiawadi' after completing his quarantine period. He has reportedly refused to meet his mother until the period of quarantine is over.

Tamil Nadu Health Secretary J Radhakrishnan on Monday visited a bus station in Chennai, inspected fever camps and also urged people to follow COVID-19-appropriate behaviour. He also warned of strict action against those who violate COVID-19 protocols at election rallies, "We are reaching 1,500 cases/day but we have also ramped up RT-PCR tests from 50,000-75,000," Radhakrishnan told ANI.

The shooting of Kartik Aaryan starrer upcoming film 'Bhool Bhulaiyaa 2' has been reportedly put on hold after the actor tested positive for COVID-19. Kartik announced the diagnosis on social media on Monday and wrote, "Positive ho gaya. Dua karo [I am positive. Pray for me]." In addition to Kartik, the film will also star Kiara Advani and Tabu.

India reported a spike of 40,715 COVID-19 cases and 199 deaths in the last 24 hours, according to the Union Health Ministry. With this latest surge, the total number of COVID-19 cases in the country rose to 1,16,86,796 while the death toll climbed to 1,60,166. Around 14 states/UTs didn't report any COVID-19 related deaths till 8:00 am on Tuesday.

Maharashtra Home Minister Anil Deshmukh released a video, claiming false reports are doing rounds in media after former Mumbai Police Commissioner Param Bir Singh accused him of corruption. Deshmukh said he was hospitalised from February 5 to 15 due to COVID-19, adding, he came to Mumbai via private plane on February 15 and stepped out of home on February 28.

A case has been registered against Maharashtra BJP chief Chandrakant Patil and more than 50 party workers for violating COVID-19 norms during a protest in Pune demanding state Home Minister Anil Deshmukh's resignation. BJP organised the protest against Deshmukh after former Mumbai Police chief Param Bir Singh wrote to CM Uddhav Thackeray levelling allegations of corruption against Deshmukh.

The Andhra Pradesh government on Monday announced that schools in the state will be open only for a half-day from April 1 due to the rising COVID-19 cases and summer heat. Students of classes one to 10 will have classes from 7:45 am to 12:30 pm. School administration have also been asked to conduct regular COVID-19 tests among students.

The active COVID-19 caseload in UP's Gautam Buddha Nagar has more than doubled in the past one month. The active cases in the district on Monday reached 130 and notably, on February 22, the number stood at 55. A week ago, there were 73 active COVID-19 cases in the district. Noida reported 29 new COVID-19 cases on Monday.

The COVID-19 pandemic-induced shocks, which led to a contraction in GDP, will delay India's target of becoming the third-largest economy by three years to 2031-32 now, according to Bank of America (BofA) Securities. The government had set a goal of becoming a $5-trillion economy by 2030. Currently, India is the fifth-largest economy in the world behind Germany.

Seven people tested COVID-19 positive in Mumbai's Senapati Bapat Marg outside Dadar Railway Station on Monday. This came after Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) conducted Rapid Antigen tests on 68 random persons, including hawkers and citizens found without masks outside the station. Officials said that those tested positive were immediately shifted to nearby quarantine facilities.

The government today announced that anyone above the age of 45 irrespective of co-morbidities will be eligible for COVID-19 vaccination from April 1. The announcement was made during a Cabinet briefing by Union Minister Prakash Javadekar. "We request that all eligible should immediately register and get vaccinated," the minister added.

Haryana Health Department administered vaccine doses to 2,48,312 beneficiaries on Monday, on its Mega Vaccination Day against COVID-19. The vaccination centres across the state witnessed an overwhelming response and most of the beneficiaries were above 60 years of age or between 45 years to 60 years with co-morbidities, said Additional Chief Secretary of Health Rajeev Arora.

The Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) has placed a demand of 10 lakh doses of Covaxin to fasten the vaccination drive in the city. "As per the preliminary instruction, we will get the consignment this week," said a BMC officer. Amid rising COVID-19 cases, BMC commissioner Iqbal Chahal has set a target to vaccinate 45 lakh people in next 45 days.

Goa Health Minister Vishwajit Rane has said that soon it would be mandatory for visitors in Goa to carry COVID-19 negative certificates or get themselves tested on arrival at airport. "We'll put this proposal before the Chief Minister," Rane added. He also said fresh SOPs would be notified to reduce crowding in public places, including restaurants, weddings and other events.

Fines of nearly ?5 lakh (?5,000) will be handed to people travelling abroad from England without good reason from next week under the new coronavirus regulations. The penalty is included in legislation that will be voted on by the country's parliament on Thursday. Currently, foreign holidays are banned in the UK under the 'Stay at Home' legislation.

Amid a surge in COVID-19 cases, all schools up to Class 8 in Uttar Pradesh will remain closed from March 24 till March 31. All other educational institutions where exams are not underway will remain closed from March 25 to March 31. The decision was taken during a high-level meeting chaired by Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath to combat COVID-19.

Citigroup's CEO Jane Fraser banned internal video calls on Fridays and said the final day of the working week shall be known as 'Zoom-Free Fridays', according to Bloomberg. She also encouraged vacations in order to combat the workplace malaise brought by the coronavirus pandemic. Fraser also designated May 28 as a firmwide holiday to be known as "Citi Reset Day."

Amid rising COVID-19 cases and complaints regarding violation of guidelines, the Pimpri-Chinchwad Municipal Corporation (PCMC) has decided to seal shops and offices which are found flouting the norms. "There is a need to take strong action against violators which will help in bringing the situation under control," Municipal Commissioner Rajesh Patil told his officials.

The Madras High Court has directed the Election Commission (EC) to advise political parties to follow COVID-19 safety protocols strictly during campaign rallies. The court, however, declined to prohibit parties from campaigning for the Assembly elections in Tamil Nadu over rising COVID-19 cases. The court remarked that it is not possible to interfere with the election process at this juncture.

The first tweet by former US President Donald Trump, referring to COVID-19 as "Chinese virus", led to a rise in anti-Asian content on Twitter, a study by the University of California, San Francisco found. While comparing the week before and after the tweet, there was a significant increase in anti-Asian hashtags associated with #chinesevirus compared with #covid19, the study added.

Brokerage firm Nomura has said that the normalisation of economic activity in the country is likely to get affected as the COVID-19 pandemic's 'second wave' is now spreading to states outside Maharashtra. The brokerage, however, said that it expects the impact to be "more transitory and muted" as businesses have adapted to the new normal.

Banaras Hindu University (BHU) in UP has suspended offline classes till further notice amid rising number of COVID-19 cases, according to an official statement. "All classes will be held in the online mode," the statement added. The decision was made yesterday after review meeting, chaired by Vice-Chancellor Rakesh Bhatnagar. The situation will be reviewed again in first week of April.

Russian President Vladimir Putin on Monday said that he will get his coronavirus vaccine shot "tomorrow". However, Putin made the statement without specifying which vaccine out of three approved for use in Russia he will take. Calling the EU's remarks on Russia's Sputnik V vaccine "strange", the 68-year-old said, "We are not imposing anything on anyone."

Recalling the time when he tested positive for COVID-19 in Siberia while shooting for a web show, actor Karan Singh Grover said that it was harder for his wife, actress Bipasha Basu. He added, "I'm clingy...and I don't like to stay away from Bipasha." "It was the longest we have stayed apart in our marriage," Karan said.

NCP supremo Sharad Pawar has said Maharashtra Home Minister Anil Deshmukh was hospitalised from February 5 to 15 due to COVID-19 and thereafter he was under quarantine till February 27 therefore former Mumbai Police Commissioner Param Bir Singh's allegations are "baseless". However, BJP IT cell head Amit Malviya tweeted a video of Deshmukh holding a press conference on February 15.

AIMIM leader Asaduddin Owaisi on Monday received the first dose of the COVID-19 vaccine at a Hyderabad hospital. "Vaccination not only helps protect oneself from COVID-19 but also reduces the risk for all. I urge everyone eligible to schedule an appointment at the earliest and get themselves vaccinated," Owaisi tweeted. The AIMIM leader received the Covishield vaccine dose.

Russian Direct Investment Fund on Monday said that it has partnered with Virchow Biotech, a part of Hyderabad-based Virchow Group, to produce up to 20 crore doses of Sputnik V COVID-19 vaccine a year. Earlier, Indian pharmaceutical firms Gland Pharma, Stelis Biopharma and Hetero struck similar deals to supply the vaccine. Sputnik V is registered in 54 countries globally.

Actress Taapsee Pannu said that shooting amid COVID-19 felt like a covert mission. She added, "There would be times when everyone around me [would be] in masks, and it'd dawn on me that I was missing an important gear." Speaking about adapting to the new normal, Taapsee said, "Fresh air, green surroundings were...a welcome change...We all adapted to...new rules."

AstraZeneca on Monday said its COVID-19 vaccine has a 79% efficacy rate at preventing symptomatic illness and is 100% effective in stopping severe disease and hospitalisation, based on a US trial including more than 32,000 participants. It added that scientists found no increased risk of blood clots among over 20,000 people who got at least one dose of the shot.

Gujarat BJP MLA Govind Patel on Monday clarified his "BJP workers don't get infected with COVID-19" remark after facing criticism. He said, "I wanted to say that labourers don't contract coronavirus but added 'BJP' also in the same sentence, which is a mistake. I take my words back." Patel was talking about politicians flouting protocols when he made the comment.

India has reported 46,951 new COVID-19 cases in the last 24 hours which is the highest number of cases reported in a day in 2021. The country reported 212 deaths in the last 24 hours, taking the COVID-19 death toll to 1,59,967. The total COVID-19 cases in the country stand at 1,16,46,081, while the active cases stand at 3,34,646.

Following a six-wicket defeat in the second T20I against South Africa Women, India Women's Shafali Verma said that she worked on every aspect of her batting during the coronavirus-induced lockdown. ?During the lockdown I worked on both front foot and back foot." The 17-year-old added, "I was also trying to prepare for ODIs so I worked on playing ground shots."

Eleven women students at the University Institute of Nursing in Punjab's Jalalabad have tested COVID-19 positive, following which the campus has been declared a micro-containment zone, an official said. The students' samples were taken after one of the nursing students developed symptoms of COVID-19. "Our team has started sampling of the entire staff," Senior Medical Officer Dr Ankur Uppal said.

Over 60% of the 1,715 daily coronavirus cases in Karnataka were recorded in Bengaluru Urban on Sunday, according to official figures. Bengaluru Urban recorded 1,039 cases of the total 1,715 in the state, while Bengaluru Rural had 32 cases. The total number of positive cases recorded in Bengaluru Urban has now reached 4,17,672, the highest in the state.

Chhattisgarh CM Bhupesh Baghel on Sunday said the state government has decided that except for Class 10th and 12th board exams, examinations will not be conducted for other classes and all students will be given general promotion. He added that this was decided keeping coronavirus transmission in mind. He also announced that all schools will remain closed till further orders.

The Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) on Sunday said that it has fined 20 lakh people for not wearing masks in Mumbai and has collected over ?40 crore from them between April 2020 and March 21, 2021. Mumbai recorded 3,775 new COVID-19 cases on Sunday, making it the city's biggest single-day spike in cases since the pandemic began.

Amid a surge in COVID-19 cases in Delhi, Lieutenant Governor Anil Baijal has said that random testing of passengers is needed at the airport and railway stations in the UT. Speaking after a Delhi Disaster Management Authority meeting on Monday, Baijal said, "In view of the upcoming festivals, the need for more caution and regulation was stressed upon."

Actor Kartik Aaryan took to Instagram to inform that he has tested positive for COVID-19. He wrote, "I'm positive. Pray for me." The 30-year-old actor, on Saturday, had walked the ramp for designer Manish Malhotra at the ongoing Lakme Fashion Week. He was also shooting for 'Bhool Bhulaiyaa 2' with co-stars Kiara Advani and Tabu.

An increase in testing is one of the reasons for the rising number of COVID-19 cases in Pune, data showed. On Sunday, 21,117 samples were tested, up from the average of about 13,000 to 14,000 two weeks ago. Pune reported 5,421 new cases on Sunday, the third consecutive day of 5,000-plus cases in the city, according to the district data.

Delhi on Monday reported 888 new COVID-19 cases, making it the third consecutive day the national capital reported more than 800 new coronavirus cases. Delhi's total coronavirus cases now stand at 6,48,872, while the active case tally stands at 3,934. Delhi saw seven COVID-19 deaths in the last 24 hours, taking the capital's coronavirus death toll to 10,963.

Congress leader Rahul Gandhi, while interacting with students in Kochi on Monday, said, "Government now doesn't have money so they are forcibly taking money from your pocket to run [itself]." "Due to demonetisation and GST, the Indian economy was damaged. It was already weak and after COVID-19 it collapsed," Gandhi added. "The mismanagement is quite profound and deep," he said.

The Centre has told states and UTs to increase the interval between two doses of Oxford-AstraZeneca's Covishield vaccine to four-to-eight weeks from the earlier four-to-six weeks. Covishield appears to offer 'enhanced protection' if the second dose is administered between six and eight weeks, it said. The change in the interval is not applicable to Covaxin.

Schools and colleges in Chandigarh will be closed with immediate effect till March 31 amid rising COVID-19 cases in the Union Territory. However, all teaching and non-teaching staff shall continue to attend the schools, an official notification said. The administration banned public gatherings for Holi and restricted the capacity of restaurants, hotels and food joints in malls at 50%.

According to the district authority's data, Maharashtra's Nagpur recorded 3,596 new COVID-19 cases on Monday. With this, the total number of cases in the district has reached 1,96,676. The city has also recorded 40 COVID-19 related fatalities in the last 24 hours, which took the death toll to 3,664, the government data showed.

American restaurant chain Texas Roadhouse's 65-year-old Founder Kent Taylor died by suicide after battling symptoms following a case of COVID-19, his family said. "After a battle with post-Covid related symptoms, including severe tinnitus, Kent took his own life," a statement said. "Kent fought hard...but the suffering greatly intensified in recent days and became unbearable," the statement added.

The Karnataka government has made negative COVID-19 test reports mandatory for people arriving in the state from Punjab and Chandigarh amid the rising cases. This is in addition to the mandatory COVID-19 negative reports for travellers arriving from Maharashtra and Kerala. This comes at a time when Karnataka health minister K Sudhakar said the second wave of COVID-19 has begun.

India has reported 43,846 new COVID-19 cases in the last 24 hours which is the highest number of cases reported in a day in 2021. The country reported 197 deaths in the last 24 hours, taking the COVID-19 death toll to 1,59,755. The total COVID-19 cases in the country stand at 1,15,99,130, while the active cases stand at 3,09,087.

Actor Mandar Chandwadkar, who plays Bhide in 'Taarak Mehta Ka Ooltah Chashmah', revealed that he has tested positive for COVID-19. Chandwadkar also shared a video on Instagram to confirm the news and said that he is under home quarantine. He added that he is asymptomatic and is following all the rules laid down by the government and BMC.

Maharashtra on Sunday recorded 30,535 new cases of coronavirus, making it the biggest daily COVID-19 case surge since the beginning of the pandemic last year. Its last COVID-19 peak came on Saturday when over 27,000 new cases were reported in the state. As many as 99 more people died of COVID-19 in Maharashtra in last 24 hours.

Veteran Bollywood actress Sharmila Tagore recently received vaccination for COVID-19 and her daughter Saba Ali Khan, who is a jewellery designer, shared the news on her Instagram Story. Saba shared the picture of her mother getting vaccinated. Sharmila's son, actor Saif Ali Khan, reportedly received the first dose of the vaccine earlier this month.

Italian luxury cars manufacturer Lamborghini has said that it registered the most profitable year in the brand's 58-year-old history the year the coronavirus pandemic hit the world. "We were surprised," says Stephan Winkelmann, who rejoined as Lamborghini's President & CEO in December 2020. Lamborghini delivered 7,430 cars worldwide in 2020 and registered a turnover of $1.93 billion.

Nine out of 25 garment factories surveyed in Bengaluru closed down during the COVID-19 pandemic, a Garment and Textile Workers' Union and Alternative Law Forum report has stated. This resulted in more than 5,600 workers losing their jobs, as per the report. The other 16 Bengaluru factories that were surveyed also reported job losses of 11,000 more workers.

As many as 43,846 new coronavirus cases have been reported in India in last 24 hours. Out of these, 83.14% cases are from six states, which are Maharashtra, Punjab, Kerala, Karnataka, Gujarat and Madhya Pradesh. Further, 197 deaths were reported in the last 24 hours. A total of 17 states/UTs have not reported any COVID-19 deaths in last 24 hours.

Gujarat BJP MLA Govind Patel on Sunday said, "BJP workers work hard and, therefore, not a single worker has been infected with COVID-19." "Those who work hard don't get coronavirus infection," he added. His remarks came after he was asked if flouting of COVID-19 guidelines by political leaders and workers during poll campaigning was resulting in surge in COVID-19 cases.

While talking about the surge in COVID-19 cases in India, AIIMS chief Dr Randeep Guleria said, "There is a loss of Covid-appropriate behaviour." He added, "Now people feel that the pandemic is over because vaccines are here. So they fail to wear masks." Dr Guleria said, "The virus itself is mutating and some of the variants are more infectious."

Maharashtra's capital Mumbai recorded 3,775 new COVID-19 cases in the last 24 hours, making it the city's biggest single-day spike in coronavirus cases since the pandemic began. Mumbai also recorded 10 deaths in the last 24 hours, taking the city's total COVID-19 death toll to 11,582. Mumbai's total cases now stand at 3,62,654 and active cases at 23,448.

A video has surfaced showing Uttarakhand CM Tirath Singh Rawat saying "America enslaved India for 200 years". While praising PM Narendra Modi for his handling of the coronavirus pandemic, Rawat said India is doing better than America that 'ruled over India and the rest of the world'. India would've been in a bad shape if not for PM, Rawat said.

Indian Premier League franchise Delhi Capitals announced on Saturday that it has requested BCCI for the COVID-19 vaccination of its Indian players ahead of IPL 2021. "We have spoken to the BCCI which is in talks with the Union Health Ministry, especially now that the Olympic-bound athletes are/will be getting the vaccine," said Delhi Capitals.

Actor Anupam Kher took to Twitter to speak about the importance of following the coronavirus guidelines and said, "I request you as a responsible citizen that we people follow all protocols and instructions by the government." He added in the video, "Wear your mask and wash your hands. Don't take things for granted...Take care of your friends and yourself."

Six labourers of Mumbai's Minatai Thackeray Flower Market (Dadar) have tested positive for coronavirus and are "undergoing treatment", Ward GN of Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) tweeted on Saturday. The results were found after 215 people from the market were tested for the virus. Notably, pictures of large gatherings at the market have been surfacing online for the past few days.

Chhattisgarh government on Sunday decided to shut schools, colleges and Anganwadis a day after the state recorded the highest single-day spike in new coronavirus cases this year. State minister Ravindra Choubey said that schools, colleges and Anganwadis will be closed with immediate effect. Chhattisgarh on Saturday recorded 1,273 COVID-19 cases, taking the state-wide tally to 3,23,153.

Amid a surge in COVID-19 cases, Gujarat CM Vijay Rupani said on Sunday that no lockdown will be imposed in the state. "People need to follow COVID-19 guidelines. Masks, sanitisers and social distancing are [essential] to stop the spread of coronavirus," said Rupani. "I urge people to not pay attention to any rumours," he added.

Fashion designer, the owner of the label House of Masaba, said that the coronavirus pandemic has not impacted her creativity and added, "I think it made me more creative and work harder." Speaking about her designs, she added, "I'm inspired by way too many things. Things that have happened to me recently and things that have happened way back."

More than 6 crore doses of COVID-19 vaccine have been sent to 76 nations, while nearly 4.5 crore doses have been administered to beneficiaries in the country till now, Union Health Minister Harsh Vardhan said on Sunday. "Our PM Narendra Modi and BJP president JP Nadda have called for making the vaccination drive a 'jan andolan' (mass movement)," Vardhan added.

A private hospital in Uttarakhand's Dehradun has been barred from conducting the COVID-19 vaccination drive following complaints that it was overcharging people, Chief Medical Officer Anup Dimri said. The Central Government has capped the price of COVID-19 vaccine at ?250 per dose in private hospitals. "An investigation has been ordered in this case," the chief medical officer added.

National Conference Vice President Omar Abdullah reacted to Sunday lockdowns imposed by the Madhya Pradesh government in Bhopal, Indore and Jabalpur due to rising COVID-19 cases. "With a rampaging virus that has a 2-14 day incubation period this one-day lockdown is meaningless tokenism," Abdullah tweeted. He added that vaccines are the answer to the rising COVID-19 cases, not one-day lockdowns.

Congress spokesperson Abhishek Singhvi has alleged that the government has failed to control the spread of COVID-19 as the country on Sunday reported 43,846 news cases, the highest single-day count this year. He said the government should come out with a plan to vaccinate all within 12 months. "The second wave of COVID-19 is staring at us," Singhvi added.

Fifteen doctors and 10 nurses at the Yashwantrao Chavan Memorial Hospital, which is run by the Pimpri Chinchwad Municipal Corporation, have tested COVID-19 positive, said hospital dean Dr Rajendra Wable. One of the infected doctors had received two doses of COVID-19 vaccine. The doctors and the nurses were handling COVID-19 patients in different wards.

Delhi on Sunday recorded 823 COVID-19 cases in the last 24 hours, making it the biggest daily COVID-19 case surge this year. The Union Territory had on Saturday recorded 813 new COVID-19 cases. As many as 613 people have been discharged after recovery in the last 24 hours in Delhi, while one more person has succumbed to the virus.

Days after a 38-year-old man died allegedly after taking the COVID-19 vaccination in UP's Mirzapur, another death of a vaccinated person was reported from Kannauj district. The deceased, identified as Yogesh Kumar Sankhwar, was administered the first dose of COVID-19 vaccination on March 18. Within 24 hours, he developed complications and was declared brought dead by doctors.

Mumbai's slum Dharavi will "receive low pressure water supply" on March 23 from 10 am-10 pm, Ward GN of Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) wrote in a tweet on Sunday. "Citizens of this area are requested to store enough water and use [it] judiciously," the tweet added. Meanwhile, Dharavi witnessed 62% surge in COVID-19 cases in March as opposed to February.

The Serum Institute of India (SII) has told Brazil, Morocco and Saudi Arabia that further supplies of the AstraZeneca's COVID-19 vaccine will be delayed, Reuters reported. The delay is reportedly due to the increased demand in India. Ministry of External Affairs said Brazil, Morocco and Saudi Arabia have received four million, seven million and three million doses from SII respectively.

The Adani Group has said that it will reimburse the COVID-19 vaccination charges for its employees. The company will also reimburse vaccination charges for the employees' spouse, children and parents, Chief Human Resources Officer Vikram Tandon said. Earlier, several other firms, including ICICI Bank, Accenture, Infosys and Flipkart, made a similar announcement for their employees.

AstraZeneca on Sunday said its COVID-19 vaccine does not contain pork-derived ingredients. This comes after Indonesia's highest Muslim clerical council, the Indonesian Ulema Council, said that the vaccine is "haram" because the manufacturing process uses "trypsin from the pork pancreas", Reuters reported. However, the council approved the AstraZeneca vaccine for use given the pandemic emergency.

Actress Rakhi Sawant defended the Zomato delivery personnel who was accused of physical assault by a female customer in Bengaluru. In a video shared by photographer Viral Bhayani on Instagram, Rakhi said, "Injustice has been done to him. They are working during COVID-19, respect them." She added, "You never know a Zomato boy could become the Prime Minister one day."

Singer Shilpa Rao said that she is performing live sessions but is not stepping out for physical concerts as she has her parents at home. Speaking about what she has learnt during COVID-19, Shilpa added, "COVID-19...taught me one thing that you can make plans but you have to surrender to life. I'm making plans only for the next 24 hours."

Unregistered but eligible people in Delhi will be able to take COVID-19 vaccine shots between 3 pm and 9 pm, Delhi Health Minister Satyendar Jain said. Till now, unregistered beneficiaries were being inoculated between 3 pm and 5 pm. Such beneficiaries just need to carry their Aadhaar cards or any other valid identity proofs for getting the vaccine, he added.

Actress Urmila Matondkar talked about making a full-fledged acting comeback and revealed that she was supposed to work on a web series in April last year but it got delayed because of COVID-19. "Right now, it's [the series] stuck with one permission issue with a certain ministry," she added. Matondkar stated that the most important thing is "constant growth".

The Union Health Ministry has asked Uttarakhand government to increase COVID-19 testing and ensure adequate critical care facilities during the ongoing Kumbh Mela in Haridwar to control the spread of COVID-19. This comes after Uttarakhand CM Tirath Singh Rawat said besides guidelines issued by the Centre no other restrictions will be there for tourists coming to Haridwar for Kumbh.

IndiGo airlines on Saturday handed over a passenger to security agencies at Kolkata airport for not wearing a mask despite repeated warnings from the flight crew. The incident, which happened on IndiGo's 6E938 Bengaluru-Kolkata flight, comes after Directorate General of Civil Aviation's (DGCA) order to de-board passengers if they don't wear masks properly or follow COVID-19-appropriate behaviour.

BJP leaders today held a protest in Maharashtra's Nagpur against state Home Minister Anil Deshmukh amid the ongoing COVID-19 lockdown in the city. This comes after former Mumbai Police Commissioner Param Bir Singh, in a letter addressed to CM Uddhav Thackeray, said that Deshmukh gave Sachin Vaze a "target" to collect ?100 crore every month from bars, restaurants, and more.

The second wave of COVID-19 has seen entire families getting infected unlike last time, said Dr Dhananjay Kelkar, Medical Director of Deenanath Mangeshkar Hospital in Pune. The number of active COVID-19 cases in the city was 20,889 on Saturday. The number of people on oxygenated beds was fewer than last year, said doctors to The Indian Express.

Maharashtra on Saturday recorded 27,126 new COVID-19 cases in the last 24 hours, making it the biggest daily case surge since the pandemic began last year. The state had reported 25,833 cases on Thursday, which was its previous single-day case record. Pune recorded the highest number of new coronavirus cases on Saturday at 3,200.

Actor Ashish Vidyarthi has tested negative for coronavirus. The 58-year-old actor, who contracted coronavirus on March 11, was admitted to a hospital in Delhi. Ashish on Saturday shared a video wherein he thanked the medical staff, his fans and well-wishers. "Let's all stay on purpose and stay AMAZING...Come what may...Let's spread hope and Cheer," he wrote alongside the video.

The Rajasthan government has extended curbs under Section 144 of CrPC till April 21 amid COVID-19. The restrictions were earlier imposed up to March 21. This has been done "looking at the risks to human life and people's health condition with the spread of COVID-19", home department's senior deputy secretary Bhawani Shankar said.

Pakistan Prime Minister Imran Khan has tested positive for COVID-19 and is self isolating at home, his Special Assistant on National Health Services, Regulations & Coordination tweeted. Khan had received coronavirus vaccine jab in Islamabad on Thursday. He got himself registered on the 1166 helpline and received the shot when his turn came.

Amid public concerns about COVID-19, the Tokyo 2020 Olympic Organising Committee is considering banning foreign volunteers at the delayed games this summer, said reports. Organisers may consider allowing volunteers with specialised skills, such as speaking minority languages, as an exception, reports added. The reports came hours ahead of a meeting of Tokyo Olympic organisers.

Lockdown imposed in Nagpur city amid rising COVID-19 cases has been extended till March 31 with some relaxations. Shops for vegetables and other essential items will be allowed to open till 4 pm while restaurants can remain open till 7 pm, Nagpur's Guardian Minister Nitin Raut said. Schools and colleges will remain closed till March 31, he added.

John Abraham, while speaking about the theatrical release of 'Mumbai Saga' amid the coronavirus pandemic, said that the crime-drama film deserves to be seen on the big screen. "A lot of actors are always worried about their filmography in terms of box office and how it'll look eventually. I'd say we're gutsy as...team to release [it] in theatres," he added.

UK PM Boris Johnson has received the first dose of Oxford-AstraZeneca COVID-19 vaccine and urged public to do the same. "I...didn't feel a thing. It was very good, very quick," Johnson said after receiving the vaccine. It comes as several European countries resumed using the AstraZeneca vaccine after regulators said its benefits outweighed any risks, following blood clot reports.

After Pakistan PM Imran Khan tested positive for coronavirus, PM Narendra Modi on Saturday tweeted, "Best wishes to Prime Minister [Imran Khan] for a speedy recovery from COVID-19." Khan tested positive for COVID-19 two days after he was vaccinated against the virus in Islamabad. He's self-isolating at home, Khan's Special Assistant on National Health Services, Regulations and Coordination said.

The Tamil Nadu government has ordered schools to shut physical classes for classes 9, 10 and 11 from Monday in the wake of increasing coronavirus cases in the state. Hostels for the students of these classes will also be closed. Physical classes are allowed for students of class 12 as they have to appear for board exams in May.

Asia's largest slum Dharavi in Mumbai witnessed a 62% rise in the number of COVID-19 cases this month compared to February 2021, Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) officials said on Saturday. Dharavi reported 272 coronavirus cases so far in the month compared to 168 in February. The officials said that the cases being reported now are scattered across the slum.

Veteran actor Dharmendra on Friday received the first dose of coronavirus vaccine. The 85-year-old actor tweeted a video wherein he can be seen getting vaccinated. "It's definitely not a show off...but to inspire you all. Friends, please take care," he wrote alongside the video. In another tweet, Dharmendra urged everyone to wear a mask and maintain social distancing.

World number one Novak Djokovic on Friday said he won't be playing at the ATP Miami Open, joining Rafael Nadal and Roger Federer in skipping the next week's event. The six-time Miami champion cited coronavirus restrictions and his desire to balance events. "Dear fans...I'm very sorry to announce that this year I won't travel to Miami to compete," tweeted Djokovic.

The European region has surpassed 10 lakh COVID-19 deaths, making it the first region to do so. The region has reported over 3.7 crore COVID-19 cases and 10,00,062 coronavirus-related deaths so far, according to a Reuters tally. The European region, which includes 51 countries, makes up to 35.5% of all coronavirus deaths and 30.5% of all cases in the world.

Defence Minister Rajnath Singh greeted US Secretary of Defence Lloyd J Austin III in New Delhi with an 'elbow bump' instead of the conventional handshake amid the coronavirus pandemic. The two leaders held delegation-level bilateral talks and issued a joint statement. The meeting's attendees were also seen wearing face masks.

As many as 813 coronavirus cases were confirmed in Delhi in the last 24 hours, marking the biggest one-day jump in 2021 and taking the total number of cases to 6,47,161. Meanwhile, two deaths have been recorded in the last 24 hours, taking the death toll to 10,955. Out of the total cases, 3,409 cases are active.

Denmark said that one person had died and another fell ill with blood clots and cerebral haemorrhage after receiving the Oxford-AstraZeneca COVID-19 vaccine. Local authorities said that the illness was reported less than 14 days after the vaccination. This comes after several countries resumed the use of the vaccine after temporarily suspending it over reports of blood clots.

Finland has temporarily suspended the use of Oxford-AstraZeneca COVID-19 vaccine following two reports of blood clots in patients who had received it, Finnish Institute for Health and Welfare (THL) said. The vaccine has been suspended as a precaution until further information is available, it added. This comes a day after Europe's medicines regulator concluded the vaccine was "safe and effective".

The UN on Friday said that none of its international staff is currently present in North Korea. A UN spokesman said that the UN office is continuing to operate with the local staff handling the operations and the international staff working remotely. Despite claiming to be COVID-19 free, North Korea has sealed off its borders as part of anti-pandemic measures.

The Jharkhand Health Department has decided to give a month's extra pay to frontline health workers who have been working round the clock since the outbreak of the COVID-19 pandemic. Jharkhand Health Minister Banna Gupta, while responding to a question by a BJP MLA in the state Assembly said that the identification process of beneficiaries is underway.

The COVID-19 vaccine should be able to give good protection from the infection for eight to 10 months and maybe, even more, AIIMS Director Randeep Guleria said on Saturday. He said that no major side-effect of the vaccine has been recorded. Guleria added that the main reason behind the COVID-19 surge is that people feel that the pandemic is over.

A COVID-19 vaccination camp for prisoners in the Central Jail of Indore was organised on Saturday. "Today 150 people will be vaccinated. The remaining vaccinations will continue even further," Dr Vivek Singh Chauhan, who administered the vaccine shots in the jail, said. "For the first time in Madhya Pradesh, vaccination is being conducted in a jail," Chauhan added.

Half of all adults in Britain have received their first dose of COVID-19 vaccine, making the country the world's first major economy to hit that milestone, UK PM Boris Johnson said on Saturday. "Many thanks to everyone involved in this fantastic achievement...Let's keep going!" PM Johnson tweeted. Around 26,263,732 people have received their first dose so far in the UK.

Amid rising coronavirus cases, the Madhya Pradesh government has announced lockdown in Indore, Bhopal and Jabalpur cities every Sunday till further orders. The decision was taken in a ?review meet chaired by CM Shivraj Singh Chouhan. All educational institutions will remain closed in these three cities till March 31, said an order by Madhya Pradesh Home Department.

European Commission President Ursula von der Leyen has threatened to ban AstraZeneca vaccine exports if the bloc doesn't receive its deliveries first. "Fulfil your contract with Europe first before you start delivering to other countries," she said. AstraZeneca Plc has delivered only 30% of the 90 million vaccine doses it had promised for the first quarter of 2021, she added.

As many as 40,953 coronavirus cases were confirmed in India in the last 24 hours, marking the biggest one-day jump in 2021 and taking the total number of cases to 1,15,55,284. Meanwhile, 188 deaths have been recorded in the last 24 hours, taking the death toll to 1,59,558. Out of the total cases, 2,88,394 cases are active.

In view of rising COVID-19 cases, BBMP is planning to propose closure of open-air gyms in parks, regular gyms, swimming pools and community halls in apartments to Karnataka government, BBMP Commissioner N Manjunatha Prasad said. "We've already had preliminary discussions with the Chief Secretary, Additional Chief Secretary and officials of the Department of Health and Family Welfare," he added.

Two more clusters of COVID-19 cases were detected among school students in Telangana, officials said on Friday. This included 22 boarding students and two others at a government ST boys hostel in Hyderabad and 17 girl students from a Jagtial residential school. All the boarding students and staff members were asymptomatic and kept in quarantine, an official press release said.

Seven states and one Union Territory (UT) are reporting a rising trajectory of daily new COVID-19 cases, the Union Health Ministry said on Saturday. "These are Maharashtra, Tamil Nadu, Punjab, Madhya Pradesh, Delhi, Gujarat, Karnataka and Haryana," said the ministry. It added that Kerala is showing a "consistently declining trend" of daily new COVID-19 cases.

The Madhya Pradesh state transport authority announced on Thursday that bus services to and from Maharashtra be stopped from March 20 till the end of the month. The decision was taken by Chief Minister Shivraj Singh Chouhan. This comes as Maharashtra on Thursday recorded 25,833 new coronavirus cases, the highest one-day spike since the outbreak of the pandemic last year.

Financial problems brought by last year's coronavirus pandemic have pushed about 3.2 crore Indians out of the middle class, undoing years of economic gains, a Pew Research Center report showed on Thursday. Job losses pushed lakhs of them into poverty, the report added. The research classified those earning between $10-$20 (?725-?1,450) a day as 'middle class'.

World's first Super Nintendo World-themed park opened at Universal Studios Japan in Osaka on Thursday. The park, which cost about $500 million to build, was scheduled to open last year but was delayed due to the coronavirus pandemic. The park will allow visitors to buy wristbands to collect coins and compete with each other via an app on their phones.

Bengaluru-based Strides Pharma Science said that its unit Stelis Biopharma has partnered with Russian Direct Investment Fund to make at least 20 crore Sputnik V COVID-19 vaccine doses. Earlier, Indian pharmaceutical firms Gland Pharma and Hetero struck similar deals to supply the vaccine. With the latest deal, India's total production of the shot will rise to over 50 crore doses.

World Health Organization's European director, Hans Kluge, urged European countries to continue using Oxford-AstraZeneca coronavirus vaccine doses as the benefits "outweigh its risks" and "save lives". This comes after several nations suspended the vaccine's use over blood clot concerns. "As of now, we don't know whether some or all of the conditions have been caused by the vaccine," Kluge added.

Nepal has become the third country in the world to approve Bharat Biotech's Covaxin for emergency use. The vaccine was found to be 81% effective in an interim analysis of late-stage trial data on some 26,000 people in India. Earlier, Nepal had received over 23 lakh doses of Covishield vaccine from India, including 10 lakh doses as a gift.

The US plans to send 40 lakh doses of the Oxford-AstraZeneca coronavirus vaccine to Mexico and Canada. Mexico will receive 25 lakh doses of the vaccine and Canada is to receive 15 lakh doses, White House spokeswoman Jen Psaki said. The vaccine, which is being rolled out in several countries, has not yet been approved for use in the US.

BJP leader Suvendu Adhikari on Friday said that speaking against Prime Minister Narendra Modi is equivalent to speaking against "democracy" and "Bharat Mata". "You'll have to take PM Modi's vaccine against COVID-19. He is the elected PM," Adhikari added. His remarks came after TMC criticised the PM over rising COVID-19 cases despite the nationwide vaccination drive.

Norway's PM Erna Solberg is under investigation after she and her family violated her own government's coronavirus restrictions. "I'm sorry my family and I have broken the...regulations, it should never have happened. We should...have followed all the recommendations, as I have asked you to," Solberg said. The restrictions on gatherings were violated by Solberg and her family in February.

Wrestler Bajrang Punia has become the first Tokyo Olympics-bound Indian athlete to take COVID-19 vaccine shot. "I was getting fed up of getting tested again and again," he said. On being asked how he managed to get it when the permission currently is only for 60-plus and 45-59 age group with co-morbidities, he said, "I didn't face any problems whatsoever."

Bigg Boss 14 contestant Nikki Tamboli took to Instagram to share that she has tested positive for the coronavirus. "I'm self-quarantined, and taking all the precautionary measures and medications on my doctor's advice...I'll forever be grateful for all your love and support. Please be safe, wear your mask always, sanitise your hands...and maintain social distancing," she wrote.

As many as 39,726 coronavirus cases were confirmed in India in the last 24 hours, marking the biggest one-day jump in 2021 and taking the total number of cases to 1,15,14,331. Meanwhile, 154 deaths have been recorded in the last 24 hours, taking the death toll to 1,59,370. Out of the total cases, 2,71,282 cases are active.

As the state recorded 107 fresh COVID-19 cases on Thursday, Bihar government's health department cancelled leave of doctors and healthcare staff till April 5. The state has 406 active COVID-19 cases and has reported 1,555 deaths so far. Meanwhile, 39,726 coronavirus cases were confirmed in India in the last 24 hours, marking the biggest one-day jump this year.

South Korea's capital Seoul on Friday withdrew an order requiring mandatory coronavirus testing for all foreign workers after criticism from foreigners, medical workers and the human rights commission. Earlier, the Health Ministry had asked the city to replace the order with measures that "don't discriminate between Korean and foreign nationals and don't infringe on human rights".

France has imposed a month-long lockdown in Paris and several other regions after a faltering vaccine rollout and spread of highly contagious coronavirus variants. French PM Jean Castex said the country faces a "third wave" of the pandemic, with the UK COVID-19 variant now accounting for some 75% of the cases. COVID-19 has infected over 42 lakh people in France.

Nepal on Thursday said that it'd resume cross-border transportation with India via various 12 routes as coronavirus cases in the Himalayan nation have decreased significantly. However, passengers travelling by land routes will have to produce a negative COVID-19 test within 72 hours of travel. Nepal had suspended the cross-border movement with India in March last year to combat COVID-19 spread.

Several European countries, including Germany and France, said that they will resume the rollout of the Oxford-AstraZeneca coronavirus vaccine after the European Medicines Agency deemed the shot "safe and effective". However, Norway and Sweden said they were not ready to resume the use of the vaccine. Earlier, the countries had suspended Oxford-AstraZeneca vaccine use over reports of blood clots.

The coronavirus variant first seen in the UK, known to be highly contagious, makes up more than 60% of cases in Poland and will soon reach 80%, a Health Ministry spokesman said. The country is currently dealing with the third wave of COVID-19 and has reported a sharp increase in daily cases. Poland has reported over 20 lakh coronavirus cases.

Mumbai's Dharavi on Thursday reported 30 new coronavirus cases for the first time since September 11, 2020, when it reported 33 cases in a single day. Dharavi now has a total of 4,328 coronavirus cases with over 315 deaths and 140 active cases. In total, the G North ward, which covers Dadar, Dharavi and Mahim, recorded 102 cases on Thursday.

Punjab Congress will not hold any political gatherings for the next two weeks amid rising coronavirus cases in the state, CM Captain Amarinder Singh announced. He appealed to other political parties and their leaders to keep their gatherings within the prescribed numbers i.e. 50% of capacity. He added that no political gatherings should take place in the most affected districts.

Punjab government on Friday closed schools and colleges in the state till March 31, amid rising COVID-19 cases. Night curfew from 9 pm to 5 am was also announced in 11 worst-hit districts of Punjab. Cinema halls will be allowed to operate at 50% capacity and only 100 people will be allowed in malls at a time.

A reference book for the second-year MBBS students in Maharashtra has been withdrawn, following objections raised over parts of its content allegedly linking the Tablighi Jamaat's congregation in New Delhi last year to the COVID-19 outbreak, an official said. The book's authors, Apurba Sastry and Sandhya Bhat apologised "if they inadvertently hurt the sentiments of a group of people".

Eight people in Punjab have tested COVID-19 positive after getting vaccinated since January, as per the health department's data. Six tested positive after taking the vaccine's first dose, while two tested positive after the second dose. However, in cases of people testing positive after second dose, the window period of 14 days required for antibodies to develop, wasn't completed.

Mumbai on Friday recorded 3,062 COVID-19 cases in the last 24 hours, making it the biggest single-day case rise in the city since the beginning of the pandemic. Mumbai's cumulative COVID-19 caseload now stands at 3,55,897. The city also recorded 10 more COVID-19 deaths on Friday, taking the total number of fatalities there to 11,565.

Actress Aahana Kumra on Friday sought the help of Health Minister Harsh Vardhan to get COVID-19 vaccination certificate for her parents. Aahana tweeted saying her parents got vaccinated a few days ago but the record shows wrong time, and she's unable to download the certificate. "We've been following up with the Centre with no revert from their end," she added.

In view of rising COVID-19 cases in Gujarat's Surat city, the Surat Municipal Corporation (SMC) has decided to increase the night curfew timing by one hour. Instead of 10 pm, the night curfew will now start from 9 pm and end at 6 am, SMC said on Friday. The new timing will come into effect from Friday night, it added.

The All England Lawn Tennis Club (AELTC) announced on Thursday that Wimbledon's ticket queue would not be operating at this year's tournament and it will be replaced by online sales. The number of fans inside the ground at the grass-court Grand Slam is also likely to be reduced. The Wimbledon Championships were cancelled last year due to the pandemic.

Union Health Minister Dr Harsh Vardhan during Question Hour in Lok Sabha on Friday said that every vaccine "doesn't require universal immunisation". Answering to NCP MP Supriya Sule's question, Dr Vardhan added, "It's not necessary, scientifically, to give each person...the vaccine...All things are based on scientific facts, scrutiny and vision of overall scientific and health community."

Google said it blocked nearly 10 crore COVID-19-related ads in 2020, including those about miracle cures. Google had launched a policy to prohibit ads and monetised content about COVID-19 or other global health emergencies that contradict scientific consensus. The number of ad accounts disabled for policy violations also increased by 70% from 10 lakh to over 17 lakh.

After opening low due to concerns of a fresh lockdown to contain the spread of COVID-19 and rise in US bond yields, Indian indices began trading in green on Friday. BSE Sensex was around 49,300 while the broader Nifty held above the day's low of 14,350. Sensex's recovery was led by gains in IT, FMCG, energy and pharma stocks.

A day after Maharashtra witnessed the highest spike in daily COVID-19 cases, CM Uddhav Thackeray said, "I see lockdown as an option going ahead." He added, "But I trust people of the state to cooperate (and follow the COVID-19 norms voluntarily) like the last time." He also appealed to people to get vaccinated against the virus without fear.

Designer duo Pankaj and Nidhi Ahuja noted that the COVID-19 pandemic has altered their perspective towards fashion. "We've realised how prudent and imperative it's to design sharp and focused collections [and] reduce waste by designing less...Our planet...needs nurturing and so do our creative souls and there won't be peace if one comes at the cost of the other," they explained.

The night curfew in Ahmedabad will be extended by one hour from tomorrow. The new curfew timings will be from 9 pm to 6 am. The malls and cinema halls will remain closed on Saturday and Sunday. Earlier on Tuesday, the Gujarat government implemented a night curfew in Ahmedabad, Vadodara, Surat and Rajkot to contain the surge in COVID-19 cases.

The Odisha government has urged the Centre to include journalists, priests of Lord Jagannath Temple and Lingaraj Temple and electricity, water supply and airport workers in COVID-19 vaccination list. "It is suggested that these categories may be included as FLWs (frontline workers)," it said. India recorded highest number of coronavirus cases on Wednesday with 35,871 new cases.

Bhartiya Kisan Union (BKU) leader Rakesh Tikait on Thursday demanded that the protesting farmers at the Delhi borders should be given the COVID-19 vaccine. He also expressed his willingness to take the shot. Tikait added that the farmers will not end the protest because of the fear of coronavirus and will take measures to ensure social distancing.

Amid rising COVID-19 cases in the city, Karnataka Chief Minister BS Yediyurappa said that the government would reopen three COVID-19 care centres in Bengaluru. The care centres were shut down with a decrease in the number of coronavirus cases and with many asymptomatic patients preferring to isolate themselves at home. The city reported 786 COVID-19 cases on Wednesday.

The Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) on Wednesday collected a total of ?19,400 as fine from 245 people for not wearing masks at a restaurant near Breach Candy Hospital in Mumbai. An FIR has also been registered against the restaurant based on the complaint filed by the BMC. Mumbai reported 2,377 new coronavirus cases on Wednesday.

Maharashtra on Thursday reported that it recorded 25,833 new COVID-19 cases in the last 24 hours, crossing last year's peak. The highest number of COVID-19 cases registered in Maharashtra in a single day until today was 24,886 cases reported on September 11, 2020. Maharashtra's COVID-19 death toll rose to 53,138 with another 58 COVID-19 related deaths.

Mark Rutte has been elected as Netherlands' PM for the fourth straight Time. "The voters of the Netherlands have given my party an overwhelming vote of confidence," Rutte said. He vowed to use this term to rebuild the country after the coronavirus pandemic. Rutte's victory came months after his last coalition resigned over a child welfare fraud scandal in January.

India has reported its highest number of COVID-19 cases in 24 hours for the second day in a row this year with 35,871 new cases. The country reported 172 deaths in the last 24 hours, taking the COVID-19 death toll to 1,59,216. The total COVID-19 cases in the country stand at 1,14,74,605, while the active cases stand at 2,52,364.

Alia Bhatt's mother Soni Razdan has shared her stand on why COVID-19 vaccination should be open for all. She reasoned that actors need it as they're the "only people" who cannot wear masks and other protection on the job. "Those who're whining...can keep shut. Stop watching content...then. It's made with great risk to the concerned actors' lives," Soni tweeted.

The Directorate General of Civil Aviation (DGCA) on Thursday said that three airlines have deboarded seven passengers so far for allegedly flouting COVID-19 guidelines on board. 
The DGCA had asked airlines to act against passengers who don't wear masks properly or don't follow the COVID-19 rules. Alliance Air, IndiGo and AirAsia are the three carriers that took the action.

Senior Kerala Congress leader Skariah Thomas passed away on Thursday, at the age of 74, at a private hospital in Kochi due to post-COVID-19 complications. The former Lok Sabha member was admitted to the hospital last month. Chief Minister Pinarayi Vijayan condoled his death and said as a Lok Sabha member he could raise the voice of Kerala in Parliament.

A petitioner has urged the Delhi High Court to direct the Centre and the Election Commission to ban political leaders from poll campaigning if they don't wear masks. "Everyone has fundamental right to life, which is impacted by politicians...not wearing masks while campaigning," the petitioner said. He added that even a single COVID-19 patient can make the event super spreader.

UK Secretary of State for Health Matt Hancock on Thursday said constrained supply of COVID-19 vaccines in the country for its rollout in April is partly due to a delay in a shipment from the Serum Institute of India. The UK had ordered 10 crore AstraZeneca shots, a crore of which are to come from Pune's SII.

Pakistan has received the second batch of five lakh Sinopharm COVID-19 vaccine doses donated by China, Health Minister Faisal Sultan said. "These 5,00,000 doses will ensure smooth continuation of our vaccine drive, currently underway for senior citizens," Sultan said. Earlier, China had donated five lakh doses of Sinopharm on February 1, enabling Pakistan to launch vaccination drive a day later.

Italy inaugurated a living monument to honour COVID-19 victims on Thursday marking the anniversary of when Bergamo's death toll reached such heights that army convoy had to transport coffins out. Premier Mario Draghi laid a wreath at Bergamo's cemetery to commemorate a national day of mourning for victims. He inaugurated a forest named in honour of over 100,000 COVID-19 victims.

Delhi on Thursday reported 607 fresh COVID-19 cases, the highest single-day count in nearly 2.5 months, the health department data showed. The death toll rose to 10,949 after one more person succumbed to the disease in the last 24 hours. The city's COVID-19 tally has risen to 6,45,632, of which 2,924 cases are active.

Actress Kajal Aggarwal, in an interview, has revealed the reason behind the delay in the shoot of her film 'Indian 2' with Kamal Haasan. She said that since most of the crew members are from the US they're unable to travel to India because of COVID-19. The shoot was stalled after an accident on the set that left three dead.

The campus of Manipal Institute of Technology, an engineering college located in Manipal in Udupi district of Karnataka, has been declared a containment zone. The development comes after 52 COVID-19 cases were reported in the campus over the last two days, with 25 cases on Tuesday and 27 cases on Wednesday. Areas coming under the campus have been cordoned off.

The district administration in Maharashtra's Palghar has ordered the indefinite closure of all schools and colleges in Vasai-Virar civic jurisdiction from Thursday and government and private hostels in the district from March 23 till further notice. District Collector Dr Manik Gursal's order came after 31 staffers and students of an ashram shala (residential school) tested positive for COVID-19.

Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal has appealed to Centre to allow COVID-19 vaccination for everyone aged 18 and above. "Instead of making list of people who are eligible, we should make list of people who're not eligible," he stated. "If Centre allows that and if we get sufficient vaccine supply, we can vaccinate entire Delhi within three months," said Kejriwal.

West Indies all-rounder Andre Russell expressed his gratitude for PM Narendra Modi, after Jamaica received doses of COVID-19 vaccine from India. "Just want to say a big, big, big thank you to Prime Minister Modi and the India High Commission. The vaccines are here and we're excited," Russell said in a video. "India and Jamaica are now brothers," Russell added.

Congress leader P Chidambaram on Thursday said, "I share the pride that India exported 5.9 crore doses of COVID-19 vaccines. At the same time, I am disappointed that we have administered only three crore doses to Indian citizens." Union Health Minister Harsh Vardhan had earlier said that the government wasn't exporting vaccines to foreign nations at the expense of Indians.

Students of classes 1 to 5 will be promoted without exams in Rajasthan government schools due to disruptions caused by the COVID-19 pandemic. However, students of classes 6, 7, 8, 9 and 11 will be promoted only after clearing final exams, state education minister Govind Singh Dotasara said. Exams for these classes will be held in April.

With the increase in COVID-19 cases in Gujarat's Ahmedabad, the bus services of Ahmedabad Municipal Transport Service (AMTS) and Ahmedabad Bus Rapid Transit System will remain suspended from today until further orders. Earlier, the Gujarat government extended night curfew in Ahmedabad, Surat, Rajkot and Vadodara till March 31. The curfew was first imposed in November last year.

The WHO has said that Oxford-AstraZeneca's COVID-19 vaccine should continue to be administered as the benefits outweigh its risks. "Vaccination against COVID-19 won't reduce illness or deaths from other causes. Thromboembolic events are known to occur frequently," the WHO said. The WHO's statement came after some European Union countries paused the vaccine's rollout over reports of blood clots.

Mumbai Mayor Kishori Pednekar on Thursday expressed her concern over the rising COVID-19 cases and said, "I think imposing a night curfew is necessary right now." She added, "We're also considering shifting the crowded markets to new sites. All Mumbaikars need to work together to prevent the imposition of a lockdown." As of Wednesday, Mumbai had 15,410 active COVID-19 cases.

Maharashtra Navnirman Vidyarthi Sena (MNVS) has urged the state government and the University of Mumbai to take action against colleges that are charging fees for facilities unused during COVID-19 restrictions. "The colleges are playing by their own rules," MNVS state Vice President Santosh Gangurde said. The university had asked colleges not to charge fees for library or other facilities.

RBI Governor Shaktikanta Das said that the worst is over for the COVID-19-hit Indian economy and it is expected to move "upwards" from here. "The large capital expenditure announced by the government will support economic activity and investment," he added in an interview. Last month, the RBI said it expects India's Gross Domestic Product (GDP) to grow 10.5% in 2021-22.

Gautam Buddh Nagar Police has imposed restrictions under Section 144 of CrPC between March 17 and April 30 as a precautionary measure against COVID-19 in view of upcoming festivals. Dates of Holi, Good Friday, Maharishi Kashyap Jayanti, Navratri, Ambedkar Jayanti, Ram Navami, Mahavir Jayanti, and Hanuman Jayanti will fall between March 17 and April 30.

Terming the spread of COVID-19 in Punjab as alarming, CM Amarinder Singh on Thursday announced to extend the time period of night curfew in nine districts from 9 pm to 5 am, instead of the previous 11 pm to 5 am. These nine districts are Ludhiana, Jalandhar, Patiala, Mohali, Amritsar, Gurdaspur, Hoshiarpur, Kapurthala and Ropar.

Maharashtra, Punjab, Karnataka, Gujarat and Tamil Nadu collectively account for 71.10% of the 28,903 new COVID-19 cases reported in the last 24 hours, the Union Health Ministry said on Wednesday. The ministry further stated that 15 states and UTs including Andhra Pradesh, Assam and Uttarakhand did not report any COVID-19 deaths in the last 24 hours.

The Indian badminton contingent has been allowed to participate in the All England Open after the three players, who had tested COVID-19 positive, returned negative in retests on Wednesday. "No positive tests in the team anyone. We're ready for All England," India's coach Mathias Boe wrote on Instagram. Apart from the shuttlers, an Indian support staff had also tested positive.

The Nagaland government has decided to reopen regular schools for students of classes 1 to 5 from March 22. State's Principal Secretary (Home) Abhijit Sinha on Tuesday issued Standard Operating Procedure (SOP) to contain the spread of COVID-19 within the school premises. The SOP mandates physical distancing of at least six feet and the use of face covers or masks.

Former US President Donald Trump has urged his supporters to get COVID-19 vaccination, saying "it's  safe" and "it's something that works". "I would recommend it to a lot of people that don't want to get it and a lot of those people voted for me, frankly. But you know again, we've our freedoms...and I agree with that also," Trump added.

Serum Institute of India (SII) CEO Adar Poonawalla has said that COVID-19 vaccine nationalism is threatening the WHO's 2021 target to deliver 2 billion doses under the COVAX scheme. SII has provided over half of the shots used so far under the program. Poonawalla reiterated concerns over the hurdles caused by the US' ban on export of critical raw materials.

A US woman who had received one dose of coronavirus vaccine while she was pregnant has given birth to the first known baby born with COVID-19 antibodies, doctors have claimed. The mother received her first dose of the Moderna vaccine in January when she was 36 weeks pregnant. Researchers detected antibodies after analysing blood from the baby girl's umbilical cord.

Ola announced that it would provide COVID-19 vaccines to over 24,000 employees and their dependents for free, becoming the first global mobility company to do so. The policy covers all direct contractual employees, consultants, advisors and their immediate dependents including parents, kids and spouses. However, Ola did not specify whether this would include company cab drivers as well.

Union Minister Prakash Javadekar on Wednesday reacted to the Maharashtra government's demand for more vaccine doses, saying that the state had used only 23 lakh of the total 54 lakh vaccines sent to it. "First mismanagement of pandemic now poor administration of vaccines," Javadekar tweeted. He added that 56% of vaccine doses remained unused in the state till March 12.

Bahujan Samaj Party (BSP) chief Mayawati on Wednesday urged the Centre and state governments to make COVID-19 vaccine free for the poor. She also welcomed Prime Minister Narendra Modi's meeting with all the Chief Ministers to discuss the spread of COVID-19. "The central and state governments should make the COVID-19 vaccination...faster and easier under the national policy," Mayawati tweeted.

NITI Aayog Member (Health) VK Paul on Wednesday addressed the concerns regarding the reported side-effects of the Oxford-AstraZeneca COVID-19 vaccine and said, "I assure you that we've no signal of concern in this regard." He added, "India's group that looks at adverse effects is tracking the information available." Ten nations have paused the vaccine's rollout over reports of blood clots.

External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar, while speaking about the indigenous vaccines in the Rajya Sabha, said that he is proud to have got vaccinated with Bharat Biotech's Covaxin. He also recalled the questions that were raised against its efficacy when it first hit the market earlier this year. He stated that the Opposition is indirectly praising India's 'Vaccine Maitri' initiative.

Dharmendra, in an interview, revealed that he'll take the first dose of coronavirus vaccine this week. "I recommend it to all, especially the elders. We must stop this terrible virus, social distancing and vaccination are the only way out," the 85-year-old actor added. "I'm...saddened to see people in Mumbai...not following...guidelines...We must continue to be very careful," said Dharmendra.

A 49-year-old Kerala woman developed severe fever and uneasiness after receiving two shots of Covishield COVID-19 vaccine on the same day. "According to my mother, she was sitting in the vaccination room and was rubbing the spot where the vaccine was given with some cotton," her son said. "Suddenly, the same nurse came and gave her another shot," he added.

British PM Boris Johnson said on Wednesday he'd get the Oxford/AstraZeneca COVID-19 shot very soon. Johnson said, "I finally got the news that I'm going to have my own jab...very, very shortly. It'll certainly be Oxford/AstraZeneca that I will be having." This comes after several EU countries suspended the Oxford/AstraZeneca vaccine use after reports of blood clots among vaccinated people.

Air India's regional arm Alliance Air said that it has put four passengers, who were onboard a Delhi-bound flight, on the no-fly list for not wearing face masks. This comes days after the Directorate General of Civil Aviation directed airlines to treat passengers that don't follow COVID-19-appropriate behaviour as 'unruly'. The four passengers were handed over to the security agencies.

In a meeting with CMs, PM Narendra Modi on Wednesday said there's over 10% COVID-19 "vaccine wastage in Telangana and Andhra Pradesh". "Vaccine wastage in Uttar Pradesh is almost the same. It should be reviewed in states that why is vaccine wastage happening? Monitoring must be done every evening and pro-active people should be contacted," he added.
