During PM Narendra Modi's meeting with all Chief Ministers over the COVID-19 situation, the Karnataka government said it has decided to open three COVID-19 care centres in Bengaluru. "We will be vaccinating three lakh people every day in the state," the Karnataka government added. Karnataka on Tuesday registered 1,135 fresh cases of COVID-19 and six more related fatalities.

The Centre on Wednesday said that Maharashtra accounts for 60% of all active COVID-19 cases and 45% of all new deaths related to coronavirus in the country. "Maharashtra's COVID-19 positivity rate is more than 16%, which is a matter of concern. [We] have asked the state to increase testing," Union Health Secretary Rajesh Bhushan said.

BSE Sensex dropped by over 550 points to 49,801.62, while 50-share index Nifty fell below the 15,000-mark to close at 14,721 on Wednesday. Domestic indices fell for the fourth consecutive day as India recorded the highest daily number of COVID-19 cases in 2021. High inflation and uncertainty around the Federal Open Market Committee meeting have also impacted the share market.

Schools in Noida and Greater Noida cannot increase fees in the academic year 2021-22 owing to the COVID-19 pandemic situation, according to a Gautam Buddha Nagar district administration order. The order also directed the schools to charge fees only on monthly basis and not insist on payment of fees on a quarterly or half-yearly or yearly basis from any student.

Actress Tara Sutaria on Wednesday took to Instagram Stories to share that she has tested negative for coronavirus. "Thank you all for your concern and love. I am covid negative and healthy! Be safe and well. Lots of love to you all," she wrote. Reports suggested that the 25-year-old actress had tested positive for coronavirus last week.

With the resurgence of COVID-19 cases, PM Narendra Modi on Wednesday chaired a virtual meeting with CMs of all states to evaluate the situation. West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee, Chhattisgarh CM Bhupesh Baghel and Uttar Pradesh CM Yogi Adityanath skipped the meeting, news agency ANI reported. India recorded 28,903 fresh coronavirus cases on Wednesday, its highest single-day spike this year.

The Ahmedabad civic body on Wednesday announced the closure of the city zoo, lakefront and all public gardens from March 18 "till further orders" owing to the rising COVID-19 cases in the city. Ahmedabad on Tuesday recorded 241 new cases of coronavirus compared to 40 cases reported a month back on February 16, reports said.

Odisha government on Wednesday promoted all the students from standard 1 to 8 to the next class without examination for the academic session 2020-21. The decision came in view of the closure of schools during the COVID-19 pandemic. The decision will be applicable to all government, government-aided and also un-aided private schools under the School and Mass Education Department.

Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Wednesday said that COVID-19 has taught us that no country is immune to global disasters. "We are witnessing an event that is being termed a once-in-a-hundred-year disaster...The pandemic has shown us that innovation to address global challenges can come from anywhere," PM Modi said during the International Conference on Disaster Resilient Infrastructure.

Three Indian shuttlers have tested positive for COVID-19 ahead of the All England Open, said India's coach. The names of the players, who have tested positive, could not be confirmed. Meanwhile, many others are awaiting confirmation on their inconclusive samples, including Saina Nehwal and Parupalli Kashyap. "No reports of the COVID-19 test done 30 hours before," Saina tweeted.

The Federation of Western India Cine Employees (FWICE) on Tuesday issued a non-cooperation notice for two months against actress Gauahar Khan for allegedly violating the COVID-19 rules. This comes after BMC booked her for allegedly going out for a film shoot despite testing positive for COVID-19. Gauahar's team earlier issued a statement saying she tested negative in multiple reports.

As many as 36 students, all aged between 13-15, have tested positive for COVID-19 at a residential school in Keesara near Hyderabad. All the infected students are from the Telangana Minorities Welfare Residential School. "All of them [students] have been isolated...A full-time medical camp has been set up to monitor positive and negative students," said District Medical and Health Officer.

Actor Nagarjuna Akkineni, who predominantly works in the Telugu film industry, received the first shot of COVID-19 vaccine on Tuesday at a hospital in Hyderabad. Taking to Twitter, the actor shared a picture of him getting vaccinated and wrote, "Got my #covaxin jab...absolutely no down time." He added, "I urge whoever is eligible to take the vaccine!!"

Beijing has made it mandatory for people coming from India and 19 other countries to get themselves inoculated with Chinese-made COVID-19 vaccines if they wish to travel to China. China's state-run Global Times reported that the countries include Pakistan, Australia, South Korea and Nigeria among others. Notably, Chinese-made vaccines are not available in India.

The Centre on Wednesday identified 70 'districts of concern' that witnessed a surge in coronavirus cases from March 1-15. Out of these 70 districts, 13 are from Maharashtra, with Maharashtra's Nanded district witnessing a 385% increase in coronavirus cases. India recorded its highest one-day tally of coronavirus cases in 2021 in the last 24 hours with 28,903 new infections.

Filmmaker-actor Satish Kaushik has tested positive for coronavirus. He took to Twitter on Wednesday to share the news and wrote, "I would request everyone to get tested, who came in contact with me in the last few days. I am home quarantined." Several celebrities, including Anupam Kher, Hansal Mehta and Anup Soni, wished Satish a speedy recovery from coronavirus.

Maharashtra has recorded 23,179 new COVID-19 cases in the last 24 hours, its highest single-day spike of this year. This has taken the total number of coronavirus cases in the state to 23,70,507 while active cases stand at 1,52,760. A total of 9,138 discharges and 84 deaths were recorded in the last 24 hours.

Delhi on Wednesday reported a single-day rise of more than 500 coronavirus cases for the first time since January 1. The number of new cases in the National Capital in the last 24 hours stood at 536, taking the total to 6,45,025 cases. Three new deaths due to coronavirus have also been reported in the last 24 hours.

Actress Gauahar Khan, who has recently been booked in a case for allegedly flouting the coronavirus guidelines, addressed the controversy indirectly as she remembered her late father by posting his old picture on Instagram. She wrote, "I miss you, papa. But you are in a better place than this slanderous world. May Allah keep you in love and truth."

YSRCP leader and Lok Sabha MP Sanjeev Kumar Singari on Wednesday asked the government to 'not waste' ?35,000 crore on COVID-19 vaccination. "Now the government is proposing to spend ?35,000 crore on COVID-19 vaccination, this is a waste of money in my view. COVID-19 vaccine saves us only for 6-9 months after that ?35,000 crore will be evaporated," he stated.

Uttar Pradesh Health Minister Jai Pratap Singh said the situation in the state is not "as alarming as in other states, so there is no need to impose any night curfew or lockdown". However, people should follow COVID-19 protocol, guidelines, he added. The government is focused more on the preventive steps before it takes an alarming proposition, Singh further said.

Former Union Minister and BJP leader Dilip Gandhi passed away on Wednesday morning. He had tested positive for COVID-19 and was undergoing treatment at a hospital in Delhi. PM Narendra Modi expressed grief and said, "He will be remembered for his rich contributions to community service and helping the poor. He made numerous efforts to strengthen the BJP in Maharashtra."

American automaker Ford unveiled its 'flexible hybrid work model' that allows over 30,000 employees to choose to work from home even after the COVID-19 pandemic gets over. The employees may stay at home for "heads-down work," while coming to the office for meetings and team-building activities. The system will debut as soon as July.

Leg-spinner Rahul Sharma, who has represented India in four ODIs and two T20Is, took to Twitter to reveal that his father passed away due to coronavirus. "I am sorry I couldn't save you from coronavirus. Without you, life is not same dad," he wrote. "God, please take care of my dad," he further wrote.

Investors' wealth fell by around ?3.6 lakh crore on Wednesday after the Sensex plunged 562 points or 1.12% to close at 49,801.62 amid concerns over the rising COVID-19 cases in the country. The broader Nifty 50 fell 189.15 points or 1.27% to settle at 14,721.30. ONGC, Sun Pharma and SBI were among the top losers on the Sensex.

Japanese automaker Honda Motor has said that supply chain issues will result in some production cuts next week at all US and Canadian plants. It cited the impact from COVID-19, congestion at various ports, the global microchip shortage and severe winter weather over the last few weeks. Honda usually produces about 30,000 vehicles a week in the US and Canada.

India has reported 28,903 new COVID-19 cases in the last 24 hours which is the highest number of cases reported in a day in 2021. The country reported 188 deaths in the last 24 hours, taking the COVID-19 death toll to 1,59,044. The total COVID-19 cases in the country stand at 1,14,38,734, while the active cases stand at 2,34,406.

Pune Mayor Murlidhar Mohol on Tuesday said that there is no need to impose complete lockdown in the city as of yet despite the spike in COVID-19 cases there. He added that the health authorities in the district have set up micro containment zones, increased screening and testing to control the recent surge. On Tuesday, Pune reported 3,574 fresh cases.

The Madhya Pradesh government on Tuesday announced that night curfew will be imposed in Bhopal and Indore from March 17 amid rise in coronavirus cases. Whereas markets in Jabalpur, Gwalior, Ujjain, Ratlam, Burhanpur, Chhindwara, Betul and Khargone will shut at 10 pm, from March 17, it stated, adding, "There won't be curfew in these cities."

Filmmaker Anees Bazmee, while talking about shooting Kartik Aaryan-starrer 'Bhool Bhulaiyaa 2' amid the coronavirus pandemic, said, "Everybody is happy that work has finally started." However, he added that people are a little scared and cautious too. Anees further said they're shooting with a lot of precautions, adding, "It's a new normal, but not very normal for us."

Hollywood actor Jamie Dornan's father, Dr Jim Dornan, passed away on Monday at the age of 73. He reportedly died after contracting coronavirus. "Everyone at NIPANC was saddened to read Jess Dornan's post telling us of her father's battle against COVID-19," the Northern Ireland Pancreatic Cancer group, of which Jim was the president, had mentioned on Instagram on Saturday.

Coronavirus cases in the world rose to over 12 crore on Tuesday while deaths from virus crossed 26 lakh, according to Johns Hopkins University tracker. The US is the worst-coronavirus hit country with over 2.9 crore cases followed by Brazil at over 1.15 crore and India at over 1.13 crore cases. Over 6.8 crore people have recovered from COVID-19 globally.

The remaining three T20Is between India and England in Ahmedabad will be played behind closed doors. The Gujarat Cricket Association (GCA) said the decision has been taken considering the increasing number of coronavirus cases. The GCA will refund the spectators who had purchased tickets for the games. The remaining three matches will be played on March 16, 18 and 20.

Brazil President Jair Bolsonaro has named its fourth Health Minister since the beginning of the coronavirus pandemic. General Eduardo Pazuello will be replaced by cardiologist Marcelo Queiroga, Bolsonaro said. Pazuello, who took over in May 2020, has been criticised for lacking public health expertise and slow vaccine rollout. Pazuello's two predecessors had quit amid disagreements with Bolsonaro.

Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Tuesday held a virtual summit with his Finnish counterpart Sanna Marin. In his opening speech PM Modi said, "More than 58 million made-in-India coronavirus vaccine doses had reached about 70 countries." Acknowledging the effort, Marin said: "I want to recognise the efforts of India in an extensive vaccination program."

Health Minister Harsh Vardhan told Rajya Sabha on Tuesday that coronavirus vaccines are not being sent to other countries at the expense of the people of India. "Experts...and a committee of the government are maintaining a sensible balance about it," he added. Over 30 lakh people were vaccinated in 24 hours, the highest so far, Health Ministry tweeted on Tuesday.

The WHO said its global coronavirus vaccine rollout remains unaffected despite several countries suspending the use of AstraZeneca's vaccine. The Oxford-AstraZeneca vaccines used for the COVAX programme are being produced in India and South Korea and the suspension have been ordered over batches made in Europe, it added. The COVAX scheme aims to distribute vaccines for free to poor countries.

Sweden has become the latest country to temporarily suspend the use of the Oxford-AstraZeneca COVID-19 vaccine over blood clot concerns. The Swedish health agency said that the move is precautionary and will wait for the European Medicines Agency to finish its investigation into suspected side effects. Several other European nations, including Germany and France, have also suspended its use.

Domestic indices opened on a positive note on Tuesday morning with BSE Sensex up by 260 points to 50,650 and Nifty reclaiming the 15,000-mark. However, the market closed with Sensex 30 points lower at 50,363 and Nifty dipping below 15,000. On Monday, Sensex fell by over 1,000 points against the backdrop of new macroeconomic data and rising COVID-19 cases.

Amid rising cases of COVID-19 in Maharashtra, the Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) has set a target of inoculating one lakh people in Mumbai city every day, BMC officials said on Tuesday. This comes after the Central government allowed round-the-clock vaccination in private hospitals. Currently, 40,000 to 45,000 people are being given vaccine shots in Mumbai every day, BMC officials added.

China has approved a new COVID-19 vaccine for emergency use last week, a fourth such vaccine to be given emergency use approval. Gao Fu, the head of China's Centre for Disease Control, developed the protein subunit vaccine for emergency use, the Chinese Academy of Sciences' Institute of Microbiology said. The vaccine's phase-3 trials are ongoing in Uzbekistan, Pakistan and Indonesia.

Thailand PM Prayut Chan-o-cha on Tuesday became the first person to receive the Oxford-AstraZeneca vaccine in the country, saying he is doing so "to boost confidence for the general public". Earlier, Thailand temporarily put a hold on the vaccine as many European nations halted its use, citing blood clot fears. However, the country resumed inoculations using the vaccine on Tuesday.

Actor Manoj Bajpayee, who recently tested positive for COVID-19, said he is "recovering slowly". "I'm quarantined because of being infected by coronavirus. I was infected because someone else was not following the rule," he stated. Talking about his symptoms, Manoj added, "You feel weak, you have headaches and many other discomforts. Because of my symptoms, I'm mostly sleeping or resting."

The European Union drug regulator European Medicines Agency's Executive Director Emer Cooke has said that there was "no indication" Oxford-AstraZeneca's coronavirus vaccine is the cause of reported blood clots. "The experts will meet again on Thursday to come to a conclusion and to advise whether there are any further actions that need to be taken," Cooke added.

Canadian PM Justin Trudeau has said that the Oxford-AstraZeneca COVID-19 vaccine is "both safe and effective" amid blood clot concerns.  "We are obviously watching what is happening with a specific batch in Europe. We can reassure all Canadians that no AstraZeneca doses came from the same batch," Trudeau added. The country had approved the AstraZeneca coronavirus vaccine last month.

Over 20 countries have suspended the use of AstraZeneca's COVID-19 vaccine over fears the shot may have caused blood clots in some recipients. Sweden and Latvia on Tuesday became the latest nations to halt the rollout. Other countries include: Germany, Italy, France, Spain, Denmark, Norway, Luxembourg, Cyprus, Portugal, Slovenia, Indonesia, Ireland, Bulgaria, Congo, Thailand, Romania and Austria.

Two doctors in Maharashtra's Pimpri-Chinchwad tested positive for COVID-19 even after receiving their second dose of vaccine. Dr Yashwant Ingale, one of the doctors who contracted the virus, said he tested positive for coronavirus nearly 20 days after receiving the vaccine. PCMC Additional Health chief Dr Pavan Salve said that such incidents are rare, but not surprising.

India has emerged as the dominant supplier of COVID-19 vaccines that can protect people from the novel coronavirus, Biocon Chairperson Kiran Mazumdar Shaw said on Tuesday. "India has been a world pioneer in vaccine development and caters to 60% of the world's vaccine requirement," she added. India has vaccinated more than 32 million citizens against COVID-19, official data showed.

BMC Education Department issued an order asking all schools in its jurisdiction to discontinue 50% rotational attendance rule from March 17. Teachers will take their classes in 'work from home' pattern with help of e-learning platforms until further orders, the department stated. This comes amid rising coronavirus cases in the city.

Two days after taking the first dose of coronavirus vaccine, Gujarat Minister Ishwarsinh Patel on Monday tested positive for COVID-19. He tweeted, "Today my corona test came positive. Good luck and blessings to all of you. I'm currently in good health." He also urged people who came in his contact in the last few days to get tested for coronavirus.

The Pune Municipal Corporation (PMC) on Tuesday reportedly decided to reserve Covishield for those residents who have been inoculated with it already and need it for the second dose. Due to shortage of Covishield stock, the PMC has made only Covaxin available for those beneficiaries who are yet to receive their first dose of Covid-19 vaccine, an officer reportedly said.

British PM Boris Johnson on Tuesday said that the Oxford-AstraZeneca COVID-19 vaccine "is safe and works extremely well". "It's being made in multiple places from India to the US, as well as Britain, and it's being used around the world," he added. Johnson's comments came after several European countries suspended the use of the vaccine over blood clot fears.

Himachal Pradesh Health Minister Rajiv Saizal on Tuesday said the state has not reported any death due to COVID-19 vaccination. While speaking in the state Assembly, he added that the death of an Anganwadi worker a few days after receiving a dose of the vaccine was unrelated. However, the viscera report of the deceased was awaited, the minister said.

Sahara India Pariwar's Chairman Subrata Roy Sahara took the first dose of the COVID-19 vaccine on Tuesday in Lucknow. "It is our duty to get vaccinated in order to strengthen the global fight against COVID-19," he said. He appealed to all those who are eligible to take the vaccine and said that vaccines developed in India are safe and effective.

Spain, Germany, France and Italy have become the latest European countries to temporarily halt the rollout of the Oxford-AstraZeneca COVID-19 vaccine over blood clot concerns. The countries said the measure was a "precaution" while the European Medicines Agency (EMA) looks into the matter. Meanwhile, the WHO said there was no evidence that the incidents were caused by the vaccine.

Pune Divisional Commissioner Saurabh Rao has tested COVID-19 positive, days after he received the first dose of the vaccine. His second dose was due on March 23, health officials said. Rao had chaired a COVID-19 review meeting on Monday that was attended by officials from Pune Municipal Corporation and Pimpri Chinchwad Municipal Corporation.

Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman and US Treasury Secretary Janet Yellen on Monday discussed global economic outlook and exchanged notes on economic issues of mutual interest. Yellen appreciated India's contribution to the world's vaccine efforts while FM congratulated Yellen on the $1.9 trillion COVID-19 relief package. The two leaders agreed to work closely through strategic collaboration.

Venezuelan Vice President Delcy Rodriguez said that the country will not authorise Oxford-AstraZeneca COVID-19 vaccine, citing unspecified "effects on patients". This comes after some European countries, including France and Germany, suspended the use of vaccine over blood clot concerns. Venezuela began its COVID-19 vaccination drive in February with Russia's Sputnik V and China's Sinopharm jabs.

Russia on Tuesday said that the pressure on some countries to not buy its Sputnik V COVID-19 vaccine is at unprecedented levels. "Such selfish attempts to force countries to abandon any vaccines have no prospects," it added. Russia's comments were in response to a US government report that claims America had tried to persuade "Brazil to reject the Russian...vaccine".

Around three people in Gujarat's Surat have received COVID-19 inoculation certificates without receiving the vaccine dose. These three persons were scheduled to get vaccinated on March 13 at a health centre. The Deputy Municipal Commissioner (Health) said the incident happened due to some technical glitch, which they are trying to fix. "We're discussing the matter with IT department," he added.

China has said it'll be donating 3,00,000 coronavirus vaccine doses to UN peacekeepers, with "priority given to the peacekeeping missions in Africa". "This is a further step to make China's vaccines a global public good and also a demonstration of China's...continuous support to the UN and multilateralism," it added. Last month, India pledged two lakh vaccine doses for UN peacekeepers.

Kewal Krishan,107, who was also part of the drafting committee of the Constituent Assembly of India, received the COVID-19 vaccine on Monday in Delhi. According to Fortis Escorts Heart Institute where he received the vaccine, Krishan is the oldest person in India to be vaccinated against COVID-19. "We hope this action will encourage people to get vaccinated," the hospital said.

Hyderabad-based Gland Pharma's shares jumped 10% to hit a record high after the company said it has struck a deal with Russian Direct Investment Fund to produce the Sputnik V COVID-19 vaccine. Under the deal, Gland Pharma will supply up to 25.2 crore doses. The production is expected to commence from third quarter of 2021 for delivery from fourth quarter.

Vaccine makers Serum Institute of India (SII) and Bharat Biotech on Monday urged the Supreme Court to restrain High Courts from entertaining petitions related to prioritising COVID-19 vaccinations for judges and lawyers. The two firms said only the Supreme Court should deal with the issue as it is a ?pan-India" matter and to not "create confusion".

In a first, Punjab's Ludhiana administration has decided to extend the COVID-19 vaccination drive to the employees of all government/private banks, government/private schools, the staff of food grain agencies, judicial officers/court staff/advocates and journalists. Further, NGO workers who worked to check the spread of the COVID-19 pandemic will also be included, officials said.

BMC has decided to run evening shifts at its own COVID-19 vaccination centres to boost vaccination drive in Mumbai. However, Additional Commissioner (Western Suburbs) Suresh Kakani said that they don't expect huge crowd at night. "I've instructed centres to be open till last person in queue is vaccinated instead of waiting for people to turn up at night," he added.

Shiromani Akali Dal president Sukhbir Singh Badal tested positive for COVID-19 on Tuesday. The 58-year-old leader took to Twitter to inform that he has isolated himself. Several political leaders have contracted the virus that has infected over 1.13 crore people in India. India on Monday reported 26,291 new cases of COVID-19, its highest single-day spike in 85 days.

Haryana Health Minister Anil Vij tweeted that 1,58,901 people were vaccinated for COVID-19 on Monday in Haryana. "A total of 6,81,264 persons have been vaccinated in the state so far," Vij added. According to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare data, there are 3,212 active COVID-19 cases and 3,077 people have died of the virus so far in Haryana.

The Karnataka government hasn't taken any decision on night curfew or lockdown yet, said CM BS Yediyurappa. "We'll wait and watch for another week before taking a final decision," he added. After chairing a meeting with senior officials and health experts, Yediyurappa appealed to the people of the state to take precautions against COVID-19 if they didn't want lockdown again.

Delhi reported 425 fresh COVID-19 cases on Tuesday, taking the city's caseload to 6,44,489, according to the health department data. The death toll reached 10,945 after one more person succumbed to the disease in the last 24 hours. The number of active cases rose to 2,488 on Tuesday from 2,321 on Monday, the data showed.

Bihar Education Minister Vijay Kumar Choudhary on Tuesday informed the state Assembly that the government will look into the issue of private schools charging tuition fees from students during the COVID-19 pandemic. However, Choudhary said, there is no provision in the law as per which the government can ask any private school to waive fees for a particular period.

The Parliamentary Standing Committee on Home Affairs has found that the COVID-19 lockdown led to a "sudden spurt in domestic violence and trafficking of women and children". "This was mainly due to disruption in economic activities, work from home and families spending more time at home," the report stated. The committee is headed by Congress Rajya Sabha MP Anand Sharma.

As many as 30,39,394 people were vaccinated against COVID-19 in 24 hours, the highest in a day so far, the Health Ministry stated. The total number of people inoculated against COVID-19 stands at 3,29,47,432, out of which 58,67,948 have taken the second dose. The vaccination of beneficiaries above the age of 60 reached one crore within 15 days.

A video of cricketer Jasprit Bumrah and sports presenter Sanjana Ganesan's wedding has gone viral on social media. The duo got married on Monday in Goa and as per reports, only around 20 people attended the wedding due to the COVID-19 pandemic. In the video that went viral, the duo can be seen exchanging garlands as part of 'varmala' ceremony.

India saw a spike of 24,492 COVID-19 cases and 131 related deaths in the last 24 hours, according to Union Health Ministry. With this new surge, the total number of COVID-19 cases in the country rose to 1,14,09,831 and the death toll climbed to 1,58,856. Meanwhile, with 15,051 COVID-19 cases, Maharashtra continues to report most number of cases in India.

Citing the impact of COVID-19 related restrictions, the 110-year-old British chocolatier and retailer Thorntons has said it would close all 61 UK stores, putting 603 jobs at risk. "The obstacles we have faced and will continue to face on the High Street are too severe," said Thorntons retail director Adam Goddard. Thorntons was acquired by Italian group Ferrero in 2015.

The Maharashtra government has issued new guidelines to contain the spread of COVID-19 in the state. All cinema halls, restaurants and hotels will operate at 50% capacity, while no social/cultural/political/religious gatherings will be allowed until March 31. Not more than 50 people will be allowed to attend weddings. All offices except related to essential services shall work with 50% attendance.

Actress Gauahar Khan's team has issued a statement after BMC filed an FIR against her for shooting while being COVID-19 positive. "She?s tested negative in multiple reports. She's...complying with all the norms of BMC," the team said. "We want Gauahar's time to her self, respectfully and let her heart heal in this mourning time," it added citing her father's demise.

Amid rising COVID-19 cases in Pune, owners and firms operating halls and venues rented out for weddings in the city have complained of various cancellations. "With restrictions being enforced, customers want to book for July now and the situation is bleak for wedding hall owners," said Shripal Oswal, President, wedding hall association of Pune.

Imposing a fresh lockdown is not an answer to the increasing COVID-19 cases in Maharashtra but restrictions will be made stricter, said state Health Minister Rajesh Tope. Though the number of cases has increased in the last few days, the mortality rate remains low, he added. Maharashtra recorded this year's highest one-day spike of 16,620 new cases on Sunday.

HSBC Holdings's main office in Hong Kong has been shut until further notice after three people working in the building tested positive for COVID-19. Visitors who stayed at the building for more than two hours between March 2 and 15 would also be required to undergo mandatory COVID-19 tests, reported Bloomberg. The latest outbreak was traced back to a gym.

Senior Congress leader Digvijaya Singh on Tuesday criticised the Centre over allowing lakhs of people to gather in Uttarakhand for Kumbh in view of rising COVID-19 cases. "While there is a ban on cricket fans to go to the stadium to enjoy a match, lakhs of devotees are being allowed to congregate in Uttarakhand's Kumbh. Thanks!" Singh tweeted.

Union Minister Piyush Goyal on Tuesday remarked that "people criticised lockdown, but had it not been done, the continuation of train services would have spread COVID-19 across the country". Goyal further said that Railways arranged about 4,600 'Shramik Special' trains for migrant labourers along with the distribution of about 2 crore free meals and water bottles.

The Bengaluru International Film Festival (BIFFes), which was scheduled to be held from March 24 to March 31, has been postponed indefinitely due to surge in COVID-19 cases in Bengaluru, an official said on Monday. According to the organisers, the decision was taken "in pursuance of the observations issued by the Health and Family Welfare Services department".

Health insurance coverage saw a growth of 69.8% during the months after the COVID-19 pandemic hit, MoS for Finance Anurag Thakur informed the Lok Sabha. The number of lives covered under health insurance business from April-September 2020 stood at 30.22 crore as against 17.83 crore during the same period a year ago, as per data by the insurance regulator IRDAI.

Mahindra Group Chairman Anand Mahindra took to Twitter to voice his concern about the rising COVID-19 cases in Maharashtra and said, "Maharashtra needs emergency permission to vaccinate every willing person." "The state is the nerve-centre of the country's economic activity and more lockdowns will be debilitating," he added. The state recorded over 16,000 cases on Sunday, the highest this year.

Actress Rituparna Sengupta took to social media to share that she has tested positive for COVID-19. "I want to inform you all that I am feeling fine. I am asymptomatic and following all the required protocols and precautions advised by my doctor and authorities. I am currently in Singapore and have quarantined myself at [a] recovery centre," she wrote.

The domestic airport sector may incur a net loss of ?5,400 crore in the ongoing financial year owing to COVID-19 related restrictions, ICRA said. The rating agency said that passenger traffic declined 66% year-on-year. "The path to recovery in case of airports is longer, domestic air travel is expected to recover back to pre-COVID levels by FY23," ICRA added.

Director Sanjay Leela Bhansali, who had reportedly tested positive for COVID-19 last week, will resume the shoot of 'Gangubai Kathiawadi' with actress Alia Bhatt by March-end, according to reports. "The remaining portions with Ajay Devgn will be shot later once fresh dates are allotted by the actor,? the reports stated. Meanwhile, Alia has tested negative for COVID-19.

Mumbai has reported 1,922 fresh cases of COVID-19 in the last 24 hours. According to the Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation's (BMC) bulletin, 246 buildings in the city have been sealed as more than five people had tested positive for COVID-19 in these buildings. While the city reported 1,712 fresh COVID-19 cases on Monday, 1,962 new cases were reported on Sunday.

Karnataka Minister S Suresh Kumar on Monday said that action will be initiated against schools that have resumed offline classes for students from Classes 1 to 5. This step is being taken by the state administration due to rising COVID-19 cases. Kumar added that the state government had only allowed schools to conduct physical classes for students from Class 6.

An investigation has been launched after a man called police and said that he would set himself on fire if the ongoing India-England T20I series at Narendra Modi Stadium in Ahmedabad was not cancelled amid rising COVID-19 cases. He identified himself as Pankaj Patel from Gandhinagar. Meanwhile, the Gujarat Cricket Association said the remaining T20Is will be played without spectators.

Mumbai Mayor Kishori Pednekar on Monday said that Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) is reviewing city's COVID-19 situation for "next 48 hours, following which a night curfew might be announced in the financial capital". "We've requested residents repeatedly to wear masks but they aren't listening...If the situation continues, we'll be forced to implement night curfew/lockdown," she added.

Danish Medicines Agency said on Sunday that the 60-year old woman who died of a blood clot after getting AstraZeneca coronavirus vaccine had "highly unusual" symptoms. It added that woman had a low number of blood platelets and clots in small and large vessels, along with bleeding. Denmark temporarily stopped using the vaccine last week after cases of blood clots.

India has reported 26,291 new COVID-19 cases in the last 24 hours, which is the highest daily number of cases reported for the fifth consecutive day in 2021. India reported 118 deaths in the last 24 hours, taking the death toll to 1,58,725. The total COVID-19 cases in the country stand at 1,13,85,339, while the active cases stand at 2,19,262.

A youth office in the Mexico City government has deployed Mexico's famous Lucha libre wrestlers in various markets to enforce the use of face masks amid coronavirus spread. A video shared by Reuters showed the wrestlers putting face masks on people roaming around in public without covering their faces. It showed the wrestlers spraying people who resisted with disinfectants.

Union Ministry of Health and Family Welfare (MoHFW) announced on Monday that India has administered over 3.15 crore COVID-19 vaccine doses. The vaccination drive against COVID-19 was launched on January 16. While healthcare and frontline workers were vaccinated in the first phase, people aged above 60 years and those above 45 with comorbidities are being vaccinated in the second phase.

The World Health Organization (WHO) has urged countries not to pause vaccinations against coronavirus after several European countries suspended the use of the Oxford-AstraZeneca COVID-19 vaccine over safety fears. Denmark and Norway have reported isolated cases of bleeding, blood clots and a low platelet count after administering the vaccine. Indonesia delayed its roll-out for the same reason.

China has administered nearly 6.5 crore doses of coronavirus vaccines to its citizens, a Chinese official said. Teams have been dispatched nationwide to oversee vaccinations and are working with targeted groups according to a schedule, the official added. China aims to vaccinate nearly 90 to 100 crore of its citizens against coronavirus by the summer of 2022.

Celebrities like Harry Styles, Taylor Swift, Billie Eilish, Noah Cyrus, Dua Lipa, Lizzo and Bruno Mars attended the 2021 Grammy Awards' red carpet event on Monday, despite the limitations due to the coronavirus pandemic. While Harry wore a lavender fake fur boa over a checkered wool jacket by Gucci, Billie wore a custom Gucci floral jacquard shirt and matching pants.

Facebook has started adding labels to posts that discuss the safety of the COVID-19 vaccines and will soon label all vaccine posts. It's launching a tool in the US to help users get information about where to get vaccines. A Facebook research said a small group of users is behind driving conversations raising doubts over vaccines, The Washington Post reported.

PM Narendra Modi has called an urgent meeting of CMs of all states on Wednesday amid a surge in cases of coronavirus in some parts of the country. The meeting will be through video conferencing at 12:30 PM. India on Monday reported 26,291 fresh COVID-19 cases- its highest single-day spike in 85 days- pushing the country's infection tally to 1,13,85,339.

After US-based Freedom House and Sweden-based V-Dem Institute criticised India over freedom and democracy, External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar called it "hypocrisy". He said, "[Y]ou have a set of self-appointed custodians of the world, who find it very difficult to stomach that somebody in India is not looking for their approval." He added India gave COVID-19 vaccines to 70 countries.

Delhi High Court and all district courts of Delhi on Monday resumed physical hearing of cases. Lawyer Vikas Singh said, "Resuming of the physical hearing will help in improving the financial condition of various lawyers who've suffered due to coronavirus pandemic." Ranjit Gambhir, a 66-year-old advocate, said that virtual hearings should've been continued as the threat of COVID-19 still exists.

New COVID-19 vaccines, including ones that don't require needles and can be stored at room temperature, are coming, World Health Organization's top scientist Soumya Swaminathan said. They may be ready for use later this year or next year, she added. Swaminathan also said that six-to-eight new immunisations may complete clinical studies and undergo regulatory review by the end of 2021.

Pune Police has filed cases against owners and managers of four restaurants in Koregaon Park for allegedly flouting COVID-19 guidelines. The restaurants had more customers than the permitted capacity, read a statement issued by the police. As per the city administration's orders, the restaurants and eateries are required to display their seating capacity and the number of customers present.

Filmmaker Dibakar Banerjee said that he is happy that his directorial 'Sandeep Aur Pinky Faraar' is releasing in the middle of COVID-19 pandemic. He added that the places shown in the film were not accessible to people last year. Dibakar said, "It's all about the outdoors, the roads of Delhi, the hills of Uttarakhand, the buses and the train stations."

Zydus Cadila has reportedly proposed a price of ?1,900 for its three-dose COVID-19 vaccine ZyCoV-D that can be given to those above 12 years of age. The government is negotiating the price and a final decision is likely this week, PTI reported citing sources. The company also has a needle-free jet injector that can administer around 20,000 doses, reports said.

New Zealand's PM Jacinda Ardern on Monday said that the country will phase out its strategy of eliminating coronavirus amid a persistent Delta outbreak. Ardern announced that the government will focus its efforts on vaccinations and ease lockdown restrictions. Last year, New Zealand was among just a handful of countries to bring COVID-19 cases down to zero.

The European Medicines Agency (EMA) on Monday gave its backing to booster shots of the Pfizer-BioNTech COVID-19 vaccine for people aged 18 and above. The European Union's drug regulator said that the booster shot "may be considered at least 6 months after the second dose". The EMA's recomendations will be sent to health authorities in all 27 EU nations.

As many as 196 daily coronavirus cases were recorded in Bengaluru, as per the data released by the city's civic body on Sunday. This brings the total number of positive cases in the city to 12,47,092. The data also showed that the number of active containment zones decreased to 70 as compared to 82 reported for September 30.

Supreme Court has approved ex-gratia compensation of ?50,000 for families of COVID-19 victims. It said no state will deny the benefit if cause of death is not shown as COVID-19 in death certificates, adding, the authorities can modify certificates on production of essential documents. The court asked the states to disburse the amount within 30 days of submission of application.

The Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) on Monday informed the Bombay High Court that the city is safe and the civic body doesn't see the third wave of COVID-19 coming. BMC added that vaccination against COVID-19 is going on smoothly and there is no shortage of vaccines now. As many as 2,586 bed-ridden people have been fully vaccinated, BMC added.

Health Minister Mansukh Mandaviya on Monday announced that 70% of India's adult population has been administered the first dose of the COVID-19 vaccine. He tweeted, "Under PM Narendra Modi, India is achieving new landmarks in the fight against the pandemic." According to officials, 25% population has been administered both doses. Over 90 crore total doses have been administered so far.

Health Minister Mansukh Mandaviya on Monday launched ICMR's Drone Response and Outreach in North East (i-Drone), a delivery model to transport life-saving vaccines. He said, for the first time a 'Make in India' drone has been used in South Asia to transport COVID-19 vaccines between two locations over an aerial distance of 15 km in 12-15 minutes in Manipur.

India has reported 20,799 new COVID-19 cases and 180 deaths in the last 24 hours. This comes a day after the country saw 22,842 cases and 244 deaths. Kerala reported 12,297 cases and 74 deaths on Sunday. India's active caseload stood at 2,64,458, the lowest in 200 days, while the death toll reached 4,48,997.

Delhi reported 34 new COVID-19 cases and zero related deaths, according to data shared by the health department on Monday. With the new cases, Delhi's infection tally climbed to 14,39,000, while the case positivity rate stood at 0.10%. According to data, 1.82 crore vaccine doses have been administered in Delhi since the inoculation exercise started on January 16.

Schools in Mumbai reopened for classes 8-12 on Monday in adherence to COVID-19 linked protocols. A teacher of Bai Kabibai English School & Jr College said, "We'll welcome students with flowers and sweets." Meanwhile, a student said he's happy he would meet his friends after a long time. Maharashtra Education Minister Varsha Eknath Gaikwad also visited a school in Sion.

The BBMP has started collecting data in anticipation of a COVID-19 vaccine rollout for children aged 12-18 years. As per BBMP Chief Comissioner Gaurav Gupta, the data is being collected to analyse whether vaccination for children can be carried out at PHCs or on a ward-to-ward basis. He added, officials will also mark households with children during block-level vaccination drives.

German Ambassador to India Walter J Lindner has said that Germany hasn't recognised Covaxin COVID-19 vaccine so far. He said that people who travel after being administered with Covaxin would have to undergo quarantine and get themselves tested in Germany. "Once Covaxin is recognised by WHO, then we'll see whether we can recognise it," he added.

The Mumba Devi Temple in Mumbai will reopen for devotees who have received both doses of the COVID-19 vaccine from October 7, the first day of the Navratri festival. A negative COVID-19 test report is a must for those who are not fully vaccinated. Flowers, garlands and prasad will not be allowed in the temple.

Around 1.05 crore COVID-19 vaccine doses have been administered and 47% of the population has been vaccinated against coronavirus in the Pune district since the imunisation programe started in January 2021. With almost 25 lakh doses administered, September saw the highest number of vaccinations as compared to 18.78 lakh people inoculated in August.

Pune district reported 573 new COVID-19 cases on Saturday while 652 people were discharged from the hospitals. Nine people succumbed to the virus. There are 6,141 active COVID-19 patients in the district and 2,660 of them are admitted to hospitals while 3,481 are in home isolation, according to District Health Officer (DHO) Dr Bhagwan Pawar.

India has reported 22,842 new COVID-19 cases and 244 deaths in the last 24 hours. This comes a day after the country saw 24,354 cases and 234 deaths. Kerala reported 13,217 cases and 121 deaths on Saturday. India's active caseload stood at 2,70,557, the lowest in 199 days. India's total cases reached 3,38,13,903, while the death toll surged to 4,48,817.

With the Brazilian presidential election one year away, tens of thousands of people across Brazil protested against President Jair Bolsonaro on Saturday. The protesters called for Bolsonaro to be impeached over his government's handling of the coronavirus pandemic. Brazil is one of the worst coronavirus-hit countries globally with nearly 5.98 lakh COVID-19 deaths and more than 2.14 crore cases.

Madhya Pradesh Congress chief Kamal Nath has challenged CM Shivraj Singh Chouhan to have a race with him. "There is a lot of debate over my health. Shivraj is saying that [I am] sick and old," Kamal Nath said. He added that he went to Delhi for his post-COVID-19 check-up because he had pneumonia.

German company BioNTech's CEO U?ur ?ahin has said that a new vaccine formula will likely be needed by mid-2022 to protect against future virus mutations. He told the Financial Times that the current variants, such as the delta strain, weren't different enough to undermine current vaccinations. He predicted that new strains will emerge that can evade booster shots.

The Uttar Pradesh government has decided to withdraw the COVID-19 violation cases registered in the state. In a meeting chaired by CM Yogi Adityanath on Sunday, the state home ministry was instructed to dissolve the cases. Over 90,000 COVID-19 violation cases were reportedly registered across the state during the first and second waves of the pandemic.

National Imunization Technical Advisory Group (NTAGI) chief Dr NK Arora on Sunday said children with comorbidities will be prioritised for COVID-19 vaccination when it begins in India. He added rest of the children who are healthy will be imunised subsequently. He said arrangements are also being made to provide these vaccines to children in their district to avoid their travel.

Delhi has reported 33 new cases of COVID-19 and zero deaths in a day while the positivity rate stood at 0.07%, according to data shared by the health department on Sunday. With the new cases, the coronavirus infection tally in the national capital climbed to 14,38,966. Of this, over 14.13 lakh patients have recovered from the disease.

Russia on Sunday reported 890 COVID-19 deaths in the past 24 hours, making it the fifth time in a week that deaths have hit a new high in the country. Russia reported 25,769 COVID-19 cases during the same period, the second-highest one-day jump in cases for 2021 so far. However, officials said there are no plans to impose a lockdown.

The Pimpri Chinchwad Municipal Corporation on Sunday said it'll ensure that standard operating guidelines are followed strictly in its jurisdiction as schools for some classes will reopen on Monday. PCMC inspectors will visit schools on a daily basis to check if COVID-19 rules are followed. The Municipal Comissioner has allowed reopening of schools for classes 8 to 12 from Monday.

The Haryana government on Sunday extended the COVID-19 curbs in the state till October 18. However, it allowed Residential Universities and Industrial Training institutes to conduct offline classes while adhering to COVID-19 appropriate behaviour. Hostel students may be given priority for getting fully vaccinated, it added. It also mandated following COVID-19 norms ahead of the festivals.

Pune district reported 765 new coronavirus cases on Friday, while 624 people were discharged from hospitals and six succumbed to the virus. Of the new cases, 155 were reported in Pune Municipal Corporation, 136 in Pimpri Chinchwad Municipal Corporation, 37 in municipal councils, 12 in cantonments and 425 in rural areas. The active caseload in the district stands at 6,229.

Delhi on Saturday reported 33 new COVID-19 cases and one death. As per the health bulletin, 58 recoveries were reported in the last 24 hours, taking the total recoveries to 14,13,462. With 383 active COVID-19 cases and a positivity rate of 0.05%, the cumulative cases in Delhi stand at 14,38,933. Meanwhile, in the last 24 hours, 1,86,140 beneficiaries were vaccinated.

The UK has said it is working with India on technical cooperation to expand its recognition of COVID-19 vaccine certification to people vaccinated by a relevant public health body in India. This comes after India said that all travellers from the UK will have to quarantine for 10 days after arriving in India, irrespective of their COVID-19 vaccination status.

The Kerala government on Saturday announced the reopening of cinema theatres and indoor auditoriums in the state from October 25, but with certain restrictions. All employees and customers who are fully vaccinated against COVID-19 can enter theatres and auditoriums that will open at 50% seating capacity, Kerala CM Pinarayi Vijayan said. Kerala recorded 13,217 new COVID-19 cases on Saturday.

Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal on Friday said that death certificates and surviving member certificates for processing of applications to avail COVID-19 ex-gratia will no longer be needed. "All these people are victims...do not deserve to be troubled because of paperwork," he added. This comes after a citizen told Kejriwal that he was having to run around to get the documents.

Abdulla Shahid, President of 76th session of UN General Assembly, was asked whether any COVID-19 vaccine should be recognised and considered or the ones that have been validated by WHO or any other group. "I got Covishield from India...I don't know how many countries would say that Covishield is acceptable or not, but...large portion of countries got Covishield," he added.

Union Health Minister Mansukh Mandaviya on Saturday said India has administered 90 crore doses of COVID-19 vaccines since the vaccination drive started in mid-January. As per the Co-WIN dashboard, 90,10,04,270 doses have been administered. India's vaccination drive was ramped up through the availability of more vaccines and by streamlining vaccine supply chain, the Health Ministry said earlier.

India reported 24,354 new COVID-19 cases and 25,455 recoveries in the last 24 hours, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. India's active caseload dropped to 2,73,889, the lowest in 197 days. With this, the country's total COVID-19 cases reached 3,37,91,061, while the death toll surged to 4,48,573.

The World Bank has approved $400 million of additional funds for Nigeria to help procure and deploy COVID-19 vaccinations. This will help Nigeria purchase vaccines for 40 million people, about 18% of its population, and support vaccine deployment to 110 million people, World Bank said. Nigeria has administered nearly seven million vaccine doses to its 200 million citizens so far.

The death toll from coronavirus in the US surpassed seven lakh on Friday, according to the Johns Hopkins University COVID-19 tracker. The US has reported an average of over 2,000 deaths from COVID-19 per day over the past week, a Reuters analysis of public health data showed. The US' COVID-19 death toll is the highest in the world.

The BMC has allowed places of worship in the city to reopen at 50% capacity, starting October 7. "All COVID-19 protocols must be followed," Municipal Comissioner IS Chahal said. According to Maharashtra government's guidelines, distribution of 'prasad', sprinkling of holy water and touching statues, idols or holy books won't be allowed. Religious events and congregations remain prohibited.

Northeast Delhi MP and BJP leader Manoj Tiwari on Friday said that he would defy orders if permission is not given for Chhath Puja celebrations at ghats in the city amid the COVID-19 pandemic. "When everything is returning to normalcy...if Arvind Kejriwal does such a conspiracy, we'll show him by celebrating Chhath Puja that we can't be stopped," Tiwari added.

The Kerala government on Saturday while issuing revised COVID-19 guidelines, allowed regular classes to resume in colleges and training institutes for fully vaccinated students from October 18. Meanwhile, schools for Classes 1-7, 10 and 12 can reopen from November 1 with fully vaccinated staff. Cinema halls can also reopen from October 25 at a 50% seating capacity.

COVID-19-related restrictions under Section 144 of CrPC have been extended in Gautam Buddha Nagar till October 31. "Maximum limit for wedding ceremonies will be 100 guests...no congregations for political support, religious...academic will be held without permission," Gautam Buddha Nagar police said. No public activities, except for essential services, will be allowed between 11 pm and 6 am.

India has reported 26,727 new COVID-19 cases and 277 deaths in the last 24 hours. Kerala accounted for nearly 60% of the new cases in India as the state reported 15,914 cases and 122 deaths. With this, India's total COVID-19 cases reached 3,37,66,707, while the death toll surged to 4,48,339. The country's active caseload currently stands at 2,75,224.

US Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) said that the US has administered over 39 crore COVID-19 vaccine doses in the country as of Thursday morning. Over 21.4 crore people have received at least one dose, while more than 18.4 crore are fully vaccinated, CDC added. Over 40 lakh people have also received a third dose since August 13.

Over one lakh beneficiaries were given COVID-19 vaccines for the fourth consecutive day in Mumbai, Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) said. As many as 1,46,175 beneficiaries were vaccinated at 464 COVID-19 vaccination centres in the last 24 hours out of which 1,09,613 were given vaccines at civic-run centres. Around 1.23 crore beneficiaries have been given COVID-19 vaccines in Mumbai so far.

Australia has recognised India-made Covishield COVID-19 vaccine and China's CoronaVac ahead of border reopening from November. The nation's top drugs regulator, the Therapeutic Goods Administration, said the shots should be "recognised vaccines" in determining incoming travellers as being inoculated, Prime Minister Scott Morrison said on Friday. Earlier, Italy recognised Covishield vaccine.

The World Health Organization said half of the countries in Africa have fully vaccinated just 2% or less of their populations. Only 15 of Africa's 54 countries have reached the global target of fully vaccinating 10% of their population by September-end, it added. Nearly 90% of high-income countries have met 10% target set by the World Health Assembly, it said.

The WHO said that COVAX, a global scheme designed to ensure fair access to COVID-19 vaccines, will this month for the first time distribute shots only to nations with the lowest levels of coverage. COVAX had earlier allotted doses proportionally among its 140-plus beneficiary states. The WHO had earlier called for a moratorium on booster shots to reduce vaccine inequality.

Sri Lanka on Friday lifted a COVID-19 lockdown after nearly six weeks amid an economic crisis in the country. However, several restrictions continue to stay in place across the country, with people being allowed to leave their homes only for work or to buy essentials. The economic crisis was sparked by a decline in tourism due to the coronavirus pandemic.

Russia on Friday reported its highest-ever one-day rise in coronavirus deaths at 887, making it the fourth consecutive day that the country has reported a record number of fatalities due to the virus. In the last 24 hours, Russia has recorded 24,522 new cases, the government coronavirus task force said. Russia has reported over 2.03 lakh coronavirus-related deaths so far.

After a gap of over five months, the Delhi government has allowed the reopening of religious places in the city for devotees from Friday, with strict adherence to COVID-19 guidelines. The Delhi Disaster Management Authority (DDMA) stated that large gatherings or congregations will not be permitted during festivals. "Chhath Puja celebrations shall not be allowed in public places," DDMA added.

The Premier of Australia's New South Wales, Gladys Berejiklian, resigned after a watchdog launched a probe into allegations of corruption against her. Berejiklian's resignation comes amid the biggest COVID-19 outbreak in Australia. "I don't want to be a distraction from what should be the focus of the...government during this pandemic, which is the well-being of our citizens," she said.

The Maharashtra State Association of Resident Doctors (MARD) on Friday began an indefinite strike across the state. The association said that they will continue the strike till the state government fulfils their demands, which include waiver of tuition fee for postgraduate medical students, COVID-19 incentives and better hostel facilities at government-run medical colleges.

Delhi on Friday reported 32 new COVID-19 cases and zero deaths. As per the health bulletin, 23 recoveries were reported in the last 24 hours, taking the total recoveries to 14,13,404. With 409 active COVID-19 cases and a positivity rate of 0.05%, the cumulative cases in Delhi stand at 14,38,900. Meanwhile, in the last 24 hours, 1,69,267 beneficiaries were vaccinated.

AIIMS Delhi Director Dr Randeep Guleria has said India may see a decline in COVID-19 cases if people remain alert during the next six-eight weeks. "During the festive season, we have to remain alert and vigilant," he said. Earlier, Union Home Secretary Ajay Bhalla in a letter said it's important to follow COVID-19 appropriate behaviour during the festive season.

Switzerland's government on Friday said that it will offer a gift certificate worth more than $53 to people who persuade others to get vaccinated against COVID-19. The government plans to spend over $161 million on the campaign. Switzerland has one of the lowest vaccination rates in western Europe, with only 58% of the country's 8.7 million population fully vaccinated.

Punjab CM Charanjit Singh Channi met PM Narendra Modi on Friday and urged him to resume talks with farmers protesting against the three agricultural laws. "I also requested to the PM that the Kartarpur Corridor, which was closed due to COVID-19 pandemic, should be reopened at the earliest," Channi said. This was his first meeting with PM after becoming CM.

Bengaluru on Friday reported 221 new COVID-19 cases, taking the total number of active cases to 7,627. As per the data released by the state health department, five COVID-19 deaths were recorded in the last 24 hours. Meanwhile, Karnataka reported 589 fresh COVID-19 cases along with 13 deaths in the last 24 hours. The state's positivity rate stood at 0.46%.

Delhi government's current scheme of 20% reduced circle rates for all categories of properties was on Thursday extended till December 31. Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal said, "The 20% rebate on circle rates would continue. [We'll] not let Delhi residents suffer during...pandemic." The rebate scheme was launched in February 2021 amid the COVID-19 pandemic and was to end on September 30.

The BBMP has decided to set up block and lane-level COVID-19 vaccination centres. As per Special Comissioner (Health) D Randeep, these centres will become operational from October 4. He added, that vaccination centres in each block would comprise 750 to 1000 houses, with each ward having 15 to 50 such blocks depending on the population.

India on Friday said all travellers from the UK will have to quarantine for 10 days after arriving in India, irrespective of their COVID-19 vaccination status. This came after India talked of reciprocal measures over "discriminatory" quarantine rules in the UK for vaccinated Indians. The new travel guidelines will come into effect from October 4 onwards.

A pre-university college in Karnataka's Mandya was sealed and declared a containment zone by health authorities after 28 students tested positive for COVID-19, officials said. The infected students were shifted to a COVID-19 care centre at a government hospital, an official from Mandya district administration said. Deputy Director of Public Instruction said the entire campus has been sanitised.

According to government data, every one in four persons eligible for COVID-19 vaccine in India has been fully vaccinated. "India's persistence and determination [are] creating ripples across the global vaccination campaign. 1/4th of the eligible population, a phenomenal 23.7 crore people, is fully vaccinated against COVID-19," Health Minister Mansukh Mandaviya tweeted on Thursday.

Rajasthan government on Thursday announced that it has decided to ban bursting and sale of firecrackers in the state from October 1, 2021 to January 31, 2022. The government cited possibility of third COVID-19 wave and other health ailments due to air pollution as the reason behind the ban. Earlier, Delhi also banned firecrackers till January 1, 2022.

The Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation on Thursday issued guidelines for the upcoming Navratri festival and allowed physical darshan at mandals, while encouraging online darshan amid COVID-19. BMC said garba won't be allowed and only five people can visit the mandal at one point. The civic body restricted idol height in mandaps to four feet and in homes to two feet.

Overseas fans have been banned from attending the Beijing 2022 Winter Olympics while all unvaccinated athletes will be quarantined for 21 days ahead of the Games. All domestic and international Games participants and workforce will be tested daily for COVID-19, the Beijing 2022 Organising Comittee said. The Games will take place from February 4 to 20.

Zydus Cadila's needle-free COVID-19 vaccine ZyCoV-D will be introduced in the national vaccination programe very shortly, Union Health Secretary Rajesh Bhushan said on Thursday. The three-dose vaccine will be priced differently than the vaccines being used currently, he added. The vaccine has received emergency use authorisation for being administered to people aged between 12 and 18 years.

Alia Bhatt's 'Gangubai Kathiawadi' is heading to theatres early next year. The film, directed by Sanjay Leela Bhansali, will release on January 6. "Bringing to you a part of my...soul," Alia wrote while announcing the release date. 'Gangubai Kathiawadi' was earlier supposed to release on July 30, 2021, however, it got postponed due to the second wave of COVID-19 pandemic.

Delhi recorded 47 COVID-19 cases and zero deaths due to the disease in the last 24 hours, the health department said on Thursday. The COVID-19 positivity rate stood at 0.06%, while 39 more people recovered from the infection. The city had reported 41 COVID-19 cases on Wednesday and 34 cases on Tuesday.

The government released the list of states which have the most number of active COVID-19 cases in the country. Kerala has 1,44,075 active COVID-19 cases, which contributes to 52.01% of India's total active COVID-19 cases (2,77,020). Kerala is followed by Maharashtra (40,252), Tamil Nadu (17,192) and Mizoram (16,841). As many as five states have active cases between 10,000 and 50,000.

Pune district reported 656 new COVID-19 cases on Wednesday while six people succumbed to the virus. As many as 656 people were discharged from the hospitals. There are 6029 active patients in the district and 2,334 of them are admitted to hospitals while 3,695 are in home isolation, according to the District Health Officer, Dr Bhagwan Pawar.

India has recorded 23,529 new COVID-19 cases and 311 deaths in the last 24 hours. This comes a day after the country saw 18,870 cases and 378 deaths. Kerala reported 12,161 cases and 155 deaths on Wednesday. India's active caseload stood at 2,77,020, the lowest in 195 days while the recovery rate stood at 97.85%, the highest since March 2020.

Mumbai recorded 527 new COVID-19 cases on Wednesday while six people succumbed to the virus. The city has recorded over 500 COVID-19 cases for the third time in September. The total coronavirus caseload in the city has reached 7,42,528. As many as 405 patients recovered from the virus on Wednesday, with this the total recoveries in the city reached 7,19,218.

The government has released list of districts that are reporting more than 5% COVID-19 positivity rate. Eighteen districts including Kerala's Kasaragod, Himachal Pradesh's Bilaspur and West Bengal's Kolkata are reporting a positivity rate between 5% to 10%. Kerala's 13 districts are among 30 districts reporting positivity rate of more than 10%

After nearly 30 MBBS students studying in Mumbai's King Edward Memorial Hospital and Seth Gordhandas Sunderdas Medical College tested positive for COVID-19, an official said the numbers may rise. "We've been telling the students to be careful. But they have been working and eating together," the official added. Meanwhile, BMC asked the hospital to test 1,100 persons for COVID-19.

Twenty-three MBBS students studying at King Edward Memorial Hospital and Seth Gordhandas Sunderdas Medical College in Mumbai have tested positive for COVID-19, said Mayor Kishori Pednekar. She added that all 23 students were vaccinated with at least one dose. She said, "Some of them have mild symptoms. It may have spread due to some cultural or sports event in college."

Delhi's Directorate of Education on Wednesday directed authorities concerned to ensure that teachers and school staff who have not been vaccinated against COVID-19 should be vaccinated by October 15. "All such teachers...who have not got themselves vaccinated by October 15 should not be allowed to attend the school...their absence would be treated as on leave," it added.

The Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) has collected over ?70 crore fine from people for not wearing masks amid the COVID-19 pandemic till September 28. This amount includes the fine collected by Mumbai Police and Railways. Separately, the civic body also collected over ?66 lakh from people for spitting in public places. Zone 1 saw the most number of offenders.

While addressing the UN General Assembly session this year, world leaders thanked India for its help and support in combating the COVID-19 pandemic through "early and meaningful" shipments of vaccine doses. Suriname's President Chandrikapersad Santokhi thanked India for its support in the battle against COVID-19. Nigeria's President Muhamadu Buhari also thanked India for the vaccines provided.

A man was mistakenly administered an anti-rabies vaccine instead of a COVID-19 vaccine in Maharashtra's Thane city, officials said. Rajkumar Yadav stood in the wrong queue and was later informed that he was administered the anti-rabies vaccine. Thane Municipal Corporation acknowledged the goof up and suspended a doctor and a nurse at the centre, while adding that Yadav is stable.

Malayalam actor Jayasurya's 100th film 'Sunny' will be shown at Calella Film Festival in October this year and Dhaka International Film Festival in January next year. 'Sunny' is selected in the competition section and is the only Indian film at the Calella Film Festival right now, director Ranjith Sankar said. The film is set in the aftermath of coronavirus-induced lockdown.

Several jewellers in India have started selling gold online for ?100 ($1.35) on their websites or through digital gold platforms amid COVID-19 pandemic. Consumers can take delivery once they've invested enough for at least one gram of gold, Bloomberg reported. There's "renewed interest among consumers" for making systematic investments in gold, Kalyan Jewellers' top executive R Kalyanaraman said.

Tesla is seeking a waiver from COVID-19 rules on mass gatherings to host up to 9,000 people at a "Giga-Fest" in Germany, Reuters reported. The firm will also have to prove that it will not damage the land or release toxic substances into the groundwater. The event will involve a "behind the scenes" tour of Tesla's Gigafactory.

Hospitals across Mumbai are witnessing almost 50% rise in emergency footfall of patients with heart attacks as compared to the peak COVID-19 pandemic period in the second wave. "Due to the lack of proper diagnosis, delayed treatment, complicated recovery and ignorance, many suffered in silence," Dr Anup Taksande, consultant interventional cardiologist, Wockhardt Hospital, Mira Road, said.

Pune district's COVID-19 positivity rate has dropped to 3.37% in the week of September 21-27 as against the previous week when it was at 5.04%. In nine districts, the positivity rate is still higher than the state's weekly average. Maharashtra also witnessed a dip in the COVID-19 positivity rate last week which stood at 2.11%.

The Centre has extended the nationwide COVID-19 containment measures till October 31.  Union Home Secretary Ajay Bhalla cautioned states and Union Territories about the possibility of COVID-appropriate behaviour not being adhered to strictly during the upcoming festivals which may lead to a surge in cases again. "Utmost vigil has to be maintained in respect of mass gathering events," he wrote.

India has reported 18,870 COVID-19 cases and 378 deaths in the last 24 hours. This comes a day after the country saw 18,795 cases and 179 deaths. Kerala reported 11,196 cases and 149 deaths on Tuesday. Notably, Haryana reported no new deaths on Tuesday but 64 fatalities were added to the state health department's daily bulletin after a death audit.

Russia has threatened to block YouTube after it deleted state-backed broadcaster RT's two German-language channels. Russia said it had written to Google and demanded that the restrictions be lifted and warned that Russia could seek to partially or fully restrict access to YouTube if it failed to comply. YouTube deleted RT's channels, saying it'd violated its COVID-19 misinformation policy.

BMC Comissioner Iqbal Singh Chahal said on Wednesday schools for classes 8-12 will reopen in Mumbai from October 4 amid COVID-19. "For the rest of the classes, we'll take a decision in November. All COVID-19 SoPs issued by the government will be implemented," he added. Last week, the Maharashtra government had allowed schools to resume physical classes from October 4.

The Jawaharlal Nehru University will award PhD degrees to 479 students at its fifth convocation on Thursday. Union Education Minister Dharmendra Pradhan will be the chief guest at the virtual event. The convocation was held online last year as well due to the COVID-19 pandemic and President Ram Nath Kovind graced the occasion.

China said that it has "no choice" but to take preventive measures like travel curbs to contain COVID-19. It said, "[China] is adjusting its measures in accordance with the evolving situation...to ensure...safe...flow of...travellers." It comes after stranded Indian students held a demonstration in front of its embassy in Delhi. They demanded China to permit their return to re-join their studies.

As many as 60 students of a boarding school in Bengaluru tested positive for COVID-19 on Sunday, Deputy Comissioner Bengaluru Urban District, J Manjunath, said. Of the 60 students, two are symptomatic, while the remaining 58 students are asymptomatic, Manjunath added. About 480 students and 57 staff members of the school were tested after a student tested positive for coronavirus.

Pakistan's Planning and Development Minister Asad Umar on Tuesday said that the country will begin vaccinating children over 12 years old against COVID-19. Pakistan will also soon launch a "special drive" to vaccinate children at schools, Umar added. Pakistan, which has reported more than 12 lakh COVID-19 cases, has fully vaccinated over 11% of its population so far.

US President Joe Biden on Monday received a COVID-19 booster shot and urged more Americans to get vaccinated. Last week, US authorized Pfizer-BioNTech booster shot for high-risk adults, those aged 65 and above, and others who are regularly exposed to the virus. Earlier, WHO had urged countries to hold off on booster shots until 2022 to reduce global vaccine inequality.

India reported less than 20,000 new COVID-19 cases after 201 days as 18,795 people tested positive in the last 24 hours. The new cases dropped by 7,246 as compared to Monday. The country reported 26,030 recoveries and 179 deaths. The number of active cases in India stands at 2,92,206, while the number of deaths has risen to 4,47,373.

Pune reported 410 new COVID-19 cases on Monday while 815 persons were discharged from hospitals. Seven persons succumbed to the virus. The active number of COVID-19 cases stands at 6,113 in the district and 2,632 of them are admitted to hospitals while 4,046 are in home isolation. Out of 410 new cases, 109 were reported in Pune Municipal Corporation.

The COVID-19 virus is expected to continue to transmit for a very long time, senior WHO official Poonam Khetrapal Singh said. "A multitude of factors will decide whether the virus will become endemic in the long run, chief among them is the level of imunity in a comunity, both through vaccination and previous infection," she added.

New York hospitals on Monday began firing or suspending healthcare workers for defying a state order to get COVID-19 vaccine, resulting in staff shortages. Some hospitals were forced to postpone elective surgeries or curtail services. Last month, New York's State Health Department had issued an order mandating all healthcare workers get at least one COVID-19 vaccine dose by September 27.

The WHO's emergency use authorisation (EUA) for Bharat Biotech's COVID-19 vaccine Covaxin has reportedly been delayed by a few weeks as the agency sent more technical queries to the vaccine maker. "It's the usual process," a WHO official was quoted as saying. The delay is likely to affect students, medical tourists, business travellers and those who want to travel abroad.

At least 30,000 auto-rickshaws were seized by private financiers in Bengaluru as the drivers defaulted on paying the EMIs. According to C Sampath, President of Adarsha Auto Union, they had approached the state government to waive off the vehicle loans as the drivers weren?t able to earn much due to the COVID-19 lockdown, however, they received no response.

PM Narendra Modi on Tuesday said the government improved the procurement process to benefit the farmers. "During the Rabi season, over 430 lakh metric tonnes (MT) of wheat was procured by the government and farmers have been paid over ?85,000 crore," he added. The PM further said that wheat procurement centres were increased over three times during the COVID-19 pandemic.

US State Department Spokesman Ned Price on Monday said that he has tested positive for COVID-19 and will be self-quarantining for the next 10 days. US State Secretary Antony Blinken has tested negative for COVID-19, State Department said. Price had attended several meetings with Blinken last week in New York on the sidelines of the United Nations General Assembly (UNGA).

India's drug regulator has allowed Covishield maker Serum Institute of India (SII) to enrol children aged between seven to 11 years for its COVID-19 vaccine trial, Reuters reported. The Central Drugs Standard Control Organisation's (CDSCO) subject expert panel made the recomendation after "detailed deliberation". SII is already conducting a trial of its COVID-19 vaccine in the 12-17 age group.

Japan will lift a coronavirus state of emergency in all regions on Thursday amid declining virus cases in the country, PM Yoshihide Suga said. "The daily new cases came down from more than 25,000 in mid-August to 1,128 yesterday," he added. With the lifting, Japan will be entirely free of emergency requirements for the first time in nearly six months.

French pharmaceutical company Sanofi said that it's stopping work on a messenger-RNA (mRNA) vaccine against COVID-19 as vaccines produced by its rivals using the same technology are widely available. The announcement comes despite previously announcing positive results from phase one and phase two trials of the vaccine. Sanofi further said that it would instead focus on another type of shot.

Bollywood actress Ananya Panday became the youngest Indian celebrity to participate in the Global Citizen concert which took place on September 26. At the event, Ananya spoke about climate change leading to the extinction of species and extreme poverty. The 24-hour music festival invited world leaders, philanthropists, and corporations to act against climate change and advance vaccine equity.

Actor Shaheer Sheikh in an interview said that he gets tested for COVID-19 every time he goes to meet his newborn daughter. Shaheer and his wife Ruchikaa Kapoor welcomed their baby on September 10. "I can't go directly back from my shoots and meet her due to the ongoing pandemic. I am avoiding meeting her often," he added.

A brawl erupted in Taiwan's Parliament on Tuesday after lawmakers from the opposition Kuomintang party (KMT) scuffled with members of the ruling Democratic Progressive Party (DPP) in a dispute over the government's response to the COVID-19 pandemic. Premier SU Tseng-chang was stopped by opposition lawmakers from addressing the Parliament. Some lawmakers threw water on others during the brawl.

Delhi on Tuesday recorded the first fatalities related to COVID-19 disease in 10 days as two patients succumbed to the infection, according to the health bulletin issued by the Delhi government. Delhi reported the last death due to COVID-19 on September 17. Moreover, Delhi reported 34 fresh cases in the last 24 hours. Delhi also reported 25 recoveries on Tuesday.

Haryana Minister Anil Vij was admitted to AIIMS in Delhi on Monday night after he complained of breathing difficulties, according to reports. A doctor said, "He has complaints of breathlessness, which could be part of post-COVID-19 complications." The minister was reportedly admitted under AIIMS Director Dr Randeep Guleria for investigations.

The Uttar Pradesh government on Tuesday allowed holding wedding ceremonies and other events in open spaces. It also said that the event should comply with COVID-19 protocols and it is compulsory to set up a COVID-19 help desk at the entrance. On September 19, the UP govt permitted a maximum of 100 people to gather in closed and open areas.

The Tamil Nadu government on Tuesday extended COVID-19 curbs till October 31 and allowed physical classes for standards 1-8 to resume from November 1. The decision was taken based on a review meeting held with health experts, the government said. All places of worship would remain closed on Fridays, Saturdays and Sundays, it added.

At least 32 students of a private educational institution in the Thanamandi area of J&K's Rajouri tested COVID-19 positive on Monday, said officials.
