The school was reopened on Monday and a team of health department had visited there for sampling. Rajouri CMO Shamim Bhati said none of the students had severe symptoms. Meanwhile, J&K recorded 117 COVID-19 cases on Monday.

India on Monday recorded over one crore COVID-19 vaccinations for the fifth time, informed Health Minister Mansukh Mandaviya. "Under PM Narendra Modi ji, India delivers a punch to Corona," Mandaviya tweeted. Meanwhile, the cumulative number of COVID-19 vaccine doses administered in the country crossed 86 crore on Monday, the Union health ministry said.

Jordan's Crown Prince Al Hussein bin Abdullah II has tested positive for coronavirus, the Royal Court said in a statement on Monday. "His Highness Prince Hussein, who had received the vaccine against...coronavirus, showed mild symptoms and is in very good health," it added. His parents King Abdullah II and Queen Rania, who tested negative, will self-isolate for five days.

After RSS-affiliated magazine Panchjanya called e-comerce firm Amazon 'East India Company 2.0', it issued a statement highlighting its "positive impact on small businesses" in India. Amazon said over three lakh new sellers in India joined its platform amid the COVID-19 crisis. It said it also helped over 70,000 businesses sell crores of made-in-India products to customers in 200 countries.

Pedro Guimaraes, a member of Brazilian President Jair Bolsonaro's delegation to the United Nations General Assembly (UNGA), has tested positive for COVID-19. Guimaraes, the CEO of state lender Caixa Econ?mica Federal, is the fourth member of the delegation to test positive. Earlier, Health Minister Marcelo Queiroga, Bolsonaro's son Eduardo and one diplomat had tested positive for COVID-19.

French President Emanuel Macron announced on Sunday in a video message that the country will be doubling the number of coronavirus vaccine doses it donates to other countries to 120 million. "The injustice is that in other continents vaccination is far behind because of us, collectively," he said. He also noted that only 3% of Africa's population is vaccinated.

India has reported 26,041 new COVID-19 cases and 276 deaths in the last 24 hours. This comes a day after the country saw 28,326 cases and 260 deaths. India's active caseload dropped to 2,99,620, the lowest in 191 days. Kerala reported 61% of the total new cases in the country as it recorded 15,951 cases and 165 deaths on Sunday.

Mizoram CM Zoramthanga on Monday took to Twitter to mourn the death of his elder sister. He wrote, "It's with deep sorrow that I announce the demise of my beloved elder sister Lalvuani (88-year-old) this morning at 11:30 am. A life so beautifully lived deserves to be beautifully remembered." He added that she was diagnosed with COVID-19 on September 27.

The Bengaluru City Police Comissioner Kamal Pant on Monday extended the COVID-19 restrictions, including night curfew between 10 pm and 5 am in the city, till October 11. Bengaluru Urban on Sunday reported 255 new COVID-19 cases and three deaths. Meanwhile, the state reported 775 fresh cases on Sunday, taking the active case tally to 13,213.

Pune district reported 731 new COVID-19 cases on Sunday while 962 people were discharged from hospitals and eight succumbed to the virus. The active caseload stands at 6,525 in the district, according to the District Health Officer Dr Bhagwan Pawar. Among the eight deaths, two were in PMC, one in PCMC, one in municipal council and four in rural areas.

Kerala on Monday recorded 11,699 new COVID-19 cases along with 58 more deaths in the last 24 hours. The test positivity rate in the state stands at 14.55%. The state also witnessed 17,763 recoveries taking the total to 44,59,193. The total death toll stands at 24,661 while there are 1,57,158 active cases in Kerala.

A recent serological survey in Odisha has found that 70% of children in the age group 6-10 years were found to have developed antibodies, while the figure for the age group 11-18 years was 74%. The survey covered 12 districts to estimate and compare the age-specific prevalence of SARS-CoV-2 antibodies. It was conducted by the ICMR Regional Medical Research Centre.

The government has released the age-wise distribution of COVID-19 vaccine doses as of September 26. While people in the age group of 18-44 account for 53.5% of vaccine doses, those in the age group of 45-60 account for 28.3% of the doses. People aged above 60 account for 18.2% doses. India has administered over 85.6 crore COVID-19 vaccine doses.

A man in a village in Madhya Pradesh, hesitant to take the COVID-19 vaccine, said he will take the first dose in the presence of PM Narendra Modi. As per an official, the man and his wife are the only two people left unvaccinated in the village and attempts will be made to convince him for the vaccination once again.

Canada has said it's lifting the ban on direct passenger flights from India from September 27, over five months after it was imposed amid second COVID-19 wave. Travellers must carry negative COVID-19 test report from an approved laboratory, taken 18 hours before departure. This comes after passengers who flew to Canada from India in three flights on Wednesday tested negative.

People who are fully vaccinated against COVID-19 and want to travel abroad will have a CoWIN vaccination certificate with their full date of birth, National Health Authority chief RS Sharma said. The date will follow the "yyyy-m-dd" (Year-Month-Day) format and will be as per WHO standards for international travellers, he added. Currently, the certificates only mention age of the beneficiary.

India has reported 28,326 new COVID-19 cases and 260 deaths in the past 24 hours. With this, India's total cases reached 3,36,52,745 and death toll rose to 4,46,918. COVID-19 recovery rate is 97.77%, the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare said. The country's active caseload, which stands at 3,03,476, accounts for less than 1% of total cases, it added.

PM Modi on Sunday said that "Team India" is creating a record everyday in the country's fight against COVID-19, especially on the vaccination front. "I request those who are not yet vaccinated to take their shot," PM added. He also urged the people of the country to follow COVID-19 protocols in the forthcoming festive season.

Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman addressed the Annual General Meeting of the Indian Banks' Association in Mumbai on Sunday, where she said, "India needs 4 different SBI-sized banks." She said this in presence of SBI Chairman Dinesh Kumar Khara. Sitharaman added, "Even before COVID-19 pandemic, the driving force for amalgamation of banks was that India needs a lot more big banks."

UP CM Yogi Adityanath-led state government Cabinet was expanded ahead of polls today. BJP leaders Jitin Prasada (formerly in Congress), Chhatrapal Gangwar, Paltu Ram, Sangeeta Balwant, Sanjeev Kumar, Dinesh Khatik and Dharmveer Prajapati took the oath of office at Raj Bhawan. The last UP Cabinet expansion took place in 2019. However, three UP ministers passed away due to COVID-19.

Microsoft Co-founder Bill Gates called India "a great example of a country that invested in its vaccine capacity". He said, "A few decades ago, India invested in its health capabilities by building research infrastructure in cities like Bengaluru, Hyderabad, Chennai, Ahmedabad and Pune." He added, "Today 2/3rds of all the world's children receive a vaccine that was made in India."

The Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) has sealed the Byculla women's jail premises after 39 inmates tested positive for COVID-19. "We suspect that someone who may have been admitted into the jail recently may have brought in the virus," a civic official said. The inmates have been quarantined at a municipal school in Mumbai's Mazgaon area.

Pune district reported 686 new COVID-19 cases on Saturday while 1,035 people were discharged from hospitals. Nine deaths were reported in the district. Out of 686 new cases, 171 were reported in PMC, 124 in PCMC, 45 in municipal councils, four in cantonments and 342 in rural areas. The active caseload stands at 6,764 in the district.

The Mumbai civic body will hold a special drive to vaccinate women against COVID-19 at civic and government centres from 10.30 am to 6.30 pm on Monday. The Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation will also run a special drive for teachers and students. The decision was taken to reduce gender disparity in the vaccination process and curb vaccine hesitancy among women.

The Director of Education, Delhi, requested the CBSE to waive off the board examination fees for all the students of classes 10 and 12 studying in government and government-aided schools, among others, for the academic session 2021-22 as a one-time measure. Udit Prakash Rai, the director, raised the request in view of the economic impact of the COVID-19 pandemic.

Delhi on Saturday reported 27 new COVID-19 cases and zero deaths. As per the health bulletin, 39 recoveries were reported in the last 24 hours, taking the total recoveries to 14,13,221. With 379 active COVID-19 cases and a positivity rate of 0.04%, the cumulative cases in Delhi stand at 14,38,685. Meanwhile, in the last 24 hours, 1,62,344 beneficiaries were vaccinated.

In his address to the United Nations General Assembly (UNGA) on Saturday, PM Narendra Modi said the COVID-19 pandemic has taught the world that the global economy should be more diversified now. "That is why the expansion of global value chains is very important," he added. "Our 'Aatmanirbhar Bharat Abhiyaan' is inspired by this sentiment," he further said.

Bengaluru's civic body has started doorstep COVID-19 vaccination for senior citizens and differently-abled people. BBMP Chief Comissioner Gaurav Gupta on Saturday tweeted, "Those with mobility issues requiring doorstep vaccination can call the BBMP helpline 1533 or contact their jurisdictional BBMP officers for further assistance. Following which the BBMP team will conduct doorstep vaccination."

Cinema halls and theatres in Maharashtra will reopen from October 22 "while observing all COVID-19 safety protocols", Chief Minister Uddhav Thackeray's office said on Saturday. The state government had on Friday announced the reopening of temples and other religious places from October 7 and urged devotees to follow COVID-19 norms including wearing face masks and maintaining social distancing.

India has reported 29,616 new COVID-19 cases and 290 deaths in the last 24 hours. Kerala accounted for nearly 60% of the new cases in India as the state reported 17,983 cases and 127 deaths. With this, India's total COVID-19 cases reached 3,36,24,419, while the death toll surged to 4,46,658. The country's active caseload currently stands at 3,01,442.

At least 30 people tested positive for COVID-19 at the Army Cantonment in Indore's Mhow area on Thursday. All the people who tested positive were vaccinated, Chief Medical Health Officer (CMHO) of Indore BS Setiya said. "We are tracing the contact and travel history of the people who are tested positive. They've been isolated in the Army hospital," CMHO added.

Himachal Pradesh CM Jairam Thakur has said the state is making efforts to become India's first state to inoculate 100% of its population with both COVID-19 vaccine doses by November 2021. Earlier this month, Himachal became the first state to vaccinate 100% of its eligible population with the first vaccine dose and one-third of the population with the second dose.

West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee on Friday criticised the Centre and asked where is lakhs of crores of rupees donated to the PM CARES fund. "The Chief Minister Relief Fund is regularly audited. PM CARES fund was formed for COVID-19...the Centre told the court that it's not a government fund," she added. Complete transparency should be maintained, Mamata stated.

During the first in-person Quad Leaders Sumit, PM Modi announced that India will make available 80 lakh doses of Johnson and Johnson's COVID-19 vaccine. "This would be ready by...end of October compatible with our decision to resume vaccine export," Foreign Secretary Harsh Vardhan Shringla said. The vaccines will be delivered to the Indo-Pacific region and Quad will pay for them.

The Finance Ministry on Friday withdrew with imediate effect the spending curbs imposed on ministries and departments in June in wake of the second COVID-19 wave. The restrictions capped expenditure to a maximum of 20% of budget estimates. Notably, the June order had exempted ministries and departments dealing with health, agriculture, fertilisers, pharmaceuticals and food.

PM Narendra Modi during his UNGA address in US invited global vaccine manufacturers to "come, make vaccines in India". "Despite limited resources, India- which believes in the philosophy of 'Seva Param Dharam' (service is the highest religion)-  is completely invested in the development and manufacturing of the vaccines," said PM. India has developed world's first DNA COVID-19 vaccine, he added.

BJP chief JP Nadda lauded PM Narendra Modi's UNGA address on Saturday, saying he spoke like a statesman and made India proud. The PM has only one goal, which is to make India "vishwa guru" again, Nadda said. "He...motivated the world to come along on the issues of COVID-19 management, COVID-19 vaccination, terrorism and even oceanic boundaries," he said.

PM Narendra Modi paid tribute to all those who died of COVID-19 and expressed condolences to their families as he addressed the 76th session of the United Nations General Assembly. "For the last 1.5 years, the entire world has been facing the worst pandemic in 100 years," he said. He invited vaccine manufacturers to "come, make vaccines in India".

PM Narendra Modi while addressing the 76th United Nations General Assembly said, India has developed the world's first DNA vaccine against COVID-19, which can be administered to all those above the age of 12 years. PM Modi was referring to Zydus Cadila's COVID-19 DNA vaccine, which had received emergency use approval from the Drugs Controller General of India last month.

Kerala government on Saturday issued new COVID-19 guidelines and withdrew the restriction in movement of those who haven't taken any vaccine dose or don't have COVID-19 negative test reports. In-house dining is allowed at hotels, restaurants and bars at 50% capacity for fully vaccinated persons. Such establishments must be well ventilated and their staff must also be fully vaccinated.

The Quad has delivered nearly 7.9 crore COVID-19 vaccine doses to countries in the Indo-Pacific, according to a joint statement from the grouping. The Quad countries, India, the US, Australia and Japan, have pledged to donate over 120 crore vaccine doses globally. Coronavirus has infected more than 23 crore people globally, according to Johns Hopkins University COVID-19 tracker.

On SP Balasubrahmanyam's first death anniversary, Malayalam actor Mohanlal remembered the late singer and shared an old video of him singing a Malayalam song. "In our hearts forever and always with his celestial voice that remains unparalleled," he wrote. The veteran singer passed away at the age of 74 following coronavirus-related complications.

Jagrati Awasthi, the 24-year-old who secured AIR 2 and topped UPSC Civil Services Exam 2020 among women, said that all coaching centres were shut due to COVID-19 and initially she studied for 8-10 hours for the exam. "Eventually, I increased it to 10-12 hours and about two months before the exam, I further pushed it to 12-14 hours," she added.

Coronavirus cases in the world rose to over 23 crore on Friday, while coronavirus-related deaths crossed 47 lakh, according to Johns Hopkins University tracker. US is the worst-hit country with the highest number of cases and deaths. In terms of cases, India comes second with over 3.3 crore cases, while Brazil comes second in terms of deaths with 5,92,964 fatalities.

Italy has recognised Serum Institute of India's COVID-19 vaccine Covishield making Indian vaccine cardholders eligible for the EU green pass, the Indian embassy in Italy said. This came after G-20 Health Ministers' meeting between India's Mansukh Mandaviya and Italy's Roberto Speranza. The UK had also recently recognised Covishield for allowing entry to international travellers.

A Dutch court has ruled in favour of a 12-year-old's wish to get COVID-19 vaccine so he can visit his ill grandmother, in defiance of his father's objections. The boy argued that getting the vaccine would reduce his chances of infecting his grandmother, who's battling lung cancer. Children aged 12-17 in the Netherlands need permission from both parents for vaccination.

The Centre has informed the Supreme Court that it has decided to include death by suicide happening within 30 days of a person testing positive as COVID-19 death, thereby entitling their next of kin to get ?50,000 as ex-gratia. Earlier, the government had said deaths occurring due to poisoning, suicide, homicide, accidents etc will not be treated as COVID-19 deaths.

Union Minister for Comerce and Industry Piyush Goyal said that despite COVID-19 and other issues, India is ahead of its exports target. "We will be at about $190 billion by the end of September 2021," he added. "Exports are at the cusp of exponential growth...government is working to bring a quantum leap in 'Quality, Productivity and Efficiency'," Goyal stated.

Ten of the total 198 wards in Bengaluru have reported no new coronavirus cases in the past 10 days, according to data released by the city's civic body. The 10 wards include SK Garden, Sarvagna Nagar and Cottonpete, among others. Begur and Horamavu have reported the highest number of positive cases in the past 10 days with seven cases.

Six restaurants and bars were fined ?50,000 each for violating COVID-19 protocols by operating after 10 pm in Navi Mumbai in the last one week. The action was taken by the special squads of the Navi Mumbai Municipal Corporation. "If they're found violating the second time, their bars and restaurants will be closed for seven days," a senior official said.

Former Australia leg-spinner Shane Warne, who was infected with coronavirus in August despite being double vaccinated, has revealed he trialled a special ventilator to make sure he doesn't develop long COVID-19 symptoms. "I was on a ventilator but it was not an emergency ventilator...It wasn't because I could not breathe, or anything like that," he added.

India recorded 31,382 new COVID-19 cases and 318 deaths in the last 24 hours, Ministry of Health and Family Welfare said. COVID-19 recovery rate stands at 97.78%, it added. Country's active caseload stands at 3,00,162, the lowest in 188 days. India's total cases reached 3,35,94,803 and the death toll surged to 4,46,368.

Sensex breached 60,000 for the first time ever as the 30-share benchmark's rally continued to pick up due to COVID-19 vaccination, eased restrictions on business activity and India's measures to support the economy. From the low of 25,638 on March 24, 2020, Sensex surged 134% in 18 months. Meanwhile, Nifty has rallied to a fresh record high of over 17,900.

Japan's Health Minister Norihisa Tamura said the country's COVID-19 infection situation is improving and that emergency conditions could soon be lifted in many areas. About 80% of Japan's population is under emergency restrictions until the end of September amid the fifth wave of the COVID-19 pandemic in the country. Japan has reported more than 16.8 lakh COVID-19 cases so far.

The Director-General of Council of Scientific and Industrial Research (CSIR), Dr Shekhar C Mande, has said even if the third wave of COVID-19 hits India, the intensity would be low. "We have been able to get a large population vaccinated with first dose and even with second dose. Our vaccines do prevent the disease to a large extent," he explained.

Russia on Friday reported 828 deaths from COVID-19 in the past 24 hours, its highest one-day rise in the death toll so far, according to the Russian government. The country's total death toll from coronavirus rose to more than 2.02 lakh. Russia is one of the top ten worst coronavirus-hit countries with more than 73.7 lakh COVID-19 cases.

Tirumala Tirupati Devasthanams (TTD) has made a two-dose coronavirus vaccination certificate or a negative RT-PCR test mandatory for pilgrims visiting the Lord Venkateshwara temple in Andhra Pradesh's Chittoor, which it manages. The RT-PCR test must be taken by the devotees three days before reporting on the allotted day of the darshan, the trust's Chairman YV Subba Reddy said.

PM Narendra Modi on Friday said that US President Joe Biden's efforts on COVID-19, mitigation of climate change and Quad have been noteworthy. "These initiatives will have a greater impact on the issues in the coming days," he added. "We discussed how India and USA will further scale-up cooperation in different spheres and work...to overcome key challenges," he further said.

Actress Divya Dutta, who's shooting for 'Sharmaji Ki Beti' in Mumbai amid the COVID-19 pandemic, has said it's a pleasure to be able to shoot and go out without much fear now. "When you reach a set now, everyone's looking after you, so, somewhere, normalcy surges in," she added. Mumbai reported 446 new coronavirus cases on Friday.

All temples and other religious places will reopen from October 7 in Maharashtra, Chief Minister Uddhav Thackeray's office said on Friday. The Chief Minister has urged all devotees to follow the COVID-19 norms including social distancing and use face masks and hand sanitisers during their visits to their respective places of worship.

Karnataka government on Friday further eased COVID-19 curbs and allowed cinema halls and auditoriums to operate at 100% capacity from October 1 while following protocols. Pubs have also been allowed to reopen from October 3. In districts with a below 1% COVID-19 positivity rate, schools can resume for standards 6 to 12 for 5 days a week with full strength.

The Polish Border Guard on Friday said that an Iraqi migrant died after crossing into Poland from Belarus, making it the fifth such death reported in the border area in the past week. Another migrant, who tested positive for COVID-19, is in hospital, it added. Polish officials on Monday had announced that four migrants were found dead in the area.

Around 400 students have tested positive for COVID-19 since schools reopened for higher classes in Tamil Nadu, State Health Secretary J Radhakrishnan has said. He further said that "these were isolated, sporadic cases and not clusters". "We are keeping a close watch and officials...are participating in regular reviews to keep an eye on the situation," he added.

Israeli Education Ministry said that teachers who've not been vaccinated against COVID-19 will be banned from entering schools unless they present a negative test result. Teachers will be required to present a rapid antigen test performed up to 84 hours earlier, it added. Those who fail to comply will not be paid or allowed to teach remotely, the ministry said.

Bihar Chief Minister Nitish Kumar said on Friday that all Anganwadis and primary schools will be reopened in the state from November 15, 2021. He tweeted the COVID-19 restrictions yielded positive results and the decision was taken after reviewing the situation. "All eligible persons will be vaccinated. The rest of the earlier decisions will continue," he tweeted.

The US has authorised a booster dose of the Pfizer-BioNTech COVID-19 vaccine for high-risk adults, those aged 65 and above and others who are regularly exposed to the virus. The third shot will be administered at least six months after the second dose. The eligible people will include healthcare workers, teachers, grocery workers, those lodged in prisons and homeless shelters.

Japanese PM Yoshihide Suga announced that the country will provide 60 million COVID-19 vaccine doses to other countries, doubling the target from the previous pledge of 30 million doses. Suga made the announcement at US-hosted Global COVID-19 Sumit on Thursday. Japan has provided about 23 million doses so far, most of which went to Asian countries including Taiwan and Indonesia.

The government has stated that people with restricted mobility, special needs or disability can be vaccinated against COVID-19 at home. "Those who don't have enough mobility...or if someone has a disability or some special needs that they can't be brought to the centre, we've made the provision of at-home vaccination under supervision for them," NITI Aayog's Dr VK Paul said.

Kerala on Thursday reported 19,682 fresh COVID-19 cases and 152 deaths, which took the caseload to 45,79,310 and fatalities to 24,191. The number of people who recovered from the infection since Wednesday was 20,510 which brought the total recoveries to 43,94,476, an official press release said. Among the 14 districts, Thrissur recorded the highest 3,033 COVID-19 cases.

During the Health Ministry's briefing on Thursday, NITI Aayog member Dr VK Paul said that about two-thirds of India's adult population has been vaccinated with at least one dose of COVID-19 vaccine. He stated, "66% of 18+ age group received at least one dose, almost a quarter of adult population [has] received both doses."

The government on Thursday said that six states and union territories have vaccinated 100% of its adult population with at least first dose of COVID-19 vaccination. The states and UTs include Lakshadweep, Chandigarh, Goa, Himachal Pradesh, Andaman and Nicobar Islands and Sikkim. Meanwhile, Lakshadweep has fully vaccinated 82% of its adult population.

The Centre on Thursday said Kerala has the most number of active COVID-19 cases in the country with 1,61,596 cases that account for 53.57% of the total active cases in India. It is followed by Maharashtra with 43,544 active COVID-19 cases, Tamil Nadu with 17,027 cases, Mizoram with 15,638 cases, Andhra Pradesh with 13,796 cases and Karnataka with 13,650 cases.

SRH coach Trevor Bayliss has said pacer T Natarajan testing positive for coronavirus ahead of their match against DC didn't affect the result. "DC played way too well for us...Natarajan was going to play...[but] every now and then, there's an injury just before play and you've got to make a late replacement," he added. DC won match by eight wickets.

India has reported 31,923 new COVID-19 cases and 282 deaths in the last 24 hours. Kerala accounted for nearly 62% of the total new cases in the country as it recorded 19,675 cases and 142 deaths on Wednesday. India's active caseload stood at 3,01,640, the lowest in 187 days. The COVID-19 death toll in the country reached 4,46,050.

Pune district's weekly COVID-19 positivity rate has dropped below 5% in the week from September 15 to 21, according to a new state Health Department analysis. However, the positivity rate remains higher than the state average, which also dipped to 2.28%. In the week from 8 to 14 September, the COVID-19 positivity rate in the Pune district was 5.82%.

Congress spokesperson Supriya Shrinate on Thursday said ?50,000 ex-gratia announced by the Centre to families of those who died of COVID-19 "is a joke". She added that ?5 lakh aid should be given instead. "Centre isn't declaring COVID-19 a disaster because as per the law, there is a provision to give ?4 lakh on death due to disaster," said Shrinate.

Government has released COVID-19 guidelines for festival season from October to November. "Mass gatherings should be avoided in areas identified as containment zones and in districts reporting over 5% case positivity rate," it said. "Gatherings with advance permissions and limited people (as per local context) will be allowed in districts with...positivity rate of 5% and below," stated government.

During a debate in Karnataka Assembly, former CM Siddaramaiah was informed by DK Shivakumar that his dhoti was about to fall down. While tightening his dhoti, Siddaramaiah joked that he gained weight after COVID-19 recovery, adding, "My panche has come off...Of late, my paunch has increased and my panche (dhoti) keeps coming off."

During a press conference on Thursday, government named 33 districts which are reporting more than 10% weekly COVID-19 positivity rate. The highest number of districts are from Kerala (13), followed by Mizoram (8) and Meghalaya (4). Meanwhile, 23 districts are reporting weekly COVID-19 positivity rate between 5% to 10%, as per government.

Mumbai Mayor Kishori Pednekar on Thursday said a decision on reopening schools, shut amid the COVID-19 pandemic, in Mumbai and surrounding areas will be taken after Diwali. Her coments came after a paediatric task force recomended reopening schools across Maharashtra in a phased manner. A task force member noted local bodies can take a decision depending on COVID-19 cases.

Pune's Serum Institute of India (SII), the world's largest vaccine manufacturer by volume, will invest $68 million in UK's Oxford Biomedica. The investment will help fund the development of a plant that manufactures COVID-19 shots, the British company said on Wednesday. Serum Life Sciences, a unit of SII, will pick up a 3.9% stake in Oxford Biomedica.

Some West Bengal residents claimed to have saved their money and time by opting to receive the first COVID-19 vaccine dose at public health centres in Bihar's Katihar, instead of Bengal to escape paying "illegal comission", Hindustan Times reported. "In Bengal, we've to pay ?600, even ?800, but in Bihar, health officials have charged just ?100," a Bengal resident said.

Delhi High Court has allowed a high-powered comittee constituted by AAP government to probe alleged shortage of oxygen as reason behind the deaths during the second COVID-19 wave. Delhi government's decision to set up the panel was earlier stayed by the Lieutenant Governor. Delhi government said the panel will not attribute blame on anyone and government will pay the compensation.

Brazil's Health Minister Marcelo Queiroga tested positive for COVID-19 hours after accompanying President Jair Bolsonaro to the United Nations General Assembly in New York on Tuesday, the government said. Queiroga "is doing well" and will remain in New York in quarantine, the government's comunications office said. It added that the rest of the delegation has tested negative for the virus.

Speaking about global COVID-19 vaccine inequality, UN Secretary-General Antonio Guterres on Tuesday said, "This is a moral indictment of the state of our world. It's an obscenity. We passed the science test. But we're getting an F in Ethics." The majority of the wealthier world is imunised while more than 90% of Africa hasn't even received one dose, he added.

While addressing the Global COVID-19 Sumit, PM Narendra Modi said that international travel should be made easier through mutual recognition of COVID-19 vaccine certificates. His coments came amid controversy over UK's decision to quarantine Indian travellers vaccinated with Covishield over certification issues. PM Modi added that India is running the world's largest vaccination campaign.

Canada has extended ban on all direct comercial passenger flights from India until September 26. Three direct flights from India will reach Canada on Wednesday and the ban would be lifted on the basis of the results of COVID-19 tests on passengers on those flights. After the ban is lifted, passengers will require a negative report from an approved lab.

The UK has revised its travel policy to include Covishield as an approved vaccine after India warned it of reciprocal action. However, Indians vaccinated with Covishield will still need to quarantine due to certification issues. The UK said it is working with India to expand recognition of vaccine certification to people vaccinated by a relevant public health body in India.

The UK and South Korea have agreed to swap over 1 million COVID-19 vaccine doses with each other. Britain will be sending the first batch of Pfizer shots in the coming weeks and South Korea will return the same amount by year-end. "This...will maximise South Korea's rollout speed without having an impact on...UK's vaccine programe," Health Minister Sajid Javid said.

US President Joe Biden will announce on Wednesday that America would donate an additional 500 million Pfizer-BioNTech COVID-19 vaccine doses to other countries, officials said. The US President is expected to announce the decision at a virtual sumit on the sidelines of the UNGA in New York. The donations are being made "free of charge", a senior administration official said.

The cumulative number of COVID-19 vaccine doses administered in the country crossed 83 crore on Wednesday, the Union Health Ministry said. More than 64 lakh vaccine doses were administered till 7 pm on Wednesday, it added. On Wednesday, a total of 34,95,128 first COVID-19 doses were administered across the country and 30,03,146 second doses were administered.

World Health Organization (WHO) chief Tedros Adhanom Ghebreyesus on Wednesday thanked Union Health Minister Mansukh Mandaviya for announcing resumption of COVID-19 vaccine shipments to the COVAX global pool in October. "This is an important development in support of reaching the 40% vaccination target in all countries by the end of the year," Ghebreyesus wrote.

India has reported 26,964 new COVID-19 cases and 383 deaths in the last 24 hours with Kerala reporting 15,768 cases and 214 deaths on Tuesday. This comes a day after the country reported 26,115 cases and 252 deaths. However, India's active caseload stood at 3,01,989, the lowest in 186 days. The COVID-19 death toll in the country reached 4,45,768.

The LA County Health Department has stated that the Emy Awards 2021 ceremony followed the COVID-19 health and safety protocols. This comes after comedian Seth Rogen said it was insane how many people were in the room while announcing the first award. The department further said that masks for attendees were exempted as the event qualified as a television production.

For the fifth day in a row, Delhi has reported zero COVID-19-related deaths. According to the state health bulletin, the national capital has reported 30 new COVID-19 cases and 19 recoveries in the last 24 hours. With this, the total number of active cases in the city stands at 411 with a test positivity rate of 0.04%, the bulletin stated.

SRH pacer T Natarajan has tested COVID-19 positive ahead of his team's IPL 2021 clash against DC. As per an official press release, Natarajan is asymptomatic and has isolated himself. Six close contacts of Natarajan including all-rounder Vijay Shankar have been placed in isolation. The match will go ahead as scheduled as rest of the contingent tested COVID-19 negative.

Pune district reported 645 new COVID-19 cases on Tuesday while 605 people were discharged from hospitals. The district reported eight deaths while the active COVID-19 caseload stands at 7,003. Out of 645 new cases, 159 were reported in PMC, 107 in PCMC, 67 in municipal councils, nine in cantonments and 303 in rural areas.

Actor Sachin Pilgaonkar has said the COVID-19 pandemic has slowed down the whole process of making a project. "We've to take into consideration every aspect and discuss to finally figure out if we can go ahead with...project or not," he added. The 64-year-old actor further said senior actors have to be more careful and safe because they're the "soft targets".

As many as 79 students and three staff members of a boarding school named Sai School, Dharampur, in Mandi, Himachal Pradesh, tested positive for coronavirus in three days. On Tuesday, Chief Medical Officer Dr Devender Sharma said the school was declared as a micro-containment zone. Students had returned in September first week and most of them are asymptomatic, he added.

The US has administered over 38 crore COVID-19 vaccine doses in the country as of Monday morning, US Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) said. Over 21 crore people have received at least one dose, while more than 18.1 crore are fully vaccinated, CDC added. Over 22 lakh people have also received a third vaccine dose since August 13.

Confidence Petroleum has laid the foundation stone for the first 20 CNG stations in Bengaluru. This comes after GAIL Gas nominated the company to set up and operate 100 CNG stations in the city. GAIL Gas CEO Raman Chadha said that this will "help deepen" the CNG network and also appreciated the firm's "fast execution despite the challenges" of coronavirus.

Brazilian President Jair Bolsonaro was seen eating a slice of pizza on a sidewalk in US' New York after he was refused indoor dining over COVID-19 vaccination. Bolsonaro, who hasn't been vaccinated yet, said his imune system is strong enough to fight coronavirus. No one is allowed into New York restaurants without proof of vaccination against COVID-19.

Amid the ongoing COVID-19 pandemic, Jamu Deputy Comissioner Anshul Garg has made the first COVID-19 vaccine dose mandatory for adults to enter government offices and other public places in Jamu from October 2. While appealing to every eligible citizen to get vaccinated, Garg said all vaccination centres in Jamu will now be open six days a week, except Wednesday.

India has reported 26,115 new COVID-19 cases and 252 deaths in the last 24 hours. Kerala accounted for 60% of the new cases in the country as it reported 15,692 cases and 92 deaths on Monday. India's active caseload dropped to 3,09,575, the lowest in 184 days. Death toll surged to 4,45,385, while the daily positivity rate stood at 1.85%.

Congress leader Hardik Patel said that Vijay Rupani-led Gujarat government had to step down due to "curse of COVID-19 victims'" family members. He claimed that more than two lakh people died due to COVID-19 in the state due to the "negligence of the state government". "People are all prepared to throw you (BJP government) out of power," he added.

China's Harbin city has ordered spas and cinemas to shut to prevent COVID-19 spread in poorly ventilated spaces, state media reported. The temporary shutdowns were part of a range of restrictions imposed on the city after one case of comunity transmission. The Harbin government has suspended religious activities in the city and ordered tourist attractions to operate at half capacity.

The Pimpri Chinchwad Municipal Corporation (PCMC) vaccinated 4,835 citizens as part of its COVID-19 vaccination drive conducted across 29 residential societies over a week. PCMC Assistant Medical Officer Dr Laxman Gofane said the drive aims to cover as many people as possible depending on the availability of vaccines. "PCMC is providing the medical staff necessary for the drive," he added.

Forty-four people were booked in 11 FIRs registered by the Mumbai Police on Sunday, the last day of the 10-day-long Ganesh festival, for allegedly violating the COVID-19 norms. Among the 44 people, 20 belonged to the same Ganesh mandal in Parel. In total, police lodged 52 FIRs against 211 people and seized 141 vehicles during the 10-day-long Ganesh festival.

Criticising UK government's new COVID-19-related travel rules, Congress MP Shashi Tharoor said, "Double standards applied by UK are impossible to understand." "It's time we all...said to the British - 'Get your act together'. Either you ask Serum Institute of India (SII) to make those vaccines and ship it to Britain, or you say you don't accept the vaccines," Tharoor added.

COVID-19 is now officially US' deadliest pandemic, surpassing the estimated US fatalities from the 1918-19 influenza pandemic. Reported US deaths due to COVID-19 crossed 6,75,000, the estimated US fatalities from the 1918-19 flu. Deaths due to COVID-19 are rising at an average of more than 1,900 fatalities per day in US, according to Johns Hopkins data.

Reacting to the UK's new COVID-19-related travel rules, India's richest self-made woman billionaire Kiran Mazumdar-Shaw said, "Dumb Brexit politics if I may say so. I don't know who's taking such decisions." Under the rules, fully vaccinated Indians won't be considered as vaccinated in UK and will have to undergo 10-day quarantine. PM Boris Johnson "needs to intervene", Biocon's Founder added.

The UK has said, "We are engaging with the government of India to explore how we could expand UK recognition of COVID-19 vaccine certification to people vaccinated by a relevant public health body in India." This comes after UK travel rules stated that fully vaccinated Indians will not be considered as vaccinated in the UK.

The Indian government will not buy COVID-19 shots from Pfizer and Moderna, Reuters reported on Tuesday citing three government sources. "This is mainly because the domestic output of more affordable and easier-to-store vaccines has jumped," the report added. The government also declined to meet the US companies' requests for legal protection over any side-effects from its shots, the report added.

Arvind Kejriwal has made seven job-related promises in Goa including ensuring jobs for Goans by ending corruption if AAP comes to power. He promised one job/family and ?3000/month until then. He said 80% private jobs would be reserved for Goans. He promised ?5000/month for people who lost jobs due to COVID-19 in tourism sector and those affected by mining ban.

Maharashtra minister Aaditya Thackeray has asked BMC to design a special logo with a QR code to identify buildings in Mumbai where all eligible residents have been fully vaccinated against COVID-19. A statement issued by the minister's office said that the QR code will be displayed at the entry gates of residential and comercial buildings and offices.

While meeting on the sidelines of the United Nations General Assembly in New York, UK PM Boris Johnson told Brazilian President Jair Bolsonaro, who hasn't been inoculated against COVID-19, that vaccines "save lives around the world". Johnson's office also said that the PM "emphasised the important role the Oxford-AstraZeneca vaccine has played in the UK, Brazil and elsewhere."

Johnson & Johnson on Tuesday announced new data saying that a booster shot of its COVID-19 vaccine provided 94% protection against COVID-19 in the US if administered two months after the first dose. A booster shot delayed up to six months is more effective, as it leads to a 12-fold increase in antibodies, according to J&J's Phase 3 trials data.

Kerala on Tuesday reported 15,768 fresh COVID-19 cases and 214 deaths, which took the caseload to 45,39,953 and fatalities to 23,897. The number of people who recovered from the infection since Monday was 21,367 which brought the total recoveries to 43,54,264. Currently, there are 1,61,195 active COVID-19 cases in the state, an official press release said.

Delhi on Tuesday reported 39 new COVID-19 cases and zero deaths. As per the health bulletin, 18 recoveries were reported in the last 24 hours, taking the total recoveries to 14,13,071. With 400 active COVID-19 cases and a positivity rate of 0.06%, the cumulative cases in Delhi stand at 14,38,556. Meanwhile, in the last 24 hours, 2,11,004 beneficiaries were vaccinated.

As Maharashtra's active COVID-19 cases dipped below 42,000 for the first time in seven months, state Health Minister Rajesh Tope on Monday said there was no indication of a potential third wave hitting the state as of now. However, the state administration will be watching the situation for a fortnight due to the festival season.

External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar on Tuesday told his UK counterpart Liz Truss that it's in India and UK's "mutual interest" to push for early resolution of the COVID-19 quarantine issue in the UK. According to UK's rules, those fully vaccinated against COVID-19 will have to quarantine in Britain. The UK earlier said it's engaging with India on the issue.

Google on Tuesday announced that it intends to buy a New York City office building for $2.1 billion. The deal is the most expensive sale of a single US office building since the start of COVID-19 pandemic and one of priciest in US history, the WSJ said. Google is currently leasing the building and expects to open it by mid-2023.

CBSE has decided to waive exam fees and registration fees of students who lost both parents or surviving parents due to COVID-19 for the academic session 2021-22. The Board has asked schools to provide the details of these students after verifying the genuineness. Schools must send a list of all class 10 and 12 candidates by September 30.

Actor Aditya Seal will reportedly tie the knot with his long-time girlfriend, model Anushka Ranjan on November 21. According to reports, both the families are very excited for the marriage and the preparations have already begun. Reports added that the couple has already locked on their outfits and the wedding will take place keeping all COVID-19 protocols in mind.

Congress MP Shashi Tharoor has said he withdrew from many UK events over Britain's decision to treat people vaccinated against COVID-19 in India as unvaccinated. Tharoor said he pulled out of a debate at the Cambridge Union as well as launch events for the UK edition of his book, adding, "It's offensive to ask fully vaccinated Indians to quarantine."

Actor Sonu Sood in an interview with NDTV said, "I have been offered different positions (in politics) for the past 10 years and in post-COVID-19, I have declined Rajya Sabha seats twice." He said, "Mentally, I was not ready." The actor added, "If I ever think of getting into it (politics), I'll shout from the rooftops that 'I'm ready'."

The Uttarakhand government on Monday extended the COVID-19 curfew in the state from 6 am on September 21 to 6 am on October 5. Uttarakhand currently has 273 active cases. Notably, the Uttarakhand High Court allowed Char Dham Yatra with COVID-19 restrictions in the state. Reportedly, over 5,000 pilgrims and tourists are arriving for this on a daily basis.

Foreign nationals will be allowed in the US from early November if they have COVID-19 vaccination proof and a negative COVID-19 test, the White House said. Fully vaccinated passengers won't be required to quarantine. Previous rules restricted travel by non-citizens who have in the prior 14 days been in the UK, EU, China, India, Iran, Ireland, Brazil and South Africa.

India will resume the export of COVID-19 vaccines under its 'Vaccine Maitri' initiative from the next quarter which begins in October, Health Minister Mansukh Mandaviya has said. "We will help the world and contribute to COVAX in the fourth quarter," said Mandaviya on Monday. "We expect to get more than 30 crores doses of COVID-19 vaccines next month," he added.

Considering the downward trend in the active COVID-19 cases and test positivity rate in Pune, the civic body has decided to open swiming pools for training purposes from September 20. Pune Municipal Corporation (PMC) Comissioner Vikram Kumar in an order said that it is mandatory for the coaches and trainees to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 for swiming training.

The Supreme Court on Monday issued notice to the Centre on a plea seeking door-to-door COVID-19 vaccination for the disabled. Seeking the Centre's response on it, the SC said it "raises substantial questions dealing with the rights of the disabled". It also sought provisions for preference in scheduling vaccination, a dedicated helpline for this and easy access to vaccination centres.

According to UK government's new COVID-19-related travel rules, fully vaccinated Indians will not be considered as vaccinated in the UK and will have to undergo 10-day quarantine. According to new rules, if a person is vaccinated in Africa, South America, UAE, India, Turkey, Jordan, Thailand and Russia, they are considered unvaccinated. The new rules will become effective from October 4.

BCCI have hiked match fee for domestic cricketers, Secretary Jay Shah announced. Seniors (players with 40-plus matches) will get ?60,000/match. Under-23 players will get ?25,000/match while Under-19 players will get ?20,000/match. "Cricketers who participated in 2019-20 domestic season will get 50% additional...fee as compensation for season 2020-21 lost due to COVID-19 situation," Shah tweeted.

Comedian Seth Rogen expressed his disappointment over the lack of COVID-19 safety protocols at the Emys 2021. While announcing first award of the 73rd Primetime Emy Awards, Rogen called out the organisers of the event for seemingly not abiding by the COVID-19 safety protocols they'd promised. "There's way too many of us in this little room...This is insane," he said.

India has reported 30,256 new COVID-19 cases and 295 deaths in the last 24 hours. Kerala accounted for 65% of the new cases in the country as it reported 19,653 cases and 152 deaths on Sunday. India's active caseload dropped to 3,18,181, the lowest in 183 days. Death toll surged to 4,45,133, while the daily positivity rate stood at 2.57%.

A booth-level BJP leader in Uttar Pradesh's Meerut has claimed that his vaccination certificate wrongly shows that he has been administered five doses of COVID-19 vaccine and is scheduled for the sixth dose. The 73-year-old leader, Rampal Singh, claimed that he was vaccinated only twice and filed a complaint accusing the health department of negligence. A probe has been launched.

Tamil Nadu government on Monday urged the Centre to allocate an additional 50 lakh doses of COVID-19 vaccines every week. The state government requested for them to vaccinate all the uncovered eligible persons by October-end. "[Centre] has supplied 3.97 crore doses of COVID-19 vaccine...to the state till September 19," Chief Minister MK Stalin said.

Recalling England's tour of India amid COVID-19 crisis earlier this year, Stuart Broad said they were locked away for 10 weeks in hotel rooms. "We'd not seen other human beings, been kept away from our families, had slow wi-fi and couldn't even stream Netflix," he added. He further said he can understand why India panicked over fifth Test in Manchester.

Kerala recorded 15,692 new COVID-19 cases on Monday, informed the health department in a press release. With 92 new fatalities, the death toll mounted to 23,683. Among all the districts, Thrissur reported the highest 2,504 new cases, followed by Ernakulam that reported 1,720 new COVID-19 cases. The number of active COVID-19 cases in the state is 1,67,008.

The Himachal Pradesh government on Monday issued an order instructing all schools, except residential schools to stay closed till September 25 in view of the COVID-19 situation in the state. The order, however, asks teachers and non-teaching staff to continue to attend the schools. The order comes into effect imediately and shall stay in place until further notice.

India has reported 30,773 new COVID-19 cases and 309 deaths in the last 24 hours. Kerala accounted for 62% of the new cases in the country as it reported 19,325 COVID cases and 143 deaths on Saturday. India's active caseload stood at 3,32,158, and the death toll surged to 4,44,838. India's daily positivity rate stood at 1.97%.

Mumbai reported around 7,407 COVID-19 cases from September 1-17, which is almost 50% more than 4,943 cases recorded during the same period in August. Similarly, in past one month, number of active cases has also increased from around 2,600 to 4,600 cases. However, number of deaths in Mumbai has come down by 38% in September as compared to August's fatalities.

The Uttar Pradesh government on Sunday eased COVID-19 restrictions by allowing a maximum of 100 people to gather at events taking place in closed and open premises, outside of containment zones. As per an order issued by the Additional Chief Secretary (Home) Awanish Awasthi, a distance of two yards should be maintained between the seating of guests.

Delhi has reported zero COVID-19-related deaths in the last 24 hours, the state health bulletin informed on Sunday. The national capital, however, reported 28 new COVID-19 cases and the test positivity rate has reached 0.04%. The new COVID-19 cases have taken the total number of active cases in Delhi to 387, the bulletin further stated.

NCP leader Nawab Malik on Saturday alleged that fewer COVID-19 vaccine doses were administered in the last two weeks so as to set a record on PM Narendra Modi?s birthday. On Friday, India set a record by administering over 2.5 crore COVID-19 vaccine doses in one day. He further asked why couldn?t a similar target be achieved the next day.

Fake COVID-19 vaccination certificates are being sold in India for as much as $75 (?5,500) on Telegram, a report by Check Point Research found. The report said the black market for fake vaccine certificates and fake negative COVID-19 test results has expanded globally to 29 countries, including India. Telegram said it is taking action against groups involved in such activities.

India's record COVID-19 vaccination of 2.5 crore doses on Prime Minister Narendra Modi's birthday on September 17 was equal to the entire population of Australia, the government said. It was also equal to two-third population of Canada (3.77 crore) and was five times the population of New Zealand (48 lakh), the government added.

The government has listed the symptoms that may require imediate attention if they occur within 20 days of administration of any COVID-19 vaccine. The symptoms include shortness of breath, pain in chest, vomiting or persistent abdominal pain, seizures, blurred vision, severe or persistent headache and pain in limbs or swelling in arms or feet.

Issuing guidelines for the tenth day of Ganesh Chaturthi on Sunday, the BMC said that maximum five people (preferably fully vaccinated for COVID-19) will be allowed to carry idols to imersion sites in case of household idols. For Ganesh mandal idols, maximum 10 vaccinated people can carry out imersions. BMC said it will deploy 25,000 employees across the city.

An 84-year-old woman in Kerala was administered two doses of the COVID-19 vaccine within a gap of 30 minutes. The incident took place at a state-run hospital in the Ernakulam district. As per the woman, she was later made to sit for observation for an hour and officials also called to check on her health after she returned home.

Xiamen city in China has told its residents to stay home and closed various venues in response to a COVID-19 outbreak. The announcement comes on the first of the four-day Mid-Autumn Festival holidays, a peak travel season across the country. Xiamen is one of the four cities in Fujian province that has reported a surge in COVID-19 cases recently.

India has set a new world record for administering the highest number of COVID-19 vaccines in a single day. India achieved the feat by administering over 2.5 crore COVID-19 vaccines under the 'Vaccine Sewa' campaign to mark the 71st birthday of Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Friday. "Today was the day for health workers," Health Minister Mansukh Mandaviya tweeted.

Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Saturday said, "More than 15 lakh vaccinations took place every hour yesterday, over 26,000 vaccinations took place every minute and more than 425 people were administered vaccines every second." He also appreciated all health workers for their efforts in helping India achieve a record number of over 2.5 crore vaccinations in a single day.

A new Apple policy will make it mandatory for its unvaccinated employees in offices and stores to undergo frequent COVID-19 testing in the US, starting next month. However, inoculated employees will be tested less often. Apple has reportedly said it is assessing its policies on a country-by-country basis, however CEO Tim Cook urged employees to get the vaccine.

Many people in Odisha are not turning up to take their second COVID-19 vaccine dose despite reminders, Dr Bijay Panigrahi, the nodal officer for Odisha's vaccination drive, said. Only 69.8 lakh people have received both doses, Bijay said, adding that "around 28 lakh more people should've taken...second dose by now". Odisha has administered first dose to over two crore people.

While interacting with healthcare workers and beneficiaries in Goa on Saturday, PM Narendra Modi said a political party "got fever" after India administered over 2.5 crore doses of COVID-19 vaccines yesterday. "Yesterday...after the figure was announced, a political party started showing some adverse reactions? Is there a logic to this," he asked a doctor, without naming any party.

Cabinet Secretary Rajiv Gauba on Saturday chaired a meeting to review COVID-19 situation in the country. While congratulating the health workers on administering over 2.5 crore COVID-19 vaccine doses on Friday, he also reminded the states that there is no room for complacency. He hoped that with the increased availability of vaccine doses, the pace of vaccination will be maintained.

A panel that advises US Food and Drug Administration (FDA) has approved a plan to give Pfizer COVID-19 vaccine booster to those who are 65 or older or run a high risk of severe disease. The FDA will consider the group's advice and make its own decision. White House called it an "important step forward in protecting Americans from COVID-19".

US' Brunswick is offering a $500 (over ?36,800) bonus to the employees of the city's government who get vaccinated against coronavirus. Those employees who have already received their doses are also eligible to receive the bonus. "It's a really good incentive...it will get the attention of employees," Brunswick City Manager Regina McDuffie said.

India's COVID-19 recovery rate stands at 97.65%, the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare said on Saturday as the country recorded 35,662 new cases. According to the latest data, 3,26,32,222 people have recovered so far. India's active cases stand at 3,40,639 and the death toll has surged to 4,44,529.

The Vietnamese government on Saturday said that Vietnam has approved Cuba's Abdala vaccine for use against COVID-19. The announcement comes as Vietnam continues to fight its worst coronavirus outbreak that began in April. Abdala is the eighth COVID-19 vaccine approved for use in Vietnam, which has one of the lowest vaccination rates in the region.

Pune district administration has fined at least 4,574 people for violating COVID-19 norms and collected ?20,95,950 in fines between September 9 and September 15. Fines were collected for not wearing masks at public places, spitting and not following COVID-19 appropriate behaviour in public places. A total of 9,80,860 people have been penalised since the beginning of the pandemic.

Actress Yuvika Chaudhary has said it's "scary" and "terrifying" to be pregnant amid the COVID-19 pandemic. "I get surprised to see people getting pregnant. I wonder how they managed to do so," she added. "I salute those who've done it like some of my...friends including Kishwer M Rai, who along with husband Suyyash welcomed...baby boy in August," said Yuvika.

Bengaluru reported 263 fresh COVID-19 cases and six deaths on Saturday. As per the official data, in the last 24 hours, 222 people were discharged while the total number of active cases in the city stands at 7,491. With a positivity rate of 0.63% in Karnataka, the active COVID-19 cases in the state stand at 15,755.

Honda Motor has said that its production lines in Japan are operating at about 40% of its initial plan for the August-September period. The Japanese automaker cited chip shortages and delays in parts shipments due to coronavirus outbreaks overseas as reasons for low output. Earlier, the world's biggest carmaker Toyota said that it's cutting annual production target by 300,000 vehicles.

Idled by coronavirus crisis, taxis in Thailand have utilised their roofs to serve as small vegetable plots. Workers from two taxi cooperatives used black plastic garbage bags stretched across bamboo frames and then added soil in which a variety of crops, including tomatoes, cucumbers and string beans, were planted. Thailand's new infections have ranged under 15,000 in recent days.

Delhi on Saturday reported 41 new COVID-19 cases and zero deaths. As per the health bulletin, 44 recoveries were reported in the last 24 hours, taking the total recoveries to 14,12,980. With 404 active COVID-19 cases and a positivity rate of 0.06%, the cumulative cases in Delhi stand at 14,38,469. Meanwhile, in the last 24 hours, 1,52,911 beneficiaries were vaccinated.

SDM Chanakyapuri Geeta Grover has issued an order to close down the Bangla Sahib Gurdwara for visitors with imediate effect, saying that COVID-19 norms were violated. Grover said orders which state "religious places shall be permitted to open but no visitors will be allowed" were violated. "We've not closed down the gurdwara; we've only closed it for visitors," she clarified.

Kerala government on Saturday announced that schools in the state will reopen for Classes 1 to 7 and 10 and 12 from November 1, while for other classes it will resume on November 15. The decision was taken at a COVID-19 review meeting. Earlier, the state government announced that colleges and other higher education institutions will reopen from October 4.

The Odisha government on Saturday directed all state-run universities and non-government degree colleges to resume physical classes for first-year undergraduate students for both three and four-year courses from September 20. The decision was taken in view of improving the COVID-19 situation. Hostels shall be reopened from September 19 and all COVID-related protocols must be followed.

Maharashtra Deputy CM Ajit Pawar has announced that all shops will be closed on Sunday in Pune city, Pune cantonment and rural areas on the occasion of Ganesh Visarjan. Restaurants and hotels will be allowed to remain open and essential services will be exempted, he added. The Ganesh Chaturthi festival is being celebrated with curbs across Maharashtra due to COVID-19.

Sri Lanka on Friday extended its nationwide lockdown till October 1 to combat COVID-19. The government decided to extend the lockdown following a top-level meeting chaired by President Gotabaya Rajapaksa on Friday. The nationwide lockdown was first imposed on August 20 and has been extended four times. The country has reported more than 4.9 lakh COVID-19 cases so far.

The Bangalore Metro Rail Corporation Limited (BMRCL) on Friday announced that metro services will operate from 6 am to 10 pm from tomorrow onwards. The last train from all four terminal stations will start at 9.30 pm, it added. At present, the metro trains operate between 7 am and 8 pm owing to the COVID-19 pandemic.

Rapper Nicki Minaj claimed in an Instagram story that she is in "Twitter jail" and has been prevented from tweeting after she posted anti-vaccine content. However, Twitter denied Nicki's claims and said it has not taken any enforcement action on the account. Earlier, Nicki had tweeted that her cousin's friend became impotent after taking COVID-19 vaccine.

Health Minister Mansukh Mandaviya has said that COVID-19 vaccine doses administered in India on Friday crossed the one crore-mark, as of 1:30 pm, on PM Narendra Modi's birthday. "I believe...today we'll make a new record of vaccinations and give it as a gift to [him]," Mandaviya tweeted. Vaccinations crossed one crore for the fourth time in less than a month.

Biocon Biologics, a Biocon subsidiary, has said it'll offer around 15% stake to Serum Institute Life Sciences, a Serum Institute of India (SII) subsidiary, at a post-money valuation of $4.9 billion. In return, Biocon will get comitted access to 100 million vaccine doses per annum for 15 years. SII CEO Adar Poonawalla will have a Board seat in Biocon Biologics.

The Brazilian Police on Friday conducted raids at the offices of Precisa Medicamentos, a Brazil-based pharmaceutical company, as part of a probe into potential irregularities in procuring COVID-19 vaccines from Bharat Biotech. Precisa, who used to represent Bharat Biotech in Brazil before the allegations surfaced, has denied wrongdoing. The contract to supply 2 crore Covaxin doses was suspended.

In a series of tweets, PM Narendra Modi on Friday thanked people for the birthday wishes he received and also took notice of the record COVID-19 vaccine doses administered in a single day. "To each and every person who has wished me today...I cherish every wish, it gives me strength to work even harder for our beloved nation," he said.

The fifth serosurvey conducted by BMC between August 12 and September 8 showed that 86.64% of the 8,674 people surveyed in Mumbai have COVID-19 antibodies. Notably, 65% of samples were of those who received at least one shot of COVID-19 vaccine. The last serosurvey in March found that 36.3% of those surveyed had antibodies against COVID-19.

IPL 2021, which was suspended on May 4 due to coronavirus crisis in India, will resume in UAE on September 19. DC are on top of the table with 12 points from eight matches and are followed by CSK and RCB, who have 10 points each. With just one victory from seven matches, SRH are placed last on the table.

India has broken the previous single-day COVID-19 vaccination record of 1.33 crore doses by administering over 2 crore doses in around 10 hours on PM Narendra Modi's birthday on Friday, according to CoWIN. "I believe that today we'll make a new record of vaccination and give it as a gift to the PM," Health Minister Mansukh Mandaviya said earlier.

Uttarakhand CM Pushkar Singh Dhami announced on Friday that Char Dham Yatra will begin from September 18. This comes after Uttarakhand High Court lifted the ban on the yatra and made it mandatory for devotees to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 and carry a negative test report. The court said 800 pilgrims will be allowed in Kedarnath Dham per day.

At least 15,295 idols, including 213 of Goddess Gauri, were imersed across Mumbai on the seventh day of the Ganesha festival, a BMC official said on Friday. Of the count, 6,818 were imersed in artificial ponds, created to avoid crowding at natural water bodies. No untoward incident was reported. The 10-day festival is being celebrated in low-key manner amid COVID-19.

Government has called the recent New York Times article on India's COVID-19 response a "provocative, attention seeking" piece. The article claimed that the "ICMR tailored its findings to fit Prime Minister Narendra Modi's optimistic narrative despite a looming crisis". "All the issues raised are dead ones and probably do not merit any attention," ICMR Director General Dr Balram Bhargava said.

India has reported 34,403 new COVID-19 cases in the last 24 hours, according to Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. Kerala accounted for over 64% of the new cases in the country as the state reported 22,182 cases and 178 deaths. The country's active caseload currently stands at 3,39,056, and accounts for 1.02% of total cases.

The Bangalore International Airport Limited has said that due to COVID-19, there has been a delay in the completion of Kempegowda International Airport's Terminal 2. As per airport authorities, the March 2021 deadline was pushed to March 2022 due to this. Being constructed at an approximate cost of ?13,000 crore, Terminal 2 will have elevated walkways, gardens and artificial waterfalls.

The UN Children's Fund (UNICEF) said the world is facing an "education crisis" due to the COVID-19 pandemic. The pandemic has left "nearly 77 million children shut out of the classroom for...past 18 months", it added. UNICEF had "closed" its social media accounts for 18 hours on Thursday, urging countries to reopen schools for in-person learning as soon as possible.

The Supreme Court has allowed the Kerala government to hold physical exams for Class 11, with the state government saying it was prepared to hold the exams adhering to COVID-19 protocol. The apex court had on September 3 stayed the state government's decision to conduct offline exams amid rising COVID-19 cases, saying, "There is an alarming situation in the state."

Union Minister for Road Transport and Highways Nitin Gadkari has said that YouTube pays him ?4 lakh per month owing to huge viewership of his lectures. He added that during COVID-19 times, he gave a lot of lectures through video conference, which were then uploaded on YouTube. Gadkari has 1,97,000 followers on YouTube.

Gujarat Health Department has planned to administer 35 lakh doses of COVID-19 vaccines on the occasion of Prime Minister Narendra Modi's 71st birthday on Friday. As part of the mega vaccination drive, the state has planned to cover 1,600 villages in a single day. As many as 3,86,58,856 beneficiaries have received the first vaccine dose in Gujarat so far.

Congress leader Digambar Kamat on Thursday alleged that the people of Goa suffered badly during the COVID-19 pandemic due to the state government's "insensitive attitude". The Congress leader thanked Goa Governor PS Sreedharan Pillai for announcing financial aid for old age homes, orphanages and other such institutions. "Your gesture will be welcomed by all the Goans," Kamat tweeted.

Centre has listed 10 states/UTs that have administered first dose of COVID-19 vaccine to over 85% of its adult population. Lakshadweep, Chandigarh, Goa and Himachal Pradesh have administered first dose to 100% of its adult population, while Sikkim administered to 99% of its adult population. This is followed by Andaman and Nicobar Islands and Dadra and Nagar Haveli among others.

Talking about the cancelled Manchester Test, Team India all-rounder Shardul Thakur has revealed that they were "worried" about themselves and their families' health after assistant physiotherapist Yogesh Parmar tested positive for COVID-19 on the eve of the Test. "We were worried about what will happen, who will be infected since Parmar had treated everyone," he added.

Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike (BBMP) Chief Comissioner Gaurav Gupta said school students with COVID-19-like symptoms for over two days will be tested. Gupta made the announcement after a meeting with members of paediatric, technical expert comittees about steps to combat COVID-19. He also ordered officials to identify nodal authorities at all schools to ensure checks are done mandatorily.

Kerala CM Pinarayi Vijayan said more than 80% of the population eligible for vaccination has been administered with the first dose of COVID-19 vaccine. Over 32% of the eligible population has received both doses, he added. The government is striving to ensure that all people above 18 years of age are given the first dose by September-end, he further said.

China has fully vaccinated over 100 crore people or over 70% of its population against COVID-19, a spokesperson of the country's National Health Comission said. "As of September 15, 2.16 billion vaccine doses have been administered nationwide," he added. Notably, China's full vaccination rate has surpassed that of several developed countries including US, UK and Japan.

White House on Wednesday offered to connect Nicki Minaj with one of the Biden administration's doctors to address her questions about the COVID-19 vaccine. This comes after the rapper tweeted, "My cousin in Trinidad won't get the vaccine cuz his friend got it & became impotent. His testicles became swollen." Minaj was criticised by global health officials after her tweet.

RBI Deputy Governor Michael Patra said, "We don't like tantrums, we like tepid and transparent transitions...glide paths rather than crash landings." The envisaged glide path should take inflation down to 4% by 2023-24, he added. RBI and the Monetary Policy Comittee will prefer to wind down extraordinary accomodation put in place during COVID-19 over a period of time, he added.

Ex-Australia spinner Brad Hogg has said Delhi Capitals, with Shreyas Iyer and Ravichandran Ashwin back in the squad, are the team to beat in the UAE leg of IPL 2021. Shreyas had missed the first half of IPL 2021 due to a shoulder injury while Ashwin had pulled out after five matches to support family during second wave of COVID-19.

Telangana government has set up a comittee to look into the losses faced by Hyderabad Metro Rail (HMR) due to COVID-19. "Hyderabad Metro is stuck in debt... the government will do its best to keep it in the groove as it has protected all sectors," CM K Chandrashekar Rao said. HMR in June had reported more than ?1,700 crore losses.

Russian President Vladimir Putin on Thursday said he would have to spend "a few days" in self-isolation, adding that dozens of people in his inner circle tested COVID-19 positive. Putin's spokesperson Dmitry Peskov said the 68-year-old, who has had two shots of Russia's Sputnik V vaccine, was healthy.

After reporting less than 30,000 COVID-19 cases for four straight days, India saw 30,570 new COVID-19 cases and 431 deaths in the last 24 hours. Kerala accounted for nearly 58% of the new cases in the country as the state reported 17,681 cases and 208 deaths on Wednesday. India's active caseload stood at 3,42,923, while the death toll reached 4,43,928.

Vera Jourova, the European Comission's Vice-President for Values and Transparency said, "No journalist should die or be harmed due to their job." She said, "[COVID-19] pandemic has shown...key role of journalists to inform us. And the urgent need for public authorities to...protect them." As per the comission, 908 journalists and media workers were attacked across the 27-nation bloc in 2020.

Uttarakhand High Court has lifted its stay on Char Dham Yatra and directed the state government to strictly follow COVID-19 norms. The court said 800 pilgrims will be allowed in Kedarnath Dham, 1,200 in Badrinath Dham, 600 in Gangotri and 400 in Yamunotri every day. It also ordered mandatory COVID-19 negative report and double vaccination certificate for devotees.

At least 20% of India's adult population has been vaccinated with both doses of vaccines against COVID-19, said government on Thursday. In addition to this, 62% of the adult population has been administered at least one dose of COVID-19 vaccine. "Overall there is stabilisation in COVID-19 cases and Kerala too has reported drop in cases," the government added.

Speaking about the COVID-19 healthcare infrastructure, Union Health Secretary Rajesh Bhushan said 3,631 Pressure Swing Adsorption (PSA) plants have been started in the country. "When these plants get comissioned, they will be able to make available more than 4,500 MT of medical oxygen," he added. Total 1,595 plants have been comissioned as of now, the health secretary further said.

The 200-year-old event of Ramlila in Ramnagar, Varanasi, organised by the Kashi royal family has been cancelled for the second straight year due to COVID-19. The family's Kunwar Anant Narayan Singh informed about the decision to Varanasi Police Comissioner A Satish Ganesh through a letter on Wednesday. Last year, couplets of Ramcharitmanas were recited for one month starting Anant Chaturdashi.

The Centre on Thursday said Kerala has the most number of active COVID-19 cases in the country with 1,99,428 cases that account for 56.8% of the total active cases. It is followed by Maharashtra with 53,220 active COVID-19 cases, Tamil Nadu with 16,549 cases, Karnataka with 15,782 cases, Andhra Pradesh with 14,412 cases and Mizoram with 13,525 cases.

Amid the speculations about a possible booster shot of the COVID-19 vaccine, the Centre on Thursday stressed that getting the whole population fully vaccinated is the first priority. "Booster doses are not the central theme at the moment in the scientific and public healthcare discussion," said Balram Bhargava, ICMR's Director-General. Currently, there are 3,42,923 active COVID-19 cases in India.

BJP on Thursday complained to the Election Comission alleging that West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee violated COVID-19 norms set by the EC while campaigning for the Bhabanipur bypoll. Banerjee is contesting from Bhabanipur where bypoll will be held on September 30. According to the complaint, her supporters also flouted the norms by not wearing masks and by not using sanitiser.

The government on Thursday said that India has exceeded the average daily COVID-19 vaccination of 18 major countries in the world combined. While the 18 countries had an average of 81.7 lakh doses, India alone had an average of 85.4 lakh, the government stated. US and Brazil have a daily average of 7.9 lakh and 13.8 lakh doses, respectively.

The centres run by the government and Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) in Mumbai will only vaccinate women against COVID-19 tomorrow, September 17, the municipal body tweeted on Thursday. "The centres will be open from 10.30 am-6:30 pm. All women can walk into the centres for their dose, online registration will be closed," BMC tweeted. Notably, both doses will be available.

Zimbabwe's government has ordered all its employees to get vaccinated against COVID-19 or they would not be allowed to come to work. Zimbabwe's Public Service Comission "urged" heads of government departments to make arrangements for their employees to be vaccinated "and to explain to any who elect not to be vaccinated that they will not be deemed to be working".

About 3,000 health workers who weren't vaccinated against COVID-19 have been suspended in France, Health Minister Olivier Veran said. A new rule, which came into force on Wednesday, made vaccination mandatory for all health and care home workers. "Most...suspensions are only temporary...many of them have decided to get vaccinated as they see that...vaccination mandate is a reality," Veran added.

The European Union has pledged 200 more vaccine doses to Africa to help curb COVID-19 pandemic. Earlier, the EU had pledged 250 million doses. "Our...urgent priority is to speed up global vaccination....With less than 1% of global doses administered to lower income countries, the scale of injustice and...level of urgency is obvious," European Comission President Ursula von der Leyen said.

After rapper Nicki Minaj claimed that her Trinidad cousin's friend "became impotent" and his testicles were "swollen" after taking the COVID-19 vaccine, UK government's Chief Medical Advisor Chris Witty said her claims are "untrue". He further said that the claim was designed to "scare" people, adding that the rapper should be "ashamed" of herself for "peddling untruths" on social media.

US Army said that soldiers who refuse to get the COVID-19 vaccine ?could be suspended from their duties and possibly discharged. "Soldiers who refuse the vaccine will first be counselled...[but] continued failure to comply could result in administrative or non-judicial punishment," it added. The Army expects its active-duty military members to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 by December 15.

Dr Reddy's Laboratories has received the Drugs Controller General of India's (DCGI) approval to conduct Phase-3 bridging trials of Russia's single-dose COVID-19 vaccine Sputnik V Light in India, according to reports. In July, the Central Drugs Standard Control Organisation's expert comittee did not grant permission for trials as it didn't find a "scientific rationale" behind the same.

Former RBI Governor Raghuram Rajan has asked, "Would you accuse the government of being anti-national for not doing a good job on vaccines initially? You'd say it's a mistake...people do make mistakes." This comes after an article in RSS-affiliated magazine 'Panchjanya' called Infosys "anti-national" over new tax portal glitches. "It just strikes me as completely unproductive," Rajan told NDTV.

Russian Direct Investment Fund on Wednesday announced the Sputnik V vaccine has demonstrated 97.2% efficacy against COVID-19 in Belarus. The efficacy of Sputnik V was measured based on data from over 860,000 people vaccinated between January-July 2021.
