The data from Belarus Health Ministry also confirmed the high safety of the vaccine, with no deaths or adverse effects associated with vaccination.

India has reported 27,176 new COVID-19 cases and 284 deaths in the last 24 hours. The country saw less than 30,000 daily cases for fourth day in a row. Kerala accounted for over 58% of the new cases as it reported 15,876 cases and 129 deaths on Tuesday. India's active caseload stood at 3,51,087, while the death toll reached 4,43,497.

Kerala has passed its peak of coronavirus and a decline in cases will likely start in the next two weeks, AIIMS Professor Dr Sanjay Rai said. "Earlier serosurvey in Kerala suggested that most population was susceptible but latest serosurvey shows that 46% had antibodies due to vaccine or by infection," he added. Kerala reported 15,876 new COVID-19 cases on Tuesday.

West Bengal government on Wednesday extended the COVID-19 restrictions with the existing relaxations till September 30. "All outdoor activities including movement of people and vehicles shall be strictly prohibited between 11 pm to 5 am except for health services, law and order, essential comodities including agriculture produce and other emergency services," the official order said.

Biocon's Executive Chairperson Kiran Mazumdar-Shaw has revealed that Biocon Biologics' IPO may happen only in 2023 or 2024, with COVID-19 having "thrown a spanner in the works". "The pandemic has delayed regulatory inspections and approvals," she added. She also discussed the difference in attitude of investors towards internet-led startups and bioscience startups.

Congress MP Benny Behanan said that the Kerala government is hiding the death toll due to coronavirus disease and demanded that a case should be filed against CM Pinarayi Vijayan. He added that all hospitals' COVID-19 data is being scrutinised by a medical body in Thiruvananthapuram because it works in "favour of the government".

Actor Manoj Bajpayee in an interview has said that OTT content has been the only saviour of the entertainment industry amid the COVID-19 pandemic. He added that it is the only medium that kept people entertained. "In our country, we often see that talented people were getting almost no due. The OTT has become a miracle for many," Bajpayee said.

China tightened lockdowns and increased orders for mass testing in cities along its east coast on Wednesday amid the latest surge in COVID-19 cases. Checks have been set up in toll stations around the city of Putian in Fujian province. The nearby cities of Xiamen and Quanzhou have also restricted travel as COVID-19's delta variant spreads through the region.

Ex-India cricketer Dilip Doshi, who had attended Ravi Shastri's book launch event in London, said he was shocked to see none of Team India players was wearing a mask. He added Indian players should have worn masks irrespective of the regulations in the UK. Several Team India supporting staff members including Shastri were infected with COVID-19 during the fourth Test.

The IPL will welcome the fans back to the stadiums in UAE leg after a brief hiatus owing to the COVID-19 situation, the organisers announced today. Matches will be played at Dubai, Sharjah and Abu Dhabi with limited seating available keeping in mind the Covid protocols and UAE government regulations, they added. The IPL 2021 will resume on September 19.

The overall crime in the country increased by 28% in the COVID-19 pandemic year of 2020 over 2019, the National Crime Records Bureau (NCRB) report showed. Cases registered under "Other IPC Crimes" rose from 2,52,268 in 2019 to 10,62,399 in 2020, the report stated. According to the report, due to the lockdown last year, crimes against women have declined.

European Comission President Ursula von der Leyen said on Wednesday that the pace of vaccination against COVID-19 must be quickened to avert "a pandemic of the unvaccinated". "Let's do everything...[so] that this does not turn into a pandemic of...unvaccinated," she said. By August end, 70% of the adult population in the 27-nation EU had reportedly been fully vaccinated against COVID-19.

According to new COVID-19 guidelines, all schools for students up to class 8 will remain closed till September 30 in Delhi. However, schools for class 9 onwards and colleges are allowed to open with 50% seating capacity. Restaurants, bars and theatres can open with 50% capacity. Metro can run with 100% capacity but standing passengers will not be allowed.

ICAI waived off the registration fee of CA course at all levels including ICITSS and AICITSS for students who have lost any parent during the COVID-19 pandemic. The students would need to submit requisite documents while registering in the CA course to avail the exemption. This scheme is applicable for the period of April 1, 2020 to March 31, 2023.

Twitter has said that rapper Nicki Minaj's tweet on COVID-19 vaccine-linked impotency is not violating its rules. Nicki had claimed that her cousin's friend "became impotent" and his testicles were "swollen" after taking the COVID-19 vaccine. A Twitter spokesperson said that because Minaj's tweet was a personal anecdote, it didn't violate the rules.

Delhi on Tuesday reported 38 new COVID-19 cases and zero deaths. As per the health bulletin, 15 recoveries were reported in the last 24 hours, taking the total recoveries to 14,12,805. With 400 active COVID-19 cases and a positivity rate of 0.05%, the cumulative cases in Delhi stand at 14,38,288. Meanwhile, in the last 24 hours, 1,64,880 beneficiaries were vaccinated.

The Shiv Sena in its mouthpiece 'Saamana' on Tuesday alleged that former Gujarat CM Vijay Rupani was changed to counter anti-incumbency against him ahead of the 2022 state Assembly polls. It said the "bubble" of the Gujarat model of development has burst. "The government machinery has clearly crumbled during COVID-19," the Shiv Sena added.

China has administered a total of 215 crore doses of COVID-19 vaccines as of September 13, according to the National Health Comission data on Tuesday. The country had administered about 44 lakh COVID-19 vaccine doses on Monday, data showed. China, which is currently witnessing a surge in COVID-19 cases due to Delta variant, has reported over 1.07 lakh virus cases.

COVID-19 vaccines have probably saved about 1,12,000 lives and averted 24 million cases of the virus in the UK, England's Deputy Chief Medical Officer Jonathan Van-Tam said. The country has administered more than 9.2 crore COVID-19 vaccine doses so far. Van-Tam added that the UK is "not past the pandemic" and that the country is in an "active phase still".

The UK on Tuesday said that it'll start administering COVID-19 booster shots from next week to everyone over the age of 50 and other vulnerable groups. Booster doses are important for keeping COVID-19 under control, British Health Secretary said. Notably, the announcement comes after WHO's appeal to wealthy nations to delay the rollout of booster shots amid global vaccine inequality.

Fifteen people, including a seven-year-old boy, were found inside a refrigerated truck in Vietnam after they tried to escape severely hit COVID-19 areas, state media reported. Tens of millions of people in Vietnam are under stay-at-home orders, with domestic travel largely forbidden, as the country is battling fourth wave of the pandemic. Vietnam has reported over 6.1 lakh COVID-19 cases.

A Mumbai Court warned Kangana Ranaut that an arrest warrant will be issued against her if she does not remain present in court on the next date of hearing in the Javed Akhtar defamation case. The next hearing is scheduled for September 20. However, Kangana's lawyer, Rizwan Siddiqui, submitted a medical report claiming that the actress is showing COVID-19 symptoms.

Speaking about her show 'Mumbai Diaries 26/11', actress Konkona Sensharma said that it's a tribute to frontline workers. She added, "We've had many shows on 26/11, but not from the perspective of doctors." "Thanks to COVID-19, we've seen what...doctors and medical staff have to go through...attacks on doctors, the lack of PPE kits [and]...shortages in government hospitals," she said.

India has reported 25,404 new COVID-19 cases and 339 deaths in the last 24 hours. The country saw less than 30,000 daily cases for third day in a row. Kerala accounted for nearly 60% of the new cases as it reported 15,058 cases and 99 deaths on Monday. India's active caseload stood at 3,62,207, while the death toll reached 4,43,213.

Dehradun DM Dr R Rajesh Kumar extended COVID-19 curfew in the Uttarakhand district from Tuesday till 6 am on September 21. Tourists can now visit Mussoorie only on weekends and should furnish negative RT-PCR reports not older than 72 hours on arrival. Further, not more than 15,000 tourists will be allowed in Mussoorie's hotels. Spitting in public has been banned.

Gujarat government on Tuesday extended the night curfew from 11 pm-6 am in eight cities from September 15-25 amid the COVID-19 pandemic. The curfew will be imposed in Ahmedabad, Vadodara, Surat, Rajkot, Junagadh, Bhavnagar, Jamnagar and Gandhinagar. Earlier, the state government had allowed eateries to function till 10 pm. As per Health Ministry, Gujarat has 161 active COVID-19 cases.

The Big Lebowski' actor Jeff Bridges, who was diagnosed with lymphoma last year, has announced that his cancer is in remission. He added that he contracted COVID-19 while undergoing treatment for cancer, but it is "in the rear-view mirror". The veteran Hollywood actor also said that the tumour has shrunk down to the size of a marble.

The Kerala government on Tuesday announced that the status of Saturdays as working days will be restored "wherever applicable", after reviewing the current COVID-19 scenario of the state. "All employees are instructed to report for duty (on Saturdays) accordingly," said the state government's Disaster Management Department. Kerala recorded 15,876 new COVID-19 cases in the last 24 hours.

Rapper Nicki Minaj claimed on Twitter that her Trinidad cousin's friend "became impotent" and his testicles were "swollen" after taking the COVID-19 vaccine. "His friend was weeks away from getting married, now the girl called off the wedding," she added. In a separate tweet, she also said that she wasn't attending the Met Gala event due to vaccination requirement.

Gautam Buddha Nagar administration said that nearly all in the district have got their first COVID-19 vaccine dose. GB Nagar has an adult population of 15,89,815, while 16,18,215 got their first dose till 8 pm on Sunday, as per the CoWin dashboard. Around 60,000 people in some areas are yet to get a single vaccine jab, GB Nagar DM said.

Lockdown in Australia's capital city of Canberra has been extended until October 15 to combat the COVID-19 surge, Territorial Chief Minister Andrew Barr said. Canberra was placed under lockdown on August 12 after a single COVID-19 case linked to a Sydney outbreak of the virus' Delta variant was detected. Australia's largest city Sydney has been under lockdown since June 26.

The Gurugram administration has set up vaccination camps across three market areas, near Hanuman Mandir in Sadar Bazaar, Galleria market and Fawara Chowk bus stand, to increase coverage. These camps will be functional for four hours between 4 pm and 8 pm. The department is aiming to administer 1.45 lakh doses across 250 sites during the drive till September 17.

Pakistan's Planning and Development Minister Asad Umar has warned that people who're not vaccinated against COVID-19 will not be allowed to work from offices from October. Unvaccinated people will also no longer be allowed to enter malls, use public transport or travel by air after the September 30 deadline, he added. Only 10.14% of Pakistan's population has been fully vaccinated.

Health Minister Mansukh Mandaviya took to Twitter to share a COVID-19 safety points table and asked citizens, "What is your COVID-19 safety score?" "This is the time to observe all COVID-19 protocols," he tweeted. According to the table, 25 points are for getting vaccinated, 20 are for wearing a mask, 20 for maintaining social distancing and 20 for sanitising hands.

Harvinder Singh, who won India's first-ever archery medal at Paralympics, said he trained on farmlands during COVID-19 lockdown to achieve this feat. Harvinder won a bronze medal at the recently concluded Tokyo Paralympics. "On the farmlands near my house, the crop was harvested, so I levelled the field, set a target and worked hard," he added.

Thirty-two districts have reported zero active cases of COVID-19 in Uttar Pradesh, informed an official statement by the Chief Minister's Office on Tuesday. While in the last 24 hours, only 16 districts have reported 33 new COVID-19 cases, it added. Till September 13, over seven crore people in the state have received the first dose of COVID-19 vaccination.

Aditya Chopra's Yash Raj Films (YRF) recently conducted the second phase of the COVID-19 vaccination drive for the workers of the Hindi film industry in Mumbai. The first phase was held in June when more than 4,000 people were vaccinated against the virus. "We want...industry to bounce back...and...workers to have financial stability," Akshaye Widhani, Senior Vice President of YRF, said.

The Centre on Tuesday informed that the Drugs Controller General of India (DCGI) has given permission to the Christian Medical College (CMC) Vellore to start a trial on the mixing of COVID-19 vaccines. "A couple of such studies have been initiated," said Dr Renu Swarup, Secretary, Department of Biotechnology. "We need more scientific data to get more clarity," she added.

Maharashtra Higher and Technical Education Minister Uday Samant has said that the academic year in the state colleges will begin from November 1. However, it is not yet decided if physical classes will begin from that day. "We have to consider the fact that not all eligible beneficiaries have been administered the first dose of the COVID-19 vaccine," Samant said.

BCCI President Sourav Ganguly has said that Team India players refused to play the fifth Test but they cannot be blamed. "The players were devastated when they came to know that assistant physiotherapist Yogesh Parmar tested positive for COVID-19," he further said. Ganguly added, "They feared they must have contracted the disease and were dead scared."

RCB captain Virat Kohli said it's unfortunate to "end up in UAE early" for second leg of IPL after a COVID-19 outbreak in the team's support staff led to cancellation of fifth Test against England. He added he hoped for a "secure" bio-bubble in the league with things being "uncertain" due to COVID-19. RCB will face KKR on September 20.

India has reported 27,254 new COVID-19 cases and 219 deaths in the last 24 hours. Kerala accounted for over 74% of the new cases in India as the state reported 20,240 cases and 67 deaths on Sunday. With this, India's total COVID-19 cases reached 3,32,64,175, while the death toll surged to 4,42,874. The country's active caseload currently stands at 3,74,269.

The paediatric ward of West Bengal's Jalpaiguri district hospital has admitted around 130 children, aged between one and four years, over the past few days with seasonal influenza-like symptoms including fever and cough, an official said. State Director of Health Services said while Rapid Antigen Tests were conducted on almost 80-90% of patients, only one of them tested COVID-19 positive.

Former England player Michael Atherton has said that the fifth England-India Test in Manchester was cancelled due to the coronavirus pandemic, player power and the Indian Premier League 2021, which begins on September 19. "Once the players had spoken, there was little the administrators could do about it. Players have never been more powerful than now," he stated.

The Ministry of Civil Aviation said it has granted conditional exemption from Drone Rules, 2021 to the Indian Council of Medical Research (ICMR) to use drones to deliver vaccines in Andaman and Nicobar Islands, Manipur and Nagaland. The ICMR has been permitted to use drones up to a height of 3,000-metre to deliver vaccines, the ministry wrote in a statement.

The India-made Covaxin COVID-19 vaccine will likely get WHO Emergency Use Listing (EUL) within the week, the chief of the Centre's COVID-19 working group has said. "Hopefully, the vaccine would be given international recognition so that people travelling abroad have less difficulty," said Dr NK Arora. Covaxin, manufactured by Bharat Biotech, is India's first indigenous COVID-19 vaccine.

Delhi on Monday reported 17 new COVID-19 cases, the lowest since March 28 last year. In the last 24 hours, zero deaths due to COVID-19 were reported in the national capital, while the positivity rate stood at 0.04%. Delhi has recorded only one fatality in September so far. With the new cases, the overall COVID-19 tally climbed to 14,38,250.

IRDAI has extended the timeline for insurers to offer COVID-19-related health policies till March 31, 2022. There are two short-term COVID-19-specific health policies. 'Corona Kavach' is an indemnity-based policy where sum insured ranges from ?50,000 to ?2.5 lakh, while 'Corona Rakshak' offers sum insured of ?50,000 to ?5 lakh for hospitalisation of at least 72 hours post-diagnosing COVID-19.

India's COVID-19 vaccination coverage crossed 75 crore on Monday, the Health Ministry said. Congratulating India for the "unprecedented pace" of vaccinations, WHO South-East Asia regional director Dr Poonam Khetrapal Singh said, "While it took 85 days to administer first 100 million (10 crore) doses, India reached 750 million (75 crore) doses from 650 million (65 crore) in just 13 days."

Zee Entertainment Enterprises has said that Ashok Kurien and Manish Chokhani have resigned from the position of Non-Executive Non-Independent Directors of the firm with imediate effect. While Chokhani had cited changed circumstances and perspective post COVID-19, Kurien had reasoned his pre-occupation for the resignation, it said. Kurien's membership of CSR comittee was also ceased, it added.

Veteran singer Lata Mangeshkar in an interview said that this year, the festival of Ganesh Chaturthi is not what it used to be. Mangeshkar added that the world has changed amid the COVID-19 pandemic and the sooner we accept it, the better. "It's time we stop thinking only about ourselves. Whether it is love or wealth, give generously," she said.

Malaysia's PM Ismail Sabri Yaakob on Monday signed an unprecedented cooperation pact with the main opposition bloc in Parliament aimed at maintaining political stability. The pact will give Ismail the backing of 88 lawmakers in the opposition bloc in addition to 114 that support him in the 222-member house. It covers six areas, including strengthening a COVID-19 plan, Ismail said.

New Zealand PM Jacinda Ardern on Monday said that the country's largest city Auckland will remain under a lockdown until September 21 to curb the spread of COVID-19. Speaking about the emergence of cases that aren't linked to any clusters in the city, Ardern said, "The fact we're finding them through surveillance...rather than contact tracing, is what we're concerned about."

Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman on Monday said that the trust between government and industry is critical for leveraging the opportunities thrown up by the COVID-19 pandemic. This trust is also reflected in the government's actions, she added. She also said that the Development Finance Institution (DFI), which was announced in the Budget, would be operational soon.

The Organization of the Petroleum Exporting Countries (OPEC) said it expects global oil demand to exceed pre-pandemic level next year. "As vaccination rates rise...pandemic is expected to be better managed and economic activities and mobility will firmly return to pre-COVID-19 levels," it added. OPEC expects global oil demand to grow by 4.2 million barrels per day on average next year.

A protest against Turkish coronavirus-related restrictions in Istanbul was attended by over 2,000 people on Saturday. The government had made proof of vaccination or a negative COVID-19 test result mandatory for intercity travel and to attend large events. "This pandemic is just going on with even more restrictions on our freedoms and there's no end to it," a protester said.

Foreign Minister S Jaishankar urged Australia to ease coronavirus travel restrictions for students who have been unable to get into the country since the pandemic started. Jaishankar said he raised the issue "in some detail" with his Australian counterpart Marise Payne. "We've heard a lot from the students and I think their frustrations, their feelings, are completely understandable," he added.

Wipro's Chairman Rishad Premji took to Twitter to share a video of safety measures as the company's leaders are returning to the office after 18 months, starting Monday. The video showed COVID-19-related safety protocols at the company's office, including temperature checks and QR code scans.  The fully vaccinated staff will be going to the office twice a week.

A pandal in Hyderabad has installed an eco-friendly Ganesh idol on a model of coronavirus vaccine vials to encourage people to get vaccinated. "[The] Ganesh deity is standing on three vaccines with two rats...The idol promotes registration on the Co-WIN portal," the organiser Sachin Chandan said. "I am very excited to see this pandal," a devotee said.

Delhi Capitals have shared pictures of their Indian players who arrived in UAE on Sunday from the UK following the cancellation of the fifth England-India Test. "The players, Rishabh Pant, Ravichandran Ashwin, Prithvi Shaw, Ajinkya Rahane, Axar Patel, Ishant Sharma and Umesh Yadav underwent COVID-19 tests upon arrival in Dubai," DC tweeted. All players will serve a six-day hard quarantine.

Union Health Minister Mansukh Mandaviya congratulated six states and Union Territories for successfully administering the first dose of COVID-19 vaccine to 100% of the adult population. These are Dadra and Nagar Haveli and Daman and Diu, Goa, Himachal Pradesh, Ladakh, Lakshadweep and Sikkim. Himachal Pradesh was the first state to vaccinate 100% of its eligible population with the first dose.

Former Pakistan captain Inzamam-ul-Haq has said that it's "wrong" to say that India pulled out of the fifth Test against England despite having their players testing negative for COVID-19 as it's difficult to play without a coach and supporting staff. "India [played] the fourth Test as well without their coach and support staff...It was a great series," Inzamam stated.

Delhi on Sunday reported 22 new COVID-19 cases and zero deaths. As per the health bulletin, 44 recoveries were reported in the last 24 hours, taking the total recoveries to 14,12,760. With 390 active COVID-19 cases and a positivity rate of 0.04%, the cumulative cases in Delhi stand at 14,38,233. In the last 24 hours, 1,30,180 beneficiaries were vaccinated.

The Technical Advisory Comittee on COVID-19 has asked the Karnataka government to strictly enforce guidelines, saying that the third wave could hit the state in October-November. "It'll be a total mess if guidelines are not followed at this stage," the comittee said. It added that if the government lowers its guard, festivals and political gatherings can bring the third wave.

India head coach Ravi Shastri reacted to people linking his London book launch event to the COVID-19 outbreak in the team, which led to the cancellation of the fifth Test in Manchester. Shastri, who didn't travel to Manchester from London after being tested COVID-19 positive, said, "The whole country [United Kingdom] is open. Anything could have happened from Test One."

PM Narendra Modi has said that the COVID-19 pandemic affected the country, but the recovery has been faster than the damage. "When global supply chains were being disrupted, we were launching PLI (production-linked incentive) schemes to turn the tide in India's favour," he added. "We should look upon ourselves as a global economic leader in the 21st century," he said.

Kerala reported 20,240 fresh COVID-19 cases in the last 24 hours, taking the total number of cases to 43,75,431, according to official data issued on Sunday. The state also reported 67 more deaths. The COVID-19 Test Positivity Rate (TPR) in the state was recorded at 17.51%. Ernakulam recorded the highest number of cases at 2,572, followed by Thrissur (2,451).

American band Backstreet Boys on Saturday announced that they are postponing the release of their Christmas album and cancelling their Las Vegas holiday shows due to the COVID-19 restrictions on travel. "[T]his creation deserves the best possible scenario and set up for success," the band wrote in their Instagram announcement. The Christmas album will now be released in 2022.

England pacer James Anderson said he hopes the fifth Test against India at Manchester will be played at some point. "I hope I will get to play another international game at my home ground that I love so much," he added. The final Test of the five-match series was cancelled due to COVID-19 outbreak concerns in the Indian team.

Around 12 police officials deployed in Nagpur city tested COVID-19 positive after returning from Pune where they'd gone to attend a training between August 30 and September 9. According to a report, 33 policemen had gone to attend training at Maharashtra Intelligence Academy as a part of their refresher course module. There are currently 51,285 active COVID-19 cases in Maharashtra.

US Senator Elizabeth Warren, in a letter to Amazon CEO Andy Jassy, said, "Top results [on Amazon] consistently included highly-ranked and favourably-tagged books based on falsehoods about COVID-19 vaccines and cures." "This pattern and practice of misbehaviour suggests that Amazon is either unwilling or unable to modify its business practices," she wrote, adding that the practice was "unethical".

Delhi's Special Police Unit for Women and Children (SPUWAC) has written to various NGOs and other educational institutions for conducting self-defence programes for women and girls, owing to a decline in COVID-19 cases in the city. SPUWAC's self-defence programes were briefly discontinued during the pandemic and later shifted to online mode. These programes are conducted free of cost.

England have claimed that Indian players were spotted in a departmental store in Manchester on Thursday despite their assistant physiotherapist Yogesh Parmar having tested positive for coronavirus, as per reports. They also claimed that an Indian cricketer attended a photoshoot on Thursday, reports added. At least one Team India backroom staff member was also reportedly seen in the city.

Ex-England pacer Steve Harmison said that cancellation of final England-India Test could be "the beginning of the end for Test cricket". He added that upcoming second leg of IPL in UAE played a part in the cancellation. The fifth Test was called off just hours before it was scheduled to begin due to COVID-19 outbreak concerns in the Indian team.

Ex-England all-rounder David Lloyd revealed when the announcement came from England and Wales Cricket Board (ECB) that fifth England-India Test was on, he had a feeling there would be a twist. Lloyd said that doubts were already there over Manchester Test after India's coaching staff tested COVID-19 positive. Lloyd stated India not showing up for practice gave him more clarity.

Journalist Rana Ayyub has issued a statement over an FIR filed in UP against her for allegedly misappropriating funds she raised for COVID-19 relief. Calling the FIR "malicious, baseless", Ayyub said, "I've been defamed, trolled and abused online on the basis of this allegation." She said "not a single paisa" was misused and she paid "heavy" taxes on the donations.

India's COVID-19 recovery rate stands at 97.49%, the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare said on Saturday as the country recorded 33,376 new cases. According to the latest data, 3,23,74,497 people have recovered so far. India's active cases stand at 3,91,516 and the death toll has surged to 4,42,317.

Reacting to the resignation of Gujarat CM Vijay Rupani, Gujarat Pradesh Congress Comittee President Amit Chavda said that BJP is "hiding its failures" and making Rupani a "scapegoat". He added, "We knew that the state government in Gujarat was remote-controlled from Delhi...The government had failed in COVID-19 management...lakhs of youth are unemployed...and farmers are comitting suicide."

White House on Friday said that US President Joe Biden will receive a COVID-19 booster shot once it's widely available. The US had allowed certain imunocompromised individuals to receive the third dose of COVID-19 vaccines in August with a wider use planned from September 20. Notably, this comes after the WHO called for a moratorium on booster doses until year-end.

Filmaker-choreographer Farah Khan, who recently contracted coronavirus, has now tested negative. Taking to Instagram Stories on Saturday, she shared a clip of her pet and wrote, "Look who's most excited to know I've tested negative." Farah had shared the news of her diagnosis earlier this month and said that she tested positive despite being fully vaccinated.

Delhi BJP spokesperson Tajinder Pal Singh Bagga tweeted a video of him rowing a raft on a waterlogged road in the national capital, following heavy rain on Saturday. ?I wanted to go rafting to Rishikesh this season but couldn?t due to COVID-19. But because of CM Arvind Kejriwal, I'm getting that experience in Delhi itself,? said Bagga in the video.

BJP corporator Asha Shedge and her 11 supporters were arrested for creating a ruckus inside the Pimpri Chinchwad Municipal Corporation (PCMC) headquarters on Thursday. Shedge's supporters allegedly threw ink on the nameplate of PCMC Comissioner Rajesh Patil. They also allegedly wrote 'Dhikkar' (condemn) on the table of officer Ashok Bhalekar. Shedge's supporters also violated COVID-19 norms.

American health agency Centers for Disease Control (CDC) on Friday said unvaccinated individuals are 11 times more likely to die due to COVID-19 as compared to vaccinated people, as per a new study. Unvaccinated individuals are over 10 times more likely to be hospitalised and 4.5 times more likely to be infected, the study which tracked 6,00,000 American people, said.

Central Bank of Sri Lanka Governor Weligamage Don Lakshman will step down on September 14 amid an economic crisis in the country. Sri Lanka has witnessed a sharp rise in prices of essential comodities as it faces dwindling reserves and revenues, looming debt repayments and an extended COVID-19 lockdown. The country's forex reserves stood at $2.8 billion in July.

The England and Wales Cricket Board (ECB) have written to ICC to start the adjudication process to decide the status of the fifth and final Test between England and India. The Test was cancelled hours before the scheduled start of play in Manchester on Friday amid COVID-19 fears. India were leading the five-match series 2-1.

Twelve people have been arrested over an alleged RT-PCR certificate racket providing fake documents for entry into Shree Jagannatha Temple in Odisha's Puri. Police conducted an inquiry after receiving information that a few devotees are trying to enter by showing fake RT-PCR certificates. Devotees visiting the temple need to produce a final COVID-19 vaccination certificate or negative RT-PCR test.

The release date of Ram Charan and Jr NTR-starrer 'RRR' has been postponed from October 13. While making the announcement, the makers shared that they "cannot announce a new date" as theatres are closed across the globe due to COVID-19 pandemic. "We'll release at...earliest possible date when...cinema markets are up and running," a tweet from the film's Twitter handle read.

The BCCI have informed all franchises that every player coming to UAE from the UK will have to undergo six days of hard quarantine before they can join the existing team bubbles for the resumption of IPL 2021. The IPL season, which was postponed in May in the wake of the COVID-19 pandemic, will resume on September 19 in Dubai.

Ex-England skipper Nasser Hussain has called IPL as "the elephant in the room'' and blamed "packed schedule" for the cancellation of the fifth England-India Test in Manchester. "Because of the finances involved, the IPL is non-negotiable to them [India]. It simply has to take place," he added. Fifth Test was cancelled due to COVID-19 cases among India's support staff.

Bengaluru reported 207 fresh cases of COVID-19 on Saturday, taking the total number of cases in the city to 12,41,170. The death toll due to COVID-19 in Bengaluru rose to 16,047 as two more people succumbed to the disease. As many as 285 people were discharged, while the number of active COVID-19 cases stood at 7,229.

JNU V-C Prof M Jagadesh Kumar on Saturday said the investigation into last year's violence which left nearly 35 injured was delayed due to the COVID-19 pandemic. He said students couldn't be called from their hometowns. When asked why the comittee didn't conduct online depositions, he replied that students are stressed. "We don't consider our students as criminals," he added.

The Presidency University Students' Council (PUSC) withdrew its 96-hour sit-in after the authorities agreed to the free vaccination of all students. PUSC office-bearer Adrija Adak said that the authorities issued a notice promising to start free vaccination at the earliest in collaboration with the state government. "We will co-operate and help the authority in every step," Adak added.

A senior Team India player is reluctant to play the fifth Test against England in Manchester due to COVID-19 fears, reports said. The BCCI is reportedly trying to persuade the cricketer to feature in the final Test despite his family also against him playing the Test. The entire Indian team had tested negative for coronavirus on Thursday.

Ex-England skipper Nasser Hussain has said the upcoming second leg of IPL 2021 played a major role in getting the fifth England-India Test cancelled. Hussain said that BCCI were concerned about "huge" financial losses they would incur if the IPL had to be postponed further in the case of players contracting COVID-19 during the Manchester Test at Old Trafford.

Sri Lanka on Friday extended its nationwide lockdown till September 21 to prevent COVID-19 spread. Health Minister Keheliya Rambukwella said the lockdown would be lifted at 4:00 am on September 21. "With numbers steadily declining, we're confident that we'll once again be able to reopen without risk," Rambukwella added. The country has reported over 4.7 lakh COVID-19 cases so far.

A huge crowd was seen at Mumbai's Dadar market on Thursday ahead of the 10-day-long Ganesh festival amid COVID-19, pictures of which surfaced on social media. Notably, the Mumbai Police has imposed Section 144 from September 10-19. As per the orders, not more than five people can gather at one place. On Thursday, Mumbai reported 458 new COVID-19 cases.

The first-ever four feet idol of Mumbai's Lalbaugcha Raja, as opposed to the traditional nearly 15 feet tall idol, was unveiled on Friday. The idol was seen in the Vishnu avatar. Due to COVID-19 restrictions, devotees won't be allowed to visit the mandal. However, the online live darshan started today and will continue till 7:00 am on September 19.

The Ganesha idol at the Sri Satya Ganapathi Temple in JP Nagar, Bengaluru, has been decorated with raw bananas, corn, leaves and nine different kinds of flowers. "After three days of celebration, everything will be distributed among devotees, so that nothing goes to waste," the temple's trustee said. A COVID-19 vaccination camp has also been organised at the temple.

Rich nations should send vaccines to Africa to help fight COVID-19 rather than administering its populations with a third shot, John Nkengasong, head of Africa Centres for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC), said. "The problem we've with...third doses is, we've not seen enough science behind them...It's really confusing to me as to why we're moving forward...[with]...booster dose," he added.

Responding to a petitioner who said that red ant chutney should be used as COVID-19 cure, the Supreme Court said, "How can we ask the entire country to use a chutney as cure for COVID-19?" "If you want to use it, use it. Nobody is stopping you," the Supreme Court further said, asking the petitioner to get vaccinated.

As many as 6,600 people living in Delhi were "forcefully evicted" between March 2020 and July 2021 amid COVID-19, as per a report by Housing and Land Rights Network. Around 1,375 families were evicted in demolition actions carried out by the Delhi Development Authority and the municipal corporations to remove encroachments, the report added. Across India, 2,57,000 people were evicted.

Pune Municipal Corporation on Thursday passed an order prohibiting physical 'darshan' at the Ganesh Chaturthi mandaps amid the COVID-19 pandemic. Pune's five 'Manache Ganapati' mandals also appealed to the devotees to opt for online darshan this year. "There is a risk of a third COVID-19 wave...we shouldn't create any opportunity to let it happen," Pune's Guardian Minister Ajit Pawar said.

UP Police on Thursday booked AIMIM chief Asaduddin Owaisi for "comunal" remarks, allegedly "vitiating comunal harmony", violating COVID-19 norms and making "indecent" remarks against PM Narendra Modi and CM Yogi Adityanath. "In his speech, Owaisi...said 100-year-old Ram Sanehi Ghat mosque was razed by the administration and its debris was also removed. This is contrary to the fact," police said.

India recorded 34,973 new COVID-19 cases and 260 deaths in the last 24 hours, Ministry of Health and Family Welfare said. COVID-19 recovery rate stands at 97.49%, it added. It further said that active cases (3,90,646) in the country constitute 1.18% of total cases. India's total cases reached 3,31,74,954 and the death toll surged to 4,42,009.

BCCI issued an official statement after cancellation of fifth Test against England, confirming they haven't forfeited it. BCCI said they held "several rounds of discussion" with ECB to find a way to play the Test, however, COVID-19 outbreak in Indian contingent forced the cancellation. "Both the boards will work towards finding a window to reschedule this Test," the BCCI added.

The United Arab Emirates (UAE) on Friday said that it is lifting entry ban for fully vaccinated residents from India, Pakistan and 13 other countries, from September 12. The residents must be vaccinated with COVID-19 vaccines approved by the WHO. Residents from Bangladesh, Nepal, Sri Lanka, Vietnam, Namibia, Zambia, Nigeria and Afghanistan are also among those allowed entry in UAE.

Punjab government on Friday ordered an extension of the existing COVID-19 restrictions till September 30, in view of the upcoming festival season. All gatherings have been limited to a maximum of 300 people. Punjab government employees failing to take even the first COVID-19 vaccine dose (for any reason other than medical) will be sent on compulsory leave after September 15.

Ex-England captain Kevin Pietersen said that England cannot "go pointing fingers" at India after the fifth Test was called off due to COVID-19 fears. Referring to England pulling out of an ODI series against South Africa last year due to COVID-19 positive tests, Pietersen tweeted, "England left...tour of SA for COVID-19 scares & cost CSA plenty...so don't go pointing fingers!"

Toyota, the world's biggest carmaker, has cut its annual production target by 300,000 vehicles. "It's a combination of the coronavirus and semiconductors, but at the moment it is the coronavirus that is having the overwhelming impact," Toyota executive Kazunari Kumakura said. The company now expects to produce 9 million vehicles in the year to March 31, rather than 9.3 million.

Denmark has become one of the first European Union nations to lift all domestic COVID-19 restrictions. Over 80% of people in Denmark above the age of 12 have been fully vaccinated against COVID-19, leading the Danish government to declare that it no longer considers COVID-19 "a socially critical disease". The country has reported over 3.5 lakh COVID-19 cases so far.

There are no active cases of the COVID-19 in 33 districts of Uttar Pradesh, the state government informed on Friday. The 33 COVID free districts include Aligarh, Hathras and Kasganj. About 67 districts have not reported a single new case of COVID-19 in the last 24 hours, the government added. Overall, the state has a total of 199 active cases.

PM Narendra Modi on Friday chaired a high-level meeting on the COVID-19 situation and vaccination status in India just as the festive season kicked in with Ganesh Chaturthi. The meeting came a day after Union Health Secretary Rajesh Bhushan said the second COVID-19 wave isn't over yet. Nearly 35 districts are reporting over 10% weekly positivity rate, Bhushan had said.

Microsoft CEO Satya Nadella has said that firms that are forcing their employees to report to office amid rising COVID-19 Delta variant cases are "short-sighted". He added there's no one-size-fits-all approach to hybrid work as employee expectations keep changing. "The only way for organisations to solve for this complexity is to embrace flexibility across their entire operating model," he stated.

Government shared a graph, stating that five Indian states are administering COVID-19 vaccines at a faster pace than foreign countries. It stated UP's single-day average in September is 11.73 lakh doses compared to US' 8.07 lakh. It added Gujarat's pace is faster than Mexico, Karnataka is faster than Russia, MP is faster than France and Haryana is faster than Canada.

Kerala reported 26,200 fresh coronavirus cases and 125 deaths on Thursday, pushing the total tally of infections to 43,09,694 and the fatalities till now to 22,126. According to Kerala Health Minister Veena George, the state's test positivity rate stands at 16.69%. Among the 14 districts, Thrissur recorded the highest number of COVID-19 cases with 3,279.

The Union Health Ministry on Thursday asked people to have low-key celebrations of festivals to avoid the spread of COVID-19. During a press briefing, Union Health Secretary Rajesh Bhushan said, "We're still witnessing the second surge, it's not over." Indian Council of Medical Research (ICMR) Director-General Balram Bhargava urged people to practise responsible travel rather than revenge travel.

An understaffed restaurant in Texas, US, has been renting robots for $15/day to greet customers, take food to tables, and will even sing "Happy Birthday". Servers accompany the robots and act as their handler through the whole experience. The restaurant said it turned to robots after it found it difficult to fill certain positions post COVID-19.

Journalist Rana Ayyub has been booked by police in UP's Ghaziabad for allegedly raising donations for COVID-19 patients and flood victims in some states and misappropriating them. Senior police officer Gyanendra Singh said the police will take legal action against the journalist only after investigating the case and finding evidence against her.

Union Health Secretary Rajesh Bhushan on Thursday said 68% of the total COVID-19 cases in India last week were from Kerala. "Out of the 43,263 COVID-19 cases reported in the last 24 hours, over 32,000 cases are from Kerala," Bhushan added. "The overall declining trend is little less than 50% which was there in the first wave," he further said.

After Team India physiotherapist Yogesh Parmar tested positive for coronavirus in Manchester, BCCI President Sourav Ganguly said, "We don't know if the fifth Test will happen at this moment." Team India's training session was cancelled and the team was asked to stay back at the hotel until further notice. The fifth England-India Test is scheduled to begin tomorrow in Manchester.

Another member of Team India's support staff has tested positive for coronavirus leading to the team's training session being cancelled as a result, ESPNcricinfo reported. The development could impact the fifth England-India Test that begins tomorrow in Manchester. Earlier, head coach Ravi Shastri, bowling coach Bharat Arun and fielding coach R Sridhar had tested COVID-19 positive.

According to the Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC), only 0.3% of the fully vaccinated population got infected with COVID-19 in Mumbai. Out of the 28.88 lakh fully vaccinated citizens in Mumbai, 9,018 got a breakthrough infection. Breakthrough infection is referred to as the phenomenon of the coronavirus "breaking through a protective barrier provided by the vaccine".

Amid COVID-19 pandemic, Mumbai Police have imposed Section 144 in the city from September 10-19, stating that more than five people are not allowed to gather at a place. The order by the police department also stated that Ganpati processions during this period will not be allowed in the city, adding that devotees can take darshan online.

Union Health Secretary Rajesh Bhushan on Thursday said that 86 lakh doses had been administered in the last 24 hours. Bhushan added that the average per-day dose administered has increased from 20 lakh in May to 78 lakh in September. The overall first doses administered in the country stand at 54,68,97,006, while the second doses administered so far are 16,97,00,422.

Centre on Thursday released the names of five states that have the highest number of active COVID-19 cases in India, with Kerala accounting for 60.98% of them with 2,40,037 cases. It's followed by Maharashtra with 51,419 active cases, which accounts for 13.06% of total active cases. Karnataka, Tamil Nadu and Andhra Pradesh are also among states with highest active cases.

YCM Hospital and nine other hospitals run by Pimpri Chinchwad Municipal Corporation (PCMC) have appointed three contractors for two years to hire employees. Medical Officer (MBBS, BAMS), dentist, pharmacist, lab technicians, dialysis technicians, physiotherapists, X-ray technicians, among others will be recruited via contractors. Due to the COVID-19 pandemic, they will be hired for three months.

North Korea has been banned from competing at the 2022 Winter Olympics in Beijing by the IOC as punishment for refusing to send a team to the Tokyo Games, citing the COVID-19 pandemic. Individual athletes from North Korea who qualify to compete in Beijing could still be accepted by a separate decision in the future, IOC President, Thomas Bach, said.

Tamil Nadu on Thursday extended political, cultural, social and religious gatherings till October 31, stating that preventive measures are being taken to prevent third wave of coronavirus in the country. "Restrictions on festivals, political, social and cultural events continue. Events like these can turn into super-spreader events," the government stated.

With 530 new cases of COVID-19 on Wednesday, Mumbai reported over 500 daily cases for the first time since July 15. The city had recorded 545 new coronavirus infections on July 15. Mumbai's COVID-19 cases tally so far stands at 7,47,608. Notably, Mumbai's Mayor Kishori Pednekar on Tuesday had said that the "third wave isn't coming, it's already here".

All players in Team India squad have tested negative for coronavirus after the team's physiotherapist had tested positive for the virus, PTI reported. The fifth Test match against England is likely to go ahead as scheduled on Friday, reports added. Earlier, reports had surfaced claiming ECB had asked BCCI to forfeit the match as they weren't willing to postpone it.

The Central Board of Direct Taxes (CBDT) on Thursday extended the deadline to file the income tax returns (ITR) for the assessment year 2021-22 till December 31, 2021. Usually due by the end of July, the deadline was extended last time in May till September 30 in view of COVID-19.

Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike (BBMP) has issued new guidelines for celebrating Ganesh Chaturthi, asking people to keep the festivities simple amid COVID-19. BBMP has capped the height of Ganesh idols to be installed at public sites at four feet and two feet for those placed in homes. BBMP said that the number of devotees at a venue shouldn't exceed 20.

The WHO has extended its call for a moratorium on COVID-19 booster vaccine doses until year-end. "I'll not stay silent when companies and countries that control the global supply of vaccines think the world's poor should be satisfied with leftovers," WHO Director-General Tedros Adhanom Ghebreyesus said. The WHO previously urged world leaders to hold off on booster doses until September-end.

During Health Ministry briefing on Thursday, ICMR chief Dr Balram Bhargava said that one dose of COVID-19 vaccine is 96.6% effective in preventing death while two doses are 97.5% effective. He cited COVID-19 vaccination data between April and August. "In our fight against the pandemic...vaccine...is the most significant shield that is protecting us from death," VK Paul said.

Delhi government has launched a new COVID-19 WhatsApp helpline number. "Just send 'Hi' to https://wa.me/911122307145 and get information about hospital beds, vaccination centres, teleconsultation with doctors...oxygen cylinder refilling," Aam Aadmi Party tweeted. "We have added some new features to aid citizens conveniently access credible information," Delhi Health Minister Satyendar Jain said.

India has reported 43,263 new COVID-19 cases and 338 deaths in the last 24 hours. Kerala accounted for nearly 70% of the new cases in India as the state reported 30,196 cases and 181 deaths on Wednesday. With this, India's total COVID-19 cases reached 3,31,39,981, while the death toll surged to 4,41,749. The country's active caseload currently stands at 3,93,614.

Japan has extended emergency COVID-19 restrictions in Tokyo and other regions until September 30 to curb infections and prevent hospitals from being overwhelmed. Residents are being urged to work from home and refrain from travel. Japanese PM Yoshihide Suga said, "Inoculation of...those who wish to be vaccinated will be completed in October or November. And from then, we will...ease restrictions."1

Delhi on Thursday reported 36 new COVID-19 cases, taking the total number of active cases to 415. According to the Delhi State Health Bulletin, the test positivity rate currently stands at 0.05% and no new COVID-19 death has been reported in the last 24 hours. The bulletin further stated that 1,45,016 beneficiaries have been vaccinated in the last 24 hours.

The England and Wales Cricket Board (ECB) have asked BCCI to forfeit the fifth Test in Manchester after Team India's physiotherapist tested positive for COVID-19, as per reports. The BCCI have reportedly told the ECB that they want the Test to go ahead if the players test negative in the RT-PCR tests. The Test is scheduled to begin tomorrow.

The fifth Test between England and India will begin in Manchester on Friday as scheduled after ECB announced there have been no further COVID-19 positive tests in the Indian camp. India's practice session at Old Trafford ahead of fifth Test was cancelled on Thursday after India's assistant physiotherapist Yogesh Parmar tested positive for COVID-19. India lead the five-match series 2-1.

ICMR Director General Balram Bhargava said the Centre has developed a COVID-19 vaccine tracker to give information on various aspects of vaccination like effectiveness post-inoculation. It has been developed by synergising data from Co-WIN portal, National COVID-19 testing database and COVID-19 India portal, Bhargava added. "It's going to be online very soon on Health Ministry's website," he said.

India's resilient V-shaped recovery is still intact despite an intense second wave of COVID-19, the Finance Ministry said in a report. "Fast-paced recovery is...evident in growth of power consumption, rail freight, highway toll collections, e-way bills, digital transactions, air passenger traffic and robust GST collections," it added. The Centre's finances improved during April to July, it said.

Tamil Nadu CM MK Stalin said that the government will live-telecast Assembly proceedings once the session comences at the Fort St George Campus. Stalin was responding to Opposition Leader Edappadi K Palaniswami in the Assembly. Due to COVID-19, the proceedings are currently taking place at Kalaivanar Arangam in Wallajah Salai as Fort St George lacked space to maintain physical distancing.

Kerala government on Wednesday decided to set up a vaccine production zone at the Life Sciences Park in Thiruvananthapuram, with a special package for anchor industries setting up units. The decision was taken at a Cabinet meeting chaired by CM Pinarayi Vijayan. The CM announced a land lease for 60 years with a subsidy of 50% in the lease premium.

The Supreme Court on Thursday dismissed a plea by nine doctors for a change of examination centres for the upcoming National Eligibility Cum Entrance Test-Post Graduate (NEET-PG) exam. The doctors had in their plea demanded a change of centres on account that some states are still witnessing a surge in COVID-19 cases. The bench said, "Today people are travelling everywhere."

The government on Thursday said "no scientific body, epidemiology and no evidence" suggests that vaccination against COVID-19 should be a condition to reopen schools for children. "However, inoculation of teachers, other school employees and parents is desirable," NITI Aayog Member (Health) VK Paul said. He added that the overall epidemiological situation has to be safe for opening schools.

The Supreme Court on Thursday dismissed a petition filed by doctors seeking directions to allow an option of changing NEET PG examination centres. The petitioner said the aspirants are young students and exposed to COVID-19 duties, therefore they should not be compelled to travel. The court said that the vaccination has increased now and the severity of cases is less.

Delhi Disaster Management Authority has said that Ganesh Chaturthi celebrations will not be allowed at public places in view of COVID-19 pandemic. The DDMA ordered district magistrates and deputy comissioners of police to ensure that Lord Ganesha idols are not set up in a tent or pandal. Further, permission for any procession would also not be granted, the DDMA added.

Of the over seven lakh people surveyed by the Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike (BBMP), 21% have received both COVID-19 vaccine doses and 62% have received at least one dose as of September 5. About 3% of the surveyed population were detected with COVID-19 previously, data showed. The BBMP has surveyed 2,48,280 households and 7,11,648 individuals in the last three weeks.

About 75% of all adults in the US have received at least one dose of a COVID-19 vaccine, the US Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) said. Around 64.3% of the adult population are fully vaccinated against the virus, the agency added. More than 14 lakh people have also received a third vaccine dose since August 13.

The Sputnik V COVID-19 vaccine is administered in two doses at a gap of 21 days and both the doses "should be taken from the same hospital", Dr Reddy's Laboratories said. This comes as the Hyderabad-based company initiated supply of the first dose component of the vaccine to partner hospitals across India. Earlier, it was facing supply constraints.

Mumbai has been conducting more rapid antigen tests, in comparison to the RT-PCR tests over the past three weeks, as per Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) data. RT-PCR tests contribute to around 35% and 45% of total COVID-19 tests conducted daily, as per BMC. Notably, Mumbai on Tuesday conducted 38,484 tests, out of which 49.3% were RT-PCR tests.

A day after Mumbai Mayor Kishori Pednekar remarked the third wave of coronavirus has arrived, she said on Wednesday that it's on our doorsteps. "I didn't say the third wave is in Mumbai. Minister Nitin Raut...said the third wave has come in Nagpur," she stated. Notably, Mumbai logged 28% of August's COVID-19 cases in the first six days of September.

After recording less than 30,000 COVID-19 cases since last Friday, Kerala on Wednesday reported 30,196 new cases, pushing the total infections in the state to 42,83,494. Kerala also reported 181 deaths, which took the toll till now to 22,001, a government release said. The Test Positivity Rate, which had dipped below 16%, rose to 17.63% in the last 24 hours.

The Union Health Ministry on Wednesday said over 5.64 crore balance and unutilised doses of COVID-19 vaccines are still available with the states and Union Territories. It added that more than 70.31 crore vaccine doses have been provided to states and UTs so far. The Ministry said that more than eight lakh vaccine doses are in the pipeline.

The Supreme Court on Wednesday said it isn't feasible to pass a general order on door-to-door coronavirus vaccination in India, considering the diverse COVID-19 situation and administrative complexities in the nation. A plea had sought door-to-door vaccination, especially for the vulnerable groups. "The vaccination programe is already underway and has progressed considerably," SC remarked.

Congress MP Manish Tewari has written to Health Minister Mansukh Mandaviya to seek explanation from Max Hospital in Delhi after it charged a COVID-19 patient ?1.8 crore for over four-month stay. Meanwhile, the hospital said the case was extremely challenging as the patient was diabetic, hypertensive and developed multiple complications such as gall bladder infection and loss of brain function.

The Greater Chennai Corporation on Wednesday said 1,600 special camps will be organised on September 12 in the city to increase COVID-19 vaccine coverage. A total of 600 doctors and 600 nurses will be deployed in this special vaccination drive. The corporation added that in each ward of Chennai, one static and two mobile camps will be functioning.

Actor Siddhanth Kapoor, who was recently seen in 'Chehre', has said people are not ready to watch films in cinemas amid the COVID-19 pandemic. "It will be a challenge to get them back to cinemas," he said, adding that it will take at least another year to get people to watch movies in cinemas in full capacity.

India has reported 37,875 new COVID-19 cases and 369 deaths in the last 24 hours. Kerala accounted for 68% of the new cases reported in the country as it saw 25,772 cases and 189 deaths on Tuesday. India's active caseload stood at 3,91,256 while death toll reached 4,41,411. India's daily positivity rate was reported to be at 2.16%.

A day after Taliban announced its interim government in Afghanistan, China's Foreign Minister Wang Yi said China would provide 200 million yuan (?228 crore) worth of grain, winter supplies, vaccines and medicine to Afghanistan. He added that China had already decided to donate an initial batch of 3 million COVID-19 vaccine doses to the Afghan people.

Mukesh Ambani-led Reliance Industries has offered a salary increment to employees, averaging about 10-12%, for 2021-22, ET reported citing company sources. The hike comes after no increment last year due to the COVID-19 pandemic. The company had announced 10% pay cuts for employees in hydrocarbons division earning over ?15 lakh per annum in April 2020 but subsequently rolled it back.

Delhi reported 41 new COVID-19 cases and zero deaths in the last 24 hours, according to a health bulletin issued by the Delhi government on Wednesday. The positivity rate stood at 0.05%, while the number of active COVID-19 cases rose to 414 on Wednesday from 386 the previous day. Delhi reported one death and 50 new COVID-19 cases on Tuesday.

A fresh petition was filed in the Bombay High Court on Tuesday challenging the Maharashtra government's order that allows only fully vaccinated people to travel by Mumbai local trains. The petitioner said this violates the fundamental rights of citizens. He also pointed out that there is no conclusive evidence to show that COVID-19 vaccines are effective.

Spain's healthcare regulator has approved the COVID-19 vaccines' third dose for people with severely compromised imune systems. It said the booster shots should be administered 28 days after the previous one in some cases and preferably the same type of vaccine shall be used. Notably, WHO had called for a moratorium on the booster shots until at least September end.

Devotees who want to visit the Sabarimala Temple in Kerala during the five-day season this month starting September 17 can book their time of visit on Wednesday, the Travancore Devaswom Board said. Only 15,000 pilgrims will be allowed every day due to COVID-19. The devotees need to have either an RT-PCR report or should be fully vaccinated against COVID-19.

Ayushmann Khurrana, who wrapped up the shoot of 'Chandigarh Kare Aashiqui', 'Anek' and 'Doctor G' amid the COVID-19 pandemic, said, "I'm fortunate to have managed to finish three films in...pandemic." Calling his upcoming films "diverse and disruptive", he said such films trigger conversations about important issues. "I hope they'll contribute towards bringing people back to...theatres," he added.

Kerala Health Minister Veena George on Wednesday said COVID-19 vaccination facilities would be made available to final year students to get imunised before entering the colleges. This comes ahead of the reopening of higher education institutes in the state from October 4. George added that the final year students should be administered at least one dose before the institutes reopen.

India has reported 31,222 new COVID-19 cases and 290 deaths in the last 24 hours. This comes a day after the country reported 38,948 cases and 219 deaths. Kerala accounted for 63% of the new cases as it reported 19,688 cases and 135 deaths on Monday. India's active caseload stood at 3,92,864 while death toll reached 4,41,042.

Delta COVID-19 variant, first identified in India, has been found to be eight times more likely to escape imunity gained through vaccines, as compared to the Alpha variant, as per a new study. The study's subjects were vaccinated with AstraZeneca or Pfizer vaccines. The study, published in 'Nature', also said Delta is 5.7 times more likely to re-infect recovered people.

Yami Gautam, who tied the knot with filmaker Aditya Dhar in June, spoke about her "simple wedding" and said, "[We're] simple people and we like to keep it like that." She added that even if there were no restrictions due to the coronavirus pandemic, they would've opted for a low-key affair. The wedding was attended by their imediate family members.

BCCI will probe Team India members attending head coach Ravi Shastri's book launch event in London, as per reports. An official said BCCI had urged members to refrain from crowded events, reports added. He further said BCCI will seek explanation from Shastri and Virat Kohli after photos were shared with them, reports stated. This comes after Shastri tested COVID-19 positive.

In a landmark achievement to India's COVID-19 vaccination, over 1.13 crore COVID-19 vaccine doses were administered in the last 24 hours. With this, the country's COVID-19 vaccination coverage surpassed the cumulative figure of 69.90 crore as per provisional reports till 7 am today. Currently, India's COVID-19 recovery rate stands at 97.48%.

Amid a rise in COVID-19 cases in Mumbai in the past few days, city's Mayor Kishori Pednekar on Tuesday said the "third wave isn't coming, it's already here". "It's already been announced in Nagpur," she added, urging people to remain inside their homes during Ganesh Chaturthi. Mumbai has logged 28% cases recorded in August in first six days of September.

Uttarakhand government on Monday extended the COVID-19 curfew by another week, till 6 am on September 14. The state has allowed shops to open from 8 am to 9 pm six days a week. Further, those who aren't fully vaccinated have to furnish COVID-19 negative RT-PCR reports for entering Uttarakhand. Only 50 people are allowed to attend funerals and weddings.

Coronavirus hospitalisations in Bengaluru rose by 51% in the week till September 4 as compared to the week prior, according to BBMP data. This breaks the trend of a drop in hospitalisations under the Karnataka government quota in Bengaluru over the last three weeks, reported The News Minute. A total of 124 hospitalisations were done in week till September 4.

Maharashtra Energy Minister Nitin Raut on Monday said the third wave of COVID-19 has reached Nagpur and restrictions will return to the city soon. He said, "Today, COVID-19 cases have been reported in double digits, it means that the third wave has reached Nagpur." He added, "Restrictions on shops and other establishments will be re-imposed after authorities decide the dates."

Sir M Visvesvaraya Railway Terminal in Bengaluru's Baiyappanahalli is likely to open after road connectivity issues are sorted out, said Railway Minister Ashwini Vaishnaw. Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike (BBMP) Chief Comissioner Gaurav Gupta presented a plan to build an elevated rotary flyover to the terminal. The launch of the terminal in March 2021 was delayed due to COVID-19.

Delhi on Tuesday reported 50 new COVID-19 cases and one death. So far, no deaths were reported in Delhi in September this year. As per the official data, 30 patients were discharged in the last 24 hours, while the positivity rate stood at 0.07%. With the new cases, Delhi's total tally of cases stands at 14,38,041 with 386 active cases.

Around 50,000 free coronavirus vaccine doses are to be administered in government vaccination centres in Pune city today. About 46,000 of those doses would be Covishield vaccine, while the remaining would be Covaxin vaccine doses. Private hospitals will continue to provide paid vaccine doses in the city. Pune has administered nearly 85 lakh vaccine doses to its residents so far.

Delhi Police has filed an FIR against Key Nightclub in Hotel Samrat in Chanakyapuri for violating COVID-19 norms. This comes after police received a call on August 30 about some minors at a party in the nightclub. "We rushed...no such party was happening. However, we found many of them were neither wearing masks nor maintaining any social distance," police said.

From September 1-6, Mumbai recorded over 28% of the total COVID-19 cases it had recorded in August, according to BMC data. The data shows that while 9,147 cases were reported in August, Mumbai has already reported 2,570 cases in the first six days of September. Next one month is very crucial, Additional Comissioner Suresh Kakani said, ahead of Ganesh Chaturthi.

Shares of Panacea Biotec on Tuesday rose by over 8% to ?318.4 on the BSE. This comes after the company supplied the first shipment of second component of the Sputnik V COVID-19 vaccine. This is the first batch of the second component produced and supplied by the company in India. The batch will be distributed through Dr Reddy's Laboratories.

Rubina Dilaik, who contracted COVID-19 a few months ago, revealed that she gained seven kilograms after recovering from the virus, which made her "really uncomfortable" and "low on confidence". "Struggled hard to get back to...50 but...Weight is all about having your health first, not...looks," she added. Rubina said she has realised that a perfect body doesn't define who she is.

India continues to "lag way behind" in COVID-19 vaccination and the negative outlook on sovereign rating signifies the rising debt-to-GDP ratio, Fitch Ratings said. Fitch had affirmed India's sovereign rating at 'BBB-' with a negative outlook in April. India's debt-to-GDP ratio stood at 72% in 2019 and Fitch expects it to rise above 90% of GDP over next five years.

The King Edward Memorial (KEM) Hospital's research centre at Vadu in Pune district has begun clinical trials of COVID-19 vaccine Covovax on children on Monday. The first dose of the Covovax vaccine, developed by US firm, Novavax Inc, will be administered to at least eight minors. Notably, Covovax is the fourth vaccine to undergo clinical trials on children in India.

Maharashtra Navnirman Sena (MNS) leader Sandeep Deshpande on Tuesday criticised the state government for "going overboard" with COVID-19 guidelines. He said that the government uses COVID-19 as an excuse for anything and everything. "I am sure one day COVID-19 will be known in the world as 'Maharashtra corona'," Deshpande said.

Apple has sent out invitations announcing that its annual launch event will take place on September 14. The invitation doesn't provide any specific details, but the company usually announces its new iPhones in September. In 2020, Apple announced iPhone 12 in October due to COVID-19 pandemic. The new iPhones are expected to come with a smaller notch and improved cameras.

The University of Delhi (DU) announced it will reopen in a phased manner from September 15. Laboratory and practical classes for final year undergraduate (UG) and postgraduate (PG) students will be allowed in offline mode with a maximum 50% capacity, DU stated. Students who wish to attend offline classes should have received at least one COVID-19 vaccine dose, it added.

At least 11 first-year students of MBBS at a private medical college in Maharashtra's Nagpur district have tested COVID-19 positive. All the 11 students had taken both their doses of COVID-19 vaccines, according to Dean Dilip Gode of Datta Meghe Medical College. It comes after Nagpur's Guardian Minister Nitin Raut on Monday said that COVID-19's third wave has reached Nagpur.

The Karnataka government on Tuesday asked the public to defer their visit to neighbouring Kerala till the end of October if there is no emergency, in order to avoid the third COVID-19 wave's onset in the state. The government also asked educational institutions to instruct their wards, who haven't returned from Kerala, to postpone their return till October end.

Kerala has decided to end the night curfew and Sunday lockdown, which were imposed to contain the spread of COVID-19 in the state, CM Pinarayi Vijayan said on Tuesday. Colleges in Kerala will also reopen for physical classes from October 4. This came on a day when Kerala recorded 25,772 COVID-19 cases and 189 deaths in the last 24 hours.

Pune reported 840 new COVID-19 cases and eight deaths on Sunday. As many as 993 people were discharged from the hospitals. There are 9,355 active COVID-19 cases in the district, according to District Health Officer (DHO) Dr Bhagwan Pawar. Out of the total active cases, 4,665 patients have been admitted to the hospitals while 4,690 patients are in home isolation.

India has reported 38,948 new COIVD-19 cases and 219 deaths in the last 24 hours. The country has reported its lowest daily casualties in the last five months. The country also saw daily cases go below 40,000-mark after five days. Kerala accounted for 68.5% of the new cases as it reported 26,701 cases and 74 deaths on Sunday.

The Delhi government has launched a 'Vaccination on Wheels' drive to administer COVID-19 vaccines to labourers in the national capital. For this, the government has converted a bus into a vaccination centre and a team from the Ram Manohar Lohia Hospital is administering vaccine doses to people. MLA Raghav Chadha also shared images of the initiative.

India batting coach Vikram Rathour has said "there was a bit of distraction" in the team when head coach Ravi Shastri tested positive for COVID-19. "We spoke, (and) decided that we need to focus on what is in hand, which is cricket," he stated. "But a lot of credit goes to the boys, the way they handled themselves," Rathour added.

Former Puducherry CM V Narayanasamy urged the Union Territory's Lieutenant Governor Tamilisai Soundararajan to reconsider allowing the installation of Ganesha idols in public places during Vinayaka Chaturthi amid COVID-19 pandemic. Tamil Nadu government has banned such installations and Puducherry should also emulate this, he added. People should celebrate the festival at home, he further said.

Air India owes around ?250 crore in travel refunds to passengers due to COVID-19-induced travel restrictions, the Economic Times reported. "Air India is opening automated refunds in India and abroad," the airline was quoted as saying by the Economic Times. "We've cleared about ?130 crore of refunds in the previous month and are planning to expedite the process," it added.

Many tourists gathered at various tourist spots in Pune's Lonavala over the weekend. The district administration has banned tourism in many places including Lonavala to avoid crowd gatherings amid COVID-19. The Pune Rural Police were unable to keep a check on the situation due to manpower shortage. Many tourists were seen roaming around without a face mask.

Hyderabad-based Hetero announced that it has received the Emergency Use Authorisation (EUA) from the Drugs Controller General of India (DCGI) to use its generic version of Tocilizumab in India for the treatment of COVID-19 in hospitalised adults. The World Health Organization (WHO) had recomended in July that the drug can be used for critically ill COVID-19 patients.

Actor Arjun Kapoor on Monday shared a post on Instagram to mark a year since he had tested COVID-19 positive. Alongside the post, he wrote, "It took a lot out of me and it took me a couple of months to feel that I'm on the right path to getting fitter again...But I'm proud...[and]...happy where I'm today."

PM Narendra Modi on Monday said Himachal Pradesh has emerged as a champion as it became the first state to vaccinate 100% of its eligible population with the first dose COVID-19 vaccine and one-third of the population with the second dose. "I have seen the state struggling for basic facilities but today we see them doing well," PM Modi said.

TCS is looking to call employees back to the offices by year-end or early 2022, The Economic Times reported. "Depending on how this third wave turns out, we'll get back 70-80% employees in the offices," TCS CEO Rajesh Gopinathan said. According to BBC, around 90% of TCS employees in India have received at least one dose of a COVID-19 vaccine.

PM Narendra Modi on Monday said India is creating a record by administering 1.25 crore COVID-19 vaccines daily, which is higher than the population of several countries. He added over 70 crore doses have been administered in the country so far. He also lauded Himachal Pradesh for administering the first dose of vaccine to all of its eligible population.

Singapore has deployed robots to patrol public areas and detect poor social behaviour such as flouting of COVID-19 safety measures, smoking in prohibited areas and the improper parking of bicycles. Two patrol robots, named Xavier, are equipped with cameras that can detect bad social behaviour. During their three-week trial, they will trigger real-time alerts to the comand and control centre.

Over 1 crore doses of the coronavirus vaccine have been administered in Bengaluru so far, Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike (BBMP) Chief Comissioner Gaurav Gupta announced on Sunday. This includes 71,88,222 first doses and 29,00,836 second doses under BBMP, according to Co-WIN data. "We believe coronavirus can be completely kept at bay when all of us are fully vaccinated," Gupta said.

Delhi on Monday reported 32 fresh COVID-19 cases and zero deaths. While 16 people recovered in the last 24 hours, the positivity rate was recorded at 0.06%, according to the official data. So far, the national capital has not recorded any death due to COVID-19 in the month of September. The overall case tally in Delhi climbed to 14,37,991.

A total of 190 stranded Pakistani citizens who've been stuck in India following border closure due to coronavirus have returned home via the Attari-Wagah border point on Sunday, an official said. They had come to India to pay their respects at Hindu and Sikh shrines. A Pakistani national praised the Indian authorities for extending all possible help he needed.

PM Narendra Modi lauded India's record one-day COVID-19 vaccination and Team India taking 2-1 lead against England in the Test series. "Great day (again) on the vaccination front and on the cricket pitch. As always, #TeamIndia wins," the PM tweeted. India on Monday again administered over 1 crore doses, a feat the country achieved thrice in the last 11 days.

Kerala HC has ordered the Centre to allow people to take second Covishield dose after four instead of 12 weeks and to make relevant changes on CoWIN portal. HC said if the government can allow persons travelling abroad to choose between 'early and better' COVID-19 protection, the privilege should be extended to those wanting early protection due to employment/ education.

The Tamil Nadu government will decide on the reopening of schools for students of Class 1 to 8 on September 9, School Education Minister Anbil Mahesh has said. "Chief Minister MK Stalin has asked us to observe the school activities and the impact of COVID-19 among students and teachers for eight days," he added.

Karnataka government has issued guidelines for five-day Ganesh Chaturthi celebrations amid COVID-19 and banned public processions for idol imersion. As per the guidelines, no cultural events will be allowed in areas where the Test Positivity Rate is over 2% and maximum 20 people can participate in celebrations. Only eco-friendly idols are allowed and no celebrations are allowed after 9 pm.

Kerala reported 26,701 new COVID-19 cases and 74 deaths in the last 24 hours. As per the office of the state health minister, the total death toll mounted to 21,496 and the active caseload stands at 2,47,791 on Sunday. As many as 28,900 patients recovered from the disease in the last 24 hours, taking cumulative recoveries to 39,37,996.

India has reported 42,766 new COVID-19 cases and 308 deaths in the last 24 hours according to the Union Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. Kerala accounted for over 69% of the total cases as it reported 29,682 cases and 142 deaths on Saturday. India's active COVID-19 cases stand at 4,10,048, while death toll reached 4,40,533.

Maharashtra on Sunday reported 4,507 new COVID-19 infections and 67 deaths, according to the state's public health department. The state also reported 5,916 COVID-19 recoveries. As per the health department, there are currently 50,095 active COVID-19 cases in Maharashtra and the death toll has reached 1,37,774. Moreover, there are 2,99,905 people in home quarantine in Maharashtra.

BMC Comissioner Iqbal Singh Chahal has said that 80% of eligible citizens of the Municipal Corporation of Greater Mumbai (MCGM) have received at least one dose of the COVID-19 vaccine. "We are number one in percentage terms amongst major cities of India," he added. A total of 1.3 lakh vaccine doses were administered in Mumbai district on Saturday, Chahal said.

Delhi government needs 1.5 crore COVID-19 vaccine doses to fully vaccinate the entire eligible population in the national capital, Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) MLA, Atishi, said. "Till now Delhi has been getting 15-20 lakh doses of vaccine every month...In the month of September, the central government has promised to give 30 lakh doses of vaccine to Delhi," Atishi said.

Kerala CM Pinarayi Vijayan has said that the state hopes to achieve herd imunity against COVID-19 soon as the vaccination is going on in full swing. Vijayan said 60.94% of people have received the first dose and 22.57% the second dose of the vaccine in the state. He added that Kerala vaccinated 1.95 crore people in June, July and August.

India head coach Ravi Shastri has tested positive for coronavirus through a lateral flow test.
