The BCCI Medical Team has isolated Shastri, bowling coach Bharat Arun, fielding coach R Sridhar and physiotherapist Nitin Patel. They have undergone RT-PCR testing and shall remain in the team hotel and not travel with Team India until confirmation from the medical team, BCCI said.

Government has listed parameters to ascertain the authenticity of COVID-19 vaccines being administered in India to curb fake doses. Guidelines sent to states said SII label on the original Covishield vaccine is dark green in colour and has been given a special honeycomb effect, visible only at an angle. WHO had earlier said it identified fake Covishield doses in circulation.

India administered more doses of COVID-19 vaccines than all G7 countries put together in August, the Centre said. As per data shared by the Centre, over 180 million doses were administered last month in India, as against 101 million across all G7 countries. The figures show that Canada, at 3 million, administered the least number of doses within the G7.

The Hyderabad Metro has changed its timings from Monday and now the first train will operate from 7 am and the last train will run at 10.15 pm. All the last trains will arrive at their final stops at 11:15 pm. Passengers have been advised to strictly follow COVID-19 safety guidelines, including social distancing and wearing of face masks.

Maharashtra CM Uddhav Thackeray on Sunday warned against calls being made to reopen places of worship and other establishments. "I request them to wait for some more time because we don't want to open them and then close again if the situation gets worse," Thackeray said. Maharashtra currently has 55,559 active COVID-19 cases.

President Ram Nath Kovind on Sunday comended the efforts of teachers for quickly learning to use digital platforms, in order to continue the education process amid COVID-19 lockdowns. While honouring 44 teachers with the National Awards, President Kovind applauded the Union Ministry of Education's 'Nishtha' programe under which efforts were being made for 'Online Capacity Building' for teachers.

Pictures have surfaced online showing a 15-year-old class 11 student reaching her school by rowing a boat amid floods in UP's Gorakhpur district. "I couldn't take online classes (amid COVID-19) as I didn't have a smartphone," said Sandhya. "When schools reopened, floods hit the area so I decided to reach school by a boat," she added.

The Haryana government on Sunday said the 'Mahamari Alert-Surakshit Haryana' coronavirus restrictions have been extended for another fortnight from September 6 (5 am onwards) to September 20 (till 5 am). Vice-chancellors of residential universities were directed to continue conducting online classes till October 15. A decision on students physically attending classes will be taken on October 15.

The UK's vaccine advisory body said it'd not recomend vaccinating children aged 12 to 15 against coronavirus, saying the benefits were "too small". However, the Joint Comittee on Vaccination and Imunisation (JCVI) recomended widening the rollout to include about 2,00,000 teenagers with health conditions. Many countries, including the US, have approved COVID-19 vaccines for the same age group.

More than 200 crore doses of coronavirus vaccines have been administered in China as of September 3, according to the National Health Comission data on Saturday. The country had administered about 75 lakh COVID-19 vaccine doses on Friday, the official data showed. China has reported over 1.07 lakh coronavirus cases so far, according to the Johns Hopkins University tracker.

The total number of COVID-19 vaccine doses administered in India crossed the 68 crore mark on Saturday, the Health Ministry said. Till 7 pm today, India had administered 62,25,922 vaccine doses taking the cumulative figure to 68,37,29,058. The government said 26,99,02,315 first doses have been administered in the 18-44 age group since May 1.

Poland will donate four lakh doses of the AstraZeneca COVID-19 vaccine to Taiwan, Polish Foreign Ministry announced on Saturday. The ministry said that its vaccine donation is a reciprocal move after Taiwan donated medical equipment to Poland during the first wave of the pandemic. "We sincerely thank the government and people of Poland for donating...vaccine doses," Taiwan's Foreign Ministry said.

Mumbai has become the first Indian district to administer over one crore doses of COVID-19 vaccine, data from the Co-WIN platform revealed. As per the portal, 1,01,64,983 doses have been administered so far, including 72,90,360 first doses and 28,74,623 second. The highest number of doses in the last month, that is 1,77,017, was administered on August 27.

Bahrain has authorised the use of a booster dose of the Sputnik V COVID-19 vaccine, the state-run agency reported. The booster shot was approved for those 18 and above at least six months after receiving their second dose of the vaccine, it said. It's the first time that the Russian vaccine has been approved for a third dose, it added.

The KEM Hospital Research Centre (KEMHRC) at Pune's Vadu will start enrolling children for the phase II and III clinical trials of COVID-19 vaccine Covovax from Monday. "Our ethics comittee has given the go-ahead recently," said Dr Ashish Bavdekar, principal investigator at the hospital. As per reports, 920 participants will be included in the trials across 10 sites.

No new lockdown induced by COVID-19 will be imposed in Maharashtra in the coming days but residents should celebrate Ganesh festival in a simple manner, Health Minister Rajesh Tope said on Friday. "The government has been issuing various guidelines and they should be followed all the time," he added. According to Health Ministry data, Maharashtra has 53,999 active COVID-19 cases.

India's active COVID-19 cases have crossed the four lakh-mark as 42,618 people tested positive in the last 24 hours. As many as 330 people died due to COVID-19 in the last 24 hours, according to Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. With this, the total cases have reached 3,29,45,907, while the death toll has surged to 4,40,225.

The Pune Zilla Parishad (ZP) has identified 91 villages, which have reported at least ten active cases of coronavirus, as COVID-19 hotspots. The ZP has also flagged 44 villages as emerging COVID-19 hotspots. "Five tehsils, namely Baramati, Indapur, Ambegaon, Shirur and Junnar have been reporting more cases in the last two weeks," Maharashtra Deputy Chief Minister Ajit Pawar said.

Fully-vaccinated travellers from India will no longer have to quarantine for 14 days when they arrive in Turkey, Turkish Embassy in New Delhi said. The travellers will have to be fully vaccinated with one of the COVID-19 shots approved by WHO or Turkey. Passengers will have to submit a negative COVID-19 test taken within 72 hours before arrival, it added.

Delhi reported zero deaths due to COVID-19 for the fourth consecutive day on Saturday. As per the latest data, Delhi recorded 55 new COVID-19 cases in the last 24 hours, taking the total case tally to 14,37,929. On Friday, Delhi reported 35 new COVID-19 cases, 39 cases on Thursday, 36 cases on Wednesday and 28 infections on Tuesday.

India has sent about 150 tonnes of oxygen to Sri Lanka to help the country combat the third wave of the COVID-19 pandemic. Last month, India had sent 100 tonnes of liquid medical oxygen to the island nation. Sri Lanka, which is experiencing a rapid increase in coronavirus cases, extended its nationwide lockdown until September 13 on Friday.

Pune's Guardian Minister Ajit Pawar on Friday said stricter curbs will return to Pune if crowds are not controlled during the Ganesh festival next week amid COVID-19. "Failure to manage crowd...on the first day of the festival will see the return of stricter norms from the second day onwards," he added. The mandals are keeping celebrations simple, he said.

The Kerala government on Saturday announced that night curfew along with lockdown on Sundays will continue amid rising COVID-19 cases in the state. On Saturday, Kerala reported 29,682 new COVID-19 cases and 142 deaths. With this, the total number of COVID-19 active cases in the state reached 2,50,065 and the positivity rate was recorded at 17.54%.

Maharashtra Housing Minister Jitendra Awhad on Friday tweeted a video of a huge crowd and rally of motorbikes welcoming him in Thane's Bhiwandi amid COVID-19. The video shows a motorcade of cars being followed by people on motorbikes and others crowding the street. Reacting to the video, a user comented, "Are COVID-19 rules only for the comon man?"

The Delhi government will celebrate Teachers' Day on Sunday as 'Abhar Diwas' and will also award 122 teachers who performed their duties diligently during COVID-19. Deputy CM Manish Sisodia also said that two teachers will receive the 'Face of DoE' awards. He added, 1,108 applications were received for the Delhi government's teachers' awards.

Cuba on Friday started vaccinating children aged two to 18 against COVID-19 using its two domestic vaccines, Soberana 02 and Abdala. Children aged 12 and older will be the first to be vaccinated followed by younger kids. The campaign is part of efforts to reopen schools for in-person instructions and to vaccinate over 90% of the population by December.

The UK will send four million Pfizer COVID-19 vaccine doses to Australia on Saturday under a deal to swap shots, Australian PM Scott Morrison said. Australia will send the same amount of Pfizer doses to the UK at a later date. This comes after Australia announced similar deals with Singapore and Poland to address a short-term Pfizer vaccine shortage.

Japan's PM Yoshihide Suga said that he will not run for re-election as party leader this month, effectively ending his tenure. The announcement comes as Suga's approval ratings dropped to an all-time low over his government's handling of the response to COVID-19 pandemic. Suga was appointed as the country's PM just a year ago following the resignation of Shinzo Abe.

Authorities in Tamil Nadu's Nilgiris district have made it compulsory for those wanting to buy liquor from state-run TASMAC outlets to be fully vaccinated against coronavirus. Customers will have to produce their vaccination certificates, authorities said. This step was part of the drive to vaccinate the residents, Collector J Innocent Divya said on Thursday.

India's services sector activity returned to growth in August, expanding at its fastest pace in 18 months since the COVID-19 pandemic began, a private survey said. The IHS Markit India Services Purchasing Managers' Index (PMI) rose to 56.7 in August, surging above the 50-mark threshold which separates growth from contraction. It had remained below 50 for three consecutive months.

The central government has said that no cases of the 'Mu' variant of COVID-19 have been detected from over 51,000 samples analysed in India. As per the WHO, the new 'Mu' or B.1.621 variant shows signs of possible resistance to vaccines. The government is keeping a close watch on this Variant of Interest, said NITI Aayog Member Dr VK Paul.

The government has said the weekly positivity rate of COVID-19 has been showing an overall declining trend, but the second COVID-19 wave is yet to come to an end. "Mass gatherings should be discouraged, but if attending them is essential, then full vaccination should be a prerequisite," Health Secretary Rajesh Bhushan said, while urging people to celebrate festivals at home.

The Delhi government is currently administering free COVID-19 vaccination to construction workers employed at the Central Vista project site. As per an official, around 1,600 workers have already been vaccinated at the site, while there are around 2,600 workers at the site. Officials also said that if the workers show vaccine hesitancy, they will be counselled for it.

The Delhi High Court on Friday directed the state government and police to ensure the number of Afghan nationals, protesting outside the UNHCR office, is reduced and they follow COVID-19 appropriate behaviour. While saying it is not against the protest, HC asked, "How can there be 500 protestors?" The court listed the matter for further hearing on September 7.

Kerala Chief Minister?s Office has confirmed that CM Pinarayi Vijayan will not impose a state-wide lockdown as it will create a huge crisis for the economy and livelihoods. The state government had earlier issued a notice stating that strict action will be taken against those violating quarantine norms. Kerala on Friday reported 29,322 new COVID-19 cases and 131 deaths.

The Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) will organise a special vaccination drive at over 300 centres on Saturday, September 4, for all those eligible for the second shot of their COVID-19 vaccine. "The first dose of the vaccine will not be administered on this day," BMC tweeted on Friday. Reportedly, only 26% of the eligible population is completely vaccinated in Mumbai.

The Centre on Friday released age-wise distribution of COVID-19 vaccine doses in the country. While people in the age group of 18-44 account for 49.4% of vaccine doses, those in the age group of 45-60 account for 30.5% of the doses. People aged above 60 account for over 20% doses. India has administered over 67 crore COVID-19 vaccine doses.

A nursing college was sealed after around 34 students tested positive for coronavirus in Bengaluru's Horamavu on Thursday. A senior official from the city's civic body told the Indian Express that this is "the biggest active cluster in the city". Most of the students who are infected with coronavirus came to Bengaluru from Kerala last month, officials said.

The Supreme Court has put a one-week interim stay on Kerala government's decision to hold class 11 exams physically from September 6 (Monday), amid the COVID-19 surge in the state. "There is an alarming situation in Kerala. It accounts for more than 70% (COVID-19) cases in the country...Children of tender age can't be exposed to risk," said the Supreme Court.

Karnataka Health and Family Welfare Minister K Sudhakar visited Christian College of Nursing in Bengaluru's Horamavu where at least 32 students tested COVID-19 positive. Taking to Twitter, Sudhakar wrote, "Instructed college management to check RT-PCR negative reports of students coming from other states and take precautionary measures as per government's guidelines."

India's COVID-19 recovery rate stands at 97.45%, the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare said on Friday as the country recorded 45,352 new cases. According to the latest data, 3,20,63,616 people have recovered so far. India's active cases stand at 3,99,778 and the death toll has surged to 4,39,895.

After the discovery of C.1.2 COVID-19 variant, the government has said that passengers travelling to India from seven more countries will have to carry a negative COVID-19 test report not older than 72 hours. As per the latest guideline by Union Health Ministry, the rule will now be applicable to South Africa, Bangladesh, Botswana, China, Mauritius, New Zealand and Zimbabwe.

As per Public ki Awaaz poll conducted on location-based social network Public, 72% respondents believe that Covid-19 vaccines are safe & effective. 8.8% respondents showed hesitancy in getting vaccinated, of which 24% said they're concerned about side effects, whereas 26% believe that more information on the vaccines can help shore up confidence. The poll garnered a total of 9,14,164 responses.

Delhi government has invited applications to set up oxygen plants to combat a possible COVID-19 third wave. It is aiming to increase its oxygen generation and storage capacity by up to 1,900MT by March 2022. Delhi government is further aiming to set up liquid oxygen generation plants with a targeted capacity of 100MT latest by December 31, 2022.

Investment banking company UBS Group AG employees who don't wish to receive a vaccine against COVID-19 can apply to work from home, CEO Ralph Hamers has said. On vaccination, UBS said that different countries have different legal frameworks around what can and can't be made mandatory. As Switzerland's largest bank, UBS has around 70,000 staff worldwide.

The European Centre for Disease Prevention and Control has urged nations to push ahead with their primary COVID-19 vaccination programes and played down the need for booster shots. The ECDC said additional shots should be considered for people "with severely weakened imune systems". "There is no urgent need for...administration of booster doses...to fully vaccinated individuals," it added.

WHO has released pictures of fake Covishield COVID-19 vaccine that was found in Myanmar. The label on the vials of the fake vaccine reads "Covisheld". "Falsified COVID-19 vaccines pose a serious risk to global public health and place an additional burden on vulnerable populations and health systems. It is important to detect and remove these falsified products," WHO said.

Union Health Secretary Rajesh Bhushan on Thursday said that 16% of the total adult population of the country has been fully vaccinated against COVID-19. He added that 54% of the total adult population of the country has received at least one COVID-19 vaccine shot. Sikkim has administered second dose to 36% of their population.

TMC leader Mukul Roy was admitted to a hospital in Kolkata on Thursday due to an increase in his sodium and potassium levels, as per reports. Roy has not been keeping well after his wife Krishna died due to post COVID-19 complications in July. He was seen walking inside the SSKM hospital in the city with his security officials.

The Centre on Thursday named states and Union Territories that have vaccinated 85-100% of its entire adult population with at least one COVID-19 vaccine dose. Sikkim, Dadra and Nagar Haveli and Himachal Pradesh have vaccinated 100% of their 18+ population with first dose. These are followed by Tripura (89%), Ladakh (88%), Daman and Diu (88%), Lakshadweep (88%) and Mizoram (85%).

North Korea has rejected about three million COVID-19 vaccine doses of China's Sinovac Biotech, saying they should be sent to severely affected countries, UNICEF said. The vaccines were offered to North Korea under COVAX scheme that aims to help poorer nations obtain vaccines. Reportedly, North Korea had rejected shipments of AstraZeneca's vaccine in July due to concerns over side effects.

Over 2.4 lakh people in Delhi were fined for not wearing masks in public between April 19 to August 31 amid COVID-19, police said. As many as 28,877 challans were issued over violations of social distancing norms and 1,463 challans were issued for holding large gatherings. Over 1,000 people are caught every day for not wearing masks, police added.

Hyderabad-based Biological E has received the Drugs Controller General of India's (DCGI) approval to conduct Phase 2/3 trials of its COVID-19 vaccine on children aged between 5-18 years, according to reports. Currently, Corbevax is undergoing Phase 2/3 trials on adults. Last month, India got its first vaccine for those aged between 12-18 years as Zydus Cadila's jab received approval.

Over 65 Kerala students have tested positive for COVID-19 in a college in Karnataka's Kolar district, the state Health Minister K Sudhakar said on Thursday. "We have directed administrations of border districts to achieve 100% vaccination coverage in villages lying within 20-kilometre area of the Kerala border," Sudhakar added. There are currently 18,438 active COVID-19 cases in the state.

The Centre on Thursday asked people to avoid mass gatherings amid COVID-19, particularly during the upcoming festivals. "Full vaccination should be a prerequisite if it's absolutely essential and critical to have a gathering of some people," ICMR Director-General Dr Balram Bhargava said. "We've to wait more for festivals to be celebrated traditionally," said NITI Aayog Member (Health) Dr VK Paul.

Abu Dhabi will drop quarantine restrictions for fully vaccinated travellers from all international destinations starting from Sunday, the government announced. The travellers, both vaccinated and unvaccinated, will have to present negative RT-PCR COVID-19 test results within 48 hours of departure, it added. "All travellers must also take a RT-PCR test on arrival into Abu Dhabi," it further said.

Kerala reported 32,097 new COVID-19 cases and 188 deaths on Thursday, which pushed the total infection count to 41,22,133 and fatalities to 21,149. The test positivity rate was found to be 18.41% after testing of 1,74,307 samples in the last 24 hours, according to a state government release. Among all the districts, Thrissur recorded the highest with 4,334 COVID-19 cases.

The release of Tom Cruise's upcoming films, 'Top Gun: Maverick' and 'Mission: Impossible 7', has been postponed due to the surge in COVID-19 cases around the world. 'Top Gun: Maverick', which was scheduled to release on November 19, will now premiere on May 27, 2022. Meanwhile, 'Mission: Impossible 7' will release on September 30, 2022, instead of May 27, 2022.

Mumbai recorded 416 new COVID-19 cases on Wednesday, the highest in over a month. With this, the total number of COVID-19 cases in the city reached 7,44,571. Four deaths were also reported on Wednesday. The last time Mumbai recorded daily infections above 400 was on July 28. Since August 20, there has been a daily spike in the COVID-19 infections.

Around 25% of healthcare workers in Delhi were infected with COVID-19 again despite being fully vaccinated, a study conducted by the Institute of Genomics and Integrative Biology, and Max Hospitals in Delhi-NCR has found. Notably, none of the 597 vaccine recipients required hospitalisation. "The severity of...infection was low...vaccination is crucial to avoid severe illnesses," the study stated.

In a bid to control the crowd, only 15,000 people can visit Mussoorie in Uttarakhand during the weekends, Dehradun DM Dr R Rajesh Kumar stated. "It is mandatory for the visitors to carry 72-hour prior RTPCR negative report," Kumar added. Recently, three cases of Delta Plus AY 2 variant of coronavirus were confirmed in Nainital.

Pune District Collector Dr Rajesh Deshmukh has warned that cases will be registered against the hospitals that are overcharging COVID-19 patients. The district administration has been auditing bills of COVID-19 patients and reducing them. The audit comittee will continue to work in the anticipated third wave as well. "There have been constant complaints against some hospitals," Dr Deshmukh said.

Bharat Biotech's MD Krishna Ella has said that Pfizer and Moderna's COVID-19 vaccines wouldn't have received approval, if they had conducted Phase-3 trials during second COVID-19 wave, which was dominated by Delta variant. "When they licensed it, there was [dominance of] Wuhan strain...They succeeded in getting 90% efficacy but now the same vaccine is showing...35% efficacy in Israel," he added.

India has reported 47,092 COVID-19 cases in the last 24 hours, the biggest single-day rise in two months. The country also saw an increase in deaths with 509 casualties. Kerala accounted for 70% of the new cases as it reported 32,803 cases on Wednesday. The total number of cases in India reached 3,28,57,937, while death toll surged to 4,39,529.

AIIMS Director Dr Randeep Guleria said it will take up to nine months to vaccinate all the children against COVID-19 and schools cannot be kept closed till then. Guleria added, educational institutes should not be opened in Kerala, which is reporting a high number of cases. "I support reopening of schools because physical interaction is important for kids," Guleria stated.

The bodyguard of actor Sidharth Shukla, who died today morning due to heart attack, revealed the Bigg Boss 13 winner spent last evening with his mother in the park. He also mentioned Sidharth stayed on the eighth floor of the building while his mother stayed on the ninth floor. They stayed on different floors due to coronavirus precautions, he stated.

Mumbai reported 323 fresh COVID-19 cases on Tuesday taking the total number of active cases in the city to 3,106, according to the Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC). One death was reported in the city on Tuesday while 272 patients recovered from COVID-19, taking the total number of recoveries to 7,22,621. The recovery rate stands at 97%, according to BMC.

A case was registered against Maharashtra BJP chief Chandrakant Patil, Pune Mayor Murlidhar Mohol and others for violating COVID-19 guidelines during a protest in the city on Monday demanding the reopening of religious places in Maharashtra. BJP city President Jagdish Mulik and some other party workers were also booked. The group had asked for permission to protest which was denied.

France has started administering COVID-19 vaccine's booster shots to people over 65 and those with underlying health conditions. Those who received Pfizer or Moderna vaccine can get the shot at least six months after they got fully vaccinated. It comes after France's health authority said that "recent studies suggest a fall in the vaccine's effectiveness, especially with the Delta variant".

Delhi has reported 36 new COVID-19 cases in the last 24 hours, taking the total number of active cases to 343, the health bulletin said. The national capital also reported 42 recoveries and zero deaths on Wednesday. While the death toll in the city has reached 25,082, the test positivity rate in the last 24 hours was 0.06%.

Pune district on Tuesday became the first district in Maharashtra to administer over two lakh COVID-19 vaccines within 24 hours. The district vaccinated 2,54,920 beneficiaries. Pankaj Ballabh, Vice President, Corporate Social Responsibility, Bajaj Group, said it was a combined effort to reach out to the maximum number of beneficiaries in a day as part of a mega vaccination drive.

The Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) on Wednesday said people arriving at Mumbai Airport from UK, Europe, Middle East, South Africa, Brazil, Bangladesh, Botswana, China, Mauritius, New Zealand and Zimbabwe will have to undergo self-paid RT-PCR test on arrival from September 3. This decision was taken in view of the new mutations of coronavirus. Fully vaccinated people will also be tested.

India's cumulative COVID-19 vaccination coverage has crossed 66-crore mark, the Health Ministry said on Wednesday. "India marches ahead with another achievement in its fight against COVID-19," the ministry tweeted. India administered more than one crore COVID-19 vaccine doses on Tuesday. "This feat has been achieved twice in last 5 days," the ministry added.

Zoom Video Comunications' shares tumbled nearly 17% on Tuesday, the most in nine months, after the company signalled a faster-than-expected drop in demand and analysts questioned its future plans as people return to offices. Zoom had gained millions of new users during the work from home surge amid COVID-19. At least six brokerages cut their price targets on Zoom.

Google has extended its global voluntary return-to-office policy through January 10, 2022 amid a surge in COVID-19 cases, CEO Sundar Pichai announced on Tuesday. Beyond January, Google will allow different countries and locations to decide when to end voluntary work-from-home conditions with a 30-day notice. "The road ahead may be a little longer and bumpier than we hoped," Pichai said.

Businessman Anand Mahindra on Wednesday said, "Our large population makes the task tough but unless I'm wrong, we are vaccinating the equivalent of 1 Australia every 3 days!" He was responding to an NYT article which said "economists are concerned about slow rate of vaccinations". India's COVID-19 vaccinations crossed 1-crore mark on Tuesday for the second time in five days.

The "Mu" or B.1.621 variant of COVID-19 which was first detected in Colombia in January has been classified by WHO as a Variant of Interest (VOI). "The Mu variant has a constellation of mutations that indicate potential properties of imune escape," WHO said. "Preliminary data showed it has the same behaviour as the Beta variant," it added.

Filmaker Farah Khan took to Instagram Stories to share that she has tested positive for coronavirus. "Despite being [fully] vaccinated and working with mostly [fully vaccinated] people...I've still managed to test positive for COVID-19," she wrote. "I've already informed everyone I came in contact with, to get tested. However, if I have forgotten someone...please test yourself," Farah added.

The Chamarajanagar district administration in Karnataka has withdrawn COVID-19 vaccination initiative that stated "no vaccination, no ration", "no vaccination, no pension". The initiative was to begin on Wednesday with an aim to fight vaccine hesitancy. However, it was criticised, with Karnataka Pradesh Congress Comittee (KPCC) President DK Shivakumar saying that the move was "unconstitutional".

The schools in Delhi reopened for classes 9 to 12, starting today, after several months. Pictures from various schools have surfaced online wherein students can be seen following COVID-19 rules strictly. A maximum of 50% students per classroom may be called depending upon capacity, the Delhi government had stated while issuing SOPs for reopening of schools and colleges.

Assam government has imposed a night curfew across all districts from 9 pm to 5 am. New COVID-19 guidelines are issued which state if test positivity of COVID-19 reaches over 10 cases in any area in the last seven days, jurisdictional DM will notify such areas as total containment zones. Shops and restaurants are allowed to operate till 8 pm.

Ireland will drop almost all COVID-19-related restrictions in October after a successful vaccine rollout, PM Michel Martin said. Reportedly, Ireland has fully vaccinated almost 90% of adults and 80% of those over 12 years. Vaccine certificates will no longer be required in bars and restaurants from October 22 and non-essential workers can return to offices from September 20, government said.

Japan reported a fresh contamination case involving Moderna's COVID-19 vaccine, the fourth such incident in less than a week. Kanagawa Prefecture said on Tuesday several black particles in one Moderna vaccine vial were found upon checking for foreign substances. Japan suspended the use of 1.63 million doses of Moderna shots last week over contamination reports in some of the supplies.

The US has administered over 37 crore doses of COVID-19 vaccines as of Tuesday and distributed over 44.1 crore doses, US Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) said. Over 20 crore people have received at least one dose, while 17.4 crore are fully vaccinated, CDC added. About 9,96,000 people have also received a third vaccine dose since August 13.

India has reported 41,965 COVID-19 cases and 460 deaths in the last 24 hours. This comes a day after the country reported 30,941 cases and 350 deaths. Kerala accounted for 72% of the new cases as it reported 30,203 cases and 115 deaths on Tuesday. The total number of cases in India reached 3,28,10,845, while death toll surged to 4,39,020.

India's manufacturing sector activities moderated in August, as business orders and production rose at softer rates due to COVID-19 and rising input costs, a private survey said. The IHS Markit India Manufacturing Purchasing Managers' Index (PMI) fell to 52.3 in August from 55.3 in July. A softer upturn in sales led companies to pause their hiring efforts, the survey added.

Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman has said the loan guarantee scheme for COVID-19 affected sectors will help in building healthcare infrastructure to help deal with a possible third wave. "There's still a need for more trained doctors, nurses...paramedics support system to ensure...COVID-19's impact is contained," she added. The scheme will take care of nearly 70% of the requirements, she said.

As Delhi schools resumed their offline classes for students of classes 9-12, Deputy CM Manish Sisodia said the AAP government is monitoring the COVID-19 situation. "If there's any risk of COVID-19 spread in any school, it'll take 30 minutes to close it," he added. "It's up to students to study online or offline as there's no restriction," Sisodia further said.

Chief Economic Adviser (CEA) KV Subramanian has said that growth during financial year 2021-22 would be higher than the pre-pandemic level. He added that the GDP data for the first quarter reaffirms the government's prediction of an iminent V-shaped recovery made last year. India's GDP grew by 20.1% in the first quarter of the current fiscal.

Union Education Minister Dharmendra Pradhan on Wednesday reviewed the reopening of schools across the country with senior officials of the ministry. He also took stock of the roadmap for vaccinating all teaching and non-teaching staff in schools by September. Schools were closed in March last year to contain the spread of COVID-19.

Intensive care cases in Australia's most populous state New South Wales will hit a peak in October amid rising COVID-19 cases, State's Premier Gladys Berejiklian said. The announcement came as the state recorded its highest single-day spike in coronavirus cases at 1,290.  The state is witnessing a surge in COVID-19 cases due to the Delta variant, first found in India.

Speaking about an important milestone in the COVID-19 vaccination campaign, European Union (EU) chief Ursula von der Leyen on Tuesday said that 70% of adults in the bloc have been fully imunised. This represents 250 million fully vaccinated people, she added. The EU is also helping in the fight against COVID-19 globally by exporting and donating vaccines, she further said.

Maharashtra CM Uddhav Thackeray said the central government has asked states to avoid gatherings during Dahi Handi as the third COVID-19 wave is expected. His response came as BJP and MNS protested the ban on Dahi Handi festivities. "People are trying to be heroes after organising a few Dahi Handis. If you want to fight, fight against COVID-19," he said.

At least 25 people were injured, six of them critically, in a stampede at a vaccination centre in West Bengal's Jalpaiguri district on Tuesday. Hundreds of local residents, who had queued outside the vaccination centre since morning, tried to rush in after the gate was opened, fearing vaccine shortage. A video of the incident showed some women with bloodied faces.

Over 1.16 crore COVID-19 vaccine doses were administered in India till 8 pm on Tuesday, marking a new record in single-day vaccinations in the country. India had last crossed the 1-crore milestone just five days ago on August 27. Meanwhile, cumulative coronavirus vaccinations in India crossed 65 crore on Tuesday.

Nurses in the Philippines have staged protests and are threatening mass resignations if government benefits are not paid by September 1 amid rising coronavirus cases in the country. The government had set aside special risk allowances for healthcare workers at the beginning of the pandemic last year. However, healthcare worker unions allege that the promised allowances haven't been paid.

Delhi has reported 28 new coronavirus cases in the last 24 hours. With this, the tally of COVID-19 cases in the national capital has reached over 14.37 lakh, according to the Delhi State Health Bulletin. While the positivity rate in the last 24 hours was 0.05%, Delhi also reported one death due to COVID-19, the bulletin further stated.

The Health Ministry revealed on Tuesday that India has administered 65 crore doses of COVID-19 vaccine since the vaccination drive started in January. Separately, Health Minister Mansukh Mandaviya said 50 crore people have received their first dose of the vaccine. "I applaud the hard work of COVID-19 warriors and diligence of citizens in helping achieve this momentous feat," he tweeted.

Malaysian PM Ismail Sabri Yaakob has quarantined himself after coming into contact with a coronavirus infected person, his office said on Monday without revealing the duration of his isolation. The Prime Minister will attend Tuesday's official National Day celebrations virtually, it added. The country has reported more than 17 lakh COVID-19 cases and over 16,000 coronavirus-related deaths so far.

Singapore will send 5,00,000 Pfizer's COVID-19 vaccine doses to Australia this week under a deal to swap shots, Australian PM Scott Morrison said. Under the deal, Australia will have to return the same amount of Pfizer vaccine doses to Singapore in December. Australia, which is witnessing a COVID-19 surge due to Delta variant, has fully vaccinated 27.57% of its population.

Pune Police has issued guidelines for celebrating Ganesh Utsav, asking people to keep the festivities simple amid COVID-19. Police said idols should be purchased online, with the height being capped at four feet for those being installed at public sites and two feet for those being placed in homes. Police said the number of devotees attending poojas shouldn't exceed five.

The Bombay High Court on Tuesday expressed concern at overcrowding in public places in Mumbai, like Marine Drive, amid COVID-19 and asked the state government to control it. Quoting an expert who claimed the third COVID-19 wave is knocking at the doors, HC added, "We need to draw from our experience." On Monday, Mumbai reported 334 new COVID-19 cases.

India has reported 30,941 COVID-19 cases and 350 deaths in the last 24 hours. This comes a day after the country reported 42,909 cases and 380 deaths. Kerala accounted for 63% of the new cases as it reported 19,622 cases and 132 deaths on Monday. The total number of cases in India reached 3,27,68,880, while death toll surged to 4,38,560.

BMC Comissioner Iqbal Singh Chahal has directed officials to deploy police personnel at the entrances of sealed buildings with over five COVID-19 positive patients in Mumbai, to ensure that nobody enters or exits from such premises. "Precautionary measures must be taken very strictly, considering the possibility of a third wave and to prevent the spread of COVID-19," he added.

Mumbai Police has registered a case against the workers of Maharashtra Navnirman Sena for allegedly breaking 'Dahi Handi' on the occasion of Janmashtami on Monday and violating COVID-19 norms. A case against the MNS workers has been registered in Worli Police Station. Earlier, the state government had banned Dahi Handi celebrations due to the COVID-19 pandemic.

Priyanka Chopra, speaking to Vogue India about resuming work amid COVID-19, said, "I spent six months at home feeling...safe with my family, and then Germany was the first time I left to go work." "I cried on the plane. I was terrified," she added. "When the pandemic started, I was sleeping in, vegetating on the couch, binge-watching," said Priyanka.

The Delhi High Court resumed its physical hearings, in a restricted manner on Tuesday after a gap of nearly five months due to COVID-19. Most of the judges conducting the physical hearing are also taking proceedings via video conferencing if a request for it is made. Physical hearings were suspended on April 9 owing to the second wave of COVID-19.

Indian shooter Singhraj Adhana, who won a bronze medal in Men's 10m Air Pistol SH1 event at ongoing Tokyo Paralympics, said had he not contracted COVID-19, he might've won gold or silver. "I contracted COVID-19 in May this year. I was...hospitalised, when I recovered, [It] felt like a second birth. I resumed training one month after recovering fully," he added.

RBI Governor Shaktikanta Das on Tuesday said the global economy is showing some signs of recovery, but it's "not yet out of the woods". "Last year, I had noted that COVID-19 has crippled global economy....It has been more than a year since," he added. He noted that sudden shock delivered by the pandemic called for swift and decisive policy responses.

Tamil Nadu BJP chief K Annamalai has questioned the state government's decision to prohibit the public celebration of Vinayaka Chaturthi amid COVID-19. He said, "Vinayaka Chaturthi is part of our lives. We are allowing TASMAC (state-owned liquor shops) to function in our states...Why ban Vinayaka Chaturthi procession alone?...Issuing a blanket ban is unacceptable."

France said that it will provide one crore additional doses of COVID-19 vaccines to African countries over the next three months. The African Union's Vaccine Acquisition Trust will be in charge of distributing the doses. Earlier, France had said that it aims to donate at least six crore doses to the poorest countries before the end of 2021.

Speaking on global vaccine inequality amid the rollout of booster shots of COVID-19 vaccines, WHO Regional Director for Europe Hans Kluge said that it's a way to keep the most vulnerable safe and "not a luxury". Notably, WHO chief Tedros Adhanom Ghebreyesus had earlier called for a two-month pause on administering booster shots as a means of reducing vaccine inequality.

Researchers from IIT Bombay have developed an app that helps users get alerts when COVID-19 vaccination slots are available. 'CoVaccinator' app can access data from the servers of the CoWIN portal. Users will be able to click on alerts, log in to the app using the same number as CoWIN and book a slot at a centre of their choice.

Himachal Pradesh has become the first state in India to administer the first dose of the COVID-19 vaccine to 100% of its adult population, claimed state Health Minister Dr Rajiv Saizal. He added, "We will administer the second dose to 100% of the population by November 30." The state reported 123 COVID-19 cases and one death on Sunday.

Tamil Nadu government on Monday announced that the COVID-19 curbs will be extended till September 15 and denied public entry to beaches on Sundays. In line with previous orders, all religious places will continue to remain shut for the public from Friday to Sunday. Classes for standards 9 to 12 and all colleges will resume as scheduled from September 1.

The European Union (EU) on Monday removed the US from a safe list of countries for non-essential travel amid the COVID-19 pandemic. Israel, Kosovo, Lebanon, Montenegro and North Macedonia have also been removed from the list compiled by the European Council. Travellers from these countries are likely to face tighter controls, such as COVID-19 tests and quarantines.

The number of COVID-19 cases in Tamil Nadu on Monday declined to 1,523 from 1,538 on Sunday, taking the total number of cases in the state to 26,13,360. After 1,739 persons were discharged, the total number of active cases in Tamil Nadu stood at 17,085. The state further reported 21 COVID-19 related deaths on Monday.

Karnataka has made seven-day institutional quarantine mandatory for anyone coming from Kerala, irrespective of COVID-19 vaccination or negative RT-PCR report. Such visitors will have to undergo COVID-19 test on last day of quarantine and may leave if they test negative. Night curfew has been relaxed in all districts except Kodagu, Hassan, Dakshina Kannada and Udupi that share borders with Kerala.

Ten lakh more doses of Moderna COVID-19 vaccine have been temporarily suspended in Japan over contamination of vials. A tiny black substance was found in a Moderna vaccine vial in Gunma, while in Okinawa, black substances were spotted in syringes and a vial, and pink material was found in a different syringe. Earlier, 16 lakh doses were suspended in Japan.

COVID-19 has devastated many lives and it's "heart wrenching" that the survival of children who lost either or both parents during the pandemic is at stake, the Supreme Court said. It, however, expressed satisfaction over schemes announced by the Centre and states for them. Authorities would leave no stone unturned to attend the imediate needs of such children, it added.

Delhi recorded 20 new coronavirus cases on Monday. With this, the tally of COVID-19 cases in the national capital has reached over 14.37 lakh, while the death toll mounted to 25,081. Moreover, one fatality and 36 recoveries have been recorded in the last 24 hours, according to the latest bulletin issued by the Delhi health department.

Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) Additional Comissioner has said that COVID-19 will be considered to be in a pandemic stage until 80% population of Mumbai is fully vaccinated. According to data from BMC, of the estimated 96.7 lakh citizens above the age of 18 years, only 24.9% are fully vaccinated. In the past week, Mumbai reported over 300 COVID-19 cases daily.

The Centre has extended the exemption of import duty on COVID-19 relief items till September 30, the Central Board of Indirect Taxes and Customs (CBIC) said on Monday. These supplies include oxygen-related equipment and COVID-19 vaccines. The decision was made in public interest, CBIC said. The relief, initially granted in April till end of July, was already extended once.

The death toll from coronavirus across the world on Monday rose to more than 45 lakh, according to Johns Hopkins University COVID-19 tracker. The total number of coronavirus cases globally rose more than 21.6 crore, the tracker data showed. The US is the worst coronavirus-hit country with nearly 3.9 crore cases and 6.37 lakh deaths.

The BJP on Monday criticised the Maharashtra government's decision to ban 'Dahi Handi' celebrations on Janmashtami due to COVID-19 and asked, "Why are all restrictions being enforced on Hindu festivals in Maharashtra." BJP MLA Ashish Shelar questioned, "Is this government taking orders from Taliban?". He claimed that the Shiv Sena was compromising on its "Hindutva".

Police have registered a case against 17 AAP leaders, including Delhi Deputy CM Manish Sisodia, for violating COVID-19 protocols during the party's Tiranga Yatra in Uttar Pradesh's Agra. The FIR also mentions 500 unidentified persons who were part of the yatra on Sunday, police said. Permission had been granted with a limit of 50 people, they added.

The World Health Organization (WHO) on Monday said that as per a reliable projection, another 2,36,000 COVID-19 related deaths are expected in Europe by December 1. "Last week, there was an 11% increase in the number of deaths in the region," said WHO's Europe Director Hans Kluge. So far Europe has recorded around 1.3 million coronavirus deaths.

A plea has been filed before the Bombay High Court against the Maharashtra government?s decision to allow only fully vaccinated people in Mumbai local trains, malls and workplaces. The petition said all people in the Mumbai Metropolitan Region should be allowed to use the trains. It added that both vaccinated and non-vaccinated people can be superspreaders of COVID-19.

Singer Arijit Singh, who will be performing live on-stage at an event in Abu Dhabi in November, said, "Since the unfortunate coronavirus outbreak, this would be my first onstage performance." He added, "I'm humbled to be a part of the concert and to be able to continue entertaining my fans...I'm...excited to perform [in UAE] after five years."

The Jamu and Kashmir administration on Sunday granted permission to higher educational institutions to resume physical classes provided all staff members and students are fully vaccinated. The administration, however, extended the closure of schools and coaching centres till further orders. According to the Health Ministry, there are 1,276 active COVID-19 cases in Jamu and Kashmir currently.

Several states and UTs have decided to reopen schools and begin physical classes from September, amid a drop in COVID-19 cases. Delhi and Tamil Nadu have allowed physical classes for standards 9-12 to begin from September 1. Schools for classes 9-12 will reopen in Rajasthan with staggered timings, while in MP and Gujarat, physical classes will resume for standards 6-8.

Pune division reported 1,908 COVID-19 cases on Sunday. Of the total cases, 406 were reported in Satara, 505 in Solapur, 579 in the Pune district. Meanwhile, Maharashtra continues to report an increasing number of cases with the state reporting 4,666 new cases on Sunday. As many as 3,510 patients were discharged while the active case tally rose to 52,844.

India has reported 42,909 COVID-19 cases and 380 deaths in the last 24 hours. This comes a day after the country reported 45,083 cases and 460 deaths. Kerala accounted for nearly 70% of the new cases in the country as it reported 29,836 cases and 75 deaths on Sunday. India's total cases reached 3,27,37,939, while death toll surged to 4,38,210.

Karnataka Health Minister K Sudhakar on Monday tweeted that Bengaluru Urban (excluding BBMP) had become the first district in the state to achieve 100% first dose vaccination against COVID-19. He further congratulated the health workers for making this possible. Recently, Sudhakar also announced that five lakh doses will be administered every day in Karnataka from now on.

Uttar Pradesh government has announced relaxation in night curfew across the state on Monday in view of Janmashtami. Additional Chief Secretary (Home) Awanish K Awasthi said that exemption has been given in the prescribed attendance limit for events organised on Janmashtami. The order stated that all COVID-19 protocols must be adhered to during the celebrations.

Doctor Naresh Trehan, Medanta's Chairman and Managing Director, questioned on Sunday if states are in a "rush" to reopen schools. "Is it that we should be patient for another few months, then a vaccine arrives and children get vaccinated...or are we in a rush to open schools," he questioned. He stressed that the children in India aren't being vaccinated yet.

Pune district reported 1,050 COVID-19 cases on Saturday while 898 people were discharged from hospitals. As many as 10 deaths were reported in the district. There are 9,089 active cases, according to the District Health Officer (DHO) Dr Bhagwan Pawar. A total of 69,475 doses of the COVID-19 vaccine were administered to the people in the district on Saturday.

Twitter has banned former New York Times journalist and author Alex Berenson over his anti-vaccine tweet. Following the ban, Berenson posted a message on Substack, saying, "Goodbye Twitter." Berenson also attached a screenshot of a tweet and said, "This was the tweet that did it. Entirely accurate. I can't wait to hear what a jury will make of this."

Singapore has fully vaccinated 80% of its around 57 lakh population against coronavirus, Health Minister Ong Ye Kung said on Sunday. "It's the result of the collective effort of...people of Singapore coming forward to take care of themselves and...people around them," he added. The milestone makes Singapore the most vaccinated country in the world, according to a Reuters tracker.

India has reported 45,083 COVID-19 cases and 460 deaths in the last 24 hours. This comes a day after the country reported 46,759 cases and 509 deaths. Kerala accounted for nearly 70% of the new cases in the country as it reported 31,265 cases and 153 deaths on Saturday. India's total cases reached 3,26,95,030, while death toll surged to 4,37,830.

The United Arab Emirates will open up tourist visa applications to everyone who has been fully vaccinated with one of the COVID-19 shots approved by the WHO. The decision applies to the citizens of all countries, including those from the countries banned previously, state-run WAM reported. The new rules go into effect from August 30.

The Delhi Police on Sunday said devotees will not be permitted to visit temples on Janmashtami as the Delhi government's guidelines prohibit religious gatherings. It advised people to celebrate the festival at their homes due to the COVID-19 pandemic. Action will be taken against those violating guidelines, said South East Delhi Deputy Comissioner of Police RP Meena.

Kerala on Sunday recorded 29,836 new COVID-19 infections, taking the tally of active cases in the state to 2,12,566. As many as 22,088 people have been cured of the infection since Saturday, taking the total recoveries to 37,73,754, a state government release said. In the last 24 hours, the positivity rate was found to be 19.67%.

The West Bengal government on Saturday extended COVID-19 restrictions in the state till September 15 with one additional relaxation. Coaching centres for competitive exams have been allowed to open at 50% capacity at one time with all COVID-19 protocols and regular sanitisation. The order will come into effect from September 1 onwards.

An unvaccinated primary school teacher in US spread COVID-19 to 26 people, including over half of the students in their classroom, Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) said. Reportedly, the teacher came to work despite having COVID-19 symptoms and removed the facemask while "reading...to the class". Eight out of 10 students in the front two rows tested COVID-19 positive.

Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal said on Saturday that his government will add 6,800 more beds in government hospitals, adding these will be ready in six months. Kejriwal pointed out the additional beds will be helpful if Delhi sees another COVID-19 wave. He added, "[COVID-19] situation...[in Delhi] is under control...We'll be reopening schools slowly...If the need to close them arises...we'll see."

World Health Organization (WHO) Chief Scientist Dr Soumya Swaminathan congratulated India after the country administered over 1 crore COVID-19 vaccine doses in a day, taking its total to 62 crore doses. "India achieves 50% coverage (at least one dose) of adult population...Vaccination, along with public health and individual preventive measures will protect everyone!" Swaminathan said in a tweet.

India has reported 46,759 new COVID-19 cases and 509 deaths in the last 24 hours. Kerala accounted for over 70% of the new cases in the country as the state reported 32,801 cases on Friday. With this, India's total COVID-19 cases reached 3,26,49,947, while the death toll surged to 4,37,370. The country's active caseload currently stands at 3,59,775.

Canada has authorised Moderna COVID-19 vaccine for use in children from the age of 12 to 17. The country had earlier approved Pfizer-BioNTech COVID-19 vaccine for the same age group. More than 76% of adolescents aged 12-17 years have received at least one COVID-19 vaccine dose and 63.57% have been fully vaccinated as of August 21, regulator Health Canada said.

German Chancellor Angela Merkel said the country will make up to 70 million COVID-19 vaccine doses available to African countries this year, more than doubling a previous pledge to donate 30 million. Merkel made the announcement after a sumit with African leaders on the G20's Compact with Africa initiative. Reportedly, Africa has vaccinated only 2% of its 1.3 billion population.

Kerala government has issued COVID-19 guidelines and said that "special intensified stringent lockdowns" will be imposed in areas where weekly infection population ratio is above seven. Such areas will be notified about restrictions on a weekly basis and Collectors will notify micro-containment zones and enforce lockdowns, said the government. A 10 pm-6 am night curfew has also been imposed.

Russia's Deputy PM Tatyana Golikova on Friday said that over 3.7 crore people in the country have been fully vaccinated against coronavirus, Interfax news agency reported. More than 4.4 crore people have received at least one COVID-19 vaccine dose, Golikova added. Russia, which has a population of over 14.4 crore, has reported more than 67 lakh COVID-19 cases so far.

As many as 12.95 lakh people in Odisha have missed their second COVID-19 vaccine dose, despite completing the maximum time gap between two doses, state's vaccination in-charge Dr Bijay Panigrahi has said. "While some people didn't come after taking the first dose, others missed it due to vaccine shortage...Efficacy of the vaccine will remain for six months," Dr Panigrahi added.

Thousands of people protested in Germany's capital Berlin against the measures imposed by the government to curb the spread of COVID-19 despite a ban on gatherings. More than 2,000 police officers were stationed around Berlin to respond to those who showed up despite the bans. The protest comes amid debates in the country about COVID-19 restrictions for unvaccinated people.

Bajaj Group, in collaboration with Pune Zilla Parishad, is organising a mega COVID-19 vaccination drive on August 31 in Rural Pune. The initiative aims at administering COVID-19 vaccines to the residents in the remotest parts of the Pune Rural area. Individuals above the age of 18 will be vaccinated, with a special focus on senior citizens and people with comorbidities.

Japan's Health Ministry on Saturday said that two men have died days after receiving Moderna COVID-19 vaccine shots that were later suspended following the discovery of contaminants. Japan on Thursday had suspended use of 16 lakh Moderna vaccine doses shipped to 863 vaccination centres, a week after the domestic distributor, Takeda Pharmaceutical, received reports of contaminants in some vials.

The Ministry of Home Affairs has said that COVID-19 containment measures will remain in force up to September 30. India reported 46,759 new cases on Saturday, the most in nearly two months, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. Active cases in the country stand at 3,59,775, while the COVID-19 death toll has risen to 4,37,370.

Russia recorded 50,421 COVID-19-related deaths in July, the highest monthly death toll since the pandemic began, state statistic service Rosstat said. Russian authorities blamed spread of Delta variant and low vaccination rate for COVID-19 surge in July. Russia recorded around 3,65,000 COVID-19-related deaths between April 2020-July, Rosstat data showed, over double the official government figure.

In a bid to curb the spread of COVID-19 in the state, Kerala CM Pinarayi Vijayan has imposed a night curfew from 10 pm to 6 am from Monday (August 30) onwards. He added that the Sunday curfew in the state will continue till further orders. This came as the state recorded 31,265 fresh cases of coronavirus and 153 deaths.

US President Joe Biden has said, "Critical information about the origins of COVID-19 pandemic exists in the People's Republic of China." "China have worked to prevent international investigators and members of the global public health comunity from accessing it," he added. "China continues to...withhold information, even as the toll of this pandemic continues to rise," he further said.

West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee has said that all teachers in the state have been inoculated with COVID-19 vaccines. After chairing a meeting with Health Department officials, Mamata added that the state is "prepared to tackle the possible third COVID-19 wave". "We are trying to prioritise vaccination of parents of children who are 12 years old and below," she added.

The operator of a cyber cafe in Mumbai has been booked for allegedly issuing fake COVID-19 negative reports to people, a police officer said. Based on a tip-off, a dumy customer was sent to the cyber cafe, which issued a fake COVID-19 negative report in the name of a pathology lab and charged the customer ?700 for it, he added.

India reported 44,658 new COVID-19 cases and 32,988 recoveries in the last 24 hours, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. Of the total 44,658, 30,007 cases were reported from Kerala. Active COVID-19 cases in India stand at 3,44,899, while the country has reported 4,36,861 deaths so far.

Over 1.58 lakh COVID-19 vaccine doses were administered in Delhi on Thursday, which is the highest in a day since July 8. As many as 1,59,037 people were vaccinated on July 8 in Delhi. A total of 1,27,19,294 people have received the vaccine doses in Delhi so far, out of which 36,06,507 beneficiaries have been administered the second dose.

New Zealand on Friday extended nationwide COVID-19 lockdown until August 31 as it tries to contain its first coronavirus outbreak in six months. Auckland, outbreak's epicentre, will likely be under lockdown for at least two more weeks, PM Jacinda Ardern said. New Zealand reported 70 new COVID-19 cases on Friday, taking the total tally from the outbreak to nearly 350.

Rajasthan CM Ashok Gehlot took to Twitter and wrote, "Post COVID-19 I was having health issues and since yesterday I was having severe pain in my chest. Just got my CT angio done." "Angioplasty will be done. I am happy that I'm getting it done at SMS Hospital. I am fine and will be back soon," he added.

Pok?mon GO-developer Niantic has permanently increased the base interaction radius for Pok?Stops and Gyms to 80 metres globally. The radius had previously been increased from 40 metres to 80 metres as a COVID-19 safety measure. Earlier, Niantic's decision to reduce the radius back to 40 metres in the US and New Zealand had faced protests from users.

Sri Lanka extended its nationwide lockdown till September 6 amid a recent surge in coronavirus deaths. This comes after Sri Lanka recorded 209 deaths on Wednesday, its highest one-day jump in COVID-19 deaths so far. Sri Lanka has reported 8,157 COVID-19 deaths in total, with over 7,500 of them being recorded amid an ongoing third wave that began in April.

Kerala reported 32,801 new coronavirus cases and 179 deaths in the last 24 hours, data released by the state government revealed. Friday is the third consecutive day that the state added over 30,000 fresh COVID-19 cases to its tally. The test positivity rate is 19.22%. Kerala's active caseload stands at 1,95,254 and the total number of deaths at 20,313.

The ISKCON Temple in Bengaluru will celebrate Krishna Janmashtami on August 29 and 30 but without any visitors in view of COVID-19. "Devotees are requested to participate online by visiting ISKCON Bangalore's YouTube channel, website and other social media accounts," a release said. Notably, Karnataka's 24-hour tally on Thursday comprised  1,213 fresh COVID-19 cases and 25 deaths.

Maharashtra Health Minister Rajesh Tope has said there is a possibility of COVID-19 third wave that could grip the state during the upcoming festival months of October and November. He reportedly predicted that 60 lakh people could be infected by the time the festival season ends in November. Maharashtra government has increased its oxygen capacity to 2000 MT, Tope asserted.

Over one crore COVID-19 vaccine doses were administered in India on Friday marking a new record in single-day vaccinations in the country, Union Health Minister Mansukh Mandaviya said. Calling it a "momentous feat", PM Narendra Modi added, "Kudos to those getting vaccinated and those making the vaccination drive a success." India's cumulative vaccination coverage crossed 62 crore today.

The Centre has informed Kerala High Court that the 84-day gap between two Covishield doses was fixed to increase the efficacy of the vaccine. The submission was made before Justice PB Suresh Kumar, who had on August 24 asked the government whether the 84-day gap period between two Covishield doses was based on availability of the vaccine or its efficacy.

China's National Health Comission (NHC) on Friday said that the country has fully vaccinated nearly 90 crore people against COVID-19 as of August 26. China aims to achieve herd imunity by the end of this year, according to Chinese state media. Separately, the latest outbreaks of COVID-19 across China have been brought under control, NHC spokesman Mi Feng said.

Myanmar's military said it'd vaccinate the Rohingya minority against COVID-19. "They're also our people...we'll not leave anyone behind," spokesman Zaw Min Tun said. "Vaccinations would include Rohingya people in Maungdaw and Buthidaung districts bordering Bangladesh," Tun added. Hundreds of thousands of Rohingyas fled to Bangladesh after a military crackdown on the Muslim minority group in 2017.

A foreign participant at Paralympics in Japan has been hospitalised with non-severe symptoms of COVID-19, a report said on Thursday. It is the first hospitalisation of the Tokyo Paralympics, which started on Tuesday. Hospitals in Japan treating COVID-19 patients have usually reserved beds for people showing severe symptoms. Like the Olympics, the Paralympics is also going on without spectators.

The Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) on Thursday sealed the St Joseph Boarding School in Mumbai after 22 people tested positive for coronavirus, reports claimed. A total of 95 people were tested for the disease. Four children aged below 12 contracted the disease while 12 in the 12-18 age group tested positive, according to reports.

Union Health Minister Mansukh Mandaviya on Thursday informed that 50% of India's eligible population has received the first dose of the COVID-19 vaccine. Calling it an "unprecedented milestone", Mandaviya tweeted, "Keep it up India." As per Health Ministry's data, India administered 67,87,305 doses today till 7 pm. With this, the cumulative vaccination coverage has crossed the 61 crore mark.

Japan has halted the use of over 16 lakh doses of Moderna's COVID-19 vaccine after particulate matter was found in a lot of vaccine vials at an inoculation site. The contamination, the company said, could be due to a manufacturing issue in one of the production lines at its contract manufacturing site in Spain.

Puducherry Lt Governor Tamilisai Soundararajan on Thursday said that the government is making all efforts to contain the COVID-19 pandemic and has largely succeeded. She added that she is confident that Puducherry would certainly be free from the coronavirus pandemic soon with the cooperation of the government machinery and the people. Puducherry reported 73 COVID-19 cases in last 24 hours.

During a media briefing on Thursday, government said that 41 districts in India are reporting more than 10% weekly COVID-19 positivity rate. These districts are in Rajasthan, Kerala and some states in the Northeast, government added while sharing the picture of a map. India's active COVID-19 cases currently stand at 3,33,725.

Former Congress President Rahul Gandhi on Thursday expressed concern over the rising COVID-19 figures as India registered 46,164 fresh coronavirus cases and urged people to take care of themselves. Criticising the Centre in the same tweet, he added, "GOI is busy with sales." Rahul has been critical of the National Monetisation Pipeline, which was revealed earlier this week.

Kerala reported 30,077 new COVID-19 cases, 18,997 recoveries and 162 deaths in the last 24 hours, figures released on Thursday showed. This is the second day in a row that the state has witnessed more than 30,000 new cases, after reporting 31,445 new cases on Wednesday. Kerala's active COVID-19 cases now stand at 1,81,209 and the death toll at 20,134.

Congress leader Shashi Tharoor on Thursday took part in a symbolic protest by the Indian Youth Congress against the Kerala government's handling of the COVID-19 pandemic in front of the Secretariat in Thiruvananthapuram. Tharoor was seen checking the health of a man with a stethoscope in a "roadside ICU". "Kerala is in ICU...while the govt charges unaffordable fees," he said.

Centre on Thursday named fives states that have most number of active COVID-19 cases in the country. Kerala, with 1,70,829 active COVID-19 cases, accounts for 51.19% of the total active cases in India, followed by Maharashtra with 53,695 active cases, that is 16.01% of the total active cases. Karnataka, Tamil Nadu and Andhra Pradesh are also among the highest contributors.

As Kerala continues to witness a surge in COVID-19 cases, Union Minister V Muraleedharan said, the situation in the state is grave. "The state, instead of using scientific methods to contain the spread, is trying to use pandemic for political objectives. I urge it to follow ICMR guidelines. Kerala's home quarantine (plan) has miserably failed," he added.

There are no COVID-19 positive cases among the 78 persons who were evacuated from Afghanistan and reached Delhi on Tuesday, the Indo-Tibetan Border Police (ITBP) tweeted on Wednesday. The evacuees are presently under institutional quarantine at the ITBP quarantine facility at Chhawla Camp. This comes after it was reported that 16 out of 78 evacuees had tested positive for COVID-19.

As many as 1,133 new COVID-19 cases and 17 deaths were reported in the Pune district on Wednesday. The number of active cases stands at 8,076 while over 710 people recovered from the infection. On Wednesday, 30,469 samples were tested in Pune and the total number of samples tested till date is 6,827,687.

Delhi Health Minister Satyendar Jain on Wednesday inaugurated a COVID-19 Rapid Response Centre at the Rajiv Gandhi Super Specialty Hospital in order to combat a possible COVID-19 third wave. "This will be manned with a Rapid Response Team which will work 24x7...will help in better management of COVID-19 patients," Jain tweeted. Delhi on Wednesday recorded 35 new COVID-19 cases.

At least 450 prisoners have tested coronavirus positive in 11 jails in Haryana, prison officials said. The infected prisoners were shifted to a special section in Rewari jail in the last 10 days, the special section's assistant superintendent BS Yadav said. A team of doctors and other staff have been deployed here to check inmates' health, he added.

Uttarakhand Cabinet Minister Subodh Uniyal said on Saturday that the state government will take a "major decision" to contain the spread of coronavirus by May 10. He added that the level of transmission despite Corona Curfew in the state is a "matter of concern". He further said that the virus had reached villages in the state.

Actress Kangana Ranaut took to Instagram to reveal she has tested positive for coronavirus. She said she underwent coronavirus test as she was hoping to go to Himachal Pradesh. "I had no idea this virus is having a party in my body, now that I know I'll demolish it, people please don't give anything any power over you," she wrote.

Shiv Sena on Saturday hit out at PM Narendra Modi-led government through its mouthpiece 'Saamana', saying that while India is accepting aid from "poor" countries amid the coronavirus pandemic, the government is not ready to stop the work of the multi-crore Central Vista project in Delhi. "In clear terms, India is surviving on the system created by Nehru-Gandhi," it added.

China's export sector, the key driver of the country's economic recovery in the past year, surprised economists by posting yet another month of resilient growth, driven this time by increased shipments to India and other countries troubled by another wave of the COVID-19 virus, WSJ reported. China's outbound shipments jumped 32.3% in April compared to the previous year.

Amazon has paused its annual Prime Day sale in India owing to the ongoing second wave of the COVID-19 pandemic. CNBC reported that Amazon paused the two-day discount event in India and Canada but didn't come out with a rescheduled date. India's daily COVID-19 death count, reported on Saturday, surpassed the 4,000-mark for the first time.

Kurnool Police has booked ex-Andhra Pradesh CM Chandrababu Naidu for allegedly spreading falsehood on COVID-19. A complaint was lodged against Naidu by a lawyer whoalleged that Naidu claimed that N440K coronavirus strain was born in Kurnool and caused enormous damage to humans. "[His utterances] have resulted in mental duress in women and children...leading to their death," the lawyer said.

The government has shared a five-step sample meal plan for people who are recovering from COVID-19. The government said that the plan will boost immunity and help people recover from post COVID-19 fatigue. According to the meal plan, the breakfast must consist of ragi dosa or a bowl of porridge. For dinner, patients must have khichdi, the government added.

At least 20 people have been added to COVID-19 healthcare staff in Gurugram. "We received 100 applications...only 50 were found to be related to the medical line...only 20 were found to be eligible," said Deputy Commissioner of Gurugram Yash Garg. The district administration on April 27 had appealed to those related to the medical line to come forward and volunteer.

After inspecting a vaccination centre for the 18-44 age group in Chirag Delhi, CM Arvind Kejriwal said that one lakh people are being vaccinated daily. "COVID-19 vaccines are being administered at 100 schools in Delhi," he added. "We're planning to expand it to 300 schools and ramp up the vaccination to three lakh per day," Kejriwal further said.

An editorial published in medical journal The Lancet has said that PM Narendra Modi's government seemed more intent on removing criticism on Twitter than trying to control the COVID-19 pandemic. PM Modi's actions in attempting to stifle criticism and open discussion during the crisis are "inexcusable", it stated. "The scenes of suffering in India are hard to comprehend," it added.

As many as 21 people have died in a village in Rajasthan's Sikar, after about 150 people attended the burial of a COVID-19 infected man. Only three or four of these deaths have occurred due to coronavirus, Lakshmangarh SDO Kulraj Meena said. The man's burial was done without following protocol and several people touched his corpse, officials said.

Two more KKR players have tested positive for coronavirus during their hard quarantine in Ahmedabad. New Zealand wicketkeeper-batsman Tim Seifert and India pacer Prasidh Krishna tested positive. Seifert failed both his pre-departure RT-PCR tests and is experiencing moderate symptoms. Earlier, Varun Chakaravarthy and Sandeep Warrier had tested positive for the virus during the tournament.

The government has said that a fake message is being circulated on social media, which claims that prolonged use of mask increases carbon dioxide and decreases oxygen in the body. The government further urged the people to wear the mask correctly to protect themselves against coronavirus infection. India reported over 4.01 lakh COVID-19 cases in the last 24 hours.

A video of a 97-year-old woman urging people to get vaccinated against coronavirus has gone viral online. "Don't be afraid. Take the vaccination, it is good for you and others around you," she said. Stating that her second dose is due on May 9, the woman added she "felt no pain or even side effects" after the first dose.

PIB's Fact Check Twitter page has warned people about a fake message doing the rounds about a WHO warning to India over coronavirus spread. It says that India will enter 'community transmission' phase after which death toll could rise to 50,000 by May. PIB said WHO hasn't issued any such warning but has issued a clarification on the fake message.

With India registering over four lakh daily coronavirus cases for the third straight day, India wicketkeeper-batsman Rishabh Pant announced that he would donate to Hemkunt Foundation to help provide oxygen cylinders with beds for those suffering due to the virus. Meanwhile, Virat Kohli along with his wife Anushka Sharma has launched a fundraiser #InThisTogether to help those affected by COVID-19.

US lawmaker Pramila Jayapal has issued an urgent appeal to raise funds for India amid a sharp increase in coronavirus cases. "India needs our help and it's our moral responsibility to rise to the challenge...Until we crush the virus everywhere, we cannot fully recover," she said. Jayapal also said that all the funds raised would go to three initiatives.

As many as 12 states account for 80.68% of 37,23,446 active coronavirus cases in India, the government said on Saturday. Maharashtra has the maximum number of active COVID-19 cases at 6.57 lakh, followed by Karnataka, Kerala, Uttar Pradesh and Rajasthan. The other states include Andhra Pradesh, Gujarat, Tamil Nadu, Chhattisgarh, West Bengal, Haryana and Bihar.

Team India cricketer Ajinkya Rahane and his wife Radhika on Saturday received their first dose of the coronavirus vaccine. Sharing a picture of himself and his wife getting vaccinated, Rahane wrote, "We're getting vaccinated not only for ourselves but also for those around us." India reported over four lakh daily cases on Saturday for the third straight day.

North Korea has warned its citizens against reading propaganda leaflets sent via balloons over the border with South Korea, saying they could be carrying coronavirus. "Even when we come across a strange object flying in the wind, we must consider it as a possible route of COVID-19 transmission rather than a natural phenomenon," the state-run Rodong Sinmun newspaper said.

India on Saturday reported 4,187 coronavirus deaths, the highest one-day rise since the pandemic began. Ten states/UTs accounted for 77.29% of the new deaths. Maharashtra saw the maximum casualties (898). Karnataka follows Maharashtra with 592 daily deaths. Uttar Pradesh, Delhi and Chhattisgarh also reported more than 200 deaths in the last 24 hours.

The State Department said that it's allowing non-essential diplomats and the families of all US staff at its embassy in Kathmandu to leave Nepal at government expense due to a surge in COVID-19 cases. It also asked Americans who wish to leave to submit information to the embassy. Nepal has recently reported a sharp increase in daily coronavirus cases.

The Health Ministry has waived off the requirement of a positive test report for coronavirus patients to get admission in COVID-19 facilities. "A suspect case (of COVID-19) shall be admitted...No patient will be refused services on any count. This includes medications such as oxygen or essential drugs even if the patient belongs to a different city," the ministry stated.

During the latest episode of her talk show, American actress Drew Barrymore spoke about the coronavirus pandemic in India. "[India]...holds a very special place in my heart...My heart goes out to the people of India who're trying hard to hold it together. Countless people, celebrities and organisations coming together and pledging support...that's truly the need of the hour," she said.

China has administered more than 30.8 crore doses of coronavirus vaccines as of Friday, according to data released by the National Health Commission on Saturday. The official data showed that China had administered around 1.05 crore doses of the vaccines on May 7. COVID-19 has infected nearly 1.04 lakh people in China, according to a World Health Organization (WHO) tally.

Sri Lanka on Saturday approved Pfizer's coronavirus vaccine for emergency use, making it the first South Asian country to do so. Earlier, the country had approved vaccines developed by Serum Institute of India, China's Sinopharm, and Russia's Sputnik for emergency use. Sri Lanka, which is witnessing the third wave of the pandemic, has reported over 1.21 lakh COVID-19 cases.

Singapore government said that it'll not accept new applications for work passes from higher-risk countries and regions with immediate effect amid COVID-19. Work pass holders from these places with approval to enter before July 5 will no longer be allowed to do so, it added. Australia, Brunei, mainland China, New Zealand, Taiwan, Hong Kong and Macau are exempt from restrictions.

India's second COVID-19 wave poses a downside risk to economic activities in first quarter of 2021-22, as per a Finance Ministry report. However, the economic impact is expected to be muted compared to the first wave, the Ministry said. The experience from other countries suggests that learning to "operate with COVID-19" provides a "silver lining of economic resilience", it added.

Ahmedabad-based Zydus Cadila is planning to submit data related to its COVID-19 vaccine ZyCoV-D by the end of this month and is looking to get approval by June, MD Dr Sharvil Patel said. The trial of India's first indigenously-made DNA vaccine is the largest in the country, he added. The company has included children between 12-17 years in the trials.
