The Indian Medical Association said that it has been insisting on the need for a complete national lockdown rather than few states declaring complete lockdown. "However, Centre refused to implement lockdown resulting in the mounting of new COVID-19 patients beyond 4 lakh everyday," it added. It further said that its suggestions and requests are put into dustbin by the government.

The Urban Primary Healthcare Centres (UPHCs) in Hyderabad have limited COVID-19 vaccine shots to 200 per day. After the Telangana government decided to prioritise people's second vaccine dose from May 8 to May 15, with a limited stock of 3.75 lakh doses. PHC officials issued tokens for the vaccine shots on a first-come-first-serve basis.

Around 50 lakh doses of Covishield vaccine earmarked by Serum Institute of India for export to UK have now been made available for the inoculation of 18-44 age group in India, according to reports. The Centre will reportedly allocate these doses to 21 states/UTs. In March, SII had sought permission from the government to supply 50 lakh doses to UK.

An editorial in medical journal The Lancet has said, "The impression from Indian government was that the country had beaten COVID-19 after several months of low case counts, despite repeated warnings of dangers of the second wave." "Before the second wave...Indian Health Minister Harsh Vardhan declared that India was in the endgame of the epidemic," it added.

Pfizer CEO Albert Bourla has said that most low and middle-income countries didn't order the company's COVID-19 vaccine. "The high-income countries reserved most of the doses. I reached out to...heads of middle/low-income countries...to urge them to reserve doses because...supply was limited," he added. Under the tiered pricing model, low-income nations were offered doses at cost, Bourla claimed.

Reiterating the importance of full protection through two COVID-19 vaccine doses, Union Health Minister Harsh Vardhan appealed to all citizens to get the second dose which boosts the immunity against COVID-19 manifold. He further said 53,25,000 doses will be supplied to the states soon. He added that 180 districts haven't seen a single COVID-19 case in the last seven days.

The European Union (EU) on Saturday signed a deal with Pfizer and BioNTech to buy up to 180 crore doses of their COVID-19 vaccine for 2021-2023. "Other contracts and other vaccine technologies will follow," European Commission chief Ursula von der Leyen tweeted. The EU currently has a portfolio of 260 crore doses from half a dozen companies.

Karnataka Health Minister K Sudhakar on Saturday said that the existing stock of Covishield and Covaxin in the state will be used to vaccinate those above 45. However, private hospitals such as Apollo and Manipal are doing vaccinations for people above 18. This comes after the Centre on Friday asked states to prioritise those due for their second vaccine dose.

Farmers took out protest marches at several places in Punjab on Saturday against the weekend lockdown imposed by the state government to control the rising COVID-19 cases. "Lockdown is not a solution to deal with the COVID-19 crisis," said a member of Bharti Kisan Union (Ekta Ugrahan). Punjab has imposed a weekend lockdown along with night curfew till May 15.

The Indian Medical Association has accused the Centre of not carrying out transparency in reporting and making registry of COVID-19 deaths. "Hundreds of deaths happening in big hospitals are shown as non-COVID deaths and crematoriums are showing houseful boards. RT-PCR negative, but CT positive cases aren't counted. Why are we trying to hide actual deaths?" it said in a letter.

The government on Saturday said it has approved the drug 2-deoxy-D-glucose (2-DG), developed by DRDO, for emergency use, amid a COVID-19 surge. The drug that comes in powder form and can be consumed orally after dissolving in water, reduces supplemental oxygen dependence in hospitalised patients, the Centre said. It accumulates in the virus-infected cells and prevents virus growth, it added.

Gujarat CM Vijay Rupani on Saturday said that no death has taken place in the state due to oxygen shortage as the central government has been watching over the state. He added that there has been no incident in the state where a hospital denied admission to a COVID-19 patient. "Elders at the Centre are worrying about Gujarat," said Rupani.

With COVID-19 cases rising in Jammu and Kashmir, the Haj house in Srinagar has been converted into a COVID care facility to accommodate patients. The facility has 100 beds, including 72 beds with oxygen supply, and is providing oxygen concentrators to COVID-19 positive patients. Hanif Balki, Additional DC Srinagar, said, "The facility is...for less critical patients who need medical attention."

Rajasthan CM Ashok Gehlot backed the need for taking a decision on COVID-19 lockdown at the Centre's level to ensure effective coordination between states and so that people have minimum hardship. He said the situation is becoming frightening, adding, "In this situation, lockdown is needed more than ever to prevent...infections." "[COVID-19] is spreading at...rapid pace in rural areas," he added.

Sri Lanka on Saturday said that it has detected the first case of the COVID-19 variant first detected in India in a person who recently returned from India. The variant was detected from samples collected from a quarantine centre, the Immunity and Cell Biology Unit at Sri Jayewardenepura University said. COVID-19 has infected over 1.21 lakh people in Sri Lanka.

Maharashtra Chief Minister Uddhav Thackeray on Saturday requested Prime Minister Narendra Modi for more supply of oxygen amid the surge in COVID-19 cases. Earlier this week, Maharashtra Chief Secretary Sitaram Kunte had written to Union Cabinet Secretary Rajiv Gauba requesting that the state's allocated quota of liquid medical oxygen be increased by at least 200 MT.

India Ratings and Research (Ind-Ra) said that state lockdowns to curb the spread of COVID-19 will impact India's energy demand growth recovery in the first quarter of the financial year. It added that demand is expected to be higher due to lower base effect. The all-India energy demand in March was up by 22.8% year-on-year to 122 billion units.

Maharashtra CM Uddhav Thackeray has written to PM Narendra Modi to allow states to develop their own applications for COVID-19 vaccination. Thackeray wrote that for the vaccination of the 18-45 age group, there's a fear that the ?CoWIN app might malfunction and crash? as it did earlier. He added that Centre can alternatively allot separate CoWIN app to each state.

Central Board of Indirect Taxes and Customs (CBIC) has allowed businesses to import and export goods without furnishing bonds to customs authorities, to ensure there are no delays amid the COVID-19 pandemic. The importers and exporters can avail this facility till June 30 by furnishing an undertaking, which will have to be replaced with a proper bond by July 15.

The Gujarat government has requested the Centre to allocate 1,400 metric tonnes of medical oxygen to the state by May 12. In a letter to Union Home Secretary Ajay Kumar Bhalla, Gujarat Chief Secretary Anil Mukim added that due to the shortage of oxygen, it was unable to operationalise 11,500 additional beds for COVID-19 patients.

Indian Air Force (IAF) has deployed 42 transport aircraft for COVID-19 relief tasks, including 12 heavy lift and 30 medium-lift aircraft, said Air Vice Marshal M Ranade. He added that these aircraft have so far lifted about 75 oxygen containers and work is in progress. The aircraft are used to bring in relief material and personnel from abroad, he added.

Puducherry Lieutenant Governor Tamilisai Soundararajan on Saturday appealed to people to adopt self-discipline and adhere to COVID-19 safety norms. "Lockdown can be imposed in the current context of surge in cases in Puducherry... But, we should also take into consideration the implications of total lockdown particularly in its impact on the livelihood of the poor," said Lieutenant Governor.

Bigg Boss 13 contestant Vikas Fhatak, popularly known as 'Hindustani Bhau', was detained for allegedly violating COVID-19 restrictions in Mumbai after using an ambulance to travel during the curfew. Fhatak, who wanted to hold a protest seeking cancellation of exams, had arranged an ambulance to take him to the protest site in order to ensure he's not stopped by police.

Punjab Chief Minister Amarinder Singh on Saturday sought the support of Radha Soami Satsang Beas sect in the state's fight against COVID-19. In a letter to sect chief Gurinder Singh Dhillon, the Chief Minister urged him to make all branches available with the Radha Soami Satsang Beas for the treatment of COVID-19 patients, along with attendants deputed for the purpose.

After eight years, India and the European Union have agreed to resume talks on free trade. In a virtual summit held on Saturday between PM Narendra Modi and 27 EU leaders, the External Affairs Ministry called this a "watershed moment". While PM Modi was scheduled to visit Portugal, it was called off amid the second wave of COVID-19 in India.

West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee while speaking about the COVID-19 crisis said that the Centre "didn?t do any work in the last six months" as its leaders were visiting the state to capture it. On the Central Vista project, Mamata said, "They?re spending around ?50,000 crore to build Lok Sabha building, PM's residence...but priority should've been...vaccination which they didn?t do."

In its revised guidelines, US' CDC has acknowledged that airborne transmission is one of several ways COVID-19 can spread, stating that the virus can be transmitted through very fine aerosolised particles released during respiration. While larger droplets of respiratory fluids settle out of the air rapidly, very fine droplets can remain suspended in the air for several minutes to hours.

Ex-India hockey player and coach MK Kaushik on Saturday died due to COVID-19 related complications. He was 66 and survived by his son and wife. MK Kaushik, a member of the 1980 Moscow Olympics gold medal-winning Indian team, had tested positive for COVID-19 on April 17. Earlier in the day, Kaushik's teammate Ravinder Pal Singh also died after battling COVID-19.

Maharashtra Health Minister Rajesh Tope on Saturday said despite imposing restrictions to control the spread of COVID-19 in the state, the daily average of cases is still over 50,000. He added that the state government is stressing on tracking, tracing and treating COVID-19 patients to curb the outbreak. Maharashtra reported 54,022 new COVID-19 cases on Friday.

UP CM Yogi Adityanath said despite being India's most populous state, UP is fighting COVID-19 effectively. He said, "It was predicted...UP will see 1 lakh positive cases per day from May 5 but as on May 8, we reported 26,000 cases...It means our COVID-19...management is successful." "From April 30 we're seeing...[a] decline in cases...[we've]...started...screening & testing in villages," he added.

Goa CM Pramod Sawant said on Thursday that people suffering from coronavirus are being treated for free in government hospitals. He added that 80% of the expenses of a coronavirus patient's treatment in a private hospital will be paid by the state government. The state government has also announced the withdrawal and suspension of shooting permissions for films and serials.

Germany has rejected a US-backed proposal to waive patents on coronavirus vaccines, saying it has "significant implications for vaccine production as a whole". "The protection of intellectual property is a source of innovation and must remain so in the future," a government spokeswoman added. India and South Africa had made the proposal at the World Trade Organization (WTO) in October.

The government has shared a video, citing The Lancet, that states that many suffer from typical symptoms like viral or flu-like symptoms for first few days of coronavirus. On Day 1, patients usually run a fever, experience fatigue or dry cough. On Day 5, patients may have difficulty breathing. On an average, patients fully recover from COVID-19 by Day 17.

The central government is considering setting up a pandemic pool fund worth at least ?1 lakh crore to financially help uninsured citizens getting hit by COVID-19, Hindustan Times reported. Government officials reportedly said that talks are on with the Insurance Regulatory and Development Authority of India (IRDAI) and the RBI. India has reported over 2.30 lakh deaths due to COVID-19.

After media reports said that BJP MP Tejasvi Surya apologised for blaming Bengaluru civic body (BBMP) staff over the bed allocation scam, he called it "fake news". Surya had, during his visit to a COVID-19 war room on May 5, accused at least 16 Muslim volunteers of being part of a 'bed-blocking scam'. These volunteers were then put on hold.

Government has named the districts that have been showing continuous rise in COVID-19 cases for two weeks. They include Karnataka's Bengaluru, Mysuru and Tumakuru, Tamil Nadu's Chennai and Maharashtra's Satara and Solapur. Haryana's Gurugram and Faridabad, Bihar's Patna and Uttarakhand's Dehradun also feature on the list. It also includes districts from Kerala, Andhra Pradesh and West Bengal.

WHO has given Emergency Use Listing to China's Sinopharm COVID-19 vaccine, making it the sixth vaccine to receive WHO validation for safety, efficacy and quality. "The Strategic Advisory Group of Experts on Immunisation... recommends the vaccine for adults 18 years and older, with a two-dose schedule," said WHO. It's the first Chinese jab to receive WHO's green light.

In the wake of the COVID-19 situation, PDP President Mehbooba Mufti on Friday appealed to Prime Minister Narendra Modi to release all political detainees from jails in and outside J&K  immediately. "As far as Kashmir is concerned, it is no secret that hundreds, or maybe thousands of detainees and political prisoners have been arrested since August 2019," she said.

Maharashtra Health Minister Rajesh Tope has requested the Central government for more COVID-19 vaccines and oxygen supply amid the COVID-19 situation. He said, "We need 1700 metric tonnes...of oxygen...We urge the Central government to provide us...required oxygen." "We [got] 9 lakh vaccines two days back and 8 lakh vaccines...administered...We request the Centre to provide us vaccines," he added.

Japan on Friday extended the state of emergency in Tokyo and three other areas until the end of May to curb the spread of coronavirus. The measures taken against the fourth wave of COVID-19 have failed to stem the surge in cases, PM Yoshihide Suga said. However, he reiterated his stance that Japan can host "a safe and secure Olympics".

The Union Health Ministry has shared a map to indicate how coronavirus recovery rates of various states and Union Territories compare to India's overall recovery rate of 81.95%. Several states have recovery rates higher than the national average including Maharashtra, Tamil Nadu, MP etc. States with recovery rates lower than the national average include Rajasthan, Gujarat, Karnataka and Kerala.

Ministry of Commerce & Industry has released a statement after US backed a plan proposed by India and South Africa at the World Trade Organization to waive intellectual property protections for coronavirus vaccines. "We welcome US' statement...The waiver is an important step for enabling rapid scaling up of manufacture and timely availability of affordable COVID-19 vaccines," the ministry said.

Delhi High Court on Friday issued a notice to the national capital's government over a plea seeking direction to provide three meals a day for people at shelter homes. Workers are unable to gain employment and are suffering economically due to lockdown amid coronavirus pandemic, the plea said. "Workers have little means to feed themselves and their children," it added.

Health Minister Harsh Vardhan on Friday hit out at Jharkhand CM Hemant Soren saying that he should "fight coronavirus, not PM". This comes after Soren said that PM Narendra Modi "just spoke his mind and didn't listen" during a call. Vardhan added that the "Centre has opened its treasury for needy while Jharkhand government has kept it shut" amid coronavirus.

Three people, including two coronavirus patients, have been booked for allegedly breaking quarantine rules and spreading the virus by attending a wedding at Madhya Pradesh's Niwari, police said on Friday. A village has been sealed, as about 40 people tested positive after the wedding, an inspector said. The third man booked knew the other two were infected, inspector added.

Director of Cricket South Africa, Graeme Smith has said that while Australia's three-Test tour of South Africa in March was postponed over coronavirus, several players participated in the IPL despite rising cases of the virus in India. "You see some of those players sitting there at the IPL and not making any noise...It's a version of double standards...disappointing," he stated.

Australia's Pat Cummins has said if hosting the ICC T20 World Cup in India is a "drain on resources" or is "unsafe" due to the coronavirus then it shouldn't be played in the country. "The IPL in the UAE last year was brilliant...but millions of people were saying it should've been played in India...You can see both sides," he added.

India on Friday recorded the highest-ever one-day rise in the number of COVID-19 cases for any country for the second day in a row as 4,14,188 people tested positive for the virus in the last 24 hours. Further, India recorded 3,915 deaths due to COVID-19 in the last 24 hours, taking the death toll in the country to 2,34,083.

Brazil has become the third country after US and India to report over 1.5 crore COVID-19 cases, the Health Ministry said. The country's total coronavirus cases rose to 1,50,03,563 after it reported 73,380 new cases in the past 24 hours. Brazil's death toll increased to 4,16,949 after it reported 2,550 fatalities during the same period, the second-highest coronavirus-related deaths globally.

A UP Panchayat election winner was booked by Ramganj police for violating coronavirus rules and allegedly also disrupting communal harmony after the candidate took out a victory procession. The candidate had released a video of the procession with a Pakistani song apparently playing in the background. The police registered a case when the video went viral on social media.

Sitar player Prateek Chaudhuri has passed away aged 49 due to coronavirus-related complications, almost a week after his father, sitar maestro Pandit Debu Chaudhuri, succumbed to the virus. According to music historian Pavan Jha, Prateek was undergoing COVID-19 treatment at a Delhi hospital. Pavan said he was "struggling" in ICU and "was totally distressed and broken" with his father's death.

Researchers at The University of Texas have released a picture showing how antibodies produced in people, who effectively fight off SARS-CoV-2, work to neutralise the part of the virus responsible for causing COVID-19. Researchers called it the "most complete picture yet". "There's an evolutionary arms race going on between the virus and our immune systems," the researchers added.

Senior journalist Shesh Narain Singh passed away due to COVID-19 on Friday. He was undergoing treatment for COVID-19 at a hospital in Uttar Pradesh. PM Narendra Modi offered condolences to his family and tweeted, "The demise of senior journalist Shesh Narain Singh ji is very sad. He will always be known for his significant contribution to the journalism world."

Karnataka Health Minister Dr K Sudhakar today announced that the state government has decided to cap the price of CT scan and X-ray in private hospitals and labs since they are becoming "increasingly necessary" to detect COVID-19 infection. The price of CT scan has been capped at ?1,500 and the price of X-ray has been capped at ?250.

The government has named the ten districts which have the most active COVID-19 cases in the country. These districts account for 25% of the total active cases in India. They are - Bengaluru Urban, Pune, Delhi, Ahmedabad, Ernakulam, Nagpur, Mumbai, Kozhikode, Jaipur and Thane. Active cases in the country stand at 36,45,164.

Amid the ongoing COVID-19 crisis in the country, Congress President Sonia Gandhi on Friday said that the system has not failed as India has many strengths and resources. The Prime Minister Narendra Modi-led government has failed to constructively channelise those resources, Sonia Gandhi said while virtually addressing the Congress Parliamentary Party meeting.

The government has said COVID-19 vaccination services may not be denied in absence of identity cards. District Task Force may identify such persons in respective districts, it stated, adding that District Immunization Officer will be responsible for providing coverage to the identified groups. The CoWIN system will provide facility for creation of special vaccination sessions for this purpose.

Congress leader Rahul Gandhi has written to PM Narendra Modi and has given four "urgent" suggestions to fight the COVID-19 crisis. They include scientifically tracking the virus and its mutations using genome sequencing, assessing all vaccines against new mutations and rapidly vaccinating the population. He suggested being transparent and keeping the world informed about the country's findings.

Bengaluru's Private Hospitals And Nursing Homes Association (PHANA) has written a letter seeking Karnataka government's help to secure COVID-19 vaccines. Most private hospitals, except for some corporate chains, had no vaccines since May 1, letter stated. PHANA also urged the state government to temporarily stop inoculating 18-44 age group so that people due for second doses can be given vaccines.

As many as 1,37,877 people have been detained for violating COVID-19 norms so far in Manipur, state IGP and Nodal Officer for COVID-19 Elangbam Priyokumar Singh said. A total fine of more than ?1.95 crore has been collected from the violators till Thursday, he added. Manipur has 2,991 active COVID-19 cases and the death toll so far stands at 447.

Russian President Vladimir Putin has announced that he supports the idea of waiving patents on Russian coronavirus vaccines. "Russia would of course support such an approach...As I have said many times...We should not think about how to extract maximum profit, but about how to ensure people's safety," he said. Russia has developed the Sputnik V vaccine against COVID-19.

Congress leader P Chidambaram on Friday asserted that the COVID-19 pandemic situation in India is going from bad to worse. Chidambaram tweeted, "The insufficient supply of vaccines is...bitter truth, but the government is in denial." "The PM [Narendra Modi] and the Health Minister [Harsh Vardhan] refuse to own responsibility and are making a mockery of democratic principles," he further tweeted.

Russian President Vladimir Putin has said that the country's COVID-19 vaccines are "as reliable as an AK-47". "By the way, it wasn't us who said that, this was said by a European specialist. And I think that he is certainly right," Putin added. Russia recently approved a single-dose COVID-19 vaccine called 'Sputnik Light'.

The Common Entrance Exam (CEC) for Army Recruitment in Jaipur and Jodhpur has been postponed due to the COVID-19 situation, informed the Defence PRO of Rajasthan on Friday. The exam was scheduled for May 30, 2021, for the medically fit candidates. According to the statement, the fresh dates will be announced later.

The Health Ministry has said that if a person contracts coronavirus after getting the first dose of COVID-19 vaccine, they should defer the second dose by four-eight weeks after recovery. This period is applicable for people having active symptoms of coronavirus, patients who have been given plasma or anti-COVID-19 monoclonal anti-bodies and acutely ill patients due to any other illness.

The International Monetary Fund has said it'll revisit its growth forecast for India when it issues a fresh World Economic Outlook in July. The recent COVID-19 surge in India posed downside risks to April forecast of 12.5% GDP growth in India in 2021-22, it added. "We're...watching what's happening in India with concern...There will be spillovers," IMF spokesman Gerry Rice said.

After criticism over a UP government press release that reportedly said that 'gaushalas' (cow shelters) in the state were being equipped with oximeters and thermal scanners amid COVID-19 spread, the state's Additional Chief Secretary (Information), Navneet Sehgal said the equipment was meant for the shelter staff, not cows. Sehgal had further called media reports on the release "misleading".

Speaking about India's COVID-19 crisis, US Vice-President Kamala Harris said, "My mother was born and raised in India...I have family members who live in India...The welfare of India is critically important to US." She added India sent assistance to US at the beginning of the pandemic and today, US is "determined to help India in its hour of need".

Congress leader Rahul Gandhi said that the ?20,000 crore Central Vista redevelopment project is a  "criminal wastage". Gandhi told the Modi government to put people's lives at the centre, not the "blind arrogance" to get a new house. India reported over 4.14 lakh new COVID-19 cases and over 3,900 deaths in last 24 hours.

Retail sales of cars and two-wheelers fell to its lowest in nine months as a second wave of COVID-19 infections stalled recovery in the automobile sector, Bloomberg Quint reported. Sales at dealerships, as measured by the number of vehicles registered, fell 29% over the preceding month to 11.89 lakh units in April, the report said.

Rhea Chakraborty on Friday penned a note mourning the demise of her uncle Colonel S Suresh Kumar VSM (Retd), who passed away due to coronavirus on May 1. Sharing a picture of her uncle, she wrote, "A renowned orthopaedic surgeon...and a wonderful human being...COVID took you away, but your legacy continues." "Suresh Uncle, you're a real life hero," she added.

Public Health England said coronavirus variant B.1.617.2, first detected in India, would be classified as a variant of concern due to evidence that it was more transmissible. It said other characteristics of the variant were still being investigated. "There's currently insufficient evidence to indicate...any of the variants recently detected in India cause more severe disease," PHE stated.

Actress Kajal Aggarwal and her husband Gautam Kitchlu on Friday received the first dose of the coronavirus vaccine. Taking to Instagram Stories, the 35-year-old actress shared a picture of herself and wrote, "Everyone, please go take your vaccine as and when possible." In addition to Kajal, Pulkit Samrat and Radhika Madan have also received the first dose.

Amid a surge in COVID-19 cases, the Union Health Ministry has shared an illustrated guide on COVID-19 appropriate behaviours. The guide lists 15 "preventive behavioural practices critical to winning the fight against COVID-19", the Ministry said. The list includes practices like maintaining respiratory hygiene, avoiding unnecessary travel, not sharing unverified information on social media, etc.

To improve the daily number of COVID-19 vaccinations in Mumbai, BMC has planned drive-in vaccination centres in all seven zones of the city. BMC stated that senior citizens coming with an appointment for both doses of Covishield will be vaccinated at these centres. "The beneficiary...shall not self-drive and he/she shall be accompanied by an attendant or a driver," it added.

Amazon Seller Services, Amazon's Indian subsidiary, has received over ?915 crore from its parent firm Amazon, according to regulatory documents. The investment was made by Amazon Corporate Holdings and Amazon.com.inc. Earlier, Amazon revealed that it has paused its annual Prime Day sale in India amid the rising COVID-19 cases.

The Central Government has said that "no major outbreak" of the deadly black fungal infection mucormycosis has been seen in COVID-19 patients so far. NITI Aayog's Dr VK Paul shared five measures to prevent it: Controlling blood sugar levels, using steroids rationally, using clean water in humidifiers for patients on oxygen support, maintaining overall hygiene and immediately treating oral ulcers.

Delhi recorded 19,832 new COVID-19 cases and 341 deaths in the last 24 hours, as per the Health Department bulletin. According to the data, Delhi now has 91,035 active cases while the cumulative caseload stood at 12,92,867. A total of 1,14,657 beneficiaries were vaccinated on Thursday, out of which 80,306 were those who got their first dose, the bulletin stated.

The central government on Friday told the states to prioritise beneficiaries due for the second dose of the COVID-19 vaccine and ensure timely completion of the recommended vaccination schedule. This comes as India reported over 4.14 lakh new COVID-19 cases and over 3,900 deaths in last 24 hours. More than 2.34 lakh people have died since the outbreak.

The CM Mamata Banerjee-led Bengal government on Friday moved the Supreme Court seeking a uniform vaccination policy and sought scrapping of the current differential pricing of COVID-19 vaccines for Centre and states. It said that the Centre should place a bulk order for COVID-19 vaccines and distribute them to states and Union Territories free of cost.

Karnataka CM BS Yediyurappa has announced that a complete lockdown will be imposed in the state from 6 am on May 10 to 6 am on May 24. "Corona curfew wasn't successful as COVID-19 cases are surging...So, a complete lockdown will be imposed," he said. "It's a temporary lockdown...I request migrant labourers to not leave," Yediyurappa added.

Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal on Friday said that now there was no shortage of oxygen in Delhi, adding that the COVID-19 vaccination drive should end in three months' time with all adults in the city being vaccinated. Speaking at a high-level government meeting, the CM also instructed District Magistrates to visit 2-3 vaccination centres daily for inspection.

Goa CM Pramod Sawant on Friday announced that state-level curfew will be imposed from May 9 to May 23 as COVID-19 positivity rate and death rate are increasing in the state. "Grocery shops allowed to remain open from 7am-1pm, restaurant takeaway orders allowed from 7am-7pm," he added. Sawant stated that essential services will be exempted from the curfew.

Telangana has no plans to impose a lockdown in the state as it will cripple public life as well as the economy, Chief Minister K Chandrashekar Rao said on Thursday. According to Rao, past experience reveals that lockdown is not effective in controlling the spread of COVID-19. He added that COVID-19 cases have not dropped in states under lockdown either.

The Kerala government has reopened the COVID-19 call centre or Disha helpline in view of the surge in COVID-19 cases in the state. The helpline was started last year. People can contact the official helpline numbers - 0471 2309250, 2309251, 2309252, 2309253, 2309254, 2309255. Citizens in the state can call on these numbers to clear their doubts about the COVID-19.

After Jharkhand CM Hemant Soren said that PM Narendra Modi's call was "Mann Ki Baat", his Andhra Pradesh counterpart YS Jagan Mohan Reddy said that politics during COVID-19 would weaken the nation. He tweeted, "Dear Hemant Soren, as a brother I'd urge you, no matter whatever our differences are, indulging in such level of politics would only weaken our nation."

The Union Health Ministry on Friday said that a new 4-digit security code feature has been added to the CoWIN vaccination registration portal, to "minimise errors for online bookings/ appointments". The code, applicable for bookings from May 8 onward, will be received by beneficiaries and will have to be given to the vaccinators to correctly record the beneficiaries' vaccination status.

Centre on Friday said that in the next three days, states and union territories will receive 10,25,000 COVID-19 vaccine doses. Over 90 lakh COVID-19 vaccine doses are still available with the states and UTs to be administered, the Ministry of Health claimed. The Centre has provided more than 17.35 crore vaccine doses to the states and UTs free of cost.

Government has shared the screenshot of a message that claimed that all people over the age of 18 can register for COVID-19 vaccination by downloading a mobile application through the given link. "This app is fake. To register for vaccination visit the website http://cowin.gov.in," a tweet by PIB Fact Check read.

The Centre has shared age-wise distribution of COVID-19 vaccine in India. Citizens aged above 60 account for 41% of COVID-19 vaccination and those aged 45-60 years account for 46%. People in the age group of 30-45 years account for 9% and those aged 18-30 account for 4% of the vaccination. A total 16.50 crore doses have been administered so far.

Delhi's Deputy CM Manish Sisodia on Friday said that 1.84 lakh people between the age group of 18-44 years have been administered the first dose of COVID-19 vaccine in the first four days of the start of the third phase of the vaccination drive in Delhi. "In total 38.88 lakh people...got...vaccine in all age groups till yesterday evening," Sisodia added.

Biological E's MD Mahima Datla has said that the Hyderabad-based company plans to produce 7.5-8 crore doses of its COVID-19 vaccine per month from August. Biological E received the drug regulator's approval to start Phase 3 trials last month, which will begin soon, Datla added. "It'll be among the most affordable COVID-19 vaccines that you can get," she further said.

When asked about his previous statement wherein he said third wave of COVID-19 is inevitable, Principal Scientific Adviser to Centre K VijayRaghavan said, "If we take strong measures, third wave may not happen in all the places or indeed anywhere at all." "It depends on how effectively guidance is implemented at...local level, in the states, districts, cities, everywhere," he added.

As many as 24 states/UTs have a COVID-19 positivity rate of more than 15%. Goa has the highest positivity rate of 48.5%, followed by Haryana (36.1%) and Puducherry (34.9%). Delhi, Rajasthan and Karnataka have a positivity rate of 29.9% each. Further, Chhattisgarh and Madhya Pradesh have a positivity rate of 27.9% each.

Telugu playback singer G Anand passed away on Thursday evening due to COVID-19 at the age of 67. Mourning his demise, actor Chiranjeevi said, "I'm shocked...I've danced for...first time on...big screen for a song sung by him, and it...established an unconditional bond with him." He added, "His demise is a sad thing that stays with me for a long time."

The Centre on Thursday issued guidelines to facilitate expeditious COVID-19 vaccination of aviation personnel working in government as well as private entities. A dedicated vaccination facility will be established by the airport operators in their respective airports to facilitate expeditious vaccination of staff, the guidelines issued by the Civil Aviation Ministry stated.

Some Delhi lawyers have written to the Bar Council of Delhi seeking ?1 crore assistance for legal practitioners facing financial difficulties amid COVID-19 lockdown. The letter states that advocates are facing financial issues due to suspension of cases in courts. Notably, the Delhi High Court and subordinate courts are hearing only urgent matters filed in 2021 amid rising COVID-19 cases.

The Delhi Government on Friday announced that it will organise a COVID-19 vaccination drive for all the media houses-electronic, digital and print, in the national capital. It added that the vaccination drive will be conducted at the offices of media houses and the Delhi government will bear its cost. Delhi recorded 19,832 fresh COVID-19 cases in the last 24 hours.

A lion at Uttar Pradesh?s Etawah Safari Park tested positive for COVID-19, days after eight Asiatic lions in Hyderabad were found infected with the virus. In Etawah, samples of 14 Asiatic lions were sent for testing, one tested positive, another was considered as a suspected case and 12 tested negative. It?s believed that the lions got infected through their caretakers.

West Bengal government issued an advisory to train passengers to carry negative RT-PCR test report for a test conducted within 72 hours of train departure, Central Railway said. Passengers travelling by train are advised to follow COVID-19 norms, it added. This comes after ICMR said that the need for RT-PCR tests for healthy people travelling in India may be removed.

Vivek Yadav, an ex-Rajasthan leg-spinner and a member of their Ranji Trophy-winning squad, passed away due to COVID-19 aged 36. Yadav was undergoing treatment for cancer and had gone to the hospital for his chemotherapy, where he was tested and returned positive for COVID-19. "A dear friend...May his soul RIP. Thoughts...with the family," ex-India opener Aakash Chopra tweeted.

The Health Ministry on Friday named 15 states/UTs where single-day rise in COVID-19 cases are decreasing or plateauing. They include Maharashtra, Uttar Pradesh, Delhi, Rajasthan, Chhattisgarh, Gujarat, Madhya Pradesh, Telangana, Jharkhand, Goa, Chandigarh, Daman and Diu, Ladakh, Lakshadweep and Andaman and Nicobar Islands. India reported over 4.14 lakh new cases in the last 24 hours.

Jharkhand CM Hemant Soren took to Twitter to take a dig at Prime Minister Narendra Modi over his call with several Chief Ministers. Soren wrote, "The respected Prime Minister called. He just spoke his mind. It would've been better if he would've talked business and listened about work." PM Modi on Thursday spoke to several CMs regarding the COVID-19 situation.

Self-styled godman Asaram Bapu, who had tested positive for COVID-19, has been put on a ventilator after his condition deteriorated. On Wednesday, Asaram was shifted to a hospital in Jodhpur after he complained of breathing problems. Asaram is currently lodged at Jodhpur Central Jail after his conviction and sentencing in a rape case.

Actress Shilpa Shetty shared that her family has tested positive for COVID-19. "The last 10 days have been difficult for us...My parents-in-law tested positive for COVID-19, followed by [daughter] Samisha, [son] Viaan-Raj, my mom and lastly, [husband] Raj," she wrote. Shilpa added they've been in isolation in their rooms while further saying that her test result came back negative.

Sensex gained 256 points to close at 49,206.47 while Nifty breached the 14,800-mark on Friday. Top gainers on Sensex included Bajaj Finserv, Mahindra & Mahindra and NTPC while Bajaj Auto, Bajaj Finance and Infosys were the top drags. This is the third day in a row that domestic benchmark posted gains, despite another record surge in COVID-19 cases in India.

Germany's Health Minister Jens Spahn said the third wave of the COVID-19 in the country "appears to be broken". Spahn's comments came as the head of government's Robert Koch Institute, Lothar Wieler, said the incidence of COVID-19 infections was falling across all age groups. Spahn cited social distancing measures and accelerating vaccination campaign as the reasons for lower infection rates.

RR's Chris Morris has revealed when they heard players started testing COVID-19 positive inside the bubble, everyone started asking questions. "By Monday...when they postponed KKR-RCB match. we knew IPL was under pressure to continue," he said. Morris added, "I was chatting to...team doctor...and Kumar Sangakkara...came around...and drew his finger across his throat...then we knew it was over."

PM Narendra Modi-led government told the Supreme Court that the country's people have given their mandate to it twice and it understands people's suffering due to COVID-19. The Modi government rebutted the Delhi government's accusation that oxygen allocation is being done arbitrarily. The Supreme Court was also told that the Delhi government has made it a "Centre versus Delhi fight".

Actress Rasika Dugal was on Thursday administered the first dose of the COVID-19 vaccine in Mumbai. She took to Instagram to share a picture of herself from a vaccination centre. She wrote, "And finally I'm 18! First jab done...Please register yourself if you haven't yet." "For the first time this week, I felt hopeful...the most desirable side effect," she added.

Maharashtra on Thursday reported 62,194 new COVID-19 cases, a jump from the 57,640 cases the state recorded in the previous 24-hour period. Mumbai's daily caseload fell to 3,028, down from over 3,800 cases the state's capital recorded a day ago. With 853 more COVID-19 deaths in Maharashtra in the last 24 hours, the state's COVID-19 death toll has reached 73,515.

Odisha CM Naveen Patnaik on Thursday wrote to Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman urging her to exempt GST on the purchase of COVID-19 vaccines. "The states have been asked to purchase vaccines out of their own resources to cover the 18 to 45 years age group. These purchases attract GST, making the vaccines costly for the state," he wrote.

Ex-Bihar CM Lalu Prasad Yadav will chair a virtual meeting over the COVID-19 situation in the state with RJD MLAs on May 9, said a party statement. The meeting will also be attended by his son and Leader of Opposition in the Bihar Assembly, Tejashwi Yadav. The meeting comes days after Lalu was granted bail by the Jharkhand High Court.

Supreme Court on Thursday asked Centre to prepare for third COVID-19 wave. "The third surge...which is around the corner according to experts will affect children...When a child goes to hospital, [parents] will also have to go," said court. "Vaccination will have to be over for this group of people. We need to plan for this in...scientific way," it added.

American biotechnology company Moderna has raised its 2021 sales forecast for its COVID-19 vaccine by 4.3% to $19.2 billion. Moderna's CEO Stephane Bancel said the company could sign more deals with countries for vaccine's supply in 2022 than in 2021. Earlier this week, Pfizer also raised full-year sales forecast for the COVID-19 vaccine it developed with BioNTech to $26 billion.

CSK batting coach Michael Hussey and bowling coach L Balaji, who were diagnosed with COVID-19, have been flown into the city from Delhi in an air ambulance, a franchise official said. "We have better contacts here and we wanted to ensure better medical facilities in case of any need," the official said. The duo are asymptomatic, he added.

Kerala on Thursday reported 42,464 fresh COVID-19 cases in the highest single-day count so far for the state, pushing the case tally to 17,86,396. Sixty-three more patients succumbed to the infection, taking the state's COVID-19 death toll to 5,628. The state government said 27,152 patients were cured of the infection, taking the number of recoveries to 13.89 lakh.

Five companies of police force have been deployed in Patna to implement the lockdown strictly to curb the spread of COVID-19 in Bihar, said Additional Director General of Police, Jitendra Kumar, on Thursday. He also informed that necessary steps are being taken to tackle the black marketing of COVID-19 medicines. The state is in a lockdown till May 15.

Infosys has committed additional ?100 crore for COVID-19 relief efforts in India. Some of the amount will be used to add hospital beds and augment the supply of oxygen concentrators, ventilators and to provide ration to migrant labourers and families impacted by the lockdowns. Infosys had committed ?100 crore last year, including contribution towards the PM-CARES fund.

WHO Director-General Tedros Adhanom Ghebreyesus called it a "monumental moment" in the fight against COVID-19 as the US announced to support waiving intellectual property protections for COVID-19 vaccines. He tweeted, "The White House support for the temporary waiving IP on COVID-19 vaccines reflects the wisdom and moral leadership of the US to support #VaccinEquity and work to end this pandemic."

Russia has authorised the one-shot Sputnik Light version of its COVID-19 vaccine Sputnik V for use, Russian Direct Investment Fund (RDIF) said. "The...vaccine demonstrated 79.4% efficacy according to analysed data taken from 28 days after...injection was administered as part of Russia's mass vaccination programme between 5 December 2020 and 15 April 2021," said RDIF. It costs under $10 a dose.

Russia authorised a single-dose version of Sputnik V coronavirus vaccine called 'Sputnik Light', which demonstrated 79.4% efficacy compared to 91.6% for the two-shot Sputnik V. Sputnik Light has proven effective against all new strains of coronavirus, Russia said. The Sputnik Light claims to have developed virus-neutralising antibodies in 91.67% of volunteers on the 28th-day post immunisation.

According to the government, a person getting COVID-19 vaccination should be asked if he/she ever had an allergic reaction to a vaccine and their medical conditions listed as precautions by vaccine manufacturer should be assessed. He/she should be observed for 15-30 minutes after vaccination. In case of unexpected or severe reactions, medical supervisor of vaccination centre should be informed.

India Women cricketer Veda Krishnamurthy's sister Vatsala Shivakumar passed away aged 45 due to COVID-19 at a private hospital in Chikkamagaluru on Wednesday night. Their mother Cheluvamba had succumbed to the infection at the age of 63 on April 22. As many as four members of their family tested positive for the infection.

Marathi actor Navnath Gaikwad has passed away due to COVID-19 infection. Filmmaker Digpal Lanjekar, who worked with the late actor in films 'Fatteshikast' and 'Farzand', shared the news on social media. "Navnath Gaikwad, a very talented and hardworking artist who worked in 'Farzand' and 'Fatteshikast', passed away tragically due to coronavirus. May his soul rest in peace," he wrote.

PM Narendra Modi held a comprehensive review meeting on the COVID-19 situation and was briefed about 12 states with over one lakh active cases, an official statement said. PM Modi reviewed the availability of medicines and was briefed about the rapid increase in production of medicines like Remdesivir. Union Ministers Amit Shah and Harsh Vardhan among others attended the meeting.

Haryana Police has temporarily deployed 440 sport utility vehicles (SUVs) for free transportation of COVID-19 patients. This comes amid reports of shortage and complaints of overcharging by private ambulances. The SUVs will be called COV-HOTS (COVID-19 Hospital Transport Service). DGP Manoj Yadava said that each police district will get 20 Toyota Innova SUVs for this purpose.

Philippine President Rodrigo Duterte has ordered police to arrest anyone not wearing a mask properly, including below the nose, amid surging coronavirus infections. Duterte said, "It's not for me, it's not for us. It's for...interest of the country so you won't infect and you won't be infected." Mask violators could reportedly be held for up to 12 hours without charge.

Former Madhya Pradesh CM and Congress leader Kamal Nath on Thursday demanded ?4 lakh assistance from the state government for families of those who died due to COVID-19. He said that the COVID-19 situation in the state was "scary". He added, "Fatalities due to COVID-19 should also be treated as deaths due to natural calamity."

Shares of COVID-19 vaccine makers plunged after the US backed a proposal to waive intellectual property rights for COVID-19 vaccines. Pfizer, Moderna, Novavax and BioNTech were down between 4% and 10% in US trading on Thursday. "You cannot go hire people who know how to make the mRNA. Those people don't exist," Moderna CEO St?phane Bancel said.

The Sputnik Light COVID-19 vaccine, which was authorised for use by Russia on Thursday, will be produced in several countries including India in the coming months, the vaccine's developers said. Sputnik Light, the single-shot version of Sputnik V vaccine, demonstrated 79.4% efficacy. "Sputnik V will be the core vaccine while Sputnik Light will be cheaper and more affordable," Russia said.

With a surge in the COVID-19 cases, actor Suniel Shetty criticised the government's inefficiency in dealing with COVID-19 second wave. "Every politician, who is coming onto the seat is thinking of the next five years, and how they will make money," Suniel said. "We're the ones who elected them. [Today], they made us run for beds [and] oxygen," he added.

Spain's Health Minister Carolina Darias has confirmed the country has detected 11 cases of the new variant of the coronavirus first identified in India. Darias stated that health officials recognised two separate outbreaks among the 11 cases, bearing similarities to India's COVID-19 variant. Meanwhile, China has detected at least 18 cases of India's "double mutant" COVID-19 variant in the country.

US President Joe Biden believes that social media platforms have a responsibility to stop amplifying untrustworthy content, the White House said. It added that platforms shouldn't amplify misinformation, especially related to COVID-19, vaccinations, and elections. Further, the White House refused to comment on Facebook Oversight Board's decision to uphold ban on former President Donald Trump.

European Commission President Ursula von der Leyen said that the European Union is ready to discuss a proposal, now backed by the US, to waive intellectual property rights for COVID-19 vaccines. "Our priority is to ramp up production to achieve global vaccination," she added. India and South Africa had made the proposal at the World Trade Organization (WTO) in October.

Rajasthan Chief Minister Ashok Gehlot on Thursday said that a national lockdown is the only option left as it can help in breaking the chain of COVID-19 transmission if it's planned properly. "For more than one year, our doctors and medical staff have been performing under excessive workload for the nation. We have lost many of them," Gehlot added.

Fitch Solutions said that the resurgence of COVID-19 cases has exposed cracks in India's healthcare system. However, it added that the actual impact on the Indian economy is likely to be less severe in comparison to June quarter of last fiscal due to the localised nature of restrictions. The company has forecast India's real GDP to grow 9.5% in 2021-22.

Delhi on Thursday recorded 19,133 new coronavirus cases and 335 deaths, taking the caseload and the death toll to 12,73,035 and 18,398 respectively, according to the health department's bulletin. Moreover, the National Capital's positivity rate dropped to 24.29% from around 30% on Monday and around 27% and 26% on Tuesday and Wednesday, respectively.

PM Narendra Modi on Thursday said vaccination should be facilitated for citizens despite lockdowns. He added that healthcare staff engaged in inoculation mustn't be diverted elsewhere. Several states including Delhi, Maharashtra and Kerala have announced COVID-19 related restrictions. The Principal Scientific Adviser to the PM on Wednesday had said the third wave of COVID-19 was inevitable.

Several companies in India have been offering extra holidays to employees to de-stress amid the COVID-19 pandemic. Godrej Properties sent its employees on leave from May 5-10, saying that it's "taking a pause to heal". PwC and Deloitte India created a "holiday pool" that employees can use to avail leaves. Meanwhile, food delivery platform Swiggy transitioned to a four-day workweek.

The Prime Minister's Office (PMO) on Thursday said that Prime Minister Narendra Modi was briefed that around 31% of eligible population over the age of 45 years has been given at least one dose of the COVID-19 vaccine. "He was informed that around 17.7 crore vaccines have been supplied to the states," the PMO added.

Maldives said a night curfew will be imposed from Thursday amid surge in coronavirus cases. The announcement came after government data showed daily COVID-19 cases in Maldives grew to 734 from 318 a week ago. "The numbers are very high. If we're not able to significantly lower these numbers, we're going to face very difficult days," spokesman Mabrook Azeez said.

Goa CM Pramod Sawant declared that the working journalists of the state have been included in the group of frontline workers and will be vaccinated against COVID-19 on priority. Central government employees, state government employees, employees of banking institutions and workers engaged in the provision of telecommunication among others have also been added to the list of frontline workers.

Madhya Pradesh government on Thursday announced that COVID-19 'junta curfew' has been extended till May 15. "To break the chain of transmission of corona in the state we have to completely shut everything," CM Shivraj Singh Chouhan said. "Weddings are super spreader events. I urge all public representatives to motivate people to not hold weddings in May," he added.

As many as 3,980 deaths due to coronavirus were reported in India in the last 24 hours. Ten states/UTs account for 76% of the new deaths. Maharashtra reported the most number of deaths (920) in the last 24 hours, followed by Uttar Pradesh (353), Karnataka (346), Delhi (311) and Chhattisgarh (253).

The Centre for Cellular and Molecular Biology (CCMB) has said there is no unique Andhra COVID-19 strain which is 15 times more virulent. Neither were any existing strains found to be more infectious than what we already saw before, it added. The CCMB further said that the N440K variant in Andhra is likely to be replaced by another variant.

The Centre on Thursday said that 89.31 lakh COVID-19 vaccine doses are available with states/UTs in the country. It stated that Haryana has 7,07,417 doses, Rajasthan has 2,62,805 doses, Madhya Pradesh has 5,70,133 and Maharashtra has 5,98,055. Meanwhile, Karnataka has 5,06,578 doses, Delhi 3,37,122, Uttar Pradesh 9,93,843, Bihar has 5,33,859, Jharkhand 4,90,043 and Telangana has 4,38,832 doses.

As many as 3,29,113 COVID-19 recoveries were registered in India in the last 24 hours. Ten states/UTs account for 74.71% of the new recoveries. The most number of recoveries were reported in Maharashtra (57,006), followed by Uttar Pradesh (40,852) and Karnataka (26,841). Kerala and Tamil Nadu also reported more than 20,000 recoveries each in the last 24 hours.

As many as 4,12,262  coronavirus cases were reported in India in the last 24 hours, marking the world's biggest daily rise in cases. Out of these, 72% new cases are from ten states, which are Maharashtra, Karnataka, Kerala, Uttar Pradesh, Tamil Nadu, Andhra Pradesh, Delhi, West Bengal, Rajasthan and Haryana. The total cases in the country stand at 2,10,77,410.

Actress Sriprada, who worked in both Bollywood and Bhojpuri films, passed away on Wednesday due to COVID-19 complications. Cine & TV Artistes' Association (CINTAA) General Secretary Amit Behl confirmed the news and said, "It's very unfortunate that we have lost a very senior actress." Sriprada was seen in films like 'Dharam Sankat', 'Reshma', 'Sholay Aur Toofan' and others.

More than 89 lakh COVID-19 vaccine doses are still available with the states and union territories (UTs) and over 28 lakh vaccine doses will be received by them within the next three days, the Union Health Ministry said on Thursday. The Centre has so far provided more than 17.15 crore (17,15,42,410) vaccine doses to states and UTs free of cost.

Nepal will suspend all international flights from May 6 midnight until May 14 amid rising coronavirus cases in the country. Earlier this week, the Nepal government had suspended all domestic flights until the same duration. The country has also placed 42 districts of its 77 districts into lockdown to combat COVID-19 spread. Nepal has reported over 3.5 lakh COVID-19 cases.

The Bihar government on Thursday suspended leaves of all police officials and employees in the state in view of the COVID-19 crisis. In an official notification issued by Bihar Police Headquarters, police officials have been instructed to monitor lockdown strictly throughout the state. Bihar is under lockdown till May 15.

China has "indefinitely" suspended all activity under a China-Australia Strategic Economic Dialogue, its state economic planner said. China has accused Australia of taking steps "to disrupt normal exchanges" due to a "Cold War mindset and ideological discrimination." It comes amid a rift between the two nations since Australia called for an independent investigation into the origins of COVID-19.

The Uttarakhand government has asked drug inspectors to constantly monitor the sale and supply of Remdesivir injections amid a surge in COVID-19 cases. It also instructed them to act against those found hoarding or overcharging for Remdesivir. The order, issued by Secretary Pankaj Kumar Pandey, also asks them to ensure that the QR code is pasted on each Remdesivir pack.

Mumbai Mayor Kishori Pednekar on Thursday said that the current coronavirus-related death rate in the city is lower compared to the previous year. She added that a war room has also been created to monitor the COVID-19 situation in the city. "We are informing people about the availability of hospital beds through the war room," Pednekar further said.

Special COVID-19 vaccination drive at housing societies in Pimpri Chinchwad came to a halt on Thursday due to a shortage of doses. Sanjiwan Sangale, Secretary of the Chikhali Moshi Housing Society Federation Limited said that the drive will restart when enough doses are available. In April, the Housing Societies Federation had coordinated with the PCMC to conduct such drives.

Actor Pandu, known for his comedy roles in Tamil films, passed away aged 74 on Thursday due to coronavirus. He was undergoing treatment at a private hospital in Chennai after testing positive for the virus. Notably, Pandu had designed the 'two leaves' symbol and the flag of the AIADMK. Pandu's wife, who had also tested positive, is currently in ICU.

The US has backed an initiative at the World Trade Organization (WTO) to waive intellectual property protections for coronavirus vaccines. India and South Africa had proposed the move, which they said would increase vaccine production around the world. US Trade Representative Katherine Tai said that "extraordinary times call for extraordinary measures".

Paytm chief Vijay Shekhar Sharma said that Paytm is going to launch a new tool for its users to find COVID-19 vaccine slots. Sharma said that users will be able to receive alerts "when new slots open up for their locality". Over 4.12 lakh new COVID-19 cases were reported in India and 3,980 died in the last 24 hours.

Actress Abhilasha Patil, who appeared in Marathi and Hindi films, has passed away due to COVID-19 complications. Apart from Hindi films 'Chhichhore', 'Badrinath Ki Dulhania' and 'Good Newwz', Patil was also known for her work in Marathi movies. Several Marathi actors mourned the demise of Patil, who is survived by her husband and son.

Mumbai's BKC Jumbo COVID-19 vaccination center Dean Dr. Rajesh Dhere on Thursday said, "As per the information given to us, today we have to vaccinate 500 people between 18 to 44 years of age who have pre-registered and have been allotted confirmed slots." Yesterday, a large crowd thronged the BKC jumbo vaccination centre, according to the civic officials.

The US support for waiving patents of COVID-19 vaccines has important implications for India as doing away with patents will pave the way for cheaper versions of the vaccines and also scale up production. According to The Indian Express, if India's proposal to waive patents was accepted at WTO last year, it could have prevented vaccine shortages in the country.

Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman on Wednesday said multilateral institutions, like Asian Development Bank (ADB), need to help developing countries to prevent the COVID-19 health crisis from turning into a "full-blown economic crisis". Speaking at a meeting of ADB, FM underlined the need for an "inclusive" global strategy to avoid the long-term impact of the pandemic on developing economies.

Union Minister for External Affairs S Jaishankar on Wednesday said that vaccines are the "only lasting solution" to COVID-19 at the G7 Foreign Ministers' meeting. "A global answer will require diversified production, uninterrupted supply chains and generous resourcing. India will do its part," he added. "Geopolitical changes have been accelerated by COVID-19-related trends," Jaishankar stated.

Spice Money has launched a dedicated assistance initiative to help India's rural population register for the COVID-19 vaccine through its Spice Money Adhikari network covering 95% of rural pin codes. The company will also help spread awareness to its banking correspondent partners about priority vaccination available to them, while dispelling myths about the vaccine in these smaller communities.

The Kerala police is investigating a church event, which was attended by over 350 priests and deacons, conducted in Kerala last month that flouted COVID-19 norms. The event was held at the Munnar CSI retreat centre. Around 110 priests belonging to the CSI Church have been infected with the virus, and two priests died after they attended the retreat.

The UK strain of coronavirus is currently dominating parts of North India while the double mutant variant is found mostly in Maharashtra, Karnataka and Gujarat, Director of the National Centre for Disease Control (NCDC) Sujeet Singh has said. He added the B.1.1.7 lineage of SARS-CoV-2 (UK variant) is declining in proportion across the country in the last 1.5 months.

Uttarakhand government has allotted ?100 crore from the Chief Minister's relief fund for COVID-19 vaccination of beneficiaries between 18-44 years of age. Additional Secretary to the state government Arunendra Singh Chauhan informed the Director-General of Medical Health and Family Welfare about the allocation in a letter. Uttarakhand reported 7,783 COVID-19 cases in the last 24 hours.

China has confirmed at least 18 cases of India's "double mutant" COVID-19 variant. Three cases were detected in Chinese nationals who worked in Noida and returned home last month, the Center for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) Weekly report stated. They had stayed in a hotel in Nepal for two days before flying to China on April 21, it added.

Data from primary market tracker Prime Database revealed that Indian companies have filed draft red herring prospectuses (DRHPs) for nine IPOs to raise a total of $2.66 billion (approx ?19,660 crore) since April 1. While the primary market has slowed down due to COVID-19, bankers say companies are filing DRHPs so they are ready when the second wave passes.

Deputy Chief Minister of Karnataka Dr Ashwathnarayan CN has said that COVID-19 test reports in the state will be given within seven hours. "Earlier, it used to take 72 hours to get results after the samples reached the laboratory. Now, this has been reduced to seven hours. This would enable early detection of the infection," Ashwathnarayan explained.

Rashtriya Lok Dal (RLD) chief and former Union minister Ajit Singh passed away due to COVID-19 at the age of 82. He was undergoing treatment at a hospital in Gurugram after testing positive for the virus. He was the son of former Prime Minister Chaudhary Charan Singh and was a multiple-time MP from Uttar Pradesh's Baghpat.

During a press briefing on COVID-19 situation in India, Principal Scientific Advisor to Centre K VijayRaghavan talked about the second wave that the country is witnessing. "Such a much larger second wave with the ferocity we are seeing was not predicted," he said. "New variants will arise all over the world...but variants that increase transmission will likely plateau," he added.

A report by Azim Premji University said that the Centre will need to provide a relief package worth ?8 lakh crore to alleviate the economic hardships faced by lower-income groups due to COVID-19. The report estimated that 23 crore Indians have fallen below the national minimum wage poverty line and 1.5 crore people remained jobless at the end of 2020.

PayPal Holdings Inc reported its strongest first quarter on record as more and more people are using digital means for payments and transaction during the ongoing COVID-19 pandemic. "Our strong first quarter results demonstrate sustained momentum in our business as the world shifts into the digital economy," CEO Dan Schulman said. PayPal processed $285 billion in payments in first quarter.

Sri Lanka on Thursday announced that all arrivals from India will be banned with immediate effect as India reported world's highest-ever daily coronavirus cases on Thursday. As many as 4,12,262 new coronavirus cases were reported in the country. India also reported 3,980 deaths in the last 24 hours, the biggest one-day jump in deaths since the pandemic began.

The Kerala government has announced that the state will go into a lockdown from 6 am on May 8 to May 16. This comes after Kerala reported more than 40,000 daily coronavirus cases for the first time on Wednesday. Kerala currently has 3,76,004 active coronavirus cases, as per the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare.

Biocon Founder Kiran Mazumdar-Shaw said that the second COVID-19 wave has hit India "like a tsunami". "The unfortunate part is it hasn't spared any part of our country...Both urban India and more frighteningly...rural India...has also got infected," she added during a virtual panel discussion. "If India isn't safe, I can tell you the world isn't safe," she further said.

West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee on Thursday raised questions about the PM-CARES fund and said that she has not received a reply from PM Narendra Modi on the issue of free vaccination. "Why are they not allotting ?30,000 crore for vaccines when they are making new Parliament and statues, and spending ?20,000 crore," Banerjee said.

As many as 4,12,262 new coronavirus cases were reported, the highest-ever one-day rise for any country since the pandemic began. Further, 3,980 deaths due to coronavirus were reported in India in the last 24 hours, the country's biggest one-day jump since the pandemic began. With this, the death toll due to coronavirus in the country has risen to 2,30,168.

A brother-sister duo, aged 23 and 25, stayed in their car with their COVID-19 positive mother for days before finding a bed for her in UP's Lucknow, the family said. They came to Lucknow from Lakhimpur Kheri for their mother's dialysis but hospital refused the treatment after she tested positive. They also put her on oxygen support in the car.

Actor Annup Sonii, who got vaccinated against coronavirus last month, said, "Somewhere down the line, we've to trust...doctors and people who invented this vaccine." "There are people who've been in human trials, who opted to be the guinea pigs initially," he added. "I was sure I'd to do this and the moment it started, I said let's...do it," said Annup.

Vasanthabalan has been admitted to a hospital in Chennai after testing positive for coronavirus. The filmmaker, known for films like 'Veyyil', 'Angadi Theru' and 'Aravaan', took to social media on Tuesday to share the news. "I am surrounded by friends, doctors, relatives who love me and are the strength of a thousand elephants," Vasanthabalan further wrote.

The government has named the districts that have been showing continuous rise in COVID-19 cases for two weeks. They include Karnataka's Bengaluru and Mysuru, Tamil Nadu's Chennai and Kerala's Kozhikode, Ernakulam, Thrissur, Malappuram, Kottayam and Alappuzha. It also names Satara and Solapur in Maharashtra, Haryana's Gurugram, Bihar's Patna, Andhra Pradesh's Chittoor and Uttarakhand's Dehradun.

Government on Wednesday released a list of states/UTs that are seeing an increasing trend in daily COVID-19 cases. These include- Karnataka, Kerala, Tamil Nadu, Andhra Pradesh, West Bengal, Rajasthan, Bihar, Haryana, Odisha, Punjab, Uttarakhand, Jammu & Kashmir, Assam, Himachal Pradesh and Goa. "It's necessary that we continue to focus on containing the spread of infection," said an official.

Government has named states/UTs that are seeing a plateauing/ decrease in daily COVID-19 cases. These are- Maharashtra, Uttar Pradesh, Delhi, Chhattisgarh, Gujarat, Madhya Pradesh, Telangana, Jharkhand, Daman & Diu, Ladakh, Lakshadweep and Andaman & Nicobar. "However, it is important to remember that laxity for even one day can take us in direction of further spread of disease," said an official.

Actor Pulkit Samrat on Wednesday received his first dose of COVID-19 vaccine. He shared the news on Instagram and wrote, "This is our best form of defence. Be safe." Meanwhile, actress Radhika Madan too got her first dose of COVID-19 vaccine on Wednesday. "I urge everyone to get themselves registered and get their shot," she wrote on Instagram.

Maharashtra on Wednesday reported 920 COVID-19 deaths in the biggest single-day increase in deaths for the state, taking the state's death toll to 72,662. The state also reported 57,640 fresh COVID-19 positive cases and 57,006 discharges during the period. Mumbai saw 3,882 new COVID-19 cases, taking the state's total active cases to 6,41,596.

The government today released state-wise distribution of coronavirus cases after India recorded over 3.5 lakh coronavirus cases for eight days in a row. There are 12 states/UTs with over 5.5 lakh total cases. Maharashtra is on top of the list with 48,22,902 total coronavirus cases. There are 12 states/UTs each which currently have 01-60,000 and 60,001-5,50,000 total confirmed coronavirus cases.

Actor Zain Imam's cousin Syed Taqi Imam recently passed away due to coronavirus. The actor shared the news of his demise on Tuesday and said that the industry has lost a "great writer, poet, speaker, a gentle and humble human being". Zain also thanked Sonu Sood, Boman Irani, producer Dipti Kalwani and others for helping the family during the crisis.

As many as 12 states in India have more than one lakh active coronavirus cases. The states are Maharashtra, Karnataka, Kerala, Uttar Pradesh, Rajasthan, Andhra Pradesh, Gujarat, Tamil Nadu, Chhattisgarh, West Bengal, Bihar and Haraya. Maharashtra has the most number of active cases at 6,44,068, followed by Karnataka (4,64,383). India has 34,87,229 active coronavirus cases currently.

Kerala CM Pinarayi Vijayan on Wednesday said that the state has reported the highest single-day rise of 41,953 new COVID19 cases and 58 deaths. "Active cases stand at 3,75,658 in the state, 23,106 recovered. Total 13,62,363 patients recovered so far, while 5,565 deaths have been reported till now," he added.

India reported 3,780 coronavirus deaths on Wednesday, the biggest one-day jump since the pandemic began. Ten states/UTs accounted for 74.97% of the new deaths. Maharashtra saw the maximum casualties (891). Uttar Pradesh follows Maharashtra with 351 daily deaths. Chhattisgarh, Karnataka also reported more than 200 deaths in the last 24 hours.

Pooja Hegde has tested negative for coronavirus. The actress, who contracted the virus last week, shared the news on Wednesday and wrote, "Thank you for all the love you all have sent my way." "I've recovered well, kicked stupid corona's butt and finally tested NEGATIVE," Pooja said, adding, "All your wishes and healing energy seemed to have done its magic."

COVID-19 cases in Delhi rose again after dropping for three straight days as 19,953 people tested positive in the national capital in a day as per the May 4 update. As many as 338 new deaths were also reported. A total of 12,32,942 coronavirus cases have been reported in Delhi so far, out of which 90,419 are active.

Canada has authorised the use of Pfizer COVID-19 vaccine for use in children from the age of 12 to 15, Canadian health officials said on Wednesday. "The department determined...this vaccine is safe and effective when used in younger age group," Supriya Sharma, Chief Medical Advisor at Health Canada, said. It's the first vaccine to be approved for children in Canada.

The world's oldest person, a 118-year-old Japanese woman, has pulled out of the torch relay for Tokyo 2020 Olympics over COVID-19 fears, an official said on Wednesday. Kane Tanaka was due to take part in the event in Japan's Fukuoka on May 11. The Olympic torch relay, which started in March, has been hit by a coronavirus outbreak.

Describing COVID-19 relief materials coming to India as "aid" is not accurate as it's friendship, External Affairs Minister Dr S Jaishankar has said. "COVID-19 is a shared problem for the world. When it came to medicines, we gave hydroxychloroquine to US, Singapore and European countries. We gave vaccines to some countries. A global pandemic requires a global effort," Jaishankar added.

Union Minister Jitendra Singh on Wednesday said that India's recoveries from the COVID-19 infections are steadily improving. According to the Union Health Ministry, India's recovery rate now stands at 81.91%. Over 2.26 lakh Indians have died due to COVID-19 since the outbreak last year. India reported over 3.82 lakh new COVID-19 cases in the last 24 hours.

The Himachal Pradesh government will pay the fourth and fifth year MBBS students, contractual doctors and junior and senior residents an incentive of ?3,000 per month for COVID-19 duty. Besides, nursing students, contractual laboratory staff and GNM third year students will be given ?1,500 per month for COVID-19 duties at medical college and hospitals.

US President Joe Biden said America is helping India "significantly" in its fight against second COVID-19 wave. "I spoke to PM Modi. What he needs most is the material and the parts to be able to have his machines that can make the vaccine work. We're sending him that," he added. "We're sending them oxygen...[and] a lot of...precursors," Biden said.

The central government has said that spending of Corporate Social Responsibility (CSR) funds directly or through the pooling of resources for creating health infrastructure for COVID-19 care are eligible CSR activities. The establishment of medical oxygen generation and storage plants, and manufacturing of oxygen concentrators, would also be considered as CSR activities, it clarified.

India accounted for 46% of the new COVID-19 cases recorded worldwide last week and one in four deaths, the WHO said. Worldwide, 57 lakh new cases were reported last week and more than 93,000 deaths, the WHO said in its weekly report. India reported nearly 26 lakh new cases, a 20% increase on the previous week, and 23,231 deaths.

Karnataka on Wednesday reported 50,112 new COVID-19 positive cases in the biggest single-day spike of cases the state has witnessed. Bengaluru Urban accounted for 23,106 of the new positive cases of COVID-19. The state also witnessed 26,841 recoveries and 346 deaths in the last 24 hours.

Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal on Wednesday said that vaccination has started in government and private sectors, but the national capital needs more supply of vaccine doses. Kejriwal said, "The only problem is that we need...vaccine on large scale...[we've] received very few doses." "[We] can vaccinate whole Delhi in three weeks. We can achieve...target if we receive sufficient doses," Kejriwal added.

The district administration in Uttarakhand's Chamoli has imposed a curfew till May 9 in view of a spike in COVID-19 cases. Shops selling essentials will remain open till 2 pm while pharmacies will be open throughout the day, said District Magistrate Swati Bhadauria. Earlier, curfew was imposed in Dehradun, Haridwar and Udham Singh Nagar till 5 am on May 6.

Amid surging COVID-19 cases, the Jharkhand government said that all migrant workers returning to the state will undergo Rapid Antigen Test on arrival. As per guidelines, those migrant workers who test negative will be quarantined for seven days in institutional quarantine facilities. The workers who will test positive will be managed as per Department of Health and Family Welfare protocols.

External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar responded to criticism over political campaigns amid rising COVID-19 cases. "When a pandemic hits hard there are arguments...We're a democratic country, you don't stop elections in a place like India," he said. "The only time we stopped elections was...some decades ago, where none of us really want to be associated with that...memory," Jaishankar added.

Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman said that the resurgence of the COVID-19 pandemic has adversely impacted India's nascent economic recovery process. "The resurgence...caused suffering for very large number of persons [and] [has] put the healthcare system under huge strain," she said. She added that inequality aggravated in 2020 and around 78 million people were pushed back into extreme poverty.

Reacting to reports that the Indian delegation to the G7 meeting is self-isolating after two officials tested positive for COVID-19, Shiv Sena leader Priyanka Chaturvedi said MEA has landed in an "embarrassing situation". She added that MEA officials went to UK to "change the narrative", but with someone in the delegation testing positive, "the narrative about GoI is set globally".

Himachal Pradesh government has decided to impose 'Corona curfew' from May 6 to May 16 amid COVID-19 pandemic. During this period, all offices will remain closed and only essential services will be allowed, it stated. It also announced that Class 10 exams have been cancelled in the state. Moreover, negative COVID-19 report is mandatory for people coming to the state.

BJP leader and Rajya Sabha MP Subramanian Swamy on Wednesday suggested that Prime Minister Narendra Modi should make Union Minister Nitin Gadkari in charge of the COVID-19 management amid the second wave of the virus in the country. "We could face one more wave that targets children unless strict precautions now are taken...Relying on PMO is useless," he tweeted.

Dismissing fewer tests as the reason behind the dip in the number of COVID-19 cases in Maharashtra, state Health Minister Rajesh Tope said 15 districts including Mumbai, Nashik and Nagpur are seeing a decline in the number of daily cases. However, in and around 20 districts including Sangli, Satara, Buldhana and Kolhapur, the cases are still on the rise.

Hours after being sworn in as the West Bengal CM for the third consecutive term, Mamata Banerjee wrote to PM Narendra Modi and urged him to allow free COVID-19 vaccination to all. She also requested him to ensure availability of Remdesivir and Tocilizumab. "At least 10,000 doses of Remdesivir...1,000 vials of Tocilizumab is daily requirement of our state," she added.

Infosys Co-founder Nandan Nilekani has extended help to revamp the computer software for bed allocation for COVID-19 patients in Bengaluru, BJP MP Tejasvi Surya said. "Lots of gratitude to him for putting very best tech architects on the job immediately," he added. On Tuesday, Surya had raised issues of alleged irregularities in BBMP's bed booking system for COVID-19 patients.

Travel agencies in Thailand are selling COVID-19 vaccine tours to the United States. The packages are priced at $2,400-$6,400 for trips to San Francisco, Los Angeles and New York, with prices depending on the time gap between doses, according to a Bangkok tour operator. The travel agencies are also offering similar tours to Russia for up to $6,700.

Meghalaya CM Conrad K Sangma has announced free COVID-19 vaccination for all above the age of 18. "The govt of Meghalaya has paid the vaccination cost to the manufacturing company for 42,000 vaccines which will reach Meghalaya in few days," the CM tweeted.
