Deputy CM Prestone Tynsong stated that the government has paid ?1.26 crore for the doses.

Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal visited the COVID-19 vaccination centre at Radha Soami Satsang Beas in the Rajinder Nagar area. He said, "The vaccination has started in both government and private sectors, but we need more supply of vaccine dosages." The Chief Minister added that there is a shortage of oxygen but the city is getting support from all sides.

A survey across 40,000 households within the Greater Hyderabad Municipal Corporation (GHMC) limits found 1,487 people suffering from fever and COVID-19 related symptoms. The door-to-door survey was carried out by 641 teams across 30 circles within the corporation limits over two days. The survey was carried out as per the directions of the state government.

Global head of equity strategy at Jefferies, Christopher Wood, has advised those foreign investors to invest in India who missed the chance to invest in India when the markets tumbled before an unprecedented rebound in 2020. Wood's advice comes at a time when the Indian markets are witnessing record outflow of foreign funds owing to the surge in COVID-19 cases.

Professor K VijayRaghavan, the Principal Scientific Adviser to the Centre, on Wednesday said, "(COVID-19) variants are transmitted the same as original strain. It doesn't have properties of new kinds of transmission." He further explained, "It infects humans in a manner that makes it more transmissible as it gains entry, makes more copies and goes on, same as the original."

Seychelles, which has fully vaccinated more of its population against COVID-19 than any other country, has closed schools and cancelled sporting activities for two weeks. The move to reintroduce COVID-19 curbs, similar to those last imposed at the end of 2020, came after the infections surged. "The COVID-19 situation in our country is critical right now," Seychelles Health Minister said.

IndiGo on Wednesday said that it has airlifted 2,717 oxygen concentrators from Thailand, China, Qatar, Hong Kong and Singapore to India amid the second wave of COVID-19 in the country. The airline further said that it has transported 1,425 oxygen concentrators domestically between 36 airports. A massive load of other medical supplies have also been flown, it added.

During press briefing on COVID-19 situation in India, Principal Scientific Adviser to the Centre K VijayRaghavan on Wednesday said, "A phase three (of COVID-19 wave) is inevitable, given the higher levels of circulating virus." He added that it is however not clear on what time scale this wave will occur, stating, "We should prepare for new waves."

Congress leader P Chidambaram on Wednesday accused the PM Narendra Modi-led central government of lying on the oxygen shortage in the country amid the ongoing COVID-19 pandemic. Chidambaram tweeted, "Government is maintaining the lie that there is no shortage of oxygen...Everyday, there are true life stories of hundreds of people desperately trying to find oxygen cylinders for their...dear ones."

In view of the surging COVID-19 cases in the country, the Election Commission of India has decided to defer bypolls in three Parliamentary constituencies and eight Assembly constituencies. The Parliamentary constituencies are Dadra and Nagar Haveli, Khandwa, Mandi and the eight Assembly constituencies are Kalka, Ellenabad, Vallabhnagar, Sindgi, Rajabala, Mawryngkneng, Fatehpur and Badvel.

Maharashtra CM Uddhav Thackeray on Wednesday said that the experts have warned about the third wave of COVID-19 and urged people to not let their guards down. He added that the state has been preparing for the wave for the past month. Thackeray further said that the administration is keeping a close tab on the districts where cases are increasing.

Centre has so far provided over 17.02 crore COVID-19 vaccine doses to states/UTs free of cost, and of this, the total consumption including wastage is over 16 crore doses. More than 94.47 lakh vaccine doses are still available with states/UTs, government said. UP has the most number of vaccines left, followed by Maharashtra, Madhya Pradesh, Bihar, Haryana and Jharkhand.

The Pimpri-Chinchwad Municipal Corporation (PCMC) has appointed surveillance squads to keep a watch on COVID-19 patients who are in home isolation. The surveillance squads have been appointed at eight zonal office-levels and will include PMPML workers and civic teachers. In all, over 500 employees will be part of the squads. The number of home isolation patients is around 13,000-15,000.

Two COVID-19 patients died in Bengaluru's Arka Hospital on Tuesday allegedly due to shortage of oxygen, the hospital management said. Dr Manju Adithya, director of the hospital, stated that an SOS call was raised on Monday night but the hospital could only arrange 15 cylinders. Both the patients died during the time of low oxygen stock, Adithya added.

Kerala CM Pinarayi Vijayan on Wednesday wrote to Centre seeking 50 lakh doses of Covishield and 25 lakh Covaxin doses amid rising COVID-19 cases in the state. "In order to augment the storage, we require at least 1,000 tonnes of imported Liquid Medical Oxygen (LMO)," he added. Vijayan also sought PSA plants, oxygen concentrators and ventilators on a priority basis.

Radhika Madan on Wednesday took to Instagram to share that she has received the first dose of the COVID-19 vaccine. The 26-year-old actress shared a picture of herself getting vaccinated and urged people to get themselves registered for the same. Radhika also asked people to wear double masks and maintain social distancing at the vaccination centres.

The US said it'd soon begin to vaccinate low-risk teens amid rising COVID-19 cases around the world. Pfizer-BioNTech in March said their vaccine was found to be safe, effective in a trial in 12-to-15-year-olds. We're ready to start vaccinations as soon as US Food and Drug Administration grants emergency use authorisation to Pfizer's vaccine for adolescents, President Joe Biden said.

Senior Congress leader Kapil Sibal said the way Centre showed negligence regarding the second wave of COVID-19 and went ahead with political rallies and Kumbh is an example of how such a pandemic should not be handled. "The Prime Minister should come in front of the country and apologise," he added.

US President Joe Biden has launched a new vaccination goal to deliver at least one shot of COVID-19 vaccine to 70% of adults by July 4, Independence Day. "This is your choice: It's life and death," Biden said from the White House. He also called for states to make vaccines available on a walk-in basis.

Ministry of Railways said that 146 COVID-19 patients have been admitted in its isolation coaches out of which 80 patients have been discharged and 66 are getting treated. "At some locations...authorities have also provided new logistical solutions like supported ramps on stair-cases," Railways stated. It deployed nearly 4,000 isolation coaches with almost 64,000 beds amid rising COVID-19 cases.

With a surge in the COVID-19 cases, actor Amitabh Bachchan took to Twitter and urged everyone to follow all the safety protocols. He wrote, "Prayers for early recovery of those suffering from coronavirus, prayers for those who...have been free from COVID-19...stay safe, follow the rules [and] be disciplined!" Amitabh was earlier diagnosed with COVID-19 in July 2020.

Actor Sonu Sood along with his team saved the lives of at least 22 COVID-19 patients. The team on Monday provided oxygen cylinders to Arka hospital in Bengaluru from where they had received an SOS call. "Had there been...delay...families would've lost their close ones...I want to thank everyone who helped in saving so many lives last night," Sonu said.

The RBI has reopened a one-time debt restructuring scheme for individuals, small businesses and MSMEs amid the second COVID-19 wave in India. The scheme will be available to borrowers who have aggregate dues of up to ?25 crore and whose accounts are classified as 'standard' as of March 31. Borrowers who availed restructuring under previous restructuring frameworks won't be eligible.

Odisha CM Naveen Patnaik on Tuesday announced that all the accredited journalists in the state will be administered the COVID-19 vaccine on priority. "Working journalists in the state are performing their duty in the critical juncture of COVID-19 pandemic," the official order stated. This comes after Patnaik declared all working journalists of the state as frontline COVID-19 warriors.

The Centre has so far provided 17,02,42,410 COVID-19 vaccine doses to the states and union territories, free of cost and over 36 lakh doses will be received by them in the next three days, the Union Health Ministry said on Wednesday. The ministry further said, 94,47,614 lakh doses are still available with the states and union territories to be administered.

Pfizer has said it expects global sales of its COVID-19 vaccine to hit $26 billion in 2021, over 70% higher than its earlier forecast. Pfizer expects to deliver 1.6 billion doses this year under contracts signed as of mid-April, with half the profits going to its German partner BioNTech. Pfizer believes there may be robust COVID-19 vaccine demand for years.

Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) received a fresh stock of one lakh COVID-19 vaccine doses on Tuesday night and it will resume vaccination of people above 45 years at BMC's and government vaccination centres, said BMC. Amid a shortage of vaccines, BMC had on Sunday said that vaccination for those aged 45 years and above will be closed on Monday.

PM Narendra Modi on Wednesday praised the Kerala government's efforts in reducing vaccine wastage. "Good to see our...nurses set an example in reducing vaccine wastage," the PM tweeted quoting Kerala CM Pinarayi Vijayan's tweet. "Kerala...received 73,38,806 doses of vaccine...We've provided 74,26,164 doses, even making use of...extra dose available as wastage factor in each vial," Vijayan tweeted.

The total doses of coronavirus vaccines administered in Karnataka crossed 1 crore-mark on Wednesday, the state's Health Minister Dr K Sudhakar said.  "We have received 1,05,49,970 doses from Centre and the state government has procured 3 lakh doses," he added. "Vaccine is the biggest weapon to defeat pandemic. We are leaving no stone unturned to vaccinate all," Sudhakar further said.

As many as 19 states/UTs have a weekly COVID-19 positivity rate higher than the national average of 21.46%. The states/UTs are Madhya Pradesh, Andhra Pradesh, Chandigarh, Himachal Pradesh, Jammu and Kashmir, Karnataka, Maharashtra, Kerala, Arunachal Pradesh, Chhattisgarh, Puducherry, Haryana, Delhi, West Bengal, Nagaland, Dadra and Nagar Haveli and Daman and Diu, Goa, Sikkim and Rajasthan.

Around 25 states/UTs have imposed lockdown or lockdown-like restrictions amid the second wave of coronavirus. Delhi has been under lockdown since April 19. Haryana is under a seven-day long lockdown from May 3. Bihar imposed a lockdown from May 4 till May 15. Odisha is under a 14-day lockdown till May 19. Rajasthan has imposed lockdown-like restrictions till May 17.

As many 3,780 deaths due to coronavirus were reported in India in the last 24 hours, the biggest one-day jump since the pandemic began. With this, the death toll due to coronavirus in the country has risen to 2,26,188. Further, as many as 3,82,315 new coronavirus cases were reported, taking the total number of cases to 2,06,65,148.

West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee today announced fresh restrictions in the state amid the second coronavirus wave. She said that only 50% attendance will be allowed in state government offices. She added that local trains will be suspended from tomorrow. "All markets, retailers, standalone shops to function from 7am to 10am and later from 5pm to 7pm only," she stated.

India Ratings and Research (Ind-Ra) has said the recovery of domestic and international air travel will be delayed by three and six months respectively, due to the sharp increase in active COVID-19 cases in India. The ratings agency also identified higher fuel expenses, rising competition intensity and possible pressure on airline yields as causes for delayed recovery.

Five COVID-19 patients died at a hospital in Roorkee in Uttarakhand's Haridwar district due to shortage of oxygen. One of the patients who died was on ventilator support while four others were on oxygen beds, a doctor said. A magisterial probe has been ordered into the incident, Haridwar District Magistrate C Ravishankar said on Wednesday.

A total of 14 crew members of a cargo ship that sailed to Durban from India have tested COVID-19 positive, South Africa's Transnet National Ports Authority said. "The vessel is currently in quarantine, as per COVID-19 regulations. No one is allowed to leave or enter the vessel," the authority said. All operations with the vessel have been suspended.

Uttar Pradesh government has decided to extend the partial 'corona curfew' till 7 am on May 10, said Navneet Sehgal, Additional Chief Secretary, Information. The state has 2,72,568 active COVID-19 cases. Uttar Pradesh has reported 13,798 COVID-19 deaths, while 10,81,817 people have been cured/discharged/migrated so far.

As many as 25 Delhi policemen have died of COVID-19 in 55 days and over 4,200 tested positive since March 11, 2021, Times Now reported. The maximum cases at 441 have been reported from the PCR unit, the report added. In one year till March 10, at least 7,724 Delhi policemen had tested positive and 34 had died.

India's entire delegation to the G7 summit in London is self-isolating after two of its members tested positive for COVID-19, British government said on Wednesday. External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar didn't test positive for the virus, British media said. Jaishankar also tweeted, "As a measure of abundant caution...I decided to conduct my engagements in the virtual mode."

A team at the Indian Institute of Science (IISc) in Bangalore used a mathematical model to predict that COVID-19 deaths will cross 4 lakh in the country by June 11 if current trends continue. India has reported over 2 lakh COVID-19 deaths so far, while active cases in India stand at 34,87,229, according to Ministry of Health and Family Welfare.

Hiring activity in India saw a 15% decline in April 2021 compared to March due to the impact of the second COVID-19 wave, according to Naukri JobSpeak. However, the current impact on the job market is less severe than what we saw in April 2020 as there's no strict nationwide lockdown, Pawan Goyal, Chief Business Officer, Naukri.com said.

RBI Governor Shaktikanta Das said that he has faith in India's ability to come out of the COVID-19 crisis. He added that localised and targeted containment measures are enabling businesses and households to adapt and the effect on aggregate demand is expected to be moderate in comparison to 2020. Normal monsoon forecast should help contain food price inflation, he added.

Activities in India's services sector dropped to a three-month low in April, due to the sharp rise of COVID-19 cases in the country. As per analytics firm IHS Markit's data, the Purchasing Managers? Index (PMI) for services sector declined to 54 in April from 54.6 in March. A figure above 50 means expansion while a sub-50 score signals contraction.

SunRisers Hyderabad wicketkeeper-batsman Wriddhiman Saha and Delhi Capitals leg-spinner Amit Mishra have tested positive for coronavirus, as per reports. Both SRH and DC teams have gone into quarantine. Earlier, Kolkata Knight Riders spinner Varun Chakaravarthy and fast bowler Sandeep Warrier had tested positive for the virus which led to yesterday's RCB-KKR match to be rescheduled.

Stressing that there cannot be anymore vaccine nationalism, Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman on Monday said that countries will have to be open about sharing technologies on COVID-19 vaccines. "The Trade-Related Aspects of Intellectual Property Rights (TRIPS) agreement will have to be looked at in the context of the pandemic," she said while addressing the Asian Development Bank's annual meet.

The Centre for Monitoring Indian Economy (CMIE) said the second wave of COVID-19 and localised lockdowns imposed to curb its spread have impacted 75 lakh jobs, pushing the unemployment rate up to a four-month high. India's unemployment rate touched 7.97% in April, as compared to 6.5% in March this year, as per the Centre's proprietary data.

Former RBI Governor Raghuram Rajan has said that India's overwhelming surge of COVID-19 cases revealed complacency after last year's first wave, as well as a "lack of foresight, a lack of leadership". "Anybody paying attention to what was happening in the rest of the world...should have recognised the virus does come back and potentially in more virulent forms," Rajan added.

Following a request from the UK, samples of the double-mutant Indian variant of coronavirus are being sent to London for studies on the effectiveness of the existing vaccines against it, said Rakesh Mishra, former director of the Centre for Cellular and Molecular Biology. "We're sending some isolates from here, and they are sending a few of their own," he added.

Actor Nawazuddin Siddiqui has returned to his hometown, Budhana, to be with his family after shooting for two films amid the pandemic. Nawazuddin said, "Things are...tough right now, I'm not sure when I'll return to Mumbai." "Every day, I'm just praying that everything gets back to normal, things improve for the country and that everyone starts working," he added.

Serum Institute of India will invest ?240 million (?2,460 crore) in the UK to expand its vaccine business and set up a new sales office. This is part of a ?1 billion UK-India trade partnership that'll create over 6,500 jobs, the UK government said. SII has already started Phase 1 trial in the UK of a one-dose nasal COVID-19 vaccine.

India has reported 3,57,229 new COVID-19 cases and 3,449 more deaths in the last 24 hours, as per the Union Health Ministry. With this, the total number of cases in India reached 2,02,82,833, while the death toll has surged to 2,22,408. Further, there are as many as 34,47,133 active COVID-19 cases in the country.

Cricket reporter Ruchir Mishra passed away due to coronavirus at the age of 42. Ruchir worked for a national daily in Nagpur. Punjab Kings batting coach Wasim Jaffer condoled his demise, tweeting, "Don't want to believe what I have just heard. Ruchir Mishra is no more. This is just so sad. He was one of the nicest journalist from Nagpur."

Kuwait's government has announced that it will ban unvaccinated residents from travelling abroad from May 22 in an effort to curb the spread of COVID-19. The announcement comes after the government announced that the distribution of the second dose of the COVID-19 vaccines will be delayed due to supply shortages. Kuwait has already banned the entry of expatriates.

Punjab CM Captain Amarinder Singh took to Twitter to reveal coronavirus vaccine stocks in the state stand depleted at less than 50,000. "Centre's allocation for May 1-15 is only six lakh doses (40,000 a day)," he added. He further wrote, "I request...Health Minister Harsh Vardhan...to urgently review and enhance Punjab's allocation given the high incidence of COVID-19 in the state."

Maharashtra Health Minister Rajesh Tope on Tuesday said 15 districts, including Mumbai and Thane, are showing a decline in cases of coronavirus. Dhule, Nanded, Bhandara, Nashik, Latur, Nandurbar, Nagpur, Aurangabad, Amravati, Raigad, Osmanabad, Chandrapur and Gondia are also seeing a decline in cases, Tope said. Maharashtra on Tuesday recorded 51,880 new COVID-19 cases and 891 more deaths.

The IPL has rescheduled CSK-RR match slated for Wednesday after CSK bowling coach Lakshmipathy Balaji tested positive for coronavirus.  CSK has informed the organisers that the squad has gone into a week-long quarantine from Monday. It's the second match to be rescheduled after Monday's RCB-KKR match was postponed after the two KKR players tested positive for the virus.

West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee said, "I am just a street fighter. I can boost up people so that we can fight against BJP. One cannot do everything alone. I think all together we can fight the battle for 2024 [Lok Sabha polls]. Let's fight COVID-19 first." Banerjee said that combating COVID-19 is one of her top priorities now.

Congress leader Rahul Gandhi on Tuesday stated that imposing a full lockdown is the only way to stop the spread of COVID-19 in the country. "GOI doesn?t get it. The only way to stop the spread of Corona now is a full lockdown-with the protection of NYAY for the vulnerable sections. GOI?s inaction is killing many innocent people," Rahul tweeted.

Serum Institute of India (SII) CEO Adar Poonawalla has said that 11 crore COVID-19 vaccine doses will be supplied to state governments and private hospitals in India in the next few months. This is in addition to the 11 crore doses that will be supplied to the Centre, for which it has received full advance payment of ?1,732.5 crore.

Pfizer has said that it told the Indian government there was no concern over the safety of its COVID-19 vaccine. "Pfizer's application for emergency use authorisation was supported with data that shows an overall efficacy rate of 95%," a spokesperson said. The company, which withdrew its application in February, is holding fresh talks with India for an "expedited approval pathway".

Bihar Chief Minister Nitish Kumar took to Twitter to announce a lockdown in the state till May 15. He added that the decision was taken after his meeting with the state ministers and officials. He further said that he has instructed Crisis management group to issue detailed guidelines today. There are 1,07,668 active COVID-19 cases in the state.

The Indian Premier League (IPL) 2021 has been suspended indefinitely, BCCI Vice President Rajeev Shukla told ANI. This comes after several players across the eight teams tested positive for coronavirus. As per reports, the IPL 2021 could be later moved to Mumbai and resume after all the players complete their hard quarantine.

Actress Deepika Padukone's father and former badminton player Prakash Padukone has been hospitalised in Bengaluru after testing positive for coronavirus. His friend Vimal Kumar told PTI that Prakash is doing better and is expected to be discharged from the hospital in two-three days. He also said that Prakash's wife Ujjala and second daughter Anisha also tested positive.

The parents of a two-month-old baby who tested positive for coronavirus after its death at a Jammu hospital abandoned the baby's body there and fled, officials said on Monday. SMGS Hospital Medical Superintendent Dr Dara Singh said the baby had congenital heart disease. Its parents were asked to undergo COVID-19 tests but they left without the baby's body, Singh said.

After Mini Mathur shared a message seeking medicines for a person, a troll wrote, "Heard your husband (Kabir Khan) has become bankrupt due to investment in '83'. Is it true?" Mini responded, "Use your extra time to help someone in distress please." The film, starring Ranveer Singh, was supposed to release last year but was delayed due to coronavirus pandemic.

Calling the ongoing coronavirus pandemic in India the "darkest hour" for the country, actress Nia Sharma said, "Everything is a mess yet everyone is trying to do their bit." She added, "This is a world crisis and the world knows about what is happening in India. I have stopped using Instagram because the situation is so overwhelming."

The National Testing Agency (NTA) today announced that after the April session, the JEE (Main) 2021 May session is also being postponed amid the COVID-19 situation in the country. It added that the rescheduling of April and May sessions will be done subsequently. It further said that the registration for the May session will also be announced later.

Philanthropist Melinda Gates in an interview with the Financial Times said wealthy nations don't need to vaccinate down to their teen populations before they start sharing doses with low-income countries. Gates suggested governments pick an age range between 20 and 30 years before they start making vaccine donations. She further called on wealthy nations to stop "hoarding" coronavirus vaccines.

The coronavirus positivity rate in Maharashtra has come down from 27% to 22%, the state's Health Minister Rajesh Tope said. "From 63,000, (daily) tally for COVID-19 patients has come down to 61,000," said Tope, adding, "At 84.07%, our recovery rate is highest in the country." He said that 2.8 lakh people were being tested for COVID-19 in Maharashtra daily.

According to WHO's updated guidelines, there's possibility of airborne transmission of COVID-19. "Current evidence suggests...virus spreads mainly between people in close contact, typically within 1 metre (short-range)," said WHO. "[It] can also spread in poorly ventilated...indoor settings...This is because aerosols remain suspended in air or travel farther than 1 metre (long-range)," WHO added.

The real estate sector will be significantly impacted by the second wave of COVID-19 as home sales are expected to fall 25-30% in the April-June quarter, as per real estate research company Liases Foras. A Knight Frank India report found that the second wave together with rollback of the stamp duty cut hit property registrations in Mumbai in April.

Several developing countries, apart from India, have reported a surge in coronavirus cases in the last few weeks. Among India's neighbours, Bhutan and Nepal have reported a significant rise in infections. Laos saw a 22,000% case surge last month as compared to the month before, while for Nepal and Thailand, the case rise was over 1,000% on a month-on-month basis.

IPL chairman Brijesh Patel has said that the BCCI will "find a way" to arrange for the return of overseas players after the tournament was suspended. BCCI in its official statement had also stated that all players would return home with their families. SRH wicketkeeper-batsman Wriddhiman Saha and DC leg-spinner Amit Mishra tested positive for coronavirus on Tuesday.

Actor Aly Goni has revealed that his mother, sister and her children have tested positive for coronavirus. He took to Twitter on Tuesday to share the news. Aly wrote, "I understand how it feels like if your family members have tested positive...most of [my] family members are positive from last nine days...they're fighter the way they're fighting...this virus."

Taking to Instagram, Telugu actor Allu Arjun shared an update about his health after testing positive for coronavirus. He said he's doing well with "very mild symptoms". "Recovering well and nothing to worry. I'm still in quarantine," he added. "Thank you so much for all the love you've been showing and...prayers you've been sending my way. Gratitude," he further wrote.

Actress Pia Bajpiee on Tuesday informed that she has lost her brother due to COVID-19. She tweeted the news of his death only hours after she appealed for a ventilator bed for him in the Farrukhabad district of Uttar Pradesh. "I need urgent help...my brother is dying...we are already in mess," Pia wrote at around 7 am.

Iraq's Health Minister Hassan al-Tamimi stepped down from his post on Tuesday over a fire that killed more than 80 people at a COVID-19 hospital in Baghdad last month. Tamimi's resignation comes after the government on Tuesday lifted the suspension imposed on him immediately after the hospital fire. The fire was caused by an oxygen tank explosion.

A drive-in coronavirus vaccination site has been opened at Ashoka Hotel in Madhya Pradesh's Bhopal. The site which formerly served as a drive-in cinema allows people to get vaccinated while maintaining social distancing. The hotel's manager said that the vaccination site is open between 5pm to 8pm and online registration on CoWIN website or Aarogya Setu app is mandatory.

The Kerala High Court on Tuesday directed the state government to step in to control overcharging by private hospitals during the COVID-19 pandemic period. "We intend to take this with some seriousness. The government will have to come out with some policy," said the court adding that it will hear the matter on May 6.

Uttar Pradesh CM Yogi Adityanath on Monday urged the sportspersons in the state to become the mental support and strength for people and the society to overcome the COVID-19 pandemic. "In a pandemic, no amount of resource is enough...And who are accustomed to taking on challenges in life better than sportspersons?" Adityanath said while virtually interacting with sportspersons across UP.

Mukesh Ambani-led Reliance Industries (RIL) on Monday decided to give its over 2 lakh employees their entire performance-linked bonuses for 2020-2021. This comes after the company on Friday reported a 35% growth in net profit at ?53,739 crore for 2020-21 amid the COVID-19 pandemic. In April 2020, the company had announced pay cuts, which were reversed six months later.

India's COVID-19 cases reached 2,02,82,833 with 3,57,229 new cases, the third straight day that daily cases have seen a decline. Chandigarh (45,196) and Manipur (32,523) are among states/UTs with 1-60,000 confirmed cases. States with 60,001-5,50,000 cases include Haryana (5,27,773) and Telangana (4,63,361). Maharashtra (47,71,022) and Karnataka (16,46,303) are among states with 5,50,000+ cases.

Coronavirus has been detected in Asiatic lions in India for the first time as eight lions housed at Nehru Zoological Park in Hyderabad tested positive for the virus. "They've been isolated and are responding well to treatment, behaving and eating normally," the Ministry of Environment, Forest and Climate Change said. It added that the zoo has been closed to visitors.

Punjab Health Minister Balbir Singh Sidhu said COVID-19 has started spreading to rural areas and it will increase problems for the state. He added that people from Delhi and other states are shifting to Punjab which is the main reason for rising cases in the state. "PM Narendra Modi has failed to fulfil his promises on the vaccine," he added.

Congress General Secretary Priyanka Gandhi Vadra on Tuesday said that it'd be "better" if the government put its resources in "saving people's lives, instead of spending ?13,000 crore for constructing PM's new house" as people are struggling with oxygen and vaccine shortages, among others. She made these remarks while referring to Central Vista revamp project, which includes PM's new residence.

Nepal PM KP Sharma Oli has urged neighbouring countries and foreign organisations to supply vaccines to the nation amid a rise in COVID-19 cases. Nepal needs at least 1.6 million AstraZeneca's COVID-19 vaccine doses to administer second shots to people, said an official. Nepal suspended its vaccination programme after failing to secure fresh supplies from India and China, Reuters reported.

Amid the shortage of COVID-19 vaccines, the Odisha government will prioritise beneficiaries who are waiting to take their second dose and has asked district authorities to plan sessions accordingly. If vaccine remains available after catering to the second dose beneficiaries, it should be used for the first dose of left out frontline workers and healthcare workers, the state government said.

The Patna High Court on Tuesday expressed anguish over the Bihar government's handling of the pandemic. It said that it may give the responsibility of COVID-19 management to Army. "The court will fail in its duty if necessary orders aren't passed in larger public interest to ensure the right of life to the people in the state," the court added.

Assam government issued revised COVID-19 guidelines which shall come into force from 5 am on May 5 and remain in force until further orders. All shops, commercial establishments and offices shall shut down at 2 pm. No meeting/ gathering at any open or closed spaces shall be allowed. For marriages, only religious part will be allowed with maximum 20 people.

In view of the COVID-19 situation, the Assam government on Tuesday postponed class 10 and 12 state board exams until further orders. Exams for both the standards were scheduled to begin from May 11 onward and have now been deferred. The revised schedule for class 10 exams will be announced after consultation with Assam Health Department, a government order said.

Ten states/UTs account for 73% of the 3,449 new COVID-19 deaths in India. Maharashtra reported the most number of deaths (567), followed by Delhi (448), Uttar Pradesh (285), Chhattisgarh (266) and Karnataka (239). Ten states/UTs, including Maharashtra (59,500), Uttar Pradesh (38,687), Karnataka (20,901), Delhi (20,293) and Kerala (19,519), constituted 73% of 3,20,289 recoveries in last 24 hours.

Poland said that travellers from Brazil, India and South Africa will have to undergo mandatory quarantine on their arrival. The total number of cases of the Indian COVID-19 variant rose to 16 in Poland, Polish Health Minister Adam Niedzielski said. These cases include two cases in the family of a Polish diplomat who had returned from India, he added.

The Congress in Bihar has criticised the state government's handling of the COVID-19 pandemic. It alleged that the Bihar government was unable to draw its quota of oxygen allotted by the Centre. "This often led to a serious crisis of oxygen for patients admitted in hospitals," said Bihar Pradesh Congress Committee chief Madan Mohan Jha.

The UP government on Tuesday announced free and priority COVID-19 vaccination for media professionals like journalists. The state's CM Yogi Adityanath has said that separate inoculation centres should be made for them and their family members aged above 18 years must also be vaccinated for free, ANI reported, quoting the UP Chief Minister's office.

The Indian Council of Medical Research (ICMR) on Tuesday issued an advisory to "optimise" RT-PCR testing and increase the availability of testing amid a surge in COVID-19 cases. "The need of RT-PCR test [for] healthy individuals undertaking inter-state domestic travel may be completely removed," said ICMR. All asymptomatic domestic travellers must follow COVID-19 appropriate behaviours, it added.

Samajwadi Party chief Akhilesh Yadav on Tuesday said that the Uttar Pradesh government's "lie" that there is no COVID-19 spread in villages is proving to be "very deadly" for the rural areas. "When there is a shortage of fever medicines in villages and tehsils, we cannot expect availability of oxygen, [COVID-19] beds or vaccines," Akhilesh said in a tweet.

Farhan Akhtar has shared a statement informing that the release of his upcoming film 'Toofaan' has been delayed due to the surge in COVID-19 cases in the country. "Our focus is completely on...pandemic and on supporting our employees...and in helping the wider community," the statement read. The sports-drama film was supposed to stream on an OTT platform from May 21.

TMC leader Derek O'Brien on Tuesday took a dig at Prime Minister Narendra Modi over his telephonic conversation with West Bengal Governor Jagdeep Dhankhar over post-poll violence in the state. "PM makes a call to West Bengal Governor on 'political violence'. (Exaggerated 214%) Stop the stunts, Mr Prime Minister. Work the phones on COVID-19," tweeted the TMC leader.

PM Narendra Modi and his British counterpart Boris Johnson adopted the 'Roadmap 2030' for elevating India-UK relations at a virtual summit on Tuesday. The two nations also launched the 'Enhanced Trade Partnership' by setting a target of more than doubling trade by 2030. The two leaders discussed the COVID-19 situation and the successful partnership on vaccines, an official statement said.

The Indian Air Force (IAF) said in a statement that it will set up a 100-bed COVID-19 treatment centre at Air Force Station Jalahalli in Bengaluru. The first 20 beds at the facility will be operational with oxygen concentrators only from May 6 and the rest by May 20. The facility will be manned by Command Hospital Air Force Bangalore.

A banner claiming that free food was arranged by Yelahanka MLA SR Vishwanath for people attending funerals of COVID-19 patients at a Bengaluru crematorium was removed after its pictures went viral online. The hoarding also featured photos of PM Narendra Modi and CM BS Yediyurappa. MLA Vishwanath apologised for the incident and said he was not aware of the banner.

Mahindra & Mahindra (M&M) said that it has advanced the annual maintenance plant shutdown of its automotive division from June to May due to the COVID-19 situation in the country. "The company has scaled up its efforts to ensure health and safety of its employees, associates and supporting ecosystem," it added. The scheduled maintenance will span for four working days.

The fifth in a series of consignments carrying 545 oxygen concentrators arrived from the United States on Tuesday, as part of COVID-19 assistance. "Appreciate the support from the US," Arindam Bagchi, MEA Spokesperson, tweeted. The US Department of Defense said the final two flights of COVID-19 aid slated for India have been delayed and will reach at least until Wednesday.

A Sub-Divisional Magistrate posted in Uttar Pradesh's Bareilly district died in an air ambulance while he was being taken to Delhi for treatment, officials said. Prashant Kumar was undergoing treatment at a private medical college in Bareilly after he developed COVID-19 symptoms three to four days ago, they added. According to officials, Kumar's condition deteriorated on Monday.

The Supreme Court on Sunday said that the Centre and the state governments may consider imposing a lockdown to curb coronavirus in the second wave in the interest of public welfare. The court also said, "We would seriously urge the central and state governments to consider imposing a ban on mass gatherings and super spreader events."

Speaking about television actress Rubina Dilaik testing positive for COVID-19, her husband Abhinav Shukla said, "Rubina is in isolation at her home in Shimla." He added, "There's no point in me going there. No one will be able to meet her right now...Panicking doesn't help anyone, we have to be well informed about how to handle it."

Celebrity chef Guy Fieri said that Amazon Founder and CEO Jeff Bezos didn't contribute to his COVID-19 emergency relief fund for food workers. In an interview with The Hollywood Reporter, Fieri said he drafted personal emails to CEOs of major corporations, including Bezos. Various companies gave huge sums of money, he said, adding, "Jeff, by the way, didn't help us."

Nepal's PM KP Sharma Oli on Monday appealed to other countries for COVID-19 vaccines, diagnostic equipment, oxygen and other supplies to help the country fight the pandemic. "Despite our utmost efforts, the second wave of COVID-19 has hit Nepal severely," he added. In an effort to curb the spread of COVID-19, Nepal will suspend domestic and international flights this week.

The WHO-led COVAX global vaccine equity programme said it has signed an agreement to buy 50 crore doses of Moderna's COVID-19 vaccine. Moderna is scheduled to supply 3.4 crore doses in 2021 and the remaining 46.6 crore doses will be delivered in 2022. The COVAX facility ensures access to COVID-19 vaccines in poor countries, with the cost covered by donors.

The leaders of 13 Opposition parties including Sonia Gandhi, HD Deve Gowda, Sharad Pawar and Mamata Banerjee have penned a joint statement, asking the Centre to launch a free mass vaccination drive across India in view of the "uncontrollable surge" of COVID-19 cases. They wrote, "The budgetary allocation of ?35,000 crore for the vaccination programme must be utilised for this."

Denmark on Monday said that it has dropped the Johnson & Johnson COVID-19 vaccine from its inoculation programme citing "a possible link between rare but severe cases of blood clots". This comes after Denmark stopped using the Oxford-AstraZeneca COVID-19 vaccine last month. Following this, Denmark will rely on COVID-19 vaccines developed by Pfizer and Moderna for its vaccination drive.

DMK chief MK Stalin on Sunday thanked the people of Tamil Nadu after his party-led alliance won the Assembly polls. "We will gradually fulfill our specific election promises. We are going to hold the swearing-in ceremony in a simple manner because the impact of COVID-19 is high. I will announce the date tomorrow or the day after tomorrow." said Stalin.

Venezuelan Health Minister Carlos Alvarado said that the clinical trials of the Cuban coronavirus vaccine candidate Abdala will begin this month. Venezuela's national vaccine laboratory will simultaneously make the vaccine with an aim to produce doses for 40 lakh people, he added. Cuba is currently carrying out late-stage trials of Abdala that will be completed in July.

RSS affiliate Swadeshi Jagran Manch (SJM) has asked the Centre to take immediate steps to increase the production of COVID-19 vaccines by allowing more companies to manufacture them. "The country needs nearly 195 crore doses to cover at least 70% of the population. This cannot be fulfilled by the two companies alone," SJM said in a statement.

Maharashtra's daily COVID-19 case count fell below the 50,000-mark on Monday as the state recorded 48,621 new COVID-19 positive cases in the last 24 hours. The state also witnessed 59,500 discharges and 567 deaths, taking the total death toll to 70,851. Mumbai reported 2,662 new positive cases during the period.

Doordarshan's former Director-General Archana Datta has said her mother and husband died of COVID-19 without receiving treatment within an hour of each other. "We failed to have access to all top-notch Delhi hospitals we used to visit! Yes, after death they (were) declared COVID-19 positive," she tweeted. The rest of her family, except her son, has also tested positive.

The Union Social Justice and Empowerment Minister Thawarchand Gehlot's daughter Yogita Solanki died in MP's Indore on Monday while undergoing treatment for COVID-19. Solanki was undergoing treatment for the last one week and infection had spread to 80% of her lungs, the hospital's Medical Director said. She died after suffering a heart attack, a statement from Gehlot's office said.

Congress leader Rahul Gandhi criticised the Centre saying that a "policy paralysed" Government of India cannot secure victory over coronavirus. "Face it. Don't fake it," Rahul tweeted. Along with the tweet, Rahul tagged a news clipping reading "Centre yet to place fresh [COVID-19] vaccine order." Earlier, Rahul stated that no other country in the world had such "high-cost" vaccines.

Maharashtra Minister of State for Home Shambhuraj Desai on Monday urged Serum Institute of India (SII) CEO Adar Poonawalla to file a written complaint against those who allegedly threatened him over the increasing demand for COVID-19 vaccines. Desai has also asked Poonawalla to name the accused and has vowed to take strict action against the culprits.

All government and private universities in Uttarakhand will remain closed till further orders in view of the rising COVID-19 cases. However, online classes will continue, said MM Semwal, Joint Secretary, Higher Education. The state government had last month announced the closure of education institutes till April 30 due to the COVID-19 situation.

The government has exempted basic customs duty and health cess on imports of Remdesivir injection, inflammatory diagnostic kits, API and Beta Cyclodextrin, till October 31. The duty was also removed from medical grade oxygen, oxygen concentrators and COVID-19 vaccines till July 31. Earlier, Centre slashed Integrated GST on import of oxygen concentrators for personal use to 12% from 28%.

Supreme Court has questioned Centre over differential pricing of COVID-19 vaccines for Centre and states. "The manner in which the current policy has been framed would prima facie result in a detriment to the right to public health," the court said. It added, "Centre should consider revisiting its policy to ensure it withstands the scrutiny of Articles 14 and 21."

The third phase of COVID-19 vaccination drive began in Delhi on Monday. Deputy CM Manish Sisodia, who visited a vaccination centre in Vinod Nagar said, "Vaccination has started at 76 Delhi government schools today. With this, vaccination has begun at 301 centres for 18-45 age group." He added, "We've given appointment to 45,150 people today. We hope for 100% turnout."

India has reported a dip in new COVID-19 cases with 3,68,147 cases and 3,417 deaths in the last 24 hours. With this, the total number of cases has reached 1,99,25,604, while the death toll has surged to 2,18,959. As many as 3,00,732 people were discharged in the last 24 hours, taking the total number of recoveries to 1,62,93,003.

The Union Health Ministry on Monday said additional 60 lakh vaccine doses will be received by states and Union Territories in the next three days. It added that the Centre has so far provided nearly 16.54 crore doses to states and UTs for free. "More than 75 lakh vaccine doses are still available with the states/Union Territories," the ministry added.

Serum Institute of India CEO Adar Poonawalla has told the Financial Times that India's COVID-19 vaccine shortage would continue till July, when production is expected to increase from about 60-70 million doses a month to 100 million. Poonawalla added the authorities did not expect to confront a second wave of COVID-19 back in January when new coronavirus cases had declined.

The IPL has rescheduled KKR-RCB match slated for tonight after two KKR players tested COVID-19 positive. Varun Chakaravarthy and Sandeep Warrier were found to be positive in third round of testing in last four days, the IPL said. KKR have moved towards a daily testing routine to identify any other possible cases and treat them at the earliest, it added.

Serum Institute of India's (SII) CEO Adar Poonawalla spoke about the COVID-19 vaccine shortage in India and told the Financial Times, "I've been victimised very unfairly and wrongly." He added, "There were no orders, we did not think we needed to make more than one billion (100 crore) doses a year." Poonawalla expects the shortage will likely continue through July.

Pfizer CEO Albert Bourla has said that the pharmaceutical company is in talks with the Indian government for an "expedited approval pathway" to make its coronavirus vaccine available here. "Unfortunately, our vaccine is not registered in India although our application was submitted months ago," said Bourla. He also announced a donation of COVID-19 medicines worth over $70 million to India.

West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee urged her supporters to maintain peace amid reports of violence after the results of the Assembly polls were announced. She added, "We know BJP and central forces have tortured us a lot but we've to maintain peace. At present, we've to fight COVID-19." Banerjee said she didn't get a congratulatory call from PM Narendra Modi.

Bangladesh has announced that the national lockdown imposed to curb the spread of coronavirus has been extended till May 16. Transport services will be allowed to operate within cities but inter-district services will remain suspended across Bangladesh. "There is no room for complacency...the bad situation can return anytime coinciding with the Eid festival later this month," an official said.

Uttar Pradesh government said on Sunday that it's planning to launch a coronavirus testing campaign for villages from May 4. The decision was taken at a review meeting chaired by UP CM Yogi Adityanath. "We've to protect villages from coronavirus infection at any cost...In such a situation, a massive campaign of coronavirus testing should be conducted," he told officials.

The Chandigarh administration on Monday announced additional COVID-19 curbs that will be in place from 5 pm tomorrow (May 4) till 5 am on May 11. All shops selling non-essential items will remain closed, along with cinema halls, gyms, swimming pools, spas etc. Government offices, banks and public transport have been allowed to operate at 50% capacity.

Chennai Super Kings (CSK) CEO Kasi Viswanathan, the team's bowling coach L Balaji and a bus cleaner from the CSK's IPL 2021 contingent have reportedly tested positive for COVID-19. However, all CSK players, who are currently in Delhi, have tested negative for coronavirus, according to reports. This came after two Kolkata Knight Riders (KKR) players also tested COVID-19 positive.

Russia has struck three deals totalling 260 million doses of Sputnik V COVID-19 vaccine with Chinese firms in recent weeks to speed up production and meet soaring demand. Russia has only been able to deliver a fraction of the millions of doses it pledged, reports said. Kremlin spokesman Dmitry Peskov said demand for Sputnik V exceeds Russia's domestic production capacity.

Haryana Health Minister Anil Vij on Monday said the state government didn't want to impose a lockdown but it didn't have any option left as people weren't adhering to COVID-19 norms. The state will be under a complete lockdown for seven days from Monday. Vij urged people to stay at home and defeat COVID-19.

Serum Institute of India (SII) CEO Adar Poonawalla on Monday issued a statement to "clarify certain things" adding that his comments "may have been misinterpreted". He said that vaccine manufacturing is a specialised process and it wasn't possible to ramp up production overnight. Even the most advanced countries with populations smaller than India are struggling, Poonawalla said.

AstraZeneca's CEO Pascal Soriot during a Q&A with shareholders said the company can't share its vaccine technology with the WHO. "Even if we give access and we told people 'here is the recipe'...there's no way we could train these people to manufacture the vaccine," the CEO said. "Our engineers are flat out working with our existing partners," he added.

The Centre on Monday refuted media reports claiming it hasn't placed any fresh orders for coronavirus vaccines since March 2021. Terming the reports "completely incorrect", the Centre said that "100% advance" of ?1,732.50 crore and ?787.50 crore was released to SII and Bharat Biotech for 11 crore Covishield doses and five crore Covaxin doses, respectively, on April 28.

Madhya Pradesh CM Shivraj Singh Chouhan on Monday announced that the state will give COVID-19 vaccine doses to people aged 18-44 from May 5. "We have placed orders to buy 4.76 crore doses of Covishield and 52.25 lakh doses of Covaxin," the CM informed. "We have currently finalised a vaccination programme to administer 1.5 lakh doses daily," the CM added.

The government on Monday shared the status of COVID-19 vaccination coverage across the country. The data showed that as of May 3, a total of 12.83 crore people have received their first dose of COVID-19 vaccine and 2.89 crore have received their second dose. A many as 12.07 crore doses have been administered to those aged 45 and above.

The Lancet COVID-19 Commission India Task Force has suggested a complete ban on gatherings of more than 10 people and closing all venues where such gatherings can take place. On lockdowns, it said, "We don't believe...there's one single policy option of a complete lockdown." It added, "A series of actions are needed...some of these require closures, some require targeted containment."

West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee has said it's the first time that a Prime Minister didn't call to congratulate after her party won the Assembly elections. "Congratulations to Mamata Didi for TMC's win. Centre will continue to extend all possible support to West Bengal Government to fulfil people's aspirations and also to overcome COVID-19 pandemic," PM Modi tweeted on Sunday.

As many as 13 states/UTs are showing early signs of plateauing in daily new COVID-19 cases, the government said in its COVID-19 press conference today. They are Chhattisgarh, Dadra and Nagar Haveli and Daman and Diu, Delhi, Gujarat, Jharkhand, Ladakh, Lakshadweep, Madhya Pradesh, Maharashtra, Punjab, Telangana, Uttar Pradesh and Uttarakhand. Remaining states/UTs are showing an increasing trend.

WHO Director-General Tedros Adhanom Ghebreyesus on Monday said that the world has recorded more cases of coronavirus in the last two weeks than were recorded in the first six months of the pandemic. He added, "India and Brazil account for more than half of last week's coronavirus cases, but there are many other countries...that face a very fragile situation."

The Delhi High Court on Monday asked the central government to apprise it of action taken on the Delhi government's request for Army's help in setting up hospitals with oxygen and ICU beds. Deputy CM Manish Sisodia has requested Defence Minister Rajnath Singh to provide Army's assistance in fighting the COVID-19 pandemic in Delhi.

The Ministry of Health and Family Welfare has informed that 84,599 beneficiaries in the age group of 18-44 years received their first dose of the COVID-19 vaccine on May 1, the first day of the third phase of the nationwide vaccination drive. The total vaccination across the country has crossed more than 15.66 crore mark, the ministry added.

Congress leader Rahul Gandhi on Saturday said that the central government "ignored" multiple early warning signs that a second wave of COVID-19 could severely hit India and "declared victory against the pandemic prematurely". "And now, where is the government in this crisis? It is completely missing in action," Rahul added. "Scientists clearly warned the government this would happen," he said.

West Bengal on Sunday recorded the biggest single-day surge in coronavirus cases with 17,515 new cases in the last 24 hours. As many as 92 more people died in Bengal in the last 24 hours, taking the state's COVID-19 death toll to 11,539. West Bengal now has 1,18,495 active cases of coronavirus.

Nepal on Sunday reported its highest one-day jump in coronavirus cases at 7,137, taking the total number of cases to 48,711. The number of people diagnosed with COVID-19 in Nepal has increased by 136.8% compared to the last week. Nepal also reported 27 deaths from COVID-19 during the same period, taking its total death toll to 3,325.

The government has shared a map showing the number of COVID-19 doses consumed by states/UTs. According to the map, Maharashtra has consumed over 1.6 crore doses, Rajasthan (over 1.33 crore), Gujarat (over 1.31 crore), UP (over 1.31 crore) and West Bengal (over 1.1 crore). Meanwhile, Ladakh has consumed 1.12 lakh doses and Andaman and Nicobar Islands (1.05 lakh).

The Election Commission (EC) said on Saturday that over 90% of the 1.5 lakh counting agents of candidates who contested Assembly elections in four states and one Union Territory have been facilitated to test for COVID-19 infection ahead of counting on May 2. For the remaining, COVID-19 tests were arranged by the respective District Election Officers (DEOs), the EC added.

The total doses of coronavirus vaccines administered in Maharashtra crossed 1.6 crore-mark on Saturday as the Phase 3 of the nationwide vaccination drive commenced. As many as 95,535 doses were administered across the state on May 1, of which 12,525 were beneficiaries in the age group of 18 to 44 years, data showed. The state reported 63,282 cases on Saturday.

At least four private hospitals and a government clinic in the national capital began vaccinating people aged 18-44 years. Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal said that large scale vaccination in Delhi will start from May 3 as the state government has received 4.5 lakh COVID-19 vaccine doses. Delhi on Saturday recorded 412 deaths due to COVID-19.

As many as 992 people aged between 18 and 44 years received COVID-19 vaccine shots in Mumbai on Saturday, BMC said. In a late night plan, BMC had decided to vaccinate 1,000 such people at the BKC vaccination centre, Rajawadi Hospital, Nair hospital, RN Cooper hospital and SevenHills Hospital on Saturday. BMC plans to vaccinate 2,500 people on Sunday.

Serum Institute of India CEO Adar Poonawalla has spoken to The Times about the pressures he's facing over the production of COVID-19 vaccines to meet the demand in India. He said, "I'm staying here (London) for an extended time because I don't want to go back to that situation. Everything falls on my shoulders but I can't do it alone."

Pakistan on Sunday said that it will impose an entry ban on Iran and Afghanistan from May 4 to 20 to curb the spread of coronavirus. However, Pakistani citizens in the two countries who want to return home and those seeking emergency medical treatment will be exempted from it. Pakistan has recently witnessed a surge in coronavirus cases.

With trends showing DMK-led alliance's victory in Tamil Nadu Assembly elections, PM Narendra Modi tweeted, "Congratulations to Thiru MK Stalin and DMK for the victory." "We shall work together for enhancing national progress, fulfilling regional aspirations and defeating the COVID-19 pandemic," he added. DMK-led alliance is leading 149 of 234 seats in the state.

Reacting to the West Bengal poll trends, lawyer and activist Prashant Bhushan on Sunday said, "Apart from the BJP, this is a big setback for EC which held an eight phase poll amidst COVID-19, to facilitate Shah and Modi's rallies." Bhushan added that BJP is clearly remaining in double digits in West Bengal despite "boasting of getting over 200 seats".

BJP candidate Mangala Suresh Angadi has registered a victory against Satish Jarkiholi of Congress by a margin of 5240 votes in Belagavi parliamentary bypoll, as per the Election Commission. The Belagavi seat fell vacant in September 2020 after Union Minister Suresh Angadi passed away due to COVID-19. The BJP had given ticket to the late minister's wife.

AIIMS chief Dr Randeep Guleria has said that a complete lockdown is needed to contain the second wave of coronavirus in India. Referring to 12 deaths at a Delhi hospital due to lack of oxygen supply, Guleria added, "That drives home the point...India needs aggressive lockdown." He further said that healthcare infrastructure and workers are stretched to the limit.

A video showing members of RSS-affiliated Akhil Bharatiya Vidyarthi Parishad (ABVP) inside COVID-19 ward of Doon Medical College Hospital Dehradun and offering juice to patients has surfaced on social media. Principal of the college said the ABVP had taken permission to help the hospital administration in maintaining order but it had not been allowed to enter the ward.

CEO of Serum Institute of India (SII), Adar Poonawalla on Saturday said the production of COVID-19 vaccine Covishield is in full swing in Pune. In a major move, SII had reduced the price of Covishield from ?400 to ?300 per dose for states recently. Earlier this month, Poonawalla had asked the government for financial assistance to ramp up vaccine production.

Former Chief Economic Adviser Arvind Subramanian has said the government should "urgently" suspend all taxes on all COVID-19-related goods and services. Subramanian further said that the customs department should fast track all such goods. Earlier, he had said that there should be only one price for COVID-19 vaccine jabs all over India and "that should be zero".

More than 79 lakh vaccine doses are available with states and over 17 lakh doses will be supplied to them in the next three days, the central government said. The Centre has so far provided nearly 16.37 crore vaccine doses to states and UTs. Maharashtra has received 17,50,620 Covishield and 5,76,890 Covaxin vaccine doses for the first fortnight of May.

Uttar Pradesh has reported 30,983 new COVID-19 cases in the last 24 hours, as per the state health department. With this, the total number of cases in the state has now reached 13,13,361, the health department added. Moreover, the state recorded 290 coronavirus-related deaths in the last 24 hours, taking the total number of deaths in Uttar Pradesh to 13,162.

Goa government on Sunday announced coronavirus curbs that will be in place from 6 am tomorrow (May 3) till 7 am on May 10. Goa CM said the lockdown imposed on April 29 will end tomorrow but the curbs will remain in place for another week. Accordingly, bars, casinos, cinema halls, gyms, schools, colleges and religious places will be shut.

Over 3,000 Pakistani children between the ages of one and 10 were diagnosed with coronavirus in April, according to data from Pakistan's Health Ministry. More than 12,000 boys and girls between the ages of 11 and 20 contracted COVID-19 during the same time, the data showed. Pakistan has recently witnessed a surge in coronavirus cases.

West Bengal Trinamool Youth Congress leader Sayan Deb Chatterjee said on Sunday that the party's performance in state elections gave TMC workers "energy", but still, they're being told to not celebrate due to coronavirus situation. This comes as TMC workers were seen celebrating despite Election Commission's ban on victory celebrations as TMC leads in over 200 seats in West Bengal.

Congress leader Digambar Kamat said the four-day COVID-19 lockdown imposed in the state should be extended "as the situation is grim". The former CM also claimed that people of Goa are scared amid the "unstoppable rise" in COVID-19 cases and increase in coronavirus-related deaths. Goa went into lockdown on Thursday following an extremely high test positivity rate of over 50%.

Some members of the COVID-19 task force, a technical expert body that advises the central government, have recommended a national lockdown to break the chain of transmission of the virus. "A nationwide lockdown rather than what we are doing now, in bits and pieces across states, because of the simple fact that it is spreading all over," a member said.

Two coronavirus positive patients in home isolation were found dead on Sunday in Uttar Pradesh's capital Lucknow. The bodies of the two patients were reportedly recovered after a foul smell emanated from the decomposing bodies in the Krishna Nagar locality of Lucknow. The bodies have been identified and are reportedly believed to be of 60-year-old Arvind Goel and his son.

Malaysia has reported its first case of the coronavirus variant first identified in India, the country's Health Minister Adham Baba said on Sunday. The variant was detected in an Indian national screened at Kuala Lumpur International Airport, he added. "We advise...public to remain calm...All public health efforts will continue in order to break the chain of infection," he further said.

Delhi Health Minister Satyendar Jain's father has passed away due to coronavirus, CM Arvind Kejriwal said on Sunday. "Satyendar himself has been working tirelessly round the clock for the people of Delhi," said Kejriwal, adding, "God bless his soul and my heartfelt condolences to the family."

Amid rising coronavirus cases, Haryana Minister Anil Vij on Sunday announced that complete lockdown will be imposed in the state for seven days from May 3. This comes as the state reported 13,588 new COVID-19 cases and 125 deaths in the last 24 hours. Haryana has over 1 lakh active coronavirus cases.

Jammu and Kashmir Lieutenant Governor Manoj Sinha formed a five-member crisis management panel on Saturday to tackle COVID-19 situation and ordered an immediate oxygen audit in every hospital to ensure its optimal availability to treat infected patients. The instructions were issued on a day when the Union Territory recorded its highest daily death toll of 47.

As many as 68 police personnel from the Maharashtra Police department died of COVID-19 in April amid second wave of the pandemic. Confirming the news, Maharashtra ADG Sanjeev Singhal said, "We've observed that vaccination has been effective in decreasing the infection's impact on our personnel. Hence, we're trying our best to get all our men vaccinated as soon as possible."

Former Australia captain Mark Taylor has said that he's surprised that Steve Smith has decided to stay back with DC in IPL amid rising coronavirus cases in India as his ?2.2 crore contract is not "as big as it should've been". "If you're Pat Cummins...with ?15.5 crore...that's very hard to knock back for six weeks of playing cricket," he added.

Dr Reddy's Laboratories CEO (API and Services) Deepak Sapra stated that Russian COVID-19 vaccine Sputnik V will be available for public in few weeks after it undergoes statutory clearances. As many as 1,50,000 doses of Sputnik V arrived at Rajiv Gandhi International Airport in Hyderabad on May 1, after being given permission by the Drugs Controller General of India (DCGI).

An 88-year-old woman died of coronavirus in Singapore on Saturday, making it the first COVID-19 death in the country since March 13. The woman had a history of cancer, hypertension, congestive cardiac failure, stroke and hyperlipidaemia, the country's Health Ministry said. With her death, the coronavirus fatality count rose to 31 in Singapore.

West Bengal Governor Jagdeep Dhankhar congratulated CM Mamata Banerjee on her party All India Trinamool Congress' win in the state. Dhankhar tweeted, "Congratulated Mamata Banerjee's party win in West Bengal Assembly elections. Tomorrow at 7 pm Hon'ble CM will be calling on me at Raj Bhawan." He further appealed to all to observe calm and peace and follow COVID-19 protocols.

As many as 56,647 new COVID-19 cases, 51,356 discharges and 669 deaths were reported in Maharashtra in the last 24 hours, figures on Sunday showed. This is a slight dip from the 63,282 new cases and 802 deaths recorded a day ago. While Pune district reported 11,661 fresh cases and 159 fatalities, Mumbai reported 3,672 new cases and 79 deaths.

Amid rising COVID-19 cases, Punjab government has imposed stricter restrictions in the state till May 15. As per the new guidelines, all non-essential shops will remain closed till May 15 and anybody entering state has to show negative COVID-19 report or a vaccination certificate. Only two passengers will be allowed to travel in a four-wheeler, including taxi.

The Odisha government has announced a 14-day lockdown in the state starting May 5. Odisha has 61,505 active COVID-19 cases, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. The state has reported 2,054 COVID-19 deaths so far, while 3,91,048 people have been cured/discharged/migrated.

India has reported 3,92,488 new COVID-19 cases and 3,689 deaths in the last 24 hours, which is the biggest rise in the daily number of deaths so far. With this, the total number of cases has reached 1,95,57,457, while the death toll has surged to 2,15,542. There are 33,49,644 active cases in the country.

Delhi on Sunday reported 407 new COVID-19 deaths, a day after witnessing its biggest surge of 412 coronavirus-related deaths. The National Capital also recorded the single-day rise of 20,394 cases, taking the total active cases to 92,290. As many as 16,966 people have died due to coronavirus in Delhi so far.

Physical gold in India was sold at a discount this week for first time in 2021 amid a spike in coronavirus cases. Dealers were offering a discount of up to $2 an ounce this week over official domestic prices, Reuters reported. "Almost every state...has put some kind of restrictions...jewellery stores are either closed or witnessing negligible footfalls," a dealer said.

The Centre, in an affidavit filed before the Supreme Court, has said that a total of 122 crore COVID-19 vaccine doses will be needed to vaccinate a population of 59 crore in the age group of 18 to 45 years. "The availability of locally manufactured Sputnik V vaccine will start from July onwards," it added.

Former Deputy CM of Bihar and BJP MP Sushil Modi on Sunday took to Twitter to inform that his younger brother Ashok Kumar Modi, aged 65 passed away due to COVID-19. Sushil Modi said that he passed away at 2.45 PM in Patna and added, "Doctors made all effort but we could not save him."

TMC candidate Kajal Sinha, who succumbed to COVID-19 last week, is leading from Khardaha Assembly seat in West Bengal by over 29,000 votes, as per Election Commission data. BJP's Silbhadra Datta and Debajyoti Das of CPI(M) are the key candidates against him. After Sinha's death, his wife filed a complaint against EC for allegedly not ensuring the safety of candidates.

As incumbent Kerala CM Pinarayi Vijayan-led LDF looked set to win majority seats in Kerala Assembly polls, PM Narendra Modi congratulated him. PM Modi said, "We will continue working together on a wide range of subjects and to ensure India mitigates the COVID-19 global pandemic." Vijayan's CPI(M) has alone won 51 seats so far and is leading on 11 others.

Israel barred its citizens from travelling to India and six other countries, citing high COVID-19 infection rates there. Other countries that Israelis will not be allowed to travel to include Ukraine, Brazil, Ethiopia, South Africa, Mexico and Turkey. This regulation will come into force on May 3 and will remain in place until May 16, an official communication stated.

BMC on Sunday informed COVID-19 vaccination for those aged 45 years and above will remain closed on May 3 due to "insufficient stock". The civic body also stated that vaccination for people aged between 18 to 44 years will continue only at five centres. BMC added that only those who have registered on the Co-WIN app must visit the centre.

PM Narendra Modi on Sunday congratulated West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee on her party All India Trinamool Congress' (AITC) win in the state. "Congratulations to Mamata Didi for AITC's win in West Bengal. The Centre will continue to extend all possible support to the West Bengal Government to fulfil people's aspirations and to overcome the COVID-19 pandemic," the PM tweeted.

Rajasthan CM Ashok Gehlot on Sunday appealed to people to not gather on the streets to celebrate poll victories in view of COVID-19 surge. "Result of the bypolls for the three [Assembly] seats...will be announced...Do not gather outside to burst firecrackers," Gehlot tweeted. "All leaders of political parties, activists, winners, supporters, etc should behave in a peaceful manner," he added.

Arrangements for vaccination centres have been made at 77 government schools too for COVID-19 vaccination of people between 18-44 years of age, said Delhi government official. "These schools will be attached to their nearest hospitals for vaccination from 3rd May," the official added. The Delhi government has decided to provide free COVID-19 vaccinations to everyone above 18 years of age.

Despite a ban on victory processions imposed by the Election Commission (EC) amid the COVID-19 crisis in the country, several DMK workers and supporters were seen celebrating without wearing masks outside the party headquarters in Chennai. This came after official trends in counting of votes showed DMK leading in Assembly elections. The EC had announced the ban on Tuesday.

CPI(M) candidate and Kerala Health Minister KK Shailaja Teacher won from the Mattannur Assembly seat in Kannur district by 60,963 votes. Shailaja earned praise for handling the Nipah virus outbreak and the COVID-19 pandemic in the state. "The LDF in Kerala got a thumping victory in Assembly elections and are thankful to people of Kerala," she told ANI.

Goa Pradesh Congress Committee President Girish Chodankar stated that "BJP Medical Cell is trying to seek publicity by circulating posters with photographs of PM Narendra Modi and other party functionaries on social media" amid COVID-19 situation in the state. Terming it as "self-publicity obsessed", Chodankar asked the cell head, Dr Shekhar Salkar, to stop the propaganda and face ground reality.

As the trends in the counting of votes in Kerala Assembly elections show the LDF winning in the state, CM Pinarayi Vijayan said, "I humbly dedicate this great victory to the people of Kerala." "But this is not the time to celebrate with great joy...This is the time to continue the fight against COVID-19," he added.

The Jammu and Kashmir administration has ordered an inquiry into the death of four COVID-19 patients at a Jammu hospital due to alleged oxygen shortage. The district administration as well as the hospital have denied the claims of the oxygen shortage. Meanwhile, Jammu Divisional Commissioner Raghav Langer has appointed a panel to ensure adequate and timely oxygen supply to hospitals.

District authorities in Andhra Pradesh's Kurnool have denied allegations that four COVID-19 patients died due to oxygen shortage at a private hospital. An official statement issued by the Collector & District Magistrate G Veerapandian and SP K Fakirappa stated that a criminal case has been filed against KS Care Hospital and patients have been shifted to another care facility.

Police in Punjab's Moga has started a free cab service for senior citizens who want to get vaccinated against COVID-19. Those in need of the transportation facility can call at 9656896568, a district official said. Moga Senior Superintendent of Police Harmanbir Singh Gill advised people to always wear masks and adhere to the guidelines issued by the state government.

After several DMK workers and supporters were seen celebrating without wearing masks outside the party headquarters in Chennai, DMK chief MK Stalin asked his party workers to avoid victory celebrations. The Election Commission (EC), amid the COVID-19 crisis in the country, had banned the victory processions. DMK is currently leading in over 100 seats, as per Election Commission trends.

As many as 12 journalists, who'd undergone RT-PCR tests to cover the Belgaum Lok Sabha bypoll counting, have tested COVID-19 positive, officials said on Sunday. The 12 are reportedly from print and television news channels. A total of 29 journalists had undergone the tests as mandated by the Election Commission, said the officials. The counting for bypoll took place today.

Delhi University (DU) has decided to defer final year examinations amid rising COVID-19 cases, officials said on Sunday. The final year and final semester exams that were supposed to begin on May 15 will now begin on June 1, DU's Dean of Examinations DS Rawat said. They will be in online mode and held in the open-book format, reported PTI.

With the CPI(M)-led LDF leading in over 90 seats out of the 140 seats in Kerala, Congress leader Shashi Tharoor congratulated Chief Minister Pinarayi Vijayan for re-election. "It is our duty to respect the confidence the people have shown in him and his government. In the fight against COVID-19 and communalism, he should have our support," said Tharoor.

Citing the COVID-19 situation in India, Congress has decided not to participate in television debates following the election results. "At a time when India is facing an unprecedented crisis, when the government under PM Modi has collapsed, we find it unacceptable to not hold them accountable and instead discuss elections..," Congress leader Randeep Singh Surjewala said.

The total number of officially recorded COVID-19 cases in Himachal Pradesh since the beginning of the pandemic crossed the one lakh mark on Saturday, according to the state government's latest health bulletins. The tally for confirmed cases has reached 1,02,038, of which 19,928 cases are active and 1,512 patients have died. Himachal Pradesh reported 2,751 COVID-19 positive cases on Saturday.

BJP candidate Mahesh Jeena is leading over Congress' Ganga Pancholi by over 1,000 votes in the by-election to Uttarakhand's Salt Assembly constituency, the Election Commission said. The BJP candidate has 8,789 votes, while Pancholi has 7,030 votes, it said. The bypoll to the seat was necessitated after BJP MLA Surendra Singh Jeena succumbed to COVID-19 last year.

French Ambassador to India Emmanuel Lenain said the COVID-19 medical aid to India is the largest package provided by France to any country. "We have been working for days and nights with ministries and companies to provide assistance to India. India had helped us last year when France was in dire need of medical drugs," Lenain added.

Nigeria will ban entry to non-Nigerian passengers, who have been to Brazil, India or Turkey in the last fortnight due to concerns of COVID-19. The travel ban does not apply to passengers, who have transited through those countries, an official statement said. All passengers arriving in Nigeria will also have to show a negative COVID-19 test taken within 72 hours.

Gujarat CM Vijay Rupani urged the heads of over 14,000 gram panchayats to enforce a 15-day blockade to control COVID-19 spread in the rural parts. "Those in the village should not step out of the village...Those from outside should not be allowed to enter," he added. "If anything needs to be brought...village committee should make the necessary arrangements," Rupani stated.

India's fuel demand dropped last month after several states announced lockdowns to curb the surging cases of COVID-19. "At the end of April, overall fuel demand is down by about 7% from the pre-COVID level seen in April 2019," Arun Singh, Director for Marketing and Refineries at Bharat Petroleum Corporation Ltd (BPCL), said.

Four more COVID-19 care centres, with a capacity of over 1,000 beds, have been established in Manipur, Chief Minister N Biren Singh has said. "250 bedded COVID-19 Care Centre at Bal Bhawan, Khuman Lampak and 70 bedded CCC at Bishnupur have started functioning," the CM tweeted. He added that each Assembly constituency will have a functioning COVID-19 care centre shortly.

With TMC leading over 200 seats in West Bengal, several TMC workers took to street to celebrate the party's performance despite the ban by the Election Commission on victory celebrations due to COVID-19 crisis. Several TMC supporters also gathered outside BJP office in Kolkata. Meanwhile, the EC has asked Chief Secretaries of five states/UT to prohibit such celebrations urgently.

The Supreme Court has allowed counting of votes on May 2 for the Uttar Pradesh Gram Panchayat polls after the State Election Commission assured that COVID-19 norms will be followed. The bench directed that no victory rallies will be permitted. The order came on a  teachers' body's plea stating that 700 teachers have died on duty during the four-phased elections.

Australian citizens returning home from India could face up to five years in jail and fines. From Monday, anyone who has been in India within 14 days of their intended arrival date in Australia will be banned from entering the country. Failure to comply could result in a five-year jail sentence, an A$66,000 (?37 lakh) fine, or both.

Hungary on Saturday eased several restrictions imposed due to coronavirus for people with government-issued immunity cards. People who have received at least one dose of a coronavirus vaccine and those who have recovered from COVID-19 are eligible for the cards. Individuals with the cards are allowed to enter indoor dining rooms, hotels, cinemas, gyms, libraries and other recreational venues.

India on Saturday recorded a COVID-19 positivity rate of 20.66% after record 4,01,993 people tested positive in the last 24 hours out of 19,45,299 people who underwent coronavirus tests, the highest ever daily tests. The COVID-19 positivity rate in India on April 19 was 20.19%, while it was 21.45% on April 29. On April 30, the positivity rate was 20.13%.

External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar on Friday spoke to his Chinese counterpart Wang Yi amid the COVID-19 situation in India. He tweeted, "Highlighted...importance of supply chains & air flights being kept open in these circumstances. Welcomed his assurances." Earlier, a Chinese airline had suspended its cargo flights to India, disrupting private traders' efforts in getting oxygen concentrators.
