Samajwadi Party leader Azam Khan tested positive for COVID-19 along with 13 other prisoners in Uttar Pradesh's Sitapur jail, officials said on Saturday. "The tests were conducted after complaints of fever and cough. Initially, the rapid antigen test was done and later samples were sent for the RT-PCR test, the reports of which came positive...[on] Friday," jailer RS Yadav said.

As India on Saturday became the first country to report over four lakh COVID-19 cases in a day, Congress President Sonia Gandhi asked the Centre and state governments to "wake up" and discharge their duties. "Evolve political consensus for national policy to deal with COVID-19," Gandhi told the Centre. Gandhi further asked the governments to ramp up testing for COVID-19.

The armed forces are set to attain the target of inoculation of 100% vaccination against COVID-19, Deputy Chief Integrated Defence Staff (Medical) Lieutenant General Madhuri Kanitkar said. The cases of COVID-19 infection are very few among the serving personnel and even if they are getting infected, they have mild symptoms, Kanitkar added.

Uttar Pradesh CM Yogi Adityanath has said those above 18 are being vaccinated at 85 centres in seven districts, where active COVID-19 cases are high, from today. "2500 centres for 45+ have begun phase 3 vaccination today," he further said, adding, "We ordered 1 crore vaccines." The seven districts include Lucknow, Prayagraj, Varanasi, Gorakhpur, Bareilly, Kanpur and Meerut.

As the third phase of COVID-19 vaccination started, Mumbai Mayor Kishori Pednekar said that vaccine will be given to people aged 18 to 44 only after they have registered and received a message from the vaccination centre to get themselves vaccinated. "Do not go to centres until and unless you receive a message," Pednekar said while talking to reporters.

Pakistan will reduce the number of inbound international flights to 20% of current numbers to curb rising COVID-19 cases, the National Command and Operation Centre (NCOC), which oversees the government's pandemic response, said. The restriction will be in place from May 5 to 20, it added. However, it wasn't immediately clear which routes and air carriers would be affected.

Many people with COVID-19 symptoms have been testing negative. The likely reasons include mutations of the virus escaping detection, quality of sampling and testing, and efficacy of RT-PCR kits, The India Express said. A number of symptomatic people who tested negative in RT-PCR, tested positive in Bronchoalveolar Lavage tests. Up to 20% symptomatic people are testing negative, reports said.

India's COVID-19 cases reached 1,91,64,969 with 4,01,993 new cases, the first time any country has recorded over 4 lakh cases in a day. Tripura (35,342) and Manipur (31,586) are among states/UTs with 1-40,000 confirmed cases. States with 40,001-5,00,000 cases include Haryana (4,87,978) and Bihar (4,70,317). Maharashtra (46,02,472) and Karnataka (15,23,142) are among states with 5,00,000+ cases.

Over 300 scientists have written to PM Narendra Modi asking for transparency in COVID-19 data. They have made four major demands. They include large-scale genomic surveillance of new variants, release of granular data on testing and clinical outcome of COVID-19 cases, release of anonymised data on clinical outcomes of hospitalised patients, and data on immune response to vaccination in population.

The lockdown in place to check COVID-19 spread in Delhi is being extended by one week, said CM Arvind Kejriwal on Saturday. The national capital's government had on April 25 extended the lockdown till 5 am on May 3 and it will now remain in place till May 10. Delhi had recorded over 27,000 new COVID-19 cases on Friday.

AIIMS chief Dr Randeep Guleria in an interview said that the rise in the number of infections in the first COVID-19 wave in India was slow, "but it is vertical in the second wave". He added, "It (the rise in cases) is almost like a rocket. This is why the healthcare infrastructure is badly shaken."

Brazilian Health Minister Marcelo Queiroga said countries should share spare vaccine doses with Brazil to help fight COVID-19 and meet its goal of vaccinating all citizens by year-end. Brazil has administered 4.1 crore doses but needs more supplies to meet a daily target of 24 lakh, he added. Brazil, on Thursday, became the second country to exceed 4,00,000 coronavirus-related deaths.

Congress leader Rahul Gandhi took to Twitter on Saturday to announce the launch of the party's medical advisory helpline "Hello Doctor" for people suffering from coronavirus. He also appealed to doctors and medical professionals to enrol themselves on it. "[The helpline is] manned by trained medical, mental health professionals," the Congress party said.

Former RJD MP Mohammad Shahabuddin, who passed away on Saturday due to COVID-19, was lodged in the high-risk ward in Tihar Jail with an infected cellmate. Shahabuddin was "impelled to share the same cell with the COVID-19 patient and this way the jail authorities have endangered the life of the petitioner", his lawyers had told the court.

Sitar maestro Pandit Devabrata Chaudhuri passed away on Saturday aged 85 due to coronavirus-related complications. His son Prateek announced the demise of his father, also known as Debu Chaudhuri, on Facebook. "He was admitted with COVID along with dementia complications and was put...on ventilator around midnight today...after which he suffered a heart attack and couldn't be revived," he wrote.

TMC MP Mahua Moitra has asked why IPL was being conducted in the middle of "this deathly chaos". "Do Indian sports lovers really want this macabre distraction?" Mahua questioned. Her remarks came as India on Saturday became the first country to report over 4 lakh COVID-19 cases in a single day. Over 2 lakh Indians have died due to COVID-19.

Former Rashtriya Janata Dal (RJD) MP Mohammad Shahabuddin died aged 53 at a Delhi hospital where he was getting treated for COVID-19, PTI reported quoting Tihar Jail DG Sandeep Goel. The gangster-turned-politician was serving a life sentence on charges of murdering Chote Lal Gupta, a CPI (Marxist-Leninist) Liberation activist. Shahabuddin had more than thirty criminal cases against him.

US Vice President Kamala Harris said the current coronavirus situation in India is "tragic" and America "as a country has made a commitment to the people of India to support them". "We've...made a commitment in terms of a dollar amount that will go to PPE and...other things," Harris added. "My prayers go to the people on the suffering," she said.

The Andhra Pradesh High Court on Friday asked the state government to rethink its decision to conduct board examinations for Class 10, 12 students amid the second wave of COVID-19. The Court directed the state government to submit an affidavit by May 3. Earlier, the government had said that the decision was taken for the better future of the students.

Actress Sneha Wagh's father passed away on April 27 due to coronavirus-related complications. She took to Instagram on Saturday to share the news and wrote, "After battling...pneumonia and COVID-19...I've lost my father." She also shared a few pictures of herself with her father and added, "No matter what you go through in life...losing a parent doesn't get close to anything."

The Election Commission on Saturday moved the Supreme Court against the Madras High Court's observation on allowing political rallies amid COVID-19 spread. EC called HC's remarks "uncalled for, blatantly disparaging and derogatory". The High Court had said "murder charges" should perhaps be imposed on EC for being 'solely' responsible for India's COVID-19 situation today.

A COVID-19 vaccine campaign kicked off in Syria's last rebel-held enclave on Saturday with doses from the WHO-backed COVAX facility. Nizar Fattouh, a 45-year-old front-line nurse, received one of the 53,800 doses of the Oxford-AstraZeneca coronavirus vaccine delivered through Turkey on April 21. More than 21,000 coronavirus cases have been reported in the rebel-held area.

The number of deaths reported in Russia between January to March of 2021 was over 25% higher than the same period a year ago, the state statistical service said. Over 5,83,000 deaths were reported in the first three months of this year, 1,23,000 more than the previous year. Notably, critics have accused the government of downplaying the severity of COVID-19.

In wake of the rising COVID-19 cases in Rajasthan, Chief Minister Ashok Gehlot on Saturday appealed to people to postpone scheduled marriage events. "Right now, everyone is worried about corona(virus) than the happiness of marriage," tweeted Gehlot. The state government has declared "lockdown-like public discipline guidelines" from May 3 to May 17, 2021.

Kanu Priya, who was popular as the host of 'Awakening with Brahma Kumaris' and 'Karmabhoomi' passed away due to COVID-19. BK Shivani, the spiritual guru and the main face of Brahma Kumaris, shared the news on social media. Kanu Priya had also acted in several serials and telefilms, including 'Meri Kahani', 'Bhanwar' and 'Kahi Aek Gaon'.

Maharashtra Deputy CM Ajit Pawar blamed the Union government's decision to export COVID-19 vaccines for the vaccine shortage in the country. Stating that the target population for vaccination in Maharashtra is 5.81 crore in the third phase, he added, "We received only 3 lakh doses today." He also said that the Centre should have prioritised vaccinating the local population.

Congress leader Rahul Gandhi on Saturday accused Prime Minister Narendra Modi of "dropping the ball and throwing it to states" after prematurely taking credit for having "won against COVID-19" when the second wave was already underway. Gandhi further said India must be the only country in the world facing the pandemic without the guidance of an expert.

As many as 2,99,988 COVID-19 recoveries were registered in India in the last 24 hours. Ten states/UTs account for 76.09% of the new recoveries. The most number of recoveries were reported in Maharashtra (69,710), followed by Uttar Pradesh (32,494) and Delhi (25,288). Kerala and Tamil Nadu also reported more than 16,000 recoveries each in the last 24 hours.

A 92-year-old woman from Rajasthan's Kota recovered from COVID-19 in just 12 days, with doctors saying her positive attitude and regular lung exercises helped in speedy recovery. Sheila Devi, who was admitted to Maharao Bhim Singh (MBS) hospital on April 18 spent seven days in critical condition at the facility and later was kept in home isolation.

As the first batch of 1.5 lakh doses of Russia's Sputnik V COVID-19 vaccine reached Hyderabad in India on Saturday, the vaccine's official Twitter handle said, "Let's jointly defeat this pandemic. Together we are stronger." Ministry of External Affairs spokesperson Arindam Bagchi shared pictures of the consignment and said, "[The vaccine] will add to India's arsenal to fight the pandemic."

CBSE has announced a policy for tabulation of marks for Class 10 board exams which have been cancelled amid COVID-19 pandemic situation. While 20 marks will be for internal assessment, 80 marks will be calculated on basis of the students' performance in various tests or exams throughout the year. The results will be declared on June 20.

Delhi on Saturday recorded 412 more coronavirus-related deaths, marking the national capital's biggest ever single-day rise in fatalities. The city also recorded 25,219 new COVID-19 cases and a daily positivity rate of 31.6%. Delhi's cumulative caseload has now risen to 11,74,552 while its total COVID-19 death toll has risen to 16,559.

Kerala CM Pinarayi Vijayan said that COVID-19 vaccination for those above 18 years may be delayed as the state is yet to receive vaccines from manufacturers. "We had decided to vaccinate all the people above 45 years of age by May 30 but it will not be possible as we have not yet received the required vaccine stock," he added.

The Gujarat government has passed an order to rope in school and college students enrolled in the National Service Scheme (NSS) for COVID-19 duties. As per the order, NSS students have to help with registration and data entry, traffic management, setting up isolation centres in villages, arrange food and water for COVID-19 patients and their attendants, among other such work.

Stating that over 52 journalists died because of COVID-19 last month itself, the Editors Guild of India said it was "extremely distressed" that the Centre had not done anything to speed up the vaccination of journalists over the past few months. Senior journalist Rohit Sardana on Friday passed away due to a heart attack after testing positive for COVID-19.

Karnataka CM BS Yediyurappa on Friday launched an initiative to use drones to sanitise containment zones and deliver medicine and essential goods to people affected by COVID-19 in Bengaluru. "During these difficult times, it's very important to...[ensure] timely delivery of emergency medicines and COVID-19 vaccines," he said. The drones reportedly have a capacity to ferry 35-40 kg of materials.

Bihar CM Nitish Kumar and RJD leader Tejashwi Yadav on Saturday offered condolences on the demise of former RJD MP Mohammad Shahabuddin who passed away due to COVID-19. "[Bihar] CM prays for [Shahabuddin's] soul to rest in peace," said a statement from Nitish Kumar's office. Yadav tweeted, "His demise is irreplaceable damage to the party...RJD is with the bereaved family."

Amid the increasing number of deaths related to COVID-19 at Pimpri-Chinchwad Municipal Corporation (PCMC) hospitals, District Guardian Minister Ajit Pawar on Saturday held a meeting with civic officials. Pawar visited the PCMC headquarters and directed the administration to strictly monitor COVID-19 hospitals and take steps to reduce mortality. Mayor Usha Dhore was present during his visit.

Singapore will reimpose social distancing curbs amid a rise in coronavirus cases in the country. The country will need to tighten measures against COVID-19 where necessary promptly to avoid the second lockdown, PM Lee Hsien Loong said. Singapore will also ban the entry of visitors from Bangladesh, Nepal, Pakistan and Sri Lanka due to a surge in COVID-19 cases.

Bigg Boss 14' winner Rubina Dilaik on Saturday informed that she has tested positive for coronavirus. She added that she has quarantined herself at home. "I always look out for silver lining!! I'll be now eligible for donating plasma," she said. Rubina also requested those who came in contact with her in the last few days to get themselves tested.

Serum Institute of India (SII) is reportedly planning to start vaccine production in other countries as it struggles to meet supply commitments. "There's going to be an announcement in the next few days," The Times quoted CEO SII Adar Poonawalla as saying. SII hopes to increase production capacity from 250 crore to 300 crore doses a year within six months.

Facebook has partnered with the government to roll out a vaccine finder tool on its mobile app in India. In the tool, vaccine centre locations and their hours of operation have been provided by the health ministry. It'll also show walk-in options (for 46 years and above) and a link to register on the CoWIN website and schedule appointments.

The WHO on Friday said it has listed Moderna coronavirus vaccine for emergency use. The other vaccines listed for emergency use by WHO are Pfizer-BioNTech, AstraZeneca, Serum Institute of India and Johnson & Johnson. WHO Assistant Director-General Mariangela Simao said it was important to have more vaccines available because of supply problems for other shots, including from India, through COVAX.

Kerala's Finance Minister TM Thomas Isaac said that India's COVID-19 "fiasco" is not merely a case of extraordinary incompetency but also of "cronyism". "Turning away of a foreign manufacturer and sitting on Sputnik file for six months were all deliberate acts to favour BJP's vaccine cronies," Isaac tweeted. India reported 3,523 deaths due to COVID-19 in the last 24 hours.

The lockdown, which was imposed in Rajasthan from April 19 to May 3, has been extended till May 17. The state government said the decision has been taken as the coronavirus positivity rate in Rajasthan is around 21% and 90-95% oxygen/ICU beds in the state are occupied. Only 31 people will be allowed in marriage ceremonies, as per the guidelines.

India has become the first country to report more than four lakh coronavirus cases in a day as 4,01,993 people tested positive for the virus in the last 24 hours. The total number of coronavirus cases in the country has risen to 1,91,64,969. Further, 3,523 coronavirus deaths were reported in India in the last 24 hours.

India's largest company by market value Reliance Industries (RIL) has said that it has not been able to escape the impact of COVID-19's second wave. The oil-to-telecom major informed its shareholders that customers visiting Reliance's retail stores dropped to 40% of pre-Covid levels in April. Fresh lockdowns will impact demand growth for fuels, the company, led by Mukesh Ambani said.

Pune Mayor Murlidhar Mohol said the Maharashtra Government has just allotted 5,000 vaccine doses for seven days. He said, "We've...[over] 20 lakh people from 18 to 44 [years] so it's very difficult...to manage with this supply of vaccines." He added, "Vaccination centres for 45 [years] and above remained close today and will remain shut tomorrow...We don't have vaccines for them."

Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal on Saturday said vaccination of people between 18 to 44 years of age was started from today "symbolically" at only one centre. "We have received 4.5 lakh (coronavirus) vaccine doses. It is being distributed in all districts. Large-scale vaccination in Delhi will begin from the day after tomorrow (Monday, May 3)," said Kejriwal.

Actor Bikramjeet Kanwarpal, who has been a part of many films, TV shows and web series, passed away due to COVID-19 complications at the age of 52. Filmmaker Ashoke Pandit mourned the loss of the actor on Twitter and wrote, "Sad to hear about the demise of actor...Bikramjeet Kanwarpal. Heartfelt condolences to his family & near ones."

A 22-day-old newborn, who tested COVID-19 positive when eight days old, has recovered at a private hospital in Ghaziabad. "The nurses took ample care of the child...used to take the baby in their arms...even though it was COVID-19 positive," a paediatrician at the hospital said. Notably, four days after the birth of the child, the parents had tested COVID-19 positive.

After imposing a travel ban on India amid COVID-19, the US State Department has said that certain categories of students, academics, journalists and individuals may qualify for a National Interest Exception (NIE). Students with valid F-1 and M-1 visas intending to begin or continue a program commencing August 1 or later don't need to contact embassy or consulate for NIE.

As India reported over 4 lakh new COVID-19 cases, top US health expert Dr Anthony Fauci told The Indian Express, "Shut down the country for a few weeks." "You don't have to shut down for six months. You can shut down temporarily to put an end to cycle of transmission," he said. "Hang in there, help each other," he added.

Adar Poonawalla, the CEO of the world's biggest vaccine manufacturer SII, said in an interview that he's been getting 'aggressive' phone calls from some of India's most powerful people for Covishield supply. "The level of expectation and aggression is unprecedented...overwhelming. Everyone feels they should get the vaccine. They can't understand why anyone else should get it before them," he said.

The US will restrict travel from India from Tuesday (May 4) in view of the spike in cases of COVID-19, the White House said. "The policy will be implemented in light of extraordinarily high COVID-19 caseloads and multiple variants circulating in India," it added. As per the new rules, "the entry as nonimmigrants of certain additional persons" will be suspended.

International bodybuilder Jagdish Lad, who belonged to Navi Mumbai, passed away in Gujarat's Vadodara due to COVID-19 at the age of just 34. Lad was on oxygen support for the last four days in a hospital. Lad had represented his home state Maharashtra and India in several body-building contests. He had won a silver medal in 'Mr India' competition.

Sri Lanka said that it's looking at sources other than India to purchase doses of the Oxford-AstraZeneca vaccine in view of the delay in securing it from the Serum Institute of India. "We've to understand that India has to look after their own country before supplying to us. It's not that they have told no to us," an official said.

Mardaani 2' actor Vikram Singh Chauhan tied the knot with girlfriend Sneha Shukla in Dehradun on Friday. Taking to Instagram, Vikram shared a picture from his wedding and said that he opted for a "small intimate ceremony" as he didn't want to have a grand celebration amid the coronavirus pandemic. "We missed having friends and family with us," he added.

Actor Anirudh Dave, who tested positive for coronavirus last week, has been shifted to the intensive care unit of a hospital in Bhopal. Actor Ajay Singh Chaudhary, who's in touch with his family and doctors, told ETimes, "He'd to be shifted to ICU because his oxygen levels could've fluctuated owing to the infection." Ajay further said Anirudh's health is improving.

M Vidyasagar, head of a government-appointed group of scientists modelling the trajectory of COVID-19 infections told Reuters, "Our belief is that by next week, the daily new cases nationwide would have peaked." India's coronavirus cases may peak between May 3 and 5, according to a mathematical model of the team of scientists.

Karnataka on Friday recorded its biggest one-day spike of 48,296 coronavirus cases, with Bengaluru Urban alone accounting for 26,756 of the total number of cases. Moreover, 217 COVID-19 related deaths were reported in the last 24 hours in the state. Active cases in the state now stand at 3,82,690, with 14,884 patients getting discharged in the last 24 hours.

Coronavirus cases in the world rose to over 15 crore on Friday, while deaths from virus crossed 31 lakh, according to Johns Hopkins University tracker. US has reported the highest COVID-19 cases at over 3.2 crore, followed by India at over 1.8 crore cases and Brazil at nearly 1.5 crore cases. Over 8.7 crore people have recovered from COVID-19 globally.

Shiv Sena MP Sanjay Raut said that India will have to adopt the "Maharashtra model" to fight the COVID-19 pandemic. "People are in a state of panic...They're not being given proper guidance," Raut added. While claiming that CM Uddhav Thackeray was the first to term the pandemic as a natural calamity, Raut said, "Today even the courts are backing it."

After four prisoners died of coronavirus in Delhi's Tihar Jail, officials have requested the Delhi government to allow the release of some inmates on "emergency parole". Earlier, Delhi High Court had sent a notice to the Centre, Delhi government and authorities on a plea seeking the release of prisoners on bail or parole from the Tihar, Mandoli and Rohini jails.

Uttar Pradesh CM Yogi Adityanath on Friday said that he has tested negative for COVID-19. "Due to your good wishes and doctors' care, I have tested negative for coronavirus. I thank you all for your cooperation...good wishes for me," Yogi Adityanath tweeted in Hindi. Adityanath had isolated himself on April 13 after some of his staffers had tested positive.

A woman was found hanging along with her husband at their home in Odisha's Nayagarh two days after she tested positive for COVID-19, police said. "Though both of them had COVID-19-like symptoms, only the woman's sample tested positive," police said. "The couple's son, who works in Puri, is undergoing treatment at a hospital there after testing COVID-19 positive," police added.

BJP MLA from Uttar Pradesh's Bairia constituency Surendra Nath Singh on Friday said, "CM [Yogi] Adityanath's experiment to control the COVID-19 pandemic with the help of bureaucracy has failed." The fact that BJP ministers and MLAs are getting infected with coronavirus and are unable to get proper treatment would be considered a shortcoming of the system in UP, Singh added.

Former Bigg Boss contestant and actress Sambhavna Seth on Friday informed that her father has tested positive for coronavirus. She took to Instagram and urged people to help her father get a bed in a hospital in Delhi. She wrote, "Can anybody help to get a bed in Jaipur Golden Hospital, Delhi as it's closest to my house...he needs...bed urgently."

Indian stock indices are on course to log their best weekly advance since February even as the record surge in COVID-19 cases in India resulted in foreigners withdrawing large investments from the Indian stock markets. Amid an estimated $2 billion outflow of foreign funds, domestic institutional investors such as mutual funds brought shares worth $1.3 billion this month.

Brazil has become the second country after US to report over four lakh coronavirus deaths. The country reported 3,001 new fatalities on Thursday, bringing the total COVID-19 death toll to 4,01,186. Brazil reportedly added one lakh coronavirus-related deaths to its tally in just 37 days. Brazil's Senate has opened an inquiry into President Jair Bolsonaro's government's handling of the pandemic.

Senior journalist and news anchor Rohit Sardana passed away on Friday due to heart attack after testing positive for coronavirus. Sardana was working with Aaj Tak. Editor In Chief and CEO of Zee News Sudhir Chaudhary tweeted, "I had never thought that this virus would take away the life of someone so close to me. I wasn't ready for it."

While reporting 41% higher net profit for the March quarter of the financial year 2020-21, Hindustan Unilever (HUL) said its health, hygiene and nutrition business grew in double-digits for the third consecutive quarter. This comes as India witnesses higher demand for hygiene products as well as medical supplies amid the second wave of COVID-19.

AstraZeneca has said that it generated $275 million (?2,034 crore) from the sales of COVID-19 vaccines, which included delivery of about 6.8 crore doses worldwide, in the first quarter of 2021. However, the drug maker added that vaccine development shaved off $0.03 per share from its earnings. It claimed that it won't make a profit from shot during the pandemic.

Bhartiya Kisan Union (BKU) leader Rakesh Tikait said on Thursday that farmers will not clear protest sites if the government asks them to amid a rise in coronavirus cases in India. He added that they would cancel their programmes after the government concludes its programmes and rallies. "The government is trying to muzzle the voice of farmers," he further added.

Samajwadi Party chief Akhilesh Yadav on Friday hit out at the BJP government saying that India's global image has been "tarnished" due to its mismanagement of the coronavirus pandemic. He added that international newspapers are publishing reports about coronavirus deaths in India. "Will the people who lie publicly now confiscate the property or impose sanctions on the publications," he tweeted.

The DGCA on Friday extended the suspension on international flights from and to India till May 31 in view of the second wave of the coronavirus pandemic. International flights were first suspended in March 2020 after a nationwide lockdown was imposed to tackle the first wave of the pandemic. This restriction shall not apply to flights specifically approved by DGCA.

French Health Minister Olivier Veran on Friday said that the potential danger of the Indian variant of the coronavirus should not be underestimated. Veran's comments came after the country detected its first three cases of the Indian variant. The Health Minister added that it was still unclear if the available COVID-19 vaccines were effective against the variant.

Bihar Chief Secretary Arun Kumar Singh on Friday passed away at a hospital in Patna due to COVID-19 complications. Singh, who was a senior IAS officer, was admitted to a hospital after testing positive for coronavirus and was undergoing treatment. He was appointed as the Chief Secretary of Bihar in February, 2021.

As many as 11 states in India have more than one lakh active coronavirus cases. The states are Maharashtra, Karnataka, Uttar Pradesh, Kerala, Rajasthan, Gujarat, Chhattisgarh, Andhra Pradesh, Tamil Nadu, West Bengal and Bihar. Maharashtra has the most number of active cases at 6,72,302, followed by Karnataka (3,49,515). India has 31,70,228 active coronavirus cases currently.

Mumbai's coronavirus test positivity rate has dropped below 10%, Municipal Commissioner Iqbal Singh Chahal said on Friday. Chahal informed that Mumbai's positivity rate was 9.94% on April 29. The test positivity rate is defined as the proportion of samples that return positive among the total tested. Chahal further stated that 85% of the new cases in the city are asymptomatic.

The Centre on Friday released the names of states which are reporting not only higher COVID-19 peaks but also high case growth trajectory. The states include Karnataka, Kerala, West Bengal, Tamil Nadu, Goa and Odisha. This comes as 3,86,452 coronavirus cases were confirmed in India in the last 24 hours, making it the world's biggest one-day jump so far.

Mumbai has reported 3,925 new coronavirus cases in the last 24 hours, taking the total number of cases in the city to 6,48,624, the Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) stated. Further, the death toll in Mumbai rose to 13,161 after 89 more deaths were reported on Friday. Over 6,380 coronavirus patients were recovered, taking the total number of recoveries to 5,72,431.

UN Secretary-General Antonio Guterres said the world organisation stands ready to step up its support to India as it faces second wave of COVID-19. "With the entire UN family, I stand in solidarity with the people of India as they face a horrific COVID-19 outbreak," Guterres tweeted. India has been reporting over 3,00,000 cases daily for over a week now.

Ten crore people in the US are now fully vaccinated against COVID-19, White House pandemic response coordinator Jeff Zients said. "That's 10 crore Americans with a sense of relief and peace of mind knowing that after a long and hard year they're protected from the virus," he added. The US has administered over 23.7 crore doses of coronavirus vaccines.

As many as 395 people died due to coronavirus in Delhi in the last 24 hours, marking the biggest single-day rise since the pandemic began. Further, Delhi reported 24,235 coronavirus cases in the last 24 hours at a positivity rate of 32.82%. The number of active coronavirus cases in the national capital currently stands at 97,977.

Government Railway Police (GRP), while screening travellers from other states entering Mumbai, found at least 450 COVID-19 patients among passengers in the last 15 days. "Once a COVID-19 patient is found, we immediately transfer the passenger to a COVID-19 care centre and call all passengers who were in the patient's bogie to get themselves tested," Mumbai Railway Police Commissioner said.

AAP MLA Shoaib Iqbal has demanded President Rule in Delhi amid COVID-19 surge. In a video, Iqbal said, "Delhi's situation makes me cry. It pains my heart to look at such a condition. There's no oxygen or medicine available." Adding that he's embarrassed of being an MLA, Iqbal said, "I'm not able to help anyone in such a distressful situation."

Maharashtra may witness third wave of COVID-19 in July-August, state Health Minister Rajesh Tope has said. "Maharashtra is trying to be self-sufficient in terms of availability of medical oxygen by then. If it is hit by a third wave...it would increase challenges before the state administration," Tope added. This comes as the state reported 66,159 new cases and 771 deaths.

As many as 3,86,452 coronavirus cases were confirmed in India in last 24 hours, marking the world's biggest one-day jump so far and taking the total number of cases to 1,87,62,976. Meanwhile, 3,498 deaths have been recorded in the last 24 hours, taking the death toll to 2,08,330.  The total number of active COVID-19 cases in India stands at 31,70,228.

Maruti Suzuki MD and CEO Kenichi Ayukawa has tested positive for COVID-19 and has been admitted to Medanta Hospital in Haryana's Gurugram, according to reports. Ayukawa is reportedly asymptomatic but he decided to get admitted because he lives alone in India. This is the second time in a year that he has tested positive for the virus, reports added.

Speaking about explaining the importance of the COVID-19 vaccine to her son Taimur through the 'Tom and Jerry' cartoons, actress Kareena Kapoor wrote on Instagram, "We don't realise that our kids are also absorbing what's going on and they are scared too." She further urged people to get vaccinated and wrote, "Please register and wait for your turn."

Television actor Manav Gohil, who tested positive for coronavirus earlier this month, documented his fight against the virus and shared a video on social media after recovering. "My boundaries of resilience are far-stretched. And if I fall short of that ability, I'll let my fate stay undefeated...I have many prayers on my side," he said in the video.

COVID-19 vaccination for the age group of 18-45 will not begin from May 1 in Bengaluru and rest of Karnataka as earlier announced, Health Minister Dr Sudhakar has confirmed. He asked those aged between 18 to 45 to register on the Co-Win portal and wait for the government to inform them once new stocks arrive.

Amid a rise in COVID-19 cases in the state, Kerala CM Pinarayi Vijayan on Thursday asked people to go into "self-lockdown". "The situation is really serious...We have requested all who visit marketplaces to wear double masks. There is no room for any complacency now," he said. He also announced new restrictions that will come into force from May 4.

Former Attorney General of India, Soli Jehangir Sorabjee, passed away on Friday at the age of 91. He had reportedly contracted COVID-19 and was undergoing treatment at a private hospital in Delhi. Sorabjee became the Attorney General of India first from 1989-90 and then again from 1998-2004. He also served as the Solicitor General of India from 1977-1980.

The "one-sided" narrative in international media of PM Narendra Modi's government's "failure" in handling the COVID-19 situation must be countered, External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar said. He was interacting with Indian ambassadors and high commissioners across the world. This comes after international newspapers like the New York Times and others criticised the PM Modi-led Central government.

Apollo Hospitals has confirmed that it will start COVID-19 vaccination for the age group of 18-44 from Saturday. In its press note, Apollo said that it will vaccinate individuals who have registered on CoWIN platform and made an appointment for the vaccine dose at Apollo Hospitals. The registrations began on April 28.

Punjab Chief Minister's Office on Friday said that CM Captain Amarinder Singh "made it clear that due to non-availability of vaccine, Phase III of (COVID-19) vaccination of 18-45 age group cannot be started as scheduled." It further stated the vaccination at private health facilities will remain suspended from Saturday. The Phase III was scheduled to start on May 1.

Russia's agricultural regulator has said that the country has produced the world's first batch of COVID-19 vaccines for animals. The first batch of 17,000 doses will be supplied to several regions of Russia, the regulator Rosselkhoznadzor said. Russia in March had registered the vaccine, Carnivac-Cov, after tests showed it generated antibodies against the virus in dogs, cats, foxes and mink.

PMC has deployed the services of private operator VaccineOnWheels (VOW) to assist with the COVID-19 vaccination drive, officials said on Friday. VOW will deploy 15 vaccination units, each of which will administer around 150 vaccine doses daily. VOW will provide its van along with a doctor, two nurses, four to five healthcare workers and a manned ambulance, VOW's Founder said.

Europe's economy shrank 0.6% in the first three months of the year as slow vaccine rollouts and extended lockdowns delayed economic recovery. Europe's largest economy, Germany, registered a degrowth of 1.7%, while France logged a growth of 0.4% compared to the quarter before. Meanwhile, the world's largest economy, the US, grew 1.6% during the first quarter.

Gujarat Chief Minister Vijay Rupani on Friday said, "COVID-19 vaccination for those above 18 will start from May 1 in 10 most-affected districts." The 10 districts include Ahmedabad, Surat, Vadodara, Rajkot, Bhavnagar, Jamnagar, Kutch, Mehsana, Gandhinagar and Bharuch. "We will cover the entire state as soon as the vaccine availability increases," he further said.

AstraZeneca on Friday said that it has delivered about 6.8 crore doses of its COVID-19 vaccine during the first three months of this year. The UK drugmaker added that 3 crore of the doses went to the European Union, 2.6 crore doses to Britain, 70 lakh to Gavi, the global Vaccine Alliance, and 50 lakh vaccine doses to other countries.

The Civil Aviation Ministry has permitted the Telangana government to use drones for the experimental delivery of vaccines. The Ministry said it has granted a conditional exemption to the Telangana government from the Unmanned Aircraft System Rules, 2021, for "conducting experimental delivery of vaccines using drones within the visual line of sight range".

As vaccination starts for those aged above 18 from May 1, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal on Friday said, "I request people to not queue up at the vaccination centres tomorrow, vaccine isn't available yet." "As soon as the vaccine comes, we will make proper announcements. Only then people with appointments can start coming to the centres," he added.

Veteran actor Randhir Kapoor, who got admitted to Kokilaben hospital in Mumbai earlier this week after contracting COVID-19, has said that he has no clue how he got the virus despite getting two doses of vaccine. "I am surprised...My entire staff of five members, too, has tested positive, and I have got them hospitalised with me," he added.

Madhya Pradesh CM Shivraj Singh Chouhan on Thursday evening said that the vaccination drive for 18+ category wouldn't start on May 1 in the state. He added that the state had ordered both Covishield and Covaxin but the companies said the order can't be fulfilled by May 1. He added that the state might get vaccines by May 3.

France has detected its first cases of a coronavirus variant found in India, the country's Health Ministry said on Thursday. A first case was identified in a woman who had travelled to India and is living in southwestern France. While two others who had travelled to India were infected with the Indian variant in southeastern France, the ministry added.

Punjab Chief Minister Captain Amarinder Singh on Friday asserted that the government will treat COVID-19 patient irrespective of the fact from where they come from. "We must not refuse any patient who needs hospital care. We will never close our doors to any patient," a statement issued by the Chief Minister read.

West Bengal government on Friday imposed COVID-19 restrictions in the state, ordering the shutting down of shopping complexes, malls, cinema halls and restaurants until further orders. All social/ cultural/ academic/ entertainment related gatherings shall remain prohibited. Bazaars/ hats will remain open only during 7-10 am in the morning and 3-5 pm in the afternoon.

Defence Minister Rajnath Singh has invoked special provisions and granted Emergency Financial Powers to the armed forces to fight the COVID-19 crisis. "These powers will help Formation Commanders to establish and operate quarantine facilities/hospitals and to undertake procurement or repair of equipment or stores besides provisioning of...works required to support the ongoing effort," he tweeted.

AIIMS chief Dr Randeep Guleria said COVID-19 patients who're being treated at home shouldn't take Remdesivir injection at home. He said Remdesivir should only be given in moderate or severe COVID-19 cases, adding, "Don't...procure or administer Remdesivir at home." "[Decision] to administer Remdesivir must be taken by a medical professional and administered only in a hospital setting," he added.

The West Bengal Council of Higher Secondary Education on Friday cancelled the annual examination of Class 11, due to the prevailing COVID-19 situation. It said that the students will be promoted to Class 12. "Topics of the reduced syllabus of Class 11...should be completed within the first quarter of Class 12," the statement by the Council added.

Amid COVID-19 surge, Telangana government has extended the night curfew in the state till May 8. The timings for the night curfew will be 9 pm to 5 am daily. All offices, firms, shops, establishments and restaurants will be closed during the time period. Essential services will be exempted from the curfew, the state government said.

LIC booked a record ?37,000 crore profit from share sales in 2020-21, the highest in its 65-year history, as the stock market climbed to a record high. The latest profit is a 44.4% jump against its ?25,625 crore gain from stock sales in the previous fiscal. LIC has reportedly cut its exposure in the infrastructure industry amid the COVID-19 pandemic.

Amid COVID-19 crisis, the Supreme Court on Friday told the Delhi government, "Politics can be done during elections. Interact with the Centre." "We told Centre how it has a special responsibility to Delhi but we need to send message to...[Delhi] govt that in this humanitarian crisis we don't want lives to be lost in political bickering," the top court stated.

Veteran sharpshooter Chandro Tomar, also known as 'Shooter Dadi', passed away on Friday. She was admitted to a hospital in Meerut after she tested positive for COVID-19. A film based on her and Prakashi Tomar's lives titled 'Saand Ki Aankh', which starred Taapsee Pannu and Bhumi Pednekar, released in 2019.

Indian benchmark indices snapped their four-day winning streak on Friday as COVID-19 cases continued to rise in the country. The Sensex fell 984 points or 2% to close at 48,782 while the broader Nifty 50 tumbled 264 points or 1.77% to settle at 14,631. HDFC, HDFC Bank, ICICI Bank, Reliance Industries and TCS were among the top losers on Sensex.

Maharashtra CM Uddhav Thackeray on Friday said that there's no need for a stricter lockdown in the state as people are following the restrictions. "We have been able to contain the spread of COVID-19 due to restrictions and lockdown. Our estimate was that there might be 10 lakh positive active patients, but now it is 7 lakh cases," he stated.

The Directorate General of GST Intelligence (DGGI) and CGST zones have booked about 8,000 cases involving fake input tax credit (ITC) worth over ??35,000 crore during financial year 2020-21, Ministry of Finance said. During FY21, 426 persons were arrested, it added. The drive against fraudulent GST invoices slowed down over the past two-three months due to COVID-19, it said.

The Uttarakhand government on Tuesday decided to cancel the annual Kanwar Yatra pilgrimage in view of the COVID-19 pandemic. This comes days after CM Pushkar Singh Dhami had said that 'God would not like it if lives are lost due to the Yatra'. Crores of devotees from several states including Delhi, UP and Haryana visit Uttarakhand for the annual pilgrimage.

With a steady rise in COVID-19 cases over the past few weeks, Pune has also reported a slight increase in the number of infections in children in July first week. Children accounted for 9.77% of total cases between March 1 and June 30, but this increased to 9.8% on July 7, according to the Pune Municipal Corporation (PMC).

Dr Reddy's Laboratories has issued a statement saying that the soft launch of Russia's Sputnik V COVID-19 vaccine has now reached 50 cities and towns in India. The vaccine, which was launched on a soft pilot basis on May 14, is currently available in Hyderabad, Mumbai, Delhi-NCR, Kolkata, Chennai, Ahmedabad, Bengaluru, Srinagar, Patna and several others, according to the statement.

The Centre has appealed to everyone not to believe "rumours" around various variants of COVID-19 namely Alpha, Beta, Gamma or Delta, and follow the basic protocol in combating coronavirus. "Follow A-B-C-D of the fight against infodemic: A: Advise, B: Believe, C: Cross-check, D: Do not promote fear," the Ministry of Information and Broadcasting tweeted on its COVID-19 handle on Monday.

Delhi government on Monday withdrew its order directing the Janpath Market to be shut over violations of COVID-19 protocol. This comes after discussions between traders and New Delhi district authorities. "All shop owners have been following COVID-19 norms...The problem on Sunday was because of the hawkers in the mini market," the general secretary of the Janpath Traders Association said.

Canada's first Grand Slam singles champion Bianca Andreescu on Monday made a "very difficult decision" of withdrawing from the upcoming Tokyo Olympics due to the COVID-19 pandemic. 
"I look forward to representing Canada in future Fed Cup ties, and competing at the 2024 Olympics in Paris!" said Andreescu. Andreescu is third tennis player from Canada to withdraw from Olympics.

Dr Reddy's Laboratories on Tuesday clarified that neither the ongoing soft commercial launch of Sputnik V COVID-19 vaccine "nor work towards its ramp-up in India have been put on hold". "Dr Reddy's will strengthen the commercial roll-out of Sputnik V in...coming weeks," it added. The vaccine's soft launch has reached over 50 cities and towns across India, it said further.

AAP leader Durgesh Pathak has alleged that the BJP-ruled municipal corporations in Delhi (MCDs) are sealing shops of traders amid COVID-19 and demanding ??2 lakh for unsealing. "This case is from Sonia Vihar area of Karawal Nagar where the NGT had constituted a committee of the MCD, the Delhi pollution board...to conduct an inquiry...seal the shops causing pollution," Pathak added.

Indonesia has deported four foreign tourists from Bali after breaking COVID-19 safety protocols. Three visitors from US, Russia, and Ireland were deported for breaching coronavirus face mask rule. While a fourth traveller, a woman from Russia, was deported for refusing to self-quarantine after testing positive for COVID-19. She was allowed to stay in Bali till she recovered from the virus.

A total of ??16.81 lakh fines were collected from people flouting COVID-19 appropriate behaviour in a week in Bengaluru by teams of Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike (BBMP) and police. The teams were booking an average of 950 cases/day, a BBMP officer said. According to BBMP, ??12.04 crore COVID-19 fines have been collected from May 2020 to July 11 this year.

Vietnam will allow people to take a dose of the Pfizer-BioNTech COVID-19 vaccine after being vaccinated with the Oxford-AstraZeneca vaccine, the government said on Tuesday. According to preliminary results of a Spanish study, the Pfizer-AstraZeneca combination was highly safe and effective. Several countries, including Canada, Spain and South Korea, have approved such mixing of vaccines.

The Delta COVID-19 variant, which was first detected in India, is ripping around the world at a scorching pace, WHO chief Tedros Adhanom Ghebreyesus has said. He added that the variant is driving a new spike in cases and deaths. The variant, now in over 104 countries, is expected to soon be the dominant COVID-19 strain circulating worldwide, he warned.
To enable screen reader support, press Ctrl+Alt+Z To learn about keyboard shortcuts, press Ctrl+slash

India has reported 32,906 new COVID-19 cases in the last 24 hours, the lowest rise in daily cases in nearly four months. The country, however, reported 2,020 deaths in the last 24 hours as Madhya Pradesh on Monday added 1,478 backlog deaths. India's total cases reached 3,09,07,282 as against 3,08,74,376 a day before. The country's active cases stand at 4,32,778.

Delhi on Monday recorded 45 new COVID-19 cases which was the lowest single-day rise since April 15, 2020, when the national capital had recorded 17 new cases. The COVID-19 positivity rate on Monday in Delhi stood at 0.08%, while it was lower on Sunday at 0.07%. Delhi recorded three COVID-19 deaths and 92 recoveries in the last 24 hours.

Panama's Health Ministry said it has approved emergency use of the Pfizer-BioNTech COVID-19 vaccine for children aged 12 and above. The vaccine was already authorised for use on adolescents aged 16 and over. The Central American country, which has reported over 4.1 lakh COVID-19 cases, has administered more than 17 lakh doses of vaccines by Pfizer-BioNTech and AstraZeneca since January.

The second wave of COVID-19 spread so fast that it was humanly not possible to control it, said Union Home Minister Amit Shah in Gujarat on Monday. "Even after doing everything - made new hospitals, factories worked even during nights to make oxygen cylinders, cryogenic tankers were imported from across the world...we lost a lot of relatives," he added.

US' Food and Drug Administration (FDA) added a warning for Johnson & Johnson??s COVID-19 vaccine saying data suggests there's an increased risk of a rare neurological disorder in six weeks after inoculation. It added that chances of developing Guillain-Barr?? Syndrome are low but they appear to be 3-5 times higher among recipients of J&J vaccine than among general population.

The US has donated 15.3 lakh doses of Johnson & Johnson COVID-19 vaccine to Nepal through the WHO-led COVAX scheme. "These vaccines will not only save lives and help Nepal emerge from...pandemic, but they'll also help to recover economic losses and regain the opportunity to safely visit with our friends, families and neighbours," US Ambassador to Nepal Randy Berry said.

A Hyderabad-based physicist has claimed that the third wave of COVID-19 may have already set in on July 4. Based on trends over 15 months, Dr Vipin Srivastava, the former Pro Vice Chancellor of University of Hyderabad, said the pattern of the new COVID-19 cases and deaths since July 4 mirrors the graph of the first week of February 2021.

Sharing pictures of six crowded places in four states/UTs, the Centre on Tuesday stated, "Continued gross violations of COVID-appropriate behaviour can nullify the gains so far." The crowded places included Delhi's Sadar Bazar and Janpath market, Maharashtra's Bhushi Dam, Chandigarh's Sukhna Lake and Tamil Nadu's Ranganathan Street in Chennai and a lake in Vilaripatti village.

Citing surveys, the Union Health Ministry has shared four common reasons why people don't wear face masks amid the COVID-19 pandemic. People say masks are 'uncomfortable', they 'quote breathing problems' to avoid wearing them and they believe they don't need masks as long as they maintain social distance. The government also said people believe masks don't help in preventing COVID-19.

WHO Chief Scientist Dr Soumya Swaminathan has said that majority of fully vaccinated people infected by Delta variant of COVID-19 are asymptomatic or have mild symptoms. She added that hospitalisations are rising in some parts of the world where the Delta variant is spreading, but it's mostly in areas with low COVID-19 vaccine coverage.

The Tamil Nadu government has made a negative COVID-19 test report and an e-pass mandatory for tourists to visit the Nilgiris. "Visitors from neighbouring states like Kerala and Karnataka will be permitted through the state borders only after producing both these documents," an official said. The state government has extended COVID-19 restrictions till July 19 with certain relaxations.

Haryana Health Minister Anil Vij said that more than one crore COVID-19 vaccines have been administered to the people of the state till date. According to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare, there are more than 900 active COVID-19 cases in the state. Moreover, as many as 9,556 people have died in Haryana due to COVID-19.

In order to increase awareness regarding COVID-19, the Andhra Pradesh government has asked officials to hold COVID-19 awareness campaigns in the state for three days every week. Elaborating on the administration's plan for the three-day week campaigns, Krishna District Collector J Nivas said the "No mask No entry" campaign would be observed at all government and private offices on Mondays.

The preliminary experiment of a cocktail of two antibody drugs, Casirvimab and Imdevimab, has been successful, Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation said. "The number of [COVID-19] patients in need of oxygen after this cocktail medication is only 0.5%...mortality rate is reduced by 70%," BMC added. "Earlier...requirement of 13 to 14 days of hospitalisation reduced to five to six days," BMC stated.

Children who have recovered from COVID-19 are coming to hospitals in Delhi with post-COVID-19 symptoms like gastric issues, headache and brain fog, according to doctors at private hospitals. "We are seeing multisystem inflammatory syndrome in children (MIS-C)," a doctor said. He added that it happens in 1% to 2% of cases, but that is also a huge number.

The Pulwama district administration, under the direction of the Jammu and Kashmir administration, is constructing a 200-bed pre-fabricated COVID-19 hospital as part of preparations against a possible third wave of coronavirus. The total cost of the project is about ??4.22 lakh. Deputy Commissioner, Pulwama, Baseer Ul Haq Choudhary said that the hospital will benefit people from far-flung areas.

The Goa Education Department on Tuesday asked teaching and non-teaching staff of schools to get vaccinated against COVID-19 urgently, adding that those who fail to do so must submit a negative RT-PCR report weekly. "The teaching and non-teaching staff members must...ensure that their family members are also vaccinated...as a precaution," the order, signed by Director of Education DR Bhagat, read.

The death toll from a fire that erupted at a COVID-19 hospital in southern Iraq rose to 92, health officials said on Tuesday. Over 100 people were injured in the fire in Nasiriyah, officials said. An investigation showed the fire began when sparks from faulty wiring spread to an oxygen tank that then exploded, police and civil defence authorities said.

The committee investigating the alleged fake COVID-19 tests conducted during Haridwar's Kumbh Mela has verified 60,000 phone numbers, Chief Development Officer Saurabh Gaharwar said. The labs under scanner claimed to have conducted 1.5 lakh tests but it was alleged that they forged data like phone and Aadhaar card numbers. Gaharwar revealed another 35,000 numbers are yet to be verified.

The Pulwama district administration, under the direction of the Jammu and Kashmir administration, is constructing a 200-bed pre-fabricated COVID-19 hospital as part of preparations against a possible third wave of coronavirus. The total cost of the project is about ??4.22 lakh. Deputy Commissioner, Pulwama, Baseer Ul Haq Choudhary said that the hospital will benefit people from far-flung areas.

The Centre on Tuesday said the world is witnessing the third wave of COVID-19, adding that people have to "join hands to ensure that the third wave doesn't hit India". "PM (Narendra Modi) today clearly said that we should focus on keeping third wave at bay, instead of discussing when it would come in India," NITI Aayog's VK Paul said.

The Bombay High Court during a hearing cited the Wimbledon finals while urging for a rapid pace of COVID-19 vaccination. "The Wimbledon finals were the sight of the year...Not a single person was wearing a mask...The stadium was jam-packed,? the judges said. ??When will India see such a situation? Vaccinating everyone is the key to it,? said the HC.

A deaf-mute unmarried man in his forties was allegedly sterilised without notice in UP's Etah, after being taken to a hospital on pretext of COVID-19 vaccination, police said. According to his brother, an ASHA worker lured him saying he'd be paid ??3,500. A district official, however, said that the man's sister-in-law asked the worker to take him for the procedure.

Dera Sacha Sauda chief Gurmeet Ram Rahim Singh was on Tuesday admitted to the All India Institute of Medical Sciences (AIIMS) in Delhi for an endoscopy. Ram Rahim is serving a 20-year-sentence for raping two of his disciples in August 2017. He had tested positive for COVID-19, earlier in June.

Google and Alphabet's CEO Sundar Pichai during an interview with BBC was asked by interviewer Amol Rajan, "When did you last cry?" Pichai responded, "Oh, seeing the morgue trucks parked around the world through COVID-19 and seeing what has happened in India over the past month." In June, Google.org announced an additional $15.5-million towards measures to fight COVID-19 in India.

Citing frequent changes to vaccine-procurement policies, over 10 small private hospitals in Pune decided to opt out of the COVID-19 vaccination drive. "Several small and medium-sized hospitals sent a proposal...for procuring one lakh vaccine doses, which was rejected after Centre's guideline on purchase deals...came into effect," said Dr Sanjay Patil, Chairman of Hospital Board of India, Pune.

Mumbai's BKC Jumbo vaccination centre on Monday resumed inoculation after two days of closure due to a shortage of vaccines. "BKC can only provide 200 doses of Covishield and 200 doses of Covaxin daily. In that, 50 is through online registration and 150 for walk-in first come first serve basis," said Dr Rajesh Dere, Dean, BKC Jumbo COVID-19 vaccination centre.

Uttar Pradesh CM Yogi Adityanath on Monday resumed his 'Janata Darshan' programme to address people's grievances at his official residence in Lucknow. The programme has reportedly resumed after a gap of almost a year and a half. It has been resumed as the COVID-19 situation has come under control, said an official.

WHO chief scientist Soumya Swaminathan said that mixing of different COVID-19 vaccines was a "little bit of a dangerous trend". She said, "We are in a data-free, evidence-free zone as far as mix and match (is concerned)." She added, "It'll be a chaotic situation...if citizens start deciding when and who'll be taking a second, a third and a fourth dose."

Ahead of the monsoon session of the Parliament, Lok Sabha Speaker Om Birla on Monday said that 311 members of the lower house have been fully vaccinated. "Twenty three members have not administered any vaccine for some reason," Birla added. The Speaker further informed that all arrangements for conducting COVID-19 RT-PCR tests have been made in the Parliamentary complex.

The Greater Hyderabad Municipal Corporation (GHMC) has started sanitation works to prevent the rise of mosquito-borne diseases, including dengue, for the past 10 days in Hyderabad. "We have just got a breather from COVID-19 cases, so the GHMC is being proactive to prevent any other disease from rising," said Mohammed Naseeruddin, Corporator for the Nanal Nagar ward.

As many as 4,000 vehicles that were on their way to Mussoorie and Nainital were sent back by Uttarakhand Police last weekend. This comes as the state government announced strict COVID-19 protocols to prevent tourist destinations from being overcrowded. Uttarakhand Police has set up additional checkpoints and barricades on the roads that lead to famous tourist spots in the state.

Dutch caretaker PM Mark Rutte on Monday apologised for "an error of judgment" over the easing of COVID-19 restrictions after the country began to report a surge in cases following the relaxation. "What we thought would be possible, turned out not to be possible in practice," he added. Last week, Rutte had reimposed some coronavirus-related restrictions.

Authorities in Jammu and Kashmir's Anantnag district have made a COVID-19 negative report and vaccine certificate mandatory for visitors to tourist places to prevent the resurgence of coronavirus, officials said on Sunday. As per an official order, joint enforcement teams of civil and police administration have been constituted to ensure the observance of COVID-19 SOPs at tourist destinations.

Indian Medical Association (IMA) has said that the third COVID-19 wave was "inevitable, imminent" and urged states to control mass gatherings. It 'painfully' noted that people were indulging in tourism and religious gatherings without protocols and said, "Opening up these rituals and enabling people without vaccination [to join] these gatherings are potential super-spreaders for the third wave."

Ahead of the monsoon session of the Parliament, Lok Sabha Speaker Om Birla on Monday said that 311 members of the lower house have been fully vaccinated. "Twenty three members have not administered any vaccine for some reason," Birla added. The Speaker further informed that all arrangements for conducting COVID-19 RT-PCR tests have been made in the Parliamentary complex.

A 26-year-old Indian national was jailed for nine months in Singapore after he tried to fly out despite being told to wait for his COVID-19 test results at a hospital's screening area. Balachandran Parthiban, who had fever and sore throat, left hospital without notice and went to the airport using public bus and taxi. His test came positive after arrest.

Jharkhand CM Hemant Soren has requested people to worship Lord Jagannath at their homes as Rath Yatra won't be taken out this year due to the COVID-19 situation. "It pains me to not allow Rath Yatra but many stern steps have to be taken to secure our tomorrow," Soren said. Celebration of many festivals had to be subdued, he added.

Thailand will combine Sinovac's COVID-19 vaccine and AstraZeneca's vaccine under its national immunisation programme, Thai Health Minister Anutin Charnvirakul said. The move aims to increase protection against variants of COVID-19, he added. Notably, this comes after Thai Health Ministry reported that over 600 medical workers who received two doses of Sinovac's vaccine were infected with COVID-19.

Mumbai's BKC Jumbo vaccination centre on Monday resumed inoculation after two days of closure due to a shortage of vaccines. "BKC can only provide 200 doses of Covishield and 200 doses of Covaxin daily. In that, 50 is through online registration and 150 for walk-in first come first serve basis," said Dr Rajesh Dere, Dean, BKC Jumbo COVID-19 vaccination centre.

Thailand will combine Sinovac's COVID-19 vaccine and AstraZeneca's vaccine under its national immunisation programme, Thai Health Minister Anutin Charnvirakul said. The move aims to increase protection against variants of COVID-19, he added. Notably, this comes after Thai Health Ministry reported that over 600 medical workers who received two doses of Sinovac's vaccine were infected with COVID-19.

The NEET (UG) 2021 exam will be held on September 12 across the country following COVID-19 protocols, Education Minister Dharmendra Pradhan said on Monday. The application process will begin from 5 pm tomorrow (July 13) through the NTA website(s), Pradhan said. In order to ensure social distancing, the examination will be conducted in 198 cities instead of 155, he added.

An Australian government advertisement to spread awareness about COVID-19 vaccination has shown a young woman gasping for air while being hooked to a ventilator in a hospital. The text at the end of the clip says, "COVID-19 can affect anyone...Book your vaccination." The ad has been criticised by people online for being 'too graphic' and 'scary'.

Authorities in Jammu and Kashmir's Anantnag district have made a COVID-19 negative report and vaccine certificate mandatory for visitors to tourist places to prevent the resurgence of coronavirus, officials said on Sunday. As per an official order, joint enforcement teams of civil and police administration have been constituted to ensure the observance of COVID-19 SOPs at tourist destinations.

Union Minister of State for Health and Family Welfare, Dr Bharati Pravin Pawar said the Centre has already sent teams to the states where COVID-19 cases are rising. Speaking about the rise in cases in Maharashtra and Kerala, Dr Pawar said "Central government's team is working on the ground. We're continuously monitoring the situation, taking feedbacks from state governments regularly."

The Delhi government on Monday ordered the closure of Janpath market for the violation of COVID-19 protocols and for not following the guidelines issued by the Delhi Disaster Management Authority (DDMA). Markets in Lajpat Nagar, Laxmi Nagar, Kamla Nagar and Sarojini Nagar are among those shut in recent weeks by the DDMA over violation of protocol.

Uttarakhand has extended the COVID-19 curfew in the state till 6 am on July 20 and allowed some relaxation in restrictions with respect to gatherings for weddings and funerals. A government order said that maximum 50 people can attend wedding functions with COVID-19 negative test reports, not older than 72 hours. Maximum 50 people can attend funerals, it said.

Authorities in Jammu and Kashmir's Anantnag district have made a COVID-19 negative report and vaccine certificate mandatory for visitors to tourist places to prevent the resurgence of coronavirus, officials said on Sunday. As per an official order, joint enforcement teams of civil and police administration have been constituted to ensure the observance of COVID-19 SOPs at tourist destinations.

India has reported 37,154 new COVID-19 cases and 724 deaths in the last 24 hours, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. This comes after the country reported 41,506 COVID-19 cases and 895 deaths on Sunday. With this, the total cases in the country reached 3,08,74,376, while the death toll surged to 4,08,764.

Actor Farhan Akhtar, who portrayed the character of sprinter Milkha Singh in the 2013 release 'Bhaag Milkha Bhaag', took to Instagram Stories and celebrated 8 years of the film.  He wrote in the caption, "8 years on...grateful everyday since". Milkha Singh passed away a few weeks ago due to COVID-19 related complications.

Citing frequent changes to vaccine-procurement policies, over 10 small private hospitals in Pune decided to opt out of the COVID-19 vaccination drive. "Several small and medium-sized hospitals sent a proposal...for procuring one lakh vaccine doses, which was rejected after Centre's guideline on purchase deals...came into effect," said Dr Sanjay Patil, Chairman of Hospital Board of India, Pune.

Delhi government's Department of Women and Child Development has identified 268 children who have been orphaned during the COVID-19 pandemic, an official said. "The 268 children...include those who lost their parents to other ailments apart from coronavirus," WCD Director said. Among them, 27 have been placed in institutional care, while others were found living with extended family, she added.

Bengaluru recorded 433 new coronavirus cases and eight new deaths, according to data shared by Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike (BBMP) Chief Commissioner Gaurav Gupta on Sunday. This brings the number of positive cases reported in the city to 12,19,378, the data shows. The total doses administered in the Bengaluru Urban and BBMP areas are 71,28,949, the data also shows.

As many as 390 beneficiaries have applied for Delhi government's scheme to provide financial assistance to the families that lost an earning member due to COVID-19, Social Welfare Minister Rajendra Pal Gautam said. "As of July 9, 220 beneficiaries have applied for a pension of ??2,500 per month and 170 beneficiaries applied for ??50,000 ex gratia amount," Gautam added.

Hyderabad's Nehru Zoological Park resumed operation on Sunday after nearly 70 days and as many as 2,536 people visited on the first day of reopening. The park had been shut amid the COVID-19 pandemic. The authorities stated that every visitor will undergo thermal scanning before the entry and wearing a face mask inside the park has been made mandatory.

A 30-year-old female doctor, Dr Sharda Suman of Lucknow's Ram Manohar Lohia Institute of Medical Sciences, was on Sunday airlifted to KIMS Hospitals Secunderabad for a lung transplant since COVID-19 caused damage to her lungs in April. Her health deteriorated and she was put on ECMO support after an emergency C-section was conducted on May 1 to save her baby.

Dutch caretaker PM Mark Rutte on Monday apologised for "an error of judgment" over the easing of COVID-19 restrictions after the country began to report a surge in cases following the relaxation. "What we thought would be possible, turned out not to be possible in practice," he added. Last week, Rutte had reimposed some coronavirus-related restrictions.

Australian batsman Peter Handscomb has reportedly tested positive for coronavirus while leading Middlesex against Leicestershire in their County Championship Group Two game. Handscomb's last international match was an ODI against England at Birmingham in July 2019. India's Ravichandran Ashwin is also playing county cricket and is currently involved in Surrey's match against Somerset.

Delhi government's Department of Women and Child Development has identified 268 children who have been orphaned during the COVID-19 pandemic, an official said. "The 268 children...include those who lost their parents to other ailments apart from coronavirus," WCD Director said. Among them, 27 have been placed in institutional care, while others were found living with extended family, she added.

Bengaluru recorded 433 new coronavirus cases and eight new deaths, according to data shared by Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike (BBMP) Chief Commissioner Gaurav Gupta on Sunday. This brings the number of positive cases reported in the city to 12,19,378, the data shows. The total doses administered in the Bengaluru Urban and BBMP areas are 71,28,949, the data also shows.

Samajwadi Party chief Akhilesh Yadav has promised to conduct an audit of COVID-19 death toll in Uttar Pradesh if his party comes to power next year following Assembly elections. "Those officers who hid numbers for COVID-19 deaths will face action," Yadav said. "There was a time during the pandemic when it seemed like UP didn't have a government," he added.

WHO chief scientist Soumya Swaminathan said that mixing of different COVID-19 vaccines was a "little bit of a dangerous trend". She said, "We are in a data-free, evidence-free zone as far as mix and match (is concerned)." She added, "It'll be a chaotic situation...if citizens start deciding when and who'll be taking a second, a third and a fourth dose."

Ladakh has become the first Union Territory to vaccinate all its residents and guest population with the first dose of the COVID-19 vaccine, BJP MP Jamyang Tsering Namgyal said. He added that this was made possible "with the efforts of PM Narendra Modi, the Health Ministry, and all COVID-19 warriors". There are currently 115 active COVID-19 cases in Ladakh.

After reports claimed that the Uttarakhand government will review its earlier decision to cancel Kanwar Yatra amid COVID-19, the newly-appointed CM Pushkar Singh Dhami said, "It's a matter of faith but people's lives are also at stake." He added, "Saving lives is our first priority. God wouldn't like it if people lost their lives to COVID-19 due to Kanwar Yatra."

All schools in Puducherry will open for students of classes 9 to 12 from July 16 onwards, CM N Rangaswamy has announced. All colleges will also be reopened from July 16, he said. Puducherry Lieutenant Governor Tamilisai Soundararajan has said that the government aimed to vaccinate the whole Union Territory against COVID-19 before August 15.

Assam CM Himanta Biswa Sarma on Sunday launched a scheme wherein one-time financial assistance of ??2.5 lakh will be given to women whose husbands died due to COVID-19 and their annual family income is less than ??5 lakh. Under the 'Chief Minister's COVID-19 Widows Support Scheme', at least 873 beneficiaries have been identified as of now, said Sarma.

Assam CM Himanta Biswa Sarma on Sunday asked officials to deploy drones in nine districts of the state which have high COVID-19 positivity rates in order to monitor locations where crowds tend to gather so that appropriate steps can be taken. The nine districts are- Biswanath, Dibrugarh, Golaghat, Jorhat, Kamrup (Metro), Lakhimpur, Nagaon, Sonitpur and Sivasagar.

Commenting on the recent Union Cabinet expansion, Congress leader Rahul Gandhi on Sunday said, "The number of ministers has increased, not [COVID-19] vaccines." Rahul also shared a chart that indicated a "shortfall" of 5.1 million vaccinations on Saturday. On July 11, India reported 41,506 new COVID cases in the last 24 hours.

Taking a dig at the Centre, Chhattisgarh Chief Minister Bhupesh Baghel on Sunday said it was the "BJP's habit" to "put blame on others". "An example is the recent Cabinet reshuffle. [COVID-19] vaccines were handled by [PM Narendra] Modi himself. When the vaccination was slammed, he put the blame on Harsh Vardhan and thus he was let go," said Baghel.

Reacting to media reports on Delta Plus COVID-19 variant's spread in Tripura, the Centre issued a statement and said that no case of the variant has been found there. It said that of the 152 samples from Tripura that were sent for genome sequencing, 138 tested positive for Delta variant, 11 for Kappa and 3 for Alpha.

Ladakh has become the first Union Territory to vaccinate all its residents and guest population with the first dose of the COVID-19 vaccine, BJP MP Jamyang Tsering Namgyal said. He added that this was made possible "with the efforts of PM Narendra Modi, the Health Ministry, and all COVID-19 warriors". There are currently 115 active COVID-19 cases in Ladakh.

Pictures of large crowds of people at Delhi's popular Sarojini Nagar market on Sunday has surfaced online. As per the visuals, people can be seen flouting social distancing norms. Earlier, two markets in Karol Bagh were shut down for flouting COVID-19 regulations. Notably, Delhi reported 53 new COVID-19 cases and three deaths in the last 24 hours.

SP chief Akhilesh Yadav accused the Uttar Pradesh government of hiding COVID-19 death figures. "They didn't give the statistics of...deaths as they didn't want to help [people]...When teachers went on [panchayat poll] duty, it was said only three teachers died [due to COVID-19]," Yadav said. A teachers' body had claimed over 1,600 staff succumbed to COVID-19 while on poll duty.

All Sri Lanka players have tested negative for COVID-19 and are likely to begin training from Tuesday. However, coaches and support staff will continue to remain in isolation until Wednesday as batting coach Grant Flower and a team analyst tested positive for the virus this week. The India-Sri Lanka ODIs have already been postponed.

Statewide COVID-19 curfew in Goa has been extended till 7 am on July 19 with further relaxations in restrictions. Gyms will be allowed to open with 50% capacity and sports complexes can open without spectators. Additionally, religious places in the state will also be allowed to open with a maximum of 15 people.

Rajasthan government has ended the weekend curfew, however, 11 pm to 5 am curfew will be imposed daily. Cinema halls and multiplexes can open at 50% capacity from 9 am to 8 pm for people with at least one COVID-19 vaccine dose. Shops and restaurants, where 60% of workers are vaccinated, can open till 8 pm and 10 pm respectively.

Delhi's Sadar Bazaar was partially shut on Sunday for three days for violation of COVID-19 norms. The authorities on Saturday noted crowding and violation of physical distancing norms at the market, forcing the administration to shut it down. Earlier, the Delhi government ordered the closure of Lajpat Nagar market and Rui Mandi in Sadar Bazaar for violation of COVID-19 norms.

Taking a dig at the Centre, Chhattisgarh Chief Minister Bhupesh Baghel on Sunday said it was the "BJP's habit" to "put blame on others". "An example is the recent Cabinet reshuffle. [COVID-19] vaccines were handled by [PM Narendra] Modi himself. When the vaccination was slammed, he put the blame on Harsh Vardhan and thus he was let go," said Baghel.

Australia on Sunday reported its first coronavirus death of this year amid an outbreak of Delta variant in the country's most populous state New South Wales. The state also recorded its highest locally acquired daily cases of the year at 77 on the same day. State Premier Gladys Berejiklian said that cases in and around Sydney are expected to rise.

Pune Rural Police fined 424 people for visiting monsoon tourist spots by violating coronavirus norms till Saturday evening and collected over ??1.99 lakh from them, a senior officer said. "Despite COVID-19 restrictions...many people came to Lonavala which is one of the famous monsoon tourist spots," Pune Rural SP Abhinav Deshmukh said. He added that 100 people visiting Lonavala were fined.

Commenting on the recent Union Cabinet expansion, Congress leader Rahul Gandhi on Sunday said, "The number of ministers has increased, not [COVID-19] vaccines." Rahul also shared a chart that indicated a "shortfall" of 5.1 million vaccinations on Saturday. On July 11, India reported 41,506 new COVID cases in the last 24 hours.

Chief Economic Adviser (CEA) KV Subramanian has asserted that India will see the impact of recent "phenomenal reforms" from the financial year 2022-23. He added that the impact of the second COVID-19 wave on the economy won't be "as large" as the first wave. However, Subramanian said that the momentum of the recovery has been impacted by the second wave.

The Uttar Pradesh government has revised night curfew timings in the state. It will now be implemented from 10 pm to 6 am. Earlier, the night curfew timings in the state were from 9 pm to 7 am. Uttar Pradesh currently has 1,608 active COVID-19 cases. The state reported 100 new COVID-19 cases and four deaths in last 24 hours.

Haryana government has extended the COVID-19 lockdown till 5 am on July 19, while allowing additional relaxations in restrictions. Cinema halls will be allowed to open at 50% seating capacity and spas can open at 50% capacity from 6 am-8 pm. Maximum 100 people are now allowed at weddings and funerals and 200 are allowed for open space gatherings.

As India reported 41,506 COVID-19 cases on Sunday, the government has released the state-wise distribution of the total cases. As many as 11 states and the UT of Delhi have reported over eight lakh cases so far, with Maharashtra topping the list by reporting 61,49,264 confirmed COVID-19 cases. Twelve states and UTs have reported below one lakh confirmed cases.

Pune Rural Police fined 424 people for visiting monsoon tourist spots by violating coronavirus norms till Saturday evening and collected over ??1.99 lakh from them, a senior officer said. "Despite COVID-19 restrictions...many people came to Lonavala which is one of the famous monsoon tourist spots," Pune Rural SP Abhinav Deshmukh said. He added that 100 people visiting Lonavala were fined.

Cautioning people against a possible third wave of COVID-19, Gujarat Deputy CM Nitin Patel has said the coronavirus is "like the Chinese" and one "cannot trust them". "The war [against COVID-19] isn't over yet. It is a temporary cease fire...We have to be ready on the border," Patel added, while speaking at the inauguration of an oxygen plant in Visnagar.

India has reported 41,506 new COVID-19 cases and 895 deaths in the last 24 hours, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare.
