This comes after the country reported 42,766 COVID-19 cases and 1,206 deaths on Saturday. With this, the total cases in the country reached 3,08,37,222, while the death toll surged to 4,08,040.

Rajasthan government has ended the weekend curfew, however, 11 pm to 5 am curfew will be imposed daily. Cinema halls and multiplexes can open at 50% capacity from 9 am to 8 pm for people with at least one COVID-19 vaccine dose. Shops and restaurants, where 60% of workers are vaccinated, can open till 8 pm and 10 pm respectively.

Sharing his views about the ongoing COVID-19 pandemic, actor Nagarjuna said, "I have learnt a lot of patience and humility." He added, "Coronavirus has taught me, 'Don't think you are too big, you can anytime get wiped out. In fact, the whole world can be wiped out. So, don't think you are someone big and won't get affected'."

A 90-year-old woman, who died after falling ill with COVID-19 in March was infected with both the Alpha and Beta variants of coronavirus at the same time, researchers have said. "It is likely that the lady was co-infected with different viruses from two different people," a researcher said. "The phenomenon is probably underestimated," the researcher added.

After a gap of three days, COVID-19 vaccination in Mumbai will resume at over 300 civic and state government-run centres from Monday. The BMC on Saturday received over 85,000 Covishield doses and around 8,000 Covaxin doses. "[The stock]...will last for around two days and...Wednesday onwards the drive will be dependent on the stock we get," Additional Commissioner Suresh Kakani said.

A 90-year-old woman, who died after falling ill with COVID-19 in March was infected with both the Alpha and Beta variants of coronavirus at the same time, researchers have said. "It is likely that the lady was co-infected with different viruses from two different people," a researcher said. "The phenomenon is probably underestimated," the researcher added.

Cautioning people against a possible third wave of COVID-19, Gujarat Deputy CM Nitin Patel has said the coronavirus is "like the Chinese" and one "cannot trust them". "The war [against COVID-19] isn't over yet. It is a temporary cease fire...We have to be ready on the border," Patel added, while speaking at the inauguration of an oxygen plant in Visnagar.

Shiv Sena MP Rahul Shewale said that the party has planned to vaccinate 100% population of Dharavi against COVID-19, in the next 2-3 months. He added that Shiv Sena has booked 10,000 slots for vaccination at private hospitals in the first phase. "We will be booking 30,000 more slots in the second and third phases separately," Shewale said.

Dehradun District Magistrate Dr Ashish Kumar Srivastava has said that tourists entering Mussoorie need to carry a COVID-19 negative report not more than 72 hours old. He further said that tourists also need to register on Dehradun Smart City portal and need to carry proof of hotel booking. This comes amid tourist rush in Mussoorie.

A large crowd of devotees was seen at Mathura's Banke Bihari Temple on Saturday. A video has surfaced online showing several devotees not wearing masks while social distancing is also not followed at the premises. The Uttar Pradesh government had allowed the major temples in Mathura to reopen from June 1 after COVID-19 cases witnessed a decline.

Stating that over 24 countries are having a vertical epidemic curve right now, WHO's COVID-19 Technical Lead Maria Van Kerkhove said, "This is not the situation we should be in when we have tools at hand." "We need to be blunt when we need to be blunt. We are not in a good place," she added.

The Navi Mumbai Municipal Corporation (NMMC) on Friday held a special COVID-19 vaccination drive for transgenders. A total of 124 transgenders were vaccinated in a single day. In addition, 103 workers in a quarry in Turbhe were also vaccinated, NMMC PRO Mahendra Konde said. Mumbai on Friday reported 596 new cases of COVID-19.

Ahead of Tokyo Olympics, IOC President Thomas Bach has said the most important thing is that the Games are happening after spectators were banned from most events due to fourth COVID-19 emergency in Tokyo. "It [banning spectators] was a decision which was necessary to ensure safe Olympic Games," he added. Olympics will be held from July 23 to August 8.

Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman has said India has made CoWIN freely available to all countries given "our firm belief that humanitarian needs outweigh commercial benefits". Participating on the second day of the G20 Finance Ministers and Central Bank Governors Meeting, Sitharaman shared India's successful experience in integrating technology with inclusive service delivery during COVID-19.

Pictures of tourists stuck in traffic as long queue of vehicles blocked roads in Mussoorie, Uttarakhand have surfaced online. "We came here to enjoy with family but due to heavy traffic, we...wasted a lot of time...in the car," a tourist said. A COVID-19 negative report not more than 72 hours old has been made mandatory for tourists entering Mussoorie.

Amid a rush of tourists in hill stations, Union Home Secretary Ajay Kumar Bhalla on Saturday reviewed the steps taken by state governments to check the spread of COVID-19, a government release said. He expressed concern over media reports showing the disregard of COVID-19 appropriate behaviour in hill stations. He added that the second wave is not over yet.

Newly-appointed Uttarakhand CM Pushkar Singh Dhami met Prime Minister Narendra Modi in New Delhi on Saturday and requested him to set up an AIIMS in the Kumaon region. According to an official release, Dhami apprised the PM about the preparations of the state government in view of the possible third COVID-19 wave. He also discussed Char Dham and Kanwar Yatra.

Delhi on Saturday reported 76 fresh coronavirus cases, one death and 81 recoveries, a government release revealed. Over 81,000 tests were conducted in the last 24 hours, taking the positivity rate to 0.09%, the release added. The cumulative positive cases and deaths stand at 14,35,030 and 25,012 respectively. Delhi has 792 active coronavirus cases.

Uttar Pradesh CM Yogi Adityanath, during a virtual meeting on Friday, instructed the concerned officials to ensure proper adherence to COVID-19 safety protocol during the Kanwar Yatra. He said, "Complete adherence to the COVID-19 protocol should be ensured...There shouldn't be any hesitation regarding...safe and successful operation of Kanwar Yatras." The Kanwar Yatra is set to begin from July 25.

Chariot pullers who have tested negative for coronavirus and have been fully vaccinated will be allowed to attend this year's Rath Yatra, an official of Jagannath Temple in Puri, Odisha said on Friday. "No devotees are allowed to participate in Rath Yatra," he added. He said 3,000 servitors and 1,000 temple officials will be allowed to perform rituals.

As many as 13 European Union (EU) countries, Switzerland and Iceland have approved Serum Institute of India-manufactured Covishield COVID-19 vaccine for travellers so far. Belgium became the recent EU country to approve the vaccine. Other EU countries to have given approval are Austria, Bulgaria, Finland, Germany, Greece, Hungary, Ireland, Latvia, Netherlands, Slovenia, Spain and Sweden.

Amid the COVID-19 situation, Kerala's Sabarimala Temple will open for its monthly puja from July 17 to 21, temple authorities said. Only 5,000 devotees who have booked their slots online will be allowed in the temple in a day. Only devotees with both COVID-19 vaccine doses or a negative RT-PCR test report issued within 48 hours will be permitted.

After opening COVID-19 vaccination for pregnant women, the government has listed some conditions in which mothers-to-be must avoid vaccination. These are- severe allergic reaction to last vaccine dose, allergic reaction to injectable therapies, COVID-19 treated with monoclonal antibodies and diagnosed infection. Vaccination must be delayed by 12 weeks from COVID-19 diagnosis, it said.

The Navi Mumbai Municipal Corporation (NMMC) on Friday held a special COVID-19 vaccination drive for transgenders. A total of 124 transgenders were vaccinated in a single day. In addition, 103 workers in a quarry in Turbhe were also vaccinated, NMMC PRO Mahendra Konde said. Mumbai on Friday reported 596 new cases of COVID-19.

The WHO is likely to take a decision on including Bharat Biotech's COVID-19 vaccine Covaxin in its  Emergency Use List (EUL) within four to six weeks, WHO chief scientist Soumya Swaminathan has said. "We currently have six vaccines approved with EUL...We continue to look at Covaxin," said Swaminathan. Covaxin has shown 77.8% efficacy against symptomatic COVID-19 in phase 3 trials.

The Gurugram health department will administer the Russian-made COVID-19 vaccine, Sputnik V, from July 10 at a government polyclinic in Sector-31 free of cost. Reportedly, Gurugram will be Haryana's first district to administer Sputnik V at its government facility. To maintain its temperature, deep freezers have been placed at the Sector-31 polyclinic and other locations, said an official.

Saudi Arabia's Food and Drug Authority on Friday approved Moderna's COVID-19 vaccine for use in the kingdom, the state news agency SPA said. Moderna is the fourth COVID-19 vaccine to get approval in the country after Pfizer-BioNTech, AstraZeneca and Johnson & Johnson. Saudi Arabia, which has reported over 4.9 lakh COVID-19 cases, has administered nearly two crore COVID-19 vaccine doses.

European Commission President Ursula von der Leyen said the European Union (EU) has hit its target of delivering "enough vaccines to member states to fully vaccinate at least 70% of the adult population". "The EU has kept its word," she added. "The member states must do everything...to ensure that vaccinations move forward. Only then will we...be safe," she further said.

Centre on Friday said pregnant women must take COVID-19 vaccine without any hesitation as scientific studies are now in favour of pregnant women getting vaccinated. "For pregnant women, COVID-19 becomes a more serious disease as the physiology of pregnant women is different," NITI Aayog Member (health) Dr VK Paul said. "COVID-19 may increase chances of premature delivery," he added.

The government is working actively with the vaccine manufacturer Moderna to see how its COVID-19 vaccine will be available in India, NITI Aayog Member (health) Dr VK Paul said. "Moderna vaccine is under emergency use authorisation," he added. Moderna COVID-19 vaccine was approved for restricted emergency use in India in June, becoming the fourth COVID-19 vaccine approved in India.

Tripura Health Surveillance Officer Deep Kumar Debbarma has said that at least 138 cases of Delta Plus COVID-19 variant have been found in the state. Debbarma added that 151 samples were sent to a laboratory in West Bengal, for the virological test. "10 others tested positive for Delta variant while three cases of alpha variant were found," he further said.

Cuba has approved its homemade coronavirus vaccine Abdala for emergency use, making it the first Latin American country to develop a COVID-19 vaccine. Cuban health regulator, CECMED, approved the shot after the manufacturers last month announced that their three-dose vaccine is 92.28% effective against COVID-19. Cuba had begun immunising its population using Abdala in May even before the approval.

Amid the COVID-19 situation, Kerala's Sabarimala Temple will open for its monthly puja from July 17 to 21, temple authorities said. Only 5,000 devotees who have booked their slots online will be allowed in the temple in a day. Only devotees with both COVID-19 vaccine doses or a negative RT-PCR test report issued within 48 hours will be permitted.

South Korea on Friday recorded its highest-ever one-day rise in the number of COVID-19 cases as it reported 1,378 new infections. This is the third straight day that South Korea has reported a record number of coronavirus cases. The country, with a population of 52 million people, has reported over 1.65 lakh coronavirus cases and over 2,030 coronavirus-related deaths.

The government is working actively with the vaccine manufacturer Moderna to see how its COVID-19 vaccine will be available in India, NITI Aayog Member (health) Dr VK Paul said. "Moderna vaccine is under emergency use authorisation," he added. Moderna COVID-19 vaccine was approved for restricted emergency use in India in June, becoming the fourth COVID-19 vaccine approved in India.

Cuba has approved its homemade coronavirus vaccine Abdala for emergency use, making it the first Latin American country to develop a COVID-19 vaccine. Cuban health regulator, CECMED, approved the shot after the manufacturers last month announced that their three-dose vaccine is 92.28% effective against COVID-19. Cuba had begun immunising its population using Abdala in May even before the approval.

A video showing several tourists in Pune at Lonavala's Bhushi Dam has surfaced online. While police personnel are also seen deployed at the spot, the video shows tourists without masks and not following social distancing norms. "Is COVID-19 over?," commented a Twitter user on the video. Earlier, videos of tourists in Dharamshala and Kempty Falls had gone viral.

Indonesia is facing a shortage of oxygen amid a surge in COVID-19 cases in the country. The government has reached out to several countries, including China and Singapore, to address oxygen shortage, Luhut Pandjaitan, Minister in charge of Indonesia's pandemic response, said. Earlier this month, 63 people had died at a hospital in Indonesia's Yogyakarta city due to oxygen shortage.

The Cyberabad Police arrested a couple who worked as caretakers at TIMS hospital, Hyderabad, on charges of looting jewellery and other valuables from COVID-19 patients. The police recovered stolen items worth ??10 lakh that included 16 tolas of gold ornaments and 80 tolas of silver anklets. The accused were arrested while they were trying to sell the stolen jewellery.

WHO Chief Scientist Soumya Swaminathan has said COVID-19 pandemic isn't slowing down. Cases are rising in five of six WHO regions, and mortality rate in Africa has jumped by around 40%, she said. She added the reasons for the surge are the fast-spreading Delta variant, pandemic fatigue, relaxation of safety measures like physical distancing rules, and slow vaccination rollouts globally.

Section 144 will remain in place in Noida till August 30 amid the COVID-19 pandemic, as per the new order. However, the relaxations as part of the unlock will continue. Gyms, cinema halls and sports complexes will continue to function at 50% capacity. People can dine in at restaurants from 7 am to 9 pm, as per previous orders.

Saudi Arabia's Food and Drug Authority on Friday approved Moderna's COVID-19 vaccine for use in the kingdom, the state news agency SPA said. Moderna is the fourth COVID-19 vaccine to get approval in the country after Pfizer-BioNTech, AstraZeneca and Johnson & Johnson. Saudi Arabia, which has reported over 4.9 lakh COVID-19 cases, has administered nearly two crore COVID-19 vaccine doses.

Commenting on resuming work amid the ongoing COVID-19 pandemic, actress Huma Qureshi said, "Of course, we have to be safe and careful, but we also have to earn a living, all of us." She further said, "We have to figure out a way while being responsible, on how to go out and work."

As many as 13 European Union (EU) countries, Switzerland and Iceland have approved Serum Institute of India-manufactured Covishield COVID-19 vaccine for travellers so far. Belgium became the recent EU country to approve the vaccine. Other EU countries to have given approval are Austria, Bulgaria, Finland, Germany, Greece, Hungary, Ireland, Latvia, Netherlands, Slovenia, Spain and Sweden.

India reported 42,766 new COVID-19 cases and 45,254 recoveries in last 24 hours, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. The number of COVID-19 deaths reported so far in the country reached 4,07,145 as 1,206 new deaths were reported. Active COVID-19 cases in the country stand at 4,55,033.

Hyderabad's Nehru Zoological Park, which was closed since May 2 owing to COVID-19, will reopen with restrictions from July 11. The public areas in the zoo will be sanitised twice every day, authorities said. They, however, advised children below 10 years and adults above 65 years of age against visiting the zoo, particularly during weekends and public holidays.

South Korea on Friday recorded its highest-ever one-day rise in the number of COVID-19 cases as it reported 1,378 new infections. This is the third straight day that South Korea has reported a record number of coronavirus cases. The country, with a population of 52 million people, has reported over 1.65 lakh coronavirus cases and over 2,030 coronavirus-related deaths.

UP's Gautam Buddha Nagar is set to vaccinate around 50,000 pregnant women against COVID-19. "There is no known risk to the foetus...studies have shown that pregnant women could even pass on their antibodies to the child," Suhas LY, GB Nagar DM, said. "Out of the 50,000 pregnant women...over 36,400 are pregnant for the first time," the chief medical officer said.

The Manipur government has imposed budgetary ceilings to control the state expenditure for fiscal 2021-2022. "The COVID-19 pandemic has seriously impacted the resource availability of the state government. The transfers from the central government and receipts from state's own resources are likely to see a sizeable reduction," said the state finance department in a statement.

Several pictures of tourists at Himachal Pradesh's Kasauli have surfaced online. As per a local, the police is issuing challans to those who are not wearing a mask amid COVID-19. Earlier, referring to the viral pictures of crowded hill stations, NITI Aayog Member Dr VK Paul had said, "We're only giving the virus opportunities to spread by our irresponsible behaviour."

Cuba has approved its homemade coronavirus vaccine Abdala for emergency use, making it the first Latin American country to develop a COVID-19 vaccine. Cuban health regulator, CECMED, approved the shot after the manufacturers last month announced that their three-dose vaccine is 92.28% effective against COVID-19. Cuba had begun immunising its population using Abdala in May even before the approval.

A Delhi court on Saturday denied bail to Kartik Garg, who was arrested for possessing fake Remdesivir injections, which are used for COVID-19 treatment. Calling the offences "serious in nature", the court said, "The applicant in those unprecedented times attempted to play with lives of patients." In April, seven vials were recovered from the car Garg was travelling.

Pictures of tourists flouting COVID-19 protocol at tourist places in Haridwar have surfaced. "We feel like we have come out of jail after two years. There's a huge crowd but we aren't scared of COVID-19. We have come here before the third wave," a tourist was quoted as saying by ANI. People were seen without masks at the tourist spots.

After opening COVID-19 vaccination for pregnant women, the government has listed some conditions in which mothers-to-be must avoid vaccination. These are- severe allergic reaction to last vaccine dose, allergic reaction to injectable therapies, COVID-19 treated with monoclonal antibodies and diagnosed infection. Vaccination must be delayed by 12 weeks from COVID-19 diagnosis, it said.

Union Home Secretary Ajay Bhalla on Saturday held a COVID-19 review meet during which it was observed that the overall case positivity rate is declining in India. However, the case positivity rate in certain districts of Rajasthan, Kerala, Maharashtra, Tamil Nadu, West Bengal, Uttarakhand and Himachal Pradesh is over 10%, which is a cause for concern, a government release said.

Centre on Friday said pregnant women must take COVID-19 vaccine without any hesitation as scientific studies are now in favour of pregnant women getting vaccinated. "For pregnant women, COVID-19 becomes a more serious disease as the physiology of pregnant women is different," NITI Aayog Member (health) Dr VK Paul said. "COVID-19 may increase chances of premature delivery," he added.

Amid rising concerns over people violating COVID-19 norms at tourist places, government gave examples of countries that witnessed rise in cases due to crowding. "Look at the UK. During Euro 2020, there was a sharp rise in the number of infections there...A resurgence is also being observed in Russia, Bangladesh, South Korea, Indonesia," Health Ministry Joint Secretary Lav Agarwal said.

Pune Zilla Parishad CEO Ayush Prasad has said that a survey conducted by the Health Department and gram panchayat has identified 107 villages where daily COVID-19 cases are increasing. "We're going to strengthen...precautionary measures in these areas," he added. "To take stock of the situation, I will hold a meeting through video conference with all these gram panchayats," Prasad said.

The Gurugram health department will administer the Russian-made COVID-19 vaccine, Sputnik V, from July 10 at a government polyclinic in Sector-31 free of cost. Reportedly, Gurugram will be Haryana's first district to administer Sputnik V at its government facility. To maintain its temperature, deep freezers have been placed at the Sector-31 polyclinic and other locations, said an official.

Uttarakhand Chief Minister Pushkar Singh Dhami has ordered hotels in Nainital and Dehradun to cap the occupancy at 50% amid an influx of tourists. "Challans are being issued to those who aren't wearing masks. We...will follow guidelines to contain the spread of the virus," Dhami said. Dehradun authorities have also made COVID-19 negative report mandatory for travellers entering Mussoorie.

The WHO is likely to take a decision on including Bharat Biotech's COVID-19 vaccine Covaxin in its  Emergency Use List (EUL) within four to six weeks, WHO chief scientist Soumya Swaminathan has said. "We currently have six vaccines approved with EUL...We continue to look at Covaxin," said Swaminathan. Covaxin has shown 77.8% efficacy against symptomatic COVID-19 in phase 3 trials.

India's limited-overs series against Sri Lanka has been postponed after COVID-19 outbreak hit the Sri Lankan camp. The ODI series will now start on July 18 instead of July 13, while the second ODI and third ODI will take place on July 20 and July 23 respectively. Meanwhile, the three T20Is will take place on July 25, 27 and 29.

The Krishi Vigyan Kendra of Jhabua in Madhya Pradesh has written to the ICMR urging it to prescribe 'Kadaknath therapy' for those recovering from post-COVID-19 complications. Kadaknath is the state's unique black poultry breed. It said that Kadaknath- based products such as its meat, eggs and soup can provide the necessary nutritional support for the recovery of post-COVID-19 patients.

Priyanka Chopra, who started a fundraiser in April for COVID-19 relief in India, recently took to Instagram to share that she has raised close to $1.3 million. "This, in turn, has provided necessary healthcare, meals, ration, and now...vaccination support to those most in need across the country," she wrote. Priyanka also thanked the people who contributed to the fundraiser.

Pakistan's Planning and Developing Minister Asad Umar said there are "clear early signs" of the fourth COVID-19 wave starting in Pakistan. Umar blamed poor compliance with coronavirus-related standard operating procedures (SOPs) and spread of coronavirus variants, particularly the Delta variant, for the fourth wave in the country. Pakistan has reported more than 9.6 lakh of COVID-19 cases so far.

Johannesburg's Mayor Geoff Makhubo passed away due to coronavirus on Friday, an official statement said. Makhubo was hospitalised following a positive COVID-19 test result in late June. South Africa is currently witnessing the third wave of COVID-19, with Johannesburg, one of the country's largest cities, and the surrounding Gauteng province being one of the worst affected areas.

Actor Sharad Kelkar, who has resumed shooting for his projects, spoke about working amid the coronavirus pandemic and said, "You've to take...precautions and be mentally positive." "You can't stay in fear whether you're shooting or not, or just staying at home," he added. "You of course have some apprehensions when coming on set, but you've to work," Sharad further said.

The Finance Ministry on Friday said targeted fiscal relief, monetary policy and a rapid pace of vaccination are spurring economic recovery after the devastating impact of the second COVID-19 wave. Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman last month unveiled a ??6.29 lakh crore stimulus package to restart the economy, and announced free visas for five lakh tourists to boost India's travel industry.

Three thieves who had broken into a house in Bengaluru while the owners were quarantined elsewhere after the death of a family member due to COVID-19 were arrested by the Bengaluru Police. The police seized gold and silver worth ??22.50 lakh, a tempo van, mobile phones and cash worth ??92 lakh from them.

Amid a drop in COVID-19 cases, the Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj International Airport (CSMIA) in Mumbai registered an approximate 60% increase in passenger traffic in June 2021 as compared to May 2021, the airport said in a statement. It further said that CSMIA catered to approximately 72,61,158 passengers across domestic and international destinations in the first six months of the year.

The Delhi government has ordered the Art, Culture and Language (ACL) department to maintain a database of active artists in order to include them in various welfare schemes amid the COVID-19 pandemic. Delhi Deputy CM Manish Sisodia said that a database on the basis of the addresses of the artists will also help in their localised engagement.

Weekend and night curfews have been lifted in Punjab and gatherings of 100 persons indoors and 200 outdoors have been allowed from Monday. While schools will remain shut, colleges and coaching centres can operate if all staff and students received at least one COVID-19 vaccine dose. People vaccinated with at least one dose allowed at places like malls, bars, gyms.

Sri Lanka cricket team's Data Analyst GT Niroshan has tested positive for COVID-19, four days ahead of the team's first ODI against India. This is the second coronavirus case to hit the Sri Lanka camp after batting coach Grant Flower tested positive on Thursday. The Sri Lankan team is currently under quarantine after returning from England.

The Delhi government's Department of Women and Child Development will undertake a survey to identify the children orphaned due to the COVID-19 pandemic. As per the department, 20 welfare officials will conduct the survey in different childcare homes, district offices and other institutions. The survey will be conducted by July 20, it added.

Spanish Tourism Minister Reyes Maroto claimed that Spain is a safe destination for tourists even though COVID-19 cases are rising. "Governments must not raise alarms...We cannot measure...epidemiological situation only based on cumulated incidence," she said. "We've over 40% of the population vaccinated...It's very important to convey that there is no hospital pressure in Spain," she added.

PM Narendra Modi has lauded the Indian Institute of Science (IISc), Bengaluru for its role in fighting COVID-19. "The IISc team shared an interesting presentation on...efforts in education such as training maths/science teachers, COVID-19 work," tweeted PM Modi. The IISc has developed 'CovidWATCH', a rapid monitoring tool for regions with low smartphone penetration, said IISc Director.

Punjab government on Friday decided to lift weekend and night curfew restrictions in the state. The government also ordered opening of bars, cinema halls, restaurants and malls, among other places, subject to all eligible staff members and visitors having taken at least one dose of COVID-19 vaccine. It also allowed gatherings of 100 persons indoors and 200 outdoors from Monday.

A video showing several tourists in Dharamshala, Himachal Pradesh has surfaced online. Many of the tourists can be seen without masks, violating COVID-19 norms. Earlier, pictures from Manali flooded with tourists had gone viral. The Health Ministry had earlier warned against 'revenge travel', while highlighting media reports on rising tourist numbers in hill stations.

The government today said that Kerala and Maharashtra reported 53% of the total COVID-19 cases recorded in India last week. It added that 80% of new cases in India are being reported from 90 districts, out of which 29 are in Kerala and Maharashtra. Further, 66 districts in the country are reporting more than 10% COVID-19 positivity rate.

NITI Aayog member Dr VK Paul on Friday said it's important for pregnant women to get vaccinated against COVID-19, adding that "it is a matter of two lives". The government explained that coronavirus infection in pregnant women can increase certain risks, like pre-term delivery. Last week, the Centre revised its guidelines to allow pregnant women to get the coronavirus vaccine.

The Calcutta High Court has dismissed a PIL seeking CBI probe into the alleged fake COVID-19 vaccination camp in Kolkata. The court said it is not required at this stage. The matter pertains to a fake vaccination camp set up by Debanjan Deb in Kolkata where more than 100 people, including TMC MP Mimi Chakraborty, were administered vaccines.

Pakistan's Planning and Developing Minister Asad Umar said there are "clear early signs" of the fourth COVID-19 wave starting in Pakistan. Umar blamed poor compliance with coronavirus-related standard operating procedures (SOPs) and spread of coronavirus variants, particularly the Delta variant, for the fourth wave in the country. Pakistan has reported more than 9.6 lakh of COVID-19 cases so far.

PM Narendra Modi on Friday chaired a high-level meeting on oxygen availability amid the COVID-19 pandemic and instructed officials to ensure that oxygen plants are made functional soon, a statement from his office revealed. The officials informed him that over 1,500 PSA oxygen plants are coming up. Once these plants are functional, they would support over four lakh oxygenated beds.

As pictures and videos showed several tourists crowding and violating COVID-19 norms in Himachal Pradesh, state's DGP Sanjay Kundu said that work from home (WFH) culture has "almost turned out to be work from Himachal Pradesh". "We are geared to welcome everyone into Himachal Pradesh but please follow all the guidelines," he added.

The Bar Council of Delhi (BCD) on Friday temporarily suspended a lawyer's license as he allegedly submitted a fake COVID-19 positive report to seek financial assistance. The council said advocate Sonu Yadav's report was sent to the laboratory for verification and it was confirmed that no such report was issued. BCD said his actions amount to "forgery and cheating".

NITI Aayog member Dr VK Paul on Friday said it's important for pregnant women to get vaccinated against COVID-19, adding that "it is a matter of two lives". The government explained that coronavirus infection in pregnant women can increase certain risks, like pre-term delivery. Last week, the Centre revised its guidelines to allow pregnant women to get the coronavirus vaccine.

Delhi's Gaffar and Naiwala markets in the Karol Bagh area have been shut for 48 hours for violating COVID-19 norms. The markets will remain closed from 10 pm on Friday till 10 pm on July 11. Apart from this, the DDA market in Rohini's Sector-13 has also been shut till July 12 for flouting COVID-19 guidelines.

The Delhi Disaster Management Authority (DDMA) has approved a colour-coded Graded Response Action Plan that will prescribe the level of restrictions needed in case of COVID-19 third wave. The alerts- yellow, amber, orange and red will be based on the positivity rate of two consecutive days, cumulative fresh cases over a week and the average oxygen requirement for a week.

Sri Lanka cricket team's Data Analyst GT Niroshan has tested positive for COVID-19, four days ahead of the team's first ODI against India. This is the second coronavirus case to hit the Sri Lanka camp after batting coach Grant Flower tested positive on Thursday. The Sri Lankan team is currently under quarantine after returning from England.

Reacting to the video of hundreds of tourists bathing at Mussoorie's Kempty Falls, Health Ministry Joint Secretary Lav Agarwal said, "Are we doing the right things? Is it not an open invitation for COVID-19 virus to infect us?" Meanwhile, NITI Aayog Member Dr VK Paul said that people violating COVID-19 norms at tourist spots is "a serious cause of concern".

The District Consumer Disputes Redressal Commission of Chandigarh directed the Superintendent of Model Jail to take action against its prison officials after a suspect in one of the cases was produced in court without a mask amid COVID-19. While the accused said that the jail had run out of masks, the Superintendent claimed that the accused lied before the commission.

The Pune district administration has reportedly administered over 50 lakh COVID-19 vaccine doses. Over 19 lakh persons, aged above 45 years, have been administered the first dose, while 7.8 lakh received both doses. In the 18-44 age group, 15.71 lakh received first dose, while 40,764 received both doses. ??Pune is behind only Mumbai, which has administered over 60 lakh doses.

Johannesburg's Mayor Geoff Makhubo passed away due to coronavirus on Friday, an official statement said. Makhubo was hospitalised following a positive COVID-19 test result in late June. South Africa is currently witnessing the third wave of COVID-19, with Johannesburg, one of the country's largest cities, and the surrounding Gauteng province being one of the worst affected areas.

Kerala on Friday reported 13,563 fresh coronavirus cases and 130 deaths, which pushed the case and death tally to 30,39,029 and 14,380 respectively. "Out of those who were found infected today, 52 reached the state from outside while 12,769 contracted the disease from their contacts," Health Minister Veena George said. The test positivity rate in Kerala stands at 10.4%.

Asserting that COVID-19 is not over yet, Himachal Pradesh Chief Minister Jairam Thakur on Friday appealed to tourists to follow COVID-19 norms. "I held a virtual meeting with districts' officials and directed them to monitor and regulate the crowd. Hotels are being asked to follow SOPs," said the CM concerned over the increasing number of tourists in the state

Pune district administration has set up a special task force of paediatricians to prevent a possible third wave of coronavirus. A total of 6,156 beds, including 3,429 in Pune city, 1,913 in Pimpri-Chinchwad and 814 in rural areas, have been planned in government and private hospitals for children. PMC has also started the recruitment process for paediatricians and neonatal specialists.

The US will send 15 lakh doses of the Johnson & Johnson COVID-19 vaccine to Nepal and 5 lakh doses of Moderna's vaccine to Bhutan, a White House official said on Friday. The initiative is part of an effort by the US to compete with China to deepen its geopolitical influence through so-called vaccine diplomacy, Reuters reported.

North Korea rejected doses of the Oxford-AstraZeneca COVID-19 vaccine that were to be delivered for free under COVAX scheme due to concerns about potential side effects, a South Korean think tank reported. The reclusive country isn't keen on Chinese vaccines due to concerns about their efficacy, it said. North Korea has shown an interest in the Russian vaccine, it added.

Vaccination drive will remain suspended at civic and government-run vaccination centres in Mumbai on Friday, due to a shortage of COVID-19 vaccines, the BMC has announced. Officials said they are expecting to receive about 1.50 lakh doses on Friday. "I've spoken to state government officials. We expect more stock in July as compared to June," Additional Commissioner Suresh Kakani said.

North Korea rejected doses of the Oxford-AstraZeneca COVID-19 vaccine that were to be delivered for free under COVAX scheme due to concerns about potential side effects, a South Korean think tank reported. The reclusive country isn't keen on Chinese vaccines due to concerns about their efficacy, it said. North Korea has shown an interest in the Russian vaccine, it added.

Vaccination drive will remain suspended at civic and government-run vaccination centres in Mumbai on Friday, due to a shortage of COVID-19 vaccines, the BMC has announced. Officials said they are expecting to receive about 1.50 lakh doses on Friday. "I've spoken to state government officials. We expect more stock in July as compared to June," Additional Commissioner Suresh Kakani said.

The international airports at Mumbai and Hyderabad have started getting ready for the UAE flight services, which are due to be restarted on July 15, reports said. Hyderabad airport has partnered up with Mapmygenome, a COVID-19 testing lab certified by ICMR. Reports added that the COVID-19 testing facility at the Hyderabad airport will operate 24 hours a day.

In his first meeting with the new Council of Ministers, Prime Minister Narendra Modi said that everyone must remember that the threat of COVID-19 is "far from over". The PM added that there is "no space for carelessness or complacency". "A single mistake would have far-reaching impacts and weaken the fight against the pandemic," PM Modi said.

On the day when the newly appointed Telangana Pradesh Congress Committee chief Revanth Reddy took charge, he along with other Congress leaders were arrested by Hyderabad Police for participating in a rally. Reports said that Congress leaders went ahead with the rally despite being denied permission for the same. COVID-19 safety protocols were not followed at the rally, police said.

The Savitribai Phule Pune University has vaccinated more than 200 foreign students against COVID-19 on Thursday. SPPU Vice-Chancellor Dr Nitin Karmalkar said, "This is the first time in the country that foreign students are being vaccinated in this manner." Dr Vijay Khare, Director, International Centre said that the program is establishing cultural ties at the international level.

Punjab Chief Minister Captain Amarinder Singh on Friday sought the Centre's intervention to increase the supply of COVID-19 vaccines as the state has run out of Covishield and left with a day's stock of Covaxin. The CM also pointed out that the state has already vaccinated nearly 83 lakh eligible people.

US Food and Drug Administration and the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention have said that fully vaccinated Americans "don't need a booster shot at this time". This comes after Pfizer said it will seek US authorisation for a third COVID-19 vaccine dose in August. Pfizer cited evidence of risk of reinfection six months after inoculation and Delta variant's spread.

Even as the Indian stock markets traded near record levels following a sharp decline in COVID-19 cases and easing of curbs, investments into equity mutual funds fell last month.  
Net inflows into equity and equity-linked schemes tumbled nearly 40% over the preceding month to ??5,988.2 crore in June, as per the Association of Mutual Funds in India (AMFI).

WHO Chief Scientist Dr Soumya Swaminathan on Thursday said the Phase-3 trial data of Bharat Biotech's COVID-19 vaccine, Covaxin, looks good and the safety profile meets the WHO benchmarks so far. "The overall efficacy is quite high...efficacy against...Delta variant is low but it's still quite good," she told CNBC-TV18. Bharat Biotech has sought WHO's approval for Covaxin's emergency use listing.

WHO Chief Scientist Dr Soumya Swaminathan on Thursday said the Phase-3 trial data of Bharat Biotech's COVID-19 vaccine, Covaxin, looks good and the safety profile meets the WHO benchmarks so far. "The overall efficacy is quite high...efficacy against...Delta variant is low but it's still quite good," she told CNBC-TV18. Bharat Biotech has sought WHO's approval for Covaxin's emergency use listing.

Filmmaker Vidhu Vinod Chopra's wife and film reviewer Anupama Chopra took to Instagram and shared a note mourning the demise of her brother-in-law Vir. "Vinod always said that Vir was his better version...They looked so alike that when Vinod and I...got married, people would congratulate Vir," she wrote alongside Vinod and Vir's picture. Vir reportedly died of COVID-19 complications.

India reported 43,393 new COVID-19 cases and 44,459 recoveries in last 24 hours, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. The number of COVID-19 deaths reported so far in the country reached 4,05,939 as 911 new deaths were reported. Active COVID-19 cases in the country stand at 4,58,727.

The Calcutta High Court has dismissed a PIL seeking CBI probe into the alleged fake COVID-19 vaccination camp in Kolkata. The court said it is not required at this stage. The matter pertains to a fake vaccination camp set up by Debanjan Deb in Kolkata where more than 100 people, including TMC MP Mimi Chakraborty, were administered vaccines.

Stocks in Japan fell on Thursday after the Japanese government announced a state of emergency in the capital city of Tokyo amid rising COVID-19 cases ahead of the Tokyo Olympics. This will be the fourth state of emergency for Tokyo, which will come into effect from July 12 till August 22. Nikkei slipped 0.88% to 28,118.03.

US Food and Drug Administration and the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention have said that fully vaccinated Americans "don't need a booster shot at this time". This comes after Pfizer said it will seek US authorisation for a third COVID-19 vaccine dose in August. Pfizer cited evidence of risk of reinfection six months after inoculation and Delta variant's spread.

Around 18 doctors have tendered their resignation to Uttar Pradesh's Gonda Chief Medical Officer after the District Magistrate (DM) allegedly used "objectionable language" during a COVID-19 assessment meeting. The doctors, including superintendents of 16 Community Health Centres, alleged that DM's "misbehaviour" hurt their feelings. They also claimed that DM had been doing so "since a long time".

The Pune district administration has reportedly administered over 50 lakh COVID-19 vaccine doses. Over 19 lakh persons, aged above 45 years, have been administered the first dose, while 7.8 lakh received both doses. In the 18-44 age group, 15.71 lakh received first dose, while 40,764 received both doses. ??Pune is behind only Mumbai, which has administered over 60 lakh doses.

Haryana government has decided to reopen schools for students of Class 9-12 from July 16 and Class 6-8 from July 23, state Education Minister Kanwar Pal said. It'll be mandatory to follow COVID-19 guidelines, including wearing a mask, maintaining social distancing and sanitisation. A decision on resuming offline classes for Class 1-5 students will be taken later, according to reports.

Punjab government on Friday decided to lift weekend and night curfew restrictions in the state. The government also ordered opening of bars, cinema halls, restaurants and malls, among other places, subject to all eligible staff members and visitors having taken at least one dose of COVID-19 vaccine. It also allowed gatherings of 100 persons indoors and 200 outdoors from Monday.

Weekend and night curfews have been lifted in Punjab and gatherings of 100 persons indoors and 200 outdoors have been allowed from Monday. While schools will remain shut, colleges and coaching centres can operate if all staff and students received at least one COVID-19 vaccine dose. People vaccinated with at least one dose allowed at places like malls, bars, gyms.

The CM also pointed out that the state has already vaccinated nearly 83 lakh eligible people.

PMC has also started the recruitment process for paediatricians and neonatal specialists.

The government explained that coronavirus infection in pregnant women can increase certain risks, like pre-term delivery. Last week, the Centre revised its guidelines to allow pregnant women to get the coronavirus vaccine.

India's Hetero Labs has sought emergency use authorisation for Merck & Co's COVID-19 drug, Molnupiravir, after interim data showed it reduced hospitalisations and led to quicker recovery in mild cases. Merck signed licensing pacts with several Indian drugmakers, including Dr Reddy's and Cipla, between March and April to expand the anti-viral drug's production and conduct clinical trials in India.

Gold imports to India rose to nearly 15-tonne last month against 13.2-tonne a year ago amid a steady decline in COVID-19 cases and the subsequent easing of lockdowns, BloombergQuint reported. "People feel prices will shoot up again amid a potential third wave of COVID-19," said Kumar Jain, owner of UT Zaveri store in Mumbai's biggest jewellery market.

The Centre has named the states with districts having more than 10% COVID-19 positivity rate for the week ending July 8. While a total of 66 districts have over 10% positivity rate, 10 of them are in Arunachal Pradesh. Rajasthan also has 10 districts with more than 10% positivity rate, followed by nine in Manipur and eight in Kerala.

Jimmy Sheirgill, who was booked by Ludhiana Police in April for allegedly flouting COVID-19 guidelines while shooting for a project, spoke about the incident and said, "We were all following...[protocols]." "I don't [think] anyone would break a rule knowing we're amid...pandemic. Things were just blown out of proportion," he added. Jimmy further said people became more careful after the incident.

Actor Sharad Kelkar, who has resumed shooting for his projects, spoke about working amid the coronavirus pandemic and said, "You've to take...precautions and be mentally positive." "You can't stay in fear whether you're shooting or not, or just staying at home," he added. "You of course have some apprehensions when coming on set, but you've to work," Sharad further said.

While addressing the new Council of Ministers, PM Narendra Modi expressed concerns over pictures and videos of people not wearing masks and crowding in hill stations like Manali. "This is not a pleasant site and should instil a sense of fear in us," the PM said, according to reports. He also warned that the COVID-19 pandemic is "far from over".

Kerala on Friday reported 13,563 fresh coronavirus cases and 130 deaths, which pushed the case and death tally to 30,39,029 and 14,380 respectively. "Out of those who were found infected today, 52 reached the state from outside while 12,769 contracted the disease from their contacts," Health Minister Veena George said. The test positivity rate in Kerala stands at 10.4%.

Former Himachal Pradesh chief minister Virbhadra Singh's mortal remains will be cremated in Rampur on Saturday, said his family spokesperson. Singh passed away at the age of 87 due to post-COVID-19 complications in Shimla on Thursday. Meanwhile, the Himachal Pradesh government has decided to observe three-day state mourning from July 8-10 as a mark of respect to Singh.

France's Sanofi and Britain's GlaxoSmithKline (GSK) have received approval from the Drugs Controller General of India for Phase-3 trial of their COVID-19 vaccine, the companies said. The trial is part of a global study which will include 35,000 volunteers, aged 18 and above, across several countries. DCGI's approval marks the first global trial for a foreign COVID-19 vaccine in India.

There is no sign that North Korean leader Kim Jong-un has been vaccinated against coronavirus, South Korea's spy agency said. "North Korea hasn't yet acquired any coronavirus vaccines," South Korean lawmaker Ha Tae-keung, who attended a closed-door briefing by the spy agency, said. Last month, North Korea had informed WHO that it's yet to find a single case of COVID-19.

Oman on Thursday indefinitely suspended passenger flights from 24 countries, including India, Pakistan and Bangladesh, to combat COVID-19 spread in the country. Oman on Wednesday reported 1,675 new cases of coronavirus, bringing the total number of COVID-19 cases in the country to over 2.8 lakh. The country has administered more than 14 lakh doses of coronavirus vaccines so far.

Oman on Thursday indefinitely suspended passenger flights from 24 countries, including India, Pakistan and Bangladesh, to combat COVID-19 spread in the country. Oman on Wednesday reported 1,675 new cases of coronavirus, bringing the total number of COVID-19 cases in the country to over 2.8 lakh. The country has administered more than 14 lakh doses of coronavirus vaccines so far.

United Nations Secretary-General Ant??nio Guterres on Thursday said four million people have now lost their lives due to COVID-19, adding that this "painful milestone" is a reminder of the long way we still have to go to defeat the pandemic. He also said, "COVID-19 vaccines offer a ray of hope but most of the world is still in the shadows."

Last month, North Korea had informed WHO that it's yet to find a single case of COVID-19.

President Ram Nath Kovind and PM Narendra Modi on Thursday condoled the demise of senior Congress leader and former Himachal Pradesh CM Virbhadra Singh, who passed away due to post-COVID-19 complications. President Kovind said Singh's political career was marked by his commitment to serve people of Himachal Pradesh. Singh had a political career with rich administrative experience, PM Modi tweeted.

The 2020 Olympics will be held without spectators in Tokyo, the organising committee said, as the Japanese capital enters a fourth state of emergency after surge in COVID-19 cases. It'll decide whether to allow spectators at venues in three surrounding prefectures after consulting with local authorities. "I'm sorry to those who purchased tickets," Tokyo 2020 President Seiko Hashimoto said.

Former Himachal Pradesh Chief Minister and senior Congress leader Virbhadra Singh died in a Shimla hospital on Thursday after a prolonged illness. He was 87. He suffered a heart attack on Monday and was critical. The six-time Chief Minister was tested positive for COVID-19 on June 11 for the second time in two months and had post-COVID-19 issues like pneumonia.

UK Foreign Minister Dominic Raab said Britain would provide genomic sequencing support to nations to help "identify, track and respond" to new COVID-19 variants. Brazil, Ethiopia, Kenya, Nigeria and Pakistan will be among the nations to receive support along with Africa CDC. The project called New Variant Assessment Platform Programme by Public Health England aims to boost "disease surveillance".

Glenmark Pharmaceuticals will be conducting phase-3 trial of a nasal spray, which it claims to be effective in the treatment of COVID-19. Last week, the firm had sought emergency approval for import and marketing of the nasal spray from the Drugs Controller General of India (DCGI). However, DCGI's Subject Expert Committee (SEC) recommended Glenmark to conduct the phase-3 trial.

After taking charge of the Health Ministry on Thursday, Mansukh Mandaviya announced that the Union Cabinet has approved 'COVID-19 Emergency Response and Health Systems Preparedness Package Phase II' at a cost of ??23,123 crore to fight coronavirus. It'll be used jointly by Central and state governments. The decision was announced after PM Narendra Modi's first meeting with the new Cabinet.

Before and after pictures of a burial area for COVID-19 victims taken 10 days apart in Indonesia's Jakarta showed how the number of graves increased amid a spike in the cases. Indonesia reported a record 1,040 deaths on Wednesday, more than double the national fatalities six days earlier. Indonesia is grappling with its deadliest COVID-19 wave since the pandemic began.

France's Sanofi and Britain's GlaxoSmithKline (GSK) have received approval from the Drugs Controller General of India for Phase-3 trial of their COVID-19 vaccine, the companies said. The trial is part of a global study which will include 35,000 volunteers, aged 18 and above, across several countries. DCGI's approval marks the first global trial for a foreign COVID-19 vaccine in India.

Academy Award winner Anthony Hopkins' upcoming film 'Zero Contact' will be offered for sale as an NFT (non-fungible token). It is expected to be the world's first NFT feature film. The drop might also include extras like behind-the-scenes footage, bonus features, and interviews. The film was produced in 17 different territories virtually during the 2020 global COVID-19 pandemic.

A 70-year-old man from Hyderabad, KR Srinivas Rao, cycles his way to help those in need during the COVID-19 pandemic. "When COVID-19 cases were at the peak, I joined a Hyderabad-based organisation Hyderabad Relief Riders [which aims] to bring awareness about cycling...was able to serve the needy with...either groceries or medicine...deliver them to the doorsteps through cycling," Rao said.

Amid drop in COVID-19 cases, Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike chief said that it has shut down most COVID-19 care centres in the city. However, the centres have not been dismantled due to the possibility of a third wave. According to reports, BBMP Chief Commissioner Gaurav Gupta added, "Our focus is...to ensure...positivity doesn't increase...as we're trying to bring it further down."

Japanese PM Yoshihide Suga declared a state of emergency for Tokyo on Thursday amid coronavirus. The state of emergency will begin on Monday and last until August 22, through the duration of the Olympic Games scheduled to be held from July 23-August 8. Suga said it's needed to "prevent the resurgence of the future spread of COVID-19 cases across Japan".

Forty prisoners have reportedly tested COVID-19 positive in Myanmar's Insein jail in Yangon. Many prisoners in Insein jail became sick and some died earlier during the pandemic, but there was little COVID-19 testing for prisoners, Zayar Lwin, an activist said. Some of the thousands of anti-coup protesters who've been arrested by the junta are being held in the Insein jail.

The country has administered more than 14 lakh doses of coronavirus vaccines so far.

Gujarat government on Thursday allowed the Lord Jagannath Rath Yatra in Ahmedabad on July 12 without devotees saying that COVID-19 positivity rate has dropped to 0.1%. A seven-hour-long curfew will be imposed in Ahmedabad and devotees have been asked to watch the live telecast. In 2020, the procession was cancelled due to pandemic, for the first time in 143 years.

Sri Lanka batting coach Grant Flower has tested positive for COVID-19 days ahead of limited-overs series against India. As per Sri Lanka Cricket, Flower has mild symptoms of the disease. He has been isolated from the rest of the Sri Lanka members including players and coaches who are undergoing quarantine following their return from England.

Manali Police started an awareness campaign for tourists amid the COVID-19 pandemic and collected ??3 lakh fine in the last seven-eight days. "Those not wearing masks can be punished with ??5,000 in fine or eight days in jail," a senior police officer said. Earlier, the Central government expressed concern about crowding in Manali saying, "Manali can wait, but virus won't".

After a video of five-year-old boy scolding people for not wearing masks on a crowded street in Himachal Pradesh's Dharamshala went viral, the local police made him their mascot for coronavirus protocols. The boy named Amit said, "I would see policemen asking people to use  masks. So, I thought I should also do it as people were not following protocol."

A video of hundreds of tourists violating COVID-19 norms at Mussoorie's Kempty Falls has gone viral. In the video, tourists can be seen not wearing masks and being in close distance with each  other. "Sorry to say this but we deserve a third wave," an Instagram user commented. "Common sense isn??t so common indeed," wrote another.

"North Korea hasn't yet acquired any coronavirus vaccines," South Korean lawmaker Ha Tae-keung, who attended a closed-door briefing by the spy agency, said. Last month, North Korea had informed WHO that it's yet to find a single case of COVID-19.

Himachal Pradesh government has decided to observe a three-day state mourning from July 8 to July 10, as a mark of respect for six-time Chief Minister Virbhadra Singh. He passed away aged 87 due to post-COVID-19 complications on Thursday.  All state government offices will remain closed today except for the offices related to essential services, Himachal Pradesh CMO stated.

United Nations Secretary-General Ant??nio Guterres on Thursday said four million people have now lost their lives due to COVID-19, adding that this "painful milestone" is a reminder of the long way we still have to go to defeat the pandemic. He also said, "COVID-19 vaccines offer a ray of hope but most of the world is still in the shadows."

Bajaj Healthcare's shares surged around 11% in early trade on Thursday after it received a licence from the Defence Research and Development Organisation (DRDO) to manufacture and sell its anti-COVID-19 drug. The stock hit a 52-week high of ??1,009.8 per share. Earlier this month, Laurus Labs received DRDO's nod to market and manufacture the oral drug called '2-Deoxy-D-Glucose' (2-DG).

Two staff workers at the athletes' village of Tokyo Olympics have tested positive for COVID-19, 16 days before the opening ceremony of the Games. They had been eating in a group with two other workers, which is a violation of COVID-19 restrictions, a report said. The athletes' village is yet to be opened to the sportspersons participating at the Olympics.

Producer-director Vidhu Vinod Chopra's elder brother Vir Chopra passed away due to COVID-19 complications. He had got infected with COVID-19 while he was in Maldives and was later admitted to a hospital in Mumbai. Vir had worked as a creative producer in several films and was the script doctor for many Vidhu Vinod Chopra projects.

The Union Health Ministry on Wednesday said states and Union Territories will receive more than 12 crore doses in July. "It is clarified that all states/ UTs are being informed...in advance about the doses that will be available during...July...including the supply to private hospitals," the statement read. The government issued a statement on doses for the second time this week.

Fully-vaccinated Britons returning from medium-risk amber list countries will no longer have to quarantine when they return to England from July 19, Transport Secretary Grant Shapps said. However, Britons would still have to take a COVID-19 test before they arrive home and then a second test on or before day two. In Britain, 65% of adults have been fully vaccinated.

The death of 1,800 cows who left Spain for Turkey in December on a ship has fuelled calls for banning cross-border trade in live animals. The vessel couldn't unload cargo amid COVID-19 and 10% of the bulls died of starvation. On return to Spain, authorities ruled the remaining animals were too sick to sell and had to be put down.

India has reported 45,892 new COVID-19 cases and 817 more deaths in the last 24 hours, as per the Union Health Ministry. This comes after the country reported 43,733 COVID-19 cases and 930 deaths on Wednesday. With this, the total number of COVID-19 cases in the country reached 3,07,09,557, while the death toll surged to 4,05,028.

World's tallest sandcastle with a COVID-19 crown on top has been built in Denmark as part of the sandcastle festival in Blokhus. The work by a team led by Dutch designer Wilfred Stijger edged out the previous world record of 17.658 metres set in Germany by around 3.50 metres. Around 4.8 tonne of sand was used to create it.

Karnataka Deputy CM CN Ashwathnarayan inaugurated the expanded Paediatric ICU (PICU) of 100 beds to support COVID-19 treatment at the Indira Gandhi Institute of Child Health (IGICH) in Bengaluru. The unit was expanded at ??1.32 crore using Corporate Social Responsibility (CSR) funding by Cognizant. The facility is equipped with PICU cots, oxygenated beds, ventilators, and multi-para monitors.

Indians continued to take bank loans to buy houses and vehicles but loans to fund education declined during COVID-19, RBI data between March 2020 and May 2021 showed. ??Students who opt for foreign universities seek loans. But this came to a standstill last year. There has been some pick up this year as universities are reopening," a banker reportedly said.

Ratings agency ICRA said that domestic air passenger traffic is expected to increase by around 42% sequentially in June amid a decline in COVID-19 cases in India. ICRA estimated that domestic passenger traffic in June 2021 was about 29-30 lakh as compared to 19.8 lakh the month before, adding that airlines deployed 46% year-on-year (YoY) higher capacity in June.

Titan Company's share price declined by 2.09% on Wednesday to trade at ??1,726 at 12:10 pm, after the company said that the second wave of COVID-19 had impacted its FY22 business plans. Titan recorded overall revenue growth of 117% in the first quarter of FY22, adding that the jewellery division grew by 107% year-on-year (YoY) due to low base effect.

The number of active COVID-19 cases in Gurugram has fallen below 100 for the first time in 13 months. The count of active cases was 101 on Monday, which has now dropped to 95. The last time Gurugram's active COVID-19 cases were below 100 was on May 21, 2020, at 99. Currently, 80 people are in home isolation in Gurugram.

United States Congressman Lou Correa has written a letter of appreciation to Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) Commissioner Iqbal Singh Chahal for his work in the fight against the COVID-19 pandemic. He appreciated BMC's ward level war rooms and integrated hospital bed management through electronic dashboards. Chahal thanked Lou Correa and said that he felt privileged and honoured.

Amid declining COVID-19 cases, the Indian Railways has decided to operate a special train in September covering various top tourist destinations, including Char Dham - Badrinath, Jagannath Puri, Rameshwaram and Dwarkadhish. The pilgrimage circuit will be covered by the "Dekho Apna Desh" Deluxe AC Tourist Train. The 16-day tour will start from Delhi Safdarjung Railway Station on September 18, 2021.

India has reported 43,733 new COVID-19 cases and 930 deaths in the last 24 hours, according to the Union Health Ministry. This comes after the country reported 34,703 COVID-19 cases and 553 deaths on Tuesday. With this, the total number of COVID-19 cases reached 3,06,63,665 while the death toll surged to 4,04,211. India's active cases stand at 4,59,920.

The WHO has recommended life-saving interleukin-6 receptor blockers like tocilizumab and sarilumab to treat COVID-19. These are the first drugs found to be effective against COVID-19 since corticosteroids were recommended by WHO in September 2020. The WHO has called on manufacturers to reduce prices of these drugs and make supplies available to nations, especially where COVID-19 is surging.

The Mumbai crime branch has busted an inter-state cyber fraud gang that targeted over 200 people across India under the pretext of providing Remdesivir injections, oxygen and other medicines used for treating COVID-19 and mucormycosis. The gang used to cheat people by putting up posts on social media platforms claiming to be Cipla, the pharmaceutical company, police said.

Myanmar's detained leader Aung San Suu Kyi and her staff have been fully vaccinated against COVID-19 since being taken into military custody, her lawyer said on Tuesday. However, it's unclear when the 76-year-old ex-leader received the shots or which vaccine she was given. It comes as Myanmar is battling a surge in cases, with 3,602 new cases reported on Tuesday.

Delhi's Lajpat Nagar market has been allowed to reopen on Wednesday after being shut for two days over violation of COVID-19 norms. The order states six conditions that have to be met. These include social distancing, thermal screening, wearing masks, manned entry and exit, checking the number of visitors and not allowing a shopkeeper to operate outside his allocated shop.

US President Joe Biden said 160 million Americans will be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 by the end of this week. "Over 182 million Americans have received at least one shot, including nearly 90% of seniors and 70% of adults over...27," Biden added. Earlier, the Biden administration missed goal to have 70% of Americans at least partially vaccinated by July 4.

A private COVID-19 vaccination centre in Gurugram has been served with a show-cause notice after a couple claimed that a pre-filled syringe was injected. "We saw the nurse...didn't take the vaccine out of the Covishield bottle...put it in the syringe," the man said. "We are not even sure if we have been inoculated with the correct vaccine," he added.

Delhi Deputy CM Manish Sisodia on Tuesday said the capital has run out of COVID-19 vaccines and no supply is coming in from the Centre as of now. "Vaccinations were carried out at record speed in last two weeks in Delhi," Sisodia tweeted. He appealed to Centre to provide vaccines as soon as possible as per the requirement of Delhi.

A video of a woman claiming to be a relative of Dilip Kumar trying to enter his residence to pay her last respects following his demise has surfaced online. She was denied entry by the police owing to the COVID-19 norms and a family member of the late actor confirmed that they did not know the woman.

With several countries easing their restrictions amid COVID-19, WHO's head of emergencies programme Mike Ryan said, "We've made a very premature rush back to full normality and I think we're going to pay a price for that." He also warned against COVID-19 variants. This comes after the UK announced that it has decided to ease social distancing and mask rules.

Former Kerala Health Minister KK Shailaja will deliver a lecture on COVID-19 management at the Indian Institute of Management Bangalore (IIMB) on Saturday. The event, which will be held online through Zoom, will be hosted by the Centre for Public Policy (CPP) at IIMB. Shailaja will speak on 'Policy Implications of the Pandemic: Learnings from Managing COVID-19'.

The Uttarakhand High Court on Wednesday expressed concern over a heavy rush of tourists to hill stations of the state. The court directed the state government to take steps to control the inflow of tourists as they may bring in the Delta Plus variant of COVID-19. It also asked the government to review its decision to relax the weekend lockdown.

Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal on Wednesday inaugurated a genome sequencing lab at Lok Nayak Jai Prakash Narayan Hospital. The genome sequencing laboratory can identify variants of COVID-19. "I have been told that this is the third such facility in North India. One is NCDC, the other one is NIB Pune and this is the third facility," the CM said.

Union Health Ministry Joint Secretary Lav Agarwal while reacting to the SBI research report stating that India may witness COVID-19's third wave from August that would reach its peak in September, said that waves are not the challenge. "The first challenge is that we have not yet closed the second wave. And the next challenge is human behaviour," he added.

About 11.4 crore jobs were lost worldwide during the COVID-19 pandemic, the Organisation for Economic Co-operation and Development (OECD) has said in a report. It further said that about 2.2 crore jobs disappeared by the end of 2020 in industrial nations. There are still over 80 lakh people unemployed than before the COVID-19 pandemic, OECD added.

Kerala High Court on Wednesday sought an explanation from the state government on the crowds seen in front of liquor shops. The HC observed that "the crowds in front of liquor outlets amid the pandemic should not be neglected and that COVID-19 protocol is not followed in liquor outlets". It asked the government to submit its explanation within a week.

Delhi Deputy CM Manish Sisodia on Tuesday said the capital has run out of COVID-19 vaccines and no supply is coming in from the Centre as of now. "Vaccinations were carried out at record speed in last two weeks in Delhi," Sisodia tweeted. He appealed to Centre to provide vaccines as soon as possible as per the requirement of Delhi.

WHO said the weekly count of COVID-19 deaths dropped to the lowest level since October. However, the number of coronavirus cases ticked up worldwide last week. Over 2.6 million new COVID-19 cases were reported between June 28-July 4, a slight increase on the previous week, while the tally of deaths registered over the week declined 7% to 54,000, it said.

Myanmar's detained leader Aung San Suu Kyi and her staff have been fully vaccinated against COVID-19 since being taken into military custody, her lawyer said on Tuesday. However, it's unclear when the 76-year-old ex-leader received the shots or which vaccine she was given. It comes as Myanmar is battling a surge in cases, with 3,602 new cases reported on Tuesday.

Congress leader P Chidambaram said the resignations of Union Health Minister Harsh Vardhan and his deputy are a "candid confession" that the Centre has failed in managing COVID-19. "There is a lesson for ministers in these resignations. If things go right the credit will go to PM, if things go wrong the Minister will be the fall guy," he tweeted.

UK Health Secretary Sajid Javid said that people in England who're fully vaccinated will not have to self-isolate if they're in close contact with a coronavirus case from August 16. "We'll have a more proportionate system of test, trace and isolate," Javid added. The government would announce details on self-isolation rules for international travellers later this week, he further said.

A private COVID-19 vaccination centre in Gurugram has been served with a show-cause notice after a couple claimed that a pre-filled syringe was injected. "We saw the nurse...didn't take the vaccine out of the Covishield bottle...put it in the syringe," the man said. "We are not even sure if we have been inoculated with the correct vaccine," he added.

Fiji police on Wednesday began distributing supplies, including packaged food and toilet paper, to some households amid rising coronavirus cases in the country due to Delta variant. The deliveries were mostly being made in poorer neighbourhoods, the government said as it urged people to stay home. The country, with less than 10 lakh people, has reported over 7,145 COVID-19 cases.

Around 69% children aged between six and 18 in Chandigarh tested positive for antibodies against COVID-19 in an interim sero survey report, the PGIMER said. Till date, blood samples of 756 children have been collected for the sero survey out of which 519 had tested positive for IgG antibodies against SARS-CoV-2, meaning almost 69% of children had been previously infected.

Wipro's philanthropic arm has committed an additional ??1,000 crore to fight COVID-19, Wipro's Founder Chairman Azim Premji announced on Tuesday. This grant will focus on universal vaccination. Premji also said, "The worst thing we could do is to ignore the past 1.5 years and keep promoting children to the next class without helping them to learn what they should've learnt."

WHO said the weekly count of COVID-19 deaths dropped to the lowest level since October. However, the number of coronavirus cases ticked up worldwide last week. Over 2.6 million new COVID-19 cases were reported between June 28-July 4, a slight increase on the previous week, while the tally of deaths registered over the week declined 7% to 54,000, it said.

Former Congress National Spokesperson Sanjay Jha has said that the resignation of Union Health Minister Harsh Vardhan is an explicit public admission by the central government that it completely mishandled the COVID-19 crisis management in India. As many as 43 leaders will reportedly take oath as Union Ministers during the Cabinet expansion on Wednesday

The Uttar Pradesh government will allow the Kanwar Yatra from July 25, a senior official said on Wednesday. According to UP Additional Chief Secretary Navneet Sehgal, "Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath has asked to coordinate with neighbouring Bihar and Uttarakhand and ensure COVID-19 guidelines are (followed) during the yatra." Uttarakhand has cancelled the yatra this year due to COVID-19 pandemic.

Blood banks attached to hospitals in Pune are facing a shortage in the absence of blood donation camps and due to the 14 days waiting period after getting the COVID-19 vaccine, doctors said. Dr Poornima Rao, senior consultant at Sahyadri Specialty Hospital's blood bank, said, "Since a fortnight now, few blood donation drives have been organised...Colleges are shut."

Fiji police on Wednesday began distributing supplies, including packaged food and toilet paper, to some households amid rising coronavirus cases in the country due to Delta variant. The deliveries were mostly being made in poorer neighbourhoods, the government said as it urged people to stay home. The country, with less than 10 lakh people, has reported over 7,145 COVID-19 cases.

Blood banks attached to hospitals in Pune are facing a shortage in the absence of blood donation camps and due to the 14 days waiting period after getting the COVID-19 vaccine, doctors said. Dr Poornima Rao, senior consultant at Sahyadri Specialty Hospital's blood bank, said, "Since a fortnight now, few blood donation drives have been organised...Colleges are shut."

Germany has lifted a ban on the travellers from India, the UK, Nepal, Russia and Portugal, where the delta variant of coronavirus has been found in the samples of COVID-19 patients. The Robert Koch Institute, a German federal government agency, said that the five nations have been downgraded to "high-incidence areas" from the current categorisation of "areas of variant concern".

Over 2 crore "balance and unutilized" COVID-19 vaccine doses are still available with States/UTs and private hospitals to be administered, Union Health Ministry said on Monday. Over 36.97 crore doses have been provided so far, it added. It further said that the government will procure and supply 75% of vaccines being produced in the country free of cost to States/UTs.

With over 4,00,000 COVID-19 vaccine doses administered on Monday, Odisha registered the highest single-day vaccination, surpassing its previous high of 3,32,000 on June 21, officials said. The doses were administered across 1,735 centres and nearly half of them were given to the 18-44 age group. "Many congratulations to our health team and citizens of Odisha," the state health department tweeted.

Commentator Harsha Bhogle called coronavirus 'Chinese virus' while tweeting on England team members testing positive. Several people criticised him, with one writing, "Very unlike you. Absolutely no need to politicise it." "I noticed...use of...South African variant...Brazil variant and...Indian variant. I guess it's the norm to refer to something by...country of origin," Bhogle defended himself.

Ruili, a Chinese city bordering Myanmar, is stepping up efforts to fight a third coronavirus outbreak after several locally transmitted cases were reported. Ruili has initiated mass testing and imposed a lockdown to prevent people from entering or leaving the city unless they can prove their travel is necessary. The Jiegao border community was named a medium-risk area on Tuesday.

Senior Trinamool Congress leader Mukul Roy's wife Krishna Roy passed away due to cardiac arrest in the early hours of Tuesday. She breathed her last at a hospital in Chennai after serious post-COVID-19 related complications. She will be brought back to Kolkata for her final rites on Wednesday.

Japan said it'd ship millions of more doses of AstraZeneca COVID-19 vaccine to Asian neighbours this week. Japan will send about 1.1 million more doses to Taiwan on Thursday and further one million doses each to Thailand, Philippines and Vietnam by end of the week, Foreign Minister Toshimitsu Motegi said. Last month, Japan had sent 1.24 million doses to Taiwan.

Ahead of the third wave of COVID-19, the Pimpri Chinchwad Municipal Corporation has started a helpline for children to address their queries about coronavirus disease. Mayor Usha alias Mai Dhore launched the child helpline that'll be functional from Monday to Friday. PCMC Commissioner Rajesh Patil said, "Parents and children should use the helpline for information about Covid-19 and children."

Nearly 44% of the 6,040 respondents from the CFA Institute globally have predicted a K-shaped recovery from the COVID-19 pandemic. The survey further said that 52% of Indian respondents believe that equity markets have recovered too quickly owing to the monetary stimulus and that the markets are out of pace with the real economy.

Indian drug manufacturer Morepen Laboratories has produced the first test batch of Sputnik V COVID-19 vaccine, the Russian Direct Investment Fund (RDIF) has said. The first test batch made by the Morepen in Himachal Pradesh will be shipped for quality controls to Gamaleya Institute, it added. Panacea Biotec had also recently received manufacturing license to produce Sputnik V.

The West Bengal government has launched a 'Vaccination on Boat' programme in Sundarbans' Kumirmari island. As many as 150 people were inoculated against COVID-19, most of whom are migrant labourers, South 24 Parganas District Magistrate P Ulaganathan said. A boat carrying health officials reached the island on Monday and it will be stationed there for five more days, Ulaganathan added.

The government released state-wise distribution of total coronavirus cases as India today recorded 34,703 daily cases, the lowest cases in 111 days. There are 12 states/UTs with 8 lakh-plus total cases. Maharashtra tops the list with 61,04,917 coronavirus cases. There are 12 states/UTs each which currently have 01-1,00,000 and 1,00,001-8,00,000 total confirmed coronavirus cases.

Israel's Health Ministry on Monday reported that the effectiveness of the Pfizer COVID-19 vaccine in preventing infections and symptomatic illness had dropped to 64%. It added that the vaccine, however, remained "highly effective" in preventing hospitalizations and serious illness at 93%. This comes amid a spread of the Delta variant and the lifting of social distancing restrictions in Israel.

UK PM Boris Johnson said that almost all COVID-19 rules, including face masks and social distancing, will end in England on July 19. People must "learn to live" with coronavirus and "exercise judgement", he added. Johnson had initially aimed for a full reopening on June 21, but was forced to delay it due to a surge in Delta COVID-19 variant.

Israel will deliver about seven lakh expiring doses of Pfizer-BioNTech COVID-19 vaccine to South Korea this month in a vaccine exchange deal. Under the deal, South Korea will transfer reciprocal number of Pfizer vaccine doses in September and October. Last month, Palestinian Authority called off a similar deal to receive 10 lakh doses, saying vaccines were too close to expiring.

According to the BMC, 50% of people of the age group eligible for vaccination have received their first dose of COVID-19 vaccine. There are around 45 lakh people aged 18 years and above who've taken their first dose, while 11.5 lakh people have taken their second dose, BMC said. It claimed that interrupted vaccine supply is hampering the vaccination speed.

Indian drug manufacturer Morepen Laboratories has produced the first test batch of Sputnik V COVID-19 vaccine, the Russian Direct Investment Fund (RDIF) has said.
