The first test batch made by the Morepen in Himachal Pradesh will be shipped for quality controls to Gamaleya Institute, it added. Panacea Biotec had also recently received manufacturing license to produce Sputnik V.

Gautam Budh Nagar resumed walk-in registrations at its government vaccination centres from Monday after having suspended them for a week due to a paucity of vaccines. As per officials, the district got around 39,000 more vaccines from the state on Sunday. Out of the total, there are 14,000 Covaxin doses and 25,000 Covishield doses.

West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee on Tuesday claimed that her government was forced to purchase COVID-19 vaccines on its own as the Centre "failed" to do so. She said, "Our shameless PM has failed the country but his picture is found everywhere, from vaccine certificates to hoardings." Banerjee added, "I have seen many prime ministers, but none so shameless."

Officials in Rajasthan's Jodhpur went door-to-door to convince people to get vaccinated against COVID-19. "There is a lot of enthusiasm over the state-led and district-led vaccinations efforts but in some areas, resistance is being seen," Jodhpur CMO Balwant Manda said. "Some people think that vaccines can have some sort of adversity. We have to increase awareness," he added.

Singapore health authorities have advised that people, especially adolescents and younger men, who have received any dose of the mRNA COVID-19 vaccines should avoid exercise for one week after vaccination. This comes as a 16-year-old boy suffered a cardiac arrest after weightlifting at a gym, six days after receiving his first dose of the Pfizer-BioNTech vaccine, reported Bloomberg.

The Australian Formula One Grand Prix 2021 has been cancelled for a second straight year due to "restrictions and logistical challenges" relating to the ongoing COVID-19 pandemic, announced the organisers. The Grand Prix was due to be held at the Albert Park Grand Prix Circuit in Melbourne from November 18-21 after being moved from its usual date in March.

Singapore health authorities have advised that people, especially adolescents and younger men, who have received any dose of the mRNA COVID-19 vaccines should avoid exercise for one week after vaccination. This comes as a 16-year-old boy suffered a cardiac arrest after weightlifting at a gym, six days after receiving his first dose of the Pfizer-BioNTech vaccine, reported Bloomberg.

Assam government today announced that total lockdown will be imposed in seven districts from tomorrow till further notice. The districts are Goalpara, Golaghat, Jorhat, Lakhimpur, Sonitpur, Biswanath and Morigaon. There will be a total ban on movement of all public and private transport. In districts with moderate COVID-19 positivity rate, the curfew will from 2 pm to 5 am.

Despite the second COVID-19 wave, there has been a 126% rise in income tax collections in Gujarat during the first three months of the current financial year, said an Income Tax official. Ravindra Kumar, Principal Chief Commissioner of Income Tax in Gujarat added, "Gujarat has made good progress...This year was a little better as there was no complete lockdown."

Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal has launched 'Mukhyamantri COVID-19 Pariwar Aarthik Sahayata Yojana', a social security scheme for COVID-19-affected families. Government will provide ??50,000 to families that lost a member to COVID-19. Further, ??2,500/month will be given to families that lost earning member and ??2,500/month will be provided to children who lost both parents till they are 25 years old.

Israel's Health Ministry on Monday reported that the effectiveness of the Pfizer COVID-19 vaccine in preventing infections and symptomatic illness had dropped to 64%. It added that the vaccine, however, remained "highly effective" in preventing hospitalizations and serious illness at 93%. This comes amid a spread of the Delta variant and the lifting of social distancing restrictions in Israel.

Japan said it'd ship millions of more doses of AstraZeneca COVID-19 vaccine to Asian neighbours this week. Japan will send about 1.1 million more doses to Taiwan on Thursday and further one million doses each to Thailand, Philippines and Vietnam by end of the week, Foreign Minister Toshimitsu Motegi said. Last month, Japan had sent 1.24 million doses to Taiwan.

A Bengaluru-based NGO, Jhatkaa.org, is introducing a course on emotional wellbeing for resident doctors working on the frontline amid COVID-19. To be launched for a batch of 50 residents initially, the course will talk about mental health and offer coping mechanisms to these doctors. "If the course is well-received, it'll be extended to all healthcare workers," said an official.

The Drugs Controller General of India has reportedly urged Pfizer twice in writing to apply for emergency use authorisation for its COVID-19 vaccine so that its application is processed well in time. However, Pfizer hasn't applied for the licence yet, ANI reported citing sources. Earlier, AIIMS Director Dr Randeep Guleria said Pfizer was close to finalising an agreement with India.

With over 4,00,000 COVID-19 vaccine doses administered on Monday, Odisha registered the highest single-day vaccination, surpassing its previous high of 3,32,000 on June 21, officials said. The doses were administered across 1,735 centres and nearly half of them were given to the 18-44 age group. "Many congratulations to our health team and citizens of Odisha," the state health department tweeted.

The Drugs Controller General of India has reportedly urged Pfizer twice in writing to apply for emergency use authorisation for its COVID-19 vaccine so that its application is processed well in time. However, Pfizer hasn't applied for the licence yet, ANI reported citing sources. Earlier, AIIMS Director Dr Randeep Guleria said Pfizer was close to finalising an agreement with India.

The government took to Twitter to share the viral picture of crowd in Manali to spread awareness about social distancing rules amid the coronavirus pandemic. "Manali can wait, but virus won't," it wrote. "Slight relaxation in lockdown, and you all went to...mountains! The crowd in hotels today can lead to an increase in the crowd in hospitals tomorrow!" it added.

The ECB today announced that seven members- three players and four management team members- of the England Men's ODI party have tested positive for COVID-19. The members will now self-isolate as per the government's protocol on quarantine. The remaining members have been deemed close contacts and will also isolate. Meanwhile, Ben Stokes has been named as the captain.

An FIR has been registered against officials of a private hospital in Gurugram after the health department found several discrepancies in their COVID-19 vaccination drive. According to police, the FIR was lodged on District Immunisation Officer MP Singh's complaint. He said a resident approached him claiming that Chiranjivi Hospital refused to do her vaccination, "even though it had online slots".

Ahead of the third wave of COVID-19, the Pimpri Chinchwad Municipal Corporation has started a helpline for children to address their queries about coronavirus disease. Mayor Usha alias Mai Dhore launched the child helpline that'll be functional from Monday to Friday. PCMC Commissioner Rajesh Patil said, "Parents and children should use the helpline for information about Covid-19 and children."

The management of Hyderabad Public School (HPS) in Begumpet and Ramanthapur has said it will waive off 100% fees for students who lost their single or earning parents to COVID-19. In addition, the school also announced a reduction of ??10,000 on the annual tuition fee for all its students for the academic year 2021-22 amid the COVID-19 pandemic.

The government released state-wise distribution of total coronavirus cases as India today recorded 34,703 daily cases, the lowest cases in 111 days. There are 12 states/UTs with 8 lakh-plus total cases. Maharashtra tops the list with 61,04,917 coronavirus cases. There are 12 states/UTs each which currently have 01-1,00,000 and 1,00,001-8,00,000 total confirmed coronavirus cases.

While dismissing a batch of petitions seeking permission to conduct the Rath Yatra across Odisha amid COVID-19, Chief Justice NV Ramana said, "I'm also feeling bad, but I can't help you." He said, "I also wanted to go to Puri but I couldn't in the last one-and-a-half years. This isn't the time. Hope God will allow the next Rath Yatra."

England have named a new ODI squad for the series against Pakistan, which includes nine uncapped players. Ben Stokes will be captaining the side for the first time. The announcement comes after three members of the initial playing group and four members of the management staff tested positive for COVID-19, and consequently the entire initial squad was required to isolate.

Officials in Rajasthan's Jodhpur went door-to-door to convince people to get vaccinated against COVID-19. "There is a lot of enthusiasm over the state-led and district-led vaccinations efforts but in some areas, resistance is being seen," Jodhpur CMO Balwant Manda said. "Some people think that vaccines can have some sort of adversity. We have to increase awareness," he added.

Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal has launched a portal to help people who have lost family members to COVID-19 apply for financial assistance as announced by the government recently. While people can apply on the portal, Delhi government representatives will also visit their houses for other formalities. "Help families and not find fault with their documents," said Kejriwal to the representatives.

Gautam Budh Nagar resumed walk-in registrations at its government vaccination centres from Monday after having suspended them for a week due to a paucity of vaccines. As per officials, the district got around 39,000 more vaccines from the state on Sunday. Out of the total, there are 14,000 Covaxin doses and 25,000 Covishield doses.

Mangoes and several vegetables from Varanasi cluster were exported to markets in Europe and Middle East for the first time despite COVID-19, Commerce Ministry officials told ANI. Till March 2021, 48 metric tonnes of fresh vegetables and 10 MT of mangoes were exported, they added. In a first, 532 MT of black rice was exported to Australia and New Zealand.

Pakistan on Tuesday closed its main border crossing point with Afghanistan to limit the spread of COVID-19. "All types of immigration departure and arrival will be closed from today at Torkham border," Interior Minister Sheikh Rashid said. The two countries have multiple crossing points but Torkham is one of the most commonly used crossings by thousands of travellers every day.

Israel will deliver about seven lakh expiring doses of Pfizer-BioNTech COVID-19 vaccine to South Korea this month in a vaccine exchange deal. Under the deal, South Korea will transfer reciprocal number of Pfizer vaccine doses in September and October. Last month, Palestinian Authority called off a similar deal to receive 10 lakh doses, saying vaccines were too close to expiring.

Avascular Necrosis or 'bone death' is death of bone tissue over lack of blood supply. While many people have no symptoms in early stages, as it worsens the affected joint might hurt. Treatment depends on how early it's diagnosed and surgery may help in some cases. Steroid-linked cases have been reported in three COVID-19-recovered patients each in Mumbai and Delhi.

The Centre's PIB Fact Check Twitter handle has warned that a website called 'sebd.in.net' which claims to offer unemployment assistance to COVID-19-impacted youths is "fake". The website, which claims to be a research institute under the Skill Development Ministry, is also charging an amount on pretext of application fee. "No such website/institute is operated by the Ministry," the handle said.

Around 80% of the new COVID-19 cases in India are being reported from 90 districts, Health Ministry Joint Secretary Lav Agarwal said. These districts are in 14 states namely Maharashtra, Tamil Nadu, Kerala, Odisha, Andhra Pradesh, Assam, Karnataka, Manipur, Goa, Meghalaya, Mizoram, Puducherry, Tripura and West Bengal. The infection is spreading in a localised way in limited areas, Agarwal added.

Over 2 crore "balance and unutilized" COVID-19 vaccine doses are still available with States/UTs and private hospitals to be administered, Union Health Ministry said on Monday. Over 36.97 crore doses have been provided so far, it added. It further said that the government will procure and supply 75% of vaccines being produced in the country free of cost to States/UTs.

The five-match Test series between India and England is set to be played in front of 100% capacity crowd after UK PM Boris Johnson announced the lifting of COVID-19 related restrictions on Monday. Last month, India and New Zealand had played the WTC final in front of a limited crowd at Southampton with the upper limit set at 4,000.

According to the BMC, 50% of people of the age group eligible for vaccination have received their first dose of COVID-19 vaccine. There are around 45 lakh people aged 18 years and above who've taken their first dose, while 11.5 lakh people have taken their second dose, BMC said. It claimed that interrupted vaccine supply is hampering the vaccination speed.

Queen Elizabeth II has awarded UK's National Health Service (NHS) the George Cross, the highest civilian gallantry award, as the health service marked its 73rd anniversary on July 5. Queen thanked the NHS workers for their dedicated service for over seven decades, including during the COVID-19 pandemic. "You've our enduring thanks and heartfelt appreciation," Queen wrote in a handwritten letter.

Amid COVID-19 pandemic, a video of a little boy scolding people for not wearing face masks on a crowded street in Himachal Pradesh's Dharamshala has gone viral. "He (boy) doesn't even have shoes to wear...Who is educated and who is uneducated here," an Instagram page captioned the video. This comes as several pictures of crowds at hill stations surfaced online.

TMC leader Mahua Moitra, reacting to 84-year-old Father Stan Swamy's demise, said she was "ashamed and saddened at how justice is on a ventilator in the country". "NIA arrested him in October from his home in a late-night raid, opposed his bail saying no 'conclusive proof' of his ailments," Moitra tweeted. Swamy died owing to post-COVID-19 complications on Monday.

Germany has lifted a ban on the travellers from India, the UK, Nepal, Russia and Portugal, where the delta variant of coronavirus has been found in the samples of COVID-19 patients. The Robert Koch Institute, a German federal government agency, said that the five nations have been downgraded to "high-incidence areas" from the current categorisation of "areas of variant concern".

UK PM Boris Johnson said that almost all COVID-19 rules, including face masks and social distancing, will end in England on July 19. People must "learn to live" with coronavirus and "exercise judgement", he added. Johnson had initially aimed for a full reopening on June 21, but was forced to delay it due to a surge in Delta COVID-19 variant.

West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee on Tuesday claimed that her government was forced to purchase COVID-19 vaccines on its own as the Centre "failed" to do so. She said, "Our shameless PM has failed the country but his picture is found everywhere, from vaccine certificates to hoardings." Banerjee added, "I have seen many prime ministers, but none so shameless."

Ruili, a Chinese city bordering Myanmar, is stepping up efforts to fight a third coronavirus outbreak after several locally transmitted cases were reported. Ruili has initiated mass testing and imposed a lockdown to prevent people from entering or leaving the city unless they can prove their travel is necessary. The Jiegao border community was named a medium-risk area on Tuesday.

Sharing pictures of crowds in hill stations like Manali, Shimla and Mussoorie and markets in Delhi and Mumbai, ICMR chief Dr Balram Bhargava said they were "frightening". Health Ministry Joint Secretary Lav Agarwal said, "People travelling to hill stations aren't following COVID-appropriate behaviours. We can nullify the ease in [curbs] again if protocols aren't complied with."

India has reported 34,703 new COVID-19 cases and 553 deaths in the last 24 hours. The country reported the lowest number of daily cases in the last 111 days on Tuesday and the lowest rise in daily deaths in the last three months. With this, the total number of COVID-19 cases reached 3,06,19,932 while the death toll surged to 4,03,281.

Police have registered a case for COVID-19 protocols violation in connection with a musical programme held in Maharashtra's Aurangabad where AIMIM MP Imtiaz Jaleel was also present. "We...registered an FIR against [some] local residents...and 50-60 other unidentified people," police said. "We are verifying the videos and if necessary, action may also be taken against Jaleel," police added.

India may witness COVID-19's third wave from August and it would reach its peak in September, according to a report by SBI Research. "Going by the current data, India can experience daily COVID-19 cases around 10,000 somewhere around the second week of July," the report said. "However, the cases can start rising by the second fortnight of August," it added.

A collective fine of around ??9.5 lakh was imposed on a marriage hall owner and parents of a newly-wed couple for violating COVID-19 norms in Chhattisgarh's Surguja district. As per an official, the wedding was attended by over 1,000 people despite the district permitting only 50 guests at wedding functions. Moreover, the wedding hall has also been sealed, he added.

Sri Lanka has become the first country in South Asia to receive a batch of the Pfizer-BioNTech COVID-19 vaccine, Sri Lankan President Gotabaya Rajapaksa tweeted on Monday. Health officials said that the country received 26,000 doses of the vaccine. "I'm proud of the work that is being done by my government to ensure vaccines for all Sri Lankans," Rajapaksa added.

A park is being developed at a Bhopal crematorium using the uncollected ashes of people who died due to COVID-19. "Most of the family members collected the bones but left the ashes...Due to this, 21 truckloads of ashes...were left at the crematorium," said an official. The park will be developed on 12,000 square feet of land, he added.

The Pune Municipal Corporation (PMC) is planning to set up temporary COVID-19 vaccination centres in slum areas to scale up vaccination in rural Pune. The civic body has set a target of vaccinating 4,66,313 slum dwellers aged above 18 in 390 slums across Pune. The PMC Assistant Medical Officer said PMC has been able to give a push to vaccination.

Bangladesh on Monday extended its COVID-19 lockdown till July 14 to fight a surge in cases caused by the Delta variant. This comes after Bangladesh on Monday reported its highest one-day rise in COVID-19 deaths at 164, taking the death toll to 15,229. It also reported the highest-ever increase in daily cases at 9,964, with the total standing at 9,54,881.

The Andhra Pradesh government on Monday extended curfew relaxation timings in all except East Godavari and West Godavari districts of the state with effect from July 8. The new curfew relaxation timings in 11 districts will be 6 am to 10 pm. The state government has also allowed theatres, restaurants, gyms and function halls to operate following strict COVID-19 protocols.

Union Minister Dr Jitendra Singh recently shared a video of a policeman in Jammu & Kashmir's Reasi carrying an elderly man on his back and climbing up a hill to get him to a COVID-19 vaccination centre. "Proud of our frontline worker SPO Mohan Singh...who helped 72-year-old Abdul Gani...to get vaccinated," said Dr Singh while sharing the now-viral video.

Pune Mayor Murlidhar Mohol has said that Covishield will not be available at any vaccination centre under the jurisdiction of Pune Municipal Corporation on Monday. "However, Covaxin will be available at six centres (200 doses each)," the mayor added. The state health department data showed that a total of 48.05 lakh COVID-19 vaccine doses have been administered in Pune district.

TMC leader Partha Chatterjee on Monday said that sit-in protests will be staged in West Bengal against the hike in fuel prices. "Protests will be staged against hike in fuel prices in every block and town...on July 10 and July 11," the TMC leader added. The protests will be held keeping in mind all the COVID-19 protocols, Chatterjee further said.

Women in India's low-income households lost jobs more often compared to men, according to a study by consulting firm Dalberg. Women made up 24% of those working before the pandemic but accounted for 28% of all those who lost jobs, the study revealed. About a tenth of the women surveyed said they ate less or had run out of food.

South Africa's ex-President Jacob Zuma on Sunday said that sending him to jail during the COVID-19 pandemic at his age would be "the same as sentencing me to death". Last week, the country's Constitutional Court had handed Zuma a 15-month jail sentence after finding him guilty of contempt of court. Zuma has legally challenged the jail term.

Karnataka reported 1,564 new COVID-19 cases and 59 deaths on Sunday. The test positivity rate in the state stands at 1.02%. As many as 352 new cases were reported from Bengaluru Urban, the capital city also witnessed three deaths and 1,742 recoveries. The active caseload in Karnataka dropped to 44,846, out of which 18,018 are in Bengaluru Urban.

Several students staged a protest outside the home of Telangana Education Minister Sabitha Indra Reddy in Hyderabad on Monday, demanding that engineering and degree examinations be postponed till all students get COVID-19 vaccines. The minister told the students that the education department is giving priority to the well being of students while making arrangements to conduct the examinations.

Delhi on Monday recorded 54 new COVID-19 cases, marking the city's lowest one-day surge in cases since April 15 last year. As many as two COVID-19 deaths and 132 recoveries were also recorded in the last 24 hours in Delhi. The city's daily COVID-19 positivity rate dropped to 0.09% and its active cases dropped to 912.

Actress Delnaaz Irani mentioned that amid the ongoing COVID-19 pandemic, she has learnt ways to explore her love for acting. "It [pandemic] didn't change anything for me career-wise. I would not want to do anything else but acting...I'll live here and die here...I'll [probably] have my makeup on when I die. I'm meant to be...in this profession," Delnaaz said.

In view of enhanced vaccine production, the Department of Biotechnology has set up a vaccine-testing facility in Pune's National Centre for Cell Science (NCCS). The facility has now been notified as a Central Drugs Laboratory for testing and lot release of COVID-19 vaccines through a gazette notification. The facility is expected to test approximately 60 batches of vaccines each month.

The Duchess of Cambridge Kate Middleton is self-isolating for 10 days after coming into contact with someone who later tested positive for COVID-19, Kensington Palace said on Monday. "Her Royal Highness is not experiencing any symptoms, but is following all relevant government guidelines," it added. Kate's last public outing was at the Wimbledon tennis championships on Friday.

Pune Mayor Murlidhar Mohol has said that Covishield will not be available at any vaccination centre under the jurisdiction of Pune Municipal Corporation on Monday. "However, Covaxin will be available at six centres (200 doses each)," the mayor added. The state health department data showed that a total of 48.05 lakh COVID-19 vaccine doses have been administered in Pune district.

Prime Minister Narendra Modi while addressing the CoWIN Global Conclave on Monday said, "Indian civilisation considers the whole world as one family...That's why...CoWIN is being prepared to be made open source." He added, "Software is one area in which there are no resource constraints...We made our COVID-19 tracing and tracking app open source as soon as it was technically feasible."

Shares of Panacea Biotec rose as much as 9% in early trade on Monday. This comes a day after the firm said that it has received manufacturing license for the Sputnik V COVID-19 vaccine from the Drugs Controller General of India (DCGI). The license is for batches of Sputnik V produced at its facilities at Baddi, Himachal Pradesh, it added.

Amid low supply of COVID-19 vaccines, New South Wales (NSW) Health Minister Brad Hazzard said, "I fear...it is almost a sense now of The Hunger Games, of people chasing vaccines." "Until we get enough vaccines...we will continue to have effectively The Hunger Games going on here in NSW," the Australian minister added.

Telangana recorded 605 new COVID-19 cases on Sunday, taking the total number of cases in the state to 6,26,690. Seven deaths were reported in the state on Sunday taking the death toll to 3,691. The Greater Hyderabad Municipal Corporation (GHMC) reported the highest number of cases with 107 followed by Karimnagar - 54 and Suryapet - 36.

Uttarakhand government spokesperson Subodh Uniyal on Monday said that the COVID-curfew in the state has been extended till 6 am on July 13. He further said that malls will be allowed to reopen at 50% capacity, adding that markets will remain closed on weekends. Uttarakhand on Sunday reported 78 new COVID-19 cases and two deaths.

Pimpri-Chinchwad has recorded almost a fivefold decrease in COVID-19 cases as the numbers have fallen to 7,389 in June from 39,975 in May. "Though the number of COVID-19 cases continues to fall, we're on guard as experts have predicted a third wave," PCMC Additional Commissioner Vikas Dhakane said. Pimpri-Chinchwad registered 2,58,993 cases in 15 months since the pandemic started.

Luxembourg's PM Xavier Bettel was admitted to a hospital on Sunday "as a precautionary measure" after testing positive for COVID-19 at the end of June. He was undergoing additional tests and would remain under observation for 24 hours, a report said. Bettel had tested positive just after he had attended an EU summit with 26 other leaders from the bloc.

Pune, Kolhapur, Satara, Sangli and Raigad are among the top five districts in Maharashtra to have a weekly COVID-19 positivity rate above the state average. Maharashtra's positivity rate during June 27-July 3 stood at 4.50% whereas that of Kolhapur was 10.24%. In Pune district, the figure rose from 7.20% in the week from June 20-June 26 to 7.68% last week.

At least three confirmed cases of avascular necrosis, or death of bone tissues, have been reported in Mumbai. Hinduja Hospital in Mahim treated the three patients who developed the disease two months after COVID-19 diagnosis. As per doctors, they developed 'bone death' due to steroid use during COVID-19 treatment and were diagnosed after complaining of pain in their femur bone.

Amid low supply of COVID-19 vaccines, New South Wales (NSW) Health Minister Brad Hazzard said, "I fear...it is almost a sense now of The Hunger Games, of people chasing vaccines." "Until we get enough vaccines...we will continue to have effectively The Hunger Games going on here in NSW," the Australian minister added.

Actress Sunny Leone talks about the daily wage workers, working in the entertainment industry, who've been affected amid the ongoing COVID-19 pandemic. "They're the people who make this industry what it is. We [actors] might afford to sit home for a while but they and all the rest of the people working...can't and that upsets me the most," Sunny said.

India's services sector activity in June contracted at the fastest rate since July 2020, a private survey said. The IHS Markit India Services Purchasing Managers' Index (PMI) plunged to 41.2 in June from May's 46.4, falling below the 50-mark threshold that separates growth from contraction. Tighter COVID-19 restrictions hammered demand and forced firms to shed jobs rapidly, the survey showed.

India reported 39,796 new COVID-19 cases and 42,352 recoveries in last 24 hours, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. The number of COVID-19 deaths reported so far in the country reached 4,02,728 as 723 new deaths were reported. Active COVID-19 cases in the country stand at 4,82,071.

Sri Lanka has become the first country in South Asia to receive a batch of the Pfizer-BioNTech COVID-19 vaccine, Sri Lankan President Gotabaya Rajapaksa tweeted on Monday. Health officials said that the country received 26,000 doses of the vaccine. "I'm proud of the work that is being done by my government to ensure vaccines for all Sri Lankans," Rajapaksa added.

In view of enhanced vaccine production, the Department of Biotechnology has set up a vaccine-testing facility in Pune's National Centre for Cell Science (NCCS). The facility has now been notified as a Central Drugs Laboratory for testing and lot release of COVID-19 vaccines through a gazette notification. The facility is expected to test approximately 60 batches of vaccines each month.

Wimbledon will have 100% capacity crowds on Centre and No. 1 Court from singles quarter-finals onwards as COVID-19 restrictions on attendances are relaxed, the All England Club announced on Sunday. It will mark the first time outdoor stadiums will be at full capacity at a sporting event in Britain since the pandemic began. Last week, only 50% capacity was allowed.

Shares of Panacea Biotec rose as much as 9% in early trade on Monday. This comes a day after the firm said that it has received manufacturing license for the Sputnik V COVID-19 vaccine from the Drugs Controller General of India (DCGI). The license is for batches of Sputnik V produced at its facilities at Baddi, Himachal Pradesh, it added.

A man in Madhya Pradesh has been booked for allegedly creating a fake COVID-19 positive report to stay away from his wife. Family members claimed that he downloaded a COVID-19 positive report from the internet and edited it. The man's wife reportedly became suspicious when he didn't return home after a month and asked her father to verify the report.

Father Stan Swamy, a tribal rights activist arrested in the Elgar Parishad case on October 8 last year, died aged 84 on Monday. His counsel informed the Bombay HC of his death when his bail plea was taken up for hearing. The Jesuit priest was put on ventilator support after his health deteriorated further owing to post-COVID-19 complications on Sunday.

The Central Market in Delhi's Lajpat Nagar has been temporarily shut down for gross violation of COVID-19 guidelines. In an order issued on July 4, the Traders' Association of Lajpat Nagar was issued a show-cause notice, asking why action shouldn't be taken against them for violating norms. Punjabi Basti and Janta Market in Delhi have been shut till July 6.

Several students staged a protest outside the home of Telangana Education Minister Sabitha Indra Reddy in Hyderabad on Monday, demanding that engineering and degree examinations be postponed till all students get COVID-19 vaccines. The minister told the students that the education department is giving priority to the well being of students while making arrangements to conduct the examinations.

No new case of COVID-19 has been reported in Mumbai's Dharavi on Sunday, the Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation said. There are currently 22 active cases in the area, the BMC added. According to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare, there are currently 1,20,802 active COVID-19 cases in Maharashtra and as many as 1,22,724 have died so far.

Father Stan Swamy, arrested in the Elgar Parishad case, has been put on a ventilator after his health deteriorated on Sunday, his lawyer said. Swamy has breathing difficulty as his oxygen levels have been fluctuating, the lawyer said, adding that it could be due to post COVID-19 complications. Swamy has been admitted to a private Mumbai hospital since May 30.

Over 1.17 lakh people in the age group 18-44 were administered COVID-19 vaccine dose in Telangana on Saturday. According to state Director of Public Health, Dr G Srinivasa Rao, 1,17,254 people in the 18-44 age group were vaccinated yesterday. The state initiated vaccination at 100 designated centres in Greater Hyderabad Municipal Corporation limits with prior online registration.

The district administration in Odisha's Puri has decided to restrict public viewing of the Ratha Yatra festival from rooftops of houses and hotels. A curfew will be imposed in Puri town a day before the festival on July 12, the District Magistrate said. The festival will be held without devotees for the second consecutive year due to the COVID-19 pandemic.

The United Arab Emirates (UAE) has approved Moderna's coronavirus vaccine for emergency use, the country's Health Ministry said in a statement on Sunday. It is the fifth vaccine to receive such approval by the Gulf Arab state, according to Reuters. Around 64% of UAE's population has been fully vaccinated against COVID-19 so far, according to the Health Ministry.

The third COVID-19 wave can hit its peak between October-November if COVID-appropriate behaviour isn't followed, according to a scientist of a government panel tasked with modelling of COVID-19 cases. Professor Manindra Agrawal said the third wave may see half the daily cases recorded during the second surge. He added the third wave could spread faster if new virulent variant emerges.

Haryana government on Sunday extended COVID-19 lockdown till 5 am on July 12 and allowed some relaxations with regards to the conduct of exams. The Institute of Chartered Accountants can hold CA exams from July 5 to July 20 with adherence to ICAI and Health Ministry SOPs. Common Entrance Exam by Army Recruiting Office in Hisar has also been allowed.

Iran on Sunday reimposed coronavirus restrictions in 275 cities amid fears that the spread of the Delta variant may trigger another wave of COVID-19 infections in the country. The government said that it was also imposing a travel ban between cities with high infection rates. Iran is the worst coronavirus-hit country in the Middle East with over 32 lakh cases.

BBMP Chief Commissioner Gaurav Gupta on Saturday said 54 teams of marshals have been formed to impose fines on those violating COVID-19 norms. "Each team will have four marshals who'll visit and regulate highly crowded areas," he added. "Police...will work in tandem with marshals. Although cases have decreased in the city, the virus is still around," Bengaluru Police Commissioner said.

India has reported 43,071 new COVID-19 cases and 955 deaths in the last 24 hours, according to the Union Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. This comes after India reported 44,111 cases and 738 deaths on Saturday. With this, the total number of cases reached 3,05,45,433, while the death toll surged to 4,02,005.

Actor Amitabh Bachchan took to Twitter on Sunday and urged his fans to take precautions against coronavirus amid the ongoing pandemic. "This [COVID-19] virus is looking for [a] home, and it resides inside human lungs...Keep all the doors and windows shut and don't let it enter its home! Wear a mask and maintain [a] safe distance," he wrote.

Amazon has been accused of "exploiting consumers in their most vulnerable hour" in a class action lawsuit filed in the US. It alleges that Amazon hiked up prices on face masks, disinfectants, canned food and other necessary supplies by as much as 1,000% during the COVID-19 pandemic. Amazon also inflated prices on its own inventory of products, the complaint added.

Pune's first animal-assisted therapy centre, Swakaya, a venture by Lipi Khemka, has opened with the aim to help people deal with feelings of grief, uncertainty and loss of hope amid COVID-19. It offers patients therapies and healing solutions with trained therapy animals' assistance. The 7,500 square feet premises currently houses 10 therapy cats, eight rabbits and seven visiting therapy dogs.

Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal has demanded Bharat Ratna for the doctors and healthcare workers, who were on the frontline in fighting COVID-19. "This year 'Indian doctor' should get Bharat Ratna. And by 'Indian doctor' I mean all doctors, nurses and paramedics. This will be a true tribute to the doctors who passed away (amid COVID-19)," Kejriwal tweeted on Sunday.

Actress Sayani Gupta recently shared a mirrored selfie on Instagram, and in the caption, she spoke about how the COVID-19 pandemic made her realise the importance of being healthy. "The pandemic...taught me that nothing is more critical than health and well-being. No amount of work or money or social obligation. I...cook for myself...and do yoga every day," she shared.

Eminent economist Pinaki Chakraborty said the RBI should not print money to finance the fiscal deficit as it will lead to fiscal profligacy. Chakraborty, Director of the National Institute of Public Finance and Policy, added, "We should see a faster economic recovery if there's no major third COVID-19 wave." He further said that the high inflation is certainly a concern.

Karnataka Pradesh Congress Committee chief DK Shivakumar on Sunday said if 80% of the people in the state get vaccinated by September-end, a possible third wave of COVID-19 will have only mild effects. He added that only 7% of the state's adult population have received both vaccine doses so far. "Is the state government up for this challenge?" he asked.

US' top infectious disease expert Anthony Fauci said that about 99.2% of recent COVID-19 deaths in America involved unvaccinated people. "It's really sad and tragic that most all of these are avoidable and preventable," he added. The US is the worst coronavirus-hit country in the world with more than 3.37 crore cases and over 6.05 lakh deaths.

Pharmaceutical firm Panacea Biotec said that it has received manufacturing license for COVID-19 vaccine Sputnik V from Drugs Controller General of India (DCGI). The firm has production facilities at Baddi in Himachal Pradesh. The firm has a tie up with Russian Direct Investment Fund and the license is a necessary condition for using Sputnik V produced by Panacea in India.

Prime Minister Narendra Modi will address the CoWIN Global Conclave on Monday as India offers CoWIN as a digital platform to combat COVID-19, tweeted the National Health Authority. Scheduled for 3 pm, the virtual meet is expected to be attended by health and technology experts of different countries. Reportedly, around 50 countries are expected to seek information about CoWIN.

Israel is holding talks to send its surplus doses of the Pfizer-BioNTech COVID-19 vaccine to other countries, Israeli officials said on Sunday. Israel has about 10 lakh surplus doses that are due to expire at the end of the month, a local newspaper reported. "We're dealing with this day and night," the Director General of the Health Ministry said.

The Punjabi Basti and Janta Market in Delhi's Nangloi have been closed till July 6 for violation of COVID-19 guidelines, an order issued by Punjabi Bagh SDM stated. In the event of any shopkeeper found violating this order or any act which may spread COVID-19, necessary action as per law would be taken against him or her, the order added.

Actor Amitabh Bachchan took to Twitter on Sunday and urged his fans to take precautions against coronavirus amid the ongoing pandemic. "This [COVID-19] virus is looking for [a] home, and it resides inside human lungs...Keep all the doors and windows shut and don't let it enter its home! Wear a mask and maintain [a] safe distance," he wrote.

Iran on Sunday reimposed coronavirus restrictions in 275 cities amid fears that the spread of the Delta variant may trigger another wave of COVID-19 infections in the country. The government said that it was also imposing a travel ban between cities with high infection rates. Iran is the worst coronavirus-hit country in the Middle East with over 32 lakh cases.

Thirty-three coronavirus patients died after a public hospital in Indonesia's Yogyakarta city ran out of oxygen due to delays from suppliers over the weekend, a hospital official said on Sunday. The shortage was caused by an increase in patients arriving in deteriorating condition, he added. A total of 63 COVID-19 patients died at the hospital since Saturday, he further said.

The United Arab Emirates (UAE) has approved Moderna's coronavirus vaccine for emergency use, the country's Health Ministry said in a statement on Sunday. It is the fifth vaccine to receive such approval by the Gulf Arab state, according to Reuters. Around 64% of UAE's population has been fully vaccinated against COVID-19 so far, according to the Health Ministry.

US' top infectious disease expert Anthony Fauci said that about 99.2% of recent COVID-19 deaths in America involved unvaccinated people. "It's really sad and tragic that most all of these are avoidable and preventable," he added. The US is the worst coronavirus-hit country in the world with more than 3.37 crore cases and over 6.05 lakh deaths.

The United Arab Emirates (UAE) has approved Moderna's coronavirus vaccine for emergency use, the country's Health Ministry said in a statement on Sunday. It is the fifth vaccine to receive such approval by the Gulf Arab state, according to Reuters. Around 64% of UAE's population has been fully vaccinated against COVID-19 so far, according to the Health Ministry.

Dr William Schaffner, an infectious diseases expert at US' Vanderbilt University, has said that people unvaccinated against coronavirus are potential variant factories. He added, "The more unvaccinated people there are, the more opportunities for the virus to multiply. When it does, it mutates, and it could throw off a variant mutation that is even more serious down the road."

Pharmaceutical firm Panacea Biotec said that it has received manufacturing license for COVID-19 vaccine Sputnik V from Drugs Controller General of India (DCGI). The firm has production facilities at Baddi in Himachal Pradesh. The firm has a tie up with Russian Direct Investment Fund and the license is a necessary condition for using Sputnik V produced by Panacea in India.

Over 1.17 lakh people in the age group 18-44 were administered COVID-19 vaccine dose in Telangana on Saturday. According to state Director of Public Health, Dr G Srinivasa Rao, 1,17,254 people in the 18-44 age group were vaccinated yesterday. The state initiated vaccination at 100 designated centres in Greater Hyderabad Municipal Corporation limits with prior online registration.

Karnataka Pradesh Congress Committee chief DK Shivakumar on Sunday said if 80% of the people in the state get vaccinated by September-end, a possible third wave of COVID-19 will have only mild effects. He added that only 7% of the state's adult population have received both vaccine doses so far. "Is the state government up for this challenge?" he asked.

Afghanistan has reported its first death from Mucormycosis or black fungus, Afghanistan's Health Minister Wahid Majrooh said on Saturday. Two other cases of the fungus were detected in the country, he added. Notably, this comes amid the third wave of coronavirus in Afghanistan that has taken the total number of cases to more than 1.2 lakh.

As per the Pune Municipal Corporation officials, ??4,84,26,733 was returned to COVID-19 patients and their families by June 26 after auditing 1,469 bills. PMC initiated the COVID-19 bill audit last year after complaints about overcharging and inflation of bills by private hospitals. Between June 24-June 30, PMC scrutinised 69 COVID-19 bills and returned ??19,51,642 to patients and their families.

Thirty-three coronavirus patients died after a public hospital in Indonesia's Yogyakarta city ran out of oxygen due to delays from suppliers over the weekend, a hospital official said on Sunday. The shortage was caused by an increase in patients arriving in deteriorating condition, he added. A total of 63 COVID-19 patients died at the hospital since Saturday, he further said.

During the second wave of COVID-19, Mumbai's BMC and Railway authorities penalised 14 lakh people and collected fines of around ??28.2 crore for not wearing masks. While this amount was collected from February 16 to July 1, the BMC has cumulatively collected fines worth ??59.16 crore from April 8, 2020, to July 1, 2021.

Delhi has reported 94 new COVID-19 cases and 111 recoveries in the last 24 hours, taking the total number of active cases in the national capital to 992. The daily COVID-19 positivity rate now stands at 0.13%, government data shows. The total number of recoveries in Delhi has reached 14,08,567 and with seven new deaths, the toll has reached 24,995.

Israel is holding talks to send its surplus doses of the Pfizer-BioNTech COVID-19 vaccine to other countries, Israeli officials said on Sunday. Israel has about 10 lakh surplus doses that are due to expire at the end of the month, a local newspaper reported. "We're dealing with this day and night," the Director General of the Health Ministry said.

A sero-survey carried out in areas under the Pimpri Chinchwad Municipal Corporation (PCMC) has revealed that  81% of the residents have developed antibodies against coronavirus. It showed that children in the age group of 6-18 years have 70.6% antibodies. The antibody prevalence was highest (91.1%) in the 45-60 age group and around 90.5% in senior citizens (60 years and above).

A buffalo that was brought to a protest site by owners of private schools in Madhya Pradesh's Shajapur district went on a rampage and injured a protester. Around 150 protestors were present when the buffalo went berserk and injured a woman. The agitators were demanding the state government should allow the reopening of private schools that were shut amid coronavirus.

A video has surfaced showing TMC leader and outgoing Asansol Municipal Corporation Deputy Mayor Tabassum Ara administering COVID-19 vaccine at a vaccination camp. Ara, who's seen taking injection from a nurse and jabbing a woman, allegedly administered the dose without prior experience. She later said, "I never pushed the injection. I just posed with the syringe to take a picture."

The Lakshadweep administration on Saturday rejected an entry permit plea of Congress MPs Hibi Eden and TN Prathapan, saying their appeal "appears to be a political action". Citing a report prepared by Lakshadweep Police, the administration claimed their visit "is likely to cause unrest". The administration added that the MPs intend to meet people and this could promote COVID-19 spread.

Defence Minister Rajnath Singh on Saturday visited residences of a few BJP leaders and a journalist who died of COVID-19 in his Lok Sabha constituency Lucknow. He met the family of deceased former BJP Lucknow chief Pradeep Bhargava. "His wife Achla urged Singh to help her younger son Abhinav join...BJP and serve...party like her late husband," said a BJP leader.

Union Minister Jitendra Singh on Saturday said the eight northeastern states are witnessing a progressive decline in COVID-19 cases. The positivity rate went from 3.96% on June 30 to 2.94% on July 2, a government statement disclosed. Singh, the MoS (Independent Charge) Development of North Eastern Region (DoNER), held a review meeting with health secretaries of eight northeastern states today.

Active COVID-19 cases in India have fallen below 5 lakh as the country reported 44,111 new cases in the last 24 hours, according to Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. India reported 738 COVID-19 deaths in the last 24 hours. So far, 3,05,02,362 people have been infected with COVID-19, while 4,01,050 people have died.

Speaking about film releases getting delayed due to the coronavirus pandemic, actress Jacqueline Fernandez said, "We need to adjust to...the new working way on sets. We need to adjust to the schedules being disrupted." She added, "Right now, the priority is the war against COVID-19 and making sure that we bring down the cases and most importantly, get vaccinated."

Actress Reyhna Pandit spoke about working amid the ongoing coronavirus pandemic and said, "[We'll] continue working till we get better opportunities." She added, "My focus is to save enough for rainy days. I have learnt that one does need financial stability to survive in such times. I feel sad to see so much pain and agony because people lost jobs."

Several schoolchildren in UK are applying orange juice and soft drinks to a COVID-19 lateral flow test after learning that they can generate a fake "positive" result in order to miss school. University of Hull Professor Mark Lorch, who verified the method, said it was possible to spot a "faked" positive test by washing it with a buffer solution.

Delhi Disaster Management Authority (DDMA) has allowed the markets and malls to open from 10 am to 8 pm from Saturday. The officials have been directed to keep a check on COVID-19 appropriate behaviour. Notably, DDMA on Friday allowed Laxmi Nagar's main market, from Vikas Marg to Lovely Public School, Kishan Kunj and its surrounding markets to open from Saturday.

The Directorate of Health Services, Kashmir has written to Directors of Higher Education (UT of J&K) and School Education (Kashmir) to vaccinate teaching/ non-teaching staff and eligible students against COVID-19 before taking a decision to reopen schools and colleges. The Directorate has also asked the Directors to convey the dates of vaccination "at the earliest".

A video has surfaced showing TMC leader and outgoing Asansol Municipal Corporation Deputy Mayor Tabassum Ara administering COVID-19 vaccine at a vaccination camp. Ara, who's seen taking injection from a nurse and jabbing a woman, allegedly administered the dose without prior experience. She later said, "I never pushed the injection. I just posed with the syringe to take a picture."

Actress Shilpa Shetty took to Instagram on Saturday to share that she has received the second dose of the COVID-19 vaccine. She also shared a video wherein she is seen getting vaccinated at a centre. "Done with my second vaccination dose today. Please book your appointments and get vaccinated at the earliest," Shilpa wrote alongside the video.

The US has donated 25 lakh doses of Moderna COVID-19 vaccine to Pakistan through the WHO-led COVAX scheme. "These vaccines will give a boost to ongoing vaccination drive in Pakistan. Deeply appreciate continued support by...US in our fight against the pandemic," Pakistan's Foreign Ministry's spokesperson Zahid Hafeez Chaudhri said. The country has administered over 1.6 crore vaccine doses so far.

Days after Brazil decided to suspend a $324 million contract for Covaxin amid allegations of irregularities in the deal, Congress spokesperson Supriya Shrinate said, "Why is the Indian government silent, when such serious allegations are being raised?" She further added that 
Bharat Biotech may be a private entity but public fund was diverted for the development of this vaccine.

Bharat Biotech has released results from final analysis from Phase 3 trial for Covaxin COVID-19 vaccine. It said that the vaccine provides 65.2% protection against the Delta COVID-19 variant, which was first detected in India. The company further claimed that the vaccine demonstrates overall efficacy of 77.8% against symptomatic infection. Around 26,000 people had volunteered for the trial.

Almost 10% of the people who had COVID-19 were reinfected during the April wave in Delhi, a study conducted by the Institute of Genomics and Integrative Biology stated. "More than 10%...showed declining and then increasing levels of antibodies," Dr Anurag Agrawal, IGIB director, said. "I think, measuring antibody levels gives a better picture of re-infections in the population," he added.

Russia on Saturday recorded its highest-ever one-day rise in coronavirus deaths at 697, raising its pandemic death toll to over 1.34 lakh. This is the fifth consecutive day that Russia has reported a record number of fatalities due to COVID-19. The country has been witnessing a surge in coronavirus cases due to Delta variant, which was first found in India.

Bharat Biotech has released results from final analysis from Phase 3 trial for Covaxin COVID-19 vaccine. It said that the vaccine provides 65.2% protection against the Delta COVID-19 variant, which was first detected in India. The company further claimed that the vaccine demonstrates overall efficacy of 77.8% against symptomatic infection. Around 26,000 people had volunteered for the trial.

The Delta variant of coronavirus, which was first detected in India, is gaining ground in Italy and accounts for some 22.7% of cases as of June 22, the National Health Institute (ISS) said on Friday. "In Italy, where the vaccination campaign has not yet achieved sufficient coverage, the spread of more transmissible variants may have a significant impact," it added.

Delhi Disaster Management Authority (DDMA) has allowed Laxmi Nagar's main market, from Vikas Marg to Lovely Public School, Kishan Kunj and its surrounding markets to open from Saturday. DDMA directed officials to place a mobile testing van in the area. The main market and surrounding markets had been closed till 10 pm of July 5 amid violations of COVID-19 norms.

Indian Space Research Organisation (ISRO) on Friday gave its nod to the Parliamentary Standing Committee on Education to provide technical assistance for satellite TV classrooms in the country. Scientists from ISRO attended the meeting and gave a presentation to the Ministry of Electronics and Information Technology and Doordarshan on ways to bridge the learning gap due to COVID-19.

ICRA estimated that the revenue growth of 21 drug companies (part of a sample set) in FY22 would be between 7% and 9% as COVID-19 cases decline in India. It added that growth will be supported by a low base of FY21 and steady demand for pharmaceutical products, but the impact of lockdowns during the second wave cannot be discounted.

The US has donated 25 lakh doses of Moderna COVID-19 vaccine to Pakistan through the WHO-led COVAX scheme. "These vaccines will give a boost to ongoing vaccination drive in Pakistan. Deeply appreciate continued support by...US in our fight against the pandemic," Pakistan's Foreign Ministry's spokesperson Zahid Hafeez Chaudhri said. The country has administered over 1.6 crore vaccine doses so far.

Lavish cash transfers that are not well-targeted might not be an appropriate tool to mitigate the blow of a crisis such as the COVID-19 pandemic, Chief Economic Adviser (CEA) Krishnamurthy V Subramanian said. Well-directed credit to vulnerable businesses and individuals, backed by sovereign guarantee, could serve the really needy better and prop up consumption, Subramanian remarked.

Russia on Saturday recorded its highest-ever one-day rise in coronavirus deaths at 697, raising its pandemic death toll to over 1.34 lakh. This is the fifth consecutive day that Russia has reported a record number of fatalities due to COVID-19. The country has been witnessing a surge in coronavirus cases due to Delta variant, which was first found in India.

Speaking about film releases getting delayed due to the coronavirus pandemic, actress Jacqueline Fernandez said, "We need to adjust to...the new working way on sets. We need to adjust to the schedules being disrupted." She added, "Right now, the priority is the war against COVID-19 and making sure that we bring down the cases and most importantly, get vaccinated."

Canadian PM Justin Trudeau has received Moderna's coronavirus vaccine as his second dose after taking Oxford-AstraZeneca vaccine as his first shot. In June, Canada's National Advisory Committee on Immunization had recommended that people who got first dose of Oxford-AstraZeneca vaccine follow it up with a second dose of either Moderna or Pfizer. Trudeau had received his first dose in April.

The Delta variant of coronavirus, which was first detected in India, is gaining ground in Italy and accounts for some 22.7% of cases as of June 22, the National Health Institute (ISS) said on Friday. "In Italy, where the vaccination campaign has not yet achieved sufficient coverage, the spread of more transmissible variants may have a significant impact," it added.

BCCI has announced it will conduct 2,127 matches in 2021-22 domestic season across various age groups in the men's and women's category. The Ranji Trophy, which was cancelled last season due to the COVID-19 pandemic, will be played from November 16, 2021 to February 19, 2022. The season will commence on September 21 with Senior Women's One Day League.

A 46-year-old policeman, who recently lost both his eyes to Mucormycosis, allegedly died by suicide by shooting himself with his service pistol in Maharashtra's Nagpur on Saturday, police said. Head constable Pramod Mergurwar shot himself in the mouth with his service weapon at his home, an official said. He had recovered from COVID-19 and later contracted black fungus.

Iranian President Hassan Rouhani on Saturday said that the country may witness a fifth wave of the coronavirus pandemic due to the Delta variant, which was first detected in India. Rouhani also warned people to be careful as the variant is spreading through the country's southern provinces. Iran has reported more than 32 lakh COVID-19 cases so far.

Actress Shefali Shah, while speaking about her directorial debut 'Someday', revealed that she shot the short film at her residence with a unit of five people. When asked if there were any apprehensions about letting people inside the house amid the COVID-19 pandemic, Shefali said, "We obviously had done our COVID-19 tests, etc...It was very well taken care of."

Actress Shilpa Shetty took to Instagram on Saturday to share that she has received the second dose of the COVID-19 vaccine. She also shared a video wherein she is seen getting vaccinated at a centre. "Done with my second vaccination dose today. Please book your appointments and get vaccinated at the earliest," Shilpa wrote alongside the video.

Chinese Foreign Minister Wang Yi has urged the international community to build a "Great Wall of Immunity" to fight the COVID-19 pandemic. "We should face the imminent challenges together...The most urgent priority is to expedite the construction of the 'Great Wall of Immunity' to fend off the virus, surpass political discrimination and carry out international anti-pandemic cooperation," he said.

Tirath Singh Rawat's reason to resign as Uttarakhand CM due to "constitutional compulsion" is the "biggest lie", Congress' Harish Rawat said. "What can be a bigger lie...that byelections can't be held in Uttarakhand due to COVID-19...and CM is resigning due to constitutional compulsion," Harish added. "The reality is...byelections have been held before in the same COVID-19 period," he stated.

Iranian President Hassan Rouhani on Saturday said that the country may witness a fifth wave of the coronavirus pandemic due to the Delta variant, which was first detected in India. Rouhani also warned people to be careful as the variant is spreading through the country's southern provinces. Iran has reported more than 32 lakh COVID-19 cases so far.

WHO chief Tedros Adhanom Ghebreyesus on Friday said the world is in "a very dangerous period" of COVID-19 pandemic as the Delta variant has now been identified in nearly 100 countries. Ghebreyesus stated that the variant, first detected in India, is continuing to evolve and mutate. It requires constant evaluation and careful adjustment of the public health response, he added.

A Brazilian Supreme Court Justice Rosa Weber on Friday approved an investigation into President Jair Bolsonaro's response to allegations of potential corruption within his Health Ministry involving a vaccine deal. The probe is related to a 1.6 billion reais (over ??2,354 crore) deal to buy two crore doses of COVAXIN. Bolsonaro had said there were no irregularities in the contract.

A 25-year-old Hyderabad man was arrested for allegedly killing his wife and claiming that she died of COVID-19. According to the police, the man suspected his wife of infidelity and killed her by smothering her with a pillow in her sleep on June 18. Earlier, a man in Andhra Pradesh had killed his wife and claimed she died of COVID-19.

A sero-survey carried out in areas under the Pimpri Chinchwad Municipal Corporation (PCMC) has revealed that  81% of the residents have developed antibodies against coronavirus. It showed that children in the age group of 6-18 years have 70.6% antibodies. The antibody prevalence was highest (91.1%) in the 45-60 age group and around 90.5% in senior citizens (60 years and above).

Canadian PM Justin Trudeau has received Moderna's coronavirus vaccine as his second dose after taking Oxford-AstraZeneca vaccine as his first shot. In June, Canada's National Advisory Committee on Immunization had recommended that people who got first dose of Oxford-AstraZeneca vaccine follow it up with a second dose of either Moderna or Pfizer. Trudeau had received his first dose in April.

Madhya Pradesh CM Shivraj Singh Chouhan on Saturday said he did not sleep for seven nights when the state underwent an oxygen crisis during the peak of the second wave of COVID-19. "We worked hard to make oxygen available. I used to talk to the driver of the oxygen tanker to find out where he had reached," said Chouhan.

Saudi Arabia has suspended entry from the United Arab Emirates, Ethiopia and Vietnam amid the spread of COVID-19 and its strains in these countries, state media reported. The ban will apply to anyone who has visited these countries within the last 14 days. Saudi citizens will be allowed to visit these countries only after getting an official permit, it stated.

A man was booked for violating COVID-19 guidelines as he was celebrating his release from jail with his friends. According to police, around 10-15 persons had come in a jeep to receive him. The man was garlanded and a party was organised, where no one was wearing mask, police added. A video of the alleged incident surfaced on social media.

Congress leader Rahul Gandhi on Saturday tweeted a graph that pointed out India's actual COVID-19 vaccination rate is 27% below the government's target rate to avoid a potential third wave. Gandhi wrote, "Mind the gap" while sharing the graph which showed that India's average rate of vaccination stands at 50.8 lakh a day against the government's target of 69.5 lakh.

The Delhi Police issued over 1.62 lakh challans in the national capital from April 19 to July 2 for various COVID-19 related violations, as per official data. Out of this, 1.37 lakh challans were issued for not wearing masks and over 22,000 for violations of social distancing norms. Apart from this, 1,552 challans were issued for holding large public gatherings.

The Centre on Friday announced that nearly 80% of healthcare workers and 90% of frontline workers have been administered both doses of COVID-19 vaccine in the country. It further said that India has administered over 34 crore COVID-19 vaccine doses, maximum across the world. There has been a decline of 86% in active cases since the peak, it added.

A majority of urban Indians left unemployed by the COVID-19 pandemic want the government to guarantee them jobs as it does for people in rural areas, a London School of Economics (LSE) study showed. ??Younger individuals, in the bottom half of pre-COVID earnings, experienced higher levels of worklessness,? the authors wrote based on responses from 4,763 individuals.

Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman has said that India has ramped up its medical infrastructure and is "well prepared" to deal with the situation if there's a third COVID-19 wave. "The way in which we're moving towards greater coverage in vaccination, I hope we would...[be] able to keep most of the vulnerable population from the attack of the virus," Sitharaman added.

Indonesia has approved Moderna coronavirus vaccine for emergency use, the country's Food and Drug Monitoring Agency chief, Penny K Lukito, said. Moderna's vaccine is the first M-RNA shot to obtain emergency use authorisation in Indonesia and will be administered to those aged 18 years and older, Lukito added. Indonesia will receive 40 lakh doses of Moderna vaccine through COVAX scheme.

Union Minister Piyush Goyal criticised Congress leader Rahul Gandhi over his statement that "July has arrived, but vaccines haven't", saying that Rahul should understand that "petty politics, instead of seriousness, isn't right at this time in the fight against COVID-19". Rahul also shared the hashtag, "Where Are Vaccines". Goyal added that 12 crore doses will be available in July.

Actor Kriti Sanon, who battled COVID-19 late last year, spoke about the things she learned amid the ongoing coronavirus pandemic. She shared, "It's made me realise how important it is to stop running so fast and...spend time with your family and be around people who you love. It was a tough year but what breaks you, also makes you stronger."

After facing a shortage of doctors amid the COVID-19 pandemic, BMC is planning to hire retired doctors for a three-year period. "We don't want talent to get wasted," Municipal Commissioner IS Chahal said. "Doctors who had worked in BMC-run medical colleges before retirement can now be reappointed till they reach 65 years of age," Additional Municipal Commissioner Suresh Kakani said.

After seeing a rise in daily COVID-19 cases for two days in a row, India recorded a dip in new cases as 46,617 people tested positive in the last 24 hours. The country saw 853 COVID-19 deaths in the last 24 hours. So far, 3,04,58,251 people have been infected with COVID-19, while 4,00,312 people have died.

A 42-year-old man and his two daughters, aged 18 and 14, died by suicide at their residence in Bengaluru's Attibele. The police suspect that the family was depressed after the man's wife succumbed to coronavirus in April. The man's father found the deceased hanging from the ceiling when he came to check up on them on Wednesday, police said.

International Monetary Fund's Chief Economist Gita Gopinath has expressed concern over the "highly unequal" access to vaccinations causing a "diverging recovery" from the COVID-19 pandemic. "The number one issue is how do we get to a point where we have good coverage of populations in terms of vaccination rates everywhere in the world," Gopinath added.

Private hospitals in Delhi-NCR have started administering the Russian COVID-19 vaccine, Sputnik V, from June 30. "Indraprastha Apollo has started the administration of the Sputnik V vaccine for the public in a staged manner from June 30th," a spokesperson of Apollo Hospitals said. The spokesperson added that more than 1,000 people have been administered the vaccine so far.

West Bengal government's COVID-19 vaccination portal 'Benvax' is illegal, the Leader of Opposition in state Legislative Assembly Suvendu Adhikari said. "I've written about the vaccination scam in West Bengal to the Union Health Ministry," he added. "When vaccination is available [for] free...few hotel groups...charging ??525 of which ??315 is being collected to CM's Relief Fund," Adhikari stated.

The single-shot Johnson & Johnson COVID-19 vaccine produces a strong response against Delta variant of the virus, the company has said. It added that its study found that the vaccine elicits neutralising antibody activity over the course of at least eight months against all variants, including Delta. It further said that there??s no need for the booster at the moment.

A 42-year-old man and his two daughters, aged 18 and 14, died by suicide at their residence in Bengaluru's Attibele. The police suspect that the family was depressed after the man's wife succumbed to coronavirus in April. The man's father found the deceased hanging from the ceiling when he came to check up on them on Wednesday, police said.

Russia on Friday reported its highest one-day rise in coronavirus deaths at 679, making it the fourth straight day that the country has reported a record number of fatalities, according to government data. Russia is fighting a surge in COVID-19 cases due to the Delta variant, which was first detected in India. Russia has reported over 1.33 lakh COVID-19 deaths.

The UAE has barred its citizens from travelling to India and 12 other countries due to COVID-19 pandemic. The other countries are Bangladesh, Nepal, Sri Lanka, Vietnam, Namibia, Zambia, Congo, Uganda, Sierra Leone, Liberia, South Africa and Nigeria. Thursday's order comes after the UAE in June extended its entry ban on passengers from India and 14 countries until July 21.

The Monsoon session of the Parliament will begin on July 19 and conclude on August 13 this year. The session is likely to hold 20 sittings and will be the first session since the crucial results of Assembly elections in Assam, West Bengal, Tamil Nadu, Kerala and Puducherry. Notably, last year Parliament's Winter session was cancelled due to COVID-19.

The Delta variant of COVID-19, which was first found in India, is the second most prevalent coronavirus mutation in the US and is predicted to become the predominant one in the coming weeks, Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) Director Rochelle Walensky said.
"An estimated 25% of all reported SARS-CoV-2 sequences nationwide are Delta variant," he added.

The Union Government on Friday said that states and Union Territories will be getting nearly 45 lakh doses of coronavirus vaccine in the next three days. So far, more than 34 crore doses have been administered in the country since the drive began in mid-January. The new universal phase of the vaccination drive started on June 21.

As many as 51,241 people in Gurugram got vaccinated against the coronavirus infection on Thursday as part of the 'Mega Drive Campaign', according to the data shared by the health department. Nearly 82% of the population of Gurugram has now been inoculated against COVID-19 with at least one vaccine dose. On Thursday, 42,907 people were given the first dose.

Toll collection through FASTag rose 21% in June to ??2,576 crore, as states eased movement restrictions amid the drop in COVID-19 cases. National Highways Authority of India (NHAI) officials said that the number of FASTag toll transactions increased to 15.78 crore in June as compared to 11.65 crore in May. Currently, 96% of NHAI tolls are collected through FASTag.

The single-shot Johnson & Johnson COVID-19 vaccine produces a strong response against Delta variant of the virus, the company has said. It added that its study found that the vaccine elicits neutralising antibody activity over the course of at least eight months against all variants, including Delta. It further said that there??s no need for the booster at the moment.

Nearly 82% of the population of Gurugram has now been inoculated against COVID-19 with at least one vaccine dose. On Thursday, 42,907 people were given the first dose.

Actor Kriti Sanon, who battled COVID-19 late last year, spoke about the things she learned amid the ongoing coronavirus pandemic. She shared, "It's made me realise how important it is to stop running so fast and...spend time with your family and be around people who you love. It was a tough year but what breaks you, also makes you stronger."

A day after suspending COVID-19 vaccination across 300 centres in Mumbai on Thursday, BMC has said that vaccination will be conducted for a limited period of three hours on Friday. Vaccination across a limited number of its centres will be conducted from 2-5 pm, officials said. "Each centre will be given around 200 vaccine doses," a senior BMC official said.

A day after suspending COVID-19 vaccination across 300 centres in Mumbai on Thursday, BMC has said that vaccination will be conducted for a limited period of three hours on Friday. Vaccination across a limited number of its centres will be conducted from 2-5 pm, officials said. "Each centre will be given around 200 vaccine doses," a senior BMC official said.

Russia on Friday reported its highest one-day rise in coronavirus deaths at 679, making it the fourth straight day that the country has reported a record number of fatalities, according to government data. Russia is fighting a surge in COVID-19 cases due to the Delta variant, which was first detected in India. Russia has reported over 1.33 lakh COVID-19 deaths.

The Union Government on Friday said that states and Union Territories will be getting nearly 45 lakh doses of coronavirus vaccine in the next three days. So far, more than 34 crore doses have been administered in the country since the drive began in mid-January. The new universal phase of the vaccination drive started on June 21.

The government has said 56 cases of Delta Plus COVID-19 variant have been found in India as of June 30. The cases have been detected in 12 states, NITI Aayog's Dr VK Paul said. The government had earlier said Delta Plus has been detected in MP, Maharashtra, Punjab, Gujarat, Kerala, Andhra Pradesh, Tamil Nadu, Odisha, Rajasthan, J&K, Karnataka and Haryana.

Goa government on Friday extended the state-wide curfew till 7 am on July 12 while allowing some relaxations in restrictions. Shops in the state can remain open daily from 7 am to 6 pm while salons and outdoor sports complexes and stadiums may also open, Chief Minister Pramod Sawant said. Goa reported 183 new COVID-19 cases on Friday.

NITI Aayog Member Dr VK Paul has cautioned that COVID-19's second wave isn't over yet, even though India is seeing a decline in the number of fresh cases. He said, "[Central] teams have been sent to problem states...We aren't safe until...entire nation is safe." The "Delta plus" variant's cases in India have risen to 56 across 12 states, he added.

As many as 51,241 people in Gurugram got vaccinated against the coronavirus infection on Thursday as part of the 'Mega Drive Campaign', according to the data shared by the health department. Nearly 82% of the population of Gurugram has now been inoculated against COVID-19 with at least one vaccine dose. On Thursday, 42,907 people were given the first dose.

Pakistan's Balochistan province has suspended 70 paramilitary troops without pay after they refused to get vaccinated against coronavirus. The troops were suspended "after repeated written warnings and verbal requests" to receive the vaccine, Habib Ahmed Bangalzai, a senior local official, said. The move comes after the federal government advised all its employees to get vaccinated by June 30.

Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike (BBMP) Chief Commissioner Gaurav Gupta told The Indian Express that coronavirus vaccination for all aged 18-44, barring priority groups, was yet to be opened by the government in the city. Priority is being given to people aged 45 and above, he said. "The availability of doses is an issue as...demand has shot up now," he added.

A study conducted by PGIMER, Chandigarh in association with the Punjab government has shown that one COVID-19 vaccine dose offers 92% protection from death, NITI Aayog's Dr VK Paul said. As per the study, both doses offer 98% protection from death, he said. The study was conducted among Punjab's police personnel who are categorised as a high-risk group, he added.

The Delta variant of COVID-19, which was first found in India, is the second most prevalent coronavirus mutation in the US and is predicted to become the predominant one in the coming weeks, Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) Director Rochelle Walensky said.
"An estimated 25% of all reported SARS-CoV-2 sequences nationwide are Delta variant," he added.

Centre today deputed multi-disciplinary teams to Kerala, Arunachal Pradesh, Tripura, Odisha, Chhattisgarh and Manipur in view of increased number of COVID-19 cases being reported by them. The teams will support them in their efforts for targeted COVID-19 response and management, the Centre said. The teams will monitor the situation and also suggest remedial actions, it added.

The Tamil Nadu government on Friday extended the ongoing COVID-19 lockdown till 6 am on July 12 and announced additional relaxations across the state. Shops can now remain open till 8 pm and dine-in is allowed in tea shops, hotels and restaurants with 50% occupancy. All places of worship can open and maximum 50 guests are allowed at weddings.

Private hospitals in Delhi-NCR have started administering the Russian COVID-19 vaccine, Sputnik V, from June 30. "Indraprastha Apollo has started the administration of the Sputnik V vaccine for the public in a staged manner from June 30th," a spokesperson of Apollo Hospitals said. The spokesperson added that more than 1,000 people have been administered the vaccine so far.

The Centre on Friday announced that nearly 80% of healthcare workers and 90% of frontline workers have been administered both doses of COVID-19 vaccine in the country. It further said that India has administered over 34 crore COVID-19 vaccine doses, maximum across the world. There has been a decline of 86% in active cases since the peak, it added.

Over 2,060 people were administered saline water instead of COVID-19 vaccine doses in nine fake vaccination drives across Mumbai, between May 25 and June 6, the city police said. "We have good evidence against the accused. Many accused have also confessed that they used saline water. In all nine drives, only one syndicate and Shivam Hospital are involved," police added.

The Centre on Friday said pregnant women are now eligible for COVID-19 vaccination. It said that both CoWIN registrations and walk-in vaccinations are allowed for pregnant women at COVID Vaccination Centres (CVCs). The government had earlier issued guidelines for administering COVID-19 vaccines to pregnant women and said that those with pre-existing conditions like diabetes should get vaccinated.

Madhya Pradesh Culture Minister Usha Thakur has urged people to donate ??500 to PM CARES fund after receiving both doses of COVID-19 vaccine. "I urge you to join my campaign...The vaccine costs ??250 per dose. If you've taken both jabs, I request those who are capable and privileged to put ??500 in the PM CARES fund," she said.

Dr Reddy's Laboratories said the Central Drugs Standard Control Organisation's expert committee told the company that it can submit Russian Phase-3 trial data of Sputnik Light for approval in India. There is no need for a separate Phase-3 trial in India, the panel informed Dr Reddy's. The single-dose vaccine has an efficacy of 79.4%, according to Russian Direct Investment Fund.

Maharashtra CM Uddhav Thackeray on Friday said that it was necessary to become self-sufficient in oxygen in order to overcome the COVID-19 pandemic. Thackeray on Friday inaugurated an oxygen generation project set up in five hospitals in Mumbai with CSR funds. Five hospitals are Nehru Science Centre, Bandra Bhabha Hospital, Rajawadi Hospital, Cooper Hospital and Kasturba Hospital.

Pakistan's Balochistan province has suspended 70 paramilitary troops without pay after they refused to get vaccinated against coronavirus. The troops were suspended "after repeated written warnings and verbal requests" to receive the vaccine, Habib Ahmed Bangalzai, a senior local official, said. The move comes after the federal government advised all its employees to get vaccinated by June 30.

Union Minister Piyush Goyal criticised Congress leader Rahul Gandhi over his statement that "July has arrived, but vaccines haven't", saying that Rahul should understand that "petty politics, instead of seriousness, isn't right at this time in the fight against COVID-19".
