Rahul also shared the hashtag, "Where Are Vaccines". Goyal added that 12 crore doses will be available in July.

Health Minister Dr Harsh Vardhan has responded after Congress leader Rahul Gandhi tweeted, "July has come, the vaccine has not arrived." "What is Rahul Gandhi Ji's problem? Does he not read? Does he not understand?" Vardhan wrote. "There is no vaccine for the virus of arrogance and ignorance. Congress must think of a leadership overhaul," he further wrote.

International Monetary Fund's Chief Economist Gita Gopinath has expressed concern over the "highly unequal" access to vaccinations causing a "diverging recovery" from the COVID-19 pandemic. "The number one issue is how do we get to a point where we have good coverage of populations in terms of vaccination rates everywhere in the world," Gopinath added.

Biocon Executive Chairperson Kiran Mazumdar-Shaw has said there is enough data available now to indicate that "it is even better to give two different vaccine shots" for protection against COVID-19. Mix and match studies will help in speeding up vaccinations, she added. Mazumdar-Shaw said further, "Most vaccines are likely to be durable for at least a year, if not more."

Amid rising COVID-19 cases, Russian health authorities have launched booster shots for people vaccinated over six months ago. Moscow Mayor Sergei Sobyanin said he had received a booster shot and urged people to get it. "I'm pleading with you not to miss a chance to get additional protection from...virus, which is particularly important amid...spread of...more aggressive Delta variant," he added.

Indonesia has approved Moderna coronavirus vaccine for emergency use, the country's Food and Drug Monitoring Agency chief, Penny K Lukito, said. Moderna's vaccine is the first M-RNA shot to obtain emergency use authorisation in Indonesia and will be administered to those aged 18 years and older, Lukito added. Indonesia will receive 40 lakh doses of Moderna vaccine through COVAX scheme.

The Indian government is in talks with US-based Johnson & Johnson with regards to its single-dose COVID-19 vaccine, NITI Aayog's Dr VK Paul said. "Their vaccine is being produced outside. As per the plan, this vaccine will also be produced in Hyderabad's Biological E," said Dr Paul. J&J has said its vaccine neutralises all COVID-19 variants, including the Delta variant.

Indonesia has approved Moderna coronavirus vaccine for emergency use, the country's Food and Drug Monitoring Agency chief, Penny K Lukito, said. Moderna's vaccine is the first M-RNA shot to obtain emergency use authorisation in Indonesia and will be administered to those aged 18 years and older, Lukito added. Indonesia will receive 40 lakh doses of Moderna vaccine through COVAX scheme.

Two-wheeler sales showed signs of picking up in June after restrictions to curb the second wave of COVID-19 were lifted. Royal Enfield, TVS Motor and Bajaj Auto were among the two-wheeler manufacturers that announced their June sales and reported positive growth. Royal Enfield's two-wheeler sales were up 57.72% month-on-month while TVS reported a 25% increase over May sales.

To prevent fake vaccination drives, the BMC has issued guidelines for COVID-19 vaccination camps at housing societies and workplaces in Mumbai. The norms include that the vaccination camp can only be conducted by private vaccination centres that are registered on CoWin. Notably, office and housing society managements will also have to appoint a "nodal officer" to coordinate the vaccination drive.

Pakistan's Balochistan province has suspended 70 paramilitary troops without pay after they refused to get vaccinated against coronavirus. The troops were suspended "after repeated written warnings and verbal requests" to receive the vaccine, Habib Ahmed Bangalzai, a senior local official, said. The move comes after the federal government advised all its employees to get vaccinated by June 30.

Over 13 lakh migrants left Delhi during the second wave of COVID-19, as per a report by the Ministry of Labour and Employment submitted to the parliamentary panel of Home Affairs. As many as 5,17,073 migrants left Delhi using trains during the second wave. Nearly 8,00,000 migrants used buses to leave Delhi between mid-April and mid-May, the report added.

Australia plans to halve international passenger arrivals from 6,000 a week to 3,000 from July 14 amid Delta COVID-19 variant outbreak in three state capital cities, PM Scott Morrison said. The measure would reduce pressure on hotel quarantine, he added after meeting with state, territory leaders. Most recent virus outbreaks in Australia have been traced to leaks in hotel isolation.

Biocon Executive Chairperson Kiran Mazumdar-Shaw has said there is enough data available now to indicate that "it is even better to give two different vaccine shots" for protection against COVID-19. Mix and match studies will help in speeding up vaccinations, she added. Mazumdar-Shaw said further, "Most vaccines are likely to be durable for at least a year, if not more."

The Uttar Pradesh government on Friday further relaxed COVID-19 curbs and allowed multiplexes, cinema halls, gyms and sports stadiums to open from Monday (July 5) onwards. However, all these establishments will have to comply with COVID-19 protocols. The decision was taken during a meeting with Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath on Friday.

Commerce Minister Piyush Goyal on Friday said that India recorded the highest ever exports in the first quarter of 2021-22 despite the second COVID-19 wave. Exports during the April-June quarter jumped to $95 billion on account of healthy growth in sectors, including engineering, rice and marine products, he added. Exports in the January-March quarter stood at $90 billion.

Actor Arvind Rathod died aged 83 at his residence in Ahmedabad, Gujarat, on Thursday due to age-related complications. "He was diagnosed with COVID-19 a few months ago, but had recovered. However, due to age-related issues, he was bed-ridden," his relative told Indian Express. Apart from starring in Gujarati films, he also appeared in Hindi films including 'Kora Kagaz' and 'Agneepath'.

Pune Railway Division has collected ??1.52 lakh in the month of June as fines from 680 railway passengers for not wearing face masks. They were also given masks for free. The Railway Division has requested the passengers to wear face masks in the station premises and during the journey in order to prevent the spread of COVID-19.

Tisca Chopra on Friday distributed 1,500 kgs of rice packets to theatre workers in Mumbai amid the COVID-19 pandemic. Speaking about the drive, she said, "These theatre workers have been out of work for this whole time." Tisca added, "If each one of us comes out and helps, we may be able to curb the suffering around us a little."

Government has named states with districts having more than 10% COVID-19 positivity rate between June 23-29. Seventy-one districts have positivity rate of over 10%, with 13 districts from Arunachal Pradesh, 10 districts from Rajasthan, 9 from Andhra Pradesh, 8 from Meghalaya and 7 from Manipur. Other states including Assam, Odisha and Sikkim also have districts with over 10% positivity rate.

The Indian government is in talks with US-based Johnson & Johnson with regards to its single-dose COVID-19 vaccine, NITI Aayog's Dr VK Paul said. "Their vaccine is being produced outside. As per the plan, this vaccine will also be produced in Hyderabad's Biological E," said Dr Paul. J&J has said its vaccine neutralises all COVID-19 variants, including the Delta variant.

Madhya Pradesh Culture Minister Usha Thakur has urged people to donate ??500 to PM CARES fund after receiving both doses of COVID-19 vaccine. "I urge you to join my campaign...The vaccine costs ??250 per dose. If you've taken both jabs, I request those who are capable and privileged to put ??500 in the PM CARES fund," she said.

Actress Huma Qureshi, along with Save the Children foundation, will be setting up a 30-bed pediatric ward in New Delhi in preparation for a possible third wave of COVID-19. "The battle is not yet over. With speculation...about an anticipated third wave and its potential impact on our children, we need to be prepared," Huma said in a statement.

The WHO in its COVID-19 Weekly Epidemiological Update has said that the Delta variant of coronavirus is expected to rapidly outcompete other variants and become the dominant variant over the coming months due to the increase in its transmissibility. It added that as of June 29, 96 countries have reported cases of Delta variant, saying that it's likely an underestimate.

Crowds at Euro 2020 football stadiums and in pubs in host cities are driving the current rise in coronavirus infections in Europe, the WHO said. Last week, new cases rose by 10%, driven by the mixing of crowds in Euro host cities, it said. Meanwhile, Scottish authorities said nearly 2,000 people have attended a Euro event while infectious with COVID-19.

Ladakh has reported no coronavirus-linked fatality in the last 11 days, government officials said on Thursday. The last COVID-19 death was reported on June 19. According to official data, 202 people lost their lives due to COVID-19 in Ladakh, of which 58 deaths were reported in Kargil and 144 in Leh. The Union Territory's coronavirus infection tally stands at 20,073.

The Reserve Bank of India (RBI) has released the bi-annual Financial Stability Report in which Governor Shaktikanta Das wrote that the second wave of coronavirus pandemic took a "grievous toll" on India. "The recovery that had commenced in the second half of 2020-21 was dented in April-May 2021, but...economic activity has started to look up in late May," Das said.

Amid complaints of vaccine shortage, Union Health Minister Dr Harsh Vardhan on Thursday urged state leaders to not "create panic" and focus on planning the coronavirus vaccination drive. In a Twitter thread, he revealed that states will get 12 crore doses in July. "If...leaders are aware of...facts and are still giving such statements, I consider it most unfortunate," he wrote.

RS Sharma, the CEO of the National Health Authority, on Thursday said it would be wrong to say that India was complacent or didn't work enough for containment during the second coronavirus wave. "One cannot...pass judgements that the country was not prepared because no country was prepared," he said, adding that India needs to focus on healthcare infrastructure.

Pune has reported the highest active cases of mucormycosis as of Monday and it continues to report the highest active COVID-19 cases in Maharashtra, as per the state health department. Out of the total 4,086 active or under treatment mucormycosis cases in the state, Pune has 858 active cases, which is the highest among all the districts in the state.

Odisha CM Naveen Patnaik disbursed ??386 crore as COVID-19 package for landless farmers across the state under the KALIA 'Krushak Assistance for Livelihood and Income Augmentation' scheme. Around 18 lakh registered farmers will be benefited and the money will be deposited in their bank accounts directly. Under the KALIA scheme, farmers get ??12,500 in three instalments.

The central government has directed various ministries and departments to restrict their overall expenditure within 20% of their annual budgetary allocation in the July-September quarter amid the COVID-19 pandemic. The restriction won't be applicable to ministries or departments such as health, agriculture, fertilisers, pharma, food, drinking water, railways, road transport and rural development.

Delhi minister Rajendra Pal Gautam on Thursday said there are 67 cases of orphaned children due to COVID-19 in the national capital. "While 651 children lost their mothers, as many as 1,311 lost their fathers. A scheme will be launched to provide financial assistance to such children," Gautam added. As many as 24,977 people have died of COVID-19 in Delhi.

Zydus Cadila has applied for Emergency Use Authorisation (EUA) to Drug Controller General of India (DCGI) for the launch of its vaccine ZyCoV-D, the world's first Plasmid DNA vaccine for COVID-19, for 12 years and above. The company said that primary efficacy of 66.6% was attained for symptomatic RT-PCR positive cases in the interim analysis from Phase III clinical trials.

India has reported 48,786 new COVID-19 cases and 1,005 deaths in the last 24 hours, according to the Union Health Ministry. This comes after the country reported 45,951 COVID-19 cases and 817 deaths on Wednesday. With this, the total COVID-19 cases in the country reached 3,04,11,634 while the death toll surged to 3,99,459. India currently has 5,23,257 active COVID-19 cases.

Delhi Health Minister Satyendar Jain said that the national capital has not reported any case of Delta plus coronavirus variant so far. "The last wave which Delhi witnessed was because of the Delta variant. Coronavirus mutates continuously. There are multiple variants such as Alpha, Beta, Gamma, Delta, etc," he added. "We are aggressively preparing for any subsequent waves," Jain stated.

The Delta COVID-19 variant, first identified in India, has been detected in 96 countries, 11 more than last week, the World Health Organisation (WHO) said in its weekly epidemiological update. Africa has reported many new outbreaks of the variant as Tunisia, Mozambique, Uganda, Nigeria and Malawi are among the 11 new countries targeted by the variant, the WHO added.

Mumbai Police has arrested one of the main accused in the fake COVID-19 vaccination drive case, Rajesh Pandey, from Baramati on Wednesday. Pandey, named in multiple FIRs is accused of using his identity as an employee of Kokilaben Ambani Hospital defrauding people in the name of vaccination. The total number of accused persons arrested in the case reached 12.

The PCMC has decided to go ahead with its pay and parking policy starting from Thursday, despite BJP and NCP opposing the move. "Implementing the policy at this time of COVID-19 pandemic is not appropriate," said BJP Pimpri-Chinchwad president Mahesh Landge. NCP Pimpri-Chinchwad president Sanjog Waghere said that NCP will take to the streets if the decision is not withdrawn.

A government panel denied permission to Serum Institute of India (SII) for conducting Covovax COVID-19 vaccine trials on children aged 2 to 17, reports said. The panel asked SII to submit safety data from the clinical trials of Covovax COVID-19 vaccine on adults first, reports added. It reportedly denied permission as the vaccine hasn??t been approved in any country yet.

PM Narendra Modi held a meeting with his Council of Ministers on Wednesday and said that the vaccination drive should be scaled up to prevent a third COVID-19 wave. He also suggested the ministers to follow COVID-19 protocols and wear masks while visiting their constituencies. The PM added that people have to remain vigilant to contain the spread of COVID-19.

Odisha Health Department has said that no COVID-19 vaccination session has been planned in 16 out of 30 districts for Thursday due to vaccine shortage. The districts where no session has been planned are Angul, Balangir, Balasore, Bargarh, Bhadrak, Deogarh, Dhenkanal, Ganjam, Jajpur, Jharsuguda, Kandhamal, Kendrapara, Koraput, Nabarangpur, Sonepur and Sundargarh.

India's manufacturing sector activity contracted in June for the first time in 11 months amid COVID-19 pandemic, according to a private survey. IHS Markit India Manufacturing Purchasing Managers' Index (PMI) stood at 48.1 in June as compared to 50.8 in May, falling below the 50-mark threshold which separates growth from contraction. Capital goods was the worst-affected area, IHS Markit said.

This Doctors' Day, Sun Pharma has launched 'Sunkalp', an initiative dedicated to doctors who've been working relentlessly since the pandemic struck. It promises to provide a helping hand to doctors via donation of COVID-19 medicines and vaccines, educational aid for children of doctors who lost their lives to COVID-19, post-doctorate educational sponsorship and mental health support to doctors.

AIIMS Director Dr Randeep Guleria said that there's not much data on the Delta Plus COVID-19 variant to suggest "it's more infectious, causing more deaths, or has developed a significant immune escape mechanism". "If COVID-19 appropriate behaviour is followed, we'll be safe against any of the emerging variants," he added. Meanwhile, India reported 48,786 new COVID-19 cases on Thursday.

Telangana government has extended the gap between two doses of Covishield vaccine to 14-16 weeks. This gap is more than what is prescribed by the Centre, which had increased the gap between two doses from 6-8 weeks to 12-16 weeks in May. Meanwhile, Telangana recorded 917 COVID-19 cases on Wednesday, taking the total number of cases to 6,23,510.

The Maharashtra government has informed the Bombay High Court that it has started a home COVID-19 vaccination drive in Pune on an experimental basis. It would later be implemented in other districts as well. The state government added that it would invite emails from interested people on a dedicated email-id, which will be announced publicly through print and electronic media.

Karnataka Health Minister Dr K Sudhakar said that a COVID Warrior Memorial would be built in Bengaluru in honour of doctors and paramedical staff who passed away amid the fight against the virus. "I believe this is the first memorial in the country," Sudhakar said during a function to celebrate National Doctors Day.

Germany's CureVac said that final trial results showed its COVID-19 vaccine had an efficacy rate of 48% across all age groups. "The unprecedented context of 15 strains circulating"  were partly responsible for the low efficacy, it added. The vaccine is 53% effective against severe illness in 18 to 60-year-olds and 77% effective against moderate and severe disease progression, it said.

India's drug regulator has reportedly denied permission to Hyderabad-based Dr Reddy's Laboratories to conduct Phase-3 trials for the Russian COVID-19 vaccine Sputnik Light. According to reports, the expert committee of the Central Drugs Standard Control Organisation (CDSCO) refused to allow Dr Reddy's to conduct Phase-3 trials because it did not find the "scientific rationale" behind the same.

TMC on Thursday showed two pictures of an alleged aide of Debanjan Deb, the main accused in the fake COVID-19 vaccination racket, to claim that Governor Jagdeep Dhankhar could be involved with it. "In one photo, he can be seen standing behind Deb while in...other he is seen standing near the governor and his family," MP Sukhendu Sekhar Ray said.

Zydus Cadila MD Sharvil Patel has said that the company expects to produce 1 crore doses per month of its COVID-19 vaccine ZyCoV-D from August and 5 crore doses by December. "Our target is to produce 10 crore vaccine doses in a year," Patel added. On Thursday, the company applied for emergency use approval of the three-shot vaccine in India.

A video is being widely circulated on social media, showing a stampede-like situation at a COVID-19 vaccination centre in Madhya Pradesh's Chhindwara district. Hundreds of people can be seen pushing and falling over each other in the video. The incident took place after a rumour on shortage of COVID-19 vaccines spread at the vaccination centre, according to reports.

BJP MP Sushil Modi asked on Thursday as to why former Bihar CMs Lalu Prasad Yadav and Rabri Devi haven't taken the COVID-19 vaccine. This comes a day after RJD leaders Tejashwi Yadav and Tej Pratap Yadav took Sputnik V shots at a Patna hospital. Sushil Modi said, "If Lalu Prasad is already vaccinated, the information should be made public."

Ladakh has reported no coronavirus-linked fatality in the last 11 days, government officials said on Thursday. The last COVID-19 death was reported on June 19. According to official data, 202 people lost their lives due to COVID-19 in Ladakh, of which 58 deaths were reported in Kargil and 144 in Leh. The Union Territory's coronavirus infection tally stands at 20,073.

The national capital on Thursday reported 93 new COVID-19 cases, according to the Delhi State Health Bulletin. With this, the active cases in Delhi have reached 1,357 and with four deaths in the last 24 hours, the toll has reached 24,981. Over 14 lakh people have recovered from COVID-19 in the national capital so far, the bulletin stated.

The Reserve Bank of India (RBI) has released the bi-annual Financial Stability Report in which Governor Shaktikanta Das wrote that the second wave of coronavirus pandemic took a "grievous toll" on India. "The recovery that had commenced in the second half of 2020-21 was dented in April-May 2021, but...economic activity has started to look up in late May," Das said.

The Delhi government has allowed waiver of the licence fee of bars in hotels and restaurants for two months as they were closed due to the lockdown during the second wave of COVID-19. After the Delhi Disaster Management Authority issued an order, all bars in hotels and restaurants were closed from April 16 to June 20.

Maharashtra on Thursday recorded 9,195 new COVID-19 cases, taking the number of active cases to 1,16,667. Besides, 252 COVID-19 deaths were reported in the day, taking the number of total fatalities to 1,22,197. As many as 8,634 patients were discharged in the day and the recovery rate in the state reached 96.01%.

Himachal Pradesh reported its first case of Delta Plus COVID-19 variant in Kangra district on Thursday. "There are 69 cases of Delta variant in Kangra," Chief Medical Officer (CMO) of Kangra, Dr GD Gupta, added. He informed that an old sample of May 26 has tested positive for Delta Plus variant and the person is in good health.

India's cumulative COVID-19 vaccination coverage reached nearly 34 crore, as per the 7 pm provisional report on Thursday. According to the report, more than 38.17 lakh vaccine doses were administered today. So far, more than 9.61 crore vaccine doses have been administered in the age group of 18-44, the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare said.

A European Union-wide COVID-19 certificate came into force on Thursday, as the EU aims to streamline summer travel within the region. The digital certificate containing a QR code validates whether a traveller has been vaccinated, recovered from COVID-19, or has recently tested COVID-19 negative. As per EU, the certificate holder should "in principle be exempted from free movement restrictions".

Crowds at Euro 2020 football stadiums and in pubs in host cities are driving the current rise in coronavirus infections in Europe, the WHO said. Last week, new cases rose by 10%, driven by the mixing of crowds in Euro host cities, it said. Meanwhile, Scottish authorities said nearly 2,000 people have attended a Euro event while infectious with COVID-19.

The WHO in its COVID-19 Weekly Epidemiological Update has said that the Delta variant of coronavirus is expected to rapidly outcompete other variants and become the dominant variant over the coming months due to the increase in its transmissibility. It added that as of June 29, 96 countries have reported cases of Delta variant, saying that it's likely an underestimate.

Filmmaker Sanjay Leela Bhansali said that the shoot of 'Gangubai Kathiawadi' has finally ended. Speaking about it, he said, "We began shooting in December...2019. [But] we had to stop shooting in March 2020 due to COVID-19." He added, "I don't know if it was the most difficult [film]. Because each of my films brings its own share of agony."

Amid complaints of vaccine shortage, Union Health Minister Dr Harsh Vardhan on Thursday urged state leaders to not "create panic" and focus on planning the coronavirus vaccination drive. In a Twitter thread, he revealed that states will get 12 crore doses in July. "If...leaders are aware of...facts and are still giving such statements, I consider it most unfortunate," he wrote.

A video is being widely circulated on social media, showing a stampede-like situation at a COVID-19 vaccination centre in Madhya Pradesh's Chhindwara district. Hundreds of people can be seen pushing and falling over each other in the video. The incident took place after a rumour on shortage of COVID-19 vaccines spread at the vaccination centre, according to reports.

BJP MP Sushil Modi asked on Thursday as to why former Bihar CMs Lalu Prasad Yadav and Rabri Devi haven't taken the COVID-19 vaccine. This comes a day after RJD leaders Tejashwi Yadav and Tej Pratap Yadav took Sputnik V shots at a Patna hospital. Sushil Modi said, "If Lalu Prasad is already vaccinated, the information should be made public."

India's cumulative COVID-19 vaccination coverage reached nearly 34 crore, as per the 7 pm provisional report on Thursday. According to the report, more than 38.17 lakh vaccine doses were administered today. So far, more than 9.61 crore vaccine doses have been administered in the age group of 18-44, the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare said.

WHO chief Dr Tedros Adhanom Ghebreyesus urged nations to vaccinate at least 10% of the population by September, asserting that failure to vaccinate in some countries will impact all countries globally. He warned that "until we end the pandemic everywhere, we will not end it anywhere". Vast inequities in the access to vaccines are fuelling a two-track pandemic, Ghebreyesus added.

The Gurugram Health Department is aiming to vaccinate 50,000 people on Thursday on the occasion of National Doctors Day. As part of the initiative, a 'Mega Drive Campaign' will be held at 220 places across the district. The officials said that the vaccines will be administered at 178 government health centres, 40 private hospitals and two drive-through facilities.

Telangana government has extended the gap between two doses of Covishield vaccine to 14-16 weeks. This gap is more than what is prescribed by the Centre, which had increased the gap between two doses from 6-8 weeks to 12-16 weeks in May. Meanwhile, Telangana recorded 917 COVID-19 cases on Wednesday, taking the total number of cases to 6,23,510.

Odisha Health Department has said that no COVID-19 vaccination session has been planned in 16 out of 30 districts for Thursday due to vaccine shortage. The districts where no session has been planned are Angul, Balangir, Balasore, Bargarh, Bhadrak, Deogarh, Dhenkanal, Ganjam, Jajpur, Jharsuguda, Kandhamal, Kendrapara, Koraput, Nabarangpur, Sonepur and Sundargarh.

A government panel denied permission to Serum Institute of India (SII) for conducting Covovax COVID-19 vaccine trials on children aged 2 to 17, reports said. The panel asked SII to submit safety data from the clinical trials of Covovax COVID-19 vaccine on adults first, reports added. It reportedly denied permission as the vaccine hasn??t been approved in any country yet.

This Doctors' Day, Sun Pharma has launched 'Sunkalp', an initiative dedicated to doctors who've been working relentlessly since the pandemic struck. It promises to provide a helping hand to doctors via donation of COVID-19 medicines and vaccines, educational aid for children of doctors who lost their lives to COVID-19, post-doctorate educational sponsorship and mental health support to doctors.

The Madras High Court on Wednesday said, "Can a citizen refuse to take a vaccine as a matter of right? It's doubtful whether the right to refuse to take the vaccine can be exercised in such circumstances." It added, "Vaccinating oneself may not only be to protect oneself but also in the larger interest of public health."

The Himachal Road Transport Corporation (HRTC) resumed its interstate operations, including luxury buses, on Thursday. The public transport was suspended on May 10 amid statewide restrictions to check the spread of COVID-19. As per an official statement, 317 interstate buses have been started, out of which, 15 are Volvo buses, four deluxe and 298 ordinary buses.

Germany's CureVac said that final trial results showed its COVID-19 vaccine had an efficacy rate of 48% across all age groups. "The unprecedented context of 15 strains circulating"  were partly responsible for the low efficacy, it added. The vaccine is 53% effective against severe illness in 18 to 60-year-olds and 77% effective against moderate and severe disease progression, it said.

On National Doctors' Day eve on Thursday, WHO Regional Director (South-East Asia) Dr Poonam Khetrapal Singh lauded healthcare workers for working tirelessly amid the COVID-19. She said, "[Countless] lives have been saved...thanks to our healthcare...workers [who've] continued to work...for over 18 months." She expressed her condolences to the kins of those healthcare workers who died of COVID-19.

The Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation has proposed to set up a ??21-crore oxygen bottling plant at Mahul as a part of its preparations to tackle the possible COVID-19 third wave. Currently, BMC refills its oxygen cylinders from an oxygen supplier's plant at Turbhe and Rabale in Navi Mumbai. The proposal will be tabled for approval before BMC??s Standing Committee on Wednesday.

Russian President Vladimir Putin said he'd received domestically-made Sputnik V vaccine against coronavirus earlier this year. Putin, who received the two-dose vaccine in March and April, said he was asked not to reveal the name of the vaccine earlier so as to not give any competitive advantage to product. Authorities had also not published any videos/photos of Putin getting inoculated.

The loss of revenue following the restrictions during the second wave of COVID-19, along with an increase in spending on pandemic relief measures, could result in the widening of the fiscal deficit by as much as one percentage point, as per estimates from six economists. Nomura Holdings and Barclays Plc expect the deficit to be wider than 7%.

The World Bank has approved $130 million of additional funds for Kenya to help buy coronavirus vaccines to tackle pandemic. "[This]...will enable the government to expand access to more Kenyans free of cost", Keith Hansen, World Bank Country Director for Kenya, said. The financing will help Kenya buy vaccines through African Vaccine Acquisition Task Team (AVATT) initiative and COVAX scheme.

Russia President Vladimir Putin said he doesn't "support mandatory vaccinations" amid rising coronavirus  cases and slow vaccination rate in the country. However, Putin urged Russians to get vaccinated against COVID-19, saying, "It's necessary to listen...to specialists". Earlier, Kremlin had said Russia would fall short of its goal to vaccinate 60% of its population by autumn due to low uptake.

Amid fears over third wave of coronavirus, the government quoted NITI Aayog member Dr VK Paul and stated that COVID-19 in children is "often asymptomatic and seldom requires hospitalisation". The government statement further highlighted that there is no data, either from India or globally, to show that children will be seriously infected in subsequent COVID-19 waves.

Guatemalan Health Minister Amelia Flores said the government has asked Russia to return the money it'd paid for Sputnik V COVID-19 vaccine doses due to non-delivery. "We'd paid about $80 million in April for eight million vaccine doses, but we've received just 1,50,000," the government said. The vaccine shipment will arrive in Guatemala soon, Russian Direct Investment Fund (RDIF) said.

West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee has claimed states smaller than Bengal have received more vaccines. "We got 1.99 crores COVID-19 vaccine doses and we have administered 1.90 crore doses. We don't have vaccines so we are giving only second dose in Kolkata," Banerjee said. On the fake vaccination in the state, she said that cheaters are more dangerous than terrorists.

A COVID-19 Vaccine Testing Centre has been set up at the viral Bio Safety Level-3 (BSL-3) facility in the Centre for Infectious Disease Research (CIDR) at the Indian Institute of Science (IISc) in Bengaluru. At this centre, solutions to tackle COVID-19, vaccines, antivirals, materials and equipment, from academic and industry partners will be tested via a fee-for-service model.

COVID-19 vaccination has been suspended for the second straight day in UP's Gautam Buddha Nagar. "We are now completely out of stock," Gautam Buddha Nagar chief medical officer Dr Deepak Ohri said. "The state headquarters has assured that we will get at least 1,00,000 vaccines before the mass vaccination drive kicks off in Noida on July 1," Ohri added.

Passengers travelling from Maharashtra to Karnataka will have to compulsorily carry a negative RT-PCR report, not older than 72 hours, or certificate of at least one vaccine dose, according to an order issued by the Karnataka government. The move comes in the wake of the Delta Plus variant of COVID-19 being reported from several districts in Maharashtra, the order stated.

Brazil's Health Ministry has suspended a ??2,400 crore deal to buy two crore doses of India's Covaxin COVID-19 vaccine amid corruption allegations. Brazilian federal prosecutors have opened an investigation into the deal over comparatively high prices, quick talks and pending regulatory approvals. However, the ministry claimed there are no irregularities in the deal.

India's Bharat Biotech has said it followed a step-by-step approach for regulatory approval and supply contract for its COVID-19 vaccine Covaxin in Brazil during the eight-month-long process. "We haven't received any advance payments nor supplied vaccines to Brazil," it added. Its statement came after Brazil suspended a ??2,400-crore deal to buy two crore Covaxin doses amid corruption allegations.

COVID-19 vaccination has been suspended for the second straight day in UP's Gautam Buddha Nagar. "We are now completely out of stock," Gautam Buddha Nagar chief medical officer Dr Deepak Ohri said. "The state headquarters has assured that we will get at least 1,00,000 vaccines before the mass vaccination drive kicks off in Noida on July 1," Ohri added.

Guatemalan Health Minister Amelia Flores said the government has asked Russia to return the money it'd paid for Sputnik V COVID-19 vaccine doses due to non-delivery. "We'd paid about $80 million in April for eight million vaccine doses, but we've received just 1,50,000," the government said. The vaccine shipment will arrive in Guatemala soon, Russian Direct Investment Fund (RDIF) said.

Maharashtra government on Wednesday told Bombay High Court it would start home vaccination against COVID-19 for people who are immobile or bedridden without waiting for  Centre's approval. Maharashtra said home vaccination on a trial basis would be introduced in Pune district first. It added that families of immobile citizens will have to send e-mails to the authorities and get appointments.

West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee has claimed states smaller than Bengal have received more vaccines. "We got 1.99 crores COVID-19 vaccine doses and we have administered 1.90 crore doses. We don't have vaccines so we are giving only second dose in Kolkata," Banerjee said. On the fake vaccination in the state, she said that cheaters are more dangerous than terrorists.

Indian Medical Association has shared a state-wise list of the number of doctors who have died amid COVID-19 second wave in India. It said 798 doctors have died during second wave so far. The highest number of deaths among doctors has been reported from Delhi (128), followed by Bihar (115), Uttar Pradesh (79), West Bengal (62) and Tamil Nadu (51).

Cipla has said it is supporting US-based Moderna with importation of COVID-19 vaccines to be donated to India and "there is no definitive agreement on commercial supplies" at this stage. Earlier, the Drugs Controller General of India (DCGI) granted permission to Mumbai-based Cipla to import Moderna's COVID-19 vaccine. This is the fourth vaccine to get approval for use in India.

Telangana on Tuesday recorded 987 fresh COVID-19 cases and seven more deaths. The Greater Hyderabad Municipal Corporation (GHMC) accounted for the most number of cases with 130 followed by Khammam (102) and Nalgonda (69) districts, a state government bulletin said. The case fatality and recovery rates in the state were at 0.58% and 97.24%, respectively.

Manipal Hospitals in Bengaluru launched a COVID-19 vaccination drive for the transgender community to celebrate Pride Month. Exclusive vaccination slots for the transgender community will be provided at the Manipal Hospitals on Old Airport Road till July 3, the hospital said. "The initiative has been taken with the sole objective of highlighting accessible, inclusive healthcare for all," it added.

India has reported 45,951 new COVID-19 cases and 817 deaths in the last 24 hours. The country reported the lowest deaths in the last 81 days. This comes after India reported 37,566 COVID-19 cases and 907 deaths on Tuesday. With this, the total COVID-19 cases in the country reached 3,03,62,848 while the death toll surged to 3,98,454.

COVID-19 vaccine Covaxin, produced by Bharat Biotech, effectively neutralises both Alpha and Delta strains of coronavirus, according to US National Institute of Health (NIH). Published results from a phase 2 trial of the vaccine indicate it is safe and well-tolerated, US' NIH said, adding that safety data from a phase 3 trial of Covaxin will become available later this year.

Delhi's Laxmi Nagar main market and surrounding markets, including Mangal Bazaar, Vijay Chowk, Subhash Chowk, Jagatram Park and Guru Ramdas Nagar, will remain shut till 10 pm of July 5. This comes amid violations of COVID-19 norms in these markets, East Delhi DM said. "Due to large footfall, the market association...were unable to ensure COVID-19 protocols," the official order said.

North Korean leader Kim Jong-un has replaced several senior officials after a "crucial" coronavirus incident. He said that officials had neglected their duties, "creating a great crisis in ensuring the security of the state and safety of the people". Analysts said that the latest development was a clear indication that there had been COVID-19 infections in the country.

Tamil Nadu Chief Minister MK Stalin has sanctioned ??100 crore to initiate precautionary measures to tackle a possible third wave of COVID-19 in the state. "The CM has directed allocating ??100 crore towards buying necessary liquid oxygen for government hospitals," said an official release. Meanwhile, Tamil Nadu reported 4,512 fresh COVID-19 cases on Tuesday.

General Insurance Corporation of India (GIC Re) posted a consolidated net profit of ??1,991.59 crore in the financial year 2020-21, as against a loss of ??186.46 crore in FY20. GIC's FY21 profit after tax stood at ??1,920.44 crore. The company said COVID-19 has "created significant uncertainties" in terms of growth prospects despite returning to black in the previous fiscal year.

Five Indian drugmakers have collaborated to conduct a clinical trial for Merck's experimental anti-viral drug to treat patients with mild COVID-19. The companies are Cipla, Dr Reddy's Laboratories, Emcure Pharmaceuticals, Sun Pharma and Torrent Pharma. These firms had entered into licensing agreements with Merck to make and supply molnupiravir to India and over 100 low and middle-income countries.

India's Bharat Biotech has said it followed a step-by-step approach for regulatory approval and supply contract for its COVID-19 vaccine Covaxin in Brazil during the eight-month-long process. "We haven't received any advance payments nor supplied vaccines to Brazil," it added. Its statement came after Brazil suspended a ??2,400-crore deal to buy two crore Covaxin doses amid corruption allegations.

The Supreme Court has directed Centre to frame guidelines within six weeks to pay ex-gratia compensation to families of those who died due to COVID-19. "The reasonable amount to be provided is left to wisdom of National Disaster Management Authority," the court said. Centre had earlier told?the court that ??4-lakh compensation cannot be paid to families of COVID-19 victims.

The World Bank has approved $130 million of additional funds for Kenya to help buy coronavirus vaccines to tackle pandemic. "[This]...will enable the government to expand access to more Kenyans free of cost", Keith Hansen, World Bank Country Director for Kenya, said. The financing will help Kenya buy vaccines through African Vaccine Acquisition Task Team (AVATT) initiative and COVAX scheme.

The impact of the COVID-19 pandemic on tourism could cause a loss of more than $4 trillion to the global economy for 2020 and 2021, according to a UN report. It said that international tourism and its closely linked sectors suffered an estimated loss of $2.4 trillion in 2020. A similar loss may occur this year, the report added.

COVID-19 vaccine Covaxin, produced by Bharat Biotech, effectively neutralises both Alpha and Delta strains of coronavirus, according to US National Institute of Health (NIH). Published results from a phase 2 trial of the vaccine indicate it is safe and well-tolerated, US' NIH said, adding that safety data from a phase 3 trial of Covaxin will become available later this year.

The administration had hiked the cost of platform tickets to ??50 at Pune Railway Division Stations to avoid crowding amid COVID-19. However, due to the drop in cases now the platform ticket will cost ??10 from July 1. "Pune, Kolhapur, Sangli and Miraj stations had temporarily increased platform ticket for ??50," railways stated in a press release.

Actor Aniruddh Dave, who was discharged from the hospital after battling COVID-19 for over a month, has revealed that actor-filmmaker Satish Kaushik helped him a lot during that period. He added, "Satish ji helped a lot. He spoke to the doctors and a lot of people for me." Reacting to it, Satish said, "I'm delighted that Aniruddh is alright now."

Union Health Secretary Rajesh Bhushan wrote to Chief Secretary of West Bengal Hari Krishna Dwivedi asking to probe COVID-19 vaccination camps being organised in Kolkata by unauthorised people and submit a report in two days. He highlighted that vaccination certificates weren't issued which "raises doubts on contents of injections delivered". Earlier, TMC MP Mimi Chakraborty had busted a fake camp.

Ex-US State Secretary Mike Pompeo has said the Chinese Communist Party must be held responsible for the COVID-19 that was leaked from the Wuhan Virology Institute and then covered up. Pompeo said China should be thrown out of the WHO and the US shouldn't send athletes to the 2022 Olympics in Beijing. Possible government sanctions may be necessary, Pompeo added.

Odisha government has extended the partial lockdown in the state till July 16. There will be no weekend shutdown in 20 districts including Sambalpur and Deogarh where COVID-19 positivity rate is below 5%. Shops will be allowed to open from 6am to 6pm in these districts, while in the remaining 10 districts, shops can open from 6am to 2pm.

Russian President Vladimir Putin said he'd received domestically-made Sputnik V vaccine against coronavirus earlier this year. Putin, who received the two-dose vaccine in March and April, said he was asked not to reveal the name of the vaccine earlier so as to not give any competitive advantage to product. Authorities had also not published any videos/photos of Putin getting inoculated.

Kerala Chief Minister Pinarayi Vijayan on Tuesday said that bodies of those who died of COVID-19 will be allowed to be taken home for one hour so that their family can conduct last rites. "The family members...of those who lose their lives to COVID-19 are unable to pay their last respects, which is...adding to emotional distress," he explained.

The government has clarified that a picture claiming that PM Narendra Modi has announced that third wave of COVID-19 has hit India is fake. The picture's claim that a strict lockdown will be imposed in the country is also incorrect, it added. "Please do not share such misleading messages," the government urged the citizens.

India has requested EU member states to individually consider extending exemption to people who've taken Covishield and Covaxin COVID-19 vaccines and accept vaccination certificate issued through CoWin, as per reports. India would reciprocally exempt people from concerned EU member states carrying EU Digital COVID-19 Certificate from mandatory quarantine if the request is accepted, reports added.

Russia President Vladimir Putin said he doesn't "support mandatory vaccinations" amid rising coronavirus  cases and slow vaccination rate in the country. However, Putin urged Russians to get vaccinated against COVID-19, saying, "It's necessary to listen...to specialists". Earlier, Kremlin had said Russia would fall short of its goal to vaccinate 60% of its population by autumn due to low uptake.

Private hospitals can no longer buy vaccines directly from manufacturers and they will have to place orders on Co-WIN from July 1, the Union Health Ministry said. The ministry also capped the number of doses a private hospital can order for a given month. The government will facilitate the supply of vaccines after payment is made electronically through NHA portal.

Brazil's Health Ministry has suspended a ??2,400 crore deal to buy two crore doses of India's Covaxin COVID-19 vaccine amid corruption allegations. Brazilian federal prosecutors have opened an investigation into the deal over comparatively high prices, quick talks and pending regulatory approvals. However, the ministry claimed there are no irregularities in the deal.

Nilgiris district in Tamil Nadu has vaccinated 21,500 eligible tribal communities and tea-estate workers with COVID-19 vaccine's first dose, said Nilgiris Collector J Innocent Divya. Pushpa Kumar, secretary of Nilgiris Particularly Vulnerable Tribal Groups Federation (TNGT) said that except for people who were advised by doctors not to administer the vaccine, the rest have all been vaccinated.

Germany's unemployment rate dropped to 5.7% in June with a decline in the country's COVID-19 cases, official data showed. The total number of people registered as unemployed in Germany stood at 26.1 lakh, which is 73,000 less than the previous month and 2.39 lakh fewer than a year earlier. Meanwhile, Germany reported 808 new COVID-19 cases on Wednesday.

Delhi has reported 94 new COVID-19 cases and six more deaths in the last 24 hours, according to the government. The daily COVID-19 positivity rate on Wednesday was 0.12% as compared to Tuesday's 0.15%. With this, the total number of COVID-19 cases in Delhi reached 14,34,188, and the death toll surged to 24,977.

A COVID-19 Vaccine Testing Centre has been set up at the viral Bio Safety Level-3 (BSL-3) facility in the Centre for Infectious Disease Research (CIDR) at the Indian Institute of Science (IISc) in Bengaluru. At this centre, solutions to tackle COVID-19, vaccines, antivirals, materials and equipment, from academic and industry partners will be tested via a fee-for-service model.

The COVID-19 vaccination drive in Mumbai will be suspended on Thursday at the civic-run and the government-run centres due to paucity of vaccine doses, the Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) said. According to the BMC, so far 54,35,731 citizens have been inoculated in Mumbai. Of these, 10,72,578 beneficiaries have received the second dose as well.

RJD leader Tejashwi Yadav and his brother Tej Pratap Yadav on Wednesday got vaccinated with Russian COVID-19 vaccine, Sputnik V, days after the former said he would only take the vaccine after 70% of Bihar's population in the 18-45 age bracket has been inoculated. "Got COVID-19 vaccine at Patna's Medanta Hospital along with my brother Tejashwi Yadav," Tej Pratap tweeted.

Serum Institute of India's (SII) CEO Adar Poonawalla on Wednesday said that his company is confident of receiving approval from the European Medicines Agency (EMA) for the COVID-19 vaccine Covishield in a month. "The EMA is absolutely correct in asking us to apply, which we have through AstraZeneca," he said. "And that process has to take its time," he added.

North Korean leader Kim Jong-un has replaced several senior officials after a "crucial" coronavirus incident. He said that officials had neglected their duties, "creating a great crisis in ensuring the security of the state and safety of the people". Analysts said that the latest development was a clear indication that there had been COVID-19 infections in the country.

Congress leader Jaiveer Shergill said that the BJP has launched an "economic warfare" against the people of India. "BJP Govt: We will not give compensation to COVID-19 death victim(s) families, we will not give farmers MSP, we will not give welfare scheme benefits to labourers, but we will give you 1-litre fuel for ??100," Shergill tweeted.

Russian President Vladimir Putin hoped that the country could avoid a new nationwide COVID-19 lockdown. "Actions of our colleagues are aimed at avoiding the need for a lockdown, when entire enterprises shut down and people are left without their jobs, without their salaries," Putin said. Russia has nearly 55 lakh confirmed COVID-19 cases so far, according to the WHO.

The Pune Municipal Corporation (PMC) has decided to take its COVID-19 vaccination drive to slums to inoculate as many as 4,66,313 slum dwellers above the age of 18 years in 390 slums across the city. "The ward offices have to identify civic cultural halls...and schools existing in the slums for setting up vaccination booths," said Rubal Agarwal, Additional Municipal Commissioner.

Uttarakhand government on Wednesday announced that classes in schools will resume via online mode from July 1, in light of the COVID-19 pandemic, said Joint Secretary JL Sharma. The online classes will continue until new guidelines for COVID-19 are issued, as per an official order. According to the Health Ministry, there are currently 2,245 active COVID-19 cases in the state.

Amid fears over third wave of coronavirus, the government quoted NITI Aayog member Dr VK Paul and stated that COVID-19 in children is "often asymptomatic and seldom requires hospitalisation". The government statement further highlighted that there is no data, either from India or globally, to show that children will be seriously infected in subsequent COVID-19 waves.

The government on Wednesday shared a map showing state-wise COVID-19 recovery rate, stating that India's overall recovery rate has touched 96.92%. Dadra and Nagar Haveli and Daman and Diu has the highest COVID-19 recovery rate of 99.55%, followed by Rajasthan (98.9%), Madhya Pradesh (98.79%), Haryana (98.58%) and Uttar Pradesh (98.5%). Meanwhile, Chandigarh has 98.43% recovery rate.

The Tamil Nadu government will resume biometric authentication at fair price shops from Thursday, July 1. The government has also announced that it would resume approval of new card applications and print new cards from Thursday. The state government added that approval of new card applications was suspended as civil supplies staff were unable to conduct field verification during COVID-19.

Two students in Delhi, one from the Lady Shri Ram College and another from Jamia Millia Islamia, have won the prestigious Diana Award 2021 for their humanitarian efforts during COVID-19. LSR student Devanshi Ranjan, who is 21 years old, helps underprivileged children with their studies amid the pandemic. Jamia's Kaif Ali won the award for designing a prefabricated sustainable shelter.

Nilgiris district in Tamil Nadu has vaccinated 21,500 eligible tribal communities and tea-estate workers with COVID-19 vaccine's first dose, said Nilgiris Collector J Innocent Divya. Pushpa Kumar, secretary of Nilgiris Particularly Vulnerable Tribal Groups Federation (TNGT) said that except for people who were advised by doctors not to administer the vaccine, the rest have all been vaccinated.

Serum Institute of India's (SII) CEO Adar Poonawalla on Wednesday said that his company is confident of receiving approval from the European Medicines Agency (EMA) for the COVID-19 vaccine Covishield in a month. "The EMA is absolutely correct in asking us to apply, which we have through AstraZeneca," he said. "And that process has to take its time," he added.

French epidemiologist said the country could face a fourth wave amid a surge in cases caused by the Delta COVID-19 variant. Professor Arnaud Fontanet said the effort is being made to "make sure that this fourth wave doesn't add pressure on hospitals and lead to severe complications and deaths". The variant is more "transmissible" and "contagious", he added.

RJD leader Tejashwi Yadav and his brother Tej Pratap Yadav on Wednesday got vaccinated with Russian COVID-19 vaccine, Sputnik V, days after the former said he would only take the vaccine after 70% of Bihar's population in the 18-45 age bracket has been inoculated. "Got COVID-19 vaccine at Patna's Medanta Hospital along with my brother Tejashwi Yadav," Tej Pratap tweeted.

Tamil Nadu on Wednesday reported 4,506 new COVID-19 cases, according to the state health department. The state also reported 5,537 recoveries and 113 deaths today, taking the total number of recoveries to 24,08,886 and the death toll to 32,619. According to the health department, there are currently 38,191 active COVID-19 cases in Tamil Nadu.

Gujarat CM Vijay Rupani said while addressing a video conference on Tuesday that the state has "almost controlled" the second wave of the coronavirus pandemic. "As against over 14,000 daily cases getting registered during its peak, less than 100 cases emerged yesterday," he added. Rupani was addressing a function to distribute uniforms to 14 lakh students of Anganwadis.

India and Chile are being targeted by cybercriminals with fake apps which lure people with promises of vaccinations, a report released by McAfee has revealed. One of the earliest coronavirus vaccine fraud campaigns was recorded in India in November 2020, before any vaccines had been approved in the country. Users were targeted with SMS and WhatsApp messages.

Russia on Tuesday reported 652 deaths from coronavirus in the past 24 hours, its highest one-day rise in COVID-19 deaths so far. This comes amid a surge in coronavirus cases in the country. Russia has reported nearly 55 lakh coronavirus cases and over 1.31 lakh COVID-19 deaths, according to the Johns Hopkins University tracker.

With coronavirus cases falling in Delhi, the AAP-led government on Monday asked private hospitals with 100 beds or more to reduce reserved oxygen beds to "30% of the total capacity or three times the occupancy as on June 16, whichever is more". There are 22,220 vacant COVID-19 beds and demand for beds for non-COVID patients is increasing, said the government.

Malaika Arora was on Tuesday administered the second dose of the COVID-19 vaccine. She took to Instagram to share a picture of herself getting vaccinated and wrote, "I'm going to be safe not just for myself but for YOU as well. Fully vaccinated." "No words can express the gratitude I have for every single frontline warrior out there," she added.

The Union Health Ministry on Tuesday said that from May 1 to June 24, 56% of COVID-19 vaccine doses were administered in rural areas while 44% were administered in urban areas. It further said that the first dose of the vaccine has been administered to 15% of the population aged 18-44 years and 42% of the population aged 45-59 years.

Sharing details about the Moderna COVID-19 vaccine that was approved for restricted emergency use in India on Tuesday, NITI Aayog's Dr VK Paul said that it'll be administered in two doses. He said all four approved vaccines- Covaxin, Covishield, Sputnik V and Moderna- are safe for lactating mothers. He added that deal will soon be closed on Pfizer vaccine too.

A day after India announced that it has surpassed the US in terms of the number of people vaccinated against COVID-19, the Health Ministry has said that it achieved this milestone faster than the US. "India surpassed the US and took 163 days to reach the 32 crore benchmark. The US took 193 days," said a Health Ministry official.

Bangladesh has extended its border closure with India till July 14 amid rising coronavirus cases in the country. However, cargo and freight transports will be allowed to cross the border. Bangladesh had shut its borders with India in April. Bangladesh on Monday reported 8,364 new COVID-19 cases, the highest single-day rise in cases in the country since the pandemic began.

Sonu Sood, intervening in a COVID-19-related plea regarding alleged hoarding of medicines, denied wrongdoing. Narrating the procedure he used, Sood said he'd first ask for patient's Aadhaar Card, doctor's prescription and COVID-19 report. He'd get the information verified, and once he was satisfied, he'd try and find out availability of medicine and its locations through various channels.

Congress leader Rahul Gandhi on Tuesday criticised the government's over ??6.28 lakh crore-economic relief measures in view of the coronavirus pandemic, saying, "It's not a package, but another sham!" The measures were announced by Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman a day earlier. "No family can spend FM's 'economic package' on their living-food-medicine-child's school fees," he added.

Punjab Chief Minister Captain Amarinder Singh on Tuesday ordered the extension of COVID-19 restrictions till July 10, in view of cases of Delta Plus COVID-19 variant. However, pubs, bars and ahatas have been allowed to open at 50% capacity from July 1 onward. The staff at all these establishments must have taken at least one COVID-19 vaccine dose, CM said.

The US has appointed Indian-American career diplomat Atul Keshap as the Charg?? d'Affaires at the American embassy in India. "Ambassador Keshap's appointment will reinforce the close US partnership with...India, demonstrated by our collaboration to overcome global challenges like the COVID-19 pandemic," the US said. Keshap has previously served as US Ambassador to Sri Lanka and the Maldives.

Bombay High Court on Tuesday asked Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) to inform it of measures taken to verify what was administered to around 2,000 victims of fake COVID-19 vaccination camps. The court asked Mumbai Police to ensure that the accused, including the "big fish", are booked. Police had informed the court that over 2,000 people received fake vaccines in Mumbai.

Amid concerns over Covishield's exclusion from the list of COVID-19 vaccines eligible to avail European Union's COVID vaccine passport, an EU official said the digital certificate isn't a "pre-condition to travel" and will serve as a person's vaccination proof. "Individual Member States will have the option to accept also vaccines that have been authorised by WHO, like Covishield," official added.

Pharma company Cipla has reportedly received Drugs Controller General of India's (DCGI) nod to import Moderna's COVID-19 vaccine for restricted emergency use, becoming the fourth COVID-19 vaccine approved in India. According to reports, the company had submitted an application for the regulator's approval on Monday. The vaccine has been shown to be around 94% effective against COVID-19.

India and Chile are being targeted by cybercriminals with fake apps which lure people with promises of vaccinations, a report released by McAfee has revealed. One of the earliest coronavirus vaccine fraud campaigns was recorded in India in November 2020, before any vaccines had been approved in the country. Users were targeted with SMS and WhatsApp messages.

There has been a continuous decline in COVID-19 cases since India reported a peak, including a progressive decrease in cases in districts, said Joint Secretary (Health), Lav Agarwal. The recovery rate stands at 96.9%, he added. The Union Health Ministry has stated that India is taking a distinct lead in total vaccine doses administered in the world.

Punjab Chief Minister Captain Amarinder Singh on Tuesday ordered the extension of COVID-19 restrictions till July 10, in view of cases of Delta Plus COVID-19 variant. However, pubs, bars and ahatas have been allowed to open at 50% capacity from July 1 onward. The staff at all these establishments must have taken at least one COVID-19 vaccine dose, CM said.

The Pimpri Chinchwad Municipal Corporation (PCMC) asked all its 7,479 employees to get the COVID-19 vaccine by July 20 or face a delay in the salary of July. About 75% of the PCMC's employees have been inoculated against COVID-19, while 40 have succumbed. Municipal Commissioner Rajesh Patil said that so far three directives have been issued in this regard.

With coronavirus cases falling in Delhi, the AAP-led government on Monday asked private hospitals with 100 beds or more to reduce reserved oxygen beds to "30% of the total capacity or three times the occupancy as on June 16, whichever is more". There are 22,220 vacant COVID-19 beds and demand for beds for non-COVID patients is increasing, said the government.

A day after it recorded 59 new infections in the lowest single-day surge since April 2020, Delhi on Tuesday recorded 101 new COVID-19 cases. As many as 119 COVID-19 recoveries and four related deaths were recorded in the national capital in the last 24 hours. The daily COVID-19 positivity rate on Tuesday was 0.15% as compared to Monday's 0.10%.

In COVID-19 vaccination cards issued to beneficiaries in Chhattisgarh, state Health Minister TS Singh Deo was shown as Chief Minister of the state alongside CM Bhupesh Baghel. The picture of a vaccination card shows photos of both the leaders printed on it. Meanwhile, CM Baghel has written to PM Narendra Modi, seeking 1 crore vaccine doses in July.

A study by Oxford called Com-COV that compared mixed two-doses schedules of Pfizer and AstraZeneca COVID-19 vaccines found that both mixed schedules produced better immune responses than two doses of AstraZeneca vaccine. An AstraZeneca shot followed by Pfizer four weeks apart produced the best T-cell responses, and also a higher antibody response than Pfizer followed by AstraZeneca.

Indonesian President Joko Widodo on Monday said the country will start vaccinating children over 12 years old against COVID-19. The announcement came after Indonesia's Food and Drug Monitoring Agency approved China's Sinovac COVID-19 vaccine for emergency use for children aged 12-17. Indonesia, which has reported over 21 lakh COVID-19 cases, has administered over four crore vaccine doses so far.

The government issued guidelines for vaccination of pregnant women against COVID-19. It said in case a woman gets COVID-19 during pregnancy, she should get vaccinated after delivery. It further said pregnant women aged over 35, obese women and those having pre-existing illness like diabetes are at a higher risk of developing complications due to COVID-19 and should get vaccinated.

The Thane Municipal Corporation (TMC) on Monday set up a committee to probe allegations of a 28-year-old woman, who claimed that she was administered vaccine doses thrice within 10-15 minutes at a vaccination centre in Thane. "There is no clarity yet if three shots were administered, but there are bruises from needle injection on the woman's arm," Thane Mayor said.

Police have arrested 22 people for partying at a guest house in Gurugram's Sector 38 in violation of COVID-19 guidelines, officials said. "It was a liquor party at the Aqua Inn guest house...Most of the party attendees are aged 25-30 years," Sadar Additional SHO said. "They...violated the pandemic norms as well as the night curfew protocols," he added.

The educational institutions in Bihar will reopen in a phased manner after July 6 if the COVID-19 situation continues to improve at the same pace, said state Education Minister Vijay Kumar Choudhary. "In the first phase, we'll open universities, secondary and higher secondary schools in the second phase," he added. Primary and middle schools will open in the third phase.

There will be no COVID-19 vaccinations at government centres on Tuesday, Gautam Buddha Nagar Health Department announced. "Once we get the vials from Lucknow, we will be able to restart the ongoing vaccination drive in the district," it added. This comes ahead of the mega vaccination drive, starting July 1, in which 25,000 people will be vaccinated in a day.

Twitter on Monday flagged two tweets by activist-lawyer Prashant Bhushan on COVID-19 vaccines as "misleading" and blocked his account for 12 hours. Bhushan tweeted, "The healthy young have hardly any chance of serious effects or dying due to covid. They have a higher chance of dying due to vaccines." In another tweet, he described why he is a "vaccine skeptic".

New Zealand has said that it'll partially resume quarantine-free travel with Australia. The country will resume travel bubble with South Australia, Tasmania and Victoria states and the Australian Capital Territory, COVID-19 Response Minister Chris Hipkins said. New Zealand had halted the travel bubble over outbreak of the Delta COVID-19 variant, first found in India, in several Australian cities.

The Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike (BBMP) has started door-to-door survey to identify those who are yet to get a dose of COVID-19 vaccine. BBMP Chief Commissioner Gaurav Gupta said that the officials are preparing a list of such people and the areas or localities they live in. "Special vaccination camps will be organised in such uncovered pockets," he added.

Australian Deputy PM, Barnaby Joyce, was fined A$200 (over ??11,000) for breaching COVID-19 rules by not wearing a mask. Joyce was spotted by a member of the public paying for fuel without wearing a mask on Monday, police said.  A total of 16 people had received fines of A$200 for failing to wear a mask on June 28, police added.

Actor Anirudh Dave, who was recently discharged after 55 days of hospitalisation due to COVID-19, said, "Two months is a long time to be hospitalised." When his lung function capacity was at 85%, the hospital asked his wife, Shubhi Ahuja, to visit him as he was critical. "I didn't know at that time, but I couldn't recognise her," Anirudh added.

A US-based crisis response organisation, CORE, in collaboration with MASHAL, a Pune-based NGO has launched a drive in several slums in Hadapsar with an aim to help people track COVID-19 symptoms. The slum dwellers will be provided with specialised COVID-19 management kits named "Corona Kavach", including essentials like thermometers and oximeters. People will be assisted in accessing vaccinations.

The European Medicines Agency (EMA) has said that it hasn't received a request for its authorisation for Covishield, a European Union official said. This came after reports said that SII has sought Indian government's help for inclusion of Covishield in the EU COVID-19 vaccine passport. The official said EU member states have the option of accepting WHO-approved vaccines, including Covishield.

India has reported 37,566 new COVID-19 cases and 907 deaths in the last 24 hours, as per the Union Health Ministry. The country reported less than 40,000 daily cases after 102 days. With this, the total COVID-19 cases in the country reached 3,03,16,897 while the death toll surged to 3,97,637. India's active COVID-19 cases stand at  5,52,659.

Bhopal resident Rajat Dangre received a message that his 13-year-old son with disabilities received COVID-19 vaccine on June 21, when Madhya Pradesh set a national record by administering over 17 lakh vaccines. The boy said his age was mentioned as 56 in the certificate. Dangre added authorities used the documents he had submitted to municipal corporation for his son's pension.

The government on Tuesday said that a total of 51 cases of Delta Plus COVID-19 variant have been found across 11 states and the Union Territory of Jammu and Kashmir in India, as of June 28. The cases have been found in the states of Madhya Pradesh, Maharashtra, Punjab, Gujarat, Kerala, Andhra Pradesh, Tamil Nadu, Odisha, Rajasthan, Karnataka and Haryana.

A study by Oxford called Com-COV that compared mixed two-doses schedules of Pfizer and AstraZeneca COVID-19 vaccines found that both mixed schedules produced better immune responses than two doses of AstraZeneca vaccine. An AstraZeneca shot followed by Pfizer four weeks apart produced the best T-cell responses, and also a higher antibody response than Pfizer followed by AstraZeneca.

External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar, while addressing the G20 Foreign Ministers' meeting at Matera, Italy on Tuesday, said that international cooperation is the answer to the challenge posed by COVID-19. "Reforms have many forms but vaccine equity will be an immediate test. The real economy needs decentralised globalisation, including in manufacturing, food and health," he added.

A ward councillor in Bihar's Katihar launched a lucky draw to encourage people to get vaccinated against COVID-19. As many as 800 people came forward for the vaccination at one centre on June 26. The councillor gave away a 24-inch LED TV, a bicycle, pedestal fan, wall clocks and tiffin boxes as gifts for the winners of the lucky draw.

A total of 11,013 vegetable vendors, grocers, petrol pump staff, barbers and courier and food delivery agents were vaccinated against COVID-19 in a special drive in Gujarat's Ahmedabad, the local civic body said on Tuesday. These groups come in contact with many people due to the nature of their job, the Ahmedabad Municipal Corporation said.

Russia on Tuesday reported 652 deaths from coronavirus in the past 24 hours, its highest one-day rise in COVID-19 deaths so far. This comes amid a surge in coronavirus cases in the country. Russia has reported nearly 55 lakh coronavirus cases and over 1.31 lakh COVID-19 deaths, according to the Johns Hopkins University tracker.

Maharashtra CM Uddhav Thackeray on Monday inaugurated a 2,170-bed COVID-19 hospital in Mumbai's Malad area. Constructed in over two months, the hospital has a 190-bed intensive care unit and 1,536 oxygen-equipped beds among others. Reportedly, over ??89 crore was spent on the construction of this facility. CM added that three more jumbo facilities will come up in Mumbai soon.

Switzerland has allowed fully vaccinated people travelling from India or those who have recovered from COVID-19 to enter the country without needing to produce a negative test or quarantine, the country's Federal Office of Public Health informed. "The vaccines used in Switzerland are only slightly less effective against...Delta variant and...still offer a very high level of protection," it added.

There is no shortage of COVID-19 vaccines in Karnataka but the state expected more which was not supplied, state Health Minister K Sudhakar said. "I'm going to Delhi next week...will meet Union Health Minister Harsh Vardhan, other ministers and officials to request more vaccine allocation to Karnataka," he added. Karnataka has reported 2,22,04,063 vaccinations so far.

Sarah Gilbert, who co-designed the Oxford/AstraZeneca COVID-19 vaccine, was given a standing ovation by crowd on Wimbledon's Centre Court on Monday. In a video that went viral, Sarah can be seen sitting in Royal Box as the entire crowd applauded and cheered her and her colleagues. Wimbledon's official Twitter account wrote, "An opening day on Centre Court with a difference."

In COVID-19 vaccination cards issued to beneficiaries in Chhattisgarh, state Health Minister TS Singh Deo was shown as Chief Minister of the state alongside CM Bhupesh Baghel. The picture of a vaccination card shows photos of both the leaders printed on it. Meanwhile, CM Baghel has written to PM Narendra Modi, seeking 1 crore vaccine doses in July.

The Union Health Ministry on Tuesday said that from May 1 to June 24, 56% of COVID-19 vaccine doses were administered in rural areas while 44% were administered in urban areas. It further said that the first dose of the vaccine has been administered to 15% of the population aged 18-44 years and 42% of the population aged 45-59 years.

The Red Cross has warned that Indonesia is "on the edge of a COVID-19 catastrophe". Indonesia needs to urgently increase medical care, testing and vaccinations amid the "record number of infections". The hospitals in Indonesia are "full to the brim and oxygen supplies critically low", Red Cross said. The COVID-19 surge in Indonesia is being blamed on Delta COVID-19 variant.

The Pune Municipal Corporation (PMC) is set to commission seven oxygen generation plants in civic hospitals by mid-July, ahead of the possible third wave of COVID-19. "The PMC has planned 15 oxygen generating plants in civic hospitals. Four of the plants have already been commissioned while seven more will be commissioned by mid-July," said Additional Municipal Commissioner Rubal Agarwal.

The Pimpri Chinchwad Municipal Corporation (PCMC) asked all its 7,479 employees to get the COVID-19 vaccine by July 20 or face a delay in the salary of July. About 75% of the PCMC's employees have been inoculated against COVID-19, while 40 have succumbed. Municipal Commissioner Rajesh Patil said that so far three directives have been issued in this regard.

Japanese brokerage, Nomura said that business activity recovered for the fifth consecutive week amid easing of restrictions and a decline in COVID-19 cases. It added that business activity is now only 13 percentage points (pp) lower than levels observed before March last year. Business activity had fallen nearly 40 pp below pre-pandemic levels for the week ended May 23, 2021.

BJP National President JP Nadda on Tuesday said that all opposition parties in Assam were "in quarantine" during the second wave of the COVID-19 pandemic. "It was the BJP members who reached out to those in distress," he added. The opposition parties emerge only during elections as "political tourists", but after that they are nowhere to be seen, Nadda said.

French Health Minister Olivier Veran said Delta COVID-19 variant, first found in India, is becoming "dominant" in France "as it's more contagious". Delta variant now accounts for about 20% of new COVID-19 cases in France, up from 9-10% last week, Veran added. "The...variant...share keeps on increasing in percentage not in absolute terms as...total number of cases is decreasing," he said.

Punjab CM Captain Amarinder Singh on Tuesday sought more doses of COVID-19 vaccines from the Centre, saying that the state had run out of Covishield stock and has limited Covaxin doses. He added that issue had been repeatedly raised with the Centre and if needed, he will take up the matter with Union Health Minister Dr Harsh Vardhan.

The Bombay HC on Tuesday asked Maharashtra government why it needed Centre's approval to begin door-to-door COVID-19 vaccination for elderly and bedridden citizens. "Have states like Kerala, Bihar and Jharkhand taken approval from Union government?" HC asked. The state government indicated it can try home vaccination. Earlier, Centre had opposed door-to-door vaccination citing wastage.

Union Education Minister Ramesh Pokhriyal was discharged from the All India Institute of Medical Sciences (AIIMS), Delhi on Tuesday, as per reports. The minister was admitted to the hospital on June 1 for post-COVID-19 complications and was in ICU for some time. The Union Minister had tested positive for COVID-19 on April 21.

Government on Tuesday directed states/UTs to consider implementation of targeted and prompt actions for COVID-19 management until July 31. "Monitoring of cases with districts as administrative units should be done on a regular basis," said government. "There should be continued focus on five-fold strategy-  test, track, treat, vaccination and COVID-19 appropriate behaviour," Centre told states.

An estimated 13.8 crore people, that is 49% of the people aged 60 years and above have been vaccinated with the first dose of COVID-19 vaccine, the government has said. Out of estimated 59.7 crore people aged 18-44 years, about 15%  have been vaccinated with the first dose, it added. Cumulative vaccine doses administered in India have crossed 33.1 crore.

Amid concerns over Covishield's exclusion from the list of COVID-19 vaccines eligible to avail European Union's COVID vaccine passport, an EU official said the digital certificate isn't a "pre-condition to travel" and will serve as a person's vaccination proof. "Individual Member States will have the option to accept also vaccines that have been authorised by WHO, like Covishield," official added.

Switzerland has allowed fully vaccinated people travelling from India or those who have recovered from COVID-19 to enter the country without needing to produce a negative test or quarantine, the country's Federal Office of Public Health informed. "The vaccines used in Switzerland are only slightly less effective against...Delta variant and...still offer a very high level of protection," it added.

Congress leader Rahul Gandhi on Tuesday criticised the government's over ??6.28 lakh crore-economic relief measures in view of the coronavirus pandemic, saying, "It's not a package, but another sham!" The measures were announced by Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman a day earlier. "No family can spend FM's 'economic package' on their living-food-medicine-child's school fees," he added.

In view of increasing COVID-19 cases, the Maharashtra government put a hold on all elections in the state till August 31, including the polls of Pune co-operative housing societies. Suhas Patwardhan, Chairman of Pune District Co-operative Housing Federation, said that they are using this time window to conduct training camps for office bearers on how to hold elections.

Sarah Gilbert, who co-designed the Oxford/AstraZeneca COVID-19 vaccine, was given a standing ovation by crowd on Wimbledon's Centre Court on Monday. In a video that went viral, Sarah can be seen sitting in Royal Box as the entire crowd applauded and cheered her and her colleagues. Wimbledon's official Twitter account wrote, "An opening day on Centre Court with a difference."

Union Health Minister Dr Harsh Vardhan on Tuesday said the second COVID-19 wave was still not over. He said, "Cases have definitely gone down sharply in Delhi but our experience of 1.5 years tells us we shouldn't relax under any circumstance." He added India can win fight against COVID-19 through appropriate behaviour and by getting more and more people vaccinated.

MakeMyTrip has launched its new campaign, #MakeTheTrip, where kids encourage adults to make the trip to their nearest vaccine centre and get vaccinated. The campaign highlights that vaccines are essential to bringing life back to normal. As a token of appreciation, MakeMyTrip is giving deals to vaccinated travellers. These are accessible on the MakeMyTrip app.

Punjab CM Captain Amarinder Singh on Tuesday sought more doses of COVID-19 vaccines from the Centre, saying that the state had run out of Covishield stock and has limited Covaxin doses. He added that issue had been repeatedly raised with the Centre and if needed, he will take up the matter with Union Health Minister Dr Harsh Vardhan.

Serum Institute of India (SII) has requested Centre to take up the matter of inclusion of Covishield vaccine in the EU COVID-19 Vaccination Passport with the European Union and other countries, according to reports. SII CEO Adar Poonawalla reportedly wrote to External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar that it will affect business travellers and students and cause severe disruptions to economy.

Twelve patients died due to COVID-19 on the intervening night of Monday and Tuesday at Gauhati Medical College and Hospital in Assam. None of the patients had been vaccinated and all of them had oxygen saturation below 90%, said Abhijit Sarma, hospital superintendent. "Nine of them were in the ICU.
