They had come three to four days ago," he added.

An estimated 13.8 crore people, that is 49% of the people aged 60 years and above have been vaccinated with the first dose of COVID-19 vaccine, the government has said. Out of estimated 59.7 crore people aged 18-44 years, about 15%  have been vaccinated with the first dose, it added. Cumulative vaccine doses administered in India have crossed 33.1 crore.

There has been a continuous decline in COVID-19 cases since India reported a peak, including a progressive decrease in cases in districts, said Joint Secretary (Health), Lav Agarwal. The recovery rate stands at 96.9%, he added. The Union Health Ministry has stated that India is taking a distinct lead in total vaccine doses administered in the world.

After his anticipatory bail plea was rejected, one of the absconding accused in Mumbai fake COVID-19 vaccination scam, Dr Manish Tripathi, surrendered on Tuesday, police said. As per Mumbai Police, Tripathi was the one who had procured vials used in all unauthorised vaccination drives. Tripathi runs a coaching institute for nursing students on the premises of Shivam Hospital.

The Philippines has extended a ban on inbound travel from India, Pakistan, Sri Lanka, Bangladesh, Nepal, Oman, and the UAE until July 15. "This is one of the proactive measures imposed to implement international border control because of the COVID-19 Delta variant," presidential spokesperson Harry Roque said. The Philippines has reported 17 cases of the Delta variant so far.

Delhi's Sir Ganga Ram Hospital has said that for the first time in India, five cases of Cytomegalovirus (CMV) related rectal bleeding have been reported in "immunocompetent" COVID-19 patients at their facility. The patients complained of bleeding stools, pain or intestinal obstruction. "One of them succumbed due to massive bleeding and severe COVID-19 chest disease," the hospital said.

The Madhya Pradesh government led by CM Shivraj Singh Chouhan on Tuesday said that 2.02 crore people have been vaccinated against COVID-19. In the 18-44 age group, 86.62 lakh people have got the first dose till now and 1.45 lakh of them received their second dose. Meanwhile, an official said that vaccination will be suspended on Tuesday and Wednesday.

Bhopal resident Rajat Dangre received a message that his 13-year-old son with disabilities received COVID-19 vaccine on June 21, when Madhya Pradesh set a national record by administering over 17 lakh vaccines. The boy said his age was mentioned as 56 in the certificate. Dangre added authorities used the documents he had submitted to municipal corporation for his son's pension.

The Himachal Pradesh government has postponed the Shrikhand Mahadev Kailash Yatra,  Kullu Deputy Commissioner Ashutosh Garg said. The decision was taken as preparations could not be done due to the ongoing COVID-19 pandemic, he added. The yatra, which is usually held from July 15 to 30, was cancelled last year due to the COVID-19 situation in the country.

The Thane Municipal Corporation (TMC) on Monday set up a committee to probe allegations of a 28-year-old woman, who claimed that she was administered vaccine doses thrice within 10-15 minutes at a vaccination centre in Thane. "There is no clarity yet if three shots were administered, but there are bruises from needle injection on the woman's arm," Thane Mayor said.

The European Medicines Agency (EMA) has said that it hasn't received a request for its authorisation for Covishield, a European Union official said. This came after reports said that SII has sought Indian government's help for inclusion of Covishield in the EU COVID-19 vaccine passport. The official said EU member states have the option of accepting WHO-approved vaccines, including Covishield.

Government has said COVID-19 variants of concern are currently found in 174 districts of 35 states/UTs, with Maharashtra, Delhi, Punjab, Telangana, Bengal and Gujarat reporting the highest numbers. B.1.617, Delta and Kappa variants have been detected in 16,238 samples and Alpha variant in 3,969 samples. Proportion of cases with VOCs rose from 10.31% in May to 51% on June 20.

Ahead of the monsoon session of the parliament, at least 179 Rajya Sabha members have been fully vaccinated against COVID-19, according to the data available with the Rajya Sabha secretariat. Seventy-seven per cent of the Upper House's 232 members are fully vaccinated. Meanwhile, at least 403 members of the Lok Sabha of total 540 members, have also been fully vaccinated.

Hong Kong said it'll ban all flights from the UK from Thursday due to "the recent rebound of...epidemic situation" and spread of COVID-19 variants there, including the variant that was first detected in India. Britain was classified as an "extremely high-risk" place. People who've stayed in Britain for over two hours will be restricted from boarding flights to Hong Kong.

Union Minister Jitendra Singh has urged medical professionals "not to create panic" about a possible third wave of COVID-19. "Let us put all our might together to fight the second wave instead of talking about the third one...Instead of getting tempted to make alarmist observations, we could be a little more reassuring," said Singh.

SBI's Deputy Managing Director VS Radhakrishnan said that the rural demand has been affected due to the second wave of coronavirus. "Consumer sentiment is weak. Many people have lost jobs too," he added. Radhakrishnan further said that the infrastructure sector can be a big game changer for the economy and foreign investors should be wooed to invest in this space.

To raise awareness about COVID-19 vaccination, a Chennai-based artist has designed an auto-rickshaw using replicas of syringes and vaccine vials. Gowtham had earlier created a coronavirus-inspired helmet worn by a police inspector during the first wave of COVID-19. On a daily basis, the auto will run in areas that lack awareness about vaccination, he said.

The Gurugram district administration tested around 500 people for COVID-19 in five different crowded places on Sunday and no one was found infected, Deputy Commissioner Yash Garg said. The testings were done in Khandsa Mandi, Subhash Chowk, Nathupur-Delhi border, Kherki Daula and the Kapashera border. Gurugram has seen an improvement in recovery rate, which is 99.43%, the Deputy Commissioner said.

COVID-19 cases with Variants of Concern (VOC) rose from 10.31% of total infections in May to 51% till June 20, government officials told a Parliamentary panel on Monday, reported PTI. Officials informed the Parliamentary panel that the Alpha, Beta, Gamma and Delta variants of COVID-19 have been traced in 174 districts of 35 states and Union Territories, the report said.

Researchers from MIT and Harvard University have developed a face mask embedded with tiny, disposable sensors that can detect COVID-19 infection. The masks require wearers to breathe into them for 15-30 minutes and then press a button on the sensor. This releases a small amount of water and provides COVID-19 test results within 90 minutes on a readout strip.

Delhi on Monday recorded 59 new COVID-19 cases, marking the city's lowest daily surge in cases since April 15 last year. The city recorded two COVID-19 fatalities and 72 recoveries in the last 24 hours, while its daily positivity rate further dropped to 0.10%. The national capital now has 1,553 active cases of coronavirus.

Turkey has halted flights and all direct travel from India, Bangladesh, Brazil, South Africa, Nepal and Sri Lanka due to new COVID-19 variants, the Turkish Interior Ministry said on Monday. Travellers who have visited these countries in the last 14 days will need to show a negative COVID-19 report, it added. Coronavirus has infected over 54 lakh in Turkey.

In a bid to curb spread of cases of COVID-19, the Karnataka government has made it mandatory for visitors from Maharashtra and Kerala to produce negative RT-PCR test reports from June 28. "This step was initiated due to an increase in...COVID-19 cases due to the Delta and Delta Plus variants," said state Health Minister Dr K Sudhakar.

In the wake of predictions regarding the third wave of COVID-19 and the threat of Delta plus coronavirus variant, the Delhi High Court has decided to continue hearing only urgent cases via video conferencing till July 23. "The Full Court has...resolved to adopt a policy of wait and watch, and to act cautiously," the Delhi HC notification said.

Cited to be the first of its kind, a 45-year-old Bengaluru doctor was diagnosed with both black fungus and green fungus. He was admitted to the hospital after experiencing pain in the right side of the face, numbness on the face and persistent headaches. The patient had tested positive for COVID-19 on April 24 and was under home quarantine.

Abu Dhabi has started using facial scanners to detect coronavirus infections at malls and airports. The technology can detect infections by measuring electromagnetic waves, which change when the RNA particles of the virus are present in the body. If the scanner identifies someone as potentially COVID-19 positive, they will be required to take a PCR test within 24 hours.

Prime Minister Narendra Modi has directed officials to create an open source version of the Co-WIN platform and give it free of cost to any country that wants it, RS Sharma, who chairs the government panel overseeing Co-WIN, said. He added, over 50 countries including Canada, Mexico, Nigeria and Panama, have shown an interest in Co-WIN for COVID-19 vaccination drive.

Saudi Arabia will start inoculating young people aged 12 to 18 against COVID-19 with the Pfizer-BioNTech vaccine after it was approved by the Saudi Food and Drug Authority, the Health Ministry tweeted on Sunday. The country has administered over 1.72 crore vaccine doses, according to a local report. Coronavirus has infected more than 4.84 lakh people in Saudi Arabia.

India has surpassed the United States in the total number of COVID-19 vaccine doses administered so far, the Union Health Ministry said on Monday. While India has administered a total of 32,36,63,297 doses till date, the US has given 32,33,27,328 doses, the ministry said. Meanwhile, as many as 17,21,268 vaccine doses were administered in India on Sunday.

Families and experts have said that India has undercounted COVID-19 deaths by "hundreds of thousands", The Wall Street Journal reported. A University of Washington's institute suggested that the deaths exceeded 1.1 million, three times the officially reported number of over 3.9 lakh, the report said. The undercounting leaves a "huge gap" in understanding Delta variant's impact, the report added.

Pune is close to vaccinating 50 lakh people against COVID-19 as the district has stepped up its drive. The city has so far administered 43.48 lakh doses. In areas under the PMC jurisdiction, over 16 lakh people have been vaccinated and efforts are on to step up vaccination at housing societies, said Rubal Agarwal, an additional municipal commissioner with PMC.

West Bengal BJP President Dilip Ghosh has accused the TMC of running a "fake" government. While referring to Kolkata's fake COVID-19 vaccination case, Ghosh alleged that TMC leaders were "hand-in-glove with those involved in scams". "TMC leaders...share a good relationship with these scamsters. Now, ruling party leaders are trying to wash their hands off the matter," Ghosh added.

Vaccination against COVID-19 resumed at government centres across Gurugram on Monday after being suspended for two days due to a polio campaign. "There is no limit on slots for those getting Covishield second dose and seven sites have been set up for it," said a district administration spokesperson. "For Covaxin, four camps have been set up," the spokesperson added.

Serum Institute of India-manufactured Covishield has been excluded from the list of COVID-19 vaccines eligible to avail European Union (EU) 'Green Pass'. Addressing Indians who've taken Covishield and are facing issues with travel, SII CEO Adar Poonawalla tweeted, "I've taken this up at...highest levels and hope to resolve [it] soon...both with regulators and at diplomatic level with countries."

Nearly 900 tourists were fined for a total of ??4,28,300 visiting Lonavala, Mulshi, Khadakwasla dam and Sinhagad Fort areas on weekend. According to the Deputy Superintendent of Police (Lonavala division), ??1.27 lakh was collected in fine on Saturday from 249 people including 197 without the mask. Thirty-four persons were fined for roaming around unnecessarily. On Sunday, ??1.51 lakh was collected.

As many as 979 deaths due to COVID-19 were reported in India in the last 24 hours. This is for the first time after 75 days that India has reported less than 1,000 daily COVID-19 deaths. Further, the daily COVID-19 cases in India dipped to 46,148. Active COVID-19 cases in the country stand at 5,72,994.

On the occasion of his film, titled 'Article 15', completing two years of its release, actor Ayushmann Khurrana, who played the lead role in the movie, said, "[It's] one of the most cherished films of my career." He added, "We will need films like Article 15, with its superlative content, to pull people back to theatres [following COVID-19 lockdown]."

Talking about how he has been affected by the ongoing COVID-19 pandemic, singer Armaan Malik said, "For the world, I am this super positive person but I've not been my best lately." He added, "Music has been my sole saviour in times of distress...I'm trying to keep my calm and praying for better times. There's nothing more I can do."

A sero survey conducted by BMC has revealed that over 50% of children in Mumbai have COVID-19 antibodies. Conducted across 24 wards, the survey took place between April 1 and June 15, 2021 and looked at 2,176 blood samples received in laboratories for various medical investigations. The overall seropositivity rate for children aged 1-18 years was recorded at 51.18%.

West Bengal government has extended COVID-19 restrictions till July 15 with some relaxations. Public vehicles can operate with 50% passengers but drivers and conductors should be vaccinated. However, train operations will remain suspended. Markets and vegetable vendors can operate from 6 am-12 pm and other shops can remain open from 11 am-8 pm. Banks can open from 10 am-2 pm.

COVID-19 fatality in patients aged below 50 is higher than those aged above 65, a single-centre retrospective study by AIIMS, Delhi has revealed. The study authored by AIIMS Director Dr Randeep Guleria covered 247 patients deceased (of 654 patients observed) between April 4 and July 24, 2020. Of these, 42.1% were aged 18-50, 34.8% aged 51-65 and 23.1% above 65.

The government announced economic relief measures in view of COVID-19 for various sectors totalling ??6,28,993 crore. These include ??1.1 lakh-crore loan guarantee scheme for COVID-19 affected sectors, ??1.5 lakh-crore towards expansion of ECLGS and ??7,500 crore credit guarantee scheme for MFIs. A ??88,000 crore boost to export insurance cover & ??93,869 crore for free food grains were also announced.

The COVID-19 situation is coming under control and the positivity rate is also declining, said Goa CM Pramod Sawant. "I am sure that by July end, 100% first dose coverage will be done (in Goa). Those who have taken both the shots of COVID-19 vaccine will be allowed to enter Goa," he added.

British number one tennis player Johanna Konta has been forced to withdraw from Wimbledon 2021 after a member of her team tested positive for COVID-19, the All England Club said on Sunday. The 2017 Wimbledon semi-finalist has become the first singles' player, in either the women's or men's draw, to withdraw from  the tournament because of coronavirus protocols.

More than 1.15 crore COVID-19 vaccine doses are still available with the states and Union Territories (UTs) to administer, according to the Union Health Ministry. It added that over 31.69 crore doses have been provided by the government to the states and UTs so far. Meanwhile, India has so far administered over 32.3 crore vaccine doses.

NITI Aayog Member Dr VK Paul has said that "discussion for paving the way for internationally developed vaccines like Pfizer and Moderna, is going on". He added, "The issue has multiple dimensions and we are trying to find an agreed way forward at the earliest...We are trying to expedite the progress in every possible way."

Police in Sydney, Australia have fined two men who had to be rescued from an Australian forest after they were startled by a deer while sunbathing nude on a beach and became lost. Their rescue involved police aircraft, the State Emergency Service and ambulance officers. They were fined 1,000 Australian dollars ($759) each for breaching a COVID-19 order.

PM Narendra Modi congratulated all the people involved in India's COVID-19 efforts stating that the country's vaccination drive keeps gaining momentum. This comes as India has overtaken the United States in the total number of COVID-19 vaccine doses given till date, according to the Union Health Ministry. The PM asserted, "Vaccines for all, free for all" remains the government's commitment.

AIIMS Director Dr Randeep Guleria has said that making COVID-19 vaccine doses available for children will be a "milestone achievement" and will pave the way for reopening of schools and resumption of outdoor activities. "Schools have to be reopened as there has been a major loss in studies in the last 18 months due to the pandemic," Dr Guleria added.

Nearly 58.8 lakh vaccine doses have been administered in Bengaluru Urban along with the area under the Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike (BBMP) to people aged 18 and above till Sunday, according to CoWIN dashboard data. This means that over 50% of the city's eligible population, which is about 99 lakh, has received at least one dose of the vaccine.

Thousands of people were stranded in Bangladesh's capital Dhaka on Monday after authorities halted most of the public transport as part of a COVID-19 lockdown amid rising cases. A large number of people were seen walking on main roads early Monday. "I started walking at 7 am. I couldn't get any bus or any other vehicles," a 60-year-old woman said.

Saudi Arabia will start inoculating young people aged 12 to 18 against COVID-19 with the Pfizer-BioNTech vaccine after it was approved by the Saudi Food and Drug Authority, the Health Ministry tweeted on Sunday. The country has administered over 1.72 crore vaccine doses, according to a local report. Coronavirus has infected more than 4.84 lakh people in Saudi Arabia.

The India Open and Hyderabad Open were on Monday cancelled by the Badminton World Federation (BWF), which announced a revised international calendar to save the remaining season affected by the COVID-19 pandemic. The world body also said that Finland will host the Sudirman Cup Finals in September-October while the season-ending World Tour Finals will be staged in Indonesia.

The Supreme Court on Monday paid tribute to 77 advocates of the Supreme Court Bar Association (SCBA), who lost their lives due to COVID-19. At the start of the day's proceedings, a bench headed by Chief Justice NV Ramana expressed condolence on behalf of the Supreme Court judges. The apex court reopened on Monday after summer vacation.

The Supreme Court on Monday dismissed a plea seeking an extra attempt in the Union Public Service Commission (UPSC) exam due to the COVID-19 pandemic and age bar, according to a report. "We decline to interfere," the Supreme Court ruled while observing that the issue has already been answered in the judgement given on February 24, 2021.

The T20 World Cup scheduled to be held in India later this year is being shifted to UAE owing to the health and safety concerns posed by COVID-19, BCCI President Sourav Ganguly told PTI on Monday. Earlier, the ICC had given BCCI a four-week window to decide and inform whether India could host the event considering the COVID-19 situation.

More than 1.15 crore COVID-19 vaccine doses are still available with the states and Union Territories (UTs) to administer, according to the Union Health Ministry. It added that over 31.69 crore doses have been provided by the government to the states and UTs so far. Meanwhile, India has so far administered over 32.3 crore vaccine doses.

British number one tennis player Johanna Konta has been forced to withdraw from Wimbledon 2021 after a member of her team tested positive for COVID-19, the All England Club said on Sunday. The 2017 Wimbledon semi-finalist has become the first singles' player, in either the women's or men's draw, to withdraw from  the tournament because of coronavirus protocols.

Andhra Pradesh government on Monday reduced the timings for daily COVID-19 curfew by three hours in eight districts where the positivity rate is less than 5%. Instead of the current 6 am-6 pm, curfew will now be relaxed from 6 am-9 pm in Visakhapatnam, Srikakulam, Vizianagaram, Guntur, Nellore, Kadapa (YSR District), Anantapur and Kurnool from July 1 to July 7.

Bengaluru witnessed heavy vehicular movement on Monday in the wake of relaxations in the COVID-19 restrictions in Karnataka. Huge traffic congestion was seen in Hebbal Flyover, Mekhri Circle, Queens Road, JP Nagar and other areas of the city. On Sunday, Bengaluru reported 788 fresh COVID-19 cases and 11 more deaths due to the disease.

Maharashtra Higher and Technical Education Minister Uday Samant has said he will hold a meeting with all universities, including the Savitribai Phule Pune University, to reduce college fees in the wake of the COVID-19 pandemic. He, however, added that as the universities are autonomous, the government will not be able to put pressure on them.

The West Bengal government on Monday extended restrictions across the state till July 15 in view of COVID-19. However, the state government allowed gyms to open with 50% capacity and salons with vaccinated staff to open from 11 am to 6 pm with 50% capacity. Additionally, private offices can open from 10 am to 4 pm with a 50% workforce.

Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman announced eight COVID-19 relief measures, four of which are new. These include a ??1.1 lakh-crore loan guarantee scheme for affected sectors, including ??50,000 crore for health sector. Credit guarantee scheme for 25 lakh people through MFIs and assistance to 11,000 people in tourism was announced. The first 5 lakh tourist visas will be issued for free.

Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman on Monday announced ??1.1 lakh crore loan guarantee scheme for COVID-19 affected sectors. Out of the total amount, healthcare sector will get ??50,000 crore and other sectors will get ??60,000 crore. The maximum loan amount for healthcare sector will be ??100 crore and the interest rate is capped at 7.95%.

Centre's COVID-19 working group's Chairman Dr NK Arora said, "ICMR has come up with a study which says 3rd wave (of COVID-19) is likely to come late." He said, "We have a window period of 6-8 months to immunise everybody in the country." He also added, "In the coming days, our target is to administer 1 crore doses every day."

Haryana government on Sunday extended the lockdown in the state till July 5 and allowed university campuses to open for research scholars, with COVID-19 protocols. Universities can also allow practical classes in laboratories and remedial classes or doubt classes. As per earlier relaxations, all shops can open from 9 am-8 pm and malls can open from 10 am-8 pm.

Madhya Pradesh CM Shivraj Singh Chouhan on Sunday alleged that Congress leader Rahul Gandhi was spreading lies and misconceptions about COVID-19. "PM Narendra Modi ensured free vaccination for all in the country but you (Rahul) are spreading lies, misconceptions and putting people's lives in danger," Chouhan said. He made the remarks after Rahul criticised PM Modi's 'Mann Ki Baat' programme.

Congress leader Rahul Gandhi, while taking a dig at Prime Minister Narendra Modi's monthly radio programme 'Mann Ki Baat', on Sunday took to Twitter to share a video that showed a graph titled "truth about vaccination rate". "Just deliver the [COVID-19] vaccines to every citizen of the country, even if you tell your 'Mann Ki Baat' after that," Rahul added.

Thailand has announced new restrictions for 30 days from Monday in Bangkok and nine other provinces amid a surge in coronavirus cases. The measures include a ban on gatherings of over 20 people and indoor dining. Authorities also said that construction sites in six areas will be shut down and workers' camps will be sealed off to contain clusters.

Microsoft Chairman and CEO Satya Nadella told The Verge that he didn't have a home office before the coronavirus pandemic. He added, "Suddenly, I found myself [saying], 'Oh my God, not only do I need a home office. I have all my girls home and they need all their own independent PCs'." "It became mission critical," he added.

Actress Mona Singh, who got married to Shyam Rajagopalan in December 2019, opened up about quarantining with her husband during the first COVID-19 lockdown. "We were just married, we were at home, we were cooking...It was like a honeymoon period for us," she said. "The second lockdown was a hard reality...we were anxious and we were feeling helpless," she added.

A man from MP got vaccinated against COVID-19 along with his family members after speaking with PM Narendra Modi. Dulariya village resident Rajesh Hirave, aged 43, told PTI, "I encouraged others also, following which 127 people from the village got vaccinated." PM Modi had counselled Dulariya's residents on vaccination and the chat was aired on 'Mann Ki Baat' on Sunday.

Malaysia's PM Muhyiddin Yassin said that the country will continue to impose a coronavirus lockdown until daily cases fall below 4,000. Yassin hopes the daily cases will decline below 4,000 by mid-July, state media reported. Daily new cases in Malaysia have stayed above 5,000, with the Health Ministry on Sunday reporting 5,586 new infections.

Japan might ask athletes from India and five other countries, which have reported the Delta variant of coronavirus, to have daily tests for the virus for seven days before their departure for the Tokyo Olympics, a report said. Currently, all overseas athletes have been asked for two tests during the last four days before leaving for the Games.

As many as 50,040 new coronavirus cases were reported in India in the last 24 hours, taking the total number of cases to 3,02,33,183. The active cases of coronavirus have declined to 5,86,403. Further, the death toll due to coronavirus in the country has risen to 3,95,751 after 1,258 new deaths were reported in the last 24 hours.

Delhi on Sunday reported 89 new COVID-19 cases and 285 recoveries. The daily COVID-19 positivity rate in the national capital stood at 0.12%, while the city's active COVID-19 cases reached 1,568. The total number of recoveries in Delhi has reached 14,07,401 and with four new deaths, the toll has reached 24,965, according to the Delhi State Health Bulletin.

Delhi on Saturday administered 2,05,170 COVID-19 vaccine doses, surpassing all previous records, said Deputy CM Manish Sisodia. "Vaccination in Delhi is happening at a record pace! This is how we are going to protect Delhi from the 3rd wave," Sisodia tweeted. Meanwhile, Delhi on Saturday reported 85 fresh COVID-19 cases, its lowest single-day rise in COVID-19 cases this year.

A 24-year-old man in Odisha, who was accused of rape and has been absconding for over two years, was arrested at a COVID-19 vaccination centre. "We got [a] tip-off that he would be coming to take the vaccine. He was arrested soon after taking the jab," police said. He was accused of raping a 20-year-old girl in 2019.

Criticising the handling of the COVID-19 crisis in Uttar Pradesh, state BJP working committee member Ram Iqbal Singh claimed that at least 10 people died in every village during the second wave as no lessons were learned from the first one. He said that after 75 years of freedom, Ballia district with a population of 34 lakh, has no doctors.

Centre has informed the Supreme Court that pharmaceutical company Zydus Cadila, which is developing DNA COVID-19 vaccines, has concluded its clinical trial for 12-18 age group and the shots will be available soon. Amid the shortage of doses in India, the Centre also told the Supreme Court that 135 crore doses will be available from all sources by the year-end.

Serum Institute of India (SII) has produced 10.8 crore doses of its COVID-19 vaccine Covishield in June so far, according to information provided to the Drugs Controller General of India (DCGI). The company sent 45 batches of Covishield to the Central Drugs Laboratory, Kasauli for release during the month. Recently, SII began production of Novavax's COVID-19 vaccine Covovax in India.

With the aim of improving women's participation in the COVID-19 vaccination drive, the Indore Health Department started six vaccination centres for women in minority-dominated areas in the district. Indore Chief Medical and Health Officer Dr BS Setya said that the district made a record for administering the maximum number of COVID-19 vaccine doses but the participation of women remained low.

Prime Minister Narendra Modi during his 'Mann Ki Baat' address on Sunday said, "I've got both my COVID-19 vaccine doses...My mother who's nearing 100 years also got both the doses." He said this during a conversation with a Madhya Pradesh villager who spoke about vaccine hesitancy. The PM then asked the villager to get vaccinated himself to encourage other villagers.

Centre has informed the Supreme Court that pharmaceutical company Zydus Cadila, which is developing DNA COVID-19 vaccines, has concluded its clinical trial for 12-18 age group and the shots will be available soon. Amid the shortage of doses in India, the Centre also told the Supreme Court that 135 crore doses will be available from all sources by the year-end.

The Management Council of Savitribai Phule Pune University (SPPU) has passed a resolution to waive the examination fees of students orphaned due to COVID-19. The university also stated that the administration is also considering ways if the college fees for these students can be reduced. The administration has been instructed to complete work on the students' sports complex by July-end.

Scientists in South Africa on Saturday said new COVID-19 infections in the country appear to be dominated by the Delta variant that was first identified in India. The Delta variant is even more transmissible than the Beta variant that was first detected locally, Professor Tulio de Oliveira of University of KwaZulu-Natal said. South Africa is the continent's worst coronavirus-hit nation.

Ahead of the opening of the Char Dham Yatra, Uttarakhand CM Tirath Singh Rawat directed officials to provide additional COVID-19 vaccine doses to inoculate people related to the yatra. The additional vaccine doses have been given to Uttarkashi, Chamoli, Rudraprayag, Tehri and Pauri districts. The CM also instructed to vaccinate all those who will be in direct contact with pilgrims.

Delhi on Saturday administered 2,05,170 COVID-19 vaccine doses, surpassing all previous records, said Deputy CM Manish Sisodia. "Vaccination in Delhi is happening at a record pace! This is how we are going to protect Delhi from the 3rd wave," Sisodia tweeted. Meanwhile, Delhi on Saturday reported 85 fresh COVID-19 cases, its lowest single-day rise in COVID-19 cases this year.

ICMR chief Dr Balram Bhargava has said Covishield, produced by the Serum Institute of India, and Covaxin, produced by Bharat Biotech, are effective against SARS-CoV-2 variants Alpha, Beta, Gamma and Delta. He added that lab tests to check effectiveness of these vaccines against the Delta Plus variant are ongoing and the results for the same are expected after a week.

The Delta Plus variant of COVID-19 has a greater affinity for lung tissues as compared to other strains of the virus, head of government's expert group NTAGI Dr NK Arora has said. He added, "But if it causes damage or not isn't clear yet. It also doesn't mean that this variant will cause more severe disease or it's more transmissible."

The first case of Delta Plus COVID-19 variant in Chandigarh was detected on Saturday. A 35-year-old man, whose sample tested positive for Delta Plus strain, had reported mild symptoms of the disease in May and has now fully recovered. A total of 50 samples were sent to the National Centre for Disease Control (NCDC) lab for whole-genome sequencing.

AAP MLA Atishi on Sunday said Delhi needs 45 lakh doses of COVID-19 vaccines in July in order to keep up the current vaccination rate and the Centre has been informed about it. As per Delhi's vaccination bulletin, 25% of the population in the 18-44 age group in the city has received at least one dose of the vaccine.

PM Narendra Modi in his monthly broadcast 'Mann Ki Baat' said rumour mongers will spread vaccine hesitancy but "we have to save lives". "Don't remain under the delusion that COVID-19 has got over," he added. Speaking to people from Madhya Pradesh's Dulariya village, he urged them to get rid of vaccine fear, saying, "There are many villages...that are 100% vaccinated."

PM Narendra Modi on Sunday's 'Mann ki Baat' said that he was inspired by how late legendary sprinter Milkha Singh devoted his life to sports. He added that when Milkha Singh was hospitalised after contracting coronavirus, he got a chance to speak to him. "I had requested him to motivate the athletes going for Tokyo Olympics," he added.

PM Narendra Modi on Sunday asked people to not believe in any rumours related to COVID-19 vaccines and urged them to get vaccinated. "Those who are spreading rumours on vaccines, let them be...I urge you all to trust science. Trust our scientists," added PM Modi. "The threat of COVID-19 remains...we've to focus on vaccination and following protocols," he said.

Kerala on Sunday reported 10,905 new COVID-19 cases out of the 1,03,996 samples tested in the past 24 hours, the state's Health Minister Veena George said. The positivity rate in the state currently stands at 10.49%. Further, Kerala reported 12,351 recoveries and 62 deaths from COVID-19, taking the death toll to 12,879 and total active cases to 99,591.

The Rajasthan government on Saturday made it mandatory for people to have at least one dose of a COVID-19 vaccine to enter public places from Monday, June 28 onward. This was a part of the state government's guidelines, according to which offices with at least 60% of staff inoculated with at least one vaccine dose can function with 100% workforce.

The Supreme Court will on Monday hear a plea filed by a child rights activist seeking an opt-out option for CA aspirants in upcoming exams. A three-judge bench will hear the plea which has also sought more exam centres and postponement of the exams if adherence to COVID-19 guidelines isn't possible. The exams are scheduled to begin on July 5.

A man from MP got vaccinated against COVID-19 along with his family members after speaking with PM Narendra Modi. Dulariya village resident Rajesh Hirave, aged 43, told PTI, "I encouraged others also, following which 127 people from the village got vaccinated." PM Modi had counselled Dulariya's residents on vaccination and the chat was aired on 'Mann Ki Baat' on Sunday.

AAP MLA Atishi on Sunday said Delhi needs 45 lakh doses of COVID-19 vaccines in July in order to keep up the current vaccination rate and the Centre has been informed about it. As per Delhi's vaccination bulletin, 25% of the population in the 18-44 age group in the city has received at least one dose of the vaccine.

Ghaziabad reported its all-time low of a single COVID-19 case in the last 24 hours since the second wave of the pandemic hit the district. The district had been witnessing 2-8 cases a day for the last one week. Ghaziabad currently has 54 active cases and 55,007 patients have recovered till date while the district has recorded total 461 deaths.

Congress leader Rahul Gandhi, while taking a dig at Prime Minister Narendra Modi's monthly radio programme 'Mann Ki Baat', on Sunday took to Twitter to share a video that showed a graph titled "truth about vaccination rate". "Just deliver the [COVID-19] vaccines to every citizen of the country, even if you tell your 'Mann Ki Baat' after that," Rahul added.

The roll out of Russian COVID-19 vaccine Sputnik V has been delayed again at various private hospitals in the Delhi-NCR region, officials said on Sunday. It was earlier stated that Apollo Hospitals' Delhi facility will tentatively start administering the vaccine by June 25. "We don't have a clarity on the dates," a spokesman of Apollo Hospitals informed.

Tokyo 2020 Olympic and Paralympic Games organisers will give all 70,000 volunteers working for the Games an opportunity to receive a COVID-19 vaccine, a Japanese newspaper reported on Saturday. It said some of the volunteers have already been vaccinated. Earlier this month, around 10,000 of the 80,000 volunteers who signed up to help at the Games had quit.

Aditya Birla Group Chairman Kumar Mangalam Birla said that the COVID-19 pandemic is more of an episodic setback than a structural setback. "After the first wave, I think we've come back into shape pretty much completely," he added. "This time around, it's been a setback for...maybe a month longer than...last time, but I...see the economy coming back," Birla said.

As many as 50,040 new coronavirus cases were reported in India in the last 24 hours, taking the total number of cases to 3,02,33,183. The active cases of coronavirus have declined to 5,86,403. Further, the death toll due to coronavirus in the country has risen to 3,95,751 after 1,258 new deaths were reported in the last 24 hours.

With the aim of improving women's participation in the COVID-19 vaccination drive, the Indore Health Department started six vaccination centres for women in minority-dominated areas in the district. Indore Chief Medical and Health Officer Dr BS Setya said that the district made a record for administering the maximum number of COVID-19 vaccine doses but the participation of women remained low.

Serum Institute of India (SII) has produced 10.8 crore doses of its COVID-19 vaccine Covishield in June so far, according to information provided to the Drugs Controller General of India (DCGI). The company sent 45 batches of Covishield to the Central Drugs Laboratory, Kasauli for release during the month. Recently, SII began production of Novavax's COVID-19 vaccine Covovax in India.

Assam government has issued fresh COVID-19 guidelines that will be effective from 5 am on June 28. As per the order, there will round-the-clock curfew in high positivity districts, including Morigaon and Biswanath. Moderate positivity districts, including Dhubri and Kokrajhar, will have 2 pm-5 pm curfew, while districts showing improvement, including Majuli and Chirang, will have 5 pm-5 am curfew.

Croatia winger Ivan Perisic has tested positive for COVID-19 and will miss the team's match against Spain in the round of 16 of Euro 2020. He will now undergo 10-day mandatory self-isolation. Croatia said that all other national team members, staff members and delegations are negative. Notably, Perisic scored goals against the Czech Republic and Scotland in the group stage.

A 65-year-old woman, who was fully vaccinated against COVID-19, is the first person to have tested positive for the Delta Plus COVID-19 variant in Rajasthan. The sample of the woman was sent for genome sequencing to the National Institute of Virology in May and her reports came back on Friday. "She was asymptomatic and has recovered," an official said.

Alia Bhatt took to Instagram and shared that she has wrapped up her upcoming film 'Gangubai Kathiawadi' and wrote, "This film...has been through two lockdowns, two cyclones and director and actor getting COVID-19 during the making." She added, "When a film ends a part of you ends with it! Today I've lost a part of me. Gangu, I love you!"

BJP leader Suvendu Adhikari has said the TMC-led government must make 2020's pandemic purchase scam committee report public. "[CM's] Chief Advisor Alapan Bandyopadhyay was head of [the] committee. Accountability and transparency call for immediate disclosure," Adhikari added. "He (Suvendu) is deliberately trying to create confusion about...CM's fight against COVID-19," TMC leader Kunal Ghosh said.

The Centre has informed Supreme Court that the country has the capacity to store vaccines that may require temperature between minus 15??C and minus 20??C. There are over 29,000 cold chain points across India where vaccines are stored at the recommended temperatures, the government said. It added that the requirement for cold storage may change with arrival of other vaccines.

Ahead of the opening of the Char Dham Yatra, Uttarakhand CM Tirath Singh Rawat directed officials to provide additional COVID-19 vaccine doses to inoculate people related to the yatra. The additional vaccine doses have been given to Uttarkashi, Chamoli, Rudraprayag, Tehri and Pauri districts. The CM also instructed to vaccinate all those who will be in direct contact with pilgrims.

Actor Pooja Hegde noted that amid the ongoing COVID-19 pandemic, it's a good thing to stay in and not step out unless it is absolutely essential. "Let's just take it...one pandemic day at a time. What's happening in the country...is quite serious and scary. I pray every day for things to get fine," she said.

A 13-year-old patient from Karnataka's Vijayanagara district has been diagnosed with Acute Necrotizing Encephalopathy of Childhood (ANEC), a rare post-COVID-19 complication that affects the brain. The patient was admitted to hospital a few days ago with an inactive brain and was put on ventilator for three days. It is the first such case in Karnataka and the second in India.

University of Hyderabad (UoH) students are demanding a free COVID-19 vaccination drive on campus. UoH Student Union President Abhishek Nandan said that without free vaccinations many students are unable to access the education they deserve. "The vaccination drive conducted on campus charged students ??850 for Covishield and ??1400 for Covaxin, which is a huge sum of money," added Nandan.

Over 1.3 lakh people were fined for not wearing face masks in public places in Delhi between June 19 and 26 amid unlock, Delhi Police said. Over 1.53 lakh challans were issued for violation of COVID-19 norms last week. "A few were even booked under relevant sections of IPC and Epidemic Diseases Act," Delhi Police Additional PRO Anil Mittal said.

Television actor Karanvir Bohra and his wife Teejay Sidhu, who recently welcomed their third daughter, opened up about parenting during the COVID-19 pandemic. "It's...frustrating more than anything. You want to take your children places and you can't because places are shut...My friends have not...come to see the baby and it is so unfair to her," Teejay said.

The roll out of Russian COVID-19 vaccine Sputnik V has been delayed again at various private hospitals in the Delhi-NCR region, officials said on Sunday. It was earlier stated that Apollo Hospitals' Delhi facility will tentatively start administering the vaccine by June 25. "We don't have a clarity on the dates," a spokesman of Apollo Hospitals informed.

PM Narendra Modi in his monthly broadcast 'Mann Ki Baat' said rumour mongers will spread vaccine hesitancy but "we have to save lives". "Don't remain under the delusion that COVID-19 has got over," he added. Speaking to people from Madhya Pradesh's Dulariya village, he urged them to get rid of vaccine fear, saying, "There are many villages...that are 100% vaccinated."

Prime Minister Narendra Modi during his 'Mann Ki Baat' address on Sunday said, "I've got both my COVID-19 vaccine doses...My mother who's nearing 100 years also got both the doses." He said this during a conversation with a Madhya Pradesh villager who spoke about vaccine hesitancy. The PM then asked the villager to get vaccinated himself to encourage other villagers.

Government offices will be allowed to open till 6pm in Rajasthan under new guidelines from Monday. Full physical attendance will be allowed in the offices with less than 25 staff members. Markets or commercial establishments, with 60% staff vaccinated against COVID-19, can remain open till 7 pm. Private vehicles will be allowed from 5am to 8pm from Monday to Saturday.

The Centre has submitted a 375-page affidavit in the Supreme Court, presenting a roadmap on how it will inoculate the entire 93-94-crore population above 18 years against COVID-19 by year-end. The government said 51.6 crore doses will be made available by July 31, while it has planned to procure the remaining 135 crore doses from August-December from five manufacturers.

Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Saturday held a virtual meeting on the progress of the coronavirus vaccination drive that started on January 16 this year. On Monday, India had launched a new phase of drive wherein the Centre provided doses to states and Union Territories for free. As per government data, 31.50 crore vaccine doses have been administered so far.

The Indian Council of Medical Research (ICMR) revealed that India has tested 40.18 crore samples for coronavirus till Friday, with nearly 18 lakh tests being conducted daily in June itself. Till June 1, India had tested 35 crore samples. ICMR Director-General Dr Balram Bhargava said increased testing enabled early identification, quick isolation and effective treatment of COVID-19 patients.

The variant of coronavirus first detected in India is "spreading rapidly" from the Lisbon area to other parts of Portugal, a report by the country's national health institute said. The Delta variant accounts for 51% of COVID-19 cases in the country, it added. More than 70% of coronavirus cases in the Lisbon area are of the variant, it further said.

Taiwan has reported its first domestic case of the coronavirus variant first found in India. The case is linked to a COVID-19 cluster that has led to six cases of the Delta variant so far, including two who returned this month from Peru, the country said. The government is carrying out mass testing in response to the cluster.

Around 300 members of the transgender community were inoculated against COVID-19 over the week in a special drive arranged for the community in Delhi's Sultanpuri. Centre for Advocacy and Research (CFAR) and NGO Aarohan helped district authorities organise the drive. Many of the beneficiaries claimed they had not been vaccinated previously because of the discrimination they face in public spaces.

The Navi Mumbai Municipal Corporation (NMMC) on Saturday announced financial assistance to local children, who were orphaned due to the coronavirus pandemic. The assistance to orphans will be in the range of ??1,000 to ??6,000 based on the age of the child. The NMMC also announced assistance of ??1.5 lakh for women who lost their husbands amid the pandemic.

Over 1.41 lakh people were administered coronavirus vaccine doses in Pune on Friday, of which over 1 lakh people received their first dose of the vaccine, according to the CoWIN dashboard data. This brings the total number of vaccine doses administered in the city to over 42 lakh. Nearly 5 lakh people were administered vaccine doses in Maharashtra on Friday.

The mass cremation site for coronavirus victims in Bengaluru's Kurubarahalli village, believed to be the biggest in the city, has been closed amid a dip in the number of deaths due to the virus. An official said that only one body was brought for cremation on Wednesday. Bengaluru Urban recorded 17 new deaths and 614 new cases on Friday.

The Uttar Pradesh government said it has administered over three crore doses of coronavirus vaccine till Saturday, adding that Lucknow was given the maximum (13,70,405) doses. Over eight lakh people were inoculated today, the government informed. Notably, Maharashtra has also crossed the three-crore vaccinations milestone. From July, UP is planning to administer 10 to 12 lakh doses daily.

Tunisia's PM Hichem Mechichi has tested positive for coronavirus and will continue to work remotely, the Tunisian government said on Friday. The PM had received a second dose of a COVID-19 vaccine last month. Tunisia has witnessed a significant rise in coronavirus cases recently with intensive care units (ICUs) in the country almost full, health authorities said.

Rajasthan on Saturday announced the easing of some curbs in the state and allowed all religious places to open from 5 am to 4 pm. Offices where 60% of employees have received at least one COVID-19 vaccine dose, can open with a 100% workforce. Gyms and restaurants with over 60% vaccinated staff can open for three hours longer than before.

The Gurugram Health Department is set to administer Russia??s COVID-19 vaccine Sputnik V, at five government health centres, free of cost from July. It'll be administered on a first-come-first-serve basis at Polyclinic in Sector 31, Civil Hospital in Sector 10, Wazirabad Community Health Centre, and the sub-divisional government hospitals in Sohna and Pataudi, said Gurugram Chief Medical Officer.

The West Bengal government on Saturday formed a four-member expert committee to investigate the impact of the fake coronavirus vaccination drive in Kolkata. "The committee will submit its detailed report immediately...The State Family Welfare Officer will do the necessary coordination in this regard," said the state Health and Family Welfare Department. An SIT is also investigating the matter.

UK Health Minister Matt Hancock has apologised for breaching COVID-19 rules after pictures of him kissing his aide Gina Coladangelo surfaced online. "I accept that I breached the social distancing guidance in these circumstances. I have let people down and am very sorry," he said. Hancock added that he'd be grateful for privacy for his family "on this personal matter".

Actress Mithila Palkar believes that the youth needs to step up and help the senior citizens who haven't received the COVID-19 vaccine due to vaccine hesitancy or lack of knowledge about the online applications. The 28-year-old said, "Youngsters with access to information should create awareness. [They should] talk to seniors in their vicinity and help them get the jabs."

A day after the Supreme Court panel released an interim report on Delhi's oxygen requirement, CM Arvind Kejriwal called for a joint effort to fight COVID-19. Taking to Twitter, Kejriwal wrote, "If the fight over oxygen is over, can we do some work, now? Let's work together so that no one has to face oxygen shortage during the third wave."

A Mumbai resident has alleged that Shivam hospital, which is under scanner for fake COVID-19 vaccination drive, didn't issue a CoWIN-generated certificate after her first vaccine dose in April. Kandivali resident Anita Bamgude alleged that she paid ??250 for the Covishield shot at the Hospital on April 3, but didn't get any receipt or certificate.

The White House on Friday said that India is an "incredibly important partner to the United States in the region and globally". The US also took a range of steps to help India in its fight against the COVID-19 pandemic, White House Press Secretary Jen Psaki added. The US has sent more than $500 million in COVID-19 assistance to India.

The World Health Organization (WHO) has asked people who are fully vaccinated against COVID-19 to continue wearing masks and follow social distancing as the Delta variant is rapidly spreading across the globe. "Vaccine alone won't stop community transmission," Mariangela Simao, WHO's Assistant Director-General for access to vaccines, said. The Delta coronavirus variant was first found in India.

Three more aides of Debanjan Deb, who posed as an IAS officer and allegedly organised fake coronavirus vaccination camps, were arrested on Saturday, Kolkata Police revealed. Two of them were signatories of the bank account created under Kolkata Municipal Corporation's (KMC) name and the third "actively participated" in the vaccination camps, said an officer. Deb was arrested on Wednesday.

Tunisia's PM Hichem Mechichi has tested positive for coronavirus and will continue to work remotely, the Tunisian government said on Friday. The PM had received a second dose of a COVID-19 vaccine last month. Tunisia has witnessed a significant rise in coronavirus cases recently with intensive care units (ICUs) in the country almost full, health authorities said.

The Uttar Pradesh government said it has administered over three crore doses of coronavirus vaccine till Saturday, adding that Lucknow was given the maximum (13,70,405) doses. Over eight lakh people were inoculated today, the government informed. Notably, Maharashtra has also crossed the three-crore vaccinations milestone. From July, UP is planning to administer 10 to 12 lakh doses daily.

Amid COVID-19 lockdown, an initiative by Apex Kidney Foundation, Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC), Mumbai Nephrology Group and IIT Bombay, helped conduct dialysis for 2,000 kidney patients. The project has been functional since May 2020. BMC Commissioner Iqbal Singh Chahal said 75 dialysis machines were deployed in public hospitals and 35 in private hospitals for COVID-19 positive cases.

WHO chief Tedros Adhanom Ghebreyesus has said that the Delta variant of COVID-19, identified in at least 85 countries, is the "most transmissible" of the variants identified so far. He stated that it's spreading rapidly among unvaccinated populations. "I know that globally there's currently a lot of concern about Delta variant, and WHO is concerned about it too," he added.

A man climbed a tree and refused to come down as he didn't want to get COVID-19 vaccine at a village in Madhya Pradesh's Rajgarh, reported India Today. The man apparently also took his wife's Aadhaar card to ensure she didn't get vaccinated. The incident reportedly occurred when authorities set up a vaccination camp and urged villagers to get vaccinated.

Walt Disney is offering $1,000 (over ??74,000) bonuses to hire housekeepers and kitchen staff at its theme parks in US' Florida. It said that housekeepers, earning $16 per hour, and line cooks, earning $18, will receive the bonus if they work for at least 90 days. This comes months after Disney laid off around 32,000 employees due to COVID-19 pandemic.

The World Health Organization (WHO) has asked people who are fully vaccinated against COVID-19 to continue wearing masks and follow social distancing as the Delta variant is rapidly spreading across the globe. "Vaccine alone won't stop community transmission," Mariangela Simao, WHO's Assistant Director-General for access to vaccines, said. The Delta coronavirus variant was first found in India.

TMC MP Mimi Chakraborty has fallen ill and is undergoing medical treatment at her home, days after taking a vaccine shot at a vaccination camp which later turned out to be fake. Her medical complications include acute stomach ache and profuse sweating, HT Bangla reported. Mimi had earlier said that the vials used at the vaccination drive weren't vaccines.

India reported 48,698 new COVID-19 cases and 1,183 deaths in the last 24 hours, according to the data released by Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. The total number of active cases in the country now stands at 5.95 lakh. As many as 64,818 people recovered from the virus in the last 24 hours in the country.

The Maharashtra government on Friday said that there will be no further relaxations in lockdown norms for a few days in Pune district. The decision has been taken as experts have predicted an increase in the number of COVID-19 patients in the coming days, the government added. "Everyone needs to continue taking care of themselves," Baramati MP Supriya Sule said.

Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal today announced that Delhi government has decided to provide free vaccines against coronavirus to everyone above 18 years of age. "Today we have given the approval for the purchase of 1.34 crore vaccines. We will make an effort to ensure that it is purchased soon and administered at the earliest to people," he added.

The Madras High Court today pulled up the Election Commission of India for allowing political rallies amid the second wave of coronavirus in the country. It said that the Election Commission of India is "singularly responsible" for the second wave of COVID-19. "Election Commission officers should be booked on murder charges probably," Madras High Court Chief Justice Sanjib Banerjee remarked.

Vistara has offered to fly doctors and nurses from government organisations, free of cost, across the country amid a spike in the COVID-19 cases. In a letter written to Usha Padhee, Joint Secretary, Ministry of Civil Aviation, the airlines said it "wants to help government organisations". Vistara said that it will accommodate the medical professionals on a first-come-first-serve basis.

Netherlands has announced that it'll be suspending passenger flights from India from 6:00 pm on Monday until at least 00:01 am on May 1 amid coronavirus crisis. The flight suspension was announced after a Cabinet meeting in which Dutch Infrastructure Minister Cora van Nieuwenhuizen said that the "epidemiological situation on the ground is very serious", news agency NL Times reported.

RCB's Australian bowlers Adam Zampa and Kane Richardson are leaving IPL 2021, the franchise announced. RCB said that the duo are returning to Australia for personal reasons, adding that they respect their decision and will offer them complete support. This comes after DC's Ravichandran Ashwin announced that he is taking a break from IPL 2021 over COVID-19 situation in India.

Congress leader Rahul Gandhi on Monday said that COVID-19 vaccines must be provided free of cost to the citizens. "Enough of discussion. Citizens must get vaccines free of cost, end of matter. Don't turn India into a victim of the BJP's system," Gandhi tweeted. The tweet comes in the context of COVID-19 vaccine pricing.

Odisha CM Naveen Patnaik has announced free COVID-19 vaccination for all in the age group of 18 to 44 years. Patnaik said, "Around two crore people of this age group will benefit and state government will spend ?2,000 crore for this purpose." He added, "Every life is precious for us. We want everyone in the state to be safe."

India has reported 3,52,991 COVID-19 cases and 2,812 deaths in the last 24 hours, which is the highest single-day rise in the number of daily cases as well as daily deaths since the pandemic began. With this, the total number of cases has reached 1,73,13,163, while the death toll has surged to 1,95,123. There are 28,13,658 active cases in India.

West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee on Sunday said people are no longer interested in PM Narendra Modi's "Mann Ki Baat" programme and instead want to hear "Covid ki baat" (COVID-19-related talks). "You [PM Modi] have caused the disaster while aiming to conquer Bengal. You should talk about vaccines, arrange vaccines and send medicines,? Banerjee added.

Moderna's coronavirus vaccine will be reviewed on April 30 by technical experts for a possible emergency use listing, the World Health Organization (WHO) said on Monday. So far, vaccines made by Pfizer, AstraZeneca and Johnson & Johnson have been approved by WHO for emergency use. COVID-19 has infected over 14.73 crore people globally, according to the Johns Hopkins University tracker.

Addressing concerns raised by some quarters on 'Liberalised and Accelerated Phase III Strategy of COVID-19 Vaccination', Union Health Minister Dr Harsh Vardhan criticised "certain political leaders" from the Opposition, saying they are indulging in "needless politics" and spreading "misinformation". Taking to his blog, Vardhan said the need of the hour is a greater degree of shared idealism.

The European Union (EU) said that it has launched legal action against pharmaceutical firm AstraZeneca over coronavirus vaccine delivery shortfalls. AstraZeneca wasn't able to fulfil its order for the first quarter and hasn't come up with a reliable strategy to ensure timely deliveries, it added. In response, AstraZeneca said that the legal action by the EU was without merit.

Amid row over US' ban on export of COVID-19 vaccine raw material to India, Chinese state media said, "This pandemic shows that the West's getting closer to India is more in a geopolitical sense." "Their closeness to each other is fragile and superficial," it added. Earlier, China's state-run airline suspended its cargo flights that were rushing medical supplies to India.

Americans who have been vaccinated against COVID-19 may be able to visit Europe by summer, said a top EU official. European Commission President Ursula von der Leyen told The New York Times that those who have received vaccines approved by the European Medicines Agency will be able to travel to Europe. The EU banned non-essential travel over a year ago.

Maharashtra Revenue Minister and Congress leader Balasaheb Thorat on Monday said that the decision on free COVID-19 vaccines should be announced by the Chief Minister and an attempt by others to take credit for it was "not good". Thorat's comments came a day after Maharashtra Cabinet Minister Nawab Malik announced that the state will vaccinate all citizens for free.

Karnataka CM BS Yediyurappa on Monday announced that COVID-19 vaccines will be provided free of cost to citizens aged between 18 and 44 years at all government vaccination centres across the state. "Union Government vaccination drive for citizens above 45 years of age will continue. I urge all eligible to register themselves from April 28," he added.

A drive-in cinema site in Bhopal will be converted into a COVID-19 vaccination centre, an official said on Monday. The site is located in Hotel Ashoka Lake View, run by the Madhya Pradesh Tourism Department. Hotel's Senior Manager KL Patel said the preparations are expected to be completed by April 30 and the vaccination programme would start the next day.

PM Narendra Modi spoke to US President Joe Biden on phone a day after US said it would "immediately" make coronavirus vaccine Covishield raw material available for India. "We discussed the evolving COVID situation in both countries in detail. I thanked President Biden for the support being provided by the United States to India," PM Modi tweeted.

A differently-abled beedi worker in Kerala's Kannur district donated almost his entire life's savings of ?2 lakh to the Chief Minister's Distress Relief Fund to provide COVID-19 vaccines to those who can't afford it. He's left with only ?850 in his bank account after the donation. "What's the use of accumulating so much money? People's lives are bigger," Janardhanan said.

Criticising the BJP for mishandling the COVID-19 pandemic, TMC leader Abhishek Banerjee on Monday exuded confidence that his aunt, West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee, will secure a two-thirds majority in the ongoing Assembly elections. He also criticised the Election Commission for holding the West Bengal elections in eight phases for "the benefit of one political party".

US President Joe Biden has assured India of assistance amid rising COVID-19 cases. "Just as India sent assistance to...United States as our hospitals were strained early in the pandemic, we are determined to help India in its time of need," Biden said in a tweet. "US is working closely with...Indian government to rapidly deploy additional...supplies," Vice President Kamala Harris tweeted.

As voting for the seventh phase of West Bengal Assembly elections began on Monday at 7 am, Prime Minister Narendra Modi tweeted, "Urging people to exercise their franchise and follow all COVID-19 related protocols." Polling will be held in 34 constituencies across 12,068 polling stations. The final phase of voting will take place on April 29.

Indian tycoons and wealthy people are spending lakhs of rupees on last-minute flights and private jets to fly to places in the UK and the UAE amid the rising COVID-19 cases, Bloomberg and AFP reported. "It's not only the ultra-rich...whoever can afford to take private jets are taking private jets," the CEO of a New Delhi-based private jet firm said.

Actress Pooja Hegde on Sunday informed that she has tested positive for COVID-19 and is under home quarantine. She wrote on her Instagram Stories, "Following all the protocols, I have isolated...I request all those who?ve come in contact with me recently to get tested too." Pooja added, "I am currently recuperating well."

Reacting to Madras High Court's observation that the Election Commission was "singularly responsible" for the second wave of COVID-19 in the country, West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee said, "EC has become a parrot of the BJP". Mamata added that despite pleading with EC to merge the last few poll phases amid COVID-19 surge, "they didn't, just to satisfy the BJP."

WHO chief Tedros Adhanom Ghebreyesus has said the situation in India, where COVID-19 cases have surged, is "beyond heartbreaking". "WHO is doing everything we can, providing critical equipment and supplies, including thousands of oxygen concentrators, prefabricated mobile field hospitals and laboratory supplies," Tedros stated. He said 2,600 extra WHO staff members were going to India to help.

The Centre has advised three main principles, containment, clinical management and community engagement, for management of COVID-19 across states. Under containment, states are advised to control human host through effective isolation, while clinical management ensures managing stress on health care delivery system. Community engagement ensures effective follow-up of Covid-appropriate behaviour.

With India reporting over 3.52 lakh COVID-19 cases in the last 24 hours, government has released a list of eight states that have more than 1 lakh active COVID-19 cases. Maharashtra with 7,00,207 active cases has the highest number. The state is followed by Uttar Pradesh, Karnataka, Kerala, Rajasthan, Chhattisgarh, Gujarat and Tamil Nadu.

The Ministry of Civil Aviation on Monday said that the fare capping on domestic flights will continue until May 31. The ministry also limited the flight capacity of domestic flights at 80% of pre-COVID-19 levels till the end of next month. Last month, the Directorate General of Civil Aviation (DGCA) had extended the suspension of international flights till April 30.

The Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike (BBMP) has issued a show-cause notice to three private diagnostic centres for not disclosing test results of COVID-19 patients to the Indian Council of Medical Research (ICMR). The civic body said it was considering to revoke the COVID-19 testing approval of these laboratories. BBMP asked the diagnostic centres to reply within 48 hours.

Samajwadi Party chief Akhilesh Yadav has alleged that the Uttar Pradesh government was giving fake data to show fewer deaths due to COVID-19 while a rush was being witnessed at crematoriums. "It's government's failure that even BJP MPs and MLAs aren't satisfied with the current state of affairs," Akhilesh added. He said the state never saw such an "insensitive" government.

BSP supremo Mayawati on Monday said initiatives announced by the Centre and the Uttar Pradesh government to overcome the COVID-19 crisis should reflect at the ground level too. "All the necessary steps taken...are good, but all of them should be implemented on the ground timely. This is the demand of BSP," Mayawati said in a tweet in Hindi.

Singapore and Hong Kong on Monday announced that they will start a quarantine-free air travel bubble between them from May 26. The scheme will start with one flight a day into each city, with up to 200 travellers on each flight, officials said. Those wanting to travel from either city must test negative for COVID-19 before departure and on arrival.

BCCI President Sourav Ganguly has said that IPL 2021 will go ahead as scheduled despite several players pulling out of the tournament over the COVID-19 situation in India. "If any player wants to pull out due to family/personal reasons, we will do everything possible to help him,? another BCCI official said. "We're planning everything to keep players motivated," he added.

The Madras High Court on Monday asked Tamil Nadu and Puducherry governments to consider imposing complete lockdown for two days on May 1 and May 2 in view of the counting of votes. This comes hours after the court held the Election Commission responsible for the surge in COVID-19 cases in the country.

Norway's PM Erna Solberg has received her first dose of a coronavirus vaccine, her office announced on Monday. Four other cabinet ministers were also vaccinated, all receiving Moderna's COVID-19 vaccine, it added. "I hope everyone who is offered a vaccine will accept it. Vaccination will eventually allow us to reclaim the everyday life we all long for," Solberg said.

BJP National President JP Nadda alleged that the West Bengal Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee skipped the COVID-19 review meetings between Prime Minister Narendra Modi and other Chief Ministers because of her "ego". Nadda added, "I think she [Mamata] has understood that after May 2, she will not remain in power and that?s why she has lost interest."

Pune on Monday reported less than a lakh COVID-19 active cases for the first time since April 9. The active cases as per the state health department in Pune district went down to 99,977. Pune's confirmed cases went up to 8.02 lakh cases with 6,162 new cases reported today. So far, 78,668 people in Pune have got vaccinated against coronavirus.

Actor Kumud Mishra, who is known for his roles in 'Rockstar' and 'Article 15' among others, has been hospitalised in Madhya Pradesh's Rewa after testing positive for COVID-19, according to a report. He was reportedly taking care of his COVID-19 positive mother when he contracted the virus. Mishra is being treated in a private hospital for the past three days.

Kerala government has imposed new restrictions from April 27 to contain COVID-19 spread. According to the new guidelines, cinema halls, malls, gyms and bars will remain shut until further orders. Moreover, only essential services and emergency services will be permitted on Saturdays and Sundays. A maximum of 50 people will be allowed at marriages for duration of about 2 hours.

The Forest Research Institute in Dehradun, Uttarakhand has been closed for visitors till further orders as 107 people have tested positive for COVID-19 at the institute, said Director Arun Singh Rawat. He added that some of the infected people were admitted to a hospital while others were in home isolation. Meanwhile, Dehradun administration imposed a curfew in parts of district.

Maharashtra on Monday reported a dip in its single-day rise of coronavirus cases to 48,700 after reporting 66,191 cases on Sunday. The state also reported 71,736 discharges and 524 deaths in the last 24 hours. Mumbai also reported a dip, with the city reporting 3,876 new COVID-19 cases in the last 24 hours.

Punjab on Monday announced a daily lockdown from 6 pm to 5 am till further notice in view of the ongoing COVID-19 situation. A weekend lockdown from Friday 6 pm to Monday 5 am has also been announced. "Urge you all to stay at home & step out only if absolutely necessary," Punjab CM Captain Amarinder Singh tweeted.

With India recording its highest single-day rise in the number of daily coronavirus cases, DC coach Ricky Ponting has said that while the current situation is quite grim, cricket can still bring a lot of joy to people. "It's important for us to put on the best show...to give the people something that they'd like to see," Ponting explained.

Punjab Kings batting coach Wasim Jaffer has said that KKR pacer Pat Cummins should be given a pat on his back for his donation towards the PM-Cares fund to help in the fight against coronavirus in India. Jaffer also jokingly added that the pacer should be given the "night off too". Punjab Kings are playing against KKR today.

Amid rising COVID-19 cases, VK Paul, NITI Aayog's Member-Health on Monday said, "Please don't go out unnecessarily, and even within the family wear a mask." Paul further urged the citizens to not invite people into their home. This comes as India recorded more than 3 lakh coronavirus infections for the fifth day in a row.

The government has said that the rumours claiming that new strains have made the coronavirus more deadly are "fake". "There's no difference between the mortality rate in the first wave and second wave," the government said. "The proportion of fatality is similar in both the waves," the government added, citing an ICMR study of about 10,000 hospitalised patients.

Thailand has suspended issuing travel documents from India over the "current coronavirus crisis" in the country. This comes amid a COVID-19 outbreak in Thailand with parks, gyms, cinemas and day-care centres in Bangkok being ordered to shut until May 9. India reported nearly 3.53 lakh coronavirus cases in the last 24 hours on Monday.

A UK Cabinet minister has denied a Daily Mail report claiming that PM Boris Johnson had said in a cabinet meeting in October, "No more f****** lockdowns - let the bodies pile high in their thousands." "It's not true - it's been categorically denied by...everyone," UK Defence Secretary Ben Wallace said. PM Johnson is focussed on coronavirus response, he added.

Uttarakhand DGP Ashok Kumar said on Monday that over 600 police personnel, including 10 SP rank officers have contracted coronavirus. This comes as a curfew was announced in municipal areas of Rishikesh, Dehradun, Garhi Cantt and Clement Town from 7:00 pm on Monday to 5:00 am on May 3. Uttarakhand reported 4,368 new coronavirus cases on Sunday.

Poland will be sending COVID-19 vaccines this week to vaccinate its diplomats in India. A Polish diplomat with a severe case of COVID-19 and his family were evacuated from New Delhi on Sunday, an official said. The evacuation was necessary because the diplomat required hospitalisation, which wasn't available in India, officials said.

The total number of coronavirus cases in the Philippines on Monday rose to 10,06,428, the country's health authority reported. The milestone was reached despite a lockdown in the country's Manila region to curb the spread of coronavirus. After Indonesia, the Philippines accounts for the highest number of COVID-19 cases in Southeast Asia.

Maldives' Ministry of Tourism has announced that tourists travelling from India to Maldives will be suspended from staying at tourist facilities in inhabited islands from tomorrow. "We thank you for the support in our endeavour to make tourism safest possible with minimum inconvenience," it added. This comes as India battles the second wave of coronavirus.

Hindustani classical vocalist and Padma Bhushan recipient Pandit Rajan Mishra died aged 70 due to COVID-19 complications at a Delhi hospital. "We were trying for a ventilator but nobody supported us...Later, PMO reached out...but he had left us by then," his son said. "He had a heart attack in the afternoon and...another attack at around 5:30 pm," Mishra's nephew stated.

Actor Adil Hussain talked about what led to the surge of COVID-19 cases in India and said, "We didn?t learn our lesson properly. But at the same time, even people who took extreme care, fell ill." He stated that lockdown is not going to work economically for anybody. "There?s a huge section of middle-class families who?ve been...devastated," Hussain added.

In wake of surging COVID-19 cases in Telangana, a group of activists led by Chevella former MP Konda Vishweshwar Reddy wrote to Chief Minister K Chandrashekar Rao to postpone the municipal elections scheduled on April 30. "These elections do not directly impact the state's functioning, so there is no harm in postponing them for another six months," the letter read.

China's state-run Sichuan Airlines has suspended all its cargo flights to India for 15 days, causing disruption to private traders' efforts to procure oxygen concentrators and other COVID-19 medical supplies from China. The company part of the airline cited COVID-19 situation in India. This comes after China offered "support and assistance" to deal with the second COVID-19 wave.

Fijian capital Suva entered a 14-day lockdown on Monday after a coronavirus 'superspreader' event in which an infected woman went to a funeral attended by up to 500 people. Three cases were identified involving people who attended the funeral, including a husband and wife who circulated through the community, Permanent Secretary For Health & Medical Services James Fong said.

Oscars 2021 was held at two different venues. Only nominees, their guests and presenters attended, and they were cycled in and out so that only 170 people would be in main room at the same time. Attendees were required to be fully vaccinated and were repeatedly tested. Masks weren't required on camera as it was treated like a film set.

Egyptian President Abdel Fattah El-Sisi has received his first dose of a COVID-19 vaccine, his office said on Sunday. The official statement did not give details on the type of vaccine Sisi received. An adviser to Sisi on health affairs on Friday had said that around 5 lakh people in the country have been vaccinated against COVID-19 so far.

Former Sashastra Seema Bal (SSB) chief Arun Chaudhary has died due to COVID-19 at the age of 66. The SSB in a tweet said, "His contribution to the nation and SSB cannot be forgotten. SSB stands by his family in this period of grief and sorrow and prays to almighty that the departed soul may rest in peace."

Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal on Sunday said that the city's COVID-19 positivity rate has dropped to around 29%. "We saw during the lockdown that the positivity rate reached...36%," Kejriwal said. "I'm not saying that COVID-19 is towards its end in Delhi...It may rise or end but we pray to God that we are rid of coronavirus soon," he added.

India's largest stockbroking platform Zerodha's billionaire Founder and CEO Nithin Kamath in a series of tweets suggested that permanent work from home is the "only long-term" fix to many of India's problems. "Large cities are choking & will continue to break down every time we're tested, COVID-19 today, could be water shortages, pollution, floods," Kamath tweeted.

Mumbai on Saturday recorded 5,888 new COVID-19 cases, the lowest daily rise in infections since March 30. Increased testing and isolation of patients along with the exodus of migrant labourers may have led to the decline, said an official. The fall in cases on Saturday also brought down the positivity rate from 18% to 15% compared to the last week.

Eight police officers have been injured while trying to manage crowds during an anti-lockdown protest in London's Hyde Park area on Saturday. The Metropolitan Police said demonstrators hurled missiles, including bottles, adding that five people have been arrested for various offences, including assault on police. Protestors were demanding a ban on vaccine passports and an end to lockdown.

India on Sunday reported 2,767 deaths due to coronavirus, the biggest one-day jump since the pandemic began. Ten states/UTs accounted for 80.23% of the new deaths. Maharashtra saw the maximum casualties (676), followed by Delhi (357). Uttar Pradesh, Chhattisgarh and Karnataka also reported more than 200 coronavirus deaths in the last 24 hours.

Congress leader Rahul Gandhi on Sunday urged Congress workers to leave all political work aside and help the people of India amid the ongoing COVID-19 crisis because the system has "failed".
