"This is the dharma of the Congress family," Rahul Gandhi tweeted, while adding that the country now needs responsible people.

The US has said it will send raw material that is "urgently required" by Indian manufacturers of the coronavirus vaccine Covishield, amid a surge in cases in India. White House National Security Advisor Jake Sullivan told his Indian counterpart Ajit Doval that the US has identified sources of the material and the same "will immediately be made available for India".

Union Minister Babul Supriyo on Sunday said he has tested positive for COVID-19 for the second time, while adding that his wife has also tested positive. Supriyo tweeted he's "very sad" he won't be able to vote in Asansol. He wrote, "Will be doing my duties from my room and be right by my candidates mentally in every way possible."

Uttar Pradesh Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath on Sunday informed that an order for one crore COVID-19 vaccine doses has been placed for the vaccination drive that will begin from May 1. He tweeted, "An order of 50-50 lakh doses has been placed for both indigenous vaccine manufacturers. In addition, the doses will be made available by the Government of India."

Goa Pradesh Congress Committee President Girish Chodankar on Sunday criticised the BJP-led state government over the COVID-19 situation, adding that it should learn from the Congress-led Chhattisgarh government that converted a stadium into a 360-bed COVID-19 care centre in seven days. Chodankar said, "The overconfident and inefficient BJP government has failed even to provide beds...to Goans."

A man in Spain's Mallorca has been arrested after infecting 22 people with COVID-19. The man allegedly went to work and gym with 104-degree fever while waiting for his coronavirus test result. He even walked around his workplace, saying, "I am going to infect you all with coronavirus." Three of the 22 people he infected were babies.

Former JNU student Umar Khalid, arrested last year in connection with a Delhi riots case, has tested positive for COVID-19 in Tihar Jail. A sessions court on April 15 had granted him bail. However, he is yet to be granted bail in the UAPA case related to the Delhi riots.

Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal today announced that the lockdown has been extended in the national capital till 5 am on May 3. The Delhi government had initially imposed a six-day lockdown on April 19, saying that Delhi's health system has reached its limits. Delhi recorded 24,103 coronavirus cases on Saturday.

The Congress on Sunday accused the Centre of allowing COVID-19 vaccine makers to profiteer to the tune of  ?1.11 lakh crore. "How can such brazen vaccine profiteering be permitted? Why is the Modi government complicit in this profiteering in times of pandemic? Prime Minister Narendra Modi must answer," said Congress chief spokesperson Randeep Surjewala.

PM Narendra Modi during 'Mann Ki Baat' talked to Dr Naveed Nazeer Shah and enquired about the protection COVID-19 vaccines provide. The doctor responded, "Our country has two made-in-India vaccines. Other companies too who've done their trials found that the efficacy is over 60%." He added, "People may test COVID-19 positive after vaccination but the disease won't be life-threatening."

Health Minister Dr Harsh Vardhan has issued a statement on Central Government's vaccine policy and said, "The allegation that Centre is getting [COVID-19 vaccines] (for) cheap and states are not, is patently false." He added, "The 50% quota, that is at Government of India's pricing, is for free distribution of vaccines and [that] will be done through the states only."

Karnataka Congress chief DK Shivakumar has demanded that the state government provide free COVID-19 vaccine to all the people of the state. "India is probably the only country which is discussing vaccine prices, when it's being given for free across the world," he said in a tweet. Shivakumar had demanded free vaccines for all earlier as well.

Terming India's COVID-19 vaccine pricing complicated and politicised, former Chief Economic Advisor Arvind Subramanian on Saturday said the Centre and not states should bear the full cost of vaccines. "There should be only ONE price for vaccines all over India. That price should be ZERO. So, vaccines should be free for all. Differentiation and complexity are unethical, unnecessary," he said.

Chhattisgarh Health Minister TS Singh Deo on Sunday said that the state government has the vaccination sites ready and can complete the vaccination process in 30 to 40 days but the Centre is doing "politics" over it. "There is no way vaccination can be done if vaccines are not available," he added.

Scientists at the UK's University of Glasgow have identified two cases of human-to-cat transmission of coronavirus, after which infected persons have been advised to restrict contact with their pets. One of the infected cats had to be put down as its situation worsened after it developed breathing difficulties. A scan revealed viral pneumonia and SARS-CoV-2 in its lungs.

Maharashtra recorded 66,191 new COVID-19 cases and 832 deaths in the last 24 hours, the highest single-day rise in COVID-19 deaths the state has seen so far. Mumbai reported 5,542 fresh COVID-19 cases, the lowest single-day rise in cases in the city in April 2021. Maharashtra's active cases stand at 6,98,354, total discharges at 35,30,060 and death toll at 64,760.

Domestic ratings agency ICRA said that fashion retailers' revenue will reach pre-pandemic levels by FY23. It further said that the industry is set to show a revenue growth of 23-25% on a low base in 2021-22 but it will not be sufficient to get back to the pre-COVID-19 levels. It added that the surge in COVID-19 cases hit the industry.

The 'corona curfew' imposed in Madhya Pradesh's Bhopal to tackle the surge in COVID-19 cases has been extended till 6 am on May 3, an official said on Sunday. The curfew has also been extended in Berasia town, an order by Collector Avinash Lavania said. Essential services will be exempted from the curfew, officials said.

Congress leader Rahul Gandhi alleged that the government was hiding the truth about the pandemic and under-reporting deaths due to the disease. "Shroud the truth. Deny oxygen shortage. Under-report deaths. Government of India (GOI) is doing everything...to save his fake image," tweeted Rahul. He shared the front page of 'The New York Times' showing a picture of cremations in India.

Actress-filmmaker Pooja Bhatt talked about the impact of OTT platforms and said, "I?m glad that the OTT platforms are having a really genuine impact on people." She added that one must accept the current situation because of COVID-19 and make the most out of it. "You...get more eyeballs (for OTT releases) than when films release in theatres," Pooja stated.

The Serum Institute of India (SII) and its CEO Adar Poonawalla have assured Maharashtra CM Uddhav Thackeray of "maximum support" in vaccinating the people in the state at the earliest, Chief Minister's Office (CMO) said on Saturday. Maharashtra is the worst-hit state in the country with a total of 6,96,298 active COVID-19 cases, according to the Union Health Ministry.

More than 100 crore doses of coronavirus vaccines have been administered across the world, according to an AFP tally. High-income countries, home to 16% of the world's population, have administered 47% of vaccine doses, the tally showed. By contrast, low-income countries account for just 0.2% of shots so far, mainly using doses delivered through the COVAX programme.

Maharashtra minister Nawab Malik on Sunday announced that the state government will vaccinate all its citizens against coronavirus for free. The announcement comes days ahead of India opening the COVID-19 vaccination drive for all aged above 18 from May 1. Maharashtra is the worst-hit state in terms of coronavirus cases.

The Himachal Pradesh government on Sunday imposed a night curfew in four of its districts- Kangra, Una, Solan and Sirmaur- from April 27 to May 10 in view of rising coronavirus cases. The restrictions will be effective from 10 pm to 5 am daily during the period. Visitors and state's residents must present COVID-19 negative reports before entering the state.

Delhi High Court on Monday sought the Centre's response on a plea to include people suffering from mental illness in the list of specified comorbidities to get them COVID-19 vaccine on a priority basis. The PIL also sought directions for authorities to frame policy to provide vaccination to homeless mentally-ill persons. The second phase of vaccination began on March 1.

Pictures of people coming outdoors to jog and exercise in Maharashtra's Nagpur amid complete lockdown in the city have surfaced online. The authorities had announced a complete lockdown in Nagpur City Police Commissionerate area from March 15 to 21 in the wake of rising COVID-19 cases. Nagpur Guardian Minister Nitin Raut had said that the essential services will continue.

Despite the recent surge in COVID-19 cases in Maharashtra, a huge crowd was seen at Mumbai's Dadar Market on Monday morning. This comes at a time when Nagpur has imposed a week-long lockdown, starting Monday and there is night curfew in Latur district. On Sunday, Maharashtra reported 16,620 fresh COVID-19 cases out of which Mumbai had 1,962 cases.

Microsoft could receive nearly a quarter of COVID-19 relief funds allocated towards US cybersecurity defenders, Reuters reported. In a draft plan by US Cybersecurity and Infrastructure Security Agency, more than $150 million of the $650 million funding is allocated for a "secure cloud platform", the report added. This comes after two major cyber attacks leveraged weaknesses in Microsoft products.

In wake of rising COVID-19 cases, the Punjab School Education Board (PSEB) on Monday postponed board exams of classes 10 and 12. While class 10 exams will now start from May 4, class 12 exams will begin from April 20 onwards. The exams were to earlier begin on April 9 and March 22 for classes 10 and 12 respectively.

BMC has directed all of its wards to counsel COVID-19 patients living in smaller flats, and also larger families to opt for institutional quarantine rather than home isolation to protect their family members. This comes as Mumbai reported 1,962 cases on Sunday. "We are prepared to handle over 3,000 new cases daily," BMC Additional Commissioner (Western Suburbs) Suresh Kakani said.

Delhi Health Minister Satyendar Jain on Monday said the COVID-19 pandemic situation in the national capital is "under control" as long as the positivity rate is below 1%. Amid a spike in daily COVID-19 cases in the city, Jain told reporters that 407 cases were reported on Sunday and the positivity rate was 0.60%, which is much below the 1%-mark.

The Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) on Monday booked actor Gauahar Khan for allegedly going out for a film shoot despite testing positive for COVID-19. Sharing the FIR on its Twitter handle, BMC wrote, "The rules apply to all alike and we urge citizens to follow all guidelines and help the city beat the virus.?

Congress leader Rahul Gandhi on Monday urged people to wear masks and follow all precautions, amid the continuous increase in COVID-19 cases in the country. "As warned earlier, COVID-19 continues to be a big threat. Please keep the guards up, wear masks and follow all precautions," Gandhi tweeted along with a media report claiming 33% spike in weekly COVID-19 cases.

Police personnel have been deployed across Maharashtra's Nagpur as the city entered into a week-long complete lockdown from today. Police Commissioner Amitesh Kumar said patrolling is being done "across the city". "Action is being taken against those who're out on streets unnecessarily or violating COVID-19 norms," he added. Earlier in the day, people were seen jogging and exercising outdoors.

Dutch Police on Sunday used batons and a water cannon to disperse people gathered to protest against the government and its tough coronavirus lockdown on the eve of the general election. Several arrests were made as the police carried out their action against the protesters. The Netherlands has reported more than 11.72 lakh coronavirus cases and over 16,000 COVID-19 deaths.

Actress Corinne Masiero stripped naked on the stage of C?sar Awards, France's equivalent of the Oscars, to protest against the closure of theatres and cinemas during the coronavirus pandemic. The actress appeared on stage in a donkey outfit and a blood-stained dress, wearing tampons as earrings. As she stripped naked, a message on her body read, "No culture no future".

Dehradun District Magistrate (DM) on Saturday ordered complete lockdown in Galway Cottage and St George's School, Barlow Ganj areas in Mussoorie, ANI reported. The DM said all shops and offices will remain shut and sale of essential items will be arranged by the administration. Only one person from a family will be allowed to step out for purchasing essential items.

India has reported 25,320 new COVID-19 cases in the last 24 hours which is the highest number of cases reported in a day in 2021. The country reported 161 deaths in the last 24 hours, taking the COVID-19 death toll to 1,58,607. The total COVID-19 cases in the country stand at 1,13,59,048, while the active cases stand at 2,10,544.

India has nearly administered three crore cumulative vaccination doses with a total of 2,97,38,409 through 5,10,400 sessions, as per the provisional report on Sunday, said the Union Health Ministry. Eight states and Union Territories are displaying an upward trajectory in daily new cases. India's total active caseload stands at 2.10 lakh (2,10,544) as of Sunday.

A petition has been filed in the Supreme Court seeking the Centre to issue guidelines to prevent the chances of fake COVID-19 vaccines. "The government has to run the awareness program for the safety of the citizens against the danger of counterfeit vaccination of the virus and to regulate and ensure the equitable distribution of the vaccine," the plea said.

Ireland on Sunday temporarily suspended the Oxford-AstraZeneca COVID-19 vaccine as a precautionary measure after reports of blood clots among some people who received it. Earlier, several European countries had suspended the use of the vaccine for the same reason. AstraZeneca's vaccine accounts for nearly 20% of the nearly 5.9 lakh doses administered in Ireland, according to government data.

Russian Police detained about 200 people at a meeting of independent and opposition politicians in Moscow, the Interior Ministry said. The forum was a gathering of municipal deputies from across the country, the event's organiser said. The police claimed that the meeting, organised by an "undesirable" organisation, was stopped and people were detained for not following anti-coronavirus measures.

The district administration in Maharashtra's Latur on Sunday imposed a night curfew amid a surge in COVID-19 cases. The curfew will remain in place between 8 pm and 5 am in the district and only emergency services will be allowed to function during this period. All the weekly markets will remain shut till March 31.

Maharashtra recorded 16,620 new COVID-19 cases in the last 24 hours in the state's biggest daily spike of cases so far this year, official figures showed on Sunday. The latest spike has taken the state's total case tally to 23,14,413. Maharashtra's COVID-19 death toll increased by 50 to 52,861 in the last 24 hours.

Madhya Pradesh government on Sunday announced that the passengers coming from Maharashtra to the state will have to undergo thermal screening and seven days of mandatory quarantine. The administrations of Bhopal, Indore and 12 other districts have been instructed to exercise extra caution, the state government said. MP on Sunday reported 743 new COVID-19 cases, the state health officials said.

Mumbai on Sunday recorded 1,962 new COVID-19 cases, reportedly the highest single-day spike since mid-October, the Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) said. With this, the total number of COVID-19 cases in the city has reached 3,43,947. Meanwhile, over 16,000 new COVID-19 cases and 50 deaths were reported in Maharashtra in the last 24 hours.

Delhi reported 407 new COVID-19 cases in the last 24 hours, continuing the streak of daily cases above the 400-mark for the fourth consecutive day. The city registered 350 recoveries and two deaths due to the coronavirus in the last 24 hours, according to the health bulletin. The COVID-19 positivity rate remained at 0.6%, which was the same on Saturday.

Maharashtra CM Uddhav Thackeray, while interacting with the representatives of hotel and restaurant associations, and shopping centre groups, warned of imposing a "strict lockdown" in the state. He ordered hotels and restaurants to follow all necessary COVID-19 protocols in their premises. However, he said his government was not in favour of a lockdown and urged people to cooperate.

British Airways CEO Sean Doyle has called on UK government to allow travel without restrictions for coronavirus vaccinated people and people with negative test results. He added he wants UK to give its backing to apps that can be used to verify test results and vaccination status. Holidays won't be allowed until May 17 at the earliest, UK government said.

A government-aided Girls Higher Secondary School at Ammapettai village near Tamil Nadu's Thanjavur has emerged as the new COVID-19 cluster with over 56 students and a teacher testing positive for the virus. The Health Department has disinfected the entire area, and the school has been shut for 14 days. The students who have been tested positive come from 24 villages.

Chhattisgarh Health Minister TS Singh Deo said that as DCGI has "upgraded Covaxin out of its clinical trials", state government is "seriously considering" allowing it for those who want it though its phase-III clinical trial results haven't yet been published. "As soon as I recover from COVID-19 and am eligible for vaccination, I'll take my first Covaxin shot," he added.

More than 400 workers at a Tesla plant in California tested positive for COVID-19 between May and December 2020, media reports said citing the website 'PlainSite'. The data provides the "first glimpse" into COVID-19 cases at Tesla, which had reopened the plant in May, in defiance of public health officials' guidelines, The New York Times reported.

Karnataka Chief Minister BS Yediyurappa will hold a meeting with state's officials and health experts on Monday over rising cases of COVID-19 in recent days, said the CM's office. The meeting would be held at 5 pm in the Vidhana Soudha. The number of daily COVID-19 cases crossed the 900-mark on Saturday for the first time since January 22.

The BBMP is increasing testing and the number of vaccination centres for tackling the rising COVID-19 cases in Bengaluru. According to the reports, mobile labs would be deployed to conduct RT-PCR and RAT tests at crowded places, like malls, railway stations, bus stations and markets. A target of 40,000 RT-PCR tests per day has been set for Bengaluru Urban district.

The small Portuguese island of Corvo which is home to around 400 people has vaccinated most of its population against COVID-19 and will soon reach herd immunity, according to its only doctor. "There's an atmosphere of celebration in Corvo," Doctor Antonio Salgado said. He said the majority of residents were likely to become immune by the end of the month.

Amid rising COVID-19 cases in the state, Karnataka CM BS Yediyurappa on Sunday appealed to the people to cooperate with the government if they didn't want another lockdown. "If people cooperate, I'm confident that without lockdown we can control," he said. Yediyurappa has called a meeting of experts and officials to discuss the COVID-19 situation in the state on Monday.

German companies are estimated to have saved nearly ?50 billion ($60 billion) due to the lack of business travel in 2020 owing to the COVID-19 pandemic, German newspaper Welt am Sonntag reported. The year 2020 also saw a nearly 90% decline in expenditure on business trips from 2019, as per Hans-Ingo Biehl, the CEO of the German Business Travel Association.

A 35-year-old singer attempted to take his life in Nagpur on Saturday by slashing his wrists and live-streamed the act on Facebook. As per police, the singer attempted suicide due to financial problems he faced because of the lockdown amid coronavirus pandemic. He was saved by friends who saw the video in time and rushed him to hospital, police added.

The Centre has approved 14 hospitals that will serve as COVID-19 vaccination centres in Pune city and Pimpri-Chinchwad, officials said. The non-empanelled hospitals with a capacity of 100-200 beds each will increase the vaccination by at least 4,000 beneficiaries per day, they added. "We're trying to increase vaccination centres given the high number of COVID-19 cases," the District Collector said.

Madhya Pradesh Chief Minister Shivraj Singh Chouhan on Sunday asked the Union Health Minister Dr Harsh Vardhan for over 62 lakh more first doses of the COVID-19 vaccine. "We need 81 lakh first doses of the vaccine and we have received 18,84,000 against it," he said. Chouhan also stated the Health Minister has promised to provide the required shots soon.

Bihar government has said it'd seek an explanation from All India Institute of Medical Sciences, Patna, for charging general indoor patients ?1,500 for RT-PCR COVID-19 tests. AIIMS Patna was charging patients despite a government order. Institute's Director Dr Prabhat Kumar Singh said it was due to a "software glitch", adding, "I have issued instructions to make the test free."

Italian PM Mario Draghi has warned of a "new wave" of coronavirus outbreak in the country and announced a nationwide lockdown during Easter from April 3 to 5. Shops, restaurants and schools across most of Italy will be closed from Monday, the government said. The country has reported over 1,00,000 coronavirus-related deaths, the second-highest tally in Europe after the UK.

US National Security Advisor Jake Sullivan announced that US, Australia, India and Japan have agreed to deliver up to a billion coronavirus vaccine doses to Indo-Pacific region by end of 2022. The announcement came after the first Quad summit on Friday. He added that it'll be done using "Indian manufacturing, US technology, Japanese and American financing and Australian logistics capability".

US Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) said that it has administered over 10 crore doses of COVID-19 vaccines as of Friday and distributed over 13.3 crore doses. Earlier, President Joe Biden said that America will make all adults eligible for the coronavirus vaccine by May 1. The US is the worst coronavirus-hit country with over 2.9 crore cases.

The Centre on Saturday listed 18 states and UTs that haven't reported any death due to COVID-19 in India in the last 24 hours. They include Rajasthan, Chandigarh, Himachal Pradesh, Odisha, Jharkhand, Puducherry, Assam, Lakshadweep, Ladakh, Dadra and Nagar Haveli and Daman and Diu, Sikkim, Nagaland, Tripura, Manipur, Meghalaya, Andaman and Nicobar Islands, Mizoram and Arunachal Pradesh.

BSP chief Mayawati was on Saturday administered the first dose of COVID-19 vaccine at a private hospital in Lucknow. Urging everyone to take the vaccine, Mayawati said, "I appeal to the Central and state governments to provide free vaccine to the poor." The vaccination drive across India began on January 16, 2021 and the second phase began on March 1.

Actress Shikha Talsania, who's shooting for a web show in Gurugram, shared her experience of working amid the coronavirus pandemic. She said, "This is also a great way to work, where everybody is now being super hygienic and careful." Shikha, who's living in a bio bubble, added, "I miss the sights and sounds [of the city], and the live gigs."

Brazil has surpassed India to report the second-highest confirmed COVID-19 cases globally. Over the past 24 hours, Brazil reported 85,663 new COVID-19 cases, taking the total number of cases to 1,13,63,380. However, India, which previously came second, has recorded 1,13,33,728 confirmed COVID-19 cases. Brazil's death toll due to COVID-19 reached 2,75,105, with 2,216 deaths in the last 24 hours.

Amid rising COVID-19 cases in Maharashtra, including Mumbai, the Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) reached out to its citizens on Saturday and tweeted, "Let's not allow the virus get the better of Mumbai." BMC added, "It is in our hands to decide which way the graph goes." Restrictions have been imposed in various districts of Maharashtra, including Nagpur, Thane and Pune.

The Directorate General of Civil Aviation (DGCA) on Saturday said passengers who refuse to wear face masks and violate COVID-19 protocols on a flight despite repeated warnings may be treated as 'unruly passengers'. Action may be taken against such passengers by the concerned airlines. Passengers may be deboarded for not wearing masks properly, DGCA has said.

Union Petroleum Minister Dharmendra Pradhan on Saturday said that both the Centre and states levy taxes on fuels as they are 'resources' that can help in reviving the economy, especially after COVID-19. "Due to (the) rise in international fuel prices, India also had to increase fuel prices but it's temporary, gradually they will be brought down," he added.

Amazon has been ordered to shut its Brampton facility in southern Ontario over the significant rise in COVID-19 cases within the facility, the local health authority said. The workers at the facility have been asked to self-isolate for 14 days. "This was a difficult decision but a necessary one," the region's medical officer of health said.

Bitcoin surpassed $59,000 to hit a new record high on Saturday amid optimism in the financial markets after US President Joe Biden signed a $1.9 trillion COVID-19 relief package. The world's largest cryptocurrency climbed to as much as $59,837, as per CoinMarketCap data. Bitcoin has surged around 1,000% over the past year and has a market value of $1.1 trillion.

Ratan Tata, the Chairman Emeritus of Tata Sons, received his first dose of the COVID-19 vaccine on Saturday. "Very thankful...It was effortless and painless. I truly hope everyone can be immunised and protected soon," the 83-year-old wrote on Twitter. India began inoculating those above 60 years of age from March 1 under the second phase of its vaccination drive.

US International Development Finance Corporation has said that it'll provide financial assistance to India's Biological E to support its efforts to produce at least 100 crore COVID-19 vaccine doses by end of 2022. The announcement came during the Quad summit. The leaders of Japan, Australia, India and the US launched an initiative to boost vaccine production for the Indo-Pacific region.

Delhi Health Minister Satyendar Jain on Friday said that the city's COVID-19 positivity rate is less than 1%, which is "much lower" than that of Kerala and Maharashtra. "Positivity rate in November was about 15%. It came down to less than 5% and then to less than 1%, and for last two months, it has remained below 1%," he added.

Indian Railways has surpassed freight loading numbers of the previous fiscal year despite COVID-19 pandemic. As per government data, Railways achieved a cumulative freight loading of 1145.68 million tonnes (mt) in 2020-21, as of March 11, as compared to 1145.61 mt recorded during the same period in 2019-20. The loading of iron and steel, cement, and other goods has increased.

With Pimpri-Chinchwad Municipal Corporation (PCMC) reporting over 800 new COVID-19 cases on Friday, Additional Health and Medical Officer Pavan Salve said that they are focused on setting up of more micro-containment zones and sealing flat/floor as one/two cases are detected there. Officials stated that number of micro-containment zones has gone beyond 700 from early this week's 600.

Amid rise in number of COVID-19 cases across India and lockdowns in some districts, NITI Aayog (Health) member Dr VK Paul said, "Would like to caution Delhi-NCR, Gurugram, part of Gautam Buddha Nagar and Ghaziabad to some extent." He added that these areas are "seeing slight rise in number of cases" and that Maharashtra isn't the single reason for concern.

The Health Ministry has stated that seven states accounted for nearly 88% of the new cases reported in India on Saturday. Maharashtra recorded the highest number with 15,817 cases. This was followed by Kerala (1,780), Punjab (1,408), Karnataka (833), Gujarat (715), Tamil Nadu (670) and Madhya Pradesh (603). India on Saturday reported 24,882 cases, its highest single-day rise this year.

Health Minister Dr Harsh Vardhan on Friday said that COVID-19 cases have increased in six states due to "people's carelessness". "India has lowest fatality rate and now vaccine is here but it isn't the time to be negligent regarding COVID-19 appropriate behaviour," he added. Notably, Punjab, Tamil Nadu, Gujarat, Karnataka, Kerala and Maharashtra have been reporting rise in daily cases.

Ahead of a seven-day complete lockdown in Maharashtra's Nagpur from March 15 due to rising COVID-19 cases, a large number of people were seen shopping without maintaining social distancing in the city's Sitabuldi Main Road and Cotton Market areas. Notably, Nagpur Guardian Minister Nitin Raut on Thursday announced the lockdown and said that essential services will continue to be available.

The BBMP on Friday declared the Government Medical and Engineering Boys College Hostel in Bengaluru's Vidyapeetha as a COVID-19 cluster after eight students tested positive for the virus. After the first positive case was reported on March 8, BBMP officials identified 158 primary contacts, who were tested on March 9 and 10, BBMP Commissioner N Manjunatha Prasad said.

India reported 24,882 new COVID-19 cases and 140 deaths in the last 24 hours, as per the Health Ministry. The active cases have crossed the 2 lakh-mark and reached 2,02,022 after 53 days. The total caseload in India stands at 1,13,33,728 and the death toll at 1,58,446. Following the discharge of 19,957 COVID-19 patients, total recoveries stand at 1,09,73,260.

The Odisha government on Friday announced waiver of hostel fees of 17,012 boarders in state-run technical universities, engineering colleges and polytechnic institutes for the period of April-December 2020, Skill Development and Technical Education Department said in a statement. The decision was taken as hostels remained closed due to COVID-19, the statement added.

The Directorate General of Civil Aviation (DGCA) has issued a new order on strict compliance of COVID-19 protocols during air travel. "Passengers shall wear masks and maintain social distancing at all times during air travel," the order read." "If a passenger does not adhere to wearing of mask properly even after repeated warning, he/she should be de-boarded," the order stated.

WHO has urged nations to closely monitor adverse health effects related to the use of any vaccine. "WHO encourages all countries to...carefully monitor for any adverse events...and to report any serious cases...to global AEFI surveillance database," a WHO spokesperson said. This comes as several EU nations halted AstraZeneca COVID-19 jab use after reports of blood clots among vaccinated people.

The White House said that it hasn't imposed any rules to prohibit the export of coronavirus vaccines. This comes after several reports stated that US told the European Union that it shouldn't expect AstraZeneca vaccine shipments anytime soon. "All vaccine manufacturers...are free to export their products while also fulfilling the terms of their contracts with the US government," it added.

HDFC Bank on Friday announced that it will reimburse the COVID-19 vaccination cost for over 1 lakh employees and their immediate family members. Sunil Mittal-led Bharti Airtel also announced that it's looking at partnering with health care providers to vaccinate its employees and their dependents. Several firms like ICICI Bank, Reliance Industries and Accenture announced similar measures earlier.

US President Joe Biden said on Thursday that the deaths in US due to coronavirus are more than in "World War I, World War II, Vietnam War and 9/11 combined". Biden gave the comment during his first prime time address to mark the one-year anniversary of coronavirus shutdowns in US. "We all lost something- a collective suffering," Biden added.

US President Joe Biden announced on Thursday that he'll direct "all states, tribes, and territories to make all adults" eligible for coronavirus vaccine "no later than May 1". "That doesn't mean everyone's going to have...shot immediately, but...you'll be able to get in line beginning May 1," he said. The inoculation will allow for small gatherings by July 4, Biden added.

All remaining Coronavirus restrictions have been lifted from New Zealand's largest city Auckland from midday today after no locally transmitted cases were reported for two weeks, PM Jacinda Ardern said. The city has been moved to Alert Level 1. "I know everyone in Auckland will be looking forward to a weekend with fewer restrictions," Ardern added.

Actor Ashish Vidyarthi took to Twitter on Friday to share that he has tested positive for coronavirus. The 58-year-old actor also shared a video wherein he informed that he would be checking himself into a hospital in Delhi. "This is one positive I didn't want...whoever has come in touch with me, please get yourself tested," he wrote alongside the video.

As many as 90% of people in Mumbai who tested positive for COVID-19 in January and February 2021 were residents of high-rise buildings while the remaining 10% were from slums and chawls, BMC said. The situation has changed to some extent this month as the number of cases from slums are also going up, officials said.

The preliminary examination of the Maharashtra Public Service Commission (MPSC), which was earlier scheduled for March 14, will now be held on March 21, the commission announced on Friday. This came a day after students protested in Pune and many other parts of the state over repeated postponement of the exam. MPSC postponed the exam on Thursday citing COVID-19.

The World Health Organization (WHO) on Friday said there was no reason to stop using Oxford-AstraZeneca's COVID-19 vaccine after several European countries suspended its rollout over blood clot fears. It said no causal link has been established between the vaccine and clotting. "AstraZeneca is an excellent vaccine," said WHO spokeswoman Margaret Harris, adding that its use should continue.

The Centre has listed 11 states and Union Territories that have less than 30,000 confirmed coronavirus cases in the country. Lakshadweep with 569 cases has the least number of cases. This is followed by Dadra and Nagar Haveli and Daman and Diu, Mizoram, Andaman and Nicobar Islands, Sikkim, Ladakh, Nagaland, Meghalaya, Arunachal Pradesh, Chandigarh and Manipur.

Thane Zilla Parishad started its COVID-19 vaccination process at 28 health centres located within five different talukas of Thane district. "These centres located in five different talukas include, Murabd, Shahapur, Kalyan, Ambarnath and Bhiwandi," an official said. "Besides these 28 centres...two to three centres will be made functional in?[two] Thane [villages],? the official added.

The WHO scientists, who travelled to China to probe the COVID-19 pandemic's origins, have said there's no evidence that COVID-19 leaked from a Chinese laboratory in Wuhan. They said, instead, the pandemic may've been caused by unfettered wildlife trade in China. The scientists found links between Wuhan's live-animal market, where people first fell ill, and regions where bats had viruses.

Karnataka Chief Minister BS Yediyurappa on Friday received his first dose of COVID-19 vaccine at Victoria Hospital in Bengaluru. "Today I took the first dose of Made-in-India COVID-19 vaccine at Bangalore Medical College. I urge all those eligible to register themselves and get the...[vaccine] at the earliest," Yediyurappa said. The second phase of the vaccination drive began on March 1.

The Gujarat Cricket Association has announced that only 50% of the 1.32 lakh capacity of the Narendra Modi Stadium in Ahmedabad will be used for the five-match T20I series between India and England due to the COVID-19 pandemic. All five T20Is are to be played at the venue with the first match set to be played today.

The closure of schools and colleges in Maharashtra's Pune has been extended till March 31, amid the COVID-19 case surge in the state. MPSC, UPSC coaching classes and libraries can, however, function at 50% capacity. The night curfew that was imposed earlier will remain in place in the city from 11 pm to 6 am.

Actor Manoj Bajpayee has tested positive for COVID-19 and the shoot of his film 'Despatch' has been halted, his publicist said. "He tested COVID-19 positive after his director (was) infected with it...The actor is on medication and recovering well. He is in self-quarantine at home and following all precautions," the statement added.

Iran will receive five lakh doses of coronavirus vaccine COVAXIN from India, of which 1.25 lakh doses have already been received by the country. "A tradition of exchanges continues. Made in India vaccines arrive in Iran," External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar tweeted on Thursday. Iran's health ministry spokesperson Kianush Jahanpur said that it'll receive 3.75 lakh doses next week.

Denmark, Norway and Iceland temporarily suspended Oxford-AstraZeneca COVID-19 vaccine use after reports of blood clots among some people who received it. Italy, Austria, Estonia, Latvia, Lithuania, Luxembourg and Romania stopped using certain batches of the drug as a precautionary measure. The EU's medicine regulator said there's no indication the vaccine is linked to an increased blood clot risk.

Amid increasing COVID-19 cases, a ?night curfew has been imposed in Punjab's Patiala and Ludhiana districts from March 12 between 11 pm and 5 am. Essential services, government officials on duty and emergency medical services are exempted, authorities said. Earlier, night curfew was imposed in Jalandhar, SBS Nagar, Hoshiarpur and Kapurthala.

Twenty-one trainees at Central Public Works Department's (CPWD) national academy in Ghaziabad have tested coronavirus positive over the past three days, officials said on Thursday. One person was shifted to hospital, another was allowed home isolation and rest are quarantined in hostel, Ghaziabad CMO Dr NK Gupta said. "The academy is now a containment zone for 14 days," he added.

India reported 23,285 new COVID-19 cases and 117 deaths in the last 24 hours, according to the Union Health Ministry. Following the discharge of 15,157 COVID-19 patients, the active cases in India now stand at 1,97,237. The total caseload stands at 1,13,08,846 and the death toll has reached 1,58,306. A total of 2,61,64,920 people have been vaccinated so far.

The Federation of Indian Chambers of Commerce and Industry (FICCI) has asked the Health Ministry to recognise the kirana community and retail employees as 'frontline workers'. They should be prioritised in the initial phase of COVID-19 vaccination drive, FICCI said. "They've been serving the nation tirelessly despite being the most vulnerable to...risk of infection," the chamber added in a letter.

Thailand has delayed the rollout of the Oxford-AstraZeneca coronavirus vaccine over reports of blood clots in some European nations, the Health Ministry said. Thailand's PM Prayut Chan-o-cha and members of his Cabinet also cancelled their plan to receive AstraZeneca vaccine shots on Friday. The delay comes after some countries, including Denmark and Norway, suspended the use of the vaccine.

WHO on Friday listed Johnson & Johnson COVID-19 vaccine for emergency use in all countries. "Today, WHO gave emergency use listing to Johnson & Johnson's #COVID19 vaccine, making it...fourth vaccine to receive WHO's approval. Emergency use listing is the green light for a vaccine to be procured and rolled out by #COVAX," WHO tweeted while quoting Director-General Tedros Adhanom Ghebreyesus.

Maharashtra has recorded 15,817 new COVID-19 cases in the last 24 hours in the biggest one-day spike in coronavirus cases in the state in 2021. The state also recorded 56 deaths and 11,344 COVID-19 recoveries on Friday. The last biggest single-day COVID-19 spike of the year in Maharashtra was recorded on Thursday when the state reported 14,317 cases.

Bitcoin prices crossed $57,000-mark for the first time in over two weeks on Thursday after the US House of Representatives passed a COVID-19 relief package worth $1.9 trillion, including $1,400 stimulus checks. The world's largest cryptocurrency had hit a record high of $58,350 on February 21 before witnessing a slump. Bitcoin currently has a market value of over $1 trillion.

General Electric CEO Larry Culp received a $73.2 million compensation in 2020 despite waiving most of his salary and all of his bonus. Of this, around $72.1 million was in the form of stock awards that he can cash in after reaching certain targets in the future. Culp earned a salary of $650,000 before disavowing his pay due to COVID-19.

Akshay Kumar and Katrina Kaif-starrer 'Sooryavanshi' will release in theatres on April 30, according to reports. The film, which was originally scheduled to release on March 24, 2020, was delayed multiple times due to the coronavirus pandemic. Directed by Rohit Shetty, the action-thriller film will also feature Gulshan Grover, Jackie Shroff, Sikandar Kher and Jaaved Jaaferi.

Chinese Premier Li Keqiang said the country would continue to work with the WHO to find the origins of COVID-19. He added that China had taken an "open", "transparent" approach and supported the WHO mission during their origin probe in Wuhan in January. The virus origin tracing is a "complex scientific matter" and requires cooperation among countries, Keqiang further said.

Hollywood actress Susan Sarandon recently admitted that she would date anyone who has received the coronavirus vaccination. "I don't care if it's a man or a woman...I'm open to all ages, all colours. And...for me, those things are just details...what I'm interested in is someone who wants to be adventuresome," she said on Dear Media's 'Divorced Not Dead' podcast.

Billboards have come up in Canada's Greater Toronto area thanking Prime Minister Narendra Modi and India for providing COVID-19 vaccines to the country. Canada received five lakh doses of Covishield vaccine from Serum Institute of India last week. "We look forward to future collaboration," Anita Anand, Canadian Minister of Public Services and Procurement, had said.

The Ministry of Health and Family Welfare has said that Maharashtra, Kerala, Punjab, Karnataka, Gujarat and Tamil Nadu cumulatively account for nearly 86% of the new cases reported in the past 24 hours. As many as 22,854 people tested positive for COVID-19 in the last 24 hours. This is the highest single-day rise in new infections reported in 2021.

India has reported 22,854 new COVID-19 cases in the last 24 hours, which is the highest number of cases reported in a day since December last year. The country reported 126 deaths in this period, taking the total number of deaths to 1,58,189. The total number of cases stands at 1,12,85,561, while the number of active cases stands at 1,89,226.

Karnataka Health Department on Wednesday confirmed the first case of the South African COVID-19 strain in the state. Further, a total of 29 people have tested positive for the UK strain in Karnataka so far, according to the Health Department. Karnataka reported 760 new COVID-19 cases and six fatalities on Wednesday, taking the total number of cases to 9.56 lakh.

US President Joe Biden said America would share COVID-19 vaccines with other countries if it has a surplus. "We're going to start off [by] making sure Americans are taken care of first but...then...try to help the rest of the world," he added. Biden made these remarks while announcing that US plans to purchase 10 crore more Johnson & Johnson vaccines.

Himansh Kohli, who took the coronavirus vaccine in Dubai, said, "I won't deny that in...beginning, I was hesitant." "Such decisions take time...I don't think one should hurry...So, I took my time and gained trust as I started reading about it," he said, adding, "The virus is much worse...At least, vaccine is providing us protection, so why not go for it?"

The Centre on Thursday said Bharat Biotech's indigenously developed Covaxin is out of the "clinical trial mode" and that it has now been granted the regular restricted emergency use authorisation. "Both the Covid-19 vaccines Covaxin and Covishield have the same licensure status...Covaxin has stood the test of time in terms of great safety," NITI Aayog member VK Paul said.

The certificates issued against COVID-19 vaccination in the poll-bound West Bengal, Tamil Nadu, Assam, Kerala and Puducherry will no longer carry PM Narendra Modi's photo. The decision has been taken by the Health Ministry after EC's order. TMC said the PM was using his position and power to steal the credits of medical and paramedical staff serving during the pandemic.

Rajya Sabha Deputy Chairman Harivansh on Thursday received the first dose of the COVID-19 vaccine at AllMS, New Delhi. "This is an unprecedented achievement of the scientists of India. The research that took place under PM Narendra Modi's leadership is remarkable," he said. He urged people to get vaccinated, saying there are no side-effects of the vaccine.

Union Health Secretary Rajesh Bhushan on Thursday said that the price of Covid-19 vaccines, which includes Serum Institute of India's Covishield and Bharat Biotech's Covaxin, has been renegotiated. "We have renegotiated the price which is significantly lower than ?200 per dose," the secretary said, without disclosing the new price of the vaccines.

Pakistan will receive 45 million doses of the coronavirus vaccine manufactured by India under the Global Alliance for Vaccines and Immunisation (GAVI), reports said. Pakistan would receive its first batch of the COVID-19 vaccines made by the Serum Institute of India (SII) by mid-March and the rest of it by June, reports added.

Observing that the government was exporting COVID-19 vaccines to "not-so-friendly countries", the Delhi High Court on Wednesday told the Centre that it needs to earn goodwill within the country first and then earn it outside. The court said this move "will deprive the Indian population". This comes amid reports claiming that Pakistan will receive 45 million vaccine doses from India.

Maharashtra CM Uddhav Thackeray on Thursday received the first shot of COVID-19 vaccine. Thackeray got himself vaccinated against the novel coronavirus disease under the second phase of the nationwide COVID-19 vaccination drive. Centre has, starting March 1, expanded the vaccination drive to include people above the age of 60 and those aged 45 or above and having specified co-morbidities.

Neetu Kapoor, speaking about the time she battled COVID-19, told Mid-Day, "At home, my staff...[left] my...food outside. I was on the floor below, while they were upstairs." "They told me they'd rather get COVID-19 than leave me alone. They never took off their masks," she added. Neetu further said there were around four or five people, but none got infected.

PM Narendra Modi on Thursday announced that his mother Heeraben Modi has received the first dose of coronavirus vaccine. "I urge everyone to help and motivate people around you who are eligible to take the vaccine," he wrote. PM Modi took the first dose of vaccine on March 1, the beginning of the second phase of the vaccination drive.

Cambodia confirmed its first death from coronavirus since the pandemic began after a 50-year-old man died of coronavirus on Thursday. Cambodia has confirmed 1,163 coronavirus cases since March 2020, but it's battling a new local outbreak that has infected hundreds of people. The outbreak was traced to a foreign resident who broke quarantine and went to a nightclub in February.

Around 3,000 nurses have died from coronavirus across 60 countries since the start of the pandemic, the International Council of Nurses said. It warned the pandemic "could trigger a mass exodus from the profession" in the second half of 2021 as stress had led millions of them to consider quitting. It said nurses had gone through "mass traumatisation" amid coronavirus.

The Centre on Thursday raised concerns over the surge in coronavirus cases in Maharashtra, which saw over 13,600 cases on Wednesday. "We're very worried about Maharashtra. This is a serious matter," Dr VK Paul, Member (Health), NITI Aayog, said. "This has two lessons - don't take the virus for granted and we need to follow COVID-19 appropriate behaviour," he added.

S&P Global Ratings on Thursday said that continuing recovery of global economy will prevent a debt crisis in the near future. It further said that the coronavirus pandemic exacerbated the global debt-to-GDP, which has been rising for many years. It added that the real global GDP growth is forecast at 5% in 2021 and 4% in 2022.

Denmark has temporarily stopped usage of the Oxford-AstraZeneca COVID-19 vaccine after several cases of blood clots among vaccinated people, the Danish health authority said on Thursday. Denmark's Health Minister Magnus Heunicke tweeted that it is not yet clear whether the clots were linked to the vaccine, adding, "It needs to be thoroughly investigated."

Indian football team captain Sunil Chhetri on Thursday said that he has tested positive for coronavirus. "I feel fine as I continue my recovery from the virus and should be back on a football pitch soon. No better time to keep reminding everyone to continue taking all the safety precautions always," he tweeted.

In the wake of rising COVID-19 cases, the authorities on Thursday announced a complete lockdown in Maharashtra's Nagpur City Police Commissionerate area from March 15 to 21. Nagpur Guardian Minister Nitin Raut said that the essential services will continue. This comes after the Maharashtra government imposed a night curfew in Kalyan Dombivli and Nandurbar and a 'janata curfew' in Jalgaon.

UN Children's Fund (UNICEF) Executive Director Henrietta Fore has urged countries to contribute more money to help poor countries receive free COVID-19 vaccines. UNICEF, which is part of the WHO-led COVAX scheme, still needs around $1 billion for vaccine rollout, Fore added. The COVAX facility aims to deliver at least 2 billion vaccine doses by the end of this year.

West Bengal Governor Jagdeep Dhankhar and his wife Sudesh Dhankhar on Thursday morning received the first dose of the COVID-19 vaccine at Command Hospital in Kolkata. Dhankhar reportedly thanked the doctors, nurses and health workers at Command Hospital after being inoculated. The Governor had visited state CM Mamata Banerjee at SSKM Hospital yesterday, where she was admitted for treatment.

Pfizer has said it will consider making its COVID-19 vaccine outside the US and Europe only after the "pandemic supply phase is over". The company isn't in talks with any other country for additional local manufacturing of this vaccine, it added. Earlier, reports claimed Pfizer told India that it would produce the shot locally if assured of faster regulatory clearance.

Shell CEO Ben van Beurden?s pay package dropped by 42% to $6.93 million in 2020. This comes after the oil company was also pushed to a historic dividend cut and a collapse in profits due to the COVID-19 pandemic. Van Beurden?s total remuneration for 2019 was nearly $11.9 million, which was already a 51% drop from the previous year.

Rolls-Royce CEO Warren East has said that 2020 certainly marked the "low point" and the worst was now behind the company. His comments came after the British engine maker posted a record underlying pre-tax loss of $5.6 billion for 2020 due to COVID-19 pandemic, as against $810 million profit in 2019. The group cut 7,000 jobs over the last year.

Maharashtra Food and Drugs Administration (FDA) said it's working to bring down the cost of Remdesivir 100 mg injection, used for treating critical COVID-19 patients. "Manufacturers are supplying this injection at a cheaper cost of ?800 to ?1300 due to comparatively lesser demands than the initial days. But patients are not getting the benefit of the cheaper prices," FDA added.

At least 11 private hospitals and two public health facilities in Gurugram will extend their COVID-19 vaccination services till 9 pm from the existing slot of 9 am till 5 pm from March 12. "The decision has been taken in the wake of high turnout of prioritised population group for the jab," Gurugram Chief Medical Officer Dr Virender Yadav said.

Mobile majors Ericsson, Nokia, and Sony have confirmed that they will not be taking part in Mobile World Congress (MWC) 2021, which is the world's largest mobile industry event. It's poised to be one of Europe's first in-person conferences to return after COVID-19. "The health of our employees...and partners is of paramount importance to us," Nokia said in a statement.

IT services major Cognizant has announced that it will cover the COVID-19 vaccination cost for all its employees in India, including its contract, support staff, and security personnel. This will cover over 6 lakh people in India, including its over 2 lakh full-time employees and their dependents. Earlier, other IT companies like Accenture, Infosys and Capgemini announced similar measures.

Delhi on Thursday recorded 409 new COVID-19 cases, the highest single-day rise in over two months, according to health department data. The death toll climbed to 10,934 with three more fatalities in the last 24 hours. The total infection tally has risen to 6,42,439, while the number of active cases stands at 2,020.

Actress Alia Bhatt took to Instagram Stories on Thursday to share a health update after her boyfriend, actor Ranbir Kapoor tested COVID-19 positive. "I've tested negative for COVID-19 and after isolating and speaking with my doctors, I am back to work from today," she wrote. "Thank you for all your good wishes! I'm taking care and staying safe," Alia added.

Maharashtra CM Uddhav Thackeray said that the state government cannot easily adopt the decision to impose a lockdown. A decision will be taken after reviewing the situation, CM added. His statement comes in wake increasing number of COVID-19 cases across the state. Meanwhile, 'Janta curfew' will be imposed for three days in Maharashtra's Jalgaon district.

Speaking about her plans of having more babies, American media personality Khloe Kardashian said, "My plan was to have kids closer in age. But with COVID-19...my plan's been a little delayed." "I have so many brothers and sisters. I think it's such a blessing, especially during these times, to have a family member...that you can...rely on," she added.

Most economies are unlikely to return to their pre-pandemic activity levels until 2022 and the global recovery will not be easy, a report by Moody's Investors Service said. "Risks remain more significant for the sectors most vulnerable to restrictions on their normal activities," it said. It added that the credit downturn arising out of COVID-19 will be short-lived.

Hours after the preliminary examination of Maharashtra Public Service Commission was postponed, CM Uddhav Thackeray said the exam will be held in a week's time. "I assure you that postponement isn't for 2-3 months but for a few days," he said. The exam, which was scheduled to be held on March 14, has been postponed due to rising COVID-19 cases.

France on Thursday eased travel restrictions for seven non-EU countries due to the changing pandemic situation. "It'll no longer be necessary to prove a compelling reason for travel to or from Australia, Israel, Japan, New Zealand, Singapore, South Korea and the UK," France's foreign ministry said. However, travellers from these countries will still need to present negative COVID-19 test results.

According to a report by ratings agency CRISIL, the cement industry is expected to have a volume growth of 13% in the next fiscal year. Timely release of funds for key housing and infrastructure projects as announced in the budget will be crucial for the growth, it said. However, it added that resurgence of COVID-19 cases could derail the recovery.

Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj International Airport's (CSMIA) Terminal 1 (T1) has resumed its operations from Wednesday, after remaining shut for nearly a year due to the coronavirus pandemic. CSMIA said that five domestic airlines, including GoAir and Air Asia, will use the terminal. The reopening of the terminal will facilitate social distancing measures and uphold passenger safety, CSMIA added.

A 103-year-old woman received her first dose of the COVID-19 vaccine in Bengaluru on Tuesday. With this, J Kameshwari became the oldest woman in India to have received the COVID-19 vaccine as per available data, said Apollo Hospitals, Bannerghatta Road. On Tuesday, another 103-year-old man named Mahabir Prasad Maheshwari took his first dose of the vaccine in Noida.

India has allowed only limited export of COVID-19 vaccines while according "highest priority to domestic needs", Centre told Delhi High Court. This comes after the High Court observed that the Centre was either donating or selling COVID-19 vaccines to foreign countries instead of vaccinating its own citizens. It is not possible to take a country-specific approach, the government further said.

A day after Thane Municipal Corporation (TMC) announced to impose lockdown in COVID-19 hotspot areas from March 9 to March 31, 2021, the civic body has clarified that there will be no complete restriction on movement. "There will be restrictions only in micro containment zones, apart from that there will not be any lockdown," Deputy Municipal Commissioner said.

India reported 17,921 new COVID-19 cases and 133 deaths in the last 24 hours, as per the health ministry. The total caseload so far has reached 1,12,62,707 and the death toll now stands at 1,58,063. Following the discharge of 20,652 COVID-19 patients, active cases in India stand at 1,84,598. As many as 2,43,67,906 people have been vaccinated so far.

Improved transport connectivity with Bangladesh can bolster India's national income by as much as 8% and Bangladesh's by up to 17%, a World Bank report said. "This is especially true as the region begins its economic recovery from COVID-19," said Junaid Ahmad, World Bank's India Country Director, adding that the sub-region could be an "economic growth pole" in South Asia.

Karan Singh Grover, who tested positive for coronavirus last year, said, "I was very angry with myself when I got the virus." He added, "I often say things that I later regret and I went around saying...I'm...anti-virus and I got the virus...I was like why do you have to say stuff?" Karan further said his recovery from coronavirus was smooth.

Gautam Buddha Nagar district administration has said that data of over 8,000 people each in Noida and Ghaziabad, vaccinated against COVID-19, does not reflect in the CoWIN portal. "We have deployed officers to check details. It's possible that some hospitals may not be entering or updating records and it is a cause for concern," Ghaziabad Chief Medical Officer said.

Maharashtra witnessed another 13,659 new COVID-19 cases and 54 deaths in the last 24 hours, official figures showed on Wednesday. Maharashtra's total cases now stand at 22,52,057, total recoveries at 20,99,207, death toll at 52,610 and active cases at 99,008. Maharashtra had reported 9,927 new COVID-19 cases and 56 deaths on Tuesday.

Pakistan has said that all educational institutions in the country's worst COVID-19-hit cities will be closed for two weeks amid a surge in COVID-19 cases. Education Minister Shafqat Mahmood said, "Educational institutions will remain closed from March 15 to March 28. Half of...students will keep attending classes in other districts." Institutions will be closed in seven cities of Punjab province.

With 370 new COVID-19 cases, Delhi on Wednesday reported the highest single-day count in nearly two months. The city's COVID-19 tally has reached 6,42,030, while the death toll has risen to 10,931 with three more deaths reported in the last 24 hours, the health department said. The active COVID-19 cases in the city rose to 1,900 from 1,812 on Tuesday.

Malayalam actor Mohanlal took to Twitter on Wednesday to share that he has received the first dose of coronavirus vaccine. He shared a picture of himself and wrote, "Took the first shot of COVID-19 vaccine." He added, "I thank GOI (Government of India), companies which are producing the vaccine and...medical fraternity, including hospitals, for the assistance in the vaccination drive."

Neetu Kapoor, who contracted coronavirus in December, spoke about her recovery and said, "I did anulom-vilom and kapalbhati...which helped me a lot." She added, "My family was my biggest strength. For immunity, I'd lots of healthy drinks like kaadhas, giloy water." Neetu also revealed that she'd lost the sense of smell for three weeks when she tested positive for coronavirus.

According to an analysis by State Bank of India (SBI) India's combined federal and states' budget gap in the current fiscal year will reach 12.7%. Increased healthcare spending and fall in revenues amid the COVID-19 pandemic led to the budget gap, SBI said. The average fiscal deficit across 13 states reached 4.5% of gross domestic product, the bank added.

The BMC on Wednesday said the private centres for COVID-19 vaccination in BMC limits are allowed to operate 24x7. "Centre has approved BMC's proposal in this regard. [We] requested Centre to do necessary changes to its vaccination registration website to facilitate this," BMC added. After the Centre's approval, BMC aims for around 1 lakh vaccinations every day, it further said.

Cambodia Prime Minister Hun Sen and First Lady Bun Rany received their first dose of the Covishield coronavirus vaccine on Wednesday. Cambodia had received its first batch of 3,24,000 coronavirus vaccine doses from India under the WHO COVAX scheme last week. The country has reported 1,124 COVID-19 cases so far, according to the Johns Hopkins University tracker.

Paris-based Organisation for Economic Co-operation and Development (OECD) now expects the global economy to grow by 5.6% in 2021, an increase of 1.4 percentage points from its December forecast. World output may reach pre-pandemic levels by mid-2021, it said. "If we don't get enough people vaccinated quickly enough to allow [COVID-19] restrictions to be lifted...recovery will be slower," it added.

Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Wednesday told BJP leaders to not skip the Budget session of Parliament at all. While addressing the BJP parliamentary meet, PM Modi also directed all the MPs and party workers to help eligible people get COVID-19 vaccines, Parliamentary Affairs Minister Pralhad Joshi said. The meeting was also attended by Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman.

Mumbai Guardian Minister Aslam Shaikh warned that the Maharashtra government will have to consider imposing a partial lockdown if COVID-19 cases don't reduce in the city. Shaikh said that the option of partial lockdown in Mumbai was discussed at a Cabinet meeting chaired by CM Uddhav Thackeray. He also said the government is considering imposing night curfew amid the surge.

ICICI Bank has announced that it will bear the cost of COVID-19 vaccination for its employees and their immediate family members. The lender said it appreciates the efforts showcased by its employees to ensure seamless services during the pandemic. Earlier, several other companies, including Reliance Industries, Accenture, Infosys and Flipkart, made a similar announcement for their employees.

Pune Film Foundation (PFF) has decided to postpone the upcoming Pune International Film Festival (PIFF) amid rising number of COVID-19 cases, the organisers said on Wednesday. While physical film screenings have been postponed until further notice, the festival will be held online between March 18-25, it added. The 19th edition of the festival was to be inaugurated on March 11.

Pune Municipal Corporation (PMC) has decided to provide one-time assistance of ?2,000 each to physically disabled people hit by COVID-19 lockdown. Maharashtra minister Bacchu Kadu has asked civic bodies to also provide 50% concession in property tax and water charges for properties owned by physically disabled people. The lockdown has put disabled citizens in financial crisis, the minister said.

Hong Kong's Cathay Pacific Airways posted a record annual loss of around $2.8 billion in 2020 due to the COVID-19 pandemic. The carrier described it as "the most challenging 12 months of its more than 70-year history". Cathay Pacific expects to operate at below 50% passenger capacity in 2021 as Hong Kong has largely closed its borders to non-residents.

Qantas Airways Ltd's budget arm Jetstar is flying 90% of its pre-COVID-19 domestic schedule in March, Jetstar's Chief Executive Officer has said. The upswing in demand follows the reopening of state borders in Australia. However, Australia's international borders remain largely closed. "We are feeling certainly more positive than we have in 12 months," Jetstar Group CEO Gareth Evans remarked.

Amid chip shortage that has forced production cuts in the automobile sector across the globe, South Korea has said that it will exempt business people working to secure the supply of auto chips from two-week COVID-19 quarantine requirements. Furthermore, the South Korean government said it would also prioritise the vaccination of people key to auto chip procurement.

Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) Commissioner Iqbal Singh Chahal has said that there is no immediate need to impose a lockdown in Mumbai. However, BMC officials warned that if citizens do not follow the COVID-19 protocol, they may be forced to take stringent steps. Mumbai has a positivity rate of 6%, which is lower than other cities in Maharashtra, officials added.

Actor Farhan Akhtar and actress Mrunal Thakur-starrer sports-drama 'Toofaan' will have an OTT release on May 21. Amid the COVID-19 lockdown, Toofaan's release was postponed. Taking to Instagram, Farhan shared the poster of the film and wrote, "Toofaan Uthega! Catch the teaser on March 12 on Amazon Prime Video." Farhan will portray a boxer in 'Toofaan'.

With 320 new COVID-19 cases on Tuesday, Delhi has now reported more than 300 new cases for the third time in March. Earlier, 312 cases were reported on March 5 and 321 on March 6. Delhi's caseload so far has reached 6,41,660. The national capital reported four COVID-19 deaths on Tuesday, following which the death toll stood at 10,928.

Three members of a family, including a minor, have been booked in Mumbai's Khar for forging negative COVID-19 reports in order to board a flight to Jaipur. According to police, despite testing positive for COVID-19, the husband-wife duo and their 15-year-old daughter showed a fake negative report to BMC doctors, who were trying to prevent them from boarding the flight.

Favipiravir and Remdesivir constituted 38 out of the 44 new antiviral brands launched in India in 2020 due to COVID-19 pandemic, according to American research firm IQVIA. The two molecules recorded combined sales of over ?1,000 crore in just seven months after their launch in June. India launched over four times more antiviral medicines in 2020 as compared to 2019.

Rajasthan CM Ashok Gehlot on Tuesday alleged that the Centre's data is "completely incorrect" after the Centre disputed the state government's claims of vaccine shortage in the state. "Health Ministry claimed that Rajasthan received 37.61 lakh vaccines," he said. "As of 8 March, Rajasthan received 31,45,340 vaccines. Of these, 2,15,180 vaccines have been made available to the Army," Gehlot added.

England's Chief Medical Officer Chris Whitty said Britain will see a resurgence in coronavirus cases. Whitty said "modelling" suggests cases will soar at some point after restrictions eased even with a successful vaccine rollout. Whitty said caution in re-opening the economy would affect the size and timing of a resurgence, but vaccines wouldn't be able to prevent all COVID-related deaths.

Veteran BJP leader Lal Krishna Advani was on Tuesday administered the first dose of the COVID-19 vaccine. Advani received the dose at the All India Institute of Medical Sciences (AIIMS) in Delhi. He became eligible to receive the vaccine under the second, expanded phase of the nationwide coronavirus vaccination drive that began on March 1.

The Centre on Tuesday said that "the factual position is that there is no shortage of COVID-19 vaccine in Rajasthan at present". This comes after media reports said that Rajasthan is left with COVID-19 vaccine doses for three days. The Centre added, "Rajasthan has been supplied 37.61 lakh doses and has consumed only 24.28 lakh doses till yesterday night."

A plea has been filed in the Delhi High Court seeking to postpone Delhi Higher Judicial Service Main Examination-2019, which is scheduled on March 13-14, till COVID-19 vaccinations are over for lawyers. The plea is filed by one of the candidates, who claimed to have severe health issues and is at a higher risk of severe complications from contracting COVID-19.

Maharashtra's Ahmednagar district administration has decided to deploy police personnel at marriage halls to prevent the spread of COVID-19 cases. Amid rising cases, police personnel will be taking on-the-spot action against organisers if more than 50 guests attend the event. The district has been reporting more than 350 cases daily but no fresh curbs have yet been announced.

Under the 'Vaccine Maitri' initiative aimed at assisting countries in their fight against COVID-19, three nations today received the Made in India COVID-19 vaccines. External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar said on Twitter that Jamaica, Tajikistan and Belize have received the consignments of vaccine doses. Twenty-five nations have got jabs and 49 more nations will be supplied in the coming days.

As many as 20,19,723 beneficiaries were vaccinated against COVID-19 on Monday, the highest in a day so far, taking the total number of doses administered in India to over 2.3 crore, the Union Health Ministry said. Out of over 20 lakh beneficiaries, 17,15,380 were vaccinated for the first dose and 3,04,343 healthcare workers and frontline workers received second dose.

Malayalam actor Mammootty has said that he has no interest in electoral politics. "The biggest politics I know is what I practice through my movies. No party has ever asked me to contest polls," the actor said. Mammootty also remarked that the film industry was one of the most impacted due to the ongoing COVID-19 pandemic.

Actress Alia Bhatt took to Instagram Story on Tuesday to share a quote that read, "We grow through what we go through." The story further read, "#thegoodword". This comes after actress Neetu Kapoor confirmed on social media earlier today that her son and Alia's boyfriend, actor Ranbir Kapoor has tested positive for coronavirus.

The Odisha government on Tuesday ordered restrictions on all kinds of religious gatherings on Maha Shivaratri on March 11. The decision was taken because of the surge in COVID-19 cases in the state. Special Relief Commissioner directed the Collectors and Municipal Commissioners to restrict congregation to such numbers as suitable, considering the local situation and space within the temples.

Singapore's Straits Times Index has surged 9.3% to overtake all other major Asian benchmark indices so far this year. This came as Nasdaq entered into correction territory after technology stocks continued to slump on the US benchmark. The Singaporean index was Asia's worst performer in 2020 as the country suffered its biggest contraction since independence due to the COVID-19 pandemic.

BJP National President JP Nadda on Tuesday received the first dose of COVID-19 vaccine at Fortis Hospital in Delhi. "India has proved under the leadership of PM [Narendra] Modi to be the leader in COVID-19 management," Nadda said. He added, "The world's largest vaccination program is underway in India." The second phase of the COVID-19 vaccination began on March 1.

Under the 'Vaccine Maitri' initiative, Afghanistan on Monday received 468,000 doses of the COVID-19 vaccine from India. Afghan envoy to India Farid Mamundzay tweeted, "468,000 doses of COVISHIELD vaccine, from...Astra Zeneca Serum Institute of #India arrived yesterday." According to Johns Hopkins University, COVID-19 cases in Afghanistan have reached 55,876, while 2,451 have died due to the virus.

Serum Institute of India (SII) has requested the Centre to intervene to enable it to import essential raw materials from the US for uninterrupted manufacturing of COVID-19 vaccines. SII said that the US government has invoked the Defence Production Act due to which it's facing difficulty in importing necessary products. This may result in acute shortage of vaccines, it added.

European Commission President Ursula von der Leyen has said the commission is "tired of being the scapegoat" for the slow rollout of coronavirus vaccines. Leyen blamed pharmaceutical companies, notably AstraZeneca Plc, which she said hadn't stockpiled vaccine doses as it started producing in Europe. "I think it is the responsibility of the company to organise its deliveries," she added.

Paresh Rawal has received the first dose of COVID-19 vaccine. The 65-year-old actor took to Twitter on Tuesday to share a picture of himself clicked at a vaccination centre. "V for vaccines! Thanks to all...doctors, nurses and...front line health care workers and...scientists. Thanks, @narendramodi," he wrote. Paresh's wife Swaroop Rawal also recently received the first jab of the vaccine.

Speaking about gaining weight while quarantining amid the coronavirus pandemic, actress Gwyneth Paltrow said, "I gained 6-kg and my gut was a mess." At the In Goop Health - The At-Home Summit she added, "I just didn't want to do anything about it...I felt like my wine, my pasta, biscuits, crackers and cheese were getting me through."

Delhi High Court asked the Directorate General of Civil Aviation (DGCA) authorities to ensure strict compliance with its COVID-19 guidelines. The court took cognisance after seeing a situation on March 5, where people were travelling on a flight from Kolkata to Delhi without properly wearing masks. Court also said that penal action will be taken if airlines failed to comply.

Thailand Health Minister Anutin Charnvirakul has said that the country will reduce its mandatory quarantine from 14 days to 7 days for international travellers who have been vaccinated against coronavirus. He added that vaccinations must be administered within three months of the travel period and the visitors must still provide negative COVID-19 test results within three days of their departure.

Aviation regulator DGCA on Tuesday announced that pilots and cabin crew members would not fly in an aircraft for 48 hours after being vaccinated against coronavirus. "If there are no symptoms after 48 hours, the aircrew is fit to resume 'unrestricted' flying duties," the regulator stated. Aircrew would be monitored for 30 minutes after taking the shot at vaccination centre.

Flipkart Group said it will cover the cost of COVID-19 vaccination for all Flipkart and Myntra employees as well as their three dependants. Flipkart Chief People Officer Krishna Raghavan in an email to employees said while opting for vaccines was their discretion, they must consider the benefits. Earlier, Mindtree and Sify Technologies said they'll bear vaccination costs for their employees.

Sachin Tendulkar took to Instagram to share a video of himself undergoing COVID-19 test in Raipur, where he's playing the Road Safety World Series tournament for India Legends. In the video, Sachin can be seen scaring the medical staff by pretending that he was hurt while giving the nasal swab sample. "A little prank to lighten the mood," he wrote.

The US said that Russia is "putting people at risk by spreading disinformation about vaccines that we know to be saving lives every day". This comes after US State Department's Global Engagement Center said Russian intelligence was behind four online platforms spreading disinformation "about two of the vaccines" that US has approved. The websites questioned the efficacy of the vaccines.

Chief Economist of the International Monetary Fund Gita Gopinath has said that India has been at the forefront in fighting COVID-19 pandemic. She hailed India for playing an important role during the crisis by manufacturing and shipping the COVID-19 vaccines to several nations. Gopinath said this during the Inaugural Dr Hansa Mehta Lecture organised on occasion of International Women?s Day.

China has launched COVID-19 vaccination certificates to facilitate cross-border travels for its citizens. The certificate will have the certificate holder's NAT and IgG antibody test results and vaccination status on record, Chinese Foreign Minister Wang Yi said. "China plans to explore the feasibility for mutual recognition of vaccine inoculation with different countries," Yi added.

Chief Economist of the International Monetary Fund (IMF) Gita Gopinath has said, "India really stands out in terms of its vaccine policy." "If you look at where exactly is one manufacturing hub for vaccines in the world ? that will be India," she added. India has been playing a very important role in helping the world, she further said.

Delhi Deputy CM Manish Sisodia while presenting the Budget on Tuesday said that the COVID-19 vaccines will continue to be available free of cost for people of Delhi in government hospitals. He said, "We allotted ?50 crore budget for the same. Soon, per day vaccination will be increased to 60,000 from 45,000." Delhi government allocated ?9,934 crore for health sector.

The Pfizer/BioNTech coronavirus vaccine was able to efficiently neutralize the variant first found in Brazil, according to a study published in New England Journal of Medicine on Monday. The study found that blood taken from people who'd been given the vaccine neutralised an engineered version of the virus which had the same spike protein mutations as of the P.1 variant.

Australian Health Minister Greg Hunt has been hospitalised with a "suspected infection", his office said on Tuesday. A statement from his office revealed the 55-year-old is "being kept overnight for observation and is being administered antibiotics and fluid". Hunt received his first dose of the AstraZeneca vaccine on Sunday, however, "his condition isn't considered to be related to the vaccine."

The Instagram algorithm is promoting dangerous falsehoods about the COVID-19 vaccine and the virus, Center for Countering Digital Hate reported. The firm has written to Facebook CEO Mark Zuckerberg asking him to fix the issue. It alleged that through Instagram's 'Suggested Posts' and 'Explore' features, people are being directed to lies and conspiracy theories.

Veteran actor Anupam Kher on Tuesday shared that he has received the first dose of the coronavirus vaccine. Taking to Twitter, the 66-year-old actor shared a video wherein he can be seen getting vaccinated. He wrote, "Got my #COVID19 first dose vaccination!! Thank you all...doctors, medical staff, scientist and Govt Of India for making it possible. India Rocks. Jai Ho!"
