Three engineers of Gujarat's Surat Municipal Corporation tested positive for coronavirus after receiving two doses of the COVID-19 vaccine, the civic body officials said. "The effectiveness of the vaccine is 80 to 85%...The immunity starts developing in the body four weeks after administering the second dose of the vaccine," New Civil Hospital's nodal officer for COVID-19, Dr Amit Gamit, said.

Ranjim Prabal Das, one of the six students with 100 percentile score in JEE (Main) 2021, said he draws inspiration from Tesla CEO Elon Musk. "I plan to go to IIT Delhi...Otherwise, I'll go to IISc Bengaluru for science graduation," he added. "When I had COVID-19, I focused on healing. Once fever was down I got back...to studies," Ranjim stated.

Maharashtra's Pune district will start 12 more COVID-19 vaccination centres as many people are queuing up in hospitals to get vaccinated, health officials said. With this, Pune will have around 80 vaccination centres. The officials added that the state government has got the Centre's authorisation for these centres, which include KEM Hospital and Poona Hospital and Research Centre.

The total number of coronavirus cases in the US topped 2.9 crore on Monday, according to Johns Hopkins University. US COVID-19 case count rose to 29,045,447, with a total of 5,25,816 deaths as it remains the worst coronavirus-hit country in the world, making up nearly 25% of the global caseload. California reported the largest number of cases standing at 49,646,014.

Punjab Chief Minister Captain Amarinder Singh has written to BCCI after Mohali wasn't included in the list of venues for IPL 2021. "If they can have a match in Mumbai, which has had 9,000 coronavirus cases per day, then what's wrong with Mohali," he said. He further said that they will take the necessary precautions if Mohali is included.

Nagaland reported zero new COVID-19 cases for the second consecutive day on Tuesday, state Health Minister S Pangnyu Phom said. The state's coronavirus tally stands at 12,217, of which 18 cases are active. The recovery rate is 97.85% as a total of 11,955 people have recovered from the disease, said Director of Health and Family Welfare, Dr Denis Hangsing.

Russia's single-day COVID-19 increase fell to the lowest level since October 2, as less than 10,000 cases were reported in the past 24 hours. The country's COVID-19 response center said on Tuesday, "Over the past day, 9,445 coronavirus cases were confirmed across 84 Russian regions, including 1,034 cases without...symptoms." Russia now has 43,42,474 COVID-19 cases and has reported 89,809 deaths.

The upcoming Tokyo Olympics and Paralympics are likely to be held without overseas fans in Japan amid concerns over coronavirus, reports have claimed. The Olympics were postponed last year due to the pandemic and are now scheduled to be held from July 23 to August 8, while the Paralympics from August 24 to September 5.

On Monday, American Airlines unveiled its plan to issue bonds worth $5 billion to pay back government loans that were passed in 2020 to help the airline industry survive the coronavirus pandemic. The airline also said it would seek a $2.5 billion loan backed by its frequent flyer programme that was valued between $19.5 billion and $31.5 billion last year.

Veteran actress Neetu Kapoor took to Instagram to share that her son and actor Ranbir Kapoor has tested positive for coronavirus. "He is on medication and recovering well. He is in self quarantine at home and following all precautions," she wrote. Earlier, Ranbir's uncle Randhir Kapoor had said Ranbir was unwell but he did not know what had he got.

After a media report claimed that Ranbir Kapoor has been infected with coronavirus, his uncle Randhir Kapoor said, "I believe Ranbir is not well, but I am not sure what he has got." As per the report, Ranbir is currently under quarantine. Ranbir's mother Neetu had tested positive for coronavirus in December last year.

As many as 10,113 firms were shut down voluntarily in the country from April 2020 till February this year amid the COVID-19 pandemic, as per government data. MoS Corporate Affairs Anurag Singh Thakur said that the government did not run any drive to strike off these companies "suo moto". Of the total, 2,394 companies were shut in Delhi.

Nearly one in three women worldwide is subjected to physical or sexual violence during her lifetime, the WHO said on Tuesday. Boys should be taught in school about the need for mutual respect in relationships and mutual consent in sex, WHO officials said. "Violence against women...has been exacerbated by the COVID-19 pandemic," WHO director-general Tedros Adhanom Ghebreyesus said.

Minister of State for Finance Anurag Singh Thakur said that the scope of minority stake sale has declined and strategic disinvestment and privatisation would be the primary mode for disinvestment receipts. He further said that the government's disinvestment plans were adversely impacted due to COVID-19. The government has realised ?20,627 crore as disinvestment receipts till March 3, he added.

Maharashtra on Tuesday reported nearly 10,000 new cases of COVID-19. The state reported 9,927 new cases, taking the total number of cases in Maharashtra to 22,38,398, while the death toll reached 52,556 with 56 more fatalities in the last 24 hours. On Sunday, the state had recorded over 11,000 new COVID-19 cases for the first time in five months.

Organisers of Mobile World Congress, the world's biggest mobile industry event, unveiled a health plan on Monday that they said would enable the gathering to go ahead in Barcelona this June. Nearly 80 of the 100 top exhibitors have confirmed participation, the organisers said. Mandatory negative COVID-19 tests, social distancing and limited access will be among the measures taken.

India reported 15,388 fresh cases of COVID-19 and 77 deaths in the last 24 hours, according to Union Health Ministry on Tuesday. With this, the nationwide tally of COVID-19 cases reached 1,12,44,786 and the death toll climbed to 1,57,930. Around 18 states/UTs didn't report any COVID-19 related deaths till 8:00 am on Tuesday.

Thane Municipal Corporation has announced to impose lockdown in COVID-19 hotspot areas from March 9 to March 31, 2021, ANI reported. So far, 16 areas have been identified as hotspots in Thane. Activities will be allowed in areas outside hotspots as per relaxation given under Mission Begin Again by the Maharashtra government.

German MP Nikolas L?bel announced his resignation with immediate effect over a government deal to procure face masks during the COVID-19 pandemic. L?bel's company had reportedly earned commissions of about ?250,000 (over ?2.16 crore) by brokering sales deals for masks between a supplier from his native Baden-Wrttemberg and two private companies. "I take responsibility for my actions," he said.

The Maharashtra government set up five COVID-19 vaccination centres exclusively for women in each district of the state on the occasion of International Women's Day on Monday. According to a health official, Thane district has 19 such centres due to higher demand. He added that these vaccination centres will be functional only for today.

West Delhi's Indraprastha World School has been shut temporarily after a student reportedly tested COVID-19 positive. The student had attended the school only on March 2, informed the school. Principal Shikha Arora said that the school will be closed for about a week and all measures to sanitise the campus are being taken.

Amid rising COVID-19 cases, the Pimpri Chinchwad Municipal Corporation (PCMC) has set up around 500 micro-containment zones and nearly 120 containment zones, said Additional Health chief Dr Pavan Salve. "If we find two or more cases, we are immediately sealing that particular place," he added. Salve said PCMC is closely monitoring crowded places like hotels, malls, social gatherings and marriages.

Actress Janhvi Kapoor's manager got angry and stopped a maskless fan from taking a selfie with the actress. "Mat karo bhai, COVID ka time hai (Don't do this brother at a time when there's COVID-19 around)," Janhvi's manager said to the fan. However, the actress went back and clicked a selfie with the fan, advising him to wear a mask.

Mumbai's Terminal 1 airport will resume operations on March 10, with five domestic airlines running 102 flights to 27 destinations. The operations at the terminal remained suspended even after domestic air services in the country restarted on May 25 after being shut due to the COVID-19 pandemic. At present, both domestic and international airlines operate from Mumbai's Terminal 2 airport.

Delhi reported 239 new COVID-19 cases and three more deaths due to the disease in the last 24 hours, the state health department said on Monday. The number of active cases in the city has dropped to 1,730 from 1,803 on Sunday. Delhi's COVID-19 tally has reached 6,41,340, while the death toll has risen to 10,924.

West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee on Monday criticised PM Narendra Modi over the inclusion of his picture in COVID-19 vaccination certificates. "The PM has put his photographs on vaccination certificates. A day will come when the country will be named after him," she said. "They (BJP leaders) will come to Bengal only during elections and spread...lies," the CM added.

Accidents and fatalities on the streets of the national capital saw a significant decrease in 2020 due to the nationwide lockdown amid the COVID-19 pandemic, compared to the previous year 2019. According to Delhi Police, there was a 26% drop in the number of accidents. A total of 5,610 accidents, were reported in 2019, while 4,178 were reported in 2020.

Singapore's biggest bank DBS Holdings Group cut CEO Piyush Gupta's total 2020 compensation by 24% after the bank posted first drop in annual profit in four years amid COVID-19. Gupta's bonus was slashed by 27% by the bank, resulting in a 24% decline in his overall compensation to S$9.2 million (?50 crore). It's down from S$12.1 million a year earlier.

New Zealand said that it'll only use the Pfizer-BioNTech COVID-19 vaccine to inoculate its population against coronavirus. The decision was based on the vaccine's effectiveness at about 95%, PM Jacinda Ardern said. The country has signed a deal with Pfizer to provide it with enough vaccines for its population of around 50 lakh, she added.

Austria has stopped using doses from a batch of the Oxford-AstraZeneca COVID-19 vaccine as a precaution while it investigates the death of a woman who received it, authorities said. However, there is "no evidence of a causal relationship with...vaccination", they added. Another woman who received a dose from the same batch developed a pulmonary embolism but is now recovering.

Delhi's economy is estimated to suffer a contraction of 5.6% in its Gross State Domestic Product (GSDP) in the current financial year, Lieutenant Governor Anil Baijal said in his address in the Assembly on the first day of the Budget session. The contraction is due to the impact of the COVID-19 pandemic, he added.

Around 36 people tested positive for COVID-19 in the Maharashtra Legislative assembly, according to JJ hospital on Monday. These 36 people tested positive after a total of 2,746 samples were tested for re-entry to the legislative assembly for the budget session on March 6 and 7. The samples were taken from MLAs, their staff, government officials, police personnel, journalists etc.

India recorded a spike of 18,599 COVID-19 cases and 97 deaths in the last 24 hours, according to the Union Health Ministry. With this, the total number of COVID-19 cases in India surged to 1,12,29,398 while the death toll increased to 1,57,853. Around 19 states/UTs reported no COVID-19 related deaths till 8:00 am on Monday.

Nine women, who delivered babies in Delhi Police PCR vans while being shifted to hospitals during COVID-19-induced lockdown, have been invited as guests at an International Women's Day event at police headquarters. "The MPVs staff displayed exemplary conviction and commitment to duty by helping the women deliver their babies...though they're untrained," DCP PCR Esha Pandey said.

The US Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) said that Americans vaccinated against coronavirus can gather indoors without wearing a mask or social distancing. Vaccinated people could also come together in the same way with people considered at low risk for severe disease, it added. However, CDC urged vaccinated people to continue to wear a mask in public places.

The death toll from coronavirus in Sri Lanka rose to 502 after five more deaths were reported on Sunday, official statistics from the Health Ministry showed on Monday. The country has reported more than 85,000 coronavirus cases so far. Sri Lanka had launched a mass vaccination drive against coronavirus for the general public recently.

Actor Ranvir Shorey shared a health update after testing negative for coronavirus while replying to a Twitter user who asked him if his taste buds are functioning properly. "Sadly, no, not yet. Taste and smell are still lost. Thanks for asking," Ranvir replied. After testing positive for COVID-19 last month, the actor tested negative last week.

US officials have said Russian intelligence agencies have been running a false online campaign to undermine confidence in Pfizer vaccine and other Western vaccines using four websites, The WSJ reported. The websites play up the vaccines' risk of side effects, question their efficacy, and claim the US rushed Pfizer vaccine's approval, the report added.

Health Minister Harsh Vardhan has said that the country is in the endgame of the COVID-19 pandemic and to succeed at this stage, "politics should be kept out" of the COVID-19 vaccination drive. "We have administered over 2 crore COVID-19 vaccine shots and have increased our vaccination rate to 15 lakh per day," he added.

Speaking about working during the ongoing COVID-19 pandemic, actress Tabu said, "Everybody wants to go back to work and believe everything is normal, we just don't know when." She added, "I'm sure we'll return to a place where we can...go and work fearlessly." Tabu also mentioned that when the situation gets better, she would take "a lot of holidays".

Around 85% of jail staff and over 58% of security personnel deployed in three jails under Delhi prisons department have been vaccinated against COVID-19, an official said. "We have been encouraging the jail staff and security personnel to get the vaccine," Director General (Prisons) Sandeep Goel said. Delhi prisons department has around 2,000 jail staff and nearly 1,700 security personnel.

A night curfew from 11 pm to 5 am was imposed in four districts of the Doaba region in Punjab from Saturday amid rising cases of COVID-19. The districts where the night curfew has been imposed are Jalandhar, SBS Nagar, Hoshiarpur and Kapurthala. Jalandhar Deputy Commissioner Ghanshyam Thori said the order will be effective from Saturday till further directions.

India reported 18,711 fresh cases of COVID-19 and 100 deaths in the last 24 hours, according to the Health Ministry. This takes India's total number of COVID-19 cases to 1,12,10,799, while the number of COVID-19 related deaths climbed to 1,57,756. Meanwhile, this is India's highest one-day spike this year since January 29, which saw 18,855 new COVID-19 cases.

Veteran actor Jeetendra and his wife Shobha Kapoor have received the first dose of COVID-19 vaccine. Actor Tusshar Kapoor took to social media to share the news alongside a picture of his 78-year-old father and 75-year-old mother. In addition to Jeetendra and Shobha, celebrities like Kamal Haasan, Johny Lever, Hema Malini and Saif Ali Khan have also received the dose.

BBMP Commissioner N Manjunatha Prasad on Saturday directed health officers to ramp up the COVID-19 vaccination drive, increase testing and keep a check on rise in COVID-19 cases in Bengaluru. Karnataka Health Minister Dr Sudhakar K has said that 12 clusters have been identified in BBMP limits and testing will be increased to 40,000 per day from the current 30,000.

A Russian intelligence agency and Chinese spies were behind cyberattacks on the European Medicines Agency (EMA) last year, Dutch newspaper de Volkskrant reported. In December 2020, the drug regulator had reported a cyberattack in which documents relating to COVID-19 vaccines and medicines were stolen and leaked. EMA was targeted by Chinese spies in the first half of 2020.

New Caledonia, a French territory in the Pacific, has reported its first coronavirus cases after nine people tested positive, local officials said. A 15-day lockdown has been ordered in the territory "in order to break the transmission of the virus while there is still time", an official said. The lockdown will not disrupt the vaccination drive against COVID-19, he added.

RSS chief Mohan Bhagwat took the first dose of the COVID-19 vaccine in Nagpur on Saturday. Along with Bhagwat, the General Secretary of RSS Suresh Bhaiyyaji Joshi was also administered his first dose of the vaccine. The duo received the vaccine at Nagpur's National Cancer Institute in the third phase of the vaccination drive.

Delhi on Sunday reported 286 fresh COVID-19 cases and two more deaths due to the disease, taking the caseload to 6,41,101 and the death toll to 10,921, according to the state health department. The number of active cases in the city rose to 1,803 from 1,779 on Saturday. Delhi reported 321 cases on Saturday and 312 cases on Friday.

Amid rising COVID-19 cases, the district administration of Maharashtra's Aurangabad on March 7 announced that night curfew from 9 pm to 6 am will be re-imposed from March 11 till April 4. Full lockdown will be imposed on the weekends, state Urban Development Minister Eknath Shinde said. "During this period, schools, colleges and wedding halls will remain closed," Shinde added.

Nepal PM KP Sharma Oli and his wife Radhika Shakya received their first dose of the Covishield vaccine on Sunday as the country launched its second phase of the nationwide vaccination campaign. In this phase, people above 65 will be inoculated. After his vaccination, PM Oli urged the eligible group to take the vaccine without any fear.

Bharat Biotech has begun the Phase 1 trial of its intranasal Covid-19 vaccine in Hyderabad. As a part of the trial, the vaccine called BBV154 was administered to two volunteers on Friday and they are reportedly doing fine. The Drugs Controller General of India gave permission to start the clinical trials on March 2.

After India delivered coronavirus vaccines to the UK, Anand Mahindra replied, "Idiom 'carrying coals to Newcastle' means doing something pointless, by shipping something to a place where it's already abundant." "That should have been the case here since the vaccine was created in the UK. But India is happy to be the world's vaccine factory," he added.

Mumbai on Friday reported 1,173 new COVID-19 cases, the highest one-day spike since October 28. This took the total caseload so far to 3,31,016, Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation said. Mumbai on Friday witnessed three new fatalities, following which the death toll stood at 11,490. After 1,151 COVID-19 patients were discharged following recovery, Mumbai's count of active patients stood at 10,469.

Brazilian President Jair Bolsonaro asked Brazilians to "stop whining" about coronavirus, as he criticised measures to combat the virus spread. "How long are you going to keep crying about it?...We regret the deaths...But where's Brazil going to end up if we just close everything?" he added. Brazil has reported the second-highest number of coronavirus deaths after the US at 2,62,770.

Italy and the European Commission have blocked the shipment of over 2,50,000 doses of Oxford-AstraZeneca COVID-19 vaccine to Australia. Italy reportedly blocked the shipment of the vaccines after the pharmaceutical company failed to fulfil its European Union contract commitments. Italy is the first EU country to use the bloc's new export control system that came into force on January 30.

TVS Motor Company has announced that it'll cover the COVID-19 vaccination cost for around 35,000 direct and indirect company employees and their immediate family members. Initially, the vaccine will be made available to those above 60 years of age or above 45 years with certain medical conditions, it said. Earlier, other companies like Reliance Industries and Accenture made similar announcements.

Actress-politician Hema Malini on Saturday received the first dose of coronavirus vaccine in Mumbai. The 72-year-old actress took to Twitter to share pictures of herself and wrote, "I have taken the Covid-19 vaccine along with the public at Cooper Hospital." Kamal Haasan, Satish Shah, Kushboo Sundar and Radikaa Sarathkumar are some of the other celebrities who have received the vaccine.

After receiving the first dose of the COVID-19 vaccine on Saturday, Tibetan spiritual leader the Dalai Lama said that the "injection is very helpful" and "more people should have the courage to take it". He received the vaccine at Zonal Hospital, Dharamshala, making his first public appearance after January 2020, reports said.

Union Minister of Agriculture and Farmer Welfare Narendra Singh Tomar was on Saturday administered the first dose of the COVID-19 vaccine at Delhi's Dr Ram Manohar Lohia Hospital. "The indigenous COVID-19 vaccine is completely safe. You must also get vaccinated," the minister tweeted. "The world's largest vaccination drive is going on in India under PM Narendra Modi's leadership," he added.

An exclusive vaccination centre for MPs, eligible for COVID-19 vaccine, has been set up inside the Parliament House Medical Centre for the second half of the Budget Session, according to an internal Lok Sabha circular. "Two vaccination centres have also been set up for the family members of MPs...Members can undertake vaccination in their respective [constituencies] also," the circular stated.

The Centre has said five states reported 82% of the new coronavirus cases reported in the country on Saturday. Maharashtra reported the highest number with 10,216 COVID-19 cases, followed by Kerala (2,776), Punjab (808), Karnataka (677) and Tamil Nadu (543). A total of 18,327 new cases have been recorded in the last 24 hours.

The findings of the WHO-led mission to Wuhan, China, to investigate the origins of coronavirus will be issued in the week of March 15, WHO Director-General Tedros Adhanom Ghebreyesus said. COVID-19 first emerged in Wuhan in December 2019. The WHO-led team began the investigation in January 2021 and spent four weeks in Wuhan visiting sites linked to early COVID-19 cases.

The Centre has listed 11 states and one Union Territory that have more than 2.8 lakh confirmed coronavirus cases in the country. Maharashtra has the highest number with 21,98,399 confirmed cases so far. This is followed by Kerala, Karnataka, Andhra Pradesh, Tamil Nadu, Delhi, Uttar Pradesh, West Bengal, Odisha, Rajasthan, Chhattisgarh and Telangana.

World Health Organization Director-General Tedros Adhanom Ghebreyesus said that COVAX has delivered over 2 crore doses of vaccine to 20 countries in a week. COVAX will deliver 1.44 crore doses to 31 countries next week, he added. Last week, Ghana became the first country to receive vaccines under COVAX scheme that aims to distribute vaccines for free to poor countries.

India reported 18,327 new COVID-19 cases and 108 deaths in the last 24 hours, as per the Union Health Ministry. The total caseload reached 1,11,92,088 and the death toll reached 1,57,656. The number of active COVID-19 cases in India stood at 1,80,304. After 14,234 patients were discharged in the last 24 hours, the total discharges stood at 1,08,54,128.

Chief Health Officer Dr MH Solanki in Gujarat's Gandhinagar said that a health official has tested positive for coronavirus days after taking the second dose of COVID-19 vaccine. He took the second dose on February 15 and tested positive on February 20. Solanki said it generally takes around 45 days for antibodies against coronavirus to develop after both the doses.

Consultations between the Finance Ministry and the RBI indicate the government will continue to retain the existing 2% to 6% inflation band for the next five years, a government official reportedly said. Earlier, the government was considering a proposal to raise the inflation target to help revive the economic activity following the COVID-19 outbreak.

Delhi recorded 312 fresh COVID-19 cases on Friday, the highest number of daily cases in about 1.5 months, according to data shared by the Health Department. Three more fatalities pushed the death toll in the national capital to 10,918. There are 1,779 active COVID-19 cases in Delhi, while the total number of cases stands at 6,40,494.

Maharashtra reported 10,216 fresh cases of COVID-19 on Friday, the highest daily infections since mid-October last year. The state also registered 53 fatalities, which pushed its death toll to 52,393. There are 88,838 active COVID-19 cases in Maharashtra, while the total number of cases stands at 21,98,399.

OYO's valuation has reached $9 billion after raising $7.31 million from Hindustan Media Ventures as part of its Series F1 round, IANS reported. OYO CFO Abhishek Gupta said that despite COVID-19, OYO's valuation has held through and that OYO is seeing signs of recovery in its core markets of India, Europe and Southeast Asia.

Delhi government's Food and Civil Supplies Department has sought information about "empty" gunny bags lying in schools from government schools in northwest Delhi which were used for food distribution in the COVID-19 pandemic. The food supply officer said the "empty bags of non-PDS food grains stored in schoolrooms should be auctioned by the Food and Supply department officials".

In view of rising COVID-19 cases, a night curfew has been imposed in Punjab's Jalandhar from March 6, read a notice issued by Jalandhar DM Ghanshyam Thori's office on Saturday. Jalandhar's night curfew will be in place from 11 pm to 5 am from Saturday until further notice. Jalandhar on Friday had reported the maximum 134 new cases in Punjab.

Over 2.2 lakh passengers underwent RT-PCR tests at Mumbai's Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj International Airport (CSMIA) from September 2020-February 2021, of which, 1,480 people tested COVID-19 positive, the airport authority said. CSMIA introduced RT-PCR test counters at its terminal for arriving passengers in September 2020 and later extended the facility to departing visitors too in October 2020.

Seven students and two teachers of a government high school at Bengaluru's B Narayanapura have tested positive for COVD-19. The school has been closed for 14 days and officials said that 66 primary and 53 secondary contacts have been traced so far. "It is another cluster...The parents of the children are also being tested," BBMP Commissioner N Manjunatha Prasad said.

The Finance Ministry has said that the Indian economy is likely to do better than the 8% contraction projected for 2020-21. Positive GDP growth in the December quarter for the first time since the COVID-19 pandemic has added to the positive sentiment, the ministry added. Indian economy had come out of recession and expanded by 0.4% in the third quarter.

Boeing CEO David Calhoun received a total compensation of over $21 million in 2020 after he gave up $3.6 million in the form of salary and bonuses amid the COVID-19 pandemic. He took $269,231 in salary for the period before he disavowed his salary in March but received around $20 million in the form of stock benefits.

Actor Nawazuddin Siddiqui's wife Aaliya, who had filed for divorce, has said they will try to sort out the problems between them. "For the last 10 days, I have been battling the COVID-19 virus...Despite being extremely busy, Nawaz is taking good care of both our children...I am very impressed with this side of Nawaz," she said.

Actor Saif Ali Khan was spotted at a COVID-19 vaccination centre in Mumbai on Friday. As per several reports, he received the first dose of the vaccine. As he walked out of the centre, the actor said 'Hi' to the photographers. Saif recently welcomed a baby boy with wife Kareena Kapoor.

Nine great apes at US' San Diego Zoo were given experimental COVID-19 vaccines for animals. Orangutan named Karen, the first ape in the world to have open-heart surgery in 1994, was also among the first great apes to get the vaccine. In January, eight gorillas at the zoo became the first great apes in the world to test coronavirus positive.

The release of Vin Diesel's 'F9', the ninth instalment in the 'Fast & Furious' franchise, has been postponed. The film, which was supposed to release on May 28, will now hit the theatres on June 25. The Justin Lin directorial was originally scheduled for release on May 22, 2020, but was delayed multiple times due to the coronavirus pandemic.

As many as 25 students and three staff members of a residential government school for differently-abled children were among 28 people to test positive for COVID-19 in Rajasthan's Udaipur on Friday. Udaipur Chief Medical Health Officer (CMHO) Dr Dinesh Kharadi said that 80 students and 10 staff members of the school were tested after a teacher tested positive for coronavirus.

Serum Institute of India (SII) has written to the PM's Office proposing reforms in the drug regulatory system. A provision, that allowed manufacturing and stockpiling of COVID-19 vaccines during clinical trial, should also be implemented for non-COVID-19 vaccines, SII said. "Because of this...we could make the vaccine [Covishield] available in...a short span of time to protect millions," it added.

Serum Institute of India CEO Adar Poonawalla told a World Bank panel that a US law blocking export of raw materials, including bags and filters, will hamper global vaccination efforts. "The Novavax vaccine, which we're a major manufacturer for, needs these items from...US," he added. The US government had invoked the Defense Production Act to prioritise supplies for Pfizer vaccine.

Rajasthan Chief Minister Ashok Gehlot on Friday received his first dose of COVID-19 vaccine at SMS Medical College, Jaipur. Following the inoculation, he said, "Around two lakh people are getting vaccinated each day in Rajasthan. This is due to people's confidence in state's COVID-19 management." Gehlot told ANI that Rajasthan currently accounts for 25% of India's overall vaccination drive.

Former Karnataka CM Siddaramaiah has urged PM Narendra Modi to reconsider the decision to allow private hospitals to charge ?250 for administering the COVID-19 vaccine. It will "adversely impact" the fight against COVID-19, he said. "The office of Prime Minister has failed to release accounts of the PM-CARES Fund and also failed to provide vaccination at zero cost," Siddaramaiah added.

Punjab CM Captain Amarinder Singh was administered with the first dose of the COVID-19 vaccine at Civil Hospital in Mohali on Friday. "I got my first shot of COVID-19 vaccine today. I urge all above 60 years of age or above 45 years with co-morbidities to get the vaccination done as soon as possible," Singh tweeted.

BJP national spokesperson Sambit Patra on Friday said that the opposition created confusion in the country about the efficacy of indigenous COVID-19 vaccine (Covaxin) and taunted PM Narendra Modi and other ministers to take it. "We saw that when [PM's]...turn...came, he went to AIIMS, stood in the line, and took the shot of the indigenous vaccine," Patra added.

As many as 13 private hospitals in Mumbai began COVID-19 vaccination drive from Thursday, Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) tweeted. Nanavati Hospital, Fortis Hospital, Mulund, and Lilavati Hospital are among these 13 hospitals. Notably, persons above 60 and above 45 with comorbidities are getting vaccinated in the ongoing second phase of nationwide COVID-19 vaccination drive.

A passenger on a Pune-bound IndiGo flight at Delhi airport informed the crew on board on Thursday that he tested positive for COVID-19, an IndiGo official said. "The flight was reported to be delayed for about two hours...The pilot of the aircraft turned back the flight from the runway to taxi-bay and offloaded all the passengers," the official added.

Ex-Pakistan fast bowler Shoaib Akhtar has criticised Pakistan Cricket Board (PCB) over Pakistan Super League (PSL) bubble after the league got postponed due to coronavirus cases in the competition. "Why did PCB not get a specific hotel for all the players?" he asked. He added, "Bubble was being breached, models were coming, weddings were happening, players were taking photos."

A total of 10 first-year MBBS students of Pandit Deendayal Upadhyay Medical College in Rajkot tested positive for COVID-19 over the past two days, college dean Dr Mukesh Samani said. He said that on-campus classes for the first-year students were suspended for a week. He also added that a section of COVID-19 hospital was reserved for students' treatment.

At least 10 staff of Radha Krishna restaurant, located in SV Road, Andheri West in Mumbai, tested positive for COVID-19. All of them have been shifted to BKC Jumbo COVID-19 centre for treatment, Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation said. As many as 35 restaurant staff were tested for COVID-19 and those whose reports came negative have been quarantined in a nearby hotel.

Queen Mary's School in Delhi's Tis Hazari, which announced a five-day closure till March 6 after a student reportedly tested COVID-19 positive, has filed a police complaint against the student's family. The school alleged it found the report by that number was issued to a man who tested negative. "We forwarded the report we had received," said the student's mother.

After the ongoing season of the PSL 2021 was postponed due to the outbreak of COVID-19 inside the bio-secure bubble, ex-Pakistan captain Inzamam-ul-Haq said PSL should "pinpoint the culprits". "This can create future problems...Now, will other countries send their players to our country?" asked Inzamam. As many as seven cases were reported in the competition.

India reported 16,838 new COVID-19 cases and 113 deaths in the last 24 hours, as per the Union Health Ministry. The total caseload in India reached 1,11,73,761 and the death toll stood at 1,57,548. Following the discharge of 13,819 patients, the active COVID-19 cases in the country stood at 1,76,319. India has vaccinated 1,80,05,503 people so far.

Reliance Industries will bear the full cost of COVID-19 vaccination of its employees, their spouses, parents and children, who are eligible, the company's Non-Executive Director Nita Ambani said. In a letter, she urged all employees to register for India's vaccination programme. Earlier, IT companies, including Infosys and Accenture, said that they will bear employees' vaccination costs.

The recent hike in platform ticket cost at some stations is "temporary" and is aimed at preventing overcrowding amid COVID-19, the Railways said on Friday. Saying that there was "nothing new" about the "short-term crowd control measure", Railways added, "Considering the upsurge of COVID-19 in few states, Indian Railway is discouraging people from unnecessary crowding at the platforms."

French IT firm Capgemini on Thursday said that it will cover the cost of COVID-19 vaccination of its employees in India and their dependents who are part of its medical benefits program. The company currently employs about 1.25 lakh people in India. Earlier, Infosys and Accenture also announced that they'll cover the vaccination costs of their employees in India.

The Delhi High Court on Thursday directed the Serum Institute of India (SII) and Bharat Biotech to disclose their capacities to manufacture COVID-19 vaccines, Covishield and Covaxin. "We're not utilising it (capacity) fully. We are either donating it to foreign countries or selling it to foreign countries," the High Court said. "We are not vaccinating our own people," it added.

Spanish King Felipe VI's sisters, Princess Elena and Princess Cristina, are facing backlash for getting COVID-19 vaccine shots during a trip to UAE last month to see their father. The Princesses said they accepted the vaccination in the hope of obtaining a "vaccination passport" for regularly visiting their father. Spain is currently only administering vaccines to elderly and essential workers.

India recorded 17,407 new COVID-19 cases and 89 deaths in the last 24 hours, according to Union Health Ministry. This is India's highest one-day spike of new COVID-19 cases since January 29. With this, the total number of COVID-19 cases in India surged to 1,11,56,923, while the death toll rose to 1,57,435.

Saudi Arabia's Health Ministry has said that only people who have been vaccinated against COVID-19 will be allowed to attend the Haj this year, local media reported. However, it did not mention the number of pilgrims that the Kingdom would allow this year. Last year, Saudi Arabia had banned arrivals from abroad for Haj due to coronavirus pandemic.

Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman on Thursday tweeted that she received the "first dose of the vaccination against COVID-19". "Thanking sister Ramya PC for her care and professionalism. Fortunate to be in India, where development and dissemination has been prompt and affordable," Sitharaman said. Earlier, Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal also received the first dose of COVID-19 vaccine.

South Korea's economy declined for the first time in 22 years in 2020, its central bank said. The country's Gross Domestic Product (GDP) contracted by 1% from 2019, according to the preliminary data released by the Bank of Korea. The decline comes amid the coronavirus pandemic that has severely affected the services industries such as restaurants and transportation.

Zimbabwe has become the first African country to approve Bharat Biotech's Covaxin, India's indigenous COVID-19 vaccine, for use. "Trying to get it to Zimbabwe at an early date," the Indian Embassy in Zimbabwe tweeted. This comes after Bharat Biotech said that the vaccine has an 81% interim efficacy in preventing COVID-19 in those without prior infection after the second dose.

Speaking about the plans to resume theatres post the COVID-19 pandemic, actress Janhvi Kapoor said, "Theatre is a big part of our culture and we can't let it die." "2020 has been a difficult year for us...but I hope people will finally step out to theatres now while maintaining safety and precautions," she added.

Maharashtra Education Minister Varsha Gaikwad on Thursday said the state board examinations for classes 10 and 12 will be held as per the schedule. "The health of our students is a prime concern for us but it is also important that their academic year doesn't go to waste," Gaikwad said amid concerns over rising COVID-19 cases in the state.

Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal and his parents got the first dose of COVID-19 vaccine at the LNJP hospital. "We took Covishield. We don't have any problems (after vaccination) and are in good health," Kejriwal said. People above 60 years of age and those above 45 years with comorbidities are getting inoculated in this phase of COVID-19 vaccination.

The number of new coronavirus cases in Europe rose by 9% last week after declining for six weeks, the WHO said. "We're seeing a resurgence in central and Eastern Europe. New cases are also on...rise in several western European countries where rates were already high," it added. The WHO called for an accelerated roll-out of COVID-19 vaccines in Europe.

The Health Ministry stated that 10.93 lakh people were vaccinated against coronavirus till 7 pm on Thursday, taking the tally of vaccine doses administered to 1.77 crore. This is the first time more than 10 lakh people received vaccination against coronavirus in the country in a single day. The second phase of the vaccination began on March 1.

Actor Hrithik Roshan's parents, director Rakesh Roshan and his wife Pinkie Roshan received the first dose of COVID-19 vaccine on Thursday. Taking to Instagram, Rakesh wrote while sharing a picture, "Unique day once in our lifetime 4321, 4th March 21 to get vaccinated GO AHEAD." Meanwhile, Pinkie also shared a photo captioned, "#covieshield vaccine taken...better to shield than to expose."

The Pune Municipal Corporation (PMC) won't declare large areas as containment zones but instead focus on buildings, housing societies and small areas to ensure restrictions don't affect others, Mayor Murlidhar Mohol said. The PMC will paste stickers on the entrance doors of the houses that have COVID-19 infected patients. It will also put stamps on the wrists of the patients.

Pakistan all-rounder Shadab Khan, who represents Islamabad United in Pakistan Super League (PSL), reacted to the tournament being postponed due to COVID-19 cases. He tweeted, "Ya Allah humary PSL ko kis ke nazar laga de (Ya Allah, who jinxed our PSL?)" Reacting to it, a fan tweeted, "They call him Dale Steyn." "International cricketers shouldn't tweet such things," wrote another.

Police in China and South Africa have seized thousands of doses of counterfeit coronavirus vaccine, Interpol said. Police have arrested around 80 people in China at a factory, where over 3,000 doses were found. Three Chinese nationals and a Zambian national were detained at a warehouse in Gauteng, South Africa, where ampoules containing 2,400 doses were discovered, Interpol added.

Rio de Janeiro, Brazil's second-biggest city, will impose a night curfew and restrict certain businesses to curb the spread of coronavirus, according to information published in the city's official bulletin on Thursday. Over the past few days, several states and cities, including the country's capital Braslia, have announced restrictions amid rising COVID-19 cases.

The ongoing season of PSL 2021 has been postponed with immediate effect due to the outbreak of COVID-19. "The decision was made after seven cases were reported in the competition, which had started on February 20," an official release from the Pakistan Cricket Board (PCB) stated. The PCB added that it would provide vaccine to the teams.

Europe's biggest airline group Lufthansa, after posting an annual loss of $8.1 billion, has said that the company will take longer than previously anticipated to achieve a full recovery from the COVID-19 crisis. "We expect demand to pick up again as soon as restrictive travel limits are reduced by a further roll-out of tests and vaccines," CEO Carsten Spohr said.

Former Prime Minister Manmohan Singh and his wife Gursharan Kaur on Thursday received the first dose of COVID-19 vaccine at AIIMS in New Delhi. Singh reportedly left AIIMS nearly half an hour after being given the vaccine dose. Earlier in the day, Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal and his parents got the first dose of COVID-19 vaccine at the LNJP hospital.

Amid rising COVID-19 cases in Mumbai, the police took action against 58,000 people who were found without a mask in public places in the last 13 days. "Police have collected a fine of ?1.16 crore so far," Mumbai Police PRO stated. Mumbai on Wednesday reported 1,121 new COVID-19 cases, taking the caseload so far to 3,28,740.

Former India captain Kapil Dev on Wednesday received his first dose of COVID-19 vaccine at the Fortis Hospital in New Delhi. The 62-year-old underwent an angioplasty in October last year after he complained of chest pain. Apart from Kapil Dev, current India head coach Ravi Shastri and ex-India cricketer Madan Lal have also received their first dose of COVID-19 vaccine.

Delhi High Court on Thursday observed that the government was either donating or selling COVID-19 vaccines to foreign countries and not vaccinating its own citizens. "There has to be a sense of responsibility and urgency," the court added. It also asked the Centre to explain why it had kept strict control over the class of persons who can be vaccinated.

Canada on Wednesday thanked India for providing 5 lakh doses of the Covishield vaccine. Canada will receive 15 lakh more vaccine doses from Serum Institute of India, Public Services and Procurement Minister Anita Anand said. Last month, PM Narendra Modi assured Canadian PM Justin Trudeau that "India would do its best to facilitate supplies of COVID-19 vaccines sought by Canada".

Gurugram health department has directed private and government hospitals designated as COVID-19 vaccination centres to assign slots on the CoWIN portal 15 days to one month in advance. They added that this will help people reserve appointments online by choosing the date and location most convenient to them. Private hospitals will also keep slots open for walk-in beneficiaries, officials said.

External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar on Thursday reached Bangladesh ahead of PM Narendra Modi's visit to the country and held talks with Bangladesh Foreign Minister AK Abdul Momen. He said Bangladesh is central to India's neighbourhood first policy. "The largest number of vaccines shipped by India to any foreign country so far, 9 million, has been to Bangladesh," Jaishankar added.

Central Board of Direct Taxes (CBDT) has asked NRIs and foreign nationals facing double taxation because of forced overstay in India due to COVID-19-related travel restrictions to submit the details by March 31. CBDT will consider providing either a general relaxation or specific relaxation in individual cases. India had suspended scheduled international flights on March 22, 2020 due to COVID-19.

A video of a dance instructor named Gurdeep Pandher doing Bhangra on a frozen lake in Canada to celebrate getting Covid-19 vaccine has gone viral on social media. "I went to a frozen lake to dance the Bhangra on it for joy, hope, and positivity, which I'm forwarding across Canada and beyond for everyone's health and well-being," he had tweeted.

Hyderabad reported 25 fresh cases of COVID-19 on Wednesday while the total number of cases recorded from all across Telangana stood at 152. With 152 new cases, the state's tally has reached 2,99,406. The latest numbers suggest that there are 1,948 active cases in the state and 2,95,821 patients have recovered and been discharged so far.

Trinamool Congress (TMC) has written to the Election Commission alleging that use of PM Narendra Modi's photo in digital COVID-19 vaccination certificates violates Model Code of Conduct. The party accused the PM of "exploiting his post" and stealing credit from vaccine makers. TMC urged the EC to stop PM from "taking unfair advantages and undue publicity at tax payer's cost".

As many as 2,153 senior citizens and people with comorbidities were given COVID-19 vaccines in Bengaluru on Tuesday, Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike (BBMP) said. This is only 51% of the targeted vaccine shots as technical issues persisted on CoWIN portal in some hospitals, it added. BBMP Commissioner N Manjunatha Prasad said he had informed the health department about the issues.

Pune Municipal Corporation (PMC) has decided to start vaccination centres at 31 hospitals ? 28 government and three private ? to meet the third-phase rush. "The COVID-19 vaccination was at four centres on Monday and eight centres on Tuesday," Additional Municipal Commissioner, Rubal Agarwal said. "Our aim is to make 100 vaccine centres operational in the coming days," Agarwal added.

The Centre on Tuesday approved 29 private hospitals in Mumbai to administer the COVID-19 vaccine for senior citizens above 60 years and those above 45 years with co-morbidities. "Private hospitals are an essential part of the medical healthcare structure. All major hospitals have over 2,000 healthcare staff who can help expedite the process," a doctor said.

Bharat Biotech has said its COVID-19 vaccine COVAXIN demonstrated 81% interim efficacy in preventing COVID-19 in those without prior infection after the second dose in Phase 3 clinical trial. The company said the trials involved 25,800 subjects, the largest ever conducted in India, in partnership with ICMR. The clinical trial will continue through to final analysis at 130 confirmed cases.

The Indian Medical Association (IMA) has urged the government to provide COVID-19 vaccines to all citizens free of cost so that herd immunity is achieved soon. It also requested PM Narendra Modi to ensure that the registration portal for the vaccination is more public-friendly. "We can tide over the crisis immediately," said IMA Maharashtra President Dr Ramkrishna Londhe.

Veteran actor Satish Shah on Tuesday revealed he received the coronavirus vaccine at a vaccination centre in Mumbai. He wrote on Twitter, "Stood for three hours in the hot sun at BKC and got [vaccination] done. Total chaos outside but very disciplined inside. Got politely scolded for not availing VIP entrance but felt good behaving like RK Laxman's common man."

President Ram Nath Kovind on Wednesday received his first dose of COVID-19 vaccine at RR Hospital in Delhi. Earlier, Prime Minister Narendra Modi took his first dose of COVID-19 vaccine at Delhi's AIIMS and said, "Remarkable how our doctors and scientists have worked in quick time to strengthen the global fight against COVID-19."

A 45-year-old man in Maharashtra died shortly after taking the second dose of COVID-19 vaccine. Sukhdev Kirdat, who worked as a driver with a doctor, fainted in an observation room around 15 to 20 minutes after taking the dose. Kirdat was taken to a hospital, where he was declared dead. Doctors said the cause of death is not known yet.

Director Sanjay Gupta, while speaking about why he preferred a theatrical release of 'Mumbai Saga' amid the coronavirus pandemic, said, "John (Abraham) wanted a theatrical run since December. Emraan (Hashmi) backed him." "They gave us...faith to take...risk of a big-screen release," he added. "Wear masks, and watch [it] only if you feel comfortable. I don't want...packed hall," he further said.

Kenya on Wednesday received 10.02 lakh COVID-19 vaccines under the WHO-led COVAX scheme that aims to distribute vaccines for free to poor countries. The doses are developed by the Serum Institute of India. "We've been fighting the pandemic with rubber bullets but what we've acquired today is equivalent, metaphorically speaking, to bazookas and machine guns," Health Minister Mutahi Kagwe said.

Brazilian footballer Pele received the COVID-19 vaccine on Tuesday. Pele took to Instagram to share photo of himself wearing a mask and giving a thumbs-up while receiving his shot. "Today was an unforgettable day. I received the vaccine...The pandemic is not over. We must remain disciplined to save lives," Pele wrote, while advocating mask-wearing, social distancing and hand-washing.

Speaking about ramping up coronavirus vaccinations in the US, President Joe Biden said, "We're...on track to have enough vaccine supply for every adult in America by the end of May." The US had earlier estimated that the target would be reached by the end of July. Biden's comment came after drugmaker Merck agreed to make rival Johnson & Johnson's vaccine.

Merck will help manufacture rival Johnson & Johnson's (J&J) single-shot COVID-19 vaccine in "an unprecedented historic step" to boost production in the US, the White House said. This will allow J&J to accelerate delivery of 100 million vaccine doses by around a month, the country's health department said. Merck had halted its COVID-19 vaccine development in January after "disappointing" results.

Kerala Chief Minister Pinarayi Vijayan was on Wednesday administered the first dose of COVID-19 vaccine in Thiruvananthapuram. "Unlike other vaccinations, there is no pain of the medicine going into the body," Vijayan said. "I took half an hour rest, no physical discomfort has been noticed," he added. He appealed to all eligible people to come forward and get themselves vaccinated.

The UK on Tuesday said it will receive 1 crore AstraZeneca COVID-19 vaccines made by the Serum Institute of India (SII). It was earlier reported that Britain's Medicines and Healthcare products Regulatory Agency (MHRA) was auditing the manufacturing processes at SII before placing orders. SII's order is a part of the 10 crore AstraZeneca doses ordered by the UK.

Texas Governor Greg Abbott has removed all mask requirements across the state and authorised businesses restricted because of the coronavirus pandemic to open "100%". Abbott claimed that the situation in Texas has improved enough to ease the COVID-19 restrictions. However, local officials can still apply limits to businesses where hospitalisations remain high, according to the order.

Maharashtra Prison Department is in the process of directing the district administrations to draw up a list of inmates who are eligible for the COVID-19 vaccination. Clarity will be sought on how and when inmates can be vaccinated, officials said. List is being prepared with difficulty as the number of undertrials are dynamic, with many out on bail, officials added.

A 23-year-old final-year MBBS student, who had tested positive for coronavirus, died in Bihar's Begusarai. The Nalanda Medical College and Hospital's student reportedly took the first shot of the COVID-19 vaccine in first week of February. Condoling his demise, Bihar Health Minister Mangal Pandey said, "Some more doctors have reportedly tested positive after his death."

Health Minister Harsh Vardhan, External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar, Law Minister Ravi Shankar Prasad and several government officials opted for Bharat Biotech's COVID-19 vaccine, instead of the AstraZeneca one. They followed the lead of PM Modi who took a shot of the Indian-made Covaxin to reduce hesitance. Earlier, states expressed concern over lack of phase 3 data of Covaxin.

Pune Municipal Corporation has declared 42 micro-containment zones in 10 ward offices in the city, two months after declaring Pune as a no-containment zone. Hadapsar-Kondhwa ward office area has the highest number of micro-containment zones at seven. Assistant municipal commissioners have been asked to declare buildings and small localities with a minimum of five cases as micro-containment zones.

Health Minister Harsh Vardhan has said that people in India can get vaccinated against COVID-19 24x7 at their convenience. "The government has removed time constraint to increase the speed of vaccination," he stated. Earlier, the Centre directed states to utilise all private hospitals, including those that are not empanelled under government health insurance schemes, for the vaccination exercise.

Infosys and Accenture on Wednesday said they would cover the COVID-19 vaccination costs of their employees and their immediate families in India. Accenture will cover the vaccination cost for its staff as well as their dependents who are part of the company's medical benefits programme. Infosys is looking at partnering with healthcare providers for vaccinating its employees and their families.

Actress Richa Chadha, while addressing the hit entertainment industry took during the lockdown due to the COVID-19 pandemic, said that the government should reduce taxes on ticket prices to give "better impetus" to the film industry. She added, "When things start getting better, people won't choose to confine themselves." Richa stated the move will draw audiences to cinema halls.

India has reported 14,989 new COVID-19 cases and 98 fatalities in the last 24 hours, as per the Union Health Ministry. With this, the total number of cases rose to 1,11,39,516, while the death toll reached 1,57,346. As many as 13,123 patients were discharged, taking the total recoveries to 1,08,12,044. The country's active cases now stand at 1,70,126.

Mumbai on Tuesday reported two COVID-19 deaths, the lowest in ten months since April 2020. A total of 11,476 people have died of COVID-19 in Mumbai so far. The city witnessed 903 recoveries on Tuesday as against the 849 new cases. The caseload in Mumbai reached 3,27,619 and the recoveries stood at 3,05,639. Mumbai has 9,633 active COVID-19 cases now.

After Australian spinner Fawad Ahmed tested positive for COVID-19 in the ongoing Pakistan Super League, three more people tested positive on Tuesday. This comes after 242 PCR tests were conducted on all the franchises, their officials and support staff since Monday. "I can confirm that two foreign players and one support staff member have tested positive," said a PCB official.

India head coach Ravi Shastri got his first dose of COVID-19 vaccine in Ahmedabad. Sharing a picture, Shastri wrote, "Thank you to the amazing medical professionals and scientists for empowering India against the pandemic." "Extremely impressed with the professionalism shown by Kantaben and her team at Apollo, Ahmedabad in dealing with COVID-19 vaccination," he added.

Executive Director of WHO's Health Emergencies Programme, Mike Ryan, has said that it was "premature" and "unrealistic" to think that the COVID-19 pandemic might be stopped by the end of the year. "If we're smart, we can finish with the hospitalisations and the deaths and the tragedy associated with this pandemic by the end of the year," he added.

India reported 12,286 new COVID-19 cases and 91 deaths in the last 24 hours, according to Union Health Ministry. This is the lowest one-day spike in COVID-19 cases and related deaths since February 23. With this, India's total number of COVID-19 cases climbed to 1,11,24,527, while the death toll rose to 1,57,248.

Commenting on people attending live concerts amid the ongoing coronavirus pandemic, singer Armaan Malik tweeted, "I'm seeing so many live concerts on my timeline where people in the audience are without masks." Replying to Armaan's tweet, a user wrote, "They think that COVID-19 has gone." Another tweeted, "There shouldn't even be any concerts during this pandemic."

Former US President Donald Trump and his wife, Melania Trump, were vaccinated against coronavirus in January before leaving the White House, according to multiple news reports. However, it was not immediately clear which vaccine or how many doses each had received. The revelation comes after Trump, in his first speech since leaving the White House, urged everyone to get vaccinated.

As new coronavirus infections globally rose last week for the first time in seven weeks, WHO said, "We need to have a stern warning for all of us: that this virus will rebound if we let it." WHO Director-General Tedros Adhanom Ghebreyesus said the rise in cases was "disappointing but not surprising" and urged countries not to relax measures.

Union Minister of State for Home Affairs G Kishan Reddy on Tuesday took the first shot of COVID-19 vaccine at Gandhi Hospital in Hyderabad. Reddy tweeted pictures of him getting vaccinated and wrote, "I thank the scientists, doctors and all other corona warriors who developed the vaccine." Telangana rolled out its second phase of vaccination on Monday.

A total of 4,27,072 COVID-19 vaccine doses were given till 7 pm on the first day of phase two of the nationwide vaccination program, Health Ministry said. As many as 25 lakh beneficiaries registered on the Co-Win portal on Monday, out of which 24.5 lakh were citizen beneficiaries. More than 1.47 crore COVID-19 vaccine doses have been given so far.

Twitter is implementing a strike system under which a user's account will be suspended permanently for repeatedly posting misleading COVID-19 information. A user's account will be permanently banned if it gets five or more strikes for violations of Twitter's policies. Twitter will also label tweets that may contain misleading information about vaccines.

Serum Institute of India's (SII) Executive Director Natasha Poonawalla on Tuesday shared a picture on Instagram where she was seen taking the first dose of the company's coronavirus vaccine Covishield. "Proud to take the jab," wrote Natasha, who's married to SII's CEO Adar Poonawalla. "Only after thorough rounds of clinical trials, Covishield vaccines were deemed safe and effective," she added.

Actor-politician Kamal Haasan took to Twitter to announce that he took his first dose of the COVID-19 vaccine and also encouraged people to get vaccinated. He tweeted, "I got vaccinated for coronavirus at Sri Ramachandra Hospital. Those who care not only for themselves but also for others should put up with it...Vaccination against corruption next month. Get ready."

China aims to vaccinate 40% of its population against coronavirus by the end of July, Zhong Nanshan, a senior health adviser, said on Tuesday. He added that the 40% would include people who have received either one dose or two doses. China, which has approved four domestic coronavirus vaccines, has administered 50.52 million doses till February 28, Zhong further said.

According to BBMP data, 22% of beneficiaries were administered the COVID-19 vaccine shots on Monday in the second phase of the vaccination drive. Out of 4,200 designated beneficiaries, 938 were administered the vaccine shots. BBMP Commissioner N Manjunatha Prasad said that the Co-WIN app and portal were unable to handle the traffic and the glitches need to be fixed soon.

Speaking about travelling amid the COVID-19 pandemic, actress Sonnalli Seygall said, "I realised we can't stop living our lives in fear...We just have to be careful yet live our life." She added that post the lockdown she has been travelling a lot for work. "As long as you maintain minimal contact, it is all fine," Sonnalli said.

Some technical glitch in Co-WIN portal led to a huge crowd gathering at Mumbai's Bandra Kurla Complex (BKC) jumbo vaccination centre on Tuesday, according to Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation officials. "Glitch was resolved...and the crowd is under control now," Dean of BKC Rajesh Dere said. He added, "I request citizens to not panic and follow all COVID-19 appropriate norms throughout."

Cricketer-turned-actor Salil Ankola has tested positive for COVID-19, a day ahead of his birthday. "I was shocked the test came out positive. My oxygen level had dropped to 80...I was breathless when I was wheeled in...I was admitted on February 28 at 5 am," he said. He added that it has been a "scary time".

Only two states, Kerala and Maharashtra, are contributing 75% of India's total active coronavirus cases (1,68,358), the Ministry of Health and Welfare said today. There are 78,825 active coronavirus cases in Maharashtra and 48,159 in Kerala. There is a marginal increase in daily new coronavirus cases in India in the last two weeks, the ministry added.

WHO Chief Scientist Soumya Swaminathan on Monday said, "India has shown the capacity to be a manufacturer at the global scale and also be an innovator when it came to [COVID-19] vaccine development." "The intent to have a global footprint in the manufacturing sector when it came to COVID-19 vaccine was path-breaking," NITI Aayog Member Vinod Paul said.

The WHO-led COVAX scheme on Tuesday said that it will deliver 23.7 crore doses of the Oxford-AstraZeneca COVID-19 vaccine to 142 countries by the end of May. The scheme aims to distribute vaccines for free to poor countries, with the first doses being delivered to Ghana last week. COVID-19 has infected over 11.45 crore people in the world.

The Pakistan Super League (PSL) match between Islamabad United and Quetta Gladiators has been rescheduled for Tuesday after Islamabad's Australian spinner Fawad Ahmed tested COVID-19 positive. On Monday, the Pakistan Cricket Board (PCB) first postponed the game by two hours before rescheduling it. "All other Islamabad United players and members have tested negative," Islamabad United tweeted.

Delhi on Monday recorded the highest COVID-19 test positivity rate since January 15. With 175 new COVID-19 cases after 39,733 tests, the positivity rate stood at 0.44%. "The increasing test positivity rate indicates...disease is spreading faster...however, with a seroprevalence of around 56%...hoping that the number of infections will remain under control," a Safdarjung Hospital official said.

Railways Ministry on Monday issued a regulatory filing, directing its catering business arm IRCTC to cancel all existing mobile catering contracts that offer cooked food to passengers. The move comes after Madras High Court directed Railways to consider representation by Indian Railways' Mobile Caterers Association to restore their services that have been suspended since March 2020 over COVID-19.

On her first day as the World Trade Organization (WTO) chief, Ngozi Okonjo-Iweala urged its member states to work with pharmaceutical companies to license more COVID-19 vaccine manufacturing in developing countries to triple global production. "The world has a normal capacity of production of 3.5 billion doses of vaccines and we now seek to manufacture 10 billion doses," Okonjo-Iweala said.

Kerala Health Minister KK Shailaja and Minister of Revenue and Housing E Chandrasekharan on Tuesday received the first dose of the COVID-19 vaccine as the second phase of the vaccination drive continued in the state. They both took the vaccination at Thiruvananthapuram Medical College hospital. Health Minister Shailaja later appealed to the public to take part in the programme.

French Ambassador to India Emmanuel Lenain on Monday visited Bharat Biotech's facility in Hyderabad's Genome Valley. Lenain, after the visit, tweeted, "Glad to visit Bharat Biotech and meet CEO Dr Krishna Ella on the day PM...was inoculated." He also met Gavi board member Mahima Datla and stated that he was "very impressed" to see board's commitment to making COVID-19 vaccine.

The State Bank of India (SBI) has decided to contribute ?11 crore to PM CARES Fund to support next phase of Centre's COVID-19 vaccination drive. "As a responsible Corporate Citizen, we consider it our duty to support government's efforts to vaccinate all," SBI Chairman said. In 2020, SBI committed 0.25% of its annual profit to support the fight against COVID-19.

After Karnataka minister BC Patil took the COVID-19 vaccine shot at his home on Tuesday, the Centre sought a report from the state government. "This is not allowed in the protocol," said Union Health Secretary Rajesh Bhushan on being asked about Patil getting vaccinated at home. Patil had shared a picture of himself receiving the vaccine shot.

NITI Aayog member Dr VK Paul on Tuesday said public compliance of "COVID-19 appropriate behaviour cannot be diluted". He added, "Please avoid large gatherings (like) parties, weddings etc. These could be super spreading events." This came after the second phase of the nationwide vaccination drive began in India on Monday.

RS Sharma, the Chairman of the CoWIN portal, along with Union Health Secretary Rajesh Bhushan will meet representatives from states today to discuss the glitches reported in the portal, Health Minister Harsh Vardhan said on Tuesday. As of 9:30 am today, there have been 39 lakh registrations for COVID-19 vaccine on CoWIN 2.0 portal, Harsh Vardhan added.

Defence Minister Rajnath Singh on Tuesday was administered with the first dose of the COVID-19 vaccine at RR Hospital in New Delhi. "India's resolve for making the country COVID free has been strengthened by this inoculation drive," Singh tweeted. He further said, "The vaccine is completely safe and hassle free."

Union Minister of Law and Justice Ravi Shankar Prasad on Tuesday received his first dose of COVID-19 vaccine at AIIMS Patna. He was administered the first dose a day after the second phase of the mega vaccination drive against the virus began in India. Prasad on Monday said that the ministers have decided to avail the paid vaccination facility.

Central Railway has increased platform tickets in six Mumbai Metropolitan Region (MMR) stations to avoid overcrowding on platforms amid COVID-19, Chief PRO Shivaji M Sutar told PTI. The current ticket price stands at ?50 instead of the earlier ?10. Mumbai's Dadar and Lokmanya Tilak Terminus and CSMT, and neighbouring Thane and Panvel are among stations where prices have been hiked.

TMC leader Derek O'Brien has said that PM Narendra Modi's photo "brazenly" appears on digital COVID-19 vaccination certificates given to beneficiaries even after the dates for Assembly elections in four states and a Union Territory were announced. Alleging it was a violation of the model code of conduct, Derek said Trinamool officials will take this up "strongly with Election Commission".

After being vaccinated against COVID-19 on Tuesday, Union Health Minister Harsh Vardhan said that he "paid ?250 for the vaccine" and "those who can afford it should pay". "This vaccine will work as Sanjeevani. Hanumanji had to cross half the country to get it, but this Sanjeevani is available at your nearby private and government health facilities," the minister added.

Former India cricketer Madan Lal on Tuesday was administered with the first dose of the COVID-19 vaccine. Sharing a picture, the 69-year-old wrote, "In the fight against COVID-19...I'm vaccine strong!!! Proud to get the jab." Earlier in the day, Team India head coach Ravi Shastri took the first dose of the COVID-19 vaccine.

In the second phase of COVID-19 vaccination drive, a total of 4,942 people have received the shot in Karnataka. With this, the total number of those vaccinated in the state so far has reached 8.25 lakh, the Karnataka government said. In 199 sessions held on Monday, 2,264 vaccinated were above 60 years and 624 were between 45-60 years with comorbidities.

As per the Ministry of Health, more than 1.48 crore doses of the COVID-19 vaccine have been administered till Tuesday 1 pm. Out of this, 2.08 lakh doses have been given to people who are 45-59 years of age with comorbidities and people above 60, said Health Secretary Rajesh Bhushan. "Active cases are still less than 2%," Bhushan added.

A 97-year-old man named Ramaswami Parthasarathy was among the first persons to receive COVID-19 vaccine in Bengaluru on the first day of next phase of vaccination drive, Manipal Hospitals said in a statement. "People aged above 60 can directly walk-in for vaccination," they added. Karnataka government has allowed vaccination drive to be conducted on all working days in private hospitals.

At least 153 monks have tested COVID-19 positive at Gyuto Tantric Monastery in Himachal Pradesh's Dharamshala, a government official said on Tuesday. A total of 330 monks were tested for the virus following initial cases on February 23. The monks have been quarantined at the monastery and the locality has been declared a containment zone, the official said.

Fifty-four students of a school hostel have tested positive for COVID-19 in Haryana's Karnal. "Medical teams have reached the spot and the hostel is being marked as a containment zone," Yogesh Kumar Sharma, a Civil Surgeon in Karnal, said. Haryana in December allowed students from Classes 9-12 to go to schools and allowed students from Classes 3-5 from February 24.

Delhi reported zero deaths due to COVID-19 in the last 24 hours, according to data provided by Delhi government's Health Department on Tuesday. The Health Department data also showed that the COVID-19 positivity rate fell from 0.44% to 0.33%. While Delhi reported 217 new cases, 78 more people recovered from COVID-19 in the last 24 hours.

The polling time for the first phase of the West Bengal Assembly polls has been extended by 30 minutes in view of the COVID-19 situation, the Election Commission said on Tuesday. The voting will now be held from 7 am to 6.30 pm. The notification for the first phase of the Assembly polls in the state was issued on Tuesday.

The Hindu wedding ceremony of Shaza Morani and Priyaank Sharma that was supposed to happen in Mumbai has been postponed due to the surge in COVID-19 cases and restrictions in the number of guests because of it. Shaza's uncle Mohammed Morani confirmed the news to The Times of India and said, "We respect the law...will not put anybody to risk."

National Health Authority chairperson RS Sharma on Tuesday said, "Since yesterday, we have had 50 lakh registrations on CoWIN for COVID-19 vaccination." Health Secretary Rajesh Bhushan added that 2.08 lakh doses have been given to people who are aged between 45 and 59 with comorbidities and people more than 60-years-old.

An independent MLA from Maharashtra's Badnera has demanded that the state government lift the lockdown from Amravati. "If a lockdown is not taken back from Amravati, then we will not allow the Assembly session to be run," said MLA Ravi Rana. The government has imposed a lockdown in Amravati till March 8 amid rising COVID-19 cases.

Maharashtra's Pune district on Monday reported 878 fresh COVID-19 cases and one more death due to the disease, according to the state health department. The district's COVID-19 tally has reached 4,10,699, of which 15,199 cases are active. The death toll due to COVID-19 in Pune has reached 8,112, while a total of 3,87,388 patients have recovered so far.

Finland on Monday declared a state of emergency amid a sharp rise in coronavirus cases in the country due to COVID-19 variants. The government has proposed to the parliament a temporary closure of bars and dining at restaurants from March 8 to 28. "The government sees it necessary that we all have fewer contacts," PM Sanna Marin said.

Lawmakers from Ukraine's ruling party said that medical facilities had thrown away some unused COVID-19 vaccines after doctors failed to show up for their appointments to be vaccinated. Ukraine had started its COVID-19 vaccination drive last week, with doctors first in line to be inoculated. The government is working to ensure vaccines don't get thrown away, the Health Minister said.

As the second phase of COVID-19 vaccination began on Monday, Haryana Health Minister Anil Vij urged people to take the vaccine without hesitation. He tweeted he can't take the second dose now as his antibody count is 300 after getting COVID-19, which is "too much". He added that perhaps the trial vaccine he took has contributed to his antibody count.

External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar on Monday took the first dose of the COVID-19 vaccine. After taking the vaccine, Jaishankar tweeted, "Got my jab. For the curious, it was Covaxin. Felt secure, will travel safely." Earlier, PM Narendra Modi took his first dose of the COVID-19 vaccine at AIIMS. PM had appealed to all those eligible to take the vaccine.

Union Minister Ashwini Kumar Choubey on Monday said PM Narendra Modi is providing COVID-19 vaccine to citizens like Lord Hanuman provided 'sanjivni booti'. Choubey added that PM Modi taking the vaccine is inspirational for others. "The PM got his vaccination on the day when the drive started for common people," the Minister of State for Health and Family Welfare said.

The Supreme Court judges will get COVID-19 vaccine shots from Tuesday. The MoHFW has issued a clarification on a report that said the judges would be able to choose between the two vaccines ? Bharat Biotech's Covaxin and SII's Covishield. The Ministry said judges won't be allowed to choose and the process would be held entirely through the Co-WIN portal.

Union Civil Aviation Minister Hardeep Singh Puri on Monday said, "The number of domestic passengers on February 28, 2021, rose to 3.13 lakh on 2,353 flights." He added, "This is the highest number since the resumption of domestic flights on May 25, 2020." Earlier, Puri had indicated that flight operations will reach pre-COVID-19 levels soon.

While responding on whether he will take the COVID-19 vaccine or not, senior Congress leader Mallikarjun Kharge said that vaccine should be given to youngsters. He said, "I am above 70-years of age. You should give it to youngsters who have a longevity in life as opposed to me." "I merely have 10-15 more years to live," he added.

South Korea's President Moon Jae-in said that the Tokyo Olympics may provide a chance to reopen dialogue between North Korea and the United States. He said that the games may also open talks between North Korea and Japan, and the two Koreas. Speaking at a ceremony, he also expressed hope for Korea and Japan to revive their COVID-19-hit economies.

Vice President M Venkaiah Naidu took his first dose of the COVID-19 vaccine on Monday in Chennai. According to a tweet by the Vice President's secretariat, Naidu was vaccinated at the Government Medical College in Chennai. The Vice President appealed that all eligible people should get themselves vaccinated proactively and join in the fight against coronavirus.

As the second phase of COVID-19 vaccination began on Monday, Health Minister Harsh Vardhan said that a provision is in place to streamline the walk-in system for beneficiaries within a week. "There are many people in the country who can't access or face difficulties in booking...As of now, there is no issue in the Co-WIN portal," Vardhan added.

As many as 12 students at Kasturba Gandhi Balika Vidyalaya (KGBV) in Telangana's Sangareddy district have tested positive for COVID-19 within a week of returning to their hostels. A total of 150 members had taken the rapid antigen tests, out of which 12 tested positive. ?Parents of those who tested positive for COVID-19 were informed," said District Education Officer.

As India began the second phase of its nationwide vaccination drive, Union Health Minister Dr Harsh Vardhan on Monday said that the number of hospitalisations due to vaccination is negligible. He added that no death that occurred after inoculation has been linked to COVID-19 vaccines. Vaccination side effects are minimal like swelling or fever, Vardhan said.

Mumbai reported 855 fresh COVID-19 cases and four more deaths on Monday, taking the city's caseload to 3,26,770 and the death toll to 11,474, according to data issued by the Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation. The number of active cases in the city stands at 9,690. As many as 876 COVID-19 patients have recovered in the last 24 hours.

India reported a spike of 15,510 COVID-19 cases along with 106 deaths in the last 24 hours, according to the Union Health Ministry. This is the first time since February 24 that India's single-day spike has gone below the 16,000 mark. With this, India's total number of COVID-19 cases rose to 1,10,96,731 while death toll climbed to 1,57,157.

After Prime Minister Narendra Modi took his first dose of the COVID-19 vaccine on Monday, Union Health Minister Harsh Vardhan tweeted, "PM Narendra Modi has given a big message by taking a dose of indigenous vaccine Covaxin." The Health Minister added that it was a message for people who were questioning this vaccine and the ability of the Indian scientists.

Karnataka Health Department has allocated seven government and 21 private facilities in BBMP and Bengaluru Urban areas for conducting the next phase of COVID-19 vaccination drive from today. Initially, vaccination will be done for online registered beneficiaries in state's urban areas and private facilities. Notably, persons above 60 and above 45 years with comorbidities can get vaccinated.

Odisha Chief Minister Naveen Patnaik on Monday took the first dose of the COVID-19 vaccine and shared a photo of himself getting the shot. He appealed to all eligible people to come forward and get vaccinated for a "Covid Free Odisha". He tweeted, "Grateful to our scientists, health workers for their race against time to deliver the vaccines to people."

Nepal's Army chief General Purna Chandra Thapa on Monday received his first dose of the Covishield vaccine, manufactured in India by the Serum Institute of India (SII). Nepal had launched its mass vaccination drive against COVID-19 in January. Nepal has reported over 2.74 lakh coronavirus cases and nearly 2,800 COVID-19 deaths, according to the Johns Hopkins University tracker.
