Less than 10% of the world's population has developed antibodies against COVID-19, the WHO said. However, there are some areas, like densely populated urban settlements, where 50-60% of the population have developed antibodies against COVID-19, it added. The vaccines approved so far offer good protection against severe disease, hospitalisation and death from COVID-19, it further said.

NCP chief Sharad Pawar and his daughter MP Supriya Sule took their first dose of the COVID-19 vaccine at Mumbai's JJ Hospital. The second phase of the COVID-19 vaccination drive began in India on Monday. "To strengthen the vaccination drive, I appeal to all those who are eligible to take the vaccine and join the fight against coronavirus," Pawar said.

British-Swedish drugmaker AstraZeneca has sold its 7.7% stake in American pharma company Moderna for more than $1 billion, The Times reported. The sale was made after Moderna's shares soared on the back of its coronavirus vaccine breakthrough, the report added. AstraZeneca is retaining partnership with Moderna on other disease treatments, the report added.

Sister P Niveda from Puducherry administered the first dose of coronavirus vaccine to PM Narendra Modi at Delhi's AIIMS. "He asked us where do we belong to and after vaccination he said, 'Laga bhi di, pata hi nahi chala'," she said. She added that the second dose of Bharat Biotech's Covaxin will be administered to PM Modi after 28 days.

The second phase of COVID-19 vaccination drive will be conducted at 10 locations across Madhya Pradesh's Indore, district COVID-19 Nodal Officer Dr Amit Malakar said. "Of [these 10], 3 are government hospitals/colleges," he added. Nationwide vaccination drive for those above 60 and above 45 with comorbidities has begun today. PM Narendra Modi took first dose of vaccine at AIIMS Delhi.

Celebrities attended the 78th Golden Globe Awards in person and also virtually from their homes amid COVID-19. The award ceremony, held from two locations in the US, saw 'Nomadland' win the Best Motion Picture, Chadwick Boseman win Best Actor posthumously and Andra Day win the Best Actress award. Celebrities attending the awards virtually dressed up at home.

Bihar Chief Minister Nitish Kumar on Monday said that COVID-19 vaccination will be "absolutely free" in the entire Bihar state. He said, "Such facility will be made available even at private hospitals. It will be facilitated by the state government." Notably, the Centre on Saturday announced that private COVID-19 vaccination centres can charge up to ?250 per dose of vaccine.

Ghana's President Nana Akufo-Addo has become the first person in the world to be vaccinated against coronavirus under the WHO-led COVAX scheme. He received his first dose on Monday. "It's important that I set the example that this vaccine is safe by being the first to have it, so that everybody...can feel comfortable about taking this vaccine," he said.

PM Narendra Modi, who took the first dose of the COVID-19 vaccine at AIIMS Delhi today, joked with the nursing officers to put them at ease, AIIMS chief Dr Randeep Guleria said. PM talked to them "in local language and enquired where they were from", Dr Guleria said, adding, "It really helped because nurses weren't aware whom they'd be vaccinating."

Pune Municipal Corporation (PMC) has made a budgetary provision of ?10 crore in the civic budget 2021-22 as part of preparatory measures amid a rise in COVID-19 cases. President of Standing Committee, Hemant Rasne, said, "PMC has spent around ?250 crore to ?300 crore so far to tackle the pandemic." Pune currently has around 4,919 active cases.

PM Narendra Modi's move to get inoculated with COVID-19 vaccine on first day of the second phase of vaccination drive should "eliminate hesitancy" from people's minds and "instill confidence" in them, AIIMS Director Dr Randeep Guleria said. He added that PM Modi was kept under observation for half-an-hour after taking the vaccine as per protocol. "He's fine," Guleria further said.

Registration of those eligible to get COVID-19 vaccine shots from today is to be done through the website cowin.gov.in only, the government has said. "There's no CoWIN app for beneficiary registration. The app on Play Store is for administrators only," said the health ministry. Those aged above 60 and those above 45 with co-morbidities can get vaccine shots from today.

Jamaican sprinter Yohan Blake has said that he would rather "miss Tokyo Olympics than take COVID-19 vaccine". "My mind still stays strong, I don't want any vaccine...I am not taking it...I have my reasons," Blake said. This comes after International Olympic Committee has "encouraged" all athletes travelling for the Olympics to take a vaccine but hasn't made it compulsory.

After PM Narendra Modi took his first dose of Bharat Biotech's Covaxin, the biotechnology firm tweeted, "Inspired and humbled by honourable PM's remarkable commitment to build an Aatmanirbhar Bharat." "Yes, we all shall fight #COVID-19 together and emerge victorious," the tweet added. PM Modi was administered the vaccine at AIIMS Delhi by Sister P Niveda from Puducherry.

Prime Minister Narendra Modi took his first dose of the COVID-19 vaccine at Delhi's AIIMS today as the second phase of vaccination drive began in India. Sharing a picture, he tweeted, "Remarkable how our doctors and scientists have worked in quick time to strengthen the global fight against COVID-19." He further appealed to all those eligible to take the vaccine.

Many people arrived at Mumbai's BKC Jumbo COVID-19 Hospital in Bandra as nationwide vaccination drive for those above 60 and above 45 with comorbidities began today. Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) has designated five free and three paid centres for first day of drive. "The number of centres will be gradually increased," BMC Additional Commissioner (Western Suburbs) Suresh Kakani said.

Private and government primary schools in Uttar Pradesh greeted students of Classes 1 to 5 with balloons and flowers on Monday as they reopened nearly a year after they were shut due to COVID-19. Meanwhile, Rawat Pathshala in Gorakhpur welcomed students with 'aarti' and 'tika'. The teachers were instructed to decorate schools by Basic Education Department of Uttar Pradesh.

A two-week lockdown was announced in Brazil's capital on Sunday to reduce the spread of COVID-19. Over the past week, at least eight Brazilian states adopted curfew measures due to the rise in COVID-19 cases and deaths. On Thursday, Brazil recorded the most number of deaths from the virus at 1,541 while 2,54,000 people have died overall in the country.

As COVID-19 cases continue to surge in Maharashtra despite lockdown, Chief Minister Uddhav Thackeray said he doesn't want to impose the lockdown but he is helpless. "I don't want to impose lockdown in the state but 'majboori' is also something," the Chief Minister said. Thackeray also urged people of the state to wear masks to avoid lockdown.

Telangana government's Minister for Industry and Information Technology, KT Rama Rao, has urged BCCI and IPL office-bearers to include Hyderabad as one of the venues for IPL 2021. KTR wrote on Twitter, "Our effective COVID-19 containment measures are reflected in our low number of cases among all metro cities." BCCI has reportedly shortlisted six cities to host IPL 2021.

A Chinese state-backed hacking group APT10, also known as Stone Panda, has attacked the IT systems of two Indian vaccine makers, Bharat Biotech and Serum Institute of India (SII) in recent weeks, cyber intelligence firm Cyfirma told Reuters. "The real motivation here is...exfiltrating intellectual property and getting competitive advantage over Indian pharma firms,? said Cyfirma CEO Kumar Ritesh.

European Medicines Agency (EMA), which is Europe?s drug regulator, is auditing the manufacturing site of Pune-based Serum Institute of India (SII), reported Reuters. This comes as AstraZeneca looks to boost shipments to Europe, where the company has committed to deliver 180 million doses in the second quarter. SII, the world?s largest vaccine maker, is producing the Oxford-AstraZeneca vaccine.

Warren Buffett, the 90-year-old CEO of Berkshire Hathaway, in his annual letter to investors called buying aircraft parts maker Precision Castparts Corp for $32.1 billion in 2016 "a big mistake". Buffett, currently the world's seventh richest person, admitted his company "paid too much" for the deal. Berkshire wrote off nearly $10 million of Precision's value in August 2020 amid COVID-19.

Tamil Nadu government has extended the existing coronavirus-related restrictions till March 31 to control the spread of the virus. A government order asked district authorities to ensure wearing of face masks, hand hygiene and social distancing. Authorities have also been asked to ensure strict adherence to SOPs related to various activities including train and air travel.

The Delhi High Court asked Air India to inform it whether the airline can, in an interim arrangement, pay a month?s salary to pilots who have challenged the termination of their contractual employment during the COVID-19 pandemic. On November 23, 2020, the High Court had said that Air India employees ?cannot be left to hang high and dry?.

The government released a list of hospitals where people can get vaccinated against COVID-19. Around 10,000 private hospitals empanelled under Ayushman Bharat PMJAY and over 600 hospitals under Central Government Health Scheme (CGHS) are part of the government's vaccination drive. From March 1, those above 60 years of age and those aged 45-59 years with comorbidities can get vaccinated.

Pune Mayor Murlidhar Mohol has said the restrictions imposed earlier are extended till March 14 and no public movement except essential services is allowed between 11 pm to 6 am. He added that it was decided to extend the closure of schools, colleges and coaching classes till March 14 as there was no slowdown in the spread of COVID-19 infection.

Undocumented migrants should be able to receive vaccination against COVID-19 without fear of being targeted by the US Immigration and Customs Enforcement (ICE), President Joe Biden has said. "They should... not be arrested for... being able to get a vaccination," he said. The Department of Homeland Security had earlier said that the ICE won't conduct enforcement activities near vaccination sites.

India's Representative to the WTO, Brajendra Navnit on Saturday said if the WTO doesn't agree on waiving certain intellectual property (IP) norms to deal with COVID-19, it would impact global growth and livelihood. "For...$30-$40 billion of annual vaccine output of few companies, we are coming in the way of $6-7 trillion of global GDP output in 1 year,? he said.

Thailand on Sunday began its mass vaccination drive against coronavirus, with Deputy PM and Health Minister Anutin Charnvirakul being the first person in the country to be inoculated. Thai PM Prayut Chan-o-cha, who is 66, attended the event but didn't get vaccinated as his age falls outside the range of 18 to 59 suitable to receive Sinovac's CoronaVac vaccine.

A planned demonstration against COVID-19 lockdown in Ireland quickly turned violent as hundreds of protesters clashed with police in Dublin. Protesters chanting "End the lockdown" and handing out leaflets reading "Let Ireland live" were blocked by police as they marched towards a city centre park. Situation turned tense after two firework rockets were fired at police from a close range.

Countries seeking their own vaccine supply and striking deals with drug companies threaten the supply of the global COVAX programme, the World Health Organization (WHO) has said. WHO chief Tedros Adhanom Ghebreyesus said COVID-19 vaccine supply cannot accelerate if countries "continue to approach manufacturers... that COVAX is counting on". "We can't beat COVID without vaccine equity," he added.

The US has issued emergency use authorisation to Johnson & Johnson's single-dose Janssen COVID-19 vaccine for use in individuals 18 years of age and older. The vaccine is the third authorised in the US, after Pfizer/BioNTech and Moderna's vaccines, both of which require two doses. It was found to be 66% effective at preventing moderate-to-severe COVID-19, 28 days after inoculation.

India has reported 16,752 new COVID-19 cases and 113 more deaths in the last 24 hours, according to the Union Health Ministry. The total number of coronavirus cases in the country reached 1,10,96,731, while the death toll reached 1,57,051. As many as 11,718 people recovered in the last 24 hours, taking the total number of recovered cases to 1,07,75,169.

Delhi reported 197 fresh COVID-19 cases on Sunday, taking the city's caseload to 6,39,289, while the death toll reached 10,910 with one new death, according to the state health department. Delhi reported 200 or more daily cases in the last four days. The number of active cases in Delhi is 1,335, while the positivity rate stands at 0.34%.

Registration for the second phase of the COVID-19 vaccination drive will start on the CoWIN 2.0 portal from 9 am tomorrow, said the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare on Sunday. Those eligible for the vaccines in this phase can register themselves on www.cowin.gov.in, it said. Citizens can book an appointment for vaccination using CoWIN or Aarogya Setu, it added.

Prince William has warned that social media is "awash" with "lots of rumours and misinformation" regarding the COVID-19 vaccine and urged those eligible to get vaccinated. He was speaking along with his wife, Catherine, in a video call with two women eligible for first doses soon. "We have to be a little bit careful who we believe," he added.

Pune Municipal Corporation (PMC) will conduct a dry run at four government hospitals in the city from March 1 before vaccinating people under phase 2 of the COVID-19 vaccination drive. PMC health chief Dr Ashish Bharti said, "Once we get the vaccinator module for the targeted population, we'll check if it runs smoothly."

During a recent interview, actress Rochelle Rao spoke about getting marriage counseling with her husband Keith Sequeira during the coronavirus lockdown, and said, "[We] took [it] up...with a couple of other friends, [it] definitely enhanced our relationship." She added, "At the same time, we also had good fun spending quality time with each other through the duration of the course."

AIIMS Director Dr Randeep Guleria said on Saturday that India may have three-four COVID-19 vaccines in a few weeks. He added that it's likely that in an area, one may've more than one vaccine provided in different private hospitals. "Therefore, it may indirectly give...choice as [one] would know which vaccine is being given at which centre," Guleria told NDTV.

Guatemala President Alejandro Giammattei has thanked Prime Minister Narendra Modi for providing 2,00,000 doses of the Covishield vaccine to the country. Giammattei said that the doses will help "us save lives and immunise frontline healthcare workers". During an address, he also thanked the "people of India" and said that the Indian government "did not hesitate to support us".

Uttar Pradesh CM Yogi Adityanath said the state has managed to control encephalitis disease by 75% and has reduced death rate by 95% in the past four years. While inaugurating an awareness campaign, he said, "In 2017, we started a special vaccination programme to make citizens aware about encephalitis." Last week, children in Lucknow were administered Japanese encephalitis vaccine drops.

The Caribbean Community (CARICOM), an organisation of 15 countries, has asked wealthy nations to share their supply of COVID-19 vaccines, stating that their economies won't be able to recover from the pandemic without them. They added that the only vaccines received have been donated by India to Dominica and Barbados, which the countries have been sharing with other members.

Ivory Coast has become the second country after Ghana to receive a shipment of COVID-19 vaccine doses under the WHO-led COVAX scheme that aims to distribute vaccines for free to poor countries. A flight carrying 5.04 lakh doses of the Oxford-AstraZeneca vaccine developed by Serum Institute of India reached Ivory Coast on Friday. The country will begin vaccinations next week.

The United Nations Security Council (UNSC) on Friday unanimously passed a resolution calling on all member states to support a "sustained humanitarian pause" to local conflicts to allow COVID-19 vaccinations. The resolution also calls on all UN member states to fund the COVAX initiative to help developing countries gain access to vaccines and include vulnerable groups in vaccination drives.

People will be prioritised by their age instead of their jobs during the second phase of Britain's COVID-19 vaccine rollout, Wei Shen Lim, COVID-19 chairman for the Joint Committee on Vaccination and Immunisation, said. Lim said that those aged between 40-49 would be next in line to receive a shot, followed by those aged 30-39 and then those aged 18-29.

Ecuadorean Health Minister Juan Carlos Zevallos has resigned after he was accused of irregularities in a pilot program for COVID-19 vaccination. Ecuador in January launched the program to vaccinate medical personnel and elderly citizens living in nursing homes. Zevallos is being investigated over his participation in an inoculation drive at a nursing home where his mother lives.

Everyone on election duty for the upcoming Assembly polls in Assam, Tamil Nadu, West Bengal, Kerala and Puducherry will be vaccinated against COVID-19 before polling day, Election Commission said. The nationwide vaccination drive has made the situation more conducive for conducting elections, it stated. Voting will be allowed for an additional hour, Chief Election Commissioner Sunil Arora said.

Mark Machin, head of Canada Pension Plan Investment Board (CPPIB), has resigned after he took a trip to UAE to get early access to COVID-19 vaccine. Machin travelled to UAE despite Canadian government's advice against travel during the pandemic. Last month, Rod Baker, CEO of Canadian casino company 'Great Canadian Gaming Corp', had resigned after attempting to jump vaccine queue.

Maharashtra School Education Minister Varsha Gaikwad has denied reports that claimed Class 10 exams have been cancelled due to the surge in coronavirus cases in the state. In schools where coronavirus cases have been found, local authorities have been directed to ensure that necessary hygiene and disinfection measures are taken, Gaikwad said, adding Class 12 exams will also be held.

An advisory panel to the US Food and Drug Administration (FDA) has endorsed the emergency use of one-dose COVID-19 vaccine from Johnson & Johnson. The panel concluded that the shot appears safe and effective against COVID-19 in people aged 18 and above. J&J said that it was prepared to supply the vaccine immediately if it is approved by the FDA.

Government has released a list of 20 co-morbid conditions that would prioritise beneficiaries in age group 45-59 in the second phase of India's COVID-19 vaccination drive. It includes heart failure with hospital admission in past one year, kidney/liver/hematopoietic stem cell transplant recipient/on waitlist, decompensated cirrhosis, end stage kidney disease on haemodialysis/ CAPD among others.

US House of Representatives has passed President Joe Biden's $1.9 trillion relief plan to revive the country's economy and combat the COVID-19 pandemic. The House voted 219-212 to approve the bill, with two Democrats and all Republicans opposing it. The bill includes direct aid to small businesses and direct payments of $1,400 to all Americans making less than $75,000 annually.

Police on Friday took YouTuber Abu Faisal into custody for alleged hate speech over COVID-19 vaccine upon his arrival at Hyderabad airport from Dubai. In the video, Faisal made claims about coronavirus and urged people not to take the vaccine, adding that it was a means of population control. The video was taken down after a petition in a court.

India has assured Palestine that it will facilitate an early supply of COVID-19 vaccines and said that a second batch of medicines would also be provided as assistance in the coming weeks. Nagaraj Naidu, Ambassador and Deputy Permanent Representative of India's Mission to the United Nations, also asserted India's role in equitable distribution of COVID-19 vaccines across the world.

As many as 19 residents of a condominium in Sector 67 of Haryana's Gurugram tested positive for coronavirus. The condominium has now been declared a containment zone. "They tested positive on different dates. We cannot confirm the source of infection...[A] party was hosted on February 7 and the first case was detected on February 19," CMO Dr Virender Yadav said.

India reported 16,488 new COVID-19 cases and 113 deaths in the last 24 hours, as per the Union Health Ministry. India's total tally reached 1,10,79,979 and the death toll reached 1,56,938. Following the discharge of 12,771 COVID-19 patients in 24 hours, India's active cases stood at 1,59,590. As many as 1,42,42,547 people have been vaccinated so far.

Delhi reported 256 new COVID-19 cases on Friday which is the highest single-day rise in the national capital in 35 days. The total count so far in Delhi reached 6,38,849 and active COVID-19 cases stood at 1,231. Following the death of one patient, the COVID-19 death tally reached 10,906. The cumulative positivity rate in Delhi is 5.21% as of Friday.

The Centre on Saturday said that private hospitals functioning as COVID-19 vaccination centres may recover a charge subject to a ceiling of ?250 per person per dose. Vaccines will be free at government facilities, the Centre had announced earlier. People above 60 years of age and those above 45 years of age with comorbidities will be vaccinated from March 1.

Tamil Nadu CM Edappadi K Palaniswami announced gold loan waiver against up to six sovereigns given by cooperative banks to poor and farmers. He said it will help the poor redeem the gold they had pledged during COVID-19 lockdown. Tamil Nadu State Apex Co-operative Bank Limited offered gold loan schemes with low interest rates as part of pandemic relief measures.

The three-match ODI series between India and England will be played without fans at the Maharashtra Cricket Association Stadium in Pune. This has come after Maharashtra recorded a spike in new COVID-19 cases. The three ODIs between India and England will be played on March 23, 26, and 28 after the conclusion of the five-match T20I series in Ahmedabad.

The US-headquartered home-sharing marketplace Airbnb posted a $3.9 billion loss during the December quarter against a loss of $351 million in the same period a year earlier. The quarterly result declared by the company was its first after it went public in December last year. The company, however, said it expects a rebound in travel with the vaccine roll-out.

People can register for Phase 2 of COVID-19 vaccination starting from March 1 in three ways. First is advance self-registration, where beneficiaries can register through CO-Win 2.0 portal and other platforms. Secondly, beneficiaries can register on-site at identified vaccination centres. Third is facilitated cohort registration, wherein ASHA workers, ANMs would help in mobilising beneficiaries.

Ahead of the COVID-19 vaccination on March 1, the government has advised the beneficiaries to bring at least one of the listed photo ID documents. They include Aadhaar card, Electoral Photo Identity Card, the Photo ID card specified in case of online registration, certificate of co-morbidity for citizens aged 45-59 years and employment certificate for health care and frontline workers.

Maharashtra recorded 8,623 new COVID-19 cases and 51 deaths in the last 24 hours, reporting over 8,000 new cases for the fourth consecutive day. While lockdown in Amravati was extended till March 8, restrictions were also imposed for the weekend in Nagpur and Yavatmal. Union Health Ministry had earlier informed that the total number of vaccinations have crossed 1.37 crores.

BBMP Commissioner N Manjunatha Prasad said, "New clusters have emerged. We are surrounded by Kerala and Maharashtra where COVID-19 cases are rising." Prasad's statement came after BBMP officials identified a cluster of COVID-19 cases in Sambhram Academy of Management Studies. According to Prasad, most people coming from such states are students and they have been tested and isolated.

The Centre has said six states reported 85.75% of the new cases reported in the country on Saturday. Maharashtra reported the highest number with 8,333 cases, followed by Kerala (3,671), Punjab (622), Karnataka (571) Tamil Nadu (481) and Gujarat (460). A total of 16,488 new daily cases have been recorded in the last 24 hours.

After WHO chief Tedros Adhanom Ghebreyesus praised PM Narendra Modi for sharing COVID-19 vaccines with many countries under COVAX facility, Modi said, "Thank you Dr Tedros. We are all together in the fight against this pandemic." "India is committed to sharing resources, experiences and knowledge for global good," Modi added. "Your commitment...is helping [over] 60 countries," Tedros had said.

Brazil has signed a deal with Indian pharmaceutical company Bharat Biotech to buy two crore doses of COVID-19 vaccine Covaxin. Brazil's Health Ministry said the deal is worth 1.6 billion reais (?2,115.4 crore), with the first 80 lakh doses expected to be delivered in March. Brazil is the third-worst coronavirus hit country in the world with over one crore cases.

US President Joe Biden said that his administration plans to educate Americans about COVID-19 vaccines to counter vaccine hesitancy, that may lead to supplies outstripping demand. "We know there's a history...of subjecting certain communities to terrible medical and scientific abuse. But...one message that needs to cut through it's this: vaccines are safe and effective," he added.

French President Emmanuel Macron has said that he would take Oxford-AstraZeneca COVID-19 vaccine if it was offered to him. "In view of the latest scientific studies, the efficacy of the AstraZeneca vaccine has been proven," Macron added. Earlier, the French President had said that the AstraZeneca coronavirus vaccine appeared to be "quasi-ineffective" on people older than 65.

WHO chief Tedros Adhanom Ghebreyesus has lauded PM Narendra Modi for sharing COVID-19 vaccines with many countries. "Thanks India & Prime Minister [Modi] for supporting vaccine equity. Your commitment to COVAX and sharing COVID-19 vaccine doses is helping 60+ countries start vaccinating their health workers and other priority groups. I hope other countries will follow your example," he tweeted.

The Ministry of Home Affairs (MHA) today issued an order to extend the existing guidelines for surveillance, containment and caution amid COVID-19 pandemic to remain in force up to March 31. The government further advised states and Union Territories to speed up the vaccination of the target population. There are 1,55,986 active coronavirus cases in India.

People who want to get vaccinated in the second phase of the coronavirus vaccination drive that starts on March 1, will have to register on the Co-WIN platform, Chairman of Empowered Group on Vaccine Administration RS Sharma said. Both online and on-the-spot registrations will be available, he said. Vaccination will be done free of cost at government facilities, he added.

The global death toll from coronavirus on Friday rose to 25,07,391, according to the Johns Hopkins University tracker. The US has reported the highest number of coronavirus deaths globally at over five lakh, followed by Brazil at 2,51,498 deaths and Mexico at 1,83,692, the tracker showed. The total cases of coronavirus in the world rose to over 11.2 crore.

Rating agency Moody's has said that loans to low-income borrowers will remain most affected due to the shock caused by the coronavirus pandemic. Despite the provisions for bad loans in this segment, credit costs will remain elevated compared to pre-pandemic levels, Moody's added. Moody's further said corporate governance remains a key credit weakness for the public sector banks.

The COVID-19 vaccination drive will be put on hold on February 27 and 28 as the Co-WIN software will be transitioning from Co-WIN 1.0 to Co-WIN 2.0, the Union Health Ministry said on Friday. Registrations for the next phase of vaccination will begin from March 1 and those who are eligible can self-register on Co-WIN for the same, officials said.

BBMP officials on Friday identified a cluster of COVID-19 cases in Bengaluru's Sambhram Academy of Management Studies. "We have prevented anyone from entering the campus except those who have to write the exam," a health department official said. According to officials, details of everyone who came in contact with the infected students have been collected for contact tracing.

India reported 16,577 new COVID-19 cases and 120 deaths in the last 24 hours, as per the Union Health Ministry. India's total tally reached 1,10,63,491 and the death toll reached 1,56,825. Following the discharge of 12,179 COVID-19 patients in 24 hours, India's active cases stood at 1,55,986. As many as 1,34,72,643 people have been vaccinated so far.

With Fitternity's OnePass, you can become a member at 5,000+ gyms and studios with just one membership. OnePass gives access to gyms, including those at 5 star hotels and classes like Zumba, Cross Functional Training, Yoga, Pilates and more. In these COVID-19 times, you can buy a OnePass stress free with a 100% membership freezing policy.

Pictures of school band members practicing in anti-COVID-19 tents in US' Wenatchee have gone viral. The school's principal said the tents may be small, but they are allowing band members to play together again. "The idea came from our music and theatre teachers...I think students enjoy being back in school," the principal added.

Syrian Health Minister Hassan Ghabache said that the war-torn country has received COVID-19 vaccine doses from a "friendly country" and healthcare workers would start receiving inoculations next week, state media reported. However, he did not specify which country had provided the vaccines. Health officials have previously said that Syria has been engaged with Russia and China on vaccine supply.

UK's Queen Elizabeth II has urged people to "think about others rather than themselves" and get the COVID-19 vaccine when they're offered one. On being asked about her experience of getting the vaccine, the Queen said, "It was very quick...It didn't hurt at all." The 94-year-old monarch and her 99-yr-old husband, Prince Philip, got vaccinated against COVID-19 last month.

German Chancellor Angela Merkel has said that the new COVID-19 variants risk a third wave of infections in the country. "We must proceed wisely and carefully so that a third wave does not necessitate a new complete shutdown throughout Germany," Merkel added. Earlier this month, Germany had announced that it would extend partial lockdown in the country until March 7.

Mumbai's Dharavi on Wednesday reported a double-digit COVID-19 case count at ten after 37 days. The slum area had last reported ten COVID-19 cases on January 17. Dharavi has been reporting COVID-19 cases in single digits since November 2020 except on November 21, December 2, January 13 and January 17. Dharavi has reported 4,041 cases with 33 cases presently active.

Goldman Sachs' 59-year-old CEO David Solomon spoke about working remotely amid COVID-19 and said, "This is not ideal for us and it's not a new normal." He added, "It's an aberration that we are going to correct as quickly as possible." He also said, "I don't want another class of young people arriving at Goldman Sachs in the summer remotely."

Mumbai reported 1,145 fresh COVID-19 cases on Thursday, taking the total cases in the city to 3,22,843, according to Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) data. The death toll rose to 11,458 after five more people succumbed to the disease. The active COVID-19 cases in Mumbai have risen to 8,997, while the number of containment zones stands at 13.

America's Moderna on Wednesday said that doses of its new South African variant-specific coronavirus vaccine had been shipped to the US National Institutes of Health for testing. The phase 1 clinical trial will determine if the vaccine can boost immunity against the variant, Moderna added. The new coronavirus variant was detected by the South African health authorities in December 2020.

With governments tightening travel restrictions owing to the new variants of COVID-19, the year 2021 for the aviation industry is turning out to be much tougher than previously expected, global airline industry body IATA has said. "Estimates for cash burn in 2021 have ballooned to $75 billion-$95 billion range from a previously anticipated $48 billion," IATA added.

Ranvir Shorey, who contracted coronavirus last week, has tested negative for the virus. The actor took to Twitter on Thursday to share the health update and wrote, "Happy to say I've tested negative for Covid after a week of quarantining and treatment. Thank you all for the good wishes." Ranvir had shared the news of his diagnosis on February 17.

The Indian economy is expected to clock a growth of 13.7% in FY22, due to recovery of activity and growing confidence in the market with the rollout of COVID-19 vaccine, Moody?s Investors Service said on Thursday. Moody's also improved its projection for FY21 from a 10.6% contraction in GDP to a 7% contraction.

The Health Ministry said that seven states have reported 89.57% of the new cases reported in the country on Thursday. Maharashtra reported the highest number with 8,807 cases, followed by Kerala (4,106), Punjab (558), Tamil Nadu (463), Gujarat (380), Madhya Pradesh (344) and Karnataka (334). A total of 16,738 new daily cases have been recorded in the last 24 hours.

The Pune Municipal Corporation's Garden Department has lost ?11 crore since the first lockdown last year, Chief Park Superintendent Ashok Ghorpade has said. "The garden department used to conduct exhibitions of flowers, fruits...and sell plant saplings which used to bring in revenue...but this had to be shut down due to COVID-19," he added. Pune has 200 public gardens.

Sri Lanka has received the second consignment of 5 lakh doses of the Covishield vaccine from India on Thursday. Actively aiding Sri Lanka to win against coronavirus pandemic, the High Commission of India in Sri Lanka tweeted. India had sent 5 lakh doses of the vaccine to Sri Lanka last month.

The Oval Maidan in Mumbai will be closed for visitors from February 26 in view of the rising COVID-19 cases in the city, Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation A-ward Assistant Municipal Commissioner Chanda Jadhav said. No activity will be allowed on the ground in South Mumbai till further orders, she added. The ground witnesses huge crowds during weekends.

Delhi reported 220 fresh COVID-19 cases on Thursday, the highest single-day rise in February so far, taking the caseload to 6,38,593, according to official data. The positivity rate stood at 0.34%, while no new death was reported due to the coronavirus infection. The number of active cases has risen to 1,169 and 536 people are under home isolation.

During Multan Sultans' PSL match against Peshawar Zalmi, the umpire refused to hold Shahid Afridi's cap when he came on to bowl over COVID-19 rules. Expressing his displeasure, Afridi tweeted to ICC, saying, "Dear @ICC wondering why...umpires aren't allowed to hold bowlers' cap even though they're in the same bubble as players/management and even shake hands [after] the game?"

Nearly 33% of front-line workers of the Brihanmumbai Electric Supply and Transport (BEST) have received COVID-19 vaccines in the past 10 days. Out of all 34,000 employees, 11,000 frontline workers have been vaccinated. BEST Chief Medical Officer Dr Anil Kumar Singhal stated the administration is trying to vaccinate at least 50% of the employees by end of this week.

At least 229 students and 3 staffers have tested COVID-19 positive in a single hostel in a school in Maharashtra's Washim district. The school premises have been declared a containment zone. A total of 327 students from Amravati, Hingoli, Nanded, Washim, Buldhana, Akola reside in this hostel. Maharashtra reported over 8,800 new COVID-19 cases on Wednesday.

India has reported 16,738 new COVID-19 cases and 138 fatalities in the last 24 hours, as per the  Union Health Ministry. With this, the total number of cases rose to 1,10,46,914, while the death toll reached 1,56,705. As many as 11,799 patients were discharged in a day, taking the total recoveries to 1,07,38,501. Active cases now stand at 1,51,708.

Tamil Nadu Chief Minister Edappadi K Palaniswami has announced that students in Classes 9, 10 and 11 will be promoted to the next class without taking exams due to the COVID-19 pandemic. Schools were reopened for Classes 10 and 12 on January 19. Palaniswami had said each classroom would have only 25 students to maintain social distancing norms.

Rajasthan government on Thursday announced that people arriving from Maharashtra and Kerala will need to produce a negative RT-PCR test on arrival to be allowed entry into the state. The decision was taken in a review meeting chaired by CM Ashok Gehlot. It was also decided that an awareness campaign will be run from March for the COVID-19 vaccination.

Germany's Lufthansa airlifted 80 tonnes of fresh fruits and vegetables to the UK amid fears of shortages over the festive season. Thousands of lorries were left stranded in the UK after France shut its border on Monday and Tuesday in response to the new coronavirus strain. Lorry drivers who test negative for Covid-19 have now been allowed to enter France.

Delhi government has completed all preparations and is ready for COVID-19 vaccination, CM Arvind Kejriwal said. Around 51 lakh people, including healthcare and frontline workers and people above 50 years, will be vaccinated in the first phase, he added. Delhi has storage capacity of 74 lakh doses which will be increased to 1.15 crore within a week, Kejriwal further said.

Australia batsman Steve Smith and wife Dani Willis' reunion has been delayed as the 29-year-old law graduate was denied entry into the Australia team camp in Melbourne over new COVID-19 restrictions, the Daily Telegraph reported. Dani had travelled from Sydney to Melbourne earlier this week to be with Smith after being apart for 121 days because of his sporting commitments.

The Bhutan government on Tuesday said that it would impose a nationwide lockdown for seven days, starting from Wednesday, to curb the spread of coronavirus. During the lockdown period, only designated shops within the zones and essential services will be allowed to function, the government added. All schools, institutions, offices and business establishments will remain closed.

The UAE's highest Islamic authority, the UAE Fatwa Council, has ruled that coronavirus vaccines are permissible for Muslims even if they contain pork gelatin. If there are no alternatives, the vaccines would not be subject to Islam's restrictions on pork because of the higher need to "protect the human body", Council Chairman Sheikh Abdallah bin Bayyah said.

IndiGo CEO Ronojoy Dutta has said that the "doom and gloom is off the table" and the airline is "recovering pretty nicely", especially domestically, from the "carnage" caused by the COVID-19 pandemic. Domestic services are likely to return to pre-pandemic levels by January or February and the airline could start rehiring staff in three months, he added in an interview.

Telangana Director of Public Health and Family Welfare G Srinivasa Rao tweeted that the state reported 635 new COVID-19 cases on Tuesday, taking the tally so far to 2,82,982. Hyderabad reported 115 new cases, followed by Rangareddy at 57 and Medchal-Malkajgiri at 49. With four COVID-19 deaths on Tuesday, state's death count so far reached 1,522.

Delhi Health Minister Satyendar Jain on Wednesday stated that the COVID-19 positivity rate in the capital has fallen to 1.14%, and added, "This is the lowest in the last eight months." Meanwhile, Jain added that the government will conduct a door-to-door survey of passengers who arrived in Delhi from the UK after a new strain of COVID-19 was discovered.

The Delhi High Court on Wednesday directed the Delhi government to frame standard operating procedures (SOPs) to deal with post-COVID-19 complications in those who have recovered from the infection. The court further asked the AAP-led government to ensure that facilities are available to test and quarantine travellers from the UK, where a new strain of coronavirus has been discovered.

India is likely to approve Oxford-AstraZeneca's Covid-19 vaccine for emergency use by next week after Serum Institute of India submitted additional data sought by authorities, reports said. India could be the first country to give regulatory approval for the vaccine. Serum Institute has already stockpiled more than 50 million doses of the Oxford shot.

The Sikh community in UK's Kent delivered food for truck drivers stuck at Dover after France shut its UK border for 48 hours on Sunday amid fears of a new coronavirus variant. The Gravesend Gurdwara collaborated with local authorities to deliver the food. France has agreed to reopen the border to lorry drivers with negative COVID-19 test.

Delhi Health Minister Satyendar Jain has said, "People who have arrived here from the UK in the last several days are being rigorously traced and tested for slightest of COVID-19-like symptoms." The decision has been taken amid the detection of the new coronavirus strain in UK. "A team has been made and house-to-house tracing is being done," he added.

Taking to Instagram on Wednesday, Ayushmann Khurrana penned a note upon completion of his film 'Chandigarh Kare Aashiqui', which also stars Vaani Kapoor. He wrote, "I feel immensely proud that our film is...first one in India to finish shooting an entire film while battling...coronavirus." He added, "It feels amazing...we managed this feat in my hometown Chandigarh - couldn't be prouder!"

After detection of a new strain of coronavirus in the UK, the Pune Municipal Corporation has mandated passengers arriving at Pune Airport from the Middle East and Europe to undergo institutional quarantine. Passengers will undergo quarantine at their own cost in designated hotels for seven days. The RT-PCR test will be conducted between the fifth and seventh day.

Actor-filmmaker Satish Kaushik has said the film industry has been badly affected by the ongoing coronavirus pandemic. "Apart from being out of jobs since the films were not releasing, we have lost so many people from the industry," he added. "We couldn't even attend the funerals of our friends because of [the] restrictions. It was very disheartening," Satish further said.

Canada has approved the use of Moderna's COVID-19 vaccine after it met the "stringent safety, efficacy and quality requirements", the Health Department said on Wednesday. "The...storage and handling requirements of...vaccine mean that it can be distributed to isolated and remote communities," it added. Earlier, Canada had approved the Pfizer/BioNtech COVID-19 vaccine for widespread use.

Delhi government will conduct door-to-door survey of passengers who arrived in Delhi from the UK, test them and advise them to isolate, Health Minister Satyendar Jain said. This comes after the UK detected a new COVID-19 variant. About 6,000-7,000 passengers flew into Delhi from UK in last two weeks, many of whom would have travelled to neighbouring places, Jain added.

The UK's Health Secretary Matt Hancock on Wednesday said another new strain of coronavirus has been detected that is "more transmissible" than the one recently discovered. Two cases have been identified in the UK, both contacts of cases who have travelled from South Africa over the past few weeks. "Travellers from South Africa must isolate immediately," he said.

US top infectious-disease expert Dr Anthony Fauci and other senior health officials received a dose of Moderna coronavirus vaccine on camera on Tuesday. Fauci said he was taking the vaccine "as a symbol" for American people to encourage them about the "safety and the efficacy of this vaccine". The US is the worst coronavirus-hit country with over 1.8 crore cases.

The shooting of Rajinikanth's upcoming film 'Annaatthe' has been halted after four crew members tested positive for coronavirus during routine testing. Sun Pictures, the production house behind 'Annaatthe', on Wednesday tweeted that Rajinikanth and other crew members have tested negative for COVID-19. The shooting of the film has been postponed.

India has reported 23,950 new COVID-19 cases and 333 more deaths in the last 24 hours, taking the total number of cases to 1,00,99,066 and the death toll to 1,46,444. As many as 26,895 people recovered in the last 24 hours, taking the total number of recoveries to 96,63,382. The number of active cases in the country stood at 2,89,240.

The government has further extended the suspension of fresh proceedings under the Insolvency and Bankruptcy Code by three more months till March 24, 2021 amid the COVID-19 pandemic. The suspension was to end on December 24. In September, the Parliament cleared a bill to replace an ordinance that was promulgated in June 2020 to protect companies from insolvency proceedings.

The state board examinations for class 10 and 12 will be held in June 2021, West Bengal Education Minister Partha Chatterjee said on Wednesday. The Class 10 exams will be held first and the Class 12 after that. Earlier, Union Education Minister Ramesh Pokhriyal 'Nishank' ruled out conducting CBSE board examinations till February in view of the COVID-19 situation.

Maharashtra government has allowed the reopening of water sports, naukavihar, amusement parks, indoor entertainment activities and tourist places outside containment zones. The SOP for naukavihar will be issued by the Home (Ports) Department, and the Tourism Department will issue the SOP for the tourist places. The state on Tuesday reported 3,106 new COVID-19 cases.

A Singaporean citizen who returned to the country from Japan has become the world's first person to use a digital COVID-19 health certificate for immigration purposes. He used the International Chamber of Commerce's AOKpass app to officially present a negative COVID-19 PCR digital test result. The app allows users to store COVID-19 related information and have medical professionals certify them.

Around 20 passengers from UK tested positive for COVID-19 in India. Punjab Minister OP Soni said seven passengers and a flight crew member tested positive in the state, while a Gujarat civic official said four passengers, including a British national, tested COVID-19 positive in Ahmedabad. Meanwhile, six were found positive in Delhi, two in Kolkata and one in Chennai.

COVID-19 has reached every continent on Earth as at least 58 people tested positive in Antarctica. Chile's army announced 36 people at General Bernardo O'Higgins Riquelme Antarctic base tested positive, and later, Health Minister for Chile's Biobio region said there are 21 infections involving people aboard Chilean navy's Sergeant Aldea vessel. One more case was reported in Las Estrellas village.

US President Donald Trump on Tuesday rejected a $900 billion COVID-19 relief bill, saying that the package "really is a disgrace". Trump urged Congress to amend the bill and increase stimulus payments from "$600 to $2,000, or $4,000 for a couple". "It's called the COVID-19 relief bill, but it has almost nothing to do with COVID-19," he further said.

UK PM Boris Johnson's India visit might not be possible due to new COVID-19 strain, "particularly if this level of infection and spread continues", Dr Chaand Nagpaul, Chair of British Medical Association's Council said. However, it's still early for the government to decide on the visit, he added. Johnson has been invited as Chief Guest for India's Republic Day parade.

Seven-time Formula One world champion Lewis Hamilton has said that he has lost 6-kg weight over the last two months, four of which he lost when he got COVID-19 earlier this month. He added, "COVID-19 is not a joke and people all over the world are out there losing their lives...it shouldn't be treated that way. It?s really tough."

The Delhi health department has formed a four-member committee to make recommendations on reducing the number of COVID-19-dedicated beds after several requests were made by hospitals.  Of over 18,000 beds earmarked for COVID-19 patients, around 85% are vacant, as per government's Delhi Corona app. The city recorded less than 1,000 new COVID-19 cases for the second consecutive day on Tuesday.

Tamil Nadu government has granted permission to hold Jallikattu events in the state with certain restrictions. The number of players cannot exceed 300 at Jallikattu events, while it cannot be more than 150 for bull racing events. The players need to produce COVID-19 negative certificates and the number of spectators cannot exceed 50% of the total capacity in open spaces.

South Korea on Tuesday ordered for all ski resorts and winter tourism spots to be shut in a bid to curb the spread of COVID-19 in the country. This comes after Seoul and surrounding areas banned gatherings of more than four people over Christmas and New Year holidays. The country recorded its highest daily death toll from COVID-19 on Monday.

Delhi government schools' e-learning contents have been receiving global recognition during COVID-19 pandemic, Deputy CM Manish Sisodia said on Monday. "It's a matter of pride that online classes...are being accessed in about 20 countries including the UK, the US, Germany, among others," he further said, adding that Delhi government "devised plan to minimise teaching-learning loss" amid pandemic.

Hollywood actor Tom Hanks, who had tested positive for coronavirus back in March along with his wife Rita Wilson, commented on his plans of taking the COVID-19 vaccine. "We'll be getting it long after everybody who truly needs to get it gets it," he told Today and added that he would do it publicly to show it was safe.

The spread of new coronavirus strain can be prevented using the same interventions that also work for the viruses that are circulating around, said Maria Van Kerkhove, WHO technical lead for COVID-19. "This is physical distancing, making sure we avoid crowded spaces," she added. "We have to work a little bit harder as the new variant is spreading," she said.

The board exams for classes 10 and 12 will not be held between March and April as usual, Karnataka Primary and Secondary Education Minister S Suresh Kumar said on Tuesday. The time table for SSLC and PUC II board exams for the academic year 2020-21 would be published soon, Kumar said. Schools across Karnataka have shut down over COVID-19.

A temple has been built in honour of Sonu Sood in Maddur Mandal of Siddipet district in Telangana. Reacting to the same, Sonu, who has been helping people amid the coronavirus pandemic, said, "I don't think I've done anything to deserve this kind of love...from...people." He added, "[Want] to thank my fans in Telangana...I hope I never let them down."

Centre has released SOPs for passengers arriving from UK due to new variant of coronavirus. The arriving passengers will have to take an RT-PCR test and those testing positive for the new variant will be isolated in a separate isolation facility. Contacts of COVID-19 positive passengers who arrived between December 21 and 23 will be subjected to institutional quarantine.

Delhi International Airport Limited (DIAL) CEO Videh Jaipuriar has said, "We have a storage capacity of 27 lakh vaccines at any given point for Delhi Airport." He added, "We can distribute 54 lakh vials, if we are able to complete two rotations in a day." He further said that the capacity can be increased at a short notice if needed.
